name: Arty and Bright London Apartment in Zone 2
summary: Unlike most rental apartments out there my flat gives you straight away home feel mainly due to the oil paintings from my own collection, something you rarely find in 5* hotels, let alone budget accommodation! A very well equipped kitchen and a large bathroom, not to mention very fast 250 Mbps Wi-Fi and a 40 inch smart TV.  Very close to shops 24hrs and supermarkets providing easy reach to daily essential...not to mention just a 3-minute walk to the fastest (Victoria Line) underground in London.
space: Amenities Bedding: 1 Double bed, 1 living room with 1 chair that unfolds into a comfortable bed and 1 sofa bed for two, 1 bathroom, 1 kitchen Utilities: Central heating, Wi-fi, 40inch smart TV, Kettle, Toaster, Iron board, Cooker, Fridge, Freezer, Washing machine, crockery, pots, pans, dishes etc.  Bed linen is provided along with fresh towels.

neighborhood_overview: Not even 10 minutes by metro from Victoria Station there is a community where colours, sounds, flavours make you catapult into a completely new and exotic world. This is precisely the largest Afro-Caribbean London community. As soon as you immerse yourself in the local markets and in the heart of the community to the rhythm of the reggae music that resounds from the locals, you can only understand the artistic, creative and cultural uniqueness. Not surprisingly, people like Bob Marley, David Bowie, Van Gogh, Charlie Chaplin have lived in this area. But what makes Brixton so unique and unexpected?  Surely the first thing you notice is the huge amount of local markets and shops. From super-coloured fabrics, fruit and vegetable stand, to the largest selection of butchers and fishmongers you can find in the area, to numerous wig and hairdresser shops, the Brixton markets offer a wide selection of local and Caribbean products. From Brixton Station Road, to the famous Electric Avenue, to Pop

name: Holiday London DB Room Let-on going
summary: My bright double bedroom with a large window has a relaxed feeling! It comfortably fits one or two and is centrally located just two blocks from Finsbury Park. Enjoy great restaurants in the area and easy access to easy transport tubes, trains and buses. Babies and children of all ages are welcome.
space: Hello Everyone, I'm offering my lovely double bedroom in Finsbury Park area (zone 2) for let in a shared apartment.  You will share the apartment with me and it is fully furnished with a self catering kitchen. Two people can easily sleep well as the room has a queen size bed. I also have a travel cot for a baby for guest with small children.  I will require a deposit up front as a security gesture on both our parts and will be given back to you when you return the keys.  I trust anyone who will be responding to this add would treat my home with care and respect .  Best Wishes  Alina

neighborhood_overview: Finsbury Park is a friendly melting pot community composed of Turkish, French, Spanish, Middle Eastern, Irish and English families.  We have a wonderful variety of international restaurants directly under us on Stroud Green Road. And there are many shops and large Tescos supermarket right next door.  But you can also venture up to Crouch End and along Greens Lanes where there will endless choice of Turkish and Middle Eastern cuisines.s
notes: For art lovers I can give guest my Tate Members card to which offers free access to the both the Tate Galleries.
transit: The flat only a 10 minute walk to Finsbury Park Station (London Zone 2) with access to the Piccadilly and Victoria lines, as well Finsbury Park over land trains. You can get to downtown central London in 10-15 minutes and to Heathrow airport in 1 hour and 20 minutes.
access: Guest will have access to the self catering kitchen and bathroom. There is the flat is equipped wifi internet, a washing machine equipped with dryer for laundry and a hair drier in the bathroom. Since the flat is non smoking guest can go outside the little front balcony and have a cigarette if they like.  Note:  I will be staying on the pull out couch in the living room at night and working away from home in daytime.  I don't mind if guests coming in to relax on the sofa, read, listen to music and or watch TV when I'm way or not using the room. My aim is make guest free as comfortable as I can:).
house_rules: I'm an artist and have my artwork up on the wall so please care.  When existing: You must lock all doors and windows when leaving the apartment and building and respect the other tenants in the building. If any problems arise you must contact me asap via telephone.

name: Bright Chelsea  Apartment. Chelsea!
summary: Lots of windows and light.  St Luke's Gardens are at the end of the block, and the river not too far the other way. Ten minutes walk if you go slowly. Buses to everywhere round the corner and shops, restaurants, pubs, the cinema and Waitrose .
space: Bright Chelsea Apartment  This is a bright one bedroom ground floor apartment in an interesting listed building. There is one double bedroom and a living room/kitchen The apartment has a full  bathroom and the kitchen is fully equipped. Two wardrobes are available exclusively for guests and bedside tables and two long drawers. This sunny convenient compact flat is just around the corner from the Waitrose supermarket and all sorts of shops, cinemas, restaurants and pubs.  This is a lovely part of London. There is a fun farmers market in the King's Road at the weekend.  Buses to everywhere are just round the corner, and two underground stations are within ten minutes walk. There is a very nice pub round by St. Luke's gardens, 4 mins slow walk, the Builders Arms, serving decent reasonably priced food. The gardens are a pleasant place to walk and read, and the Church serve coffee and cake on the portico.  microwave, dishwasher, washer, tumble drier, fridge, freezer, internet, tel. printer,

neighborhood_overview: It is Chelsea.
notes: The building next door is in the process of being taken down and rebuilt. I thought that this would make my life here pretty horrible, but it has actually turned out to be rather fun. Work starts at 8.00am and stops at 6.00 and nothing at weekends. Noisy work from 9.00 to 12 and 2 to 5.30. Deliveries to Waitrose sail past with 'By Appointment' on the side and, by a fluke, the sound of their deliveries is not audible in my flat.   I will add a picture of the operating rules, and my new 'garden' . The bedroom windows when closed keep the noise out, and you can keep the air moving with the overhead fan or the Dyson, or both. My joy is that they have made me a little garden strip under my windows, which in the hot weather the traffic marshalls, my new friends, keep watered for me.  Dead heading by guests who garden is encouraged! Have fun Sincerely, Philippa Anyway, giant machines like dinosaurs creep past on occasion, I see them over the top of my net curtains. I have bought a Dyson air p
transit: The underground stations are South Kensington and Sloane Square. They are an equal distance from the flat. The bus to Chelsea Old Town Hall is the 49 from S. Ken, and 11, 19 or 22 from Sloane Square, but the distances are short if you prefer to walk.
access: There are two wardrobes for guests exclusive use, and two long drawers as well as the two bedside tables. My wardrobes have mirrored doors and I remove the handles and stick them shut.  This method is not childproof, hence, sorry, NO CHILDREN.
house_rules: NO SMOKING PLEASE.. No unauthorised guests. Not safe for small children.  There are two wardrobes for your use, and several drawers. No  parties please. It is a quiet building with only eight other flats.  Please do not bring strangers in, just friends.  Please feel welcome. It is a lovely place to be. Always double lock front door and close windows when you go out.

summary: You'll have a wonderful stay in this superb modern well-equipped recently refurbished apartment in very central desirable arty and foodie Fitzrovia, W1. Free wifi. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs and supermarkets.
space: This is a wonderful very popular beautiful, spacious, contemporary 3-bed / 2-bath apartment in Fitzroy Street, Fitzrovia, W1 (with unlimited wifi). This is a superb property, which has been recently and fully furnished in a contemporary style. With a recently fitted kitchen, two recently fitted bathrooms, new flooring, recently purchased furniture, beds and mattresses, and redecorated throughout, it makes a great base. London is literally on your doorstep! The apartment is on an upper level (with elevator) and is set out over one floor. neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location! You won't find better than this! Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz. Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and everything in between. If y
notes: This property has new flooring throughout. Guests must remove shoes at the front door otherwise the floor will mark - NO SHOES to be worn inside the apartment!! Guests must agree to this.  Strictly non-smoking apartment. A deep cleaning charge will be applied if there is any evidence of smoking
transit: You can walk to tourist London or take numerous transport options close by.  Our closest tubes are Warren Street, Goodge Street, Euston Square (all within 5 minute walk) and Tottenham Court Road and St Pancras (within a 10 minute walk) Coming from Heathrow? Easy! Take the tube from Paddington direct to Euston Square  Coming from Gatwick? Easy! Take the tube from Victoria direct to Warren Street Coming from Eurostar? Easy! Take a bus along the Euston Road or take the tube direct to Warren Street Being so central, you can walk to all of tourist London. The British Museum is 10 minutes away. You've got Oxford Street / Soho very close by (a 10 minute walk), Covent Garden will take you about 15 minutes, Regent's Park about 10-15 minutes. Camden is a 5 minute bus ride. You can head in any direction and arrive somewhere interesting. Numerous buses stop close by in Tottenham Court Road, Gower Street and Euston Road You are in easy reach of all the sights. Leicester Square and Trafalgar Square
access: Full use of whole independent apartment
house_rules: * The apartment benefits from new flooring throughout. Guests MUST remove shoes at the front door so as not to mark the flooring. NO SHOES inside the apartment! All guests must agree to this. Thank you * Minimum of 5 night stay for instant bookings made for trips more than three months in advance * Due to staffing issues, we cannot accept instant bookings that start or terminate on Easter Sunday, Christmas Day, Boxing Day or New Year's Day unless pre-approved by us * This is a strictly  no-smoking apartment * Lead guest must be aged 21+ and must provide formal photo ID (driving licence or passport) within 48 hours of booking

name: Boutique Chelsea/Fulham Double bed 5-star ensuite
summary: Enjoy a chic stay in this elegant but fully modernised Victorian townhouse. Well-connected via tube/bus/train, the best of London is only steps away. See our other listing for the bigger, King room.
space: Enjoy a boutique London townhouse bed and breakfast experience. Barclay House offers what travelers need: great beds, speedy WiFi, powerful hairdryers, sizable closets, award-winning bathroom design, in short everything you need for a great stay in the city of the cities, London. We are very popular so we usually have a 3-4 night minimum stay, but once in a while a shorter stay fits in between, so do email us.

neighborhood_overview: Fulham is 'villagey' and residential – a real historic London neighbourhoods. From Whole Foods to YoSushi, Patisserie Valerie to Gail's Bakery, fine food and dining is easy. Fulham is very well connected too, with a Tube station and many buses on the high street. Add in some great pubs, excellent wine bars, and lots of green space/parks and you've got a great base from which to enjoy London. See AirBnB's neighbourhood guide to Fulham for more. Our postcode is "SW6 1EJ".
notes: Ask us and we'll answer.
transit: The Tube is just 2 minutes away, or take a short bus trip up Fulham Rd to Harrods, or to Sloane Square, Piccadilly and beyond.
access: We give you a set of keys to use during your stay. Enter the house through the main front door.
house_rules: Guests respect our high standards and we respect them for appreciating everything we offer. Simple.

neighborhood_overview: Barnet is one of the largest boroughs in London, situated to the North West of the city and bordering Hertfordshire. Featuring neighbourhood diversity ranging from London’s most expensive and exclusive properties in leafy and sought after locations through to your typical terraced or purpose built homes, this expansive borough offers a great variety of sights, sounds and culture.

Gatwick, City airport and Heathrow you will need to take the metro.

name: Beautiful Ensuite Richmond-upon-Thames borough
summary: Walking distance to Twickenham Stadium, 35 min drive to Wimbledon Tennis! London borough of Richmond.
space: This is a spacious Bedsit + En-Suite at the top of a large Victorian family house. Approximately 25 minute walk to Twickenham Stadium & a 35 minute drive to Wimbledon Tennis, or 45-50 mins by public transport this is a peaceful retreat. It benefits from super views over exotic gardens. The decor is clean, simple and tasteful. The En-suite bedsit is well appointed with ample storage space, simple but efficient cooking facilities, and shared washing machine/drier. Within a minute's walk there are friendly local shops and excellent transport facilities that will get you to St Margaret's station within 3-5 minutes, or Richmond station within 5-10 minutes. A news-agent, post box, butcher, delicatessen, cafe/restaurant. The river Thames tow-path is 2 minute's walk away, and it is a scenic 20 minute walk into Richmond town centre. Wifi included. Available immediately just in time for the tournament. References will be required.

name: Kew Gardens 3BR house in cul-de-sac
summary: 3 Bed House with garden close to Thames river (2 min walk, private road to river nearby), on the District Line Underground (7 min walk) for direct access into Central London, near Kew Gardens. Kids playground in walking distance along the Thames tow path.
space: Residential neighborhood, mix of English and corporate expat families. House is in a cul-de-sac with a private road to the river Thames at its end. River about 300 feet away. Walking distance to subway (7 min).  Central London via the underground: 30-40 min, the District line (Kew Gardens stop 7 min walk - Zone 3). In addition, the Overground to Stratford also stops at the Kew Gardens underground station (Kew Gardens stop 7 min walk). Further, there is an overland railway station at Kew Bridge (10 min walk) to take you to Waterloo railway station in 21 minutes.  By bicycle one can follow the towpath to Hammersmith Bridge or continue to Putney Bridge (50 min).  Lastly, several Streetcar parking spots within a few min walk. Imperial College (and the museum of Natural History, the science and technology museum, the Victoria and Albert): 20 minute ride, straight shot on the subway (to South Kensington). If you use it, take care of it 8. If you make a mess, clean it up 9. If you move it, put it back 10. If it belongs to someone else and you want to use it, ask permission first 11. name: You are GUARANTEED to love this
space: This room is located on the ground floor of the house. It is lovely, a very good size with a double bed and has a beautiful view of the garden, with your own door leading out to the patio. AND a plentiful breakfast is included in the price of the room! Blenheim Lodge is a beautiful house in a quiet upmarket residential area in North London, the perfect place to rest and recover after a busy day out sightseeing. You can take advantage of the big garden in the summer months, when it is full of colourful flowers and wildlife.  Our house is in Zone 3, 20 minutes by underground to London Bridge and Kings Cross and just 10 minutes to Camden Market. The nearest station is East Finchely and is 5 minutes walking distance from our house.    Cinema, shops, pubs and restaurants are minutes away from the house.  If you do not mind changing rooms in order to cover your requested days please contact me as I might be able to book you in different rooms.  Wi-Fi available  Towels, bed linen and hairdrye

name: Gorgeous Victorian Flat Overlooking London Fields
summary: Situated literally in London Fields park and only moments from the Lido heated outdoor swimming pool this Victorian one-bedroom apartment is the ideal location for a visit to London's most vibrant and trendy area.  Broadway Market is on the doorstep and Hackney Central and Dalston only a short stroll away, as well as easy Underground and bus access to Central London. This listing is for the whole apartment. Fast Broadband, Cable TV, towels, toiletries and breakfast are included.
space: The flat is situated in the beautiful area of London Fields in Hackney. The super-trendy area of Hackney, close to famous Dalston, Islington and the City of London, contains an outstanding choice of arts and cultural attractions, shops, bars and restaurants. The famous Hackney Empire theatre and Hackney Picturehouse, are moments away. Broadway Market with it's quaint and stylish shops and restaurants are quite literally on your doorstep and Columbia Road, famous for it's Sunday flower-market can be reached with a pleasant stroll. The flat itself is actually located within London Fields park, a great place to take in some sun in the summertime while also a vibrant social maelstrom all year round! The London Fields Lido is only a short walk across the park! Victoria Park with all it's amenities is also reachable by foot in 10 minutes or so. The flat is also located very nearby to the area of Dalston and Stoke Newington where the local Turkish and young artistic communities produce a real

neighborhood_overview: London Fields is one of the most vibrant and exciting places in London. Broadway market is just moments away with all the great shops, bars and cafes plus the great market every Saturday.
notes: Check in from - 15:00  Check out before - 12:00 Please note that there is an additional charge of £50 for any late check-ins after 11pm
transit: Transport: Trains/tube station walking distances: London Fields Station (Overground Line) - 4 minute walk. This will take you to London Liverpool Street Station for connections on to many tube lines and also the trains and coaches to Stansted Airport. Hackney Central Station (Overground Line) - 10 minute walk. This will take you to Stratford, Camden Town, Hampstead and then to Kew Gardens or Richmond. Bethnal Green Underground Station (Central Line) - 15 minute walk or 5-10 minute on number 106 or 254 buses. The Central Line takes you across central London to Oxford Circus in about 13 minutes. Buses There are many bus routes that will take you all over London, here's just a few!: 55 (N55 night bus) - Oxford Circus 48 - London Bridge 26 (N26 night bus) - Waterloo Cycling There are plenty of Santander Cycle Hire docking stations nearby for cheap bike hire.  If you need parking please let me know in advance so I can arrange it for you.
access: You have full access to the whole apartment yourselves so you can come and go at your leisure 24 hours a day.  There is free high speed broadband internet, Cable TV, a washing machine (with washing tablets) and a dryer. You will also have fresh towels and the use of toiletries and I will leave some Oyster cards (a top up system which allows you to travel cheaply around the city via tube, train and bus).
house_rules: - Strictly no smoking. - The flat sleeps 2 people. Only guests who have booked are allowed in the apartment unless prior notice has been given. - Strictly no parties. - Please be considerate to our neighbours. Respectful and reasonable quiet noise levels especially between 10pm and 9am. - Please respect the apartment as you would your own and leave it in the same condition as you found it in. Most importantly relax and enjoy your stay!

Regrettably  Emily-dog has passed away which brings great sorrow but luckily, the neighbours cat has taken up visiting us on a  regular basis. He seems to love the idea of house guests! He can be found hanging out in any of Emmy's favourite spots. >^..^ <. Bear in mind that this house was built in the Victorian era and still has many of the original features. name: SUNNY ROOM PRIVATE BATHROOM PLUS BREAKFAST
summary: Our guest room & bathroom overlooks the garden. It is simply furnished with a comfortable double bed. The private bathroom has a bath & shower with towels supplied.  Breakfast is served in the kitchen where guests are welcome to make tea & coffee at other times, but we don't offer guests cooking facilities.  There is pay by phone parking in the street 7 days per week 9am-9pm
space: The house is located in a quiet street in lively diverse Shepherd's Bush. This is a multicultural area where you will experience a taste of real life in the capital and still be only a short bus or tube ride away from all its famous tourist haunts. Our guest room is on the second floor and is located at the back of the house overlooking the garden. The room is quiet with no traffic noise and simply furnished, light and airy double bedroom and next to it is a private bathroom for the sole use of our guests.  Ours is a typical Victorian era terraced family home. Like a lot of old houses it has its creaks and the plumbing has its own quirky character.  BREAKFAST AVAILABLE  Breakfast - juice, croissants, yoghurt, bagels, fruit coffee or tea, is served in our bright family kitchen and can be left out for you to help yourself to whenever it suits you.  If you’re not breakfast eaters just let us know in advance. The family is often long gone when our guests have their breakfast so you will  h

neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush is one of London's truly diverse neighbourhoods. Throughout different time in the day and weekend the demographic in the streets is in a constant state of flux. It is lively and urban but at the same time friendly and neighbourly. In London ethnic diversity is the norm and in the 21 years we have lived none of our family, including our teenage and young adult daughters and son have ever experienced any problems with safety even when returning home late at night. There are always people on the streets 24/7 which adds to this feeling and night buses stop right at the end of our street.
notes: OUR CHECK IN IS AT 3pm & CHECK OUT 10.30am However while we can't always guarantee earlier access to our guest room, if we have guest checking out in the morning and it needs to be cleaned, we aim to accommodate earlier check in times where possible and guests are always welcome to drop off their bags at the house.  We are also happy to keep our guests bags on the day they leave so long as they check out of the room by 10.30am. Bags can be kept downstairs in the lounge and collected later. Guests can keep their key until then.
transit: Shepherds Bush is one of the best served neighbourhoods for transportation. It is a transport hub where buses, overground and underground trains carry people to different destinations all over the capital but also the rest of the UK and the main airports are easily accessible from here.
access: Guest have use of our guest room and their own private bathroom. Breakfast is served in the kitchen. At other times the family kitchen is only available to make hot drinks - we don't provide guests with cooking facilities. However if you wish to use the fridge to store food items you are welcome to - just label them as sometimes our kids won't realise it's not ours!
house_rules: No Smoking, please be relatively quiet after 11pm.  Guests can choose to have their breakfast in the kitchen or a breakfast tray left outside their room.  If no breakfast is required please let us know in advance.  Use of our kitchen to make hot drinks at other times is permitted however guests are kindly asked to respect our privacy during evening meals. We politely request that guests take off their shoes - particularly when returning home late at night and on wet days. name: CHARMING FAMILY HOME SLEEPS 10
summary: A typical Victorian Terraces London house, colourfully decorated, comfortable and homely. This is a friendly, quiet neighbourhood street with plenty of nearby restaurants, takeaways and great transport links right into the centre of London.  Westfield one of Europe's largest urban shopping malls is on our doorstep. You get to feel like a local living in London but still with easy access to all the tourist areas. Convenient for airports & Eurostar
space: Our simply furnished low tech 5 bedroom Victorian terraced family home is located in a quiet street in lively Shepherds Bush. As our own family home it provides guests with the opportunity to live in London as a local. For this listing all five of our double bedrooms are available for the use of up to 10 guests.

This is our family home and we know that Airbnb community members are always respectful of that fact.  As we are occasionally out of town and most of our grown up children have left home we are happy to make our house available to othe
neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush itself is a prime real estate location. It is among one of the most diverse neighbourhoods in London with convenience stores and multi ethnic restaurants just around the corner from the house.  Shepherds Bush is one of London best linked transport hubs giving guests easy access to Central London, the major airports, North, West and South- West Britain. Shepherds Bush Green is a short walk or even shorter bus ride away from our home and is a bustling metropolitan centre with market, theatres, cinemas, music venues, gyms, night clubs, and the massive Westfield Shopping Mall with its comprehensive shopping ranging from Tiffany to Marks and Spencer, Prada to the Disney Store.  The BBC Television Centre is also just around the corner with its new high end restaurants, Soho House and TV studios. The London College of Fashion and the University of The Arts is also based in Shepherds Bush making this area popular with media types and fashion folks . We also have the FA first div
notes: While we make sure our home is clean and tidy, potential guests are reminded that this is a family house and therefore contains all the trappings of our family life. We do leave our personal effects in the house but we will clear the top couple of drawers in each of the bedrooms and leave coat hangers out for guests to hang clothes behind the bedroom doors. Downstairs there are plenty of places to hang coats and store outdoor shoes. Guests are welcome to use our condiments and spices in the kitchen and we only request that anything used is replaced if it runs out!  We will also provide a detailed information leaflet that explains things about the house and area. This is made available by Airbnb when guests make their booking.
transit: (Zone 2 on the tube) Shepherds Bush is extremely well linked by public transport to all of London's major attractions.  Shepherds Bush has direct London Underground tube lines and London Overground trains from to the Central London’s West End, The City, Canary Wharf, Kensington Palace, Hampstead Heath, Richmond Park, The Olympic Park Stratford, Wembley Stadium, Buckingham Palace, Whitehall, Houses of Parliament, St Paul's Cathedral and Westminster Abbey, Horse Guards Parade, London's Earl's Court and Olympia Exhibition Centres. There are easy routes to Heathrow and Gatwick airports, and Stansted via Liverpool Street.  It is also easy to get to the typical English seaside at Brighton, and access the M4 and M3 motorways for West of England including Windsor and Eton and M40 for Oxford and the North of England.  GETTING HERE Car drivers please note: There is on street pay and display parking here with charges made from Monday to Sunday between 9am and 9pm.  Car drivers can pay for parking
access: This is our family home and we know that Airbnb community members are always respectful of that fact.  As we are occasionally out of town and most of our grown up children have left home we are happy to make our house available to other families or groups of mature friends who would like somewhere homely to stay in London. Guests will have access to all of our five double bedrooms, there are two bathrooms both with showers and baths, there is also a spacious  kitchen diners where guests are welcome to cook their own food or eat takeaway food from the many local restaurants and food outlets on our doorstep.  Guests also have access to the back garden where we have outdoor dining table and chairs and a barbecue. Most of our grown up kids live in different parts of London but all are happy to be contacted should guests have any queries about the house or need advice about their visit and the local area when there are no family members staying in the house during the booking period.
house_rules: Guests are responsible clearing up after themselves and leaving the house tidy.  We politely request that guests remove outdoor shoes when in the house

summary: Welcome to my place! I am offering a large room in a renovated flat, with contemporary décor. The room is airy and spacious, with plenty of natural light and very comfortable. Located in a residential road, the flat is just 8 minutes’ walk from Queens Road Peckham station, on the Overground and mainline trains. There are several buses going into town, Greenwich and Victoria. Peckham itself is a vibrant and fashionable area, and there are plenty of good cafes, bars and restaurants minutes away!

The bedroom floor is carpeted (for better comfort) but the floors in the rest of the flat are solid oak and ceramic tiles for the kitchen and bathroom.

You will have full access to your room and the bathroom.   A light breakfast (coff
neighborhood_overview: Peckham itself is a vibrant and fashionable area, and there are plenty of good cafes, bars and restaurants across the area.  Peckham is thhe London neighborhood that has been voted one of the coolest in the world.  Frank’s Café on Rye Lane, provided the gold standard for the Peckham renaissance. Open every summer, it occupies the top floor of a former multistorey car park, welcoming children and dogs with alacrity, and staff hand out blankets on chillier evenings. The six storeys beneath Frank’s host Peckham Levels, which are open year-round: a galli­maufry of international cuisine (mezze platters, Hawaiian poke, vegan pizza), a yoga centre, art and ceramics studios and Ghost Notes, a live-music bar. Tickets for the latest Hollywood releases and independent films at the ground-floor Peckhamplex cost a mere £4.99, less than half the price of cinema admission in London’s West End. All in all, perhaps the absolute best use of a used car park anywhere, ever...
notes: The flat is located on the 2nd floor (and top floor) without elevator. No pets and no smoking in the flat, please.
transit: In addition of being served by London Overground (Queens Road Peckham), there are great communications with city centre: -Direct trains to London Bridge (2 stops) -Direct buses to Soho (13 stops) and Vauxhall (12 stops).
access: You will have full access to your room and the bathroom.   A light breakfast (coffe/tea, oats and fruit) is offered in the kitchen. But there is no share of the kitchen for meals or cooking. You can have access to the kitchen for hot and cold drinks, fruit and light snacks. The tea and coffe making facilities (along  microwave, fridge and kitchenware) are available for that purpose. No eating in the bedroom, please. In order to keep the flat clean, everyone is requested to take the shoes off when entering the flat.

neighborhood_overview: West Green is an area of North London, England in the United Kingdom and part of the London Borough of Haringey. It is an inner-suburban area located 5.7 miles (9.22 km) north of Charing Cross. The area is mainly residential and includes both Chestnuts and Downhills parks. Its area is roughly defined by Downhills Park in the North and Northeast, by Cornwall Road to the East, a line running between Cranleigh and Stanley Roads to the South, Harringay Road and Stanmore Road to the West and Northwest.

name: Room in relaxed family house!
summary: Lovely friendly house, close to central line underground station. Pretty sure you'll enjoy your stay.
space: Welcome!  I have a five bedroom modern townhouse in East London. It is just 8-11 minute walk to nearby Leyton underground station. It is close to local amenities, and about 15 minute walk from Europe's largest shopping mall, Westfield. The place is close to public transport connections, and of course, I will be here to give advise on the sights of our beautiful and historic city. If you are a nature lover, then the house is close to Epping Forest; and if you're sporty, there are places to go cycling, horse riding, ice skating and rowing. And there is a nearby gym and leisure centre. If you're a foodie, you will also have a feast! The room is a double room, TV, chair, cupboard and chest of drawers. You also have complete access to the shared relaxed lounge and kitchen. The house is cosy and warm with central heating and wifi. name: A room with a view in Kensington
summary: A peaceful and spacious Bedroom in a beautiful house. A choice of 1 super king size bed, 2 or 3 single beds, or the big bed and a single can be set for your needs. There are two windows overlooking this lovely street. If more than two people, then you will have a sole use of one of the bathrooms in the case there is another guests or me in the house. There are no pets living in the house!
space: Come and stay in a lovely spacious home in West Kensington. You'll have a spacious and beautiful bedroom. The house is within a safe and beautiful conservation area close to Kensington Village and Olympia Exhibitions Centre. Clean towels and linen provided. The new super king size bed can be split into two single beds if required and another single bed will be able to fit in the room to if needed.  As well as your room, you will also have access to the kitchen for making a cup of tea or coffee, prepare and eat a meal. The house is peaceful, the street is quiet and safe, yet very central and well located. The internet access is fast and reliable.   Excellent Location with lots of transport choices connecting you to anywhere in London and outside London. It´s very close to Olympia Exhibition Centre. notes: Please take your shoes off. No smoking allowed in the house. Please clean the kitchen after you use it.
transit: The flat is within 3-5 and 7 mins walk from three underground stations and many bus routes that will take you to anywhere in London and outside London. We also count with an overground station, Olympia, which will connect you with the South, North and East of London in one easy train ride.
access: You are welcome to eat and heat up food in the large kitchen.   If three of you stay, then you will get the exclusive use of one of the bathrooms in the house.
house_rules: This is a friendly home and respectful manners are expected at all times.  No friends/acquaintances are allowed in the house, unless included at the time of reservation. Please provide an ID upon arrival, this can be a passport or an UK driver's license.  - Please take your shoes off as you come in. If you don't like walking barefoot, please bring your slippers or non-slide socks. -There will be a charge of £10 per washing if you need to do your laundry -Make sure doors are closed as you come in and out of the house. -If you are to use the terrace, make sure the door is locked after use. -Please ensure the dishes go in the dish washer and that you clean up after using the kitchen. -Please be considerate, turn off lights when they are not being used.  -Be quiet when entering too late and going to the the bathroom at night.  -Strictly no smoking in the house.  This is our home and we want you to feel comfortable.

name: You Will Save Money Here
summary: Blenheim Lodge was built in 1878 when there were only horses and coaches travelling on the roads. If you are travelling by car we have off road parking in front of our house. East Finchley is a safe friendly area. Our house is about five minutes walk to the tube train station, shops, pubs and restaurants. There are parks nearby and the Phoenix cinema is the oldest continually running cinema in England.
space: This room is located on the ground floor of the house. It is lovely, a good size with a double bed and has a 'Great Britain' theme! A lovely, plentiful breakfast is included in the price of the room. Blenheim Lodge is a beautiful house in a quiet upmarket residential area in North London, the perfect place to rest and recover after a busy day out sightseeing. You can take advantage of the big garden in the summer months, when it is full of colourful flowers and wildlife. Our house is in Zone 3, 20 minutes by underground to London Bridge and Kings Cross St. Pancrass, just 10 minutes to Camden Market. The nearest station is East Finchley and is 5 minutes walking distance from our house. Cinema, shops, pubs and restaurants are minutes away from the house. If you do not mind changing rooms in order to cover your requested days please contact me as I might be able to book you in different rooms. Wi-Fi available  for guests to use. notes: At the moment we are looking after our daughters two Siamese cats called Splodge and Coconut.  This room is on the ground floor overlooking our front garden. The bathroom is shared with one other guest room. East Finchley station is in zone 3 of the London underground.

name: Fabulous flat w garden and bkfst!
summary: Holland Park/Notting Hill. Guests have access to the large flat and beautiful conservatory that opens onto spectacular garden. Breakfast can be served in both (or in bed). Host is a chef and one of the perks is an invite to spontaneous fusion meal.
space: This lovely flat is spacious, spotless and funky chic. The glass covered conservatory where breakfast is served opens out to private garden, lovely to look out on a rainy day or to read the morning newspaper on a sunny day. The room can be configured with a single bed or king size bed. We have a larger bedroom available too under a separate listing. A stay includes coffee or tea, juice and breakfast... plus a morning newspaper. The room is available up to two weeks at a time, but will consider longer stays.
description: Holland Park/Notting Hill. Guests have access to the large flat and beautiful conservatory that opens onto spectacular garden. Breakfast can be served in both (or in bed). Host is a chef and one of the perks is an invite to spontaneous fusion meal. This lovely flat is spacious, spotless and funky chic. The glass covered conservatory where breakfast is served opens out to private garden, lovely to look out on a rainy day or to read the morning newspaper on a sunny day. The room can be configured with a single bed or king size bed. We have a larger bedroom available too under a separate listing. A stay includes coffee or tea, juice and breakfast... plus a morning newspaper. The room is available up to two weeks at a time, but will consider longer stays. Guests have access to the kitchen, conservatory and garden. Although we prefer no cooking, guests can keep things in the fridge and since we cook a lot there is a pretty good chance you'll be offered a meal. There is a TV in the bedroom.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Holland Park borders Notting Hill and is filled with trees, and a beautiful park (10 minutes walk) that shares its name. Withing a 20 minute walk you can visit the famous Portobello Market for antique shopping or fresh produce and food stands, the chic shops of Westbourne Grove or bookstores and delicatessens along Holland Park Avenue. In the middle of the city, this neighborhood is an oasis of peace.
notes: The bedroom is only suited for a single person or a couple or a single parent and one child (no babies please).
transit: There are two tube stops nearby, each about 5 minutes walk - Holland Park and Shepherds Bush - and there are many buses that stop right in front of the house. There is no parking on the street.
access: Guests have access to the kitchen, conservatory and garden. Although we prefer no cooking, guests can keep things in the fridge and since we cook a lot there is a pretty good chance you'll be offered a meal. There is a TV in the bedroom.
house_rules: No smoking in the house, but as long as guests take care of their cigaret butts, smoking is allowed in the garden.  No pets are allowed.

name: Beautiful 1 bed apt in Queens Park
summary: A beautiful, light-filled, mid-century design inspired apartment in an attractive modern apartment block with great views across London.  Perfect for couples or for a business traveller wanting a place to stay within easy reach of town and the world famous Portobello market. There is a new building being constructed across the road.  It's in the final phases and not noisy anymore (thankfully). But occasionally you can expect some minor disruption Mon - Fri 8am - 6pm.
space: This spacious home is arranged on the third floor and comprises of semi open-plan kitchen/reception room, double bedroom, bathroom and large private balcony. This apartment is presented in excellent condition throughout and is furnished in a contemporary style.  On street parking available. No private parking. Parking restrictions in place Mon-Fri, 8.30am - 6.30pm, free on weekends. Bank holidays parking charges apply. See parking details on last picture of gallery.

space: Double Private Room with Ensuite Bathroom. This elegant house with French windows leading onto a garden is conveniently situated on the border of Fulham/Chelsea.  Furnished with antiques  and modern decor. This B&B is used mostly by regulars from all over the world who return year after year. Good public transport nearby, trendy restaurants nearby and only 5 minutes from the River Thames. Three large parks.  TV in each bedroom. The owner/occupier has helped make many TV documentaries on Britain and France and she shares her dozens of books and information.  With her large car, she is also able to do pick ups from airports etc.   For anyone touring Britain she also does tailor made tours for up to 6 people.

The area is home to three train stations (all, confusingly, called West Hampstead!) and is a bona fide yuppie
neighborhood_overview: West Hampstead is, to all intents and purposes, just one street - West End Lane. It is located in the London Borough of Camden, in zone two of the London Underground. It borders Belsize Park/Finchley Road to the east, and Kilburn/Willesden to the west. In the north are Cricklewood and Golders Green, whilst to the south lie uber-refined St. John's Wood and Maida Vale. The area is home to three train stations (all, confusingly, called West Hampstead!) and is a bona fide yuppie stronghold. Though West Hampstead is hardly a place that springs to mind when you think nightlife, it has a smattering of good restaurants, pubs and bars. On the whole, the area's watering holes are towards the swankier (and pricier) end of the spectrum, and places tend to feel more mature feel than, say, Camden Town. In terms of nightclubs, Lately on West End Lane is a charming old-school dancing spot, whilst the Lower Ground Bar (also on West End Lane) flaunts its status as "West Hampstead's Premier Nightspot." O
notes: Safe, friendly and sophisticated.

access: Use of kitchen for morning tea/coffee only. Shared use of bathroom.
house_rules: No loud guests.  Reasonable hours. No kitchen use, safe for coffe/tea in the morning.

name: ONE BEDROOM IN NEW DEVELOPMENT
space: The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea is rich in history and architectural interest - yet fashionably modern.  The area has always been closely associated with the British Monarchy : The Albert Hall and the recently restored Albert Memorial dedicated to Price Albert, the husband of Queen Victoria are located in Kensington - an area that is also associated with the late Princess Diana who lived at Kensington Palace.  However, it is not just the spectacular monuments and history that attract so many tourists each and every year, but also the shopping, the restaurants, the nightlife. Kensington & Chelsea has the ability to remain "fashionably cool". Kings Road, Chelsea with its many boutiques epitomised Op-Art fashion in the 60's, in the 70's Kings Road was the home-place of punk-rock fashion. An amazing one bedroom apartment within this modern development. The apartment consists of living/dining room, double bedroom, kitchen with dishwasher, washing machine and microwave. Other ben

name: Cosy Double studio in Zone 2 Hammersmith (6)
space: Our studios are located in Hammersmith. Hammersmith is a leafy Borough on the North Bank of the River Thames. The extensive transport links make it a convenient base to explore London. The studios are only a 3 minute walk from public transport & only minutes away by underground & bus from top London attractions of Kensington, South Kensington, Knightsbridge as well as central London a 15-20 minute ride away. Closer to home HMV Apollo is a 5 minute walk. Locally there is a large selection of restaurants & local pubs.  Locally 3 minutes walk you have Kings Mall Shopping Centre with numerous stores as well as a large supermarket. You will find a wealth of restaurants catering for every conceivable taste only a few minutes walk away. Local bars & pubs are plentiful & all within minutes walk away; only 5 minutes by tube. To the north is Shepherds Bush with it's fabulous Westfield Mall. The largest urban shopping centre in Europe with 250 stores (including a designer Village) 50 restaurants

space: I have a fantastic one bedroom flat in a beautiful Georgian building in Notting Hill. It is situated on a beautiful, quiet, tree lined street in one of the most sort after streets in this trendy area. It is a 5 minutes walk from Westbourne Grove (fabulous designer shops), and 10/15 mins Portobello Road ,and Hyde Park/Kensington Gardens. The flat is in a fabulous central location with 4 tube stations and an abundance of buses nearby! The flat in in ZONE 1. The apartment is south facing with high ceilings, sash windows and beech wooden floors throughout. You will find bespoke 11ft hardwood doors in the apartment, and sand blasted glass sliding door into the bathroom. name: Beautiful double bedroom Stockwell
summary: A lovely big bright bedroom in a 2 bedroom flat, sharing with me (but i'm away quite a lot).  There is easy access to just about everywhere in London, 7 minutes walk to Stockwell tube station, the neighbourhood is a great authentic part of London.
space: A delightful double bedroom, in a 2-bedroom apartment (sharing with me).  The kitchen and sitting room are open-plan, there's a good TV/DVD set-up, and doors lead out to the big roof terrace (smoking allowed out there) with lots of lovely plants in the summer.  The bedroom has a comfy double bed, a small desk, huge windows and plenty of storage with a big wardrobe.  The bathroom is wonderful with a powerful shower and plenty of hot water, and a washing machine.  The apartment has wireless internet and plenty of good books and fun things to play with, very cosy.  It is over the top floors of a Victorian building, about 7 minutes walk from Stockwell tube station. The apartment is in Stockwell which is fairly central in London - it's 3 stops on the tube from Victoria Station.  The tube lines are the Victoria and Northern lines so links into most parts of the city are fantastic. notes: It's your visit make the most of it!  35% drop in prices is in effect since extensive refurbishments in the flats above and next door (including installation of a new roof); have left the communal hallway and my flat in need of a paint job. Otherwise, everything is in perfect working order. There are seperate listings for the double  room and the entire apartment. You are booking either the double room for 2 or the single room for one person on this listing, and not 2 rooms. To book the 2 rooms you need to book the entire flat at its own listing.
transit: Tube and bus stop only 2 minutes walk away. Perfeclty connected to all main London rail and tube stations and easy access to all London's main business areas and tourist attractions. Eat excellent food at local restaurants at reasonable prices.
access: I will be at home to meet you and settle you in, if not I will arrange to leave keys for you with one of the neighbors and with detailed instructions how to get here.
house_rules: NO SMOKING, NO PETS AND NO FRIENDS.  NO COOKING FOR GUESTS STAYING LESS THAN ONE WEEK.  THE DOUBLE ROOM IS PRICED AT120GBP FOR 2 PEOPLE (INCLUSIVE OF CONCESSION FOR EXTRA PERSON). This rate may be reduced during low season and will reflect in the pricing during booking.  IF I AM AWAY, HEATING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE PRICE. A GAS METER READING WILL BE TAKEN AT DAY OF ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE. GUESTS WILL BE CHARGED FOR IT SEPARATELY.  ELECTRIC READINGS WILL BE TAKEN & USAGE IN EXCESS OF 15GBP/WEEK WILL BE CHARGED TO THE GUEST. THE SINGLE ROOM IS FOR ONE PERSON ONLY AND THE REGULAR  RATE IS 75GBP.  THE FLAT IS ALWAYS IMMACULATELY CLEAN AND TIDY AND GUESTS ARE EXPECTED TO MAINTAIN THE STANDARDS.  NO OTHER HOUSE RULES I CAN THINK OF, I SHALL CONTINUE TO WAFFLE ON UNTIL I MEET THE AIRBNB REQUIREMENTS OF MORE THAN FIFTY ONE WORDS FOR HOUSE RULES. SOUNDS LIKE ALLOT OF HOUSE RULES TO ME!!   TOP RULE IS THAT YOU RELAX AND ENJOY YOUR STAY  ;)

name: Spacious Upmarket Belsize Park
summary: This beautifully refurbished, bright, spacious and very comfortable flat is located on the fifth floor (with lift) of an upmarket purpose built block.
space: This beautifully refurbished, bright, spacious and very comfortable flat is located on the fifth floor (with lift) of an upmarket purpose built block.   The block is located within 3 minutes walk from Belsize Park tube station (Northern line).  This reserved and exclusive block is beautifully maintained and staffed 24/7 by friendly and helpful porters. It is very well located for transportation into all the attractions at the center of town being close to Belsize Park tube station and also within 10 minutes walking distance to Swiss Cottage tube station (Jubilee line).  The flat is close to the very cool and exciting, Camden Lock market and Camden Town.  Just a 5-minute tube ride or 15 minute bus ride away!!! The block is surrounded by beautiful and large private gardens, exclusively available to the residents.  Through the seasons the gardens change with a spectacular display of flowers all through the summer.   Squirrels reside in the gardens and can be seen leaping through the tree

house_rules: • Check-in time is 2PM. Smoking is not permitted within the flat or in the small outdoors balcony.  Parties or dinners with invited guests are not allowed. We ask that you are discreet and do not discuss the details of your stay with other residents in the building.  Check-in 2pm onwards, check-out 11am. If no other bookings exist for your check in or check out day then these times can be flexible.

name: Beautiful huge double room in artist’s garden flat
summary: In the heart of the trendy east end, this spacious garden flat offers lots of light and space. A 5 minute walk to both Whitechapel ( District/Circle, Hammersmith and City and Overland lines) and Bethnal Green ( Central line) tube stations, the apartment couldn't be better connected for sight seeing in London, both daily and also with easy access to the night tube at weekends.  In addition the local area is a thriving hub of trendy cafes and bars, with the famous Brick Lane only minutes away.
space: Your room comes with Egyptian cotton sheets, a large wardrobe, desk, chest of drawers and Edison lamp. The apartment is decorated with original photography, film posters and some quirky artefacts, creating an eclectic and interesting space to relax after a day touring London.  The garden affords a relaxed and fragrant addition, rarely found in the heart of London, to sit and relax or smoke.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment lies in the heart of the east end. Famous local history includes Jack the Ripper, The Krays and The Elephant man.  This is the rich and vibrant east end! On the doorstep are trendy London Fields, lush Victoria Park, the Famous Whitechapel gallery, art cinemas, local markets, Columbia road flower market, Brick lane, Spitalfields, Shoreditch and Hoxton.
notes: There is a direct bus (A7 National Express coach) Which you can take to and from Whitechapel and Stansted Airport.  Welcome drinks, coffee and tea are available.
transit: You couldn't be better connected with five lines within a five minute walk. (District /Circle /Hammersmith and City/ Overland/Central line). The night tube runs through to nearby Bethnal Green at weekends, and night buses N25 and N8 run throughout the week.  An uber into Tottenham Court Road starting at around £8.00 The journey by tube 12 minutes from Bethnal Green tube. In addition the National Express A7 bus brings you directly to and from Whitechapel to Stansted Airport.
access: Guests will have full access to the living space, garden, kitchen, hallways and entrance. I will look forward to greeting them and offering them tailor made recommendations for their trip. I have had years experience of travel, and living in London, and can tailor itineraries for different ages/budgets/interests with many off the beaten track tips outside of the typical tourist route.  I can make recommendations for local restaurants/bars in Brick lane, London fields, Bethnal Green and elsewhere.

name: FASCINATING ONE BEDROOM APT IN CANARY WHARF
summary: Spacious, sophisticated and modern, Lanterns Court, located moments away from the business district Canary Wharf, exudes a welcoming ambience for guests in the city. 03rd guest at £35 per night. Early Check-in / Late Check-in & Late Check-out basis availability and on payment of extra charges in advance. The apartment doesn't have a fixed reception. Our standard Check-in time is 3-8 PM.
space: With large windows overlooking the surrounding area, the living spaces are defined by natural light, whilst featuring a seating area, a television, a coffee table and a dining space suitable for four people. The kitchens in these apartments offer all the necessary appliances, utensils and crockery for home from home living. The spacious bedrooms feature neutral tones and chic furnishings that add character to the space, while the bathrooms contain bathing and showering facilities. Additionally, each apartment contains complimentary Wi-Fi and a secure entry system.  Offering one and two bedroom apartments, the apartments are neutral in tone, minimalist yet stylishly contemporary.

neighborhood_overview: The financial hub of London, Canary Wharf is a modern district located in the east of the city. Housing some of London’s most iconic and attractive skyscrapers, Canary Wharf is a popular district for corporate travelers working in the surrounding area.  Although Canary Wharf is synonymous with big business and capital, the district features ample entertainment options for guests. Canary Wharf offers cultural activities, such as the Dockland Museum and an abundance of public art, in addition to retail, dining and drinking options.
notes: DISCLAIMER : Please note, at this time, we can only offer accommodation for key workers. We are not accepting any other types of booking at the moment. DISCLAIMER : Please be aware due to unexpected traffic & weather condition you might have to wait a maximum 15 minutes before a member of our Guest Services can check you in.  DISCLAIMER : Please note we have multiple units within same building. Images used are only for representation purpose and the actual apartment may vary. However, facilities and standards will remain the same. DISCLAIMER : Additional charges will be applicable in case of early check-in and late check-out. Also this will be subject to the availability.
transit: Canary Wharf is well-connected to central London’s other business and tourist hubs. The DLR runs from several stations in the area- Heron Quays, South Quay, Canary Wharf, Cross harbour and West India Quay. Journeys to central London take around 15 minutes. Canary Wharf is located on the Jubilee Line.
access: We know our guests are concerned regarding health and safety post drastic rise in COVID-19 cases across  Europe. In lieu to this we have introduced specialized services: *Deep Cleaning - A longer process to our deep cleaning policy. *14-day grocery pack - This will cover the required isolation period. *Extra HK Sanitation Service - Our HK team will use COSHH, Diesin Maxx Acid Cleaner Disinfectant and other medically approcved products. *Intercom System - Ensures distance from others and stop further contamination. *High Speed Broadband - Work from the apartments with ease and no hassle. *Healthcare Products - Gloves , masks and sanitiser gels provided if needed. *Entertainment Package - Use (Hidden by Airbnb) Chrome-cast to stream from your laptop to the TV. Please Note : They are subject to availability Grocery Pack : If you or your employee want anything specific, or have any allergies, please let our guest services know 24 hours in advance

name: Cosy Double studio in Zone 2 Hammersmith (4)
space: Our studios are located in Hammersmith. Hammersmith is a leafy Borough on the North Bank of the River Thames. The extensive transport links make it a convenient base to explore London. The studios are only a 3 minute walk from public transport & only minutes away by underground & bus from top London attractions of Kensington, South Kensington, Knightsbridge as well as central London a 15-20 minute ride away. Closer to home HMV Apollo is a 5 minute walk. Locally there is a large selection of restaurants & local pubs.  Locally 3 minutes walk you have Kings Mall Shopping Centre with numerous stores as well as a large supermarket. You will find a wealth of restaurants catering for every conceivable taste only a few minutes walk away. Local bars & pubs are plentiful & all within minutes walk away; only 5 minutes by tube. To the north is Shepherds Bush with it's fabulous Westfield Mall. The largest urban shopping centre in Europe with 250 stores (including a designer Village) 50 restaurants

name: Portobello Road Notting hill. Exceptional value.
summary: Exceptional value.
space: This is the family home of an artist on the famous Portobello Road and market. Hip, bohemian lively area with many cafes and restaurants. On Friday and Saturday the market runs directly by our door. I would describe my home as "shabby chic" rather than super smart, and typical of the old style of Portobello houses. It is clean, light, airy artistic and comfortable . The room has a double bed, and is large and comfortable! There is a little roof terrace garden with table and chairs, which is lovely to sit out on, on warm summer night! The apartment has wifi throughout. Please note that I have 2 lovely cats! Portobello Road is a wonderful and friendly area, full of cafes and bars. There is always interesting shopping and browsing in the market and surrounding shops. The market takes place every weekend, and you can browse the amazing antiques stalls, or maybe pick up an vintage bargain. There are also lots of amazing food stalls, selling cuisine from every corner of the world! During the

name: Gorgeous London garden apartment
summary: A gorgeous modern self contained private guest suite within our Victorian house with its own entrance and cute back garden. It is extremely well located for many tourist areas of London and the local daily markets and shops. "A lovely cosy atmosphere, a real den to escape to."
space: ACCOMMODATION A gorgeous modern self contained private suite within our Victorian house with its own entrance and cute back garden. The suite is extremely well located for many tourist areas of London and the local daily markets and shops, including a great 24/7 grocery/deli just 2 minutes away. The private suite is within an 1870's house, but has a modern very characterful design, making full use of the space. You enter through the side gate, walk through the garden, down three steps, across the decking and into the suite though the double doors (and two more steps). It's has a lovely cosy atmosphere and is a real den to escape to.  The first space you come to is the lounge with lots of very comfortable large bean bags and cushions. The small kitchen area is off to one side and includes all the regular kitchen appliances including a microwave, dishwasher and two ring hob. Through the arch (which has a sliding door) is the large double bedroom with ensuite shower/wet room with lots of

neighborhood_overview: OVERVIEW OF THE AREA The area is a real London neighbourhood. We live on a cute Victorian terrace street. It's a very friendly street, where most people know each other and has an active residents association. Walk, literally, just round the corner and we're a few minutes away from lots of shops and very convenient bus routes into town, going past many iconic London sights on the way. There are tennis courts, a recently renovated (£8m) park and a gym nearby plus a vibrant local market, restaurants and many very handy shops just round the corner.
notes: Please let me know if you have any questions and we hope to welcome you to London soon!
transit: GETTING AROUND As well as Kennington and Elephant & Castle Underground tube stations, the suite is very well served for buses to almost anywhere in London. They're a great way to get around and see things on the way, especially the fabulous views over the river. - Trafalgar Square, 20 mins - Covent Garden, 15 mins - Parliament/London Eye, 15 mins - Liverpool Street/Shoreditch, 15 mins - Borough Market, 10 mins - South Bank Arts centre, 10 mins - Hyde Park/Knightsbridge, 25 mins We are an 8 minute walk from Kennington tube, and 10 minutes walk from Elephant and Castle tube station (zone 1).
house_rules: Please let me know something about you and the purpose of your trip when you make a booking. This is a self contained private suite but part of my house and lovely local community, so it's good to know whose coming to stay, thanks. To be considerate with noise and leave the suite in the same condition it is found in. It is non-smoking. The suite is private from the rest of the house and has its own entrance via the black side gate into the back garden.  Guest parking permits can be purchased, although public transport (tube and buses) are excellent here. ID (e.g. passport) may be requested on arrival. PLEASE LET ME KNOW WHEN YOU WOULD LIKE TO check-in AND check-out Check-in is any time after 4pm (to give us time to clean the apartment). Check-out is by 11am. It would be useful if you could please let us know what time you are likely to arrive and for any details about your flight number in case it is delayed. It would also be very helpful to know when you are planning to check out so I

name: Lovely room in cool Brixton
space: Available for you to rent is a lovely double room in a large house in cool Brixton.   The accommodation is comfortable and stylish with everything you need - free wifi, TV, Egyptian cotton sheets and stylish interiors. There is a private bathroom with separate bath and shower.  The area is fantastic, both just to explore for itself, and with great transport links to let you explore the rest of London. There are a choice of Underground Lines, and the Tube Station is a 5 minute walk from the house. It is just a 12 minute ride to Oxford Circus for shopping or 20 minutes into the City of London for business travellers.  The immediate area is a lively cosmopolitan neighbourhood with something for everyone including high street shops, Marks & Spencers, H&M, Topshop etc. A great market which is now on London's tourist map containing excellent coffee shops, and Franca Manca Pizza Restaurant - winner of UK's best cheap eats along with spices and foods from Africa and the West Indies.

name: Fabulous Hackney flat  Victoria Park London fields
summary: Fabulous Hackney apartment in Victoria Park Village - recently refurbished flat in one of the most desirable areas of east London. The furniture and decor is mid-century inspired and the kitchen is well equipped and comfortable.
space: Fabulous contemporary first-floor living space within a London Victorian conversion. The apartment features high ceilings, a new kitchen and bathroom, mid-century Danish furniture and local Hackney-based artists work on the walls. The beds and mattresses are new with good quality cotton bed linen - the beds are extremely comfortable and both have mattress toppers. East London is one of the most culturally rich areas in the UK - with great independently owned shops selling clothes, art, and all things vintage.  Hackney offers real diversity in terms of restaurants, with a cuisine to suit every palate. In addition, there are numerous bars and live gig spaces.  Hackney has historically attracted artists and creatives in all manner of professions, Hence there's a strong art scene and impromptu events which pop up with great frequency. Victoria Park village has all the charm you might imagine - set in an urban atmosphere and vibe - here you'll find great locally-owned shops, which include a

neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location! You won't find better than this! Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz. Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and everything in between. If y
notes: Non-smoking apartment
transit: You can walk to tourist London or take numerous transport options close by.  Our closest tubes are Warren Street, Goodge Street, Euston Square (all within 5 minute walk) and Tottenham Court Road and St Pancras (within a 10 minute walk) Coming from Heathrow? Easy! Take the tube from Paddington direct to Euston Square  Coming from Gatwick? Easy! Take the tube from Victoria direct to Warren Street Coming from Eurostar? Easy! Take a bus along the Euston Road or take the tube direct to Warren Street Being so central, you can walk to all of tourist London. The British Museum is 10 minutes away. You've got Oxford Street / Soho very close by (a 10 minute walk), Covent Garden will take you about 15 minutes, Regent's Park about 10-15 minutes. Camden is a 5 minute bus ride. You can head in any direction and arrive somewhere interesting. Numerous buses stop close by in Tottenham Court Road, Gower Street and Euston Road You are in easy reach of all the sights. Leicester Square and Trafalgar Square

name: John and Normas Homestay B&B
summary: Muswell Hill has a village-like atmosphere but a village with a wide variety of excellent restaurants and shops plus an Everyman cinema.  We are a short walk from Alexandra Palace and Park with beautiful views across London and a venue for concerts and exhibitions.  It only takes 30 - 40 minutes to get into the centre of London with excellent bus and tube links but it's nice to get back to Muswell Hill for an evening meal and a quiet night's sleep.
space: We are a new B&B in the vibrant Muswell Hill area of North London. The nearest tube stations are Highgate and Bounds Green. We have a stylish double room within our Edwardian house and a single/twin room. Both with LCD televisions and Wi-Fi. You can book the double room on its own with exclusive use of the bathroom, or book both rooms and share the bathroom. Perfect for a family of 4 or group of 3 adults. We have a comfortable breakfast room where we serve a continental or vegetarian breakfast. A travel cot is available and we make no charge for infants under 2 years using the cot in the double room. Double room £106per night Double room single occupancy £80 per night Both rooms for family of 3 £132 per night Both rooms for family of 4 £158 per night Breakfast and cleaning included in price. We are a smoke free  house. We look forward to welcoming you.

name: Dbl en suite @ Oval tube Sth London
summary: In the words of a recent guest: 'The house is darling, and the room itself is lovely with its private shower. The neighborhood is close to so many interesting areas, and is a great jumping off point to embark from. I highly recommend a stay here!'
space: This is the spare room of a Victorian terraced house in a quiet street in a conservation area. The room is very peaceful (there's no traffic noise), at the back of the house, so overlooks my - and all the neighbouring -  gardens.  It is furnished with a very comfortable double bed, plenty of wardrobe space and an en suite shower and toilet. Clean bedding and towels are provided - and plenty of spare blankets and duvets, if people need them. There's also a hairdryer and an iron. It's a good sized room, with two radiators and two windows, providing great light. There is also excellent hi-speed wi-fi throughout the house. The house has recently been redecorated and there's new flooring in the guest room.  There’s also a garden for guests to use. Note: the  Street View on this listing sometimes shows neighbouring streets rather than my road. For travellers arriving at Victoria station, my house is a short bus ride away, or two stops to Vauxhall tube. For travellers arriving at Kings Cross/
description: In the words of a recent guest: 'The house is darling, and the room itself is lovely with its private shower. The neighborhood is close to so many interesting areas, and is a great jumping off point to embark from. I highly recommend a stay here!' This is the spare room of a Victorian terraced house in a quiet street in a conservation area. The room is very peaceful (there's no traffic noise), at the back of the house, so overlooks my - and all the neighbouring -  gardens.  It is furnished with a very comfortable double bed, plenty of wardrobe space and an en suite shower and toilet. Clean bedding and towels are provided - and plenty of spare blankets and duvets, if people need them. There's also a hairdryer and an iron. It's a good sized room, with two radiators and two windows, providing great light. There is also excellent hi-speed wi-fi throughout the house. The house has recently been redecorated and there's new flooring in the guest room.  There’s also a garden for guests to use.
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is known as Oval. There are plenty of local shops, cafes and bars and it’s close to two parks. Just north of my area is Vauxhall, which has been christened 'VoHo' because of the mix of bohemian shops, gardens, cafes and bars.  It is also close to the American Embassy (25 minute walk) for guests needing to attend to visa applications. Other cool neighbourhoods nearby are  Kennington, Clapham and Brixton.  The Tate Britain gallery is just across the river and the South Bank Centre is a few stops away in the tube.
notes: One of the things I like about AirBnB is getting to know a bit about guests before they come, so I can help and assist to make their stay a good one. That's why I really encourage anyone getting in contact to have a full profile with details about themselves and official verifications. For this reason, I will only accept reservation requests from users with full profiles and one of airbnb's official ID verifications (so not just an email or phone number) and at least one review. thanks
transit: The house is convenient for public transport (zones 1 & 2 tube stations). Oval tube is 3 minutes’ walk away (on the Northern line) and Vauxhall station (Victoria line and overground) is 10 minutes away. There are also plenty of buses into central London (either the West End or Covent Garden), taking about 20 minutes. And it's perfectly possible to walk into central London along the river, about 45 minutes at a gentle pace. There are also bicycles for hire, with stations in adjoining streets.
access: Guests have full use of the kitchen and living areas. In the kitchen, there are two fridges, all the usual appliances and guests are welcome to prepare whichever meals they choose. As you'll see from my reviews, this doesn't cause problems with my own mealtimes. I don't provide breakfast as I discovered guests prefer to do their own thing, which is fine.
house_rules: Guests will be asked to provide some kind of photo ID on arrival (and I'm happy to provide mine in return). Since there's a new carpet in the guest room, I would prefer guests to remove outdoor footwear while in the house. A polite reminder, this is a non-smoking house, but guests are welcome to smoke in the garden. There's an electrical adapter plug in the room, which is compatible with most power supplies. I would ask, however, that guests do not leave electrical items plugged in and charging which are unattended.  Guests will be given a set of keys and can come and go as they please. They have full access to the dining and kitchen areas on the ground floor.  Usual security rules apply: please don't leave windows open when leaving the room/house. And guests are requested to use the extractor fan/light in the shower and put the bath mat on the floor. Guests are welcome to use the washing machine, but please ask for instructions first. If guests would like to bring friends back to the

name: Two bedroom luxury Flat in Brixton with city view!
summary: The apartment is on the top floor of a portered building. From the apartment there are amazing views of both the city of London and the hills of the south.
space: The apartment is on top floor of a secure building in trendy Brixton. The flat comprises of 2 bedrooms and 2 bathroom. Guests will have exclusive use of the flat. The master bedroom  has a king size bed and an ensuite bathroom with a powerful shower. The second bedroom is duplex, it has a double bed with a large wardrobe upstairs and a small office and a tv with a sofa downstairs. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, coffee machine and a hot and cold (still and sparkling) on demand water tap. The lounge has a very large and comfortable goose feather filled sofa Which can become a better than average comfortable large double bed for two people,  a 55 inch TV with Dolby digital sound system, a piano and leads into a small balcony where our smoking guests can enjoy a cigarette without the need of leaving the building. There is also a large family bathroom with a bath and shower over bath. The property benefits of a 200 Mb wifi available throughout. From the bedroom window there

neighborhood_overview: Brixton is a world unto itself, a volatile slice of London’s multiculturalism and a vibrant hotbed of food, drink and music. Supermarkets Sainsbury’s Local A small version of a Sainsbury’s supermarket is located beside the tube station on Brixton Road, exit the tube and turn right. There is another, generally with fewer customers, further down the same road, also on the right. Tesco Express If you walk to and from Loughborough Junction station there is a small Tesco on Coldharbour Lane just 200m from the station. Tesco Metro A full size supermarket is on Acre Lane, turn right out of the main gates, continue across the main intersection with the town hall and tower, Tesco is on the left with a large carpark out the front, approximately 10 minute walk. Pharmacy 449 Brixton Road, Brixton SW9 8HH There is a large Boots chemist at Brixton tube selling all the personal essentials. They also have a pharmacy and trained medical staff onsite. Bakery  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Market Row, Brix
transit: The very best site to enable you to work out how to get where you’re going is the Transport for London (TfL) Journey Planner (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Tube The fastest way to get into and around London is by tube from Brixton Underground station, a 7 minute walk from our building – turn right outside the main gate, then right at the KFC. Oxford Circus is just a 13 minute journey away. London Underground maps are available for free at Brixton station. Oyster and contactless cards Oyster is a system of automated public transport pre- payment, valid on the tube, trains, buses and selected ferries across London. If you have a contactless payment card you can also use this to pay for your travel at entry and exit gates. Train The overground train is also a good option to and from Brixton with two train stations close to our apartment. Turn right outside the main gate then right at the first traffic light onto Atlantic Road for Brixton Station (5 minutes walk) or turn left outside the main
access: The keys can be collected from our concierge who works from 8 am to 8 pm but NOT between 1.30 pm and 2.30 pm. Collection time needs to be pre agreed with us however we will try to accommodate our guests needs wherever possible.
