name: A Fab Family house in Kensington
summary: This is a lovely family home with a great location in West Kensington. It is within walking distance to three tube stations and with great bus routes going all over London. It is a vibrant area with a great array of restaurants and shops. I will consider rentals longer than 1 month. So if you are moving homes or relocating, it'll be great for you and your family to relax while looking for a permanent home in London. Utility bills and council tax will be included plus a week cleaning service.
space: This is a very comfortable and spacious home in Central London. The street is an English Heritage listed, grade II street from 1893. So, you will have the experience of staying in a real old London area.   The flat has large spacious rooms throughout and it's interesting in every corner. This Edwardian house has preserved its stained windows up the staircase giving a beautiful light throughout. The kitchen is a great place to eat with the whole family around the round table. There is a separate and beautiful living room which will give the group more space without being one on top of the other. There are three very large double bedrooms with king size beds and a single bedroom with a raised bed where another bed can be added. One of the king size beds can be split in two. All the beds are very comfortable and dressed with professionally cleaned and ironed linen. As head of your party you will be able to enjoy the most luxurious and amazingly comfortable bed in the master bedroom. A bed

notes: If you require an early check in or late check out a charge of an extra day may be applied as I won't be able to take any other bookings for that reason. No one night stays, Please. The house is not suitable for loud parties. I may consider a two night stay. Please enquire about it.

Please don't make use of personal items such as cosmetics, clothing and food stuff. If you do use up something in the kitchen, I would appreciate you replace it.
house_rules: A strict non smoking policy in the house! Please take your shoes off at the entrance of the house. Bring slippers or non-slip socks if wanted. Please make sure children behave well and be safe as there are windows in the top floors.  Please make sure they have clean hands and keep the place clean by not eating or chewing gum in the living room and bedrooms. If they are likely to wet the bed, please place a water repellant mat or let me know so I can place a special cover too.  Let them know that we have neighbours underneath and that they should not run or jump around the flat.   No loud parties as this is a quiet neighbourhood. Strictly, no smoking in the house. Be mindful as you come in and make sure the doors are shut properly.  If you read any of the books or watch dvd's which belong to the house, please make sure to return it where you found it and place the dvd in the right box too. summary: Experience the best of London. High quality comfort in a lovely apartment in the heart of London. Everyone loves staying here. The perfect trendy & peaceful location, accessable to all main attractions in London.  Only 30 minutes to Heathrow.
space: A super central place to stay in an elegant part of town. This flat mixes old-world charm with modern touches and amenities.  It is continuous work in progress particularly as we have had a new roof installed last year, and the front of the building has had a face lift. The second bedroom is equally comfortable with a feather-down quilt on the single bed and a large mirror above the feature fireplace. If you enjoy jogging there are several great routes to enjoy.
notes: It's your visit in London; whether for business or pleasure you deserve the best.

Eat excellent food at local restaurants at reasonable prices.
access: Make yourself at home, the flat is all yours!
house_rules: Please do remove your shoes in the apartment. The floors are kept very clean. The flat is strictly NO SMOKING, and NO PETS. To avoid unnecessary risks please do not bring your friends to the apartment.  The apartment and furniture are in very good condition and it is important that guests are clean and responsible to keep it in the same conditions they got it. Please do report any damages caused. The housekeeper will inspect the apartment after departure of the guests and any damages found the guest will be contacted through Airbnb website & the repair or replacement cost will be deducted from the deposit. It is very difficult to maintain a competitive low day rate if guests leave heating and electricity on all day. Heating is not included in the price, a gas meter reading will be taken at day of arrival and departure. Guest may be charged for it separately. Electric readings will be taken & usage in excess of 15gbp/week will be charged to the guest. One weeks deposit will be withheld

summary: Perfect for Wimbledon Tennis. A comfortable room in our warm, friendly house with everything you need. Hillcross Avenue has Morden at one end and Grandrive at the other, offering local shops. Backing onto Morden Park a quiet, green area. Good public transport with the 163 & 293 bus to Morden,Wimbledon and Epsom. Morden, Underground  Station(Zone 4) and Bus station is only a 5 min drive/bus or 15 /20 min walk away. space: Welcome to our home and friendly B&B (bed and breakfast). We do accept pets but not cats as Adrian is allergic.  We offer you a nice sized, double bedroom, looking out onto Morden Park in Hillcross Avenue, Morden, Surrey, Greater London.  We are only 2 miles from Wimbledon SW19. We have free off-street parking on the front of our house. There is also free parking in Hillcross Avenue. Morden is a very clean, quiet and safe area to live in. We do not ask a cleaning fee or weekend rates. Nor do we ask for a security deposit. Your Room In your room we provide you with fresh bedding and towels, unlimited wireless internet, TV (Free-view), a DVD and CD player (with a large selection of DVD's  and CD's to watch - or listen to), a mini fridge (with complementary drinks and snacks) , a kettle with coffee and teas, a hairdryer, books to read and some leaflets and guidebooks of the more popular places / events in the local area and the whole of London. neighborhood_overview: I love living in Morden it is a wonderful place. We have Morden Park right behind us which is lovely in (URL HIDDEN) has a Swimming Baths, childrens's playground, walking track (running around the outside) and is a large open space of grass dotted with small groups of trees. I enjoy watching all the wildlife that comes into the garden and listening to the birds singing in the morning.  Morden is a very safe place with a very low crime rate. We have local shops at Grandrive which includes a Co Op supermarket, a cafe, post office, hair dressers and dog groomers. Morden town center is the other end of our road with Morden Underground (Norther Line) and Bus station. Morden has many shops including Sainsbury, Lidl, Iceland supermarkets, Boots and Superdrug chemists, a dry-cleaners and many places to eat. One of the nicest place in Morden is Morden Hall Park. It has a lovely rose garden and for wasting an afternoon with a picnic it is just the perfect spot. It also has a wonderful children's
notes: Wimbledon Tennis: We are very conveniently located if you wanted to come and watch the Wimbledon Tennis Championship. Only 13 minute drive from the courts, you can drive there, take the bus or get a cab. Surrey and International Cricket: Morden Underground Station will have you at The Oval Underground station in 22 minutes (only 10 stops) from which it is a 3 minute walk to The KIA Oval CCC.
transit: Morden is the end of the Northern Line Underground Network. It is also a large bus station with many different bus routes. Morden is in zone 4 of the London Underground. We advise getting travel cards (Oyster) on which you put credit to travel on train, tube, tram and bus throughout London. If you don't have an Oyster we have guest cards you might like to borrow. You put credit on it at any station. It allows you to make as many journeys as you wish each day on tube, bus, tram and train and you will not be charged any more than the £7.70 (off-peak) or £10.60 (peak times) per day. When I came to London to travel I was shocked at how regular the underground was and how easy it was to use my Oyster card.    A 15 minute walk or a 5 minute bus ride to Morden tube Station (Underground Station) - you can be in Central London in 30 minutes. Please do not use the wood burning stove in the living room - we will gladly put it on for you. Please lock all doors and shut windows when you are away from the property

name: Charming Apartment Amazing Location
summary: The apartment is Victorian and has well proportioned rooms with high ceilings, sash windows, all original wooden floors and other period features. In contrast the flat accommodates all modern necessities making it the ideal central London base.
space: Large and bright, one bedroom apartment on the second floor, in a centrally located Historic Victorian Mansion Block with bags of character and all modern conveniences. Beautiful contemporary kitchen incorporating a dining table, sleeps 4, modern hotel style bathroom and separate toilet and handbasin, quiet location and only 10 minutes walk from Hyde Park, 5 minutes from Oxford Street and Marble Arch. A perfect base for exploring all that London has to offer from; museums, galleries, historical buildings, shopping, theatre, restaurants...the list is endless! The bedroom has a double bed, hanging space, a desk, chest-of-drawers and TV. Bed linen, towels and some toiletries provided. The bedroom and kitchen look onto a communal garden, so it's very quiet. The bathroom has white marble tiles and a large walk in shower. The living room has a large bay window. It looks onto the street, but is not overlooked (office opposite). There is Sky TV, a DVD player, wifi, books and movies. The large

Turn left out of the flat and you will be heading to Marylebone High Street, one of the best streets in London for restaurants and shops which has a great village atmosphere. Turn tight and you are at Edgware road which is bustling and alive 24 hours with Mediterranean restaurants and an array of shops to cater for every taste.
transit: Superb public transport links, 2 mins walk from Edgware Road Underground Station; District & Circle, Hammersmith & City and Bakerloo lines. Baker Street Station; Jubilee, District & Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines is a 7 minute walk. 10 minutes walk is Paddington Mainline station with access to the high speed Heathrow Airport Express train so time to the airport is only 15 minutes.
access: There is a courtyard in the centre of the building, if you'd like access I can a arrange a key for the duration of your visit.

name: Chelsea Studio by Kings Road London
space: Hi, Are you looking for a cozy place to stay in London's swanky Chelsea without having to break the bank?  Happy to help. My 280sq ft. studio is situated less than 15 minutes from three tubes (Sloane Sq., South Kensington, & Knightsbridge); this means quick and easy access to the District, Circle, and Piccadily lines. It is just one stop on the underground to Victoria (or just a short walk), and from there you can catch trains and buses which go to all of London's major airports, as well as destinations all over the UK.  More importantly, Harrods, Kings Road, the Saatchi Gallery, and Partriges Saturday Market are all just a short walk away! The flat: A 280sq ft. studio style flat 3rd floor walkup with morning sun  Sleeps 2 on fold out bed/couch The bathroom boasts a spacious standing shower Kitchenette with washer/dryer machine Virgin Wifi
description: Hi, Are you looking for a cozy place to stay in London's swanky Chelsea without having to break the bank?  Happy to help. My 280sq ft. studio is situated less than 15 minutes from three tubes (Sloane Sq., South Kensington, & Knightsbridge); this means quick and easy access to the District, Circle, and Piccadily lines. It is just one stop on the underground to Victoria (or just a short walk), and from there you can catch trains and buses which go to all of London's major airports, as well as destinations all over the UK.  More importantly, Harrods, Kings Road, the Saatchi Gallery, and Partriges Saturday Market are all just a short walk away! The flat: A 280sq ft. studio style flat 3rd floor walkup with morning sun  Sleeps 2 on fold out bed/couch The bathroom boasts a spacious standing shower Kitchenette with washer/dryer machine Virgin Wifi South Kensington is home to major museum's, with the beautifully gilded Natural History Museum and the Victoria & Albert Museum.  Royal Albert Hall
neighborhood_overview: South Kensington is home to major museum's, with the beautifully gilded Natural History Museum and the Victoria & Albert Museum.  Royal Albert Hall is the UK's most famous concert hall, just a 20 minute walk or 10 minute bus away from Draycott Place. Sloane Square is a shopping centre for Brits, with two major streets.  Kings Road is more low key with several small parks, a short walk to the river Thames, the Saatchi Gallery, and has your more interesting stores such as Vivian Westwood, Antropology, LK Bennett, Bimba y Lola, plus great dining and nightlife.  Sloane Street has all of your D&G, Prada, Hackett, Marni, ending up near Harrod's of Knightsbridge. Knightsbridge gives to the south of Hyde Park, which is also a great place for walking, biking, horseback, or just enjoying tea overlooking the Serpentine pond.  Enjoy the West London living experience.
house_rules: No smoking No pets

name: Pretty Self Contained Coach House
space: Very pretty, self-contained coach house, fully furnished in contemporary style, available for short lets in residential area close to public transport (bus, underground and railway), shops, restaurants and leafy parks. Accommodation comprises living room, mezzanine bedroom, additional sofa bed in living rooms, modern and fully equipped kitchen and brand new bathroom with shower and bath. Fully fitted kitchen and bathroom with washing machine.  Ideal for 1 or 2 people. Non-smokers only please.  Estimated travel times from the Coach House:  To Leicester Square, Central London: 25 mins To Wimbledon: 25 mins To Heathrow Airport: 45 mins To Gatwick Airport: 35 mins To The City (Finance District): 25 mins

space: Comfortably sleeps 4 people. Fully equipped kitchen (with good knives) and plenty of sunlight in all rooms. Private terrace.

name: Hampstead Home from home  in great area.
summary: A lovely flat in a beautiful part of North London with a beautiful big garden. The building is nearly 200 years old and in a  Conservation area.  Nb There are steps down to the flat.    Parking  is restricted to resident only CAB  but there are pay bays around.
space: Stay in a bright one bedroom, 2 living room garden flat in a 200 year old building with a large garden in Belsize Park which is a beautiful part of London close to transport facilities. Near Jubilee , Northern line  and Overland stations and several Bus routes. The famous Camden Market is very near as is beautiful Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill. There are some good golf courses around the area and tennis courts. A local outdoor swimming pool on the nearby  Heath, access by local bus C11. Also an indoor pool at nearby Swiss Cottage with other sports facilities. There are several good restaurants , pubs  and cafes in the area as well as  local cinemas and  plenty of  shops in nearby Hampstead. Good local food shops too. The property.... neighborhood_overview: It has a friendly local feel whilst having all the amenities of the city.
notes: There is a double sofa bed in one of the living rooms. There are top ceiling lights but some are deliberately deselected as they are so bright! They also don’t last if left on all the time. The heating is served by a Combi Boiler which we leave on timed but can be adjusted. We ask guests to respect electricity costs these days.  There is Resident only parking so you need to sort your own parking , I can arrange parking for a few hours on special request. There are pay bays nearby as well. You have to take note of the yellow restriction notices on lamp posts as the Council will tow away your car without notice if incorrectly parked and it is costly. The Royal Free Hospital is up the road  with AnE should  it be necessary.
transit: 2 nearby tube lines , Northern and Jubilee and several Bus Routes as well as local cab firms and car hire. Also easy access out of London by road.

neighborhood_overview: Neatly tucked away between the wealth of Marylebone, the edgy energy of Soho and the grandeur of Bloomsbury, Fitzrovia is peaceful and attractive, home to small media organisations, small pubs and small restaurants and a smattering of decent hotels. Wide streets lined with tall buildings in Victorian brick mingle with cosy side alleys, with a variety of architectural styles from the eighteenth century to the present day, all of it dominated by the BT Tower, one of London’s tallest and most iconic buildings. Tottenham Court Road is the major shopping street, and the best place in London to look for home furnishings and electronic goods. The area around Oxford Street mixes good high street shops with pubs and bars catching the overflow from Soho’s nightlife.
notes: late check in £35 after 6pm late check out. £100 past 12pm. Option of self check in.
transit: Warren Street Great Portland Street Regents Park  These are the closest tube station and they are 5 minutes away. Euston station is about 15 minutes away and King Cross St Pancras is 20 minutes away.

name: Stylish Central London Flat with pool and terrace
summary: You will love this modern, perfectly formed, well equipped studio flat located in the Tower Hill area. Close to numerous transport links including Underground stations, Light Railway station and bus routes.   Your safety is always our priority and your stay will include: - 5 hour professional deep clean including 'touch point' and soft furnishings disinfection  - Each guest will be supplied with a sealed '3 ply mask' - A 50 ml 80% alcohol hand sanatiser is supplied with each stay
space: Ultra stylish and modern entire studio flat located in the heart of Central London, giving easy access to all of London’s extensive range of attractions. The apartment is located within a short walk from Tower Bridge and the Tower of London which are two of London’s most iconic landmarks and provides an ideal base from which to explore the delights of the city. LOCATION AND ATTRACTIONS The apartment is well served by public transport links which include Tower Hill and Aldgate East tube stations which are within the central Zone 1 network and allow easy access to London’s West End, Bond Street, Oxford Street, Covent Garden and the South Bank just to name a few. Numerous bus stops and the Docklands Light Railway are also within a short walk giving you some further transport options if you need them. name: 3 bedroom / 2 Bathroom house in West London
summary: Our home is an attractive and contemporary styled 3 bedroom Victorian house situated within a very quiet and neighbourly area just to the west of the city centre within Zone 2 of the underground network.
space: 3 bedrooms: Master bedroom with Super king double bed and en-suite shower room, Double bedroom with King double bed and one single bedroom/home office. 2nd family bathroom has both bath and shower.    There is an open plan kitchen, dining room and reception area on the ground floor and a large basement TV room with a small laundry room. To the rear is a small west facing garden with seating for al fresco dining.  Bought by the owners 8 years ago and completely re-modelled and refurbished to a very high standard, the house has been maintained in excellent condition with constant improvements and updates.  Furnished with modern super comfy beds and lots of mid century modern, vintage & antique furniture giving a characterful aesthetic.  Plenty of space for a family of 5 or two couples.

neighborhood_overview: Know locally as Brackenbury Village this is a residential district of west London between Kensington and Chiswick. It is named after Brackenbury Road in which there is a small parade of shops which form the heart of the village. This includes Brackenburys (Delicatessen & Coffee Shop), The Brackenbury Restaurant, Sisi's (Hardware store), Hepsibah (Art gallery) and Stenton's (a traditional family butchers).  There is a good selection of gastropubs and neighbourhood restaurants in the area.  See our guidebook.
notes: A single air bed is available for a sixth guest. Parking available on the street at a cost of £2.20 per hour 9am - 5pm Mon-Fri.  Weekends are free.
transit: With three tube lines and a bus station all within 5-10 minutes walk, you’ll find Hammersmith to be one of the best connected areas of London. Tube lines include the District, Piccadilly and Hammersmith & City.     Locally there is excellent shopping at Westfield, the biggest shopping centre in London,  just under 1 mile away. Our nearest local high street is King Street, which is a 5 minute walk away with a selection of familiar high street stores, including a Sainsbury's supermarket, Marks & Spencers, Boots, high street banks, WH Smiths etc  Notting Hill with its Portobello Market is a couple of miles away and Olympia Exhibition Centre is nearby too.
access: The whole house.
house_rules: Please let us know about your travel plans and keep us informed as to your expected time of arrival. A simple text updating us of when you are leaving the airport/train station, for example, would be very helpful. We would appreciate if you would take your shoes off before stepping up to your room.  Please do ask us if there is anything we can do to improve your stay.

name: Clerkenwell penthouse, huge terrace
summary: "Best views in London - Far exceeded expectations - Fab bedroom suite with glorious terrace - incredibly quiet but so central - Trendiest hood - Walk to Covent Garden..." share my home and have the best ever London experience.
space: This is high-rise living at its most spectacular. Sunshine pours in from the triple aspect floor-to-ceiling windows, and with it, a view that takes in nigh on every major London landmark; St Paul’s Cathedral, The London Eye, The Gherkin, Tate Modern,The Telecom Tower, Canary Wharf… There's a 1500 (YES 1500) sq foot wrap around terrace to enjoy the views and outdoor dining throughout the summer Even if splendid vistas were all that was on offer, you’d be moving in. But turn your back on the windows and you’ll find two very large double bedrooms, an enormous open plan living space equipped with beautiful leather furniture and an ultra-modern kitchen. Fully furnished, including large screen plasma TV, wifi and luxury finishings with lots of storage space. Kitchen is fully fitted - toaster, microwave, fridge, freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, oven. And when your feet touch the ground again, you’ll discover that you’re right in zone 1.  A short walk can have you wandering in Piccadilly, Co
description: "Best views in London - Far exceeded expectations - Fab bedroom suite with glorious terrace - incredibly quiet but so central - Trendiest hood - Walk to Covent Garden..." share my home and have the best ever London experience. This is high-rise living at its most spectacular. Sunshine pours in from the triple aspect floor-to-ceiling windows, and with it, a view that takes in nigh on every major London landmark; St Paul’s Cathedral, The London Eye, The Gherkin, Tate Modern,The Telecom Tower, Canary Wharf… There's a 1500 (YES 1500) sq foot wrap around terrace to enjoy the views and outdoor dining throughout the summer Even if splendid vistas were all that was on offer, you’d be moving in. But turn your back on the windows and you’ll find two very large double bedrooms, an enormous open plan living space equipped with beautiful leather furniture and an ultra-modern kitchen. Fully furnished, including large screen plasma TV, wifi and luxury finishings with lots of storage space. Kitchen is
neighborhood_overview: I cycle everywhere - it's flat and takes 8 minutes to Covent Garden 15 minutes to Oxford Street, 15 minutes to Regents Park, 30 minutes to Hyde Park, 20 minutes to Buckingham Palace.  Islington, Clerkenwell and Exmouth Market (I sit on the corner of all three) are all really exciting areas to explore with abundant shopping, eating and drinking beyond your imagination
notes: The room is very bright and does not have heavy curtains - bring a mask if you mind light
transit: 2 minutes to 19 and 38 bus. They come EVERY minute and take you to Covent Garden, Piccadilly and Knightsbridge. Many other bus routes close by. Angel tube is 7 minutes walk. Kings X, Farringdon, Chancery Lane, Russell Square tubes are all a 15 minute walk. You can walk easily to the British Museum, The British Library, Covent Garden ...... Sign up for Uber and nothing is far away at low cost because it's so central

name: Cosy Double room London, River View
summary: our flat is overlooking the river Lea and it's houseboats, the room is cosy, with reclaimed wood furniture and fitted with a flat-screen tv and shutters on the windows. Looking out of the window feels more like countryside than being in London. Own toilet opposite guest bedroom, shared shower. Free coffees ;-)
space: Double bed room with a proper comfy bed. We know how important a good night's sleep is! Free parking in Timberwharf Road (1min Walk)  Central London  (Euston) is 11 Minutes journey time from Seven Sisters station.  Walking along the canal, you will see ducks, geese, swans, herons and cormorants. There are a few local pubs within walking distance. (15 mins) The nearest restaurants are about 25 mins walking distance. Our flat is filled with pieces from auctions and carboot sales and things we found in the skip and renovated. As I am trading with vintage items, there will be large amounts of ceramics and glass items on shelves and other places - this is the main reason we are not quite suitable for guests with small children unfortunately. We are very happy to accommodate guests with kids aged 6 and over - Airbnb does not give the option to specify this. We love that we overlook the river, the marshes are within 5 minutes walking distance, wonderful Springfield Park is just around the cor
description: our flat is overlooking the river Lea and it's houseboats, the room is cosy, with reclaimed wood furniture and fitted with a flat-screen tv and shutters on the windows. Looking out of the window feels more like countryside than being in London. Own toilet opposite guest bedroom, shared shower. Free coffees ;-) Double bed room with a proper comfy bed. We know how important a good night's sleep is! Free parking in Timberwharf Road (1min Walk)  Central London  (Euston) is 11 Minutes journey time from Seven Sisters station.  Walking along the canal, you will see ducks, geese, swans, herons and cormorants. There are a few local pubs within walking distance. (15 mins) The nearest restaurants are about 25 mins walking distance. Our flat is filled with pieces from auctions and carboot sales and things we found in the skip and renovated. As I am trading with vintage items, there will be large amounts of ceramics and glass items on shelves and other places - this is the main reason we are not qu
neighborhood_overview: Compared to other London places it's really quiet here, you will hear the geese and ducks and people rowing on the canal. We live in a Cul-de-sac and there will be kids playing outside in the afternoon. Generally, it's a very safe community and a brilliant close-knit neighbourhood in our street. Our place is located in north-East london, right in the middle of the Hasidic Jewish community. Generally, Hackney is one of the most diverse places in England. There is a large Turkish community (lots of yummy kebab shops), Polish, Afro Caribbean and many others.   There are a few big supermarkets in walking distance (Sainsbury's and Asda) and many small local shops just a few hundred yards away (most of them won't be open on sabbath though) If you're brave, rent out a bike and explore the area, it's well worth it. Or go for endless walks around the marshes and the canal.
notes: In case you have overlooked it: we have a cat. She is well behaved and never jumps on kitchen surfaces or tables but she is known to catch mice (there are plenty as we live next to canal) that's her job. We might not be suitable for people who are going out partying and hoping for a lie-in. As I said, we live here with our young daughter and there is probably some slight noise around 8 am. Light sleepers might feel disturbed. Saying that, we will make of course any effort to keep the noise at a minimum. My husband leaves for work at ridiculous-o-clock and I am frequently around during the day. I'll be working from home most days during the week running my online business.
transit: The 318 bus (this bus goes 4 times per hour)  is just around the corner. Loads of busses go from Stamford Hill (10 minutes walk). The Victoria line goes from seven sisters, 25 mins walk or a short bus ride.  Travel information and directions can be found on the transport for London website: (Website hidden by Airbnb) - most helpful for getting around London.
access: There is a separate toilet just opposite the guest room. The main bathroom with shower is shared. Have your breakfast in the kitchen/diner/lounge.  Guests will get their own house keys.
house_rules: Hello there, please make sure you can check in between 6pm and 10pm.  We have quite often guests checking out the same morning and need to clean the room, wash the laundry and we all need to get up in the morning to go to school or work so can't really stay up until late night to wait for check-ins. Sorry. No smoking please and no shoes in the bedroom.

name: 3 bedroom house in Wimbledon with parking
summary: Our beautiful 3 bedroom house with amazing location in the heart of Wimbledon town is available for your stay. We are open for long term stays (over 1 month) from 15th June. Please get in touch if you are looking for short term fully furnished let in London.

We have a keyless lock device on our front door and will provide you with a code for entrance prior to your arrival. You will have private access to the entire house and the garden. We are available for contact at all times prior and during the stay to make your stay as comfortable as possible. You can get in touch with me via Airbnb, email or text and I will respond to you immediately most of the time or within 2 hours (not during the night though) Our home is extremely conven
neighborhood_overview: Our home is extremely conveniently located. It takes seconds to walk to the heart of Wimbledon town. At the same time, it is in a quiet residential street so you have the best of both worlds. Within 1 minute on foot, you will arrive at an IMAX Odeon Cinema, a huge supermarket Morrison’s, Patisserie Valerie for amazing cakes and tea, Bill’s for great food, etc. Within 5 minutes on foot, you will find pretty much anything that you need (a number of large supermarkets, department stores and many other shops, amazing restaurants, fast food chains… You name it, you have it!) There are many wonderful parks around, Dundonald recreation ground (5 mins walk), South Park Gardens and Wimbledon Common.  Wimbledon Village with lots of cosy shops and restaurants is within walking distance (10 mins on foot)
notes: There is also off-street parking available for 1 car inside our garden through the back door.
transit: It takes 2 mins on foot to arrive at Wimbledon Station with amazing transport links to Central London. Every 2-3 minutes, there are direct trains to London Waterloo and it takes 15-20 mins to get to Waterloo. From Waterloo, you can take Northern line to Leicester Square, Charing Cross, etc and it's only couple of stops. Otherwise you have an option to take London Underground District line which will take you to South Kensington and Knightsbridge within about 25 minutes.  Bus stops are even nearer, 1 minute away from the house connecting you to various different parts of London.
access: We have a keyless lock device on our front door and will provide you with a code for entrance prior to your arrival. You will have private access to the entire house and the garden.
house_rules: Please do respect our home Please absolutely no party or event should take place in our home.  Please do not make excessive noise past 10pm. Please do check out by 11am as our cleaners are booked for that time. Please do take off your shoes inside the house.  Please do not leave dirty dishes behind you. Please do not leave doors or windows open when you leave the house Please do let us know if you accidentally damage or break anything like spills, stains, etc. We may reduce the deposit taken this way rather than us finding out later.

summary: A lovely large two-story home centrally located for all of London's must-see sights and entertainment offerings, and in convenient walking distance to the gorgeous outdoor spaces of Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens, and the Regent canals.  The sizable living areas and 2 ample, tranquil bedrooms allow guests to enjoy all the comfort and luxury of their own home.
space: My large, bright yet cozy home with extra high ceiling and full length double glazed windows, is set over the ground and first floors of a Victorian building. From the spacious carpeted lounge with leather sofas, flat screen TV and streaming services, it opens through double doors to a comfortable eat-in kitchen with polished wooden floor and all mod cons.  Up the stairs are sleeping quarters comprising of the master bedroom,  bathroom, and a 2nd en-suited bedroom (with own shower and toilet). Central heating and free internet is available on the wireless network which reaches all the way out to the quiet communal garden. Gloucester terrace is a beautiful street of grand white Victorian houses, very conveniently located - mins walk to Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens, the shops and restaurants of Queensway, Westbourne Grove (Notting Hill) and the new Paddington developments. 3 tube/train stations (Lancaster Gate, Paddington, Royal Oak) are within 7-15 mins walk and 3 mins walk to buses to

neighborhood_overview: Gloucester terrace is a beautiful quite street of grand white Victorian houses, very conveniently located - mins walk to Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens, the shops and restaurants of Queensway(buzzy street that doesn't sleep...much) and Westbourne Grove (Notting Hill). The area offers a big choice of supermarkets, convenience stores, boutiques and well-known brands; a wide range of international eateries (from fast food outlets to Michelin star establishments), plenty of drinking and socialising options from traditional pubs to hip bars/clubs. It's home to the most luxurious public cinema in London, very good value public spa and swimming pools, variety of gyms, fitness/wellness studios, even 2 cool adult ten pin bowling alleys and an ice skating rink.
transit: 3 tube/train stations (Lancaster Gate, Paddington, Royal Oak) are within 10 mins walk and 3 mins walk to buses to the West-end and City (bus7, bus23,bus27,bus36) There are also 3 Santander bike racks (London rental bicycles) across, up and down the street. Canal boats go from Maida Vale which is less than 10 mins walk away.
access: Guests are welcome to make themselves comfortably shoe-free and at home in all areas within the apartment, except the storage room, as well as the garden.  All furnishing, appliances, available amenities etc...are at guests' disposal.
house_rules: No shoes in the house please (it's a lot more comfortable with bare-feet on the warm carpet, anyway!) Strictly no smoking/vaping inside the apartment (the garden can be used for this purpose).

name: Gorgeous Spacious Bloomsbury Studio
summary: Gorgeous peaceful, spacious and light-filled studio - an oasis of calm in London's literary heart.
space: Full of original features, the south-facing studio has a large main room with a wood floor, an extremely comfortable four-poster bed, two sofas (one of which turns into a double sofa bed), and a dining area.  There is a sun-filled balcony with a table and two chairs overlooking a park with a lovely view of the  City skyline.  A separate kitchen is small but well-equipped, with an electric hob, grill and oven, microwave, washing machine and tumble dryer, and a range of kitchen equipment. The bathroom is full of original features, including an old-fashioned mirrored alcove and a (recently restored) 1930s bath, with a shower. Fresh linen and towels are provided, and there is a fast wireless internet connection. There is also a TV.  The studio is very well located for visitors to London. It is a few minutes walk from Russell Square (Piccadilly Line to Covent Garden, Piccadilly, South Kensington and Heathrow Airport), and Chancery Lane (Central Line to Oxford St and Notting Hill Gate) and K

The bathroom is full of original features, including an old-fashioned mirrored alcove and a (recently restored) 1930s bath, with a shower. Fresh linen and towels are provided, and there is a fast wireless internet connection. There is also a TV.  The studio is very well located for visitors to London. It is a few minutes walk from Russell Square (Piccadilly Line to Covent Garden, Piccadilly, South Kensingt
neighborhood_overview: Bloomsbury is a fantastic neighbourhood, full of little restaurants, great pubs, independent shops, spacious green squares and lovely little unexpected pleasures tucked away between the main thoroughfares. It's walking distance from the heart of London, and a lovely place to stay to get to know the city.
transit: The apartment is very well located for transport - there are bus stops virtually outside the building, and just about every tube line is within a short walking distance (3 tube stations within 10 minutes walk, the nearest, Russell Square, connecting you to the South Kensington Museums, Piccadilly Circus and Heathrow).
access: The flat is self contained, and guests will have access to a balcony overlooking a park with an amazing view of the city.
house_rules: The main rules concern consideration to others in the building, such as for noise to be minimised between 11 and 7am, with no loud music or other loud sounds between these times. There is a strict no smoking rule, both inside the flat and on the balcony. Please take care with the shower curtain, making sure you are fully enclosed to avoid water spillage on the floor.

name: Friendly flat share
space: We are offering a private room (bunk beds) with space for two people in our home, in wonderful Woolwich, London. We have great transport links to central London, with a choice of rail, underground, bus and Woolwich Clipper boat (a great alternative to regular transport!), getting you to Central London (Oxford Street, Piccadilly Circus etc.) within about 30 minutes. For the Olympics, taking the DLR from Woolwich Arsenal Station will get you to Stratford (home of the new Olympic Park) in 20 minutes, where you will find, among others, the Aquatics Centre, Velodrome, Basketball Arena, and the Olympic Stadium! Ideally suited for a couple of friends, or for a quick taste of a forgotten childhood! Come and try a different side to London!  We're really looking forward to welcoming you to our lovely home, and showing giving you a local's taste of London! Don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions!

name: 2 bed West Kensington apartment
summary: Gorgeous 2 bed ground floor apartment with period features and a real gas fire to keep you warm and cosy.  A great location in West London as a base to explore the city; quiet and residential after a long day out but very accessible from Heathrow and Gatwick and plenty of choices of tube or bus to get you quickly into the centre.
space: Our apartment is located in the W14 district, and is an excellent base to explore London. Set in a leafy quiet residential street, you have numerous local restaurants and pubs a few minutes walk away. The area is also known as Brook Green. Within 10 minutes walk you can be exploring shopping districts like Westfield and High Street Kensington. The famous Portobello market and Notting Hill area are also a short walk or tube ride away. The property has two bedrooms with double beds overlooking gardens at the back; the bathroom has a shower and bath and plenty of storage; the lounge has beautiful period features, an open fire and a large bay window looking out onto the street; the kitchen is located off the lounge and offers a dishwasher, washing machine, gas cooker with oven and microwave. As you enter the property, you come into a small hall area with the doors to the bedrooms, lounge and bathroom. neighborhood_overview: A bit of history about the W14 area:  Comprising parts of Fulham, Hammersmith, Shepherds Bush, Holland Park and Earls Court, it seems only right that four of London's busiest west-east roads pass through here and all are bisected by an equally busy north-south route.  Equally appropriate is the proliferation of hotels and boarding houses, ancillaries to the twin monoliths in the area, Olympia and Earls Court Exhibition Halls. Covering all standards of accommodation, they are perhaps the sole unifying element of this postcode.  Facilities in W14 are very much geared for visitors. Slap bang in the middle of W14 is the cavernous Kensington Olympia, built in 1884 and able to supply a gargantuan 37,000 square metres of exhibition space split between its three constituent halls. In recent decades it has had to play second fiddle to the even larger Earls Court Hall - just over the border in SW5 - but with both places now owned by the same firm the two quite happily complement each other.    T
transit: We are close to Kensington Olympia train and tube station, Hammersmith and Shepherds Bush.  There are useful buses that leave from Shepherds Bush (7 minutes walk) and from Hammersmith Road (10 minutes walk).  It is a very well located apartment; the nearest main line station is Padditington and the nearest airport is Heathrow.  Gatwick is very easy to access via Kensington Olympia train station which means  you do not need to head into Victoria to get the train. Parking is a pain but if you must have a car then you need to pay the parking metres on the street.  There are car parks near by but they may charge a lot of money to park there all day.  You have been warned!
access: You have the entire place to yourselves.
house_rules: Please leave the place as you have found it; any damages will have to be paid for and/or taken out of your deposit. name: 2 Bed 2 Bath Wimbledon Apartment
summary: Apartment available, less than 2 minute walk to underground station (northern line) 30 minutes to central London, 5 minutes to Wimbledon centre,  10 minute drive to the all England Tennis Club.  Good bars and restaurants near by. Two supermarkets within 2 minute walk. The modern apartment has two bathrooms Wifi + TV living room, kitchen, 2 comfortable double beds, parking space available by request for long term bookings.
space: A private apartment is available in leafy area of south west London.  This is the perfect place to stay if you love tennis as the property is only a short distance away from the famous Wimbledon all England tennis club  (10 minutes).  Plus the nearest tube is just a 2 minute walk away  (Northern Line) which has direct links to the centre of London ( Leicester Square, Euston, London Bridge, St Pancras etc..) and will only take 25 minutes.   The apartment comes with two comfortable double beds with towels and linen provided, a large fully equipped kitchen and cosy sitting room - which is a great place to relax after a long and exciting day exploring London.  The price also includes Wifi,  Cable Tv and free secure parking. The apartment  is also close to all amenities and restaurants, 5 minutes to town centre. Wimbledon Tennis - 25 minutes Walk 10 minutes on bus/car Underground - 2 minutes     The whole apartment is available for the duration of the Wimbledon Championships.

name: LUXURY DOUBLE ROOM CLAPHAM(ZONE 2)
summary: Contemporary and stylish double bed room in the heart of Clapham . 2 min walk from Clapham North on the Northern Line (zone 2) . 10 min walk to O2 Brixton Academy Tube 15-20 min to the west end, Less then 10 min Waterloo or Victoria, 20 min Liverpool street.
space: Bright , modern and spacious, recently refurbished maisonette split level , top 2 floors in a victorian house  2 min from Clapham North tube.  Also minutes walk is the trendy high street with many shops,bars, restaurants, clubs, cinema and Clapham Common park. I am  italian ,  very laid back  friendly and with sense of humor . I like travelling, cooking, art, cinema, nature...  gay friendly :) The bedroom has a  brand new white leather Habitat european size bed ( with luxury memory foam mattress 200x160), padded headboard, super comfy!  feather pillows ( or memory foam if you prefer ) It's very quiet and overlooking the backgardens. This accomodation is not the right choice for you if are uncomfortable with 3 small exotic reptiles in their display glass tank.

name: Light airy double bedroom for rent
summary: We're set back from the road, with gardens - yet you can get into central london within 12 mins. The room is spacious with a good sized warddrobe and big window letting in lots of light.  Parking is available and free too.
space: A beautiful room is available to rent in a light and airy flat in West Dulwich.  This is the perfect place to  relax whilst in London, plus its only 10 minute train away from Central London.   The property is a lovely leafy location with parking space if necessary.   Close to the Dulwich Picture Gallery for those who like art and all the main London  tourist attractions such as Houses of Parliament, London Eye, Tower of London, Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square, are all within less than 30 mins from the Flat!  We are close to two main train stations: West dulwich - from where you can get a train that takes you to Victoria Station in only 10mins Tulse Hill station - from where you can get a train that takes you to London Bridge within 20 mins and Kings Cross within 25mins The flat is a located close Dulwich park which is a great place to enjoy the local bird life on a sunny day . It is also close  to Thurlow Park  which is ideal for children and has tennis courts which  you can hire.

name: North Kensington – Balcony Room
summary: A cosy double bedroom with private shower room in a Victorian terraced house. Accommodation with character in a warm and welcoming family home. Easy access to central London, Portobello Road, Westfield Shopping Centre and the museums of South Kensington. There's a lovely park with playgrounds at the end of our road and two minutes walk from our home you will find a small supermarket selling fresh produce, post office, pub, cafe, hairdresser and family-run Thai restaurant.
space: Come and stay in a warm and welcoming family home in west London . We will try our best to help you decide where to go and what to do to make your visit more fun.  We are a 15 minute walk from Portobello Road and Westfield Shopping Centre and convenient for Central Line and Hammersmith and City Line and Circle Line tube stations. Our home is just 30 minutes by tube to central London. We are also a 2 minute walk from a bus stop where you can get the number 7 bus, which takes you to central London and the number 70 bus, which takes you to the Victoria and Albert museum, the Science Museum and the Natural History museum. You will have your own double bedroom with private shower room and toilet and private balcony. Bed linen, towels, hairdryer, breakfast and Wi - Fi are included. We invite you to take breakfast in a modern kitchen overlooking a patio garden.  You will share the rest of our home with us.....two adults and two teenage children.
description: A cosy double bedroom with private shower room in a Victorian terraced house. Accommodation with character in a warm and welcoming family home. Easy access to central London, Portobello Road, Westfield Shopping Centre and the museums of South Kensington. There's a lovely park with playgrounds at the end of our road and two minutes walk from our home you will find a small supermarket selling fresh produce, post office, pub, cafe, hairdresser and family-run Thai restaurant. Come and stay in a warm and welcoming family home in west London . We will try our best to help you decide where to go and what to do to make your visit more fun.  We are a 15 minute walk from Portobello Road and Westfield Shopping Centre and convenient for Central Line and Hammersmith and City Line and Circle Line tube stations. neighborhood_overview: An eclectic melting pot of cultures and characters make Portobello a constantly lively and fun place to visit. You might rub shoulders with celebs in E&O restaurant one minute and get a coffee in one of the authentic Portuguese cafes the next. Get down with the local DJs at the Mau Mau bar or watch a band at the Tabernacle. With Moroccans, Spanish, Portuguese, Caribbean and more recently American bankers, there is always something new to experience. From posh to bohemian from market stall to Michelin restaurant, there is something for everyone.
notes: We need you to check in between 8am (08:00) and 9pm (21:00). So, before you book with us, please carefully check your arrival time at our home on the first day when you check in. If your flight arrives very early in the morning, we ask you kindly to delay your arrival at our home until 8am (08:00) (perhaps you could take coffee or breakfast in the airport). If your flight is delayed or changed and you cannot avoid arriving after 9pm (21:00), we understand and will of course greet you when you arrive. Once you have checked in, you will be given a key and you are welcome to come and go at whatever time you want.  Please note: If we have guests checking out the same day that you check in, your room may not be ready for you until after 1pm (13:00). If this is the case, we are happy for you to check in before this time and drop your bags.
transit: We are a 10 minute walk from White City station on the Central Line and a 15 minute walk from Wood Lane or Ladbroke Grove on the Hammersmith and District Line. We are also very close to major bus routes which go into central London and other parts of the city, many of which run all night.
access: Guests will also have access to the kitchen, living room and laundry room.

name: Lovely Victorian Room Streatham
summary: Hi, we want our guests to have a great time when staying with us, we will guide you to the best things to see and do in London and how to get around, all we ask is that you are as friendly as we are.
space: We have a lovely room in  our  Victorian Maisonette.  The room is on the ground floor, at the back of the house, overlooking a quiet garden, which is really nice in the summer. We have fully fitted kitchen, dining room, bathroom. Plus free wi-fi. We're very relaxed and flexible. From near the house you can catch a 417 bus to Streatham Hill Station in 3 minutes or it is a 12 minute walk , or a bit longer to Streatham or Tulse Hill. From Streatham Hill rail station you can get to Victoria in  15 minutes by train or change at Balham for the Northern Line underground (20 minutes to the centre).  Our location is also convenient for Gatwick Airport, which is approx. 30 mins, by train. Buses run directly from Streatham Hill to the Centre (40-50 minutes) and East London (45-50 minutes) and Brixton (10 minutes) (on Victoria Line underground). The Piccadilly Line has direct connection to Heathrow Airport. Direct connection to St Pancras International for Eurostar. access: Guests can enjoy the garden, put food in the fridge, use the microwave and use plates and cutlery. name: Large bedroom with 1 double bed
space: Hello, I'm renting out the second bedroom in my fully-furnished 2 bedroom flat. It's suitable for short or longer term stays.  It's on the sixth floor of a modern apartment building 10 minutes walk from Barnes train station and 15 minutes from East Putney tube station. You can walk to Roehampton University and the National Archives are a short bus ride away.  The building is set in landscaped grounds with controlled access. You can get to Waterloo station in about 20 minutes and from there it's easy to get to the West end for theatres or the City for business. Heathrow airport can be reached via the Piccadilly line at Hammersmith in just under one hour. The apartment has six main rooms: two bathrooms, living room, kitchen, and two bedrooms. There is also a balcony. We have a baby and babies are welcome to stay: we have a baby bath and a moses basket. The bathrooms both have showers. As a guest, one of the bathrooms will be for your use. The kitchen has an oven with a counter-top range

summary: The Single room overlooks the trees and grass of the garden. A place to relax away from the noise and bustle of this great metropolis but in very easy reach of the major tourist sites, business areas and theatres and museums.

neighborhood_overview: Truly multi-ethnic with tolerance and respect between different races and religions.  A wealth of sights, smells and tastes every time you leave the house and yet very often the loudest sound is that of birds singing. It is easy to get into central London, but my favourite round trip is much closer - a canal walk, cake and coffee overlooking the Olympic Stadium,  walk along the Greenway, drop down into the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and stroll around the Wetlands, then up into Westfield for some retail therapy or a film.
notes: The rail lines and stations in London are constantly being worked on.  This means that sometimes one or more routes is unavailable at the weekends.  I will do my best to let you know if you are likely to be affected during the dates you wish to book, but you might like to check yourself as well.
transit: Easy links with the District Line, the Hammersmith and City Line, the Central Line and the Jubilee Line.   There are two Overground routes within easy reach, a  third only a few stops away. Connection to the various DLR routes is likewise very straightforward. Many buses are within a few minutes from the house going in many different directions, including to Canning Town and Stratford where connections to Central London can be picked up.
access: Help yourself to teas and coffee in the kitchen at any time. There is space to store food in the fridge, freezer and cupboard so you can cook your own food if you wish.   No meat in the house, thank you. There are plenty of books in the sitting room and on the landing, and boxes of leaflets of things to do, places to go, in and around London both in your room and in the kitchen. Large scale A-Z maps for your reference can help you plan your visit. You are welcome to use the Yoga room for your own practice, and if there is space you would be welcome to join a class - details on request. In the summer the garden is great to sit in - there's a seat at the end, and rugs for the grass area.
house_rules: NO SMOKING. No shoes upstairs, thank you.  Slippers provided. No shoes in the yoga room. The house runs on consideration for others - for instance - Please respect that this is a vegetarian household and dispose of any fish products as soon as possible by wrapping them and placing in the outside bin.   Please do not cook meat in the house. Do your washing up as soon as possible after meals. Be considerate of others in the house when using the bath or shower (if several people need to use it at about the same time then that is not the best time to have long bath)  Noise - Please limit long (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) or phone calls at night, and if watching a film at night use earphones. Do not download more data than is strictly necessary as it blocks the internet access for others. Do use the downstairs rooms for working in, but meals have priority on the kitchen table, and conversation and TV programmes have priority in the sitting room. There are separate containers for disposing of

Stylish and comfortable little room, next to the Underground station, in colourful and fashionable Notting Hill, just off the buzzing Portobello Road ; Located within minutes of all the amenities of Central London, only 15 minutes from St Pancras International Eurostar station and multiple connections for direct transfers from the 6 London airports. Two young French men of thirty something, one designer, one restaurateur, living in a beautiful flat, in this little corner of London for over 10 years, cu
neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill is definitely more than just the setting for a famous movie. You will fall in love with this cosmopolitan part of London, its leafy streets, its multiple works by the artist Banksy, its yearly carnival (the Portobello Room is located right on the route of the Notting Hill carnival), its flea market, its colourful facades and its multiple eccentricities. No visit to London would be complete without spending a few days here.    Notting Hill's diverse cultural scene stems from a rich musical and political heritage.  We couldn't recommend more our neighbourhood which still holds so much uniqueness to enjoy with its cross-cultural cuisine. We're talking Moroccan, Italian, Mexican, Ethiopian, Persian, French, Portuguese, Spanish, Indian, Lebanese, Palestinian, traditional British and gastro-pub restaurants, hot food stalls and delis.
notes: Some walk lovers will pace up and down Portobello market and then stroll about Hyde Park, one of the green lungs of the city, which leads, at its north east corner to the shopping mecca, Oxford Street, or further south, to Harrods and Harvey Nichols. Others will prefer to visit Regents Park, wandering along the Regent's Canal, which will lead to punk neighborhood Camden Town via the romantic Little Venice. The more adventurous will discover the BoBo area of Kensal Rise with its antique shops and coffee places. `  To get the real feel of the neighbourhood, it is worthwhile to move beyond the street market and the images conjured up by the eponymous movie, and walk down some of the streets away from Portobello Road and Notting Hill Gate. Just spending a day in the boutiques of Ledbury Road and Westbourne Grove, or whiling away time people watching in one of the many cafes and bars will help you appreciate why the area has become one of London's most popular and expensive places to live.
transit: Public transports:  -Underground:  Ladbroke Grove (Circle Line + Hammersmith and City Line), only 3 minutes walk from the Portobello Room.  Holland Park (Central Line) down the road, at the beginning of Ladbroke Grove, about 10 to 15 minutes walk from the Portobello Room.  Alternatively, Notting Hill gate station is right at the other end of Portobello Road, a beautiful daily walk that doesn't take a long time if you decide not to stop at every single little boutiques that make this street so special. -Buses: (all the buses are on our doorstep)  -Route 7 (Little Venice, Oxford Street, Soho, British Museum...)  -Route 23 (Little Venice, Oxford Street, Regent Street, Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square, Covent Garden, Saint Paul Cathedral, Tate Modern, Brick Lane, Spitalfields Market...)  -Route 52 (Kensington Palace, High Street Kensington, Royal Albert Hall, Exhibition Road, Knightsbridge, Harrod's, Hyde Park Corner, Green Park, Buckingham Palace)  -Route 70 (Kensington Palace, High St

name: Roof Garden Oasis 10 Minutes From  Kings Cross
summary: Welcome to my apartment, located just moments from Highbury & Islington tube station & the wonders of Upper Street.  It's located in an unassuming yet historic building (John Lennon stayed here!) & has a generously sized, south facing roof garden.  It's been recently renovated (apart from the bathroom - I'm getting there!) so it has a nice light & airy feel.  There is a bedroom with a double bed & an optional wall bed (small double in the living area.
space: Recently renovated, I hope you'll find my apartment to your liking with it's neutral tones & natural, warm feel.  I've tried to make it as homely & comfortable as possible for your stay, you are welcome to use the tea, coffee & groceries in the cupboards & use the kitchen ware & utensils on offer.   The entire apartment overlooks a south facing roof garden, so even though you're on the hustle & bustle of Holloway Road, you don't hear any traffic.

You have full access to the whole apartment & garden at all times.  My daughter & I live in t
neighborhood_overview: Islington is a gorgeous borough with the jewel of the crown being Upper Street with it's plethora of bars & restaurants.  The immediate area we're in is called LoHo & has a variety of amenities within 1 minute of the flat.  Immediately downstairs is House of Hammerton, famous for its craft ales.  We have a fun concept store called Provisions which do wine & cheese tastings & the North London Buddhist Centre is just 30 seconds away with a full yoga & meditation schedule, open to all.  If it's coffee & breakfast you're after - Vagabond N7 is the one, just 3 doors along.  Need a little fix-up after your journey?  The N7 Collective is Islington's premier hair & beauty salon and is just 14 doors away.  If you want to book in just let me know for a special Air BNB discount, I know the owner (spoiler, it's me).
notes: You DO sometimes hear the bar downstairs on the occasional busy weekend night.   The roof terrace does have an edgy feel to it, it's not perfectly landscaped but it IS a work in progress, has a comfy sofa & is a south facing sun trap! The 2nd bed is in the living area which currently doesn't have any blinds, so the sun will be your alarm clock!  The bathroom is a little tired but bear with, I'm a single mama just trying her best!  It's perfectly functional & clean, it just needs a little facelift.   The apartment doesn't have an iron.... or an ironing board.  My mother said ironing was a waste of your life so I've never ironed a thing.  Maybe that's why I'm single.
transit: Islington is a fantastic area & is very connected to the rest of London being on the Victoria line (one stop to King's Cross, 4 stops to Oxford Circus) Piccadilly line & east London overground.  The apartment is just 1 minute walk from the tube.  It is also serviced by bus 24 hours per day.   Parking vouchers are £20 per 24hours and I can purchase these for you in advance.
access: You have full access to the whole apartment & garden at all times.  My daughter & I live in the apartment so our belongings will be discreet but there in the wardrobes etc... luckily we're pretty minimal!

IT HAPPENS THAT OUR MESSAGES TO EACH OTHER END UP IN SPAM AND WE DO NOT ESTABLISH CONTACT AT ALL! THANK YOU FOR YOUR CO-OPERATION

name: South Bank Bijou Studio Flat
space: This newly finished bijou studio flat is adjacent to the owner's home and art studio and has an independent entrance. It is wonderfully secluded, yet situated in the heart of London's culturally rich South Bank. Beautifully detailed and designed, this unique space sits in the back garden of our Georgian terraced house. Private, en suite bathroom with shower. The studio is well appointed with all new appliances. The kitchenette includes a microwave, refrigerator kettle, sink and is suitable for preparing basic ready-meals, coffee and tea but is not appropriate for full scale cooking; double bed, cable TV and WIFI; iron + ironing board.  Sheets and towels are provided. For stays longer than 1 week, we arrange for a cleaner to come refresh the flat. For your personal laundry there is a dry cleaners nearby that will do a drop off laundry service. We consider ourselves very lucky to be in such a fabulous location. This vibrant neighborhood has numerous restaurants and shops and Borough Food

name: Newly upgraded! 2 private rooms, bath, kitchenette
summary: Recently remodeled relaxing private space in a secure family townhouse with a Scandi, arty feel.  Two private rooms, bathroom, and kitchenette. Sleeps up to five - perfect for family, friends, couple or business in Central London's hip East End!  Located near Shoreditch, Canary Wharf, Queen Mary University, galleries, markets, shopping, pubs, parks and canals. Short journey to the West End.  Guests with ID, photo, and reviews welcome. *We follow Airbnb COVID 19 cleaning guidelines.
space: This listing is for a cosy guest bedroom and lounge which can comfortably accommodate up to 5 people: - 1 bedroom (double bed + comfy sofa chair) - New, private bathroom - New, private kitchenette - New, private lounge (with comfy futon sofa bed). The space is light, clean and relaxing, accessible on the ground floor level in a uniquely designed, modern, 3 level London townhouse.  Our house is creatively decorated, making it a welcoming homely environment.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in a unique, diverse neighbourhood in zone 2 of the city centre. It has a rich heritage of its own and is well worth exploring, including Cockneys, Suffragettes, Kray Twins, the oldest fashion market in London. Nowadays there are local restaurants, cafes (try the local pie 'n mash), markets, galleries, boutiques and events and the market still exists.  We are close to many parks and canals and I really recommend exploring these by bike or by foot (Bow has been been nominated for a National Walking Award and Victoria Park has a Green Flag award). For your shopping delight Stratford's Westfield Shopping centre (the largest indoor in Europe) is across the park to cater for your every shopping need. We are also within easy reach of the West End - Oxford circus and Covent Garden - by bus or tube. We're ideally located to explore Shoreditch and Spitalfields, with its wonderful markets, hip lifestyle and nightlife. Lauriston village has hip cafes and arguably the best fish n' c
notes: The house is a family home. We live upstairs and welcome guests to stay in our separate ground floor level. Common area is the shared hallway.
transit: We are in Zone 2, conveniently located at just 3 minutes walk from the bus stop or 12-15 minutes walk from the tube and then pretty much between 5 mins to 30 via tube travel into other parts of central London. We are easily accessible from all London Airports. London City Airport is closest but Stansted, Gatwick and Heathrow although a bit further away are easily accessible. The nearest tube stations are Bow Road/ Mile End and we're also close to Bow Church DLR. All will get you into central London very easily on the Hammersmith & City, District and Central Lines. The No. 8 Bus takes you central.  Metered street parking is available next to the house. I may be able to offer a permit if I'm given plenty of notice. There is a daily cost for this. There are plenty of bikes to hire locally. London is a great walking city - plenty of markets, along the canal, through parks etc. Access to London Hotspots: Conveniently located to discover so much of London... * 5 - 15 minute tube journey into
access: Access to a private bedroom + lounge own bathroom and own kitchenette
house_rules: We have a long history of having guests  to stay and there are only a few rules... - We are grateful when you keep noise to a minimum in the evenings - You'll understand, I'm sure, that with a child at home we'd like to see ID - Strictly no extra guests unless booked in via Airbnb. - Please remove your shoes when indoors. That's it!  We look forward to welcoming you to stay.

name: Lovely large room, Bethnal Green
summary: Lovely characterful room in a house belonging to an artist and a musician.
space: A lovely large room in a late Georgian house belonging to an artist and a musician.  Our house was built between 1820 and 1830. It is characterful, and is furnished simply and comfortably, with many original features and stripped floorboards throughout. We overlook Museum Gardens, The Museum of Childhood and St John's, a John Soanes' church. It is a two minute walk from Bethnal Green Tube, which is on the Central Line and 15 minutes from Oxford Circus. Brick Lane and Shoreditch are  both about a 15 minute walk away, as are Broadway Market and Columbia Road. The room available has two sofas, one of which is a very comfortable double sofa bed.  There is a shared bathroom and second loo. You are welcome to help yourself to breakfast, tea and coffee at any time, and to use the kitchen and the washing machine and dryer. All bedding and towels are provided, as is Wifi connection. If you have any questions, please ask.

name: JESSIE the narrowboat in Little Venice
summary: JESSIE the narrowboat is moored in the heart of Little Venice on the north bank of the Pool of Little Venice and just opposite Brownings Island. It’s a stones throw from Paddington Station. Convenient, pretty and very relaxing.
space: Stay on this lovely individual, comfortable boat in the heart of London and experience the capital from a different point of view. Jessie is a 57 foot canal boat (or narrowboat) completed in 2011.  She is 6 foot 10 inches wide. She can sleep 4 people in comfort, for 2 she is very comfortable. The boat has a warm inviting interior and space on deck to sit and watch the world go by. The appropriately named Little Venice (a name coined by the poet Robert Browning) is a very pretty corner of London, famous as home to hundreds of beautiful canal boats and convenient base from which to explore the capital. Two underground stations and good bus routes to all parts of the city are a short walk away. There is something very special about returning to the peace and quiet of the canal after a day in the city. There are lots of local pubs, restaurants, cafe and shops in the immediate neighbourhood. Free Wifi connection. The sleeping accommodation is made up of a double cabin at the front with door

summary: WHOLE APARTMENT: Spacious, sunny, one-bedroom South London apartment close to central London. Make your holiday or business trip comfortable and easy. This is a  bright, lovely private space in a Georgian house and set in a neighbourhood with easy transport links and close to the city. Just like the photo!
space: Spacious, sunny, one-bedroom South London suite within a character Georgian house just 3 miles from central London. Transport is easy (read the reviews). There are great train links to Victoria, Kings Cross/St Pancras and London Bridge stations at the top of the street and many bus links at the bottom of the street direct to places like Big Ben, Trafalgar Square, Oxford Street, Covent Garden and the West End. There is even a (Northern line) Tube station within a short bus ride or brisk walk. The apartment has been recently painted and decorated and all appliances are new. It has its own entrance and bathroom and a hairdryer. There is high speed Wireless Internet and Freeview TV. It has a separate bedroom with comfortable double bed. There is also a foldaway bed if guests require separate sleeping arrangements or there is a third person (for a small extra charge). Dine in with full kitchen and laundry facilities (good supermarket within a short walk) or head out to explore great local p

transit: Camberwell has great transport options. It is less than 3 miles from Big Ben and is served by trains and buses that run 24 hours a day. There is a website call (Website hidden by Airbnb) which will give you a good indication of how to get across London from our address - postcode SE5 8SP. Trains Denmark Hill Station is a five-minute walk up the hill, turn right into Windsor Walk. Frequent trains to Victoria (9 min), London Bridge (12 min) and Kings Cross/St Pancras (22 min). It’s best to check timetables before leaving to get the right train.  There are two tube stations – Oval and Elephant & Castle within a 10-minute bus ride or a 20-minute walk. Both are on the northern line and good to use if you want to go to the north of the city to places like Camden and Hampstead. We would recommend using the buses which are close, frequent, run 24 hours a day - and you can see London. name: Lovely two bedroom Islington home.
summary: A two bedroom victorian terraced house set on a peaceful residential street within easy reach of the life of Islington. Refurbished to a high standard, very well appointed with taste and style.
space: It benefits from:  - Beautiful reception/living room. - Sleek and stylish kitchen with integrated appliances, dining tables in and out.  - French doors opening to the garden.  - Master bedroom fitted wardrobes and wooden shutters.  - South-facing second bedroom with garden views.  - Modern bathroom.  - South-facing garden, outdoor living area with full teak decking. - 60mb wifi, video and music streaming around house, home cinema system, Bose stereo throughout.  - Even a Stocked 'cellar'!
description: A two bedroom victorian terraced house set on a peaceful residential street within easy reach of the life of Islington. Refurbished to a high standard, very well appointed with taste and style. It benefits from:  - Beautiful reception/living room. - Sleek and stylish kitchen with integrated appliances, dining tables in and out.  - French doors opening to the garden.  - Master bedroom fitted wardrobes and wooden shutters.  - South-facing second bedroom with garden views.  - Modern bathroom.  - South-facing garden, outdoor living area with full teak decking. - 60mb wifi, video and music streaming around house, home cinema system, Bose stereo throughout.  - Even a Stocked 'cellar'! The whole house is yours, guests have access to everything. Guests fully left to their own devices, though housekeeper and owner on hand whenever required. The lovely housekeeper has managed the house and for over 10 years and will be available for all guest needs. Islington/De Beauvoir is a quality residential
neighborhood_overview: Islington/De Beauvoir is a quality residential area of inner north east London. Upmarket, thriving, rich in culture, it has a rich and diverse mix of residents giving it an individual and hip vibe. Islington was once a neglected inner-city spot, but now it is one of the capital’s most fashionable places to live with trendy bars, shops, restaurants and nightlife surrounded by beautiful nineteenth century terraces. City workers, wealthy young couples and creatives living alongside students, families and pensioners. Googling around on the terms 'Islington’ and 'De Beauvoir Town’ will provide lots more info.
notes: I work abroad much of the year thus look for tenants to enjoy the house in my absence. The property will be let in a fully managed and furnished condition for this period. I've no doubt you'll enjoy the house, Having been my home for over 10 years it has everything one could possibly need, great location, all ready to go. Any questions don't hesitate to ask. ALL BILLS INCLUDED, except house cleaning.  Looking for a tenant, ideally a medium term one, to take the house from December 4th 2014 onwards. Minimum stay of 10 days. Any questions just let me know. Thank you.
transit: Located in quality Islington residential area with literally 20 min tube commute to absolute central London (Oxford Circus). Located very well for most other London event venues too: - Bus Routes: 4x routes into the ‘city’ (EC) within 4min walk from the door, 3x bus routes into central & west London within 6min walk from door. - Essex Rd Station - National Rail: 7min walk from the door, Old st in 3mins, Moorgate in 7mins. Line out to Hertfordshire. - Highbury & Islington Station - Victoria Line+National Rail: 10 min walk from the house (or 4min bus) , 11minutes to Oxford st. Same national rail line as Essex Rd, but one stop further out.   - Angel Station – Northern Line, city branch: 12 min walk from the house (or 4min bus) Connections north and south,  Kings Cross 4 mins, London bridge 10min.

name: DOUBLE RM IN LONDON(check in unavail 21-24 Feb)
summary: One lovely bright double bedroom for one guest only in a quiet area 25 minutes by tube from central London.
space: One lovely double bedroom for one guest only in a quiet area 25 minutes by tube from central London. Guests have use of the kitchen and bathroom, with constant hot water and separate toilet. The room includes a double bed, towels and linen, free WiFi and TV. The apartment is shared with the owner and other guests. The apartment is very clean and tidy and is situated in Bounds Green, a bus ride away from Muswell Hill with it's many stylish bars, cafes and restaurants and a local park minutes away with a great view over London and with 25 minutes to Leicester Square and all London's tourist attractions this is perfectly situated. It is also  only 30 mins train away from the city, the nearest station is Bounds Green  which is roughly around a 10 minute walk  away.  The preferred guest would for this accommodation would be for a single person, unfortunately the rooms cannot accommodate families. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: A stylish original Victorian home in West London
summary: A very large and light one bedroom Victorian apartment with original wooden floors throughout and heaps of style, 60m2. Comfortably fits a couple, and is a short walk from trendy areas of Portobello and Westfield entertainment and shopping, three tube lines, train and bus.
space: Ground floor of a Victorian villa, a very large, airy and sunny apartment. It has one double bedroom with a very large double bed, spacious living room and separate kitchen. The place is within walking distance from great shopping, on a quiet residential street in Shepherds Bush, just off Goldhawk Road.  There is a lovely neighbourhood with cafes and shops just across the road - Hammersmith Grove.  The flat is also not far from Holland Park shops and cafes (15-20 min walk max) and 20-25 min walk to Portobello Road.  This is zone 2, next to three (3) tube stations, Westfield shopping, outdoor market within 5 min walk, etc. Nearest tube: Goldhawk road Hammersmith & City + Circle Line (2-3 min), Shepherds Bush Central line (7-10 min).  Dishwasher, washer/dryer, cooker (gas stove and oven), all kitchen stuff,  super juicer, french press, towels and bedlinen, hairdryer and all other perks of a normal home.  Minimalistic interior with antique pieces, all necessary things, plenty of storage,
