neighborhood_overview: You can easily walk to Holland Park (just over the roundabout) and enjoy the tranquil green space or go for a run, go have coffee or lunch around Holland Park area (15-20 min walk max) or even get to Portobello on foot. If you chose to stay very locally - crossing the road to Hammersmith Grove will get you to some nice cafes (in about 5 minutes), like Raoul's deli and cafe, for example, the Grove restaurant and many more. There is a yoga studio as well. Should you wish to shop till you drop - within 10 minutes walk is a Westfield shopping centre, with a mind-blowing array of cafes, bars and restaurants, plus a great number of shops, a cinema and a great deal more. Right next to us is a Shepherds Bush market, an open air affair for fresh veggies and fruit and some ethnic fair. A great number of supermarkets and ethnic shops and cafes on both Goldhawk road and Uxbridge road. Uxbridge road (just at the other end of Devonport Road, where you are) has great Middle Eastern shops that always
notes: Toilet flush is operated upwards. Please do not push the handle down. You will be responsible for the cost of call out and fixing it, if you break it. Please wipe clean any water on Black Stone in the bathroom and use bathmat provided. Heating - is operated by boiler. To set the timer, gently pull on two silver handles on the grey panel below the boiler and open boiler panel.
transit: You are right in the middle of great transport connections: Circle, District and Hammersmith and City line station (Goldhawk road) is within 3-4 min walk, Central line *Shepherds Bush - 10 min walk. There are a number of buses outside the house as well.

name: Theatreland Central London
space: The room has bunk bed. The window overlooks High Holborn. Anything that London can offer is but a short walk away. Drury lane is about 250m as is the British Museum. Covent garden is about 500m as is Soho. The area is surrounded by restaurants, theatres, pubs, clubs etc.  Holborn tube station is just at the bottom of the road, and can be seen by looking left from the window – the street shot shows this view. If you look right you can see the junction of Drury Lane and High Holborn.  Own kettle, fridge, microwave and cutlery available – wifi available.  So why stay in this area? This is as central as you can get, as far as London goes. Great public transport connections everywhere, whether you're looking to get to the Olympic Village (in less than 30 minutes), the London Eye, O2 Arena, Oxford Street or Piccadilly Circus - you literally are in the middle of everything.

name: Stylish, Colourful & Beautifully Located 2 Bed
summary: Bright and quirky, super lovely, beautifully furnished and stylish flat in N7.  2 Bedrooms with double beds, 1 Bathroom and Large Open Plan Living Space comprising Lounge, Dining Space and Kitchen opening out on to a Private Sunny Balcony. This secure, gated development also offers Landscaped Communal Gardens & Concierge and is superbly located within easy reach of Central London and walking distance from the boutique shops and restaurants of nearby Upper Street in Islington.
space: With stylish and modern fixtures and fittings throughout, this stunning light and colourful 2 bedroom flat is placed within a popular, modern Piers Gough designed development with 24 hour concierge and also benefits from pretty communal gardens and ponds. The property, which is on the second floor offers a large reception room with space for dining, 2 bedrooms, modern bathroom and private sunny balcony.  Eden Grove is just moments from the extensive and diverse amenities on Holloway Road including cinema, supermarkets and bars and vibrant Upper Street in Islington is within easy reach for a fabulous selection of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants.  The flat is within a secure gated development with key fob entry points.

The property, which is on the second floor offers a large reception room with space for dining, 2 bedrooms, modern bathroom and private sunny balcony.  Eden Grove is just moments from the extensive and diverse amenities on Holloway Road including cinema, supermar
neighborhood_overview: Islington it is one of the capital’s most fashionable places to live with trendy bars, shops, restaurants and nightlife surrounded by beautiful nineteenth century terraces. Islington has a rich and diverse mix of residents that gives it its individual and hip vibe. City workers, wealthy young couples, first time buyers and creative types live alongside students. Younger residents love the social side of Islington and that it is so easy to get into the City.  Islington's Best Bits! - Shopping in Islington High Street and Upper Street – supermarkets, chains and independent shops and a great street market every Wednesday  - Camden Passage antiques village - world famous for its huge range of shops, arcades and markets  - Chapel Market – variety of delis, clothes and bric-a-brac plus the Islington Farmers’ Market on Sundays  Nearby you'll find a Tesco and Waitrose, as well as plenty of Bars, Restaurants, and Shops.
transit: For those wishing to travel into central London, Holloway Road and Caledonian Underground Stations (Piccadilly Line) are very close with Covent Garden only a ten minute tube ride away.  The 43 bus goes to Old Street and London Bridge.
access: The whole property all to yourself as well as the communal gardens.
house_rules: No smoking, no pets. I very much welcome guests to make themselves comfortable in my flat during their stay but do expect the flat to be left more or less as it was found.  - Please don't use the washing machine after 10pm.   - Please come in and leave quietly being careful not to slam the door.   - Please do any washing-up – no dirty washing up to be left in the sink please. - Please take off shoes on entering the flat. - If carpet and upholstery stains are permanent, professional cleaning costs will be deducted from the deposit.  - Breakages and damage will be deducted from the deposit.

name: Penthouse Flat w/Roof Terrace near Little Venice
summary: Welcome to my penthouse apartment! The private roof terrace is just the perfect place to enjoy the beautiful views of London, including the Shard and the Gherkin.  The flat is located at a short walk both to Westbourne Park and Warwick Avenue stations, getting you to Oxford Circus in 10 minutes. The enchanting area of Little Venice and Portobello Road are a stroll away. I am looking forward to welcoming you!
space: Make yourself at home in my bright, spacious penthouse apartment. It's located in Maida Vale, a refined area known for its wide boulevards and green areas: a very spacious and leafy part of London but still very central, thanks to great transport links. The quiet, peaceful bedroom is lit by plenty of natural light coming in from the windows, overlooking the gardens. The use of the light-blue colour savvily balanced by neutral interiors adds charm and personality to the room, which also has extra storage space for your belongings.  Get ready for a day of exploring in the modern bathroom. This refined room features a natural tile wet room with a powerful rain shower: have your energy loaded with the utmost comfort! Toiletries and soft towels will be provided. The kitchen and living area share a splendid open-plan layout, with a distinctly modern touch. The oak flooring adds elegance, and it's the perfect frame for the contemporary interiors. The kitchen is fully equipped for you to cook

neighborhood_overview: The beautiful area of Maida Vale, characterized by green and verdant streets, small independent shops, and pretty buildings is a charming part of London. Aside from plenty of great food and drink options, the two main attractions of Maida Vale are arguably the location and the canal. The Little Venice Canal may be London’s best kept secret, enjoy long walks by the canal and live comedy show in a cozy setting at the Canal Café Theater. The location of Maida Vale is ideal because of how close it is to central London is a walk or a quick tube ride away, as is the green expanse of Regent’s Park. You are also near Lord’s Cricket Ground; an iconic and historic sports venue as well as home to one of the oldest sports museums in the world, The Lords Cricket Museum. Slightly further away the heart of Maida Vale are the beautiful green lawns of Regent’s Park which houses ZSL London Zoo as well as a picturesque rose garden, a boating lake (with rentable paddle and pedal boats) and lots of open sp
notes: Please, always be cautious while around the terrace's railing.
transit: The flat is located at a short walk both to Westbourne Park and Warwick Avenue stations, getting you to Oxford Circus in 10 minutes. You'll be connected to Circle, Hammersmith & City and Bakerloo lines. Paddington station a few stops away, which means you'll have access to one of the main hubs for national train services super easily. From there, you can get to Heathrow in half an hour: amazing! If you fancy a ride, Uber is a nice and cheaper alternative to taxis, although the area is well-served by buses, which also run overnight.

name: Smart Two Bed Apartment, Abbey Rd!
space: Available for you to rent is a newly renovated two bedroom apartment on the famous Abbey Road in London. A few minutes walk from Abbey Studios, the home of the Beatles! The apartment has been newly modernised to a high standard and is lovely and bright. It has two double bedrooms, a living room and an eat-in kitchen and private balcony with free high-speed wifi throughout. Set in St John's Wood, one of London's most exclusive locations, the apartment is an easy 15 minute stroll to the High Street, where you will find many places to eat, drink and shop.  Right across the road from the apartment there are local shops, bars and a variety of restaurants. space: The flat (approx 60.75 sq m / 654 sq ft.) with Private balconies, in the City of London. The flat is near The River Thames, just 150metres from the Tower of London and is surrounded by some of the capital's most famous sights – including the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. Other sites include St Paul's Cathedral, Tate Modern, Globe Theatre, South Bank Arts centre, 'The Gherkin'.  It is a fantastic base for exploring the Capital and all the major attractions.  Shakespeare's Globe Theatre is most definitely worth visiting and a trip to the West End, which is a most for the varied productions that are on all year round. The flat is 150 meters from the Tower of London with Tower Bridge just slightly further away.   The flat is within easy reach of the river, and with Fenchurch and Tower Hill stations less than 2 minutes walk away, access to the rest of the city couldn't be easier. neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in the former historic core of London and is a short walk to some of the capital's most famous tourist attractions such as the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, St Pauls Cathedral, the Tate Gallery, to name just a few. There are some very nice restaurants located within few minutes from the flat and Tower Bridge and the South Bank of the Thames.  The Tate and the Thames and Borough Market  are short walking distance away from the flat. There are a number of excellent supermarkets, Pubs, and cafes within walking distance and excellent food market such as Borough market for more specialist options. London theatre district is few tube or bus stops away or easy to get to by taxi. There are plenty of places near the theatres for pre theatre meal. The location is also an excellent location for working in the City.

neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location! You won't find better than this! Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz. Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and everything in between. If y
notes: Non-smoking apartment
transit: You can walk to tourist London or take numerous transport options close by.  Our closest tubes are Warren Street, Goodge Street, Euston Square (all within 5 minute walk) and Tottenham Court Road and St Pancras (within a 10 minute walk) Coming from Heathrow? Easy! Take the tube from Paddington direct to Euston Square  Coming from Gatwick? Easy! Take the tube from Victoria direct to Warren Street Coming from Eurostar? Easy! Take a bus along the Euston Road or take the tube direct to Warren Street Being so central, you can walk to all of tourist London. The British Museum is 10 minutes away. You've got Oxford Street / Soho very close by (a 10 minute walk), Covent Garden will take you about 15 minutes, Regent's Park about 10-15 minutes. Camden is a 5 minute bus ride. You can head in any direction and arrive somewhere interesting. Numerous buses stop close by in Tottenham Court Road, Gower Street and Euston Road You are in easy reach of all the sights. Leicester Square and Trafalgar Square

neighborhood_overview: Finchley has an 'arty vibe' and the Arts Depot which is only a few minutes walking distance, is a hub of comedy, music, drama and art in the area. Notable people who have lived here include : Charles Dickens lived here when he wrote Martin Chuzzlewit (1843) after a trip to the United States, Comedians such as Spike Milligan (Goons) and Eric Morecambe (Morecambe and Wise Show) also lived here, as did Harry Beck (the designer of our famous London Underground Map).Actors, comedians, artists, musicians, writers and journalists still reside in Finchley. Down in East Finchley The Phoenix Cinema is an 1930's Art Deco building is one of the oldest cinemas in the UK and was voted as the best single screen cinema in London.There are also plenty of activities for the kids at the Finchley Leisure Centre including Bowling, Swimming and Cinema.Arriving back at the station of Finchley Central from a trip into the centre, one has a feeling of calm and serenity. Yet within a few minutes from our house

The apartment is overlooking the Bow river canal and the new olympic stadium in East London, with excellent travel links. All rooms are very spacious and with modern furniture with plenty of storage space. Kitchen is smaller than the rest of the rooms, but very practical and fully equipped. All towels and linen are also provided, together with the welcome pack of tea, coffee, milk and breakfast cereal for the duration of your stay. Overall, this is an ideal East London base for your vacation and/or work in the city. You will have sole use of the flat during your
neighborhood_overview: The whole area has been regenerated. Surrounding canals and the river Lea offer beautiful walking routes and bird-spotting opportunities. At some places, it does not feel like you are in London at all. If you, however, prefer the urban life style, Westfield Shopping Centre in Stratford is Europe’s largest urban shopping and leisure centre, with more than 250 shops and 70 places to dine. It is only one stop away on the DLR, (over-ground train), or 4 short bust stops. Best of all, the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park has now reopened to the public and it offers a fantastic array of sport activities and other attractions. You could swim in the Aquatic Centre for £4.50 or visit Arcelomittal Orbit; standing 114.5m tall, this extraordinary attraction is the result of a creative collaboration between world-renowned artist Sir Anish Kapoor, designer Cecil Balmond and ArcelorMittal, the world’s largest steel and mining company. With two observation floors, at 76m and 80m, the ArcelorMittal Orbit pr
notes: Parking is not provided.
transit: Excellent transport connections with 4 underground/overground stations within 10 minutes on foot. Also bus and night bus connections.  Parking is not included with this listing.  My full address is: 39 Central House 32-66 High Street E15 2NS (phone number hidden)) Best way is to go to Stratford, (Central or Jubilee Line), and change to DLR trains from there. Take the first train and get out on the first stop, Pudding Mill Lane. From there, it's 3 minutes walk to mine. Whilst at the platform, turn opposite from the Olympic Stadium. You'll see 2 buildings, straight ahead, in the close distance. A white, square building standing next to the greenish tower. I'm in the white building. The interphone for the main entry is not working, so call me on my mobile and I will come down to let you in.
access: Check in time is after 17:00 and check out is before 10:00.  Guest are either greeted by me, or my cleaner lady, and failing both of those, the keys to the flat are left in the safebox, which is situated outside my entry door, at the bottom, left. You will get the pin number to open the safe and take the keys. Gym, sauna and steam room facilities, open daily from 6AM to 11PM.

name: ST. GEORGE WHARF 2 BED 2 BATH APT. IN VAUXHALL
summary: Our serviced apartments in St George’s Wharf stand out in every imaginable way. Each one of our serviced apartments is set to provide both long-term and short-term residents with an elegant home. £20 extra for 4th and 5th guest. Early Check-in / Late Check-in & Late Check-out basis availability and on payment of extra charges in advance. The apartment doesn't have a fixed reception. Our standard Check-in time is 3-8 PM.
space: The design of the complex honours London’s maritime heritage by following the streamlined shape of sails, while the interiors will leave you nothing to want for with our line of luxury products appointed to make your stay more relaxing and enjoyable. With an innovative floor plans and key amenities such as fully equipped kitchens, wireless Internet access, free view television and 24-hour security features, you will be guaranteed to enjoy the best in contemporary living. You will find yourself in the lap of luxury with our quality linen and towels, and delight in our lavish toiletries from our Gilchrist and Soames assortment. With direct, pedestrian access to Pimlico, Westminster, Victoria, Mayfair, Chelsea and the South Bank, you will be ideally situated to become a fully-fledge Londoner in no time. neighborhood_overview: Our serviced apartments offer the ideal base for contemporary travellers, being located in Vauxhall. Recent property developments have turned this laidback riverside quarter into prime-location real estate, as it’s becoming one of the most diverse areas in the heart of London. Within a ten minute walk, you’ll get to Tate Britain and a little further downriver you will hit the Houses of Parliament. With Victoria station also located only a mile away you can always plan trips to the British countryside on a whim, or simply enjoy the view from your apartment on a balmy night.
notes: DISCLAIMER : Please note, at this time, we can only offer accommodation for key workers. We are not accepting any other types of booking at the moment. DISCLAIMER : Please note we have multiple units within same building. Images used are only for representation purpose and the actual apartment may vary. However, facilities and standards will remain the same. DISCLAIMER : Additional charges will be applicable in case of early check-in and late check-out. Also this will be subject to the availability.

access: We know our guests are concerned regarding health and safety post drastic rise in COVID-19 cases across  Europe. In lieu to this we have introduced specialized services: *Deep Cleaning - A longer process to our deep cleaning policy. *14-day grocery pack - This will cover the required isolation period. *Extra HK Sanitation Service - Our HK team will use COSHH, Diesin Maxx Acid Cleaner Disinfectant and other medically approcved products. *Intercom System - Ensures distance from others and stop further contamination. *High Speed Broadband - Work from the apartments with ease and no hassle. *Healthcare Products - Gloves , masks and sanitiser gels provided if needed. *Entertainment Package - Use (Hidden by Airbnb) Chrome-cast to stream from your laptop to the TV. Please Note : They are subject to availability Grocery Pack : If you or your employee want anything specific, or have any allergies, please let our guest services know 24 hours in advance

name: Double room, breathtaking views
summary: Double room in a character filled flat with beautiful light and breathtaking views in a two bedroom zone 1 location with good transport links in a safe area of Central London.
space: The flat has been fully refurbished following some major plumbing issues so a new bathropm and kitchen have been fitted. Please note that pictures 7 and 8 show the living room not the bedroom. The last few pictures are of the room available and since refurbshment the furniture has changed to an antique wardobe and dresser with eco resin flooring.  As you can see from the picture the bed is on a high platform so small children are best to sleep on the inside, the bed is a queen so will sufuce for two people but please be aware of the edge.  Please note there is no lock on the door as this is a true home not a lodging property. The is a washing machine you can use but no dryer, you are welcome to use our iron and I do not have a hairdryer so if you require one please be sure to bring your own. The kitchen has a lovely whistling kettle, excellent dualit toaster, and gas oven. Fridge space is limited but we will endeavour to clear a shelf if you require it. The views will take your breathe

neighborhood_overview: The Kings Road and Chelsea are famous for the shopping, dinning and architecture. The area is quiet and safe away from the serious hustle and bustle of the main touristic areas. Science mueseum, V&A and natural history museums are an enjoyable 30minite stroll or you can walk to the bus and take a ride that way. Buses take you direct to Soho, Westminster, Liverpool street for brick lane and Shoreditch. London is one of the largest sprawling cities with large parks at fairly regular intervals so please be sure to consider it's vastness when planning your journies as some are surprised by how much time can be spent travelling.
notes: Traditional gas cooker and oven  Power shower that was installed a few years ago qnd has a trick to switch it on we will show tou on arrival. We don't have curtains as we like to be able to admire such an incredible and unusually lucky view of London so if you need something put up please do let us know and we can arrange. The beds in the bedrooms are on platforms as the pictures show so small children who wriggle might want to sleep on the inside, no one has ever fallen out to date.  There are two bins, one with a lid is for general waste that goes down the shoot just outside and to the right of the front door. The second bin is without a lid and is for clean recyclables only that can be disposed of in the communal containers in the car park below the tower (card board, paper, plastic, metal and glass) If you need extra towels please ask before using so we can point you towards the guest towels of which there are plenty :-)  Most of all, we are on hand and always in contact to help so
transit: There are bus stops are a three to seven minute walk for access to other areas and tube and train stations. The closest tube is 15minute walk but you can take a bus to shorten the journey. There is also a bike hire dock on the estate so you can enjoy london by bike easily.
access: You are most welcome to the livingroom, bathroom and toilet as well as the kitchen. I am a freelance chef and will sometimes use it for work so please do try to return everything to its place and leave it tidy and clean. You will have your own key to come and go as you please, please dont lose it ;-)
house_rules: No Smoking inside the flat Strictly no drugs to be used in the flat and if you are coming to London to do this please kindly look for another place to stay as our home is a place of calm not to recover from a heavy night out.  No Pets The apartment is a shoes free zone, please leave them at the door. Please no visitors, there are some lovely. pubs, bars, coffee and juice bars, restaurants, parks and so forth you can meet in. You will have your own private room and access to a shared bathroom and living spaces if you need them, please respect our home.  thank you for taking the time to read

name: Spacious London garden apartment
summary: Modern two bedroom, extremely spacious (950 square feet /88m sq.) Muswell Hill apartment with garden. Family friendly. Ideally located street: quiet but close to the Underground (Highgate) as well as the shops and restaurants of Muswell Hill.
space: About the house: Our home is spacious, clean and modern. It is our home first and foremost - we do not rent this property unless we are away for a period of time so don't be put off by the lack of reviews - we only make it available occasionally!  There is a king size bed in the master bedroom, with Siberian goose down duvet and Hungarian goose down pillows, a 40' flatscreen smart TV (with Netflix and Amazon) and ample wardrobe space.  In the second bedroom there is a single bed, but it's a very large room so for those who require extra beds / travelling with kids we have a double air mattress we can inflate and make up for you. (With the single bed and the double air mattress you could sleep 3 children) There are also plenty of children's toys and books. Please contact me if you have other requirements.  The living room / dining room is open plan with a kitchen half a floor up. The dining table seats 6 or 8 when extended. There is a 43' flatscreen smart TV, a library of 500+ DVDs and

neighborhood_overview: About the area: Muswell Hill is a highly sought after area known for its intellectual, artistic, musical and literary associations. The area has retained most of its village atmosphere and charm; it is a lovely area packed with trendy wine bars, great pubs and a good selection of yummy restaurants. There is also a large Marks & Spencer Food hall, Planet Organic, Sainsbury's and Waitrose supermarkets, Bill's restaurant, Bob's cafe (both excellent for families with children), Carluccio's, Pizza Express, the award winning Toffs fish and chip shop, as well as a plethora of boutique fashion outlets and coffee shops and an Everyman arthouse Cinema, all within 10 mins walk.  We live on a quiet, friendly street with free parking. Our neighbours are especially friendly - one of the many reasons why we love our home!  We are also just a 15-20 minute walk from Crouch End and Highgate village, both lovely village-y areas with fabulous restaurants, bars and coffee shops.  Muswell Hill has just been
notes: The property is our permanent home so not every cupboard / wardrobe will be available to use. However please rest assured you will have ample storage space for your needs.
transit: The apartment is perfectly situated for easy access to: - the shops and restaurants of Muswell Hill (10 mins walk) - historic and beautiful Highgate Wood / Queens Wood  - Highgate tube on the Northern Line of the London Underground. (7-10 mins walk). The Northern line takes you directly into the centre of London. It's about 18-20mins by tube into Tottenham Court Road / Leicester Square. Alternatively, you can catch a 134 bus into town - the bus stop is a 2/3 minute walk from our home and takes you into Tottenham Court Road. The 43 bus runs to London Bridge via Angel Islington, you can catch it from the same bus stop.
access: The garden is shared with our lovely upstairs neighbour. He lives alone and in reality he very rarely uses it - you would almost certainly have it to yourselves. The friendliness of our neighbours (and in fact the neighbourhood as a whole) is one of the reasons we love our home. We are very lucky to have such fabulous neighbours and you can certainly rely on them to make sure you have everything you need, or if you need some more recommendations for things to do / restaurants etc.
house_rules: We only ask that you treat our home with the love and respect that you'd treat your own.

summary: For rent is a beautiful, contemporary one bedroom apartment in the heart of trendy Dalston, within walking distance of Shoreditch.
space: -The bedroom opens to a winter garden balcony. -The apartment features a fully fitted kitchen, washing machine with dryer, dishwasher, and a spacious and bright living room that opens to a large winter garden balcony. -A spacious bathroom with bathtub and shower is across the hall from the bedroom. -Unlimited fibre optic broadband Wi-Fi. -43" 4K TV with Netflix, Amazon Prime and Freeview
description: For rent is a beautiful, contemporary one bedroom apartment in the heart of trendy Dalston, within walking distance of Shoreditch. -The bedroom opens to a winter garden balcony. -The apartment features a fully fitted kitchen, washing machine with dryer, dishwasher, and a spacious and bright living room that opens to a large winter garden balcony. -A spacious bathroom with bathtub and shower is across the hall from the bedroom. -Unlimited fibre optic broadband Wi-Fi. -43" 4K TV with Netflix, Amazon Prime and Freeview The building complex includes a free gym for residents and huge communal deck and stunning roof-top terrace with a view over the city, perfect for summer evenings. -Located at Kingsland Road/Dalston Lane, 100m from the Dalston Junction Overground station, close to Kingsland Shopping Center, Cooperative, full-size Sainsbury's, three Tesco Expresses, several organic groceries, Argos, two Post Offices, new Dalston library and Hackney archives, dry cleaners, GP, Rio Cinema, clu

All of the above within a five-minute walk. -Dalston Junction is located at the center of Islington, Stoke Newington, London Fields and Shoreditch.
notes: For rent is the spare bedroom and bathroom within a two-bedroom/two-bathroom flat which I rent when I am away, effectively making it a private one-bedroom rental; I won't always be traveling, though, so please inquire specifically.
transit: The flat is perfectly situated with access towards every direction in the city. Dalston Junction Overground station is a one-minute walk from the flat and Dalston Kingland Overground station is a three-minute walk. Buses to Victoria, Piccadilly Circus, Tottenham Court Road, Hackney, Canary Wharf, Wood Green, Seven Sisters, Shoreditch, Liverpool Street, London Bridge, Waterloo, Old Street, Kings Cross St. Pancras, Angel/Islington. Liverpool Street is less than 15 minutes away.
access: The building complex includes a free gym for residents and huge communal deck and stunning roof-top terrace with a view over the city, perfect for summer evenings.
house_rules: Please refrain from wearing shoes or smoking inside the apartment. Please do not bring anyone not on the reservation to the apartment. If you would like to bring a visitor, please let us know beforehand. No partying or late night noise.

name: Quiet double room, with friendly, experienced host
summary: A double room in a stylish and quiet flat, my place isn't in tourist London, so you can live like a real Londoner for your days here! But it isn't far to the centre with public transport. There's a full description below, but don't take my word for it, check out the 130+ positive reviews!
space: Hi there! My place is a two bedroomed architect-designed apartment, in a lovely street of little houses. A double room is available, for a maximum of two people. You will share the apartment with me, Matthew. Like London, the place is modern on the inside but old on the outside!
description: A double room in a stylish and quiet flat, my place isn't in tourist London, so you can live like a real Londoner for your days here! But it isn't far to the centre with public transport. There's a full description below, but don't take my word for it, check out the 130+ positive reviews! Hi there! My place is a two bedroomed architect-designed apartment, in a lovely street of little houses. A double room is available, for a maximum of two people. You will share the apartment with me, Matthew. Like London, the place is modern on the inside but old on the outside! WHAT IS YOURS: Your room has a double bed (140cm wide), with lots of storage and a desk. The bed is made up with linen, and towels are provided, and there is a hairdryer and a European socket adaptor WHAT IS SHARED: You share with me the open plan living room with high, roof-lit ceiling, and a piano if you want to play! Please feel free to use the kitchen area, with oven, dishwasher, microwave, and all utensils, and dining tab
neighborhood_overview: WHERE: The apartment is in Southwark, south of the Thames. To be clear, this location is 16 mins walk from the Underground at Elephant and Castle, is not in tourist London and not right next to nightlife and shops. If you want to roll out of bed right in the middle of town next to an underground station, then this is not the place for you. The area is a residential area just south of the centre of London. So if you need somewhere comfortable, clean, sunny, and quiet, that is easy to get into town from, in an interesting multicultural area where real people actually live, then this apartment is great! Central London is pretty big. Yet thanks to the bend in the river Thames, the flat is equidistant to most places of interest - Westminster, Soho, the West End, Covent Garden, and the City of London are a short bus journey away.  The area isn't London's most glamorous, but it is convenient.  Local facilities are great for buying provisions. Not only are good British supermarkets under five
notes: Check in is flexible, but you do need to provide arrival details in advance. Check out is usually best before 11 am, though you are very welcome to leave your luggage here on the day of departure, to pick up in the evening. Please read the listing carefully before booking, or requesting a booking,  reservations will be accepted on the basis you have done so. The room is for one or two people, there is no space for a third person, and the flat is not suitable for a baby or small child. This is a private house, not a hostel or commercial property. If you prefer that kind of service, please book elsewhere.  All the information guests usually require is hopefully stated here, so please double check your questions before asking, or committing to book. Should you then not see the answer to your question, then ask!
transit: BUS The buses from the Walworth Road, which is five minutes walk away, are frequent and the best way get here. It takes as little as 20 minutes to all of central London, with 11 routes during the day, and 7 routes all night TUBE The nearest tube station is Elephant and Castle (in zone 1) is 16 minutes walk away, and is on two lines, Bakerloo and Northern.  Kennington tube is also within 15-20 mins walk. BIKE The nearest London cycle hire scheme (only £2 for 24hours access) is a few mins walk away TRAIN Elephant and Castle has Thameslink trains, direct to all central London stops, plus further north and south.  AIRPORTS The great thing about this location is all six London airports (Heathrow, Gatwick, Luton, Stansted, City and Southend) take around the same time to get to from the place, around 1 hour or so, though that varies with the time of day. CAR If you have a car, there is street parking right outside the door. It is free in the evenings and all weekend, outside these times it is
access: WHAT IS YOURS: Your room has a double bed (140cm wide), with lots of storage and a desk. The bed is made up with linen, and towels are provided, and there is a hairdryer and a European socket adaptor WHAT IS SHARED: You share with me the open plan living room with high, roof-lit ceiling, and a piano if you want to play! Please feel free to use the kitchen area, with oven, dishwasher, microwave, and all utensils, and dining table Bathroom with shower, bath and washing machine. South facing balcony overlooking private gardens, great for breakfast or lunch in good weather. The place has wi-fi
house_rules: My house is your house, and my guests tend to want to keep it tidy, as I do. There are no time rules, and I give you the keys and you are free to come and go as you like.  I do have one particular rule though. If you are a smoker. If you could make sure you don't smoke inside, that would be greatly appreciated!

name: West London,loft ensuite, 5min2tube
summary: Large, light and spacious loft bedroom with a newly decorated ensuite shower room and only 5 minutes to the tube in Hammersmith.
space: We are providing a large double bedroom and will suit either a couple or small family travelling together.   This is for a bedroom in our 4 bedroom house that we currently live in. Our aim is to make your stay in London as comfortable and as pleasant as possible and that you take away wonderful memories of your stay and visit with us!  We hope to be able to point you to the best foodies places, the unique markets and even the gems in the touristy spots.   If you are not here to sight-see but are looking for a temporary home whilst you set yourselves up in this lovely city we now call home, we hope to be able to point you to all the various neighbourhoods in London (as between us, I think we've lived pretty much all of London!) and provide you with as much guidance and assistance as you wish. The room is of good size and there is a newly built ensuite shower room within the bedroom (ensuite).  Ther is also plenty of storage in the room. The room has an abundance of natural light is simp

We are providing a large double bedroom and will suit either a couple or small family travelling together.   This is for a bedroom in our 4 bedroom house that we currently live in. The room is of good size and there is a newly built ensuite shower r
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is extremely convenient for someone like me who doesn't drive as I am never more than one hour away from anywhere in London that matters to anyone due to the amazing transport links we have available. The river is a mere 5 minutes away and that provides for a very relaxing riverside walk especially during the long summer months and there is also a children's playground just across the road.   My favourite green space is Bishop's Palace and Bishop's Park which is a 15/20 minute walk away and that almost does not feel like you are in Central London. There are also numerous cheap eats and independent cafes not more than 5 minutes walk away - so extremely convenient for grabbing a quick bite.  For something very special the River Cafe is just a skip and hop away.
notes: If anything needs clarification please do ask and be in touch!
transit: We hope the unique position of our home will allow you to explore London to it's fullest without having to fork out a premium for staying right in Central London as we are just a 5 minute walk to either Hammersmith or Barons Court station (Zone 2, Piccadilly, District, Circle and Hammersmith and City line) - perfect for sightseeing in the capital. 5 minutes walk to Queens Tennis club 10 mins tube to Harrods, V&A and the Natural History Museum 10 mins tube to the world renowned Kew Gardens (for the garden buffs) 10 mins tube to Portobello Market/Notting Hill 15 mins bus ride to Westfield Shopping Centre 15 mins tube to Green Park/Mayfair/Picadilly Circus 20 mins tube to the British Museum/Trafalgar Square/National Gallery 35 mins tube to Tower of London/Tower Bridge 40 mins direct tube to Heathrow Airport
access: Guests have access to their bedroom, the ensuite shower room and downstairs WC and can use the kitchen to make a hot drink or the microwave to warm up some ready meals but not use the kitchen for any cooking of any sort. We also provide the use of our laundry room for longer stay guests (please ask before using!)
house_rules: 1) No smoking anywhere in the house please!  2) And pets are not welcomed. 3) No shoes in the bedrooms - we ask that you leave your shoes in the hallway. 4) Our kitchen is very precious to us; so please use with love and care. 5) No drunks and late night loud music please - we enjoy the peace and quiet of our neighbourhood alot and we hope you do too. 6) Please note check in and check out times in the listing.   Check-in: after 6:30pm on a weekday and weekends are more flexible Check-out: by 9am at the very latest on a weekday and weekends we are more flexible. 7) Keys and deposit - the £300 security deposit held on your credit card is to cover the lost/no-return of keys.  The reason why it's such a high amount is that it includes the cost of changing the locks - which for our security sake, will be done if keys have been lost or have not been returned to us (even if returned at a later date). Generally, please treat my home as how you would like your home to be treated when you have g

name: Charming Garden Apartment | London
summary: We are Zone2 in S.E London. The house is of victorian architecture on one of Telegraph hills leafy green streets Fantastic panoramic views over the city, beautiful parks, cafes, traditional pubs Excellent transport to Gatwick airport & London sights
space: Stay at Telegraph Hill This cottage like apartment incorporates a double bedroom that catches the morning sun with a door leading onto the patio and garden. The shower room which is off the bedroom is supplied with 100% Egyptian cotton towels. The bed linen is 400 thread count Egyptian cotton. An internal door leads to living room with a sofa bed and armchair. The sofa bed opens out into a Queen size bed. The open plan kitchen/dinner is fully fitted with fridge, washing machine and oven appliances plus cooking utensils and cutlery. Rate: £110 per night plus £15 extra charge for sofa bed occupants. Baby Cot available at no extra charge. Can sleep 3 adults or a family of 4 comfortably. Telegraph Hill is a leafy green conservation area in New Cross Gate, sth east London. Home to the Internationally renowned Goldsmiths University of London. The area has beautiful landscaped parks with tenis courts and community cafes. New Cross Gate is vibrant, urban and with great transport connections to

neighborhood_overview: Telegraph hill is a conservation area. Protecting victorian architecture and landscaping. The hill offers fantastic panoramic views over the city and has a beautiful park with tennis courts and children's playgrounds. There are local cafes, churches, theatres and old fashioned pubs serving traditional British sunday roasts.
notes: Guests who have stayed in the apartment have said its like having the best of both worlds. "A little bit of country in the city". "A great relaxing home to come back to after the business of the centre"
transit: The area is a transport hotspot, with buses, tube and trains to every corner of London including London Bridge in 7mins. And a direct train to Gatwick airport every hour or change at East Croydon. New Cross Gate Station is on the new and very convenient Overground line tube, south bound.  It is 1 stop away from mainline London Bridge. It has a direct train to Gatwick once an hour and a more regular train which stops once at East Croydon station. There are nearly 10 buses which will link directly to  all quarters and central London.  The bus 343 stops outside the house.

name: A double Room 5mins from King's College Hospital
summary: Calm sunny double room with a queen size bed and a soft mattress in a quiet Zone 2 period flatshare in Loughborough Junction between Denmark Hill and Brixton. A short walk to excellent transport links with easy access to the centre of London, West End & City. A vast range of bars restaurants and local amenities walking distance in nearby Camberwell and Brixton. Modern shared kitchen and bathroom. No idea why Airbnb say it is in Stockwell. Nothing against Stockwell but it's not in Stockwell.
space: Sunny, furnished room with double bed in a shared apartment on a quiet street in Camberwell. It is a 4 bedroom apartment and there are usually 2 girls and 2 boys staying, sometimes Trevor is at home and sometimes he is away, in which case Elsa the housekeeper or Emi the neighbour may let you in. The shared kitchen is also a communal space where you can prepare and eat your food or work at the table. The most important thing is the calm and peaceful atmosphere of the house.  You are welcome to come home late at night but please be mindful of others who may have to get up early in the morning for work! 2 minutes walk to 24 hour buses and a 3 min walk to Loughborough Junction train station which is a 10 min ride to Blackfriars and the South Bank. 15 mins walk to Brixton tube station which is 12 mins on Victoria Line to Oxford Circus, Centre of London.  We are close to some of London's exciting attractions, including a 15 minute walk to the popular new Brixton Markets. The South Bank is 8

notes: In some circumstances, it may be possible for our guests to invite a friend back to stay overnight in their room however it is important to book this via Airbnb or arrange this with myself in advance.

access: Wifi.
house_rules: This is a quiet flat in a calm house on a tranquil street, so we invite our guests to support this relaxed and gentle atmosphere. Please use headphones when using phones and laptops. Leave each room as you would like to find it.  Please clean up immediately after you cook! The bathroom is easy to clean and leave ready for the next person too! If you make a booking for one person then no other guests regardless of their relation to you will be permitted to stay in the room without amending the booking. The house is old - built in 1859 - so we ask our visitors to tread softly so as not to disturb our neighbours or other guests. The wall are very thin so we invite you to use headphones when using your laptop to watch or listen to content and to talk quietly when talking to others. If you plan on arriving at the house after 11pm please check in advance that is is possible as sometimes I am away and I have to rely on other people to check guests in.

name: Charming Flat in Notting Hill
summary: A stylish apartment close to Portobello market with excellent Wi-Fi connection and easy access to travel options.
space: The flat is on the first floor of a beautiful old house with high ceilings and big windows. It is located only a few hundred metres from Ladbroke Grove tube station, and is a good size for two. You'll also have the place to yourselves as I'll only be letting when I'm away.  The decor is simple and stylish.  The kitchen is compact but well equipped for a short stay with cooker, microwave, fridge, freezer, etc. There isn't a washing machine but there is a laundrette just across the road.  There is now a new electrical shower fitted in the bathroom. There's no TV but you can use the WiFi. The house is on a bus route - which is very convenient but can be a little noisy at night.  There's one double bed, with an air bed and spare duvet in the cupboard.

neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill has many cafes, bars and restaurants and, of course, the market - which mainly happens on a Saturday, but there's a reduced antiques/clothing market on fridays/sundays and a fruit and vegetable market most days. There's two supermarkets within 100 metres (open 7am-11pm).
notes: I would appreciate it if you would message me before making a reservation with the dates you are interested in and your arrival and departure times (so that I can be certain I would be available to check you in and out again). I would also appreciate it if you you add a short description and photo to your profile (if you haven't already) before messaging: this is my home and I like to know a little about guests who may be staying in it. Please also let me know who any additional guests would be and I promise to get back to you quickly so that, if all is well, we can get the reservation confirmed swiftly.
transit: We're well-appointed for transport with many bus routes (which run throughout the night) and the tube just 100 metres away - it can take you into London's glittering West End in 30-45 minutes (depending on time of day).

name: Feel at Home in a Charming, Bright, Central Apartment in Notting Hill
summary: Unwind in a living room featuring high ceilings and loads of light. This modern comfortable space set in a Victorian house offers a big living room, a quiet bedroom overlooking the back garden, and a fully equipped kitchen.
space: This lovely, spacious and bright apartment is available in the desirable neighborhood of Notting Hill. The apartment is on the ground floor of a Victorian building and has a cozy living room with a separate fully equipped kitchen. The apartment has period features, high ceilings, wooden floors and bay windows and gets loads of light both in the front and in the back. The kitchen comes with a dishwasher, an oven, a washing machine, pots pans, a Nespresso machine, a microwave, and a minipimer handblender.  The bedroom comes with a comfortable bed and loads of storage. It is a perfect place to relax as it is very quiet and it faces the back garden. Double bed. There is free super fast and unlimited wi-fi (fiber optic broadband). The neighborhood offers plenty of entertainment with loads of great bars and delicious restaurants at walking distance.  It is only five minutes walk to Portobello Road, which regularly holds the world famous market that takes place there.  The market sells everyt
description: Unwind in a living room featuring high ceilings and loads of light. This modern comfortable space set in a Victorian house offers a big living room, a quiet bedroom overlooking the back garden, and a fully equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is set in a small building in a residential area with access to nearby public transit, restaurants, pubs, and grocery stores. Explore the neighbourhood's shops, restaurants and cafes around the corner.
notes: The flat is very quiet, especially the bedroom which faces a private garden. However the house is early 1900 so not well soundproofed. Please be respectful when watching films or listening to music as the noise can travel. The neighbors will do the same.
transit: Closest tube is Westbourne Park on the Circle Line -  4/5 minutes walking distance to the flat - while Notting Hill Gate is about 12 minutes away. Westbourne Park is on the same tube line as Paddington and King's Cross so getting to the Eurostar, Heathrow Express and Soho/Oxford Street is very easy. Loads of buses stop nearby 31 (Camden, Primrose Hill), 328, 52 (Royal Albert Hall), 70 (Kensington, V&A Museum), 23 (Piccadilly, Aldwych). Number 7 bus stops a few meters from the the flat and goes to Paddington, Oxford Street and the British Museum.
access: Everything!
house_rules: Please keep in mind that the building and the flat are non-smoking. Parties and pets are not allowed. Please remove shoes when in the apartment, this minimises noise for the neighbours.  Please double lock both locks when leaving the apartment and close all windows.  Please don't leave the keys in the door lock either inside or outside the door, even if you are in the flat.  Please use Calgon if you use the washing machine. Please avoid eating on the sofa and the two green chairs and putting feet up on them. Thanks ever so much and enjoy your stay!

There is even a private garden, in case you smoke (no smoking indoor).   Bermondsey Street, Borough Market, London Bridge, Tower Bridge are all within 15 minutes walking distance! PETS FRIENDLY

neighborhood_overview: Walworth is a central district in the London Borough of Southwark. This area is in the process of serious regeneration and gentrification.  The Artworks Elephant near Elephant & Castle station, is a trendy box park made of second-hand shipping containers - there are bars, cafés and restaurants on the ground floor, including tiny French eateries. It additionally functions as a creative hub with two floors of studios and a temporary council library. Classic and newer release films are currently being shown by Backyard Cinema at Mercato Metropolitano, a huge indoor food venue and Italian supermarket in Newington Causeway.  Bermondsey Street and its trendy bars are 5 mins away. Borough Market and its food stalls is 15 mins away, by walk.  The local council swimming pool and gym is at The Castle Centre in Elephant & Castle. The East Street Market off Walworth Road, known locally as "The Lane", is a busy general market selling everything from clothing to jewellery, household goods, fruit and
notes: Ground floor flat with private garden, pet and children friendly.   Very quiet area, cul the sac road, a park very near to walk your dog!
transit: Elephant & Castle is on the Northern and Bakerloo Underground lines, with services to the West End and the City. Thameslink trains run to Blackfriars, Farringdon and St Pancras. Many useful commuter bus services run along Walworth Road. The No 12 goes to Oxford Circus; the No 35 to Shoreditch via Liverpool Street; the No 40 to Aldgate; the No 45 to King’s Cross via Blackfriars and Holborn; the No 68 to Euston via Waterloo; the No 148 to White City, handy for Westfield, via Victoria and Marble Arch; the No 171 to Holborn via Waterloo, and the No 176 to Tottenham Court Road via Waterloo and Leicester Square.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
house_rules: Please treat the home as you would your own. Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. No parties. If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.

name: A Double Room with  River Views
space: The Appartment is on the Upper  Floor of a Modernised and Secure Building near  Canary Wharf, with fantastic views of the River Thames and London .  I am offering a Home from Home Experience , with a light Breafast with Fresh Juice and  Tea's and Coffee's during the day . Double Room with Plenty of Storage , Fresh Towels and Bed Linen . There is a Shared Bathroom with Step in Shower  , HairDryer and Essentials . Wifi service .  The Appartment is 10/15 Minutes Walk to Nearest DLR (South Quay)and London Underground (Canary Wharf)  Network into Central London and right next to a Bus Stop . Close to Both Asda and Tesco Supermarkets Chains , and plenty of local shops and Restaurants .  Walking Distance to a City Farm ,Greenwich  Foot Tunnel and Fabulous walkways  along River front .  There is also a 24 Hour Medical Center very close to appartment ,  Any More Questions Please let me know .

space: The bedroom is bright and spacious, with wonderful westerly view, overlooking gardens in a two-bedroom apartment in Kensington. name: Charming central 2 bedroom flat
summary: A wonderful first floor apartment with private terrace in the middle of London, just by Marble Arch and Baker street. It is well connected to airports and situated in the heart of Marylebone, a lovely vibrant neighbourhood in the heart of the city.
space: We are renting a lovely double bedroom in our flat, which is located in the heart of Marylebone - the hottest new area in central London.  It is a wonderful first floor apartment in the middle of London, just by Marble Arch and 3 minutes walk from Baker street. It is extremely central, only 10 min walk to Regents Park, Oxford Street, Hyde Park and is very well connected to airports (heathrow / stansted express) and the tube (5 tube lines within walking distance). The flat consists of an open plan kitchen, living / dining room, a lovely quiet big terrace with lots of nice flowers, two bedrooms (one double bedroom, one single bedroom) and bathroom. The flat is decorated with mixture of antique and modern furniture and has original art on the walls. Linen and towels are provided. The flat also provides an HD TV, DVD player and a selection of books and board games.  There is a washing machine and Wifi. Ideal for a relaxed  and central stay in London. Rent includes all bills. Get in touch i

name: Large Bedroom with EnSuite Bathroom
summary: inside flat is one staircase to go downstairs to basement, where private room and EnSuite Bathroom is located
space: Sutherland Avenue (Maida Vale) is just a few minutes walking distance from the beautiful Little Venice,  where you can take a  lovely boat trip from the Regent Canal to Camden Town to visit its famous market. The property is also just a 20 minute walk away from Notting hill which is home to the famous Portobello market. There is something for everyone here as there are a several different market days; antiques, traditional vegetable stalls, vintage clothing etc.. Sutherland Avenue is a very wide tree-lined Victorian Avenue just a few minutes away from the  Warwick Avenue tube (bakerloo line) & bus station,  which will directly connect you to Oxford Street or Knightsbridge,  plus there are lots little restaurants and old english pubs (Prince Alfred and The Warrington) which are all within walking distance.  The house also has a wonderful private communal garden which you free to use, this is a great  place to relax in on a  beautiful sunny day.

name: 1 bedroom in Vibrant Notting Hill
space: Hello I'm Eric hope your time in London will be a pleasant one, my apartment is a stunning, recently refurbished one bedroomed flat located on the second floor of a period conversion, boasting a contemporary decor with wood floors and stylish fittings.  The property comprises superb reception room with great open-plan kitchen, bedroom and bathroom with stone tiled finish.  The apartment is on Cambridge Gardens in Kensington and Chelsea and is located moments from Portobello Road Market and in the Notting Hill neighbourhood with its vibrant market and trendy surrounding restaurants, shops and bars.  It is a short walk to Hyde Park, and the nearest tube is Ladbroke Grove, 2 minutes walk away from the apartment on the Hammersmith & city line, the line connects through all parts of central London. The kitchen is well equipped with a microwave, fridge, oven, washing machine, toaster, sandwich maker, kettle, blender … Also all utensils and cups, plates, pots and pans, etc But I'm guessing you will not be cooking much with amazing restaurants and street markets surrounding you and tempting you with delicious and inventive food offers.  You have a Tesco supermarket very close and a Sainburys one and Co-op very close, all open until 23.00 every night. And a lot of smaller shops, some open 24 hours. neighborhood_overview: SHOREDITCH/HOXTON/THE CITY AREA Flat is in Shoreditch, zone 1, Central London. It is between East London and City of London so it has the best of both worlds. City of London is where London started so it’s the oldest part of London, the original London. Nowadays also quite formal and business like. The East End is the complete opposite, a young, very vibrant and interesting area, full of galleries, street markets, pubs, restaurant and clubs. You will not be bored! The flat is in a quiet street so you can sleep peacefully but all the fun is a few seconds away once you feel up for it. There are also food stores, a 24 hour shop and fast food places just around the corner.  Shoreditch and East London is also famous for thousands of new start-ups in the last five years. Old street roundabout is now "Tech City" and people refer to it also as "Silicon Roundabout".  The apartment is also very close to Moorfields Eye Hospital. PLACES OF INTEREST 2 minutes to Hoxton street market  Food stalls, b
notes: Check in from 3pm Check out is by 11am at the latest.

access: You will have the whole apartment to yourself. You'll also have access to a fully furnished kitchen.  There is also a balcony and private parking. There are also maps, brochures and guide books on London and UK.

name: Lovely 1 bed Apartment Islington on Tube Stop
summary: Located in Islington Studios this apartment is a 1 minute walk to Holloway Road Tube Station (Piccadilly Line), Arsenal Stadium & London Met Uni. Incredible access to transport. Close to Kings Cross, Angel, Old Street, Dalston. While Soho and Central London are just 15 minutes by tube, you may not find a reason to leave- the flat is surrounded by cafes, restaurants, pubs, and food shops a plenty in case you feel like dining in. There's also a concierge, private communal garden & a balcony.
space: A beautifully appointment apartment is super light, spacious, comfortable, and even has a balcony. There's a big kitchen, really light lounge with large windows, a new bed, new smart TV and new sofa bed. Bathroom has both a bath and shower. There's a private communal garden, a free gym, plus many amazing foodie places nearby. Great for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and small families.

It's accessed by a private entrance through a security / concierge d
neighborhood_overview: Yes Arsenal Football Stadium is a stones throw away, but there's so much more too! The area is becoming a real foodie haven with the opening of great cafes, dirty burger, the chicken shop, italian pizzeria where there's always a queue, coffee roasters, a fabulous wine and cheese shop, delicious vietnamese, famous chinese, bakeries, plus there's always the long standing a great local pubs.  If it's shopping you're after, you're in luck! If the enormous amount of shops along Upper Street doesn't work for you, jump on the overland train to Westfield, or bus to Camden, or tube to Oxford Street! There's a classic old cinema 10 minutes walk to Holloway, or walk towards Angel for the more snazzy  Screen on the Green cinema (with sofas and a bar in the cinema!)
transit: It's incredibly easy to explore anywhere in London from this apartment.  The apartment is 1 minute walk from Holloway Road Tube which is on the dark blue Piccadilly Line. It's 10 minute walk to Highbury and Islington Station, which is on the light blue Victoria Line and orange Overland line.  There are loads of great public transport options on your door step with many buses - head to Angel, Hackney, Camden, Shoreditch, Hampsted Heath in 30 mins.
access: The entire apartment is yours. It's accessed by a private entrance through a security / concierge desk, which takes you through to a shared garden (the garden a quiet haven away from the street).
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties. - If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £40 fee will apply.

space: Quiet and sunny double bedroom (with down pillows and duvet) and own bathroom, high speed wi-fi. Beautifully decorated apartment and lovely sun-trap terrace. Safe neighbourhood, next to gorgeous Battersea Park a short walk or bus ride to centre of Chelsea and the Kings Road.  Wonderful local cafes, bars, delicatessen and shops including The Bluebird Café (Kings Road)  , Daylesford Farmshop and Cafe and the Farmers Markets on Pimlico Road and Duke of Yorks Square. Nearby places of interest include The Saatchi Gallery, The Royal Court Theatre, The Chelsea Physic Garden, riverside architecture by Richard Rogers and Norman Foster, the pretty cottages and secret streets of Old Chelsea and the grand white stucco houses of Belgravia. Gym, sports club and tennis courts within 10 minutes walk. There are plenty of towels and we provide all those little extras you need for a comfortable stay!The style is very retro with 1960/70 original decorations.  Very spacious with a homely and trendy feel.  The location is suberb and has easy access to all transport links. This spacious flat promises to give you a relaxed and stylish break with all the home comforts needed. Sheets and Towels included. Close to  Imperial Wharf Station. The kitchen is equipped with fridge, freezer, microwave, oven, washing machine. The Sitting room has Flat screen TV, Bose speaker with ipod player, Pure DAB Radio, Free Wireless Internet throughout the flat. DVD and Wii Player and Wii fit. Bedroom One King Sized Bed with memory foam bed mattresses.  Bedroom Two Has a Double Sized bed with memory foa
neighborhood_overview: Riverside flat with a stunning marina 2 minute walk away.  Children's soft play centre Gambados 1 minute away. Train station round the corner. Great riverside walk and restaurants. Jazz bar 606 club 5 mins away.  Train to Westfield Shepherd Bush 8mins away!! This location is amazing.
transit: Overground train station 2minute walk from flat. Overground connects one stop to West Brompton - district line. Or three stops to Shepherds Bush - central line. There is a water taxi by the river 2 minute walk away. Bus stop outside goes to Earls court.
access: Entire flat 2 bedroom
house_rules: No Smoking No pets

name: Quiet Double Room - Good for walks
summary: Bed & Breakfast - Quiet double room in comfortable modern house overlooking the Ham Meadow Lands, close to the River Thames, Richmond Park and Richmond Town Centre as well as Kew Gardens and Hampton Court Palace.  30mins from Heathrow and central London by train from Richmond station.  Easy free parking.  Several pubs  and restaurants for every taste can be found near by in Richmond, Teddington and Kingston-upon-Thames.
space: Bed & Breakfast - Quiet double room in comfortable modern house overlooking the Ham Meadow Lands, close to the River Thames, Richmond Park and Richmond Town Centre as well as Kew Gardens, Ham House and the historic Hampton Court Palace and gardens.  30mins from Heathrow and central London by train from Richmond station.  Easy free parking.  Several pubs good for food and restaurants for every taste can be found near by in Richmond and Kingston-upon-Thames for lunch and dinner. 15 mins. drive from Hampton Court and Kew Gardens , there are also buses to take you there 20mins drive from Twickenham - the home of English Rugby 20mins drive from Wimbledon - the home of English Tennis Richmond has 4 cinemas and the popular Theatre Royal, Kingston also has several cinemas and the Shakespearean Rose Theatre. River trips can be taken from both Richmond and Kingston. 2019 GREAT RIVER RACE    14th September

neighborhood_overview: Ham Meadow Lands are just behind the house and the Thames is within a 5 minute walk. Richmond Park is a 5 minute drive and is a Royal park and International Conservation Area, it is the largest park in London and home to over 600 red and fallow deer which roam freely through out the park.
notes: TWICKENHAM STADIUM  - Guests have stayed with me who were attending sporting and musical events at Twickenham Stadium. It takes about 50 mins to walk there but the easiest route is to cross Teddington Lock (5mins from my house) then take a bus to the stadium.
transit: The nearest station is Richmond for both underground and over-ground trains. There are taxis at the station and the 371 bus comes to within a 3 minute walk of the house. The 65 bus will take you a 8 minute walk. Tedding station is in walking distance just across Teddington Lock
house_rules: Please remove your shoes when in the house - slippers are provided. There is no smoking . The room is not suitable for children or pets.  If you are coming back after 11pm, please come in quietly.  Breakfast IS included, but there is no use of kitchen; please do not keep food in your room  All other information is supplied in the room. Thank you.

name: ARCHITECT'S FLATLET ISLINGTON
summary: Architect designed private, self contained flatlet, close to many great local restaurants and bars.  Private shower ensuite, kitchen large bedroom and dedicated entrance off the front light well onto the street.
space: Highly convenient, centrally located and newly refurbished, (Modern fixtures and fittings) private studio flatlet in a Victorian terrace house, in Islington, its own street entrance, en suite shower and private kitchenette. Buses right on your doorstep, and 7 mins from Canonbury Station on the tube network. We have created a fully self contained studio flatlet in the lower ground/basement floor in a locally listed Victorian terrace, virtually on Newington Green. As Architects we have paid attention to the detail, and provide clean, modern spaces. The flatlet is in excellent condition, having been newly refurbished. The room overlooks a small lightwell onto the street which is accessed via a cast iron metal winding staircase. You have your own access from the street, and own private outside entrance area. name: Modern+own bath near Tate/Southbank
space: I only advertise my flat through Airbnb.com and no other websites. Lovely new flat in a fantastic location. I have a large spare bedroom with its own luxury bathroom available to rent. I also live in the flat however I have my own bathroom. The flat is large and bright with a huge terrace with views of the London eye. Your room is a good size  with plenty of wardrobe space, it's own TV with built in DVD and there is wifi. The location is just a few minutes walk from the Tate Modern, the river Thames and the Globe theatre. This Southbank area of London is very trendy with many cafes and restaurants. The pedestrian bridge across the Thames is right opposite the Tate modern and from here you can walk across to St Paul's cathedral. The wonderful Borough Market and Southwark cathedral are just a few minutes away. The Tower of London and Tower bridge and all the restaurants of Shad Thames about a 10 minute walk. For transportation the Jubilee, Northern and Bakerloo lines are all within a few

house_rules: As this is my home I expect that whomever wishes to stay here, will be respectful of that and will treat the apartment, the items contained inside as well as the neighbours with respect and curtesy. I only rent my room to single travellers, however if you have a long stay and wish for friends or relatives to visit for a weekend during your stay this can be agreed upon in advance.

name: Amazing King's Cross 1BD-sleeps4!
summary: Quiet and bright. Beautiful apartment; 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom shower/bath, living room with sofabed and good-sized kitchen. Located in the heart of Bloomsbury! Just a short walk away from Euston and King's Cross stations.
space: Beautiful red brick Victorian mansion block, top floor apartment, in Central London. The bright bedroom has a double bed. Lovely Regent’s Park is also in the area.

name: Beautiful Modern Bright Spacious 1-Bed Apartment
summary: My stunning stylish one-bedroom second-floor flat is large, modern, beautifully decorated, bright & spacious with high-ceilings & brand new kitchen & bathroom. A short walk from 2 subways, bus stops & local shops, & only 20 mins into Central London.
space: I own a beautiful, large, spacious and bright second-floor one-bed apartment in Kilburn, Zone 2 Northwest London, just 20 minutes on public transport from Central London. It is available when I am on holiday. Modern and stylishly decorated with a large bright living area, wooden floors, leather sofa, large flat-screen TV plus digital and internet channels, wireless broadband and stereo. Fully equipped modern kitchen and bathroom - microwave, dishwasher, washer-drier, bath and shower. Large bright double bedroom with TV and radio. Located in Zone 2, 7 minutes walk to both Kilburn and Kilburn Park London Underground (tube) stations, 5 minutes from Brondesbury and Kilburn High Road Overground Stations, several buses stop outside and run all day and night. Only 20 minutes travel to Central London. It is a peaceful and quiet apartment with friendly neighbours and close to the bustling community of Kilburn High Road - a minute's walk from the shops, pubs, bars, restaurants, live music / come

Less than ten minutes on the overland to Hampstead Heath.
transit: Just a 7 minute walk to Kilburn and Kilburn Park tube stations, which are on the Jubilee and Bakerloo lines - then a 15 minute journey into Central London. Also a 5 minute walk from Brondesbury and Kilburn High Road overland stations which link directly to East and West London and also 6 minutes directly to Euston. There are bus stops outside the flat with buses running all day and all night in and out of Central London, approx 25 minute journey. Easy access to / from all London airports via public transport.

name: FAB CHISWICK ROOM
summary: A home from home space in west London that serves as a perfect base to explore London and its surroundings.  For practical reasons I cannot take last minute bookings, a spacious double bedroom is available for rental.  Female visitors only as bathroom is shared. Children welcome. Veggie kitchen.
space: Are you looking for somewhere to stay in London?  Welcome to a perfect base to explore London from, a spacious room, in a stylish apartment!  We have a big garden outside and a large double room available for short term visitors. 'Leafy Chiswick', as it is known, is popular and renowned for its vast selection of cafes, bars, restaurants and shops.  These range from Michelin-starred restaurants to local cafes. With excellent transport links for work or sightseeing, the location is just a 5 minute walk from Chiswick High Road.  It really is easy to get around London from here in pretty much any direction.  FACILITIES: Wifi! TV etc. The flat is in a private apartment block with communal gardens, bbq area and cycle parking, as well as an open air heated pool. Good security. All the sheets and towels are dry cleaned and eco products are used for cleaning.  The kitchen is vegetarian.  Transport links: RICHMOND, EARLS COURT, OLYMPIA, KENSINGTON AND NOTTING HILL ARE  ONLY 20 MINS AWAY BY UNDER

name: Light filled 2-bedroom with gardens, London Fields
summary: We welcome you to our beautiful home in the vibrant neighbourhood of Broadway Market and London Fields, Hackney in east London. The place consists of two bedrooms, large open-plan living room and kitchen, and front and back gardens.
space: Please contact me before booking.  Overlooking Regent's Canal, it's a stone's throw from Broadway Market, and London Fields park.  The flat sleeps 4-6, with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, an open plan living room with sofa bed and kitchen with all modern amenities (over 2 floors) and fantastic front and back gardens.  The gardens will be full of beautiful organic produce and flowers during summer and autumn months. There is a patio, with outdoor table and chairs for alfresco dining. There is also a child's wooden playhouse. Upstairs: 1 large bedroom with king size (160cm) bed, built-in cupboards, large windows overlooking the canal.  1 small double bedroom with a bunk bed, and clothes storage. This is our kids room and we will have some kids toys and books available for you to use. A bathroom with shower-bath, and toilet. Downstairs: Lobby for shoes and jackets. Open-plan kitchen-living room with large windows and light throughout Utility room with washing machine, 2nd toilet and basin. Gard
description: We welcome you to our beautiful home in the vibrant neighbourhood of Broadway Market and London Fields, Hackney in east London. The place consists of two bedrooms, large open-plan living room and kitchen, and front and back gardens. Please contact me before booking.  Overlooking Regent's Canal, it's a stone's throw from Broadway Market, and London Fields park.  The flat sleeps 4-6, with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, an open plan living room with sofa bed and kitchen with all modern amenities (over 2 floors) and fantastic front and back gardens.  The gardens will be full of beautiful organic produce and flowers during summer and autumn months. There is a patio, with outdoor table and chairs for alfresco dining. There is also a child's wooden playhouse. Upstairs: 1 large bedroom with king size (160cm) bed, built-in cupboards, large windows overlooking the canal.  1 small double bedroom with a bunk bed, and clothes storage. This is our kids room and we will have some kids toys and books availa
neighborhood_overview: Broadway Market in Hackney is the epicentre of cool in London. Full of boutique shops, cafes and restaurants, there's always something to see and do. Our home is right on the canal which takes you to Victoria Park with its wonderful playgrounds. Even closer is the famous London Fields park with 2 playgrounds. The Saturday market on our doorstep is a foodie's heaven.
transit: There are many buses close by to take you into town in 30-40 minutes. Nearby buses also go to many other destinations in London. Bethnal Green tube station is a 15 minute walk away and connects you to the underground. Haggerston overground station is a 12 minute walk.
access: You will have the whole house to yourself. If you are coming with kids we can leave you lots of toys to play with.
house_rules: We have beautiful front and back gardens, and we ask that you please water them in hot weather. You are welcome to eat produce from the garden when it is ripe and ready.  We ask that you don't smoke inside the house, but you are welcome to smoke in the garden. Please don't wear shoes inside the house. We provide guests with slippers to wear inside. This is our home so, although we will provide you with plenty of storage space in the bedrooms and the kitchen, we will be leaving most of our possessions on view. This may include some of our son's toys, which you are also welcome to use if you are coming with kids. Please be respectful of our neighbours, who are mainly families with kids - so no loud parties please. Also, you will be required to pay for any accidental damages to the objects around the house, so please take care.

name: Bright single room in Chelsea
summary: Bright single bedroom in central London (Zone One) in Chelsea very close to the major sights and only a few minutes walk from Earls Court tube station. The flat is very bright and sunny with great views over the garden square.
space: The single bedroom is in my two-bedroom flat in central London (Zone 1).  The flat is on the third floor – it’s in a 1870s Victorian house, so no lift.  The building is on a garden square between Chelsea and Earls Court just a five-minute walk from Earls Court underground station on the Picadilly and District lines, about 45 minutes direct from Heathrow. You are surrounded by many restaurants, pubs, supermarkets and tourist attractions.  The Victoria & Albert, Natural History and Science museums are about twenty minutes away and Harrods only another ten minutes.  Chelsea football stadium is only a ten-minute walk.
