name: Penthouse Living in East London
summary: Share a sun terrace with my super friendly cat and I in my apartment in Barking town centre.
space: This is a 2008 new build, top floor penthouse with spacious outdoor terrace in East London. It is perfect for socialising, sunbathing or just for peaceful reflection! The interior is spacious and fully furnished with stylish furniture. It is very well located, near to public transport, the town centre, a park and a gym. The room on offer is a fully furnished double bedroom with views of Canary Wharf and has a fitted wardrobe. As the main bedroom has its own en suite bathroom, this bedroom has the main bathroom as pratically an en suite! Your LGBT host is a friendly gay guy, 39 years old and an adorable cat named Arthur so you must be a cat lover The apartment is about a 5 minute walk from the tube and train station (Barking) which allows access to central London in just 18 minutes. Westfield Stratford City shopping centre and the Olympic Park are within easily travelling distance as well. There are shops, gym, parks all within minutes walking distance, we hope you enjoy your stay!

neighborhood_overview: I live in Barking town centre, at one time the capital of England (!) and where Captain Cook got married!  It also had the largest fishing fleet in England and one of the largest monasteries until King Henry burned it down in the 1600s (the church still remains and can be seen from your window).  It's currently undergoing a lot of redevelopment with plans for a nearby film studio, brand new shopping centre and a new station.  There are two gyms within walking distance, a multi screen cinema, three supermarkets and local shops. Historial Barking Abbey. Barking Park Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park Westfield shopping centre the 02 Emirates Air Line Local gay scene in nearby Limehouse features a gay club, pub sauna!
notes: Historial Barking Abbey. Barking Park Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park Westfield shopping centre the 02 Emirates Air Line Local gay scene in nearby Limehouse features a gay club, pub sauna!
transit: Parking is difficult, although for a small daily fee I can arrange parking nearby via a permit.  Short stays are possible behind the building.  Barking is within Zone 4 and the train station is just a five minute walk away.  The station is served by four lines, two tube lines, Hammersmith and City and District and two train lines, Overground and C2C allowing you to get into central London, Zone 1 in just 18 minutes.
access: You can have guests stay over but not for more than two consecutive nights and please let me know in advance. No drugs in the apartment please. Smoking is allowed on the terrace. Other than that normal human being rules apply :-)

name: London Whitechapel Room with WIFI
summary: Close to the best markets of London-Brick Lane, Spitalfields,Colombia Road and neighbours to uber cool Shoreditch,with tube links to West End in 30 mins-you have a prime location in E1 with an incredible history of its own-Jack the Ripper,and more...
space: My partner and I are very easygoing and will make you feel welcome during your stay. We are on the ground floor so you dont have to worry about carrying luggage upstairs. The is a double room - recently renovated, and faces the garden (lots of natural light). We provide linens and towels. We also have an adaptor for your electrical devices (so you can charge your phone, etc!) If there is anything you need to make your stay comfortable, please ask - we always do our best :-) We have fibre WIFI. Parking in the area is free after 5.30pm weekdays and at weekends. Tea/coffee making facilities are provided and you would be welcome to use the kitchen for cooking in. We have a supermarket 3 mins walk away. We can give you fridge space (just ask).  We do have a small garden and living room. We use the living room for work (we both often work from home) however if you do want to eat some meals at home, let us know and you are welcome to use the dining table. We try and be very flexible with bein
description: Close to the best markets of London-Brick Lane, Spitalfields,Colombia Road and neighbours to uber cool Shoreditch,with tube links to West End in 30 mins-you have a prime location in E1 with an incredible history of its own-Jack the Ripper,and more... My partner and I are very easygoing and will make you feel welcome during your stay. We are on the ground floor so you dont have to worry about carrying luggage upstairs. The is a double room - recently renovated, and faces the garden (lots of natural light). We provide linens and towels. We also have an adaptor for your electrical devices (so you can charge your phone, etc!) If there is anything you need to make your stay comfortable, please ask - we always do our best :-) We have fibre WIFI. Parking in the area is free after 5.30pm weekdays and at weekends. Tea/coffee making facilities are provided and you would be welcome to use the kitchen for cooking in. We have a supermarket 3 mins walk away. We can give you fridge space (just ask).
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a residential pocket of Whitechapel tucked behind the brand new Royal London Hospital. Whitechapel has many cafes and restaurants and we are at a walking distance from Brick lane, famous for its nightlife, restaurants and its amazing Sunday food market. You can also walk to popular tourist attractions such as the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. Our house is situated in a residential street so there is little  noise at night, and the guest room is facing the garden -you will have a great night sleep.
notes: The mattress in the guest room in firm. Many guests love this but a recent guest did not. Please do let us know if we can make anything better for you. We are here to help.  We both work from home sometimes and enjoy chatting with guests during breaks.
transit: We are located 1 mile from the old 'city of London' so this is a very central and convenient spot. Shoreditch is the neighbouring area with its bars and nightlife. Whitechapel is a more chilled place to be but very convenient to access the craziness when you want.  The transport links are plentiful with night busses running 24 hours and two nearby stations - Whitechapel  (hammersmith and city/district/london overground) and Shadwell (dlr/london overground). Aldgate East and Bethnal Green are also walkable or a short bus ride away. (I am a public transport nerd so am happy to help with any questions). I recommend 'citymapper' (app) and (Hidden by Airbnb) maps for getting around London easily by public transport.  I can also send you referral links for various taxi schemes to get you some free rides. Every little helps :-) It is a 2-3 minute walk to the nearest supermarket and post office, and Brick Lane is (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) mins walk away.
access: Guests can access the bathroom (shared with us) and the kitchen, which you will be welcome to use if you want to make yourself some food. You can also use the dining table in the living room so you can eat your lunch / breakfast comfortably.

neighborhood_overview: Happening Camden!  Home to the alternate and original. Noisy, grungy and always interesting, you could never be bored or un-enthused in Camden Town! Home to the world famous Market with it’s vintage clothing, crafts and original little shops selling almost everything, it would seem, but many leaning towards clothing and music in one way or the other. Here you will find a live music scene that is envied by all, plus enough bars, clubs, music-venues, funky eateries and street food to keep even the most picky tourist fascinated and intrigued for the entire length of their stay!  The canals add a little bit of calm and serenity in an otherwise bustling and busy market atmosphere. They are very pleasant to sit beside with a drink in the summer, to walk by, or just to watch people cycling and walking their dogs. There is always a great duality here with young people hanging out and strumming a guitar with not a care in the world, and those milling around the markets, eager to find that one o

name: Desirable Queens Park walk to Nottinghill, zone 2
summary: Modern period apartment, original Edwardian features with mid-century furnishing. Stylish interior design. Completely refurbished in 2018 - complete refit of bathroom and kitchen. New boiler, plumbing and electrics throughout. Redecorated and tiled to a very high spec. Walking distance to famous Portobello Road, Notting Hill or Camden. Walk to vibrant Queens Park for coffee, jump on the tube and be in the west end in 15 minutes.  Sorry, single occupancy only!
space: First floor flat, there are a total of 4 privately owned flats in this period 1900 house on a terraced crescent. The apartment is at the front of the house and looks out onto an old church and Victorian buildings. High ceilings and flooded with sunlight in the afternoon, there are windows in all the rooms, including the bathroom. - Wooden floors throughout - Stylish retro / vintage furniture - Walk or cycle along the nearby canal   - Don't miss Portobello market on Fridays and Saturdays - Washing machine - Paddington (for the Heathrow Express) is 10 minutes by taxi or a short bus ride - Nearest tube stations are Queens Park and Westbourne Grove - Paddington park is right around the corner. Ideal for running, morning coffee, watching the autumn leaves fall, laughing at dogs. - The only personal belongings in the flat are a few bags of stored clothes. The flat is ready to make your own!

name: Luxury designer 2 bed flat, heart of Notting Hill
summary: Historic 2  bedroom 2 bathroom artist complex and studio (only changed hands once in 100 years). I've just completed a luxury renovation of every aspect of this unique property. Shower room with glass ceiling, handmade moroccan tiles, bespoke marble, parquet floors throughout, bespoke fitted beds, sofa, wardrobes and copper backlit bar.  50" HD flat screen TVs with integrated Sonos system.
space: **At present I am only looking for stays in the property for a minimum of 5 days Beautiful, unique and amazing two bedroom two bathroom luxury lateral apartment available in the heart of Notting Hill.  This unique historical property was once the rectory for the adjacent St Peter's church (view across garden to stained glass windows -stunning). It was formerly rectory for the church and subsequently home to celebrated 18th century illustrator John Hassall (21 May 1868 – 8 March 1948). At the centre of the complex is a spacious artist studio with triple height ceiling,  pitched glass conservatory  providing amazing natural light and view of the stars at night. It also has a 15ft x 12ft beautiful solid oak window facing  famous St Peter's church and gardens. The apartment has two beautiful double bedrooms (sleep 4).  Each bedroom has en suite. name: Room on Portobello Road Exeptional value for area
summary: Light cosy room in family home, overlooking the famous Portobello Road.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
space: Light cosy room in family home, overlooking the famous Portobello Road. Cosy clean light room with double bed, . desk and Wi Fi . Overlooking the famous Portobello Road and market. This is a great area to stay in. It is within zone two and a two min walk from Ladbroke Grove tube station, with easy access to the rest of central London. At the same time we live in the most friendly and laid back bohemian area of London. It is full of cafes and restaurants, vintage clothing shops and the eclectic and buzzing world famous market This is a family house, well lived in and with lots of space. But don't expect a white washed hotel like place. The house is as bohemian as the area of Portobello, and furnished with treasures and finds from Portobello market. You can walk from here to Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park, and to Holland Park, with it's beautiful gardens and peacocks.

neighborhood_overview: Even if you’ve never been to London before, the barrows, bars and famous blue doors of Portobello Road would be immediately familiar. You’ll have seen its market playing host to Hugh Grant, Paddington Bear and the cast of the 1971 Disney classic ‘Bedknobs and Broomsticks’, in which the street even got its own theme song. Portobello Road retains much of that magic, mystery and romance today. Most famous for its half-mile-long antiques market (the largest in the world), the street is transformed every Saturday into a glittering treasure arcade. Admittedly there’s quite a lot of trash too, and the crowds can be overwhelming during the summer. But there’s something here for everyone, from pearl-handled Edwardian opera glasses – a snip at £3,000 – at the fancier Notting Hill end, to more interesting bargains and bric-à-brac towards Ladbroke Grove. And despite having been heavily, heavily gentrified, the area still has plenty of character. Weirdos and eccentrics seem drawn here. Step into on
notes: we have pets, two cats,  both one year old.
transit: We are very close, about three of four mins walk,  to Ladbroke Grove station and buses. There is also a nice walk of 20 or 25 mins  to Notting Hill Gate tube station at the top of Portobello Road.
access: You can use the roof terrace with its little table and chairs for sitting our on or for smoking. Obviously nicer in summer! You may keep things in the fridge in the kitchen and use the kettle. I don't allow cooking for safety reasons. There are lots of lovely cafes  on the doorstep which I can tell you about during your stay.
house_rules: No smoking in house. Roof terrace available for smoking.  No visitors allowed. There are many local cafes and bars to meet friends  This rule is for the safety of all in our home.

name: Double Room Hammersmith/Fulham Border By River
summary: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families, and groups. Airbnb can only work out cost based on  everyone in one room. This is fine if you need just 1 room, but if you require a second or third bedroom or have more than 2 people in your group, the cost will be incorrect and I will need to send you a new offer. Please therefore send only a 'pre approved' offer if multiple guests as easier to amend the cost. Also, advise me of your configuration of guests .
space: Double room by Thames, SW London A lovely and spacious family house by the River Thames in Fulham, with a double room to rent and when available, two additional bedrooms for children or additional guests.  You will have your own bathroom (one is en suite and the other is shared), TV, wifi and fantastic bus routes to central London from the end of the road.  Most of my bookings tend to come through this listing so if there is no availability showing, it is still worth messaging me to see if one of the other rooms is free. Alternatively, (Email hidden by Airbnb) .uk/rooms/705526 and airbnb.co.uk/rooms/705523 too.   Hammersmith and Putney Bridge tube stations are about a 20 minute walk away along the river and I am close to the river bus too if you prefer the scenic route to the City. I'm close to Heathrow Airport (20 minute drive or direct Tube line from Hammersmith).  Lovely, leafy river walks one minute away and 20 minutes on the bus to the shopping district of Knightsbridge and the mu

neighborhood_overview: It is unique in so much as it is so close to the centre of London, but has a real feel of peace, quiet and country side. It is close to the river, where I regularly do a 7K run around the 2 bridges loop (takes about an hour to walk this), and Bishops Park is 5 mins away which has  a lovely Farmers Market every Sunday morning. There is a great local pub, The Crabtree, on the river 5 mins walk away and a great little corner shop for all your basic shopping requirements.  The famous River Cafe Restaurant is about a 10 minute walk away along the river and I can recommend many others. Jump on a bus at the top of the road and you can arrive at the great museums of South Kensington within 20 minutes and Piccadilly Circus is 15 minutes on the tube once you get to Hammersmith.
notes: I have 2 cats!
transit: There are very good bus routes to all areas of London from the top of my street, and 5 mins on the bus to the tube stations of Hammersmith and Putney Bridge. To walk to the local tube stations however would take you around 15-20 minutes so do be aware I am not super close to the underground.
access: As this is my family home, guests tend not to use the communal areas of the house besides the kitchen and we just ensure we don't clash!
house_rules: As this is my family home, I favour guests who are out by day, either sight seeing or working, please clarify this in your introductory note and let me know the purpose of your visit. I am pretty relaxed and happy to try and accommodate your arrival and departure plans, but ideally if guests can check in after 3pm and leave by 10 am that would be preferable.   Breakfast is not included but happy for guests to help themselves to tea, coffee etc.  No smoking inside the house is permitted, but I have a nice, big garden if you are desperate!  There is metered car parking right outside the door if you do have a car and if not, the bus stop is right at the top of the road with the closest tubes being Hammersmith or Putney Bridge. These are about a 20 minute walk away or a 3-4 minute bus journey.   Guests are NOT permitted to invite friends to the house unless pre-agreed  with myself and certainly no 'friends' may stay overnight unless pre-arranged and at the extra cost of £30 if in the same

name: Awesome Room near Central London
summary: I have been hosting for over 4 years now and enjoy having guests come and stay.  My flat is ideal for short or long stays, tourists or business people.  The flexible nature of the bedroom also means I can host singles, couples, families or friends.
space: This is a very clean single/twin/double room in 3 bedroom maisonette (duplex) in a very vibrant and arty neighbourhood.  The ground floor is made up of the kitchen/diner and open plan living room.  Bedrooms and bathroom are upstairs.  The apartment is very warm and light and airy with a great view towards the city and west end.  The entire apartment was re-modelled five years ago so everything is new and in good working order!   THE ROOM Well equipped with comfortable bed (with pull-out for second guest), clean bedding and warm duvet.  The room can be configured for a single guest, two sharing or a couple.  Lots of drawers and hanging space in the wardrobe for your things.  Bedside table with reading light. BATHROOM Three piece suite shared with owner.  Power shower and bath, and a never-ending supply of hot water for a long soak after a hard day’s sightseeing. KITCHEN Guests can use the kitchen to prepare meals.  Facilities include: large fridge-freezer, gas stove and electric oven, m

neighborhood_overview: Camberwell, Peckham and East Dulwich are lovely areas with lots of great bars, cafes, restaurants and shopping.  The apartment is next door to the South London Art Gallery and The Habit cafe which does some of the best breakfasts in London.  A short walk away is hip and happening Peckham, with leafy East Dulwich and it's assortment of shops and bars a little further.
notes: This room would especially suit out-of-town Mon-Fri commuter looking for an alternative to Travel Lodge etc.
transit: Great transport connections to Central London (Zone 2): South Bank (Tate Modern, London Eye) - 20 mins Westminster (Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey) - 25 mins West End (Soho, Theatre District. Shopping etc) - 30 mins Greenwich (River, Maritime Museum) - 20 mins Buses: 5 different buses all stop right outside the flat, 3 of these run 24 hours a day.  See TFL website for details. Tube:  Oval (Northern Line), Elephant & Castle (Northern and Bakerloo Lines) and Vauxhall (Victoria Line) all within 15 min bus ride. Trains:  Overground and Suburban Services from Peckham Rye (10 mins walk).
access: Private bedroom, shared bathroom, kitchen, lounge.  You will receive your own key.
house_rules: Guests are asked to take special care not to mark walls (flat newly redecorated) particularly when carrying luggage up and down the stairs. No smoking in the flat but you may on the balcony. You may have visitors over (not overnight), but please ask me first. Please secure the front door by double-locking it with the key to fully engage all locking bolts.  This should be done on entering and exiting the flat. Please do not eat or drink in the lounge, there is a large dining table in the open plan kitchen and you can see the TV from there anyway! Lower kitchen window blinds when going out (security). Please leave shoes by the front door, the flat is very warm and stocking or bare feet are ok. That's it - enjoy!

name: THREE rooms Eurostar LB Islington
summary: Location Location Location! Welcome to this amazingly located apartment on the doorstep of the Eurostar terminus at St Pancras International, and the British Library, Central Saint Martins, UCL and the Francis Crick Institute.
space: This spacious THREE roomed apartment offers light and airy interiors, neutral décor and an enviable location moments from an array of fantastic amenities and transport links. The apartment has three rooms, and three double beds.
description: Location Location Location! Welcome to this amazingly located apartment on the doorstep of the Eurostar terminus at St Pancras International, and the British Library, Central Saint Martins, UCL and the Francis Crick Institute. This spacious THREE roomed apartment offers light and airy interiors, neutral décor and an enviable location moments from an array of fantastic amenities and transport links. The apartment has three rooms, and three double beds. Flat includes: * WiFi (internet)  * Power adaptors * Bedsheets, towels * Hairdryer * Iron and ironing board We can be available if necessary. The flat around the corner from the EUROSTAR terminus, the Francis Crick institute, the British Library, a short walk from University College London (UCL), Granary Square, Central Saint Martins (CSM), Kings Cross. The beautiful green open spaces of Regent's Park are also nearby, as are many other local attractions including the funky CAMDEN TOWN, a fun place with markets, bars, clubs and food. The a
neighborhood_overview: The flat around the corner from the EUROSTAR terminus, the Francis Crick institute, the British Library, a short walk from University College London (UCL), Granary Square, Central Saint Martins (CSM), Kings Cross. The beautiful green open spaces of Regent's Park are also nearby, as are many other local attractions including the funky CAMDEN TOWN, a fun place with markets, bars, clubs and food.
notes: When selecting number of persons to stay, please include all children in your group. Some people are being sneaky by not counting children in order to get a better price. If more people show up than have booked, then I will cancel your stay.  This listing is not suitable for infants and very young children. The maximum number of humans this apartment can take is 6. Please don't try and squeeze some extra children in or make excuses like "they can sleep in the bed with us"...  no. PHOTO AND BIO: For security reasons, I don't pre-approve enquiries without a face photo (so I know the person who shows up is the person who booked). It's nothing personal! Please also make sure your profile or message says a little bit about you - reason for visit etc :-)
transit: The apartment is in an excellent, CENTRAL location. It is immediately next to the Eurostar terminus at Kings Cross St Pancras!  You can also walk to THREE transport hubs from the flat -  Kings Cross/St Pancras International (Eurostar),  Euston Camden Town
access: Flat includes: * WiFi (internet)  * Power adaptors * Bedsheets, towels * Hairdryer * Iron and ironing board
house_rules: I'm an easygoing guy! I want you to have FUN here! And I'd prefer to not have rules! But I need to clearly outline the rules below, so everything runs smoothly, both during your stay and after! THE FLAT: * Don't let people stay who haven't paid.  PLEASE DISPOSE OF RUBBISH CORRECTLY! Put it in the designated bin area, using the fob provided. If in doubt, ask. * After showering, always leave the bathroom door OPEN so the room can be ventilated * Don't rearrange furniture. * No parties* - The flat is a place to relax. My neighbours are all families and professionals. If you want to celebrate, please do so at one of the many bars and clubs in Camden :) Finally THANK YOU for reading the rules! When you meet me you're realise I'm actually an easygoing person :)

name: Lovely Apartment C in CentralLondon
space: This spacious flat of 70m2 is situated on the second floor (no lift) and can comfortably accommodate up to six people. Located next to Waterloo train station, this property offers excellent transport links to all the districts of London. You will also be able to reach all of the Capital’s principal monuments with just a few minutes’ walk. The Houses of Parliament and Big Ben are just 10 minutes away on foot. This delightful apartment features a generous living room with a double sofa bed, flat screen TV, DVD player and sound system. The kitchen is open concept and equipped with an oven, microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer and a variety of utensils for preparing your meals. For enjoying dinners with your family and friends, there is a dining table should you decide to eat at home. There are two spacious bedrooms with large double beds, bed side tables and ample wardrobes for your clothes. In the bathroom is a full sized bath with shower, ideal for relaxing after a long day out. There is

neighborhood_overview: Waterloo is beautiful, the night life is amazing, with so many lovely restaurants to dine in.  The Lower Marsh market is directly outside the apartment with amazing street food.  There are many quirky places to discover. Best Cheap Eats: Mamuska in Leak Street.  Does fabulous Polish food. Marie's Cafe insanely good Pad Thai  Best Pub  Mulberry Bush, Vaulty Towers and we highly recommend Cafe Del Marsh for a nightcap, great staff and background music.  There is also a beautiful back garden for those who smoke. Leak Street Graffiti tunnel:  Every time you go it is different. The South bank center is a 10 minute walk if that.  There is just so much to do 2 minutes from your doorstep.
house_rules: If you are leaving the apartment (checking out) or plan to check in at an unsociable hour, you must let us know in advance. An unsociable check in/check out time is deemed to be a time outside of the stated check in/check out period. Our standard times are: Check In between 4:00pm – 8pm Check out between 8am-11am Please note if you choose to check in between the hours of 11pm and 5am you will be charge an unsociable check in fee of 50 pounds.

name: room for travellers
space: I have a lovely double room in my apartment which is perfect for weekenders and travellers. In the room there is a very comfortable double bed, wardrobe and comfy chair. The apartment has a large, new kitchen with all mod cons and a living room which has a TV with free view, a very comfortable corner sofa, and a bookcase. The apartment has wifi.  The apartment is in a great location for sight seeing in London. The apartment is a few minutes walk from the local tube stop which is on the Piccadilly Line, and from there you can be in central London in 15 minutes. The apartment is easy to reach from all major London airports as the Piccadilly Line goes through Kings Cross and directly to Heathrow. Also it only takes half an hour to get to the new Olympic site at Stratford and the new Westfield shopping centre. The area is also served a several night buses which makes getting home easy if you miss the last tube!

name: Bright sunny appt on garden square
summary: Entire bright two-bedroom apartment in central London (Zone One) in Chelsea very close to London's major sights and only a few minutes walk from Earls Court tube station.  The flat is very bright and sunny and has great views over the garden square.
space: The flat is on the third floor with windows facing south and east, so very bright and sunny all day.  The main bedroom has a double futon bed, the second bedroom a single bed and there is a sofa in the lounge. It’s a historic 1870s Victorian townhouse building, but unfortunately no lift.
description: Entire bright two-bedroom apartment in central London (Zone One) in Chelsea very close to London's major sights and only a few minutes walk from Earls Court tube station.  The flat is very bright and sunny and has great views over the garden square. The flat is on the third floor with windows facing south and east, so very bright and sunny all day.  The main bedroom has a double futon bed, the second bedroom a single bed and there is a sofa in the lounge. It’s a historic 1870s Victorian townhouse building, but unfortunately no lift. You are surrounded by many restaurants, pubs, supermarkets and tourist attractions. The Victoria & Albert, Natural History and Science museums are about twenty minutes walk away and Harrods only another ten minutes. You can see Chelsea football stadium from the window. The flat is just a five-minute walk

You are responsible for leaving the place in the condition it was in when you arrived - AirBnB Terms of Service 11.1. There is no advance cleaning charge and, if you leave the place dirty, you will be charged for the time taken to restore to original condition.  No one likes cleaning when they are on holiday, but, particularly if you use the kitchen, clean thoroughly afterwards and leave in the same condition as you find it or you will be charged accordingly.  If you choose to fry, ensure all splashes are cleaned.  Please also ensure no spills – you will be charged for any necessary cleaning. space: This is truly the ideal location for anyone visiting London as it's right in the middle of it all!! The apartment is about 650 square feet with high ceilings and a lot of light. It's newly renovated and centrally located (Tubes: Oxford Circus, Goodge Street, Great Portland Street). I rarely take the tube as everything including many of the tourist sites are within walking distance.    The flat sleeps 4 and is lovely and spacious - one double bed and 1 double pull out sofa (the nice type that is very comfortable). It comes fully furnished with a washing machine and dryer and all utilities included (provided renter doesn't go crazy with gas/electric!). It gets a lot of light due to the large bay windows. name: Bright room on park near city 7
summary: Bright double room in beautifully renovated house, fronting large peaceful park in central London.   Very convenient for transport to key locations including West End, City, Canary Wharf, Greenwich (UNESCO site), O2 Arena, Excel and East London.
space: Big bright & airy double room in beautifully renovated house fronting large 7ha park.  Please note it is a full, proper private house, not an apartment! The house is luxurious & well-renovated, facing a big beautiful park, very near city centre. Modern kitchen & bathroom (heated floor, central heating, huge shower, separate bath). Faces beautiful Deptford Park across a very quiet street with free car parking in front of the house. Very convenient for transport to key locations including West End, City, Canary Wharf, Greenwich, O2 Arena, Excel Centre, Shoreditch & East London. London Bridge (2 stops / walking distance) & Bank (3 stops)  - West End / Soho (~20 mins, 6 stops direct)  - Canary Wharf (1 stop). neighborhood_overview: The area is very central, but relaxed due to facing Deptford Park across a very quiet street and in a lovely Victorian pocket.  Located short walking distance to one of London's UNESCO world heritage listed sites: beautiful Maritime Greenwich (20 mins walk / 5 min bus) and London's second UNESCO site at the Tower of London (~35 minutes by foot / 15 minutes bus) Deptford itself is very historic with Tudor era Royal Docks & diarists John Evelyn and Samuel Pepys, ancient churches & Watling Street. Deptford High Street has galleries, the great Deptford Project Cafe and vibrant market.   We are very near Surrey Quays tube station, shopping centre and restaurants.
notes: We may provide you an alternative room of comparable size in some circumstances. We will discuss this with you at or before check-in. Each room has a double bed and we charge the same for 1 or 2 people.  Additional people are at the half room rate if in the same room - so f you book for 3 people (or odd numbers), you can either pay a single person rate with the third person in the room on a futon mattress, or pay the room rate for them to have their own room.  Bookings for 4 would usually be across 2 rooms.  We have access to 7 rooms in total in two adjoining houses so if any rooms are listed as unavailable or you have a larger group we may be able to accommodate you.  Because of this also, 'Instant Book' bookings are only valid for up to three people - more requires us to confirm availability of other rooms. Please advise us ahead of time when you will arrive so we can receive you.  If we cannot be home then for any reason then we will give you a key.  Please have your phone on and ch
transit: Great Transport links from Canada Water (Jubilee / silver line - 5 minutes by bus from our house); or Surrey Quays (Overground) stations (7 minutes' walk). Also three bus routes at end of the street, two of them run 24 hours a day. From Canada Water:  - London Bridge (3 minutes) - Westminster (7 minutes) - Green Park (8 minutes) - West End / Soho (15 minutes) - Canary Wharf (2 minutes) Also easy airport connections.
access: Private bedroom in house facing park, with access to a very large, modern and spotlessly clean shared bathroom with massive shower and full size bath.  Linen & towels included. Use of large, well-appointed kitchen. Dining room and sitting room. Private garden with chairs and table. Free luggage storage. Free car parking. Free wi-fi.
house_rules: We're pretty relaxed so no major rules apart from no smoking, but do remember that it's someone's house, not a hotel. Please let us know during your stay - not after you have left, as it helps no one :) - if there is anything unsatisfactory or that we can do to improve your stay.

name: Spacious loft conversion - Hackney
summary: Superbly located studio flat in charming factory conversion. Fully equipped kitchen, double bed + toddlers bed, wi-fi, TV/ DVD.
space: Available from 23/07/2015 to 30/08/2015.  Minimum stay 1 week. 900 sqft loft conversion located in old factory in the heart of Hackney. A  stone's throw from Broadway Market/ London Fields, Columbia Road Flower Market and Regent's Canal. Around the corner from Haggerston overground station and good bus connections to Liverpool Street and Central London. Access to shared balconies overlooking the city. The loft has high ceilings and is very spacious, with an open plan kitchen with a fridge, oven/ cooker, freezer. Located in a very friendly building. Lots of trendy cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. Also very close to the Shoreditch/ Brick Lane/ Redchurch Street shopping area. There is a Tesco shop on the corner (7am-11pm) or a larger Sainsbury's branch in Dalston Junction (5 min bus journey)/ an organic grocer's nearby in Shoreditch (also a 5 min bus journey). I can provide bedding and towels, and the cleaner comes once a week. Suits 2 adults + 1 toddler. Toddler bed and high chair ava

name: Self Contained Stylish Loft Studio in Clerkenwell
summary: Situated in the heart of vibrant Clerkenwell, what many consider to be the creative and culinary capital of London and within a short walk of a multitude of pubs, bars and restaurants. Self contained accommodation with own door features all the comfort and convenience of a hotel with easy access via keypads and dedicated BT wifi box.

house_rules: 2 persons allowed only - no guests at any time No meet and greet. I prefer to use an innovative self serve access product provided by Smarterkey.  I will send out self check in instructions prior to arrival for accessing your room suite. If you need advice on where to eat, drink or things to do I'm happy to oblige either in person or by phone. The house number is on the outside of the building, so it should be pretty easy to find. If any problems feel free to call me or i can call you. Once you have arrived keycards are provided that open the house front door and your double en-suite bedroom door. With this key you can come and go as you wish. The internet wi-fi code will be texted to you upon arrival and is obviously free to use as you wish. Bed linen, towels and toiletries are included. Check-in time is as we have agreed via email. When it comes to checking out, you can simply leave the key in the bedroom and go, should i not be around to say goodbye. The professional cleaner is book

name: A great room in a stunning flat.
summary: Our stylish and comfortable two bedrooms flat is located in a conservation area which is one of the quietest spot of Central London. Safe, lush green and quiet. garden access, and easy access to city centre.
space: Kennington Park is just a 10-minute walk, Burges Park 2 mins walk away from this large two double room flat in Southwark's quiet Conservation Area, which is set amongst leafy surroundings and offers regular transport to city landmarks.  Wooden floors, Free Wi-Fi and a 50” flat-screen TV/DVD are available for use. The bedroom features a large sash window overlooking Grosvenor Park Square. Oval Tube Station is just a 15-minute walk away, and serves the Northern Line. Camberwell New Road is just 50 metres away, and serves as a calling point for many of the city’s bus routes.  Central London just 10-15mins bus drive away  Key landmarks within Southwark include Big Ben, Parliament building, London eye, Tower of London, Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, The Imperial War Museum and Borough Market. Wi-fi, washing machine, dish washer, garden... Secure, quiet, green and traffic free Excellent bus and tube services to city attractions. PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE LIVING IN THE FLAT SO YOU WILL BE SHARING IT

name: Double Room in Lux Flat Kensington
space: The double room in the 2 bed apartment is just 1 min away from the Earls Court station. It is in a very central location, and is really luxurious accommodation.  pecial key for the private gardens and the possibility of using the grass tennis court. The flat is situated on a very quiet residential street but at the same time very close to the local pubs,restaurants and clubs.  The V&A and Natural History Museums, the Royal Albert Hall,  Kesington Palace, High St Kensington, Holland park and Hyde Park are just minuts away. You can use the kitchen facilities if required.  There is a room in the fridge specialy allocated for my guests. Drinks offered on arrival. I supply fresh towels for you to use. My guests will have their own keys and they come and go as they please.  There is no restriction on timing and privacy is assured.

name: Quiet double room, Stoke Newington, own bathroom
summary: We offer a warm welcome in our quiet double room. Own bathroom (not en suite). Super-comfy bed, garden views, homemade bread & preserves for breakfast. Room overlooks our garden and lovely green, leafy Abney Park. Two minutes from Stoke Newington station, less from the bus stop! Five minute walk from restaurants, cafes, shops, 15 minutes on the train to the City, 40 minutes from West End (bus/tube). Wifi available.
space: Lovely, cosy double room with own bathroom (not en suite, but for your exclusive use while you're staying with us) in terraced house in a very quiet no-through road with no traffic to disturb your sleep. Bedroom faces on to garden and Abney Park. There's a very comfortable double bed (4ft 6), space in the wardrobe and chest of drawers for your things and plenty of books to read plus unlimited wifi. There's also a radio/alarm clock, a hairdryer and loads of sockets for you to charge your laptops/phones. As well as a warm welcome, we provide clean cotton bedlinen and towels, plus continental breakfast (fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, cereal, toast - homemade bread and marmalade/jam, tea/coffee). Occasional evening meals can be arranged. You're welcome to help yourself to tea and coffee at other times. Please let me know if you need gluten free bread/lactose free milk etc. Use of washing machine available for guests staying more than two nights (please note we don't have a tumble dryer). Ther

Five minute walk from restaurants, cafes, shops, 15 minutes on the train to the City, 40 minutes from West End (bus/tube). Wifi available. neighborhood_overview: We live in a very quiet crescent which has a great community feel to it. Unusually for London we know lots of our neighbours, and it's a very calm, friendly place.  Stoke Newington itself is a great area, full of independent little shops, cafes and tearooms, with an eclectic mix of restaurants, bars and pubs. Lots of green space around with interesting places to visit and explore.
notes: Please tell us a little bit about yourself before you book. Many people just seem to have blank profiles these days and we like to know who will be sharing our house with us. Please note latest check in time is 10pm. Obviously once you've checked in, you'll have a key and can come and go when you like.
transit: We are just two minutes walk from the bus stop or the London Overground station - 15 minutes to Liverpool Street/Spitalfields/Petticoat Lane every 15 minutes. The train links with the underground at Liverpool Street. It's easy to get around, and we'll be very happy to show you where the bus stops are.  There is parking in the street, but we are in a controlled parking zone, so there is a £2.00 charge per day for parking permits (except Sunday). We have a number of reliable taxi companies in the area should you need one. Transport from all London airports to this area is pretty straightforward. Tell me where you're coming from and I'll send you detailed directions.
access: Guests have access to their room, bathroom and kitchen to eat in. You're also welcome to sit in our courtyard garden on the rare occasions the weather is warm enough.
house_rules: Check in time. We try to be flexible to accommodate guests' travel arrangements, but the latest check-in is 10pm, and we prefer before 9pm (during your stay here, you can come and go at whatever time you like). Happy to get up early to make you a cup of tea if you have an early flight. We'll give you breakfast from any time in the morning until about 10.30. After that you're free to make tea and coffee and there will be fruit salad and yoghurt in the fridge. This is strictly a no smoking house. Our house is our home, so please treat it the same way you would your own home - with care, respect and consideration. We're pretty friendly, so say 'hello' to us when you come in, and let us know when you're going out. You're welcome to bring takeaways back, but please eat them in the kitchen and not in your bedroom. We've discovered that curry + white sheets is not a good combination. Please don't bring other people back to the house without asking us first. If you come in late, please remembe

name: Five minute walk to South Bank
summary: Clean and quiet private room in a shared apartment. Your room locks and you will have your own key.  This is central London. You can walk to everywhere central including to: London Eye, Big Ben, Southbank, St Paul's, Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Shakespeare's Globe  and Borough Market.  Zone 1 underground stations Waterloo and Southwark are within 3 minutes walk from the apartment.  The apartment is situated on the first floor within a quiet and secure apartment block.
space: There are two other rooms in this apartment: - If this room is not available for the dates you want please look at the Airbnb room called 'Also five minutes to South Bank' click http://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/268398 or 'Waterloo Sunset Central London' click https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/18914878 Description: - Large clean, quiet and secure private room - a double bed and fold out single bed  -  a quiet apartment within a calm block. Also safe local streets at night - You will have your own keys to your room and front door. So you will be able to come and go when you want - Free Wi-Fi internet connection  - A selection of cereal, bread, fresh coffee/tea, fruit and fruit juice for breakfast - Clean bed linen and towels are provided including extra pillows if you need - A metal heat radiator for when it's cold and also electric fans for when it's hot! - SHARED USE of bath/shower room, toilet and kitchen.  - Drinkable tap water - so fill up plastic bottles and take them out with you in the

neighborhood_overview: Situated in central London Zone 1 and the underground stations Waterloo and Southwark are within 3 minutes walk from the apartment. The streets are well-lit at night and safe, for example for lone women to walk on their own. You can walk everywhere including to: - South Bank; the London Eye, the Royal Festival Hall, London aquarium, Hayward Gallery, National Theatre and Tate Modern museum (within 15 mins) - St Paul's Cathedral, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, Borough Market and both London and Tower Bridges (20 minutes) - West End's Theatre Land, to Covent Garden, British Museum, Trafalgar Square or to Big Ben, Downing Street, and Buckingham Palace (between 15 and 30 minutes)
notes: Charges: Please note, the general price quoted is for a single person. There is an additional charge for each extra guest for each night. You must select the correct number of guests. The price you see when you select to book is the total price including any additional fees.
transit: You can walk from here to all the major attractions. But also taxis, buses, local underground (subway) system, bicycle hire and national rail are all within 5 minutes walk.
access: You will come in and out the apartment when you want using your own key.   Room Size: Two guests sleep in a double bed and a third guest can sleep on a comfortable and solid fold-out sofa-bed - the red chair in the photos!  If you are a group of 3 people please take a moment to consider:  - It is not a big room for 3 people - so it works best when you are active e.g. wanting to be out having fun in London before coming home to relax and sleep - If you want to spend most days or evenings together in the room, you may find it too small for 3 people Apartment Space: - THIS IS A SHARED APARTMENT! You will have privacy but the bathroom and kitchen are shared with other guests - There are two other Airbnb rooms in this apartment - each can sleep 3 people Bathroom: - There is a separate bathroom and toilet - There is always hot water Check-in / Check-out: Please note. Check-in and check-out is flexible but depends on the other guests checking in or out. Check-in before 10am is only possible i
house_rules: Arrivée / Départ Arrivée dans le temps est flexible et vous pouvez donc arriver à tout moment , tant que vous me donniez un préavis suffisant . Vérification est également flexible , mais dépend à quelle heure arrive tout nouveau client . Si un nouveau client arrive le jour de votre départ , votre dernière heure de départ sera d'une heure avant leur arrivée. Cependant, votre première heure de départ sera 8 heures . Clients ne sont pas tenus de s'enregistrer avant 8h du matin. Vous pouvez généralement laisser vos bagages dans l'appartement si vous consultez le matin, mais votre avion ou train part dans l'après-midi ou le soir. Laissez-moi savoir si vous voulez faire cela . Des frais supplémentaires Ceux-ci sont ajoutés pour chaque personne supplémentaire pour chaque nuit . Le prix que vous voyez lorsque vous choisissez de réserver le prix total , y compris tous les frais supplémentaires . Bruit L'appartement et le bloc sont assez calme . name: Lift & balcony | 3 tube lines | St Paul's nearby
summary: Modern and fresh, this is a bright two bedroom home in a stylish new development. Well furnished with comfortable modern classics and conveniently near to Farringdon and Barbican stations.
space: LIVING ROOM The light and bright living room offers comfy sofas, dining table and chairs for six, large screen TV, WiFi and a balcony. Floor to ceiling double glazing allows fabulous west facing views over the City and will give you an energising king of the castle feeling. BEDROOMS Both of the peaceful bedrooms face the rear, central courtyard. The master bedroom has a queen size bed and ample storage. The second bedroom offers twin beds and built in wardrobes. KITCHEN The smart and modern kitchen is open-plan to the living room with all machines including ceramic hob, oven, fridge/freezer, dishwasher, cooking utensils, crockery and cutlery. There are three bar stools under the the breakfast bar. BATHROOMS A fully tiled and stylish bathroom is en-suite to the master bedroom. It has a large walk-in shower, WC & basin. The second modern bathroom is adjacent to the second bedroom and offers a bath, telephone shower, WC and basin. OUTSIDE SPACE The balcony is directly off the living room

neighborhood_overview: Clerkenwell is a popular and thriving area of central London - directly adjacent to The City.  It seems to have it all from antique shops and art-galleries to local produce markets such as Exmouth Market. This is an area where you will also find a vast array of London’s very best gastro-pubs, bistro’s and Italian Deli’s.    The famous and fabulous Barbican Arts Centre is housed here and it is a feast for lovers of art and culture. It is Europe’s largest art and conference venue and is the home of the London Symphony Orchestra.  If street markets are your thing, you are spoiled for choice.  If you take yourself over to Hoxton you will find the Columbia Road flower market, Pettycoat Lane, Spitalfields, Brick Lane and Broadway Markets. There are also a few excellent and respected galleries around this way like the Cube and the Geffrye Museum.  This is a great area for walking. Stroll through the City, past St Paul’s and cross the river Thames  to the Globe Theatre to see if Shakespeare is
house_rules: RATES The total displayed includes utilities, exit cleaning and WiFi. DAMAGE DEPOSIT Airbnb takes a security deposit for us.   We will charge £200.00 if we detect cigarette smoke in the home after your departure, and £200.00 if all keys are not returned.  There are no extra charges unless the property is left very dirty or damaged. ARRIVAL & DEPARTURE Standard arrival time is: 14.00 If we do not have people leaving the day that you arrive it may be possible to move in before 14.00, but we can no guarantee this. If you need to guarantee early entry to the home please book the night before. Standard departure time is 10.00 If you would like to stay at the flat after 10.00 then please add the day of departure to your booking. If the property is not vacated by 10.00, an extra night will be charged.   LUGGAGE We do not offer luggage storage, this is a private residential building.  There are luggage storage facilities at major train stations in London.  After you book we will send you a lis

name: Beautiful one bed ground floor flat
space: This beautiful flat was recently redecorated to be featured in House & Garden magazine, and has been carefully planned by a fantastic London interior designer. The fabrics and colours used in the flat reflect the personality and lifestyle of the owner, who travels a lot on business and lives part of the year on the Greek island of Patmos. It's a beautiful, peaceful and clean space to be in with high ceilings and masses of natural light. The flat is situated on the ground floor of a Victorian House, with a huge living/dining space, kitchen and one bedroom with en-suite bathroom. There is wireless internet access and washing machine.  This newly decorated, light and airy flat is situated on Hammersmith Grove which is wide tree lined Avenue with beautiful Regency and Victorian Townhouses.  It's 5 minutes walk from Hammersmith tube station, 5 minutes walk from Goldhawk Road tube station and a short walk from Shepherds Bush station giving access to the centre of London within 20 minutes. Th

name: Notting Hill, next to Portobello Rd
summary: Our apartment is just off the Portobello Road where the Portobello Market happens every Friday and Saturday. It's an area full of restaurants and cafes where you can enjoy the mix of international cultures, with nearby tubes, parks and lots to do.
space: Ground floor apartment in the heart of Notting Hill, just one street from the famous Portobello Road Market. At the end of our street is the multicultural Goldborne Road with a Portuguese coffee shop and Market, amazing Pizza place and it's great second hand shops! There are many fantastic restaurants as well as the independent boutiques for which the area is known. Holland Park and Hyde Park are 20 minutes walk from the apartment or a short bus ride. Underground is 5 min walk and there are plenty of buses to move around the city.  The apartment is divided over 2 floors, it has 2 bedrooms, both with comfortable double beds and a studio. The beds are brand new, and the building itself only around 5 years old. It accommodates 5 person-max. It has 2 bathrooms and a beautiful and airy terrace/patio. There is wi-fi, Apple TV and Netflix, washing machine, dishwasher, oven and microwave. Lovely, cosy, clean and comfortable; fresh linens and towels provided. Kid friendly! Price is 180 pounds p

neighborhood_overview: On Fridays and Saturdays you must visit Portobello Market which is literally 1 min walk from our apartment. Also visit Golborne Road for Moroccan food stalls and great vintage shopping. Go to Pizza East not only for Pizza but for Sunday Roast and cocktails! And Westbourne Grove for more upmarket boutiques and cafes like famous Grangers Restaurant for brunch.
transit: Very well connected. Underground (Hammersmith and City line) is 5 minutes walk and there are lots of buses to take you around the city. 452 and 52 will take you to Kensington High Street, Sloan Square, and to the museums like V&A, Science Museum and Natural History, and bus 7 and 23 will take you to Oxford Circus.
house_rules: No smoking (except terrace), no parties, no pets. Respect the neighbors as there are families with kids and take care of our home please!

name: Modern Notting Hill Apartment/flat
summary: Top floor of a grand Victorian building with a lift. Bright and airy inside. Kensington and Notting Hill are on your doorstep. Many fantastic restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Hyde Park and Kensington Palace Gardens close by for your enjoyment.
space: I’m going to mention this first because it’s referred to in reviews. My previous water situation has been rectified by getting a tank installed in the flat. name: Bright 'n' Arty RM - Super Location
summary: Spacious and comfortable room for 1 or 2 people in small, arty flat. Only 1 min to tube station, shops & buses.  Great location on quiet tree-lined road with lovely light all day long!  Room has a dinner table, a desk, TV, and double sofa-bed.
space: You will have private use of a spacious and comfortable room with double sofa-bed, high ceilings and lots of light. In the room, you can use the large TV, desk & dining table, clothesrail and have peace and quiet and your privacy.  You can also use the kitchen to make breakfast, light cooking and make teas/coffees, use the fridge and have a shelf for your items. We share the bathroom also, which has a bath and shower ( and a mosaic!) My flat is extremely unique as it has lots of character with original artwork and is located on a quiet road.  Yet, within 1 minute walk you have all available transport to get around London, and local shops round the corner.

name: Muswell Hill, wifi, good transport, lovely garden
summary: This is a lovely double room in a quiet and friendly household. We've got unlimited wireless internet. We're a short distance to the centre of town, just ask for directions. There are buses, and we're not too far from Highgate station, which is on the Northern Line.  We have two cats who need to be fed! They are shy, so spend most of the time either outdoors or hiding.  There is a dining room area and a kitchen to store food and basic food preparation, but no cooking.
space: This is a wonderful space and if you're interested in staying for more than one month I will give you a special rate. Just email me! Even if it's only for one night, you'll be in wonderful Muswell Hill, North London where there are plenty of transport links to Central London - 3 buses within a 1 minute walk! We're in Zone 3, so close enough to enjoy the hubbub of city life and yet far enough away to drift into peaceful calm. This is a double bedroom with wardrobes and plenty of space. We've got a lovely big garden, friendly vibe and internet. We also have a full-size pub pool table! If you like a good challenge at snooker or pool, you'll have it! There's plenty of space in the kitchen and dining room, too.  Generally, we're quiet and clean. So you'll be comfortable, for sure. Breakfast is continental, coffee or tea. If it's not raining, you can have it in the garden. It'll get you going for the day! Muswell Hill has a village-y feel to it with plenty of cafes and boutiques, even a cine

access: This is friendly, family home where you'll have your own private room. There is a double bed, but it is for single occupancy only. If you would like to have a guest stay, please discuss this beforehand as visitors are generally not allowed. If your guest is approved, and they stay the night, there will be an additional fee. We have a shared bathroom and an additional loo downstairs. We also have a shared kitchen and dining room where you can prepare fresh food and use the toaster, microwave oven and kettle. You are asked to clean up after yourself.
house_rules: This is a double room but I only host single guests. Please note that the cleaning fee refers to after check-out, so I ask guests to kindly clean after themselves, remove their own rubbish, etc.. Thank you.  Also, please leave your shoes at the door. Quiet time after 10pm.

name: Stylish flat in Hackney, London
space: This light and airy one bedroom flat is set in an Edwardian house in Hackney, North East London and is available for short term stays (2-10 nights). My stylish but cosy flat is in a quiet road but near to the fashionable hustle and bustle of Dalston and Stoke Newington. The flat itself is very large for London. The bedroom has a king size bed and room for hanging clothes. In the bright living room there are large sash windows overlooking the garden and the city. The thee seater sofa is cozy and turns into a sofa bed. The kitchen has everything you'd need for cooking and baking and the bathroom has both a shower and bath as well as a washing machine. I've got lots of books for you to look at, FreeSat TV with plenty of channels and free wi-fi. Locally there is a Sainsbury's supermarket and small shops like a grocer, fishmonger, newsagent and a nice friendly cafe just a couple of minutes walk from the flat. For more variety bohemian Stoke Newington is just 10 mintutes walk or a short bus

neighborhood_overview: ‘Captivating’ Tooting has been named one of the best neighbourhoods in the world, alongside exotic hotspots in Rio, Seoul and New York. Sound unlikely? The south London neighbourhood of Tooting has joined the ranks of the world’s coolest city areas according to Lonely Planet.   And Lonely Planet is not the first big name to recognise the buzz in Tooting. In January 2017 the New York Times published its guide to the “The London of London’s Mayor”, a reference to Tooting resident and its former MP, Sadiq Khan.

access: Guests have access to the kitchen for preparing breakfast only however this is negotiable for longer term guests.. Laundry facilities for guests staying 5 days or more. While we welcome guests to use the kitchen  to prepare breakfast or use microwave it is essential that the clearing up is done soon after and the dishes stacked in the dishwasher.  This is a friendly home, we will be respectful at all times and expect this to be reciprocated. name: Beautiful house in trendy E. London
summary: A very spacious and comfortable family home close to shops, transport links and amenities in the heart of Clapton Village. All mod cons, inc. toys and gaming and a lovely sunny garden with outside dining facilities.
space: I have a beautiful, large and distinctive Victorian house with three bedrooms, located in a really cool part of East London.  It is a real home from home, in a perfect location for exploring all the best of London's sights. There is a train link to central London from Homerton Station which is 7 minutes walk away and there are also good bus connections. What's in the house?  The house has three bedrooms and sleeps 6 easily, more if you use the pull out bed. There is a large bathroom with bath and large separate shower and the top bedroom has an en suite shower room. There is also a ground floor toilet. There is a big kitchen/diner with French doors leading to a decked area and a sunny, gorgeous garden ideal for al fresco dining.  The kitchen has all modcons, including cooker, dishwasher, microwave, mixer, blender, juicer and expresso machine so you wont need to waste money eating out all the time.  The large double sitting room has a flatscreen TV, DVD player, games consoles, grand pia

neighborhood_overview: This a great community with easy access to town and all that London has to offer. We are very close to some lovely outside spaces.
transit: Homerton overground station connects to Stratford City to the east and Highbury and Islington to the west. Both have ideal connections to central London.
house_rules: Smoking This is a no-smoking house. Please respect this. If you want to, you can put organic waste (no bones) in the caddy beside the sink (green recycling bags are under sink) and empty into the large blue caddy out the front ready for collection on Friday mornings.  Tea Towels/bulbs In small red drawers in kitchen Extra Towels: In lower section of large grey cupboard in bathroom Extra Bed Linen: In upper section of large grey cupboards in bathroom.  Cooker:  Hob is gas. The ignition doesn’t always work and you may need to use matches or lighter to light rings. Oven is electric. Place on Fan setting and set temperature as required, over 180c most effective as its not so great on cool settings. Under cooker there is a drawer with roasting tins. The oven knob is a bit wobbly but if you fiddle with it you will feel when it goes into correct position. name: Stunning double room own bathroom
summary: Downstairs bedroom, with a separate  exclusive steam shower and toilet,  Spacious and light, with skylight, a comfy double bed and great storage, room is cleaned once a week. tea/coffee facility is available in your room. Private side entrance.
space: Hello fellow travellers!   My name is Sophia I have travelled intensively around the globe, and have previously ran a small 10 room hotel abroad.  I live in ‘Southgate’ a leafy North London suburb,  where I am able to offer up to 2 beautiful bedrooms in my home for the discerning traveller. Our home is safe and welcoming very important especially for ladies who may feel a bit nervous about travelling to new lands! I am an ex probation officer so have been police cleared to be a responsible and law abiding citizen.  I also travel quite a bit sometimes my nephew will be living at the house, when i am not there, he is a great guy, tidy and sweet helpful repectfull and polite,  he runs his own company called (Website hidden by Airbnb) check it out.   So back to your accommodation!  There is access to a bathroom with a new steam shower, which is exclusively for your own use. Sometimes the other Master Bedroom will be available, this has its own en-suite bathroom as is more (Website hidden b

neighborhood_overview: I love my neigbour hood as it is friendly, and convenient for getting around, M25, M1, and M4 are a short drive away, transport links are excellent, and there is a lovely park across the street. Food shopping is good, and there are lovely cafes and a gym all within a 5 minute walk. the area is safe and leafy.
notes: meals can be arranged for an extra cost, breakfast £8  pp and evening meal, £12 I was a in the last 60 auditioned for master chef, so its worth a try. This is our home and is not a party house, we respect your privacy.
transit: Public transport links are excellent, with Southgate tube, Picadilly line to centre of London taking 35 minutes, night buses also operate to and from central London.
access: High speed wifi, , kitchen can be used to prepare for breakfast, 7-9am  if you would like me to provide it for you there is an extra charge £8 p p   Your own bedroom shower toilet own side entrance. you are welcome to join me in the living room to watch a movie or a share a coffee, when i am home, If I am in the U.K., if not you will always be welcomed  by a friendly family member, who will show you how things work and answer any questions.
house_rules: No smoking permitted in bedrooms or rest of house, permitted only in side garden. Kitchen access breakfast 7 -9.30 am only. ID required on arrival thank you Please keep all doors closed between your room, and hall and living room,. make sure that you leave shower clean please let me know if you will be home during the day, as I sometimes have clients for therapy. and need to keep noise to a minimum. Only the number of guests allocated at time of booking are allowed on the premises. Be happy and enjoy our lovely environment. Treat our home with respect and love. Please secure all windows and doors when coming in and out. All our doors have locks, including bedrooms.

name: Listed Georgian Cottage single room
space: The room is a single on the top floor with access to a shower room and a large full bathroom shared with the owner. The house is a Listed Georgian cottage in a conservation area in a delightful quiet street just off Islington's Upper Street. There is a kitchen and dining room in the basement and a small pretty gardem with a table and chairs. The property is 3 minutes walk away from Highbury and Islington Station on the Victoria Line and London Rail Services. There are also numerous bus routes  just a few minutes walk from the house that will take you just about anywhere you want to go in London. Zone 1 begins at the other end of Upper Street Close to the house is the New River Walk. a small park alongside a river and Highbury Fields. a larger open space, is a few minutes away. The Almeida Theatre is five minutes walk away and the Estoric Gallery is just around the corner.

name: Art Gallery Flat - Best Panoramic Views in LDN!
summary: The best panoramic views in London with windows overlooking the city from each room. It's a gallery flat with original art pieces by internationally exhibiting artists and handmade or designer furnishings. The flat is in a neighbourhood buzzing with clubs, restaurants and galleries of international standard!
space: - sleeps up to 12 people over 2 flats - high speed wifi - multiple sets of keys provided - selection of teas, coffee and cooking essentials - high quality linen and towels - hairdryers in both rooms - speakers and amp - plenty of wardrobe space - good table for working or eating - wide selection of books and magazines - original art, handmade and designer furnishings - south-east facing with sunsets in winter and amazing sunrises all year round! - free parking (if requested a week in advance) - smoking allowed *on balcony - everything clean and ready upon arrival - quick response to enquiries and questions Two x two double bedroom flat in a quiet residential 1972 tower block with stunning panoramic views across the East End, City of London and the West End. There is a large open plan living room/kitchen with 180 degree double glazed windows and balcony, bespoke wooden kitchen with Miele washing machine. The sofa can be set up as a comfortable single bed and there is also another comfor

neighborhood_overview: The flat is just off Hoxton Street. For anyone less familiar with this area, it is on the doorstep of some of London's best galleries, great bars, clubs and weekend markets - A hub of creativity and fun.  On the doorstep of The City of London and easily accessible to the West End.
notes: Please note that the flat isn't suitable for parties or large gatherings and noise must be minimal in the evening and at night. Because of past issues unfortunately we are unable to accept guests without at least one good review on their profile and a government ID - please don't ask to book if you don't have any reviews as I cannot make any exceptions. Check out is 11am. Luggage may be left until 1pm for an extra charge of £10 per case. If luggage is still there beyond 1pm we will need to charge for an extra night.
transit: Walking directions from Old Street tube station will be sent to you in your confirmation e-mail and I can also provide other directions upon request. There are bikes to hire directly outside the apartment and buses and train/underground stations a short walk away. There is also almost anything you could need within walking distance. Walking distance according to (Hidden by Airbnb) maps: Hoxton Station: 11 minutes Shoreditch High Street Station: 22 minutes Old Street Station: 14 minutes  Liverpool Street Station: 28 minutes Hoxton Square: 10 minutes  Hoxton Street Market (mainly Saturdays): 2 minutes  Brick Lane: 28 minutes  Colombia Flower Market (Sundays): 19 minutes
access: Two x two bedroom apartmenst with sole access to kitchen, living room and bathroom and separate toilet.
house_rules: The most important rule is no music above laptop volume after 9pm. I have had many complaints from the neighbours about parties and it's come to the point where I may not be able to continue to rent the flat via airbnb if I get another complaint. For this reason there is a £100 fine if I receive any complaints from neighbours. Apologies to be so strict about this. Please keep the room and living spaces exactly how they were found and report any breaks or accidents as soon as possible. Please DO NOT move any of the furniture. There should be plenty of spare plugs so please do not unplug any of the lamps or other electrical items - as we clean during the morning we often do not notice when things have been unplugged. Please keep noise to a minimum after 10:30.  Lock both front doors when leaving the flat and lock the main door behind you when entering. Please keep the kitchen clean and tidy. Pets are welcome but please let me know in advance. Please leave a reference after your stay!

name: YOUR IDEAL ROOM - IN ZONE 2 !!!
space: I have 2 bedroom flat in a luxury apartment. It is an attractive and newly decorated contemporary 2 bedroom appartment with a good sized bedroom.  The flat is modern, new with entirely wooden flooring, a large modern kitchen, a large living room with a 50 inch flat screen TV with sky. There is access to free  international and national phonecalls.And of course there is high speed internet access with unlimited downloads. The nearest tube stations: Caledonian Road (piccadilly line) is 1 minute walk. Kingscross station (Piccadilly Line) about 10 minutes walk. Easy commute to and from Heathrow and both West End and the City. Good for shopping as Stratford Westfield, the biggest shopping centre in Europe, 20 minutes by tube. The area has some outstanding wine bars, pubs and many excellent neighbourhood restaurants. I am very friendly, happy a caring person who likes to meet people from different backgoundnd. If you're interested, please let me know a little bit about yourself.

name: lovely room in shared house.
space: I have a lovely double/ twin room available in our newly renovated property. As well as your room you will also have access to a shared bathroom, the kitchen, where you are free to cook a meal, and the dining room. We also have a back garden which is lovely during the summer! There is free off road parking, where there is space for either 2 small cars or one large car. In the local area there are the amenities you will need. We have a large twenty four hour supermarket and petrol station close by. We are also a short walk from the high street where there are restaurants, takeaways, fast food and cafes if you don't want to cook!  The house also has good transportation links. Close by we have a bus station which has local buses and also buses to central London. There are a number of night buses that stop here, so if you miss the last tube it is still easy to get home at night! name: Victorian family home Tufnell Park
summary: Cosy and elegant family home in leafy urban area ( Zone 2), with all mod cons. 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, garden, terrace,10 min from Kings Cross.Ideal for the family stay in London. Brand new master designer bathroom in place.
space: Very lovely family house with a choice of  two  single bedroom with desks and single beds ( brand new mattresses!)  and one double bedroom with ensuite designer bathroom .Large living room with a sun terrace and access to long garden.Good sized and equipped kitchen with large bay window. 10 min to Kings Cross in very quiet and leafy residential area. 10 min to Camden Lock with its plethora of stalls, bars, restaurants and streetfood and live music. Fully furnished with  bathroom, separate WC, free super high speed WiFi!! , fully equipped kitchen, terrace, large garden, BBQ  Busstop 9 min to Kings Cross( 390 exclusively new London Routemaster buses), Tube 5 min Tufnell park/Kentish Town Northern line, takes 6 min into town 2 bathrooms-one brand new!! Cosy family house in quiet residential street with loads of wildlife in large garden

name: Family House-Hackney Central area with nice garden
summary: The house is situated in very trendy area but in a residential street. Very close to many cafes, bars, restaurants, parks and Sunday market. Our rent is very reasonable as there are 2 cats to feed. Close to bus stops and easy to go to central london with overground.
space: Spend a week with your family in a beautiful 3 bedroom house in a very residential and quiet street and trendy area, decorated by an artist and a designer.  Fireplace in kitchen and living-room. Can have up to 7 people. name: Spacious double in OldStreet/City
summary: Lovely spacious double bedroom in amazing location, with use of bathroom and kitchen. Very homely flat. Please note hairy cats live here as well as a really messy human. This is not a business, it is somebody's home. Common courtesy is appreciated. As well as basic respect of house rules.
space: Zone 1 - Large double bedroom in good safe location close to transports. Three lovely pubs nearby. Fibre optic broadband included. Nice kitchen and bathroom with traditional bathtub.      This is a very comfortable homey flat, please get in touch before booking: it is nice to get to know each other a bit. Lovely Canal path is virtually on the doorstep, you can get to the lively nightclub and restaurant scene in Angel in less than 10minutes, theatre and art exhibitions at Barbican are also a short walk away. Trendy Hoxton, Shoreditch and Brick Lane about 15minutes on foot. Old Street, Angel and Barbican stations are all in walking distance. The area offers plenty of shops, trendy eateries, parks and it is still quietly tucked away from the major roads.

name: Gorgeous house for summer in London
summary: A beautiful, spacious and stylish family home in a safe and leafy neighourhood on a pretty and quiet Victorian tree-lined street.  Very close to transport and amenities.  Walking distance to Hampstead Heath  and only 15 minutes from central London.
space: This stunning, stylish and very large Victorian villa is only available for four weeks during the summer. This is a superbly designed very spacious family home in leafy Tufnell Park, a quiet and sought after residential area very centrally located, three miles north of London’s West End.   It is airy and light and has been recently renovated and restyled to the highest contemporary standards by an architect, whilst retaining the lovely period features of the original Victorian building. The house combines contemporary furnishings with vintage collectables, and is full of character and style. It also has an exquisite garden with a large table, perfect for eating out in the summer. The house is extremely spacious - 2200 sq feet. It has an exceptional 30 ft fully equipped open-plan kitchen/dining room, perfect for entertaining, with huge glass doors opening directly onto the delightful garden. name: The Portobello situated in Notting Hill
summary: Lovely 2 bedroom/2 bathroom  apartment  sleeps 6 people .Wall to wall carpets throughout the flat. Fully equipped kitchen if you want to cook for your family. Located in central London in zone 2 nearest tube Notting hill gate and nice restaurants/supermarket only 7 mins walk from the flat.
space: This lovely flat is on the ground floor of an old Victorian home, situated in Notting Hill Gate. The flat overlooks a lovely private garden square.  The flat has two bedrooms and can sleep up to six people. The flat has a lovely open plan living room and kitchen, which is fully fitted. In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are shops, supermarkets,cafes, restaurants, bars, clubs, and a cinema, all within walking distance. The area also has great transportation links; there is a bus stop just a few moments from the flat, and the underground is a few minutes away (Hammersmith and City Line, and the Circle Line).  The world famous Portobello Road and market is a 5 minute walk from the apartment. Here you can browse the stalls selling antiques and vintage clothes, or grab a snack from the food stalls selling cuisine from across the world! neighborhood_overview: This flat is situated on a pretty, private garden square in Notting Hill Gate. It is extremely quiet because there is almost no traffic, even though it is only moments from bustling Portobello Market.  This colourful, exciting area has many pubs, restaurants and trendy cafes. You will find traditional fish & chip shops alongside a huge variety of ethnic food. If you want to update your wardrobe, you can find the latest trends on the market stalls or browse in upscale boutiques.  Take a 10 minute stroll and you will be in the middle of leafy, green Kensington Gardens. Kensington Palace, home to generations of British Royals, is located within the park. A quick tube ride and you will be in the West End with its theatres, restaurants and glittering shops.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is Close to Holland Park and High Street Kensington, this flat has both green spaces and shopping on its doorstep. You could picnic while you watch the peacocks in the park or indulge yourself in its boutiques. Or you could take a 10 minute stroll to the new billion pound shopping complex, Westfield London.  Kensington & Chelsea is the UK’s only Royal Borough. Princess Diana had her home here and you can see her dress collection at Kensington Palace. Alternatively, you might want to see the fabulous treasures of the Victoria & Albert Museum or catch a concert at the Albert Hall, home to the Proms, the world’s great classical music festival.
