name: Lord Holland close to The Olympia Stadium
summary: This location is fantastic.  Lord Holland is in the Borough of Kensington and Chelsea on Holland Road.  In 10 minutes you can walk to the largest mall in Europe and the Shepherds Bush Tube Station which is on the central line.  Lord Holland is a busy road in the morning and night but does die down after 8pm.  .  Kensington Palace & Hyde Park in walking distance.  Bus stop outside the door.  Great Location into the city.
space: Lord Holland in Kensington & Chelsea This Kensington apartment is sunny and stylish. As soon as you open the French doors and step on to the patio, you will instantly feel at home.  Chic white sofas and colourful cushions create a relaxing vibe in the light-filled living room. You will enjoy its delightful views over a pretty garden.  In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are shops, supermarkets,cafes, restaurants, bars, clubs, and a cinema, all within walking distance. The area also has great transportation links. The apartment is beside Kensington (Olympia) Station, which gives you access to the Overground. It is also just a short walk to Kensington High STreet Underground Station, which gives you access to the Circle and District Lines. There are several buses in the area, including night bus services, so travelling around London is simple and convenient no matter what time of day it is!  Lord Holland is the place to be when you stay in London

name: Georgian heaven
summary: Beautiful sunny double room to rent. Quiet and garden facing. Available within large georgian house.
space: We have a beautiful 1850's Georgian house that has a lovely double bedroom available. The house boasts character and charm with beautiful decor, high ceilings, and open fires. Your room is a large, clean and comfortable double, which has an open fireplace and storage space available on request. The house has two shared bathrooms which you can use. Throughout your stay you will also have access to the kitchen and the living room, where there is satellite TV. Our house also has a large garden which is lovely to sit in and enjoy warm London nights! The apartment is ideally located for you to explore London. We are just a short walk from Queens Road Peckham Rail station which will take you to London Bridge in 6 minutes. The new East London line at New Cross overground station is just 10 minutes away that will take you into the heart of the east end. We are also perfectly located for visiting the new Westfield Shopping Centre, and the new Olympic Stadium at Stratford, which you can reached

name: Comfortable family house in great neighbourhood
summary: 3 bed house on a quiet friendly estate just minutes away from the buzz of Stoke Newington and Dalston. Enjoy a modern family house surrounded by green space.
space: Family home with a spacious kitchen diner, a small living (with a sofabed) and front and back gardens on the ground floor. The first floor has a living room (with another sofa bed), 2 small bedrooms (one with a single and one with a double bed) and a bathroom. And the top floor has a bedroom with King size bed and an additional bathroom. Fast speed wireless internet available throughout the house. The house is in a quiet location off the road and overlooks green spaces.
description: 3 bed house on a quiet friendly estate just minutes away from the buzz of Stoke Newington and Dalston. Enjoy a modern family house surrounded by green space. Family home with a spacious kitchen diner, a small living (with a sofabed) and front and back gardens on the ground floor. The first floor has a living room (with another sofa bed), 2 small bedrooms (one with a single and one with a double bed) and a bathroom. And the top floor has a bedroom with King size bed and an additional bathroom. Fast speed wireless internet available throughout the house. The house is in a quiet location off the road and overlooks green spaces. Guests will have use of the entire house and the front and back yards. I will be available via email or phone to answer any questions during your stay. Our house manual (on Airbnb but there’s also a folder at the house) has suggestions for places to go and information on the local area Stoke Newington is a friendly arty neighbourhood, renowned for independent shops
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is a friendly arty neighbourhood, renowned for independent shops, fantastic restaurants and great pubs and cafes. Church Street is a 10 minute walk to the north and boasts independent cafes and shops and Clissold Park (with a big playground, a skate park, tennis courts, cafe, animals, butterfly domes and ponds), Abney Park (a beautiful Victorian cemetery and nature reserve) and a modern leisure centre. Stoke Newington High Street is a 3 minute walk and has a variety of great restaurants, supermarkets, lifestyle boutiques, vintage clothes shops and bars. Dalston is a 10-15 minute walk away (or 3 min bus ride) and full of trendy bars, clubs, cafes, restaurants and arts venues (such as EartH, The Arcola Theatre, Café Oto and The Vortex Jazz Club) and has an independent cinema (The Rio), a shopping centre and the Ridley Road Market.
notes: We used to have a lodger (you might see this mentioned in reviews) but not anymore. The house is exclusively for guests.
transit: The house is a 2 min walk from Stoke Newington High St with many bus routes heading to places such as Dalston, Shoreditch,  Liverpool Street, Waterloo and London Bridge.  10 mins walk to Stoke Newington Church St gives you access to buses heading to Angel, Kings Cross, Euston, Highbury, Kentish Farm, Chalk Farm, Oxford Street and Victoria.  Overground and train stations are about 8-15 mins walk including Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction, Rectory Road or Stoke Newington. For the London Underground you can take a 20 min bus ride to a number of  stations (for example Angel, Kings Cross, Seven Sisters, Finsbury Park, Highbury), or the train from Dalston connects to the underground system.   Vouchers for street parking can be supplied at an extra cost.
access: Guests will have use of the entire house and the front and back yards.

name: Homely room in leafy Ealing.
space: Enjoy 'village life' in our capital city! If you're looking for a quiet, relaxed homestay, in a lovely area of West London, just a 15 minute walk to the tube, this is the choice for you!  We live in a cul-de-sac in Pitshanger Village, North Ealing, just minutes from the delightful Pitshanger Lane shopping street on the E2 and E9 bus routes and a 10-15 minute walk to Ealing Broadway station. Oxford Street and Notting Hill are 28 and 20 minutes by tube respectively.I have lived in London all my life and will be happy to give you any information and advice you need. If you wish to improve your English, I may  also be able to give you English lessons, as that is my area of expertise The room features a very comfortable single bed with new IKEA mattress, a spacious chest of drawers, a built-in wardrobe plus bookcase and stereo/cds if you want to use them. name: Artistic flat close to Portobello
summary: Situated in leafy Westminster, this light and airy apartment offers sleek Italian-themed decor and comfortable yet attractive furnishings. Wooden floors throughout, free Wi-Fi and laundry facilities.  10 minutes walking to Portobello Market 8min to the nearest tube station (Queen's park) and buses 200m away
space: This is the 'perfect' home - from - home beautiful flat with an Italian touch all through out!  Fully equipped; Dish Washer  Washing Machine Wood Floor throughout Free Wi-Fi All Towels and Linen provided  Free use of the Kitchen You will love the short walk to the famous Portobello Market and Notting Hill with its unique atmosphere and amenities.  It couldn't be easier to get to the very best areas of London such as the West End, High Street Kensington, Camden Town, Victoria and Sloane Street with all buses right on the doorstep. Little Venice is one of London's most popular tourist attractions. A very short walk takes you directly to the picturesque canals with Narrow-Boat Cruises travelling frequently between Little Venice and Camden. Take a Cruise and discover a completely different side of London. This is what I call 'HOME' ! !

notes: Our House Keys – to get in use the large key in the keyhole halfway down the door and then the small key on the left hand side. Once you are in you can if you wish lock it by sliding the security bar over at the bottom of the door.  Heating – the heating is turned on and off by a temperature dial behind the bookcase in the kitchen. You will see the light go on and off as you use it. There is also a portable electric heater located in your bedroom. Cooking – There are four gas rings which operate manually. To operate the electric cooker you need to turn the timer on (it won’t work if you don’t do this) and put the dial to the symbol that looks like a propeller! You then turn it to the temperature you require. There is wi-fi in the house if you wish to make use of it. The security code (SN) is next to the black wifibox.  After your stay, when you leave and we are not in, please lock up and put the keys through the letter box. Enjoy your stay! James & Kathleen
transit: 10  minutes walk from the nearest underground station (Leyton on the central line). It is 15 minutes by underground to the centre of London.

house_rules: There are no particular house rules apart from being respectful to the property and considerate to others. We love having people around and hope you will enjoy the house as much as we do! Guests are allowed to smoke in the back yard.

name: 45 sqm flat in the heart of Hoxton
summary: The flat is 7 mins walk from Old Street Station, 5 mins from Hoxton Overground.  Juts 2 mins from Hoxton Square. The area is exciting with loads of attractions like Street Art, pubs, bars, clubs and restaurants. The flat is in a 3rd floor.
space: Just 7 minutes walking from Old Street station (zone 1) and trendy Shoreditch, with all its bars and great nightlife. Talking about trendy, Brick Lane is a short 10 minutes walk. There you'll find a great mix of bars, restaurants and even a few 24 hours bakeries with cheap and tasty treats. Also there are plenty of vintage shops and a unique sunday market where you can find a little bit of everything, from ethnic food to clothes and decoration pieces. If that wasn't enough, Spitalfields Market is also close by (you can check it out on (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You'll be 3 minutes away from Hoxton Square and just a few minutes walk to Regents Canal where you can have long walks to Angel and even Camden Town if you're up for the chalenge.  Liverpool Street Station - the final stop for the Express train to Stansted Airport - is only  15 minutes walk away, an about 5 minutes on a bus.  You couldn't really get any closer to the buzz! contact Otto: (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: Comfy room Islington. Great transport links!
summary: A fab room in a fab location! This central, comfortable and warm room is close to Stoke Newington best watering holes and restaurants and a short walk to Highbury Barn and on to Islington Upper Street. Very well placed for public transport (bus, tube, overgound), we are also lucky enough to get 2 night buses on the doorstep!!! Perfect for medim and long term stays, with discounts available. However it is very near bars and restaurants of Islington Upper Street and Stoke Newington. Excellent transport links on the doorstep.  Wi-fi always available and home cooked breakfast often possible. Your hostess is a relaxed person who really lives and loves London. Heaven!  Oh, I have a dog... friendly.... but big!

name: Single Room - Clapham / Battersea
summary: A lovely room available in the heart of Battersea. Located 5 minutes from Clapham Junction and situated on a quiet residential room, this is the perfect place to explore the city.
space: Pretty, cosy semi detached end of terrace Victorian House in Battersea. The house has been recently renovated and features 3 bedrooms and a pretty, small back garden. Beautiful Battersea Park is a short 10 minute walk away.Battersea Square and Northcote Road, where you can find shops and markets, are close buy.  Clapham Junction is 8 minutes walk away as there you'll find many shops, bars, restaurants and supermarkets. Also, from Clapham Junction Station you can get the underground to the centre of London as well as mainline trains to Victoria and Waterloo linking you to most of the underground lines. You can also get the buses 49, 345 to Kings Road and South Kensington, 319 Kings Road and 44 to Victoria.   Wi-Fi Internet is available and there's metered parking (09h30-16h30 Monday to Friday) available outside the house.    'Comfortable, clean and kind'.  Highly appreciative comments from previous guests.  Continental breakfast included and delicious cooked breakfast available upon req

name: 2 Bedroom London East End Apartment
summary: This is a terraced ground floor flat that was built in the 20s. Very typical of the terraced houses of London. It's located five minutes from the main road where you will find supermarkets, restaurants and local businesses. There is a local convenience store opposite, and its about 15 minutes by bus to the 2012 Olympic Park and Westfield Stratford shopping centre. The Excel is a short five minute ride by bus.
space: Self catering two bedroom purpose built ground floor apartment . Wood laminated flooring through out. It has a delightful garden as well as a separate dining area which is adjacent to the modern spacious fitted kitchen. There is one master bedroom with a comfortable double bed and fitted wardrobes, and one bedroom with two single beds. It can comfortably accommodate four people. There is also a sofa bed in the reception area. Towels and bed linen provided. Recently decorated, the property comes with everything you need for a pleasant stay in London.  UNLIMITED FREE WIFI INTERNET ACCESS. The TV is connected to Freeview with up to 50 digital TV channels and 24 digital radio stations to choose from, more information at: (URL HIDDEN) Excellent train and bus links to all parts of London. A convenient store two doors down, two large supermarkets 5 minutes walk away, as well as all manner of local shops, fast food, bank, and post office all within walking distance.

You do not need a car, if you bring one leave it on the drive for your stay unless you want to visit Kent and the surrounding countryside. The motorways south are a 25 minute drive.
access: The pool is shared and open 2pm to 10pm daily.
house_rules: We try to allow guests freedom to enjoy their stay in London in the way they would like, but ask that respect is shown to the property and other guests at all times.  We don't allow smoking in the building, as it's law in the UK, and we ask smokers to move away from the building to prevent open windows allowing tobacco smells inside.  We don't allow large groups of all male/female/under 21s, and whilst we encourage bbqs in the summer, we ask guests to keep noise to a minimum outside after 11pm, that includes music being turned off.  The pool is open from 2pm to 10pm and ask guests to respect timings as we add chemicals overnight. Additionally no glass of any kind is permitted in the pool area, guests must shower before using the pool and wear a swimming costume. There is no lifeguard so the pool is used entirely at guest's risk and under 14s must be supervised at all times. The sauna operates with £1 coins at £2 per hour. name: Single bedroom + en suite shower room near tube
summary: Single room with single bed,  armchair, desk and chair and en suite shower room with wc and basin. Room is also supplied with a kettle, a fridge and microwave, but no other cooking facilities are available.
space: Single room with single bed,  armchair, desk and chair and en suite shower room with wc and basin. Room is also supplied with a kettle, a fridge and microwave, but no other cooking facilities are available. We view our rooms as a budget option for those who cannot afford hotel charges - our rooms can be used for sleep, relaxation and study but are not suitable for visitors requiring self-catering facilities. We supply bedding, a towel, and a bar of soap, but please bring your own shampoo and any other toiletries. There is no television in the rooms. The house is located in a quiet tree lined street only a short walk from the Seven Sisters rail station and Victoria line tube. Ideal for academics visiting London to do research at the British Library - only 3 stops on the tube. Our prices are inclusive of bills with access to unlimited hot water and central heating morning and evening.  Nearby West Green Road has a range of shops, restaurants, pubs and fast food outlets, also a launderett

name: Central London with Stunning Views!
summary: We've welcomed over 500 guests and received exceptional reviews from all. You can be certain that our listing is 100% accurate and of outstanding quality. We really enjoy hosting guests and you will love our central location and beautiful historical environment.
space: Being one of the original London Airbnb hosts, we operate under the philosophy of welcoming guests into our home and providing a very personal and local experience of London. We love to receive guests and to share our extensive knowledge and experience of living in the capital. We offer a superb ZONE 1 LOCATION with a good sized, immaculate room, suitable for one person.  We're walking distance to: THE EUROSTAR * WEST-END * SOHO * COVENT GARDEN * LEICESTER SQUARE * SOUTH BANK * OXFORD STREET * PICCADILLY CIRCUS * THE BRITISH MUSEUM * THE BRITISH LIBRARY * GRANARY SQUARE * CAMDEN TOWN ... Just to name a few! We offer: • A beautifully presented single bedroom in a two bedroom apartment  • Spectacular views across central London  • We are surrounded by atmospheric restaurants, cafes and garden squares • Excellent transport links incl. Euston, St. Pancras International, Euston Square & Russell Square The room comprises: •Comfortable single bed •Built-in double wardrobe •Bureau with leather
description: We've welcomed over 500 guests and received exceptional reviews from all. You can be certain that our listing is 100% accurate and of outstanding quality. We really enjoy hosting guests and you will love our central location and beautiful historical environment. Being one of the original London Airbnb hosts, we operate under the philosophy of welcoming guests into our home and providing a very personal and local experience of London. We love to receive guests and to share our extensive knowledge and experience of living in the capital. We offer a superb ZONE 1 LOCATION with a good sized, immaculate room, suitable for one person.  We're walking distance to: THE EUROSTAR * WEST-END * SOHO * COVENT GARDEN * LEICESTER SQUARE * SOUTH BANK * OXFORD STREET * PICCADILLY CIRCUS * THE BRITISH MUSEUM * THE BRITISH LIBRARY * GRANARY SQUARE * CAMDEN TOWN ... Just to name a few! We offer: • A beautifully presented single bedroom in a two bedroom apartment  • Spectacular views across central London
neighborhood_overview: Our local area has an array of independent cafes, bars and restaurants, such as Fork, Casa Tua, The Norfolk Arms and the Marquis de Cornwallis, all on the edge of the West-End. We also have a renowned art-house cinema, The Curzon Bloomsbury, which shows award winning independent and foreign films.  You may also wish to enjoy a glass of champagne at the beautiful and historic St. Pancras Hotel, or a beautiful meal at one of the many up-market restaurants of Granary Square, such as Vinoteca, The German Gymnasium or Dishoom. Equally, we're only a 5 minute walk to the Eurostar, should you wish to have lunch in Paris! For those interested in history, the local area was developed by the Russell and Bedford families in the 17th and 18th centuries into a fashionable residential area. It's notable for its array of garden squares, strong literary connections and numerous cultural, educational and healthcare institutions. For those travelling for work or educational purposes, we can provide an ea
transit: Our home is in close proximity to an extensive selection of public transport. Within easy walking distance you can access Kings Cross and St Pancras, Euston and Russell Square stations. Each providing quick and simple transport connections across London, to the rest of the country and to France via the Eurostar.
house_rules: No additional guests. The accommodation is only suitable for one person. Guests must be 18 years and over and respectful towards members of the household and the accommodation.

name: Also five minutes to South Bank
summary: Clean and quiet private room in a shared apartment. Your room locks and you will have your own key.  This is central London. You can walk to everywhere central including to: London Eye, Big Ben, Southbank, St Paul's, Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Shakespeare's Globe  and Borough Market.  Zone 1 underground stations Waterloo and Southwark are within 3 minutes walk from the apartment.  The apartment is situated on the first floor within a quiet and secure apartment block.
space: There are two other bedrooms in this apartment: - If this room is not available for the dates you want please check availability of the second Airbnb room called 'Five minute walk to South Bank' click http://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/236956 or 'Waterloo Sunset Central London' click https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/18914878. neighborhood_overview: This is central London zone 1 and subway stations are Waterloo and Southwark 3 minutes walk from the apartment. The streets are well lit at night and safe, for example, for women to walk on their own.  You can walk everywhere, including to:  - Bank of the South; the London Eye, Royal Festival Hall, London Aquarium, Hayward Gallery, the National Theatre and Tate Modern (within 15 minutes)  - St. Paul's Cathedral, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre, Borough Market and London and Tower Bridges (20 minutes)  - West End theaters, Covent Garden, the British Museum, Trafalgar Square, Big Ben, Buckingham Palace and Downing Street (between 15 and 30 minutes)
notes: Please note. In response to the Coronavirus pandemic all steps are taken to ensure that the safety of guests is maintained and that the apartment is clean and free of any possibility of infection. Prior to your arrival a full deep clean will be undertaken of the apartment. This will include disinfectant and bleach on relevant surfaces. All bedding provided including protective under-sheets and towels will have been washed at high temperature prior to your arrival.  Prior to your arrival you will be informed of any other guests staying there. Guests must observe strict social distancing rules and remain no less than two metres apart from each other at all times. This means only one guest can use the kitchen at a time.  This apartment is within an apartment block. However all residents observe strict social distancing measures. Where residents enter and exit the block at similar times they are asked to open and shut the gate themselves without holding the door for others so that social d
transit: You can walk from here to all the main attractions in Central London. As well as taxis, buses, local metro (subway), bike rental and national railway are all within 5 minutes walk.
access: You will be able to come and go as you want using your own key.  Room Size: Two guests sleep in a double bed and a third guest can sleep on a comfortable and solid fold-out sofa-bed - the red chair in the photos!  Apartment space : - THIS IS A SHARED APARTMENT! You will have privacy but the bathroom and kitchen are shared with other guests - There are two other bedrooms in this apartment Airbnb - each can sleep 3 people Bathroom: - There is a bathroom and separate WC.  - There is always hot water Check-in / Check-out Please note. Check-in and check-out is flexible but depends on the other guests checking in or out. Check-in before 10am is only possible if no previous guest is checking out. On the day you leave check-out after 10am is only possible if there is no new guest arriving. It is important that you tell me the time your train or flight arrives in london so I coordinate. Please note check-in after 11pm is not possible. So do not book this room if your flight lands later than 9pm
house_rules: Arrivée / Départ Arrivée dans le temps est flexible et vous pouvez donc arriver à tout moment , tant que vous me donniez un préavis suffisant . Vérification est également flexible , mais dépend à quelle heure arrive tout nouveau client . Si un nouveau client arrive le jour de votre départ , votre dernière heure de départ sera d'une heure avant leur arrivée. Cependant, votre première heure de départ sera 8 heures . Clients ne sont pas tenus de s'enregistrer avant 8h du matin. Vous pouvez généralement laisser vos bagages dans l'appartement si vous consultez le matin, mais votre avion ou train part dans l'après-midi ou le soir. Laissez-moi savoir si vous voulez faire cela . Des frais supplémentaires Ceux-ci sont ajoutés pour chaque personne supplémentaire pour chaque nuit . name: Beautiful farmhouse on the R Thames
space: Wide, beautiful Georgian farmhouse overlooking the RIver Thames near Kew bridge.  The house consists of 3 double bedrooms, being one of them an ensuite. There are 2 bathrooms - one with a bath and shower attachment and the other with a shower - and a toilet. Nice living room and kitchen and leafy, mature front and rear gardens, both with seating areas.  Gunnersbury Park is a 10 minutes walk away and the Kew Royal Botanic Gardens is a short 15 minutes walk south of the river.  The house is 5 minutes walk to Kew Bridge Rail Station and 15 minutes walk to Gunnersbury Station, where you can take the tube and get to central London in about 30 minutes. The access to central London via car is also quite easy, and parking is available. Also close by is Chiswick High Street where you can find plenty of restaurants and bars as well as supermarkets and shops.  We're a short journey away from Wimbledon so it would be a great place to stay if you're coming over for the Tennis Championship.

Nice living room and kitchen and leafy, mature front and rear gardens, both with seating areas.  Gunnersbury Park is a 10 minutes walk away and the Kew Royal Botanic Gardens is a short 15 minutes walk south of the river.  The house is 5 minutes walk to Kew Bridge Rail Station and 15 minutes walk to Gunnersbury Station, where you can take the tube and get to central London in about 30 minutes. The access to central London via car is also quite easy, and parking is available. Also close by is Chiswick High Street where you can find plenty of restaurants and bars as well as supermarkets and shops.  We're a short journey away from Wimbledon so it would be a great place to stay if you're coming over for the Tennis Championship.

name: The Kensington
summary: The flat is situated on a quiet, shady, residential street.  The best part, is that the two bedrooms are on the quiet side and the windows can be opened up during the night.  The kitchen and living room face Holland Road and it can be noisy during the rush hours.  At the end of the street there are a few restaurants and convenience store.  Shepherd's Bush Tube station is 5 minutes away. Kensington Palace and Hyde Park in walking distance.
space: This lovely spacious 2 bed flat is on the first floor of a period conversion building in a lovely neighborhood. The flat also has a fully fitted kitchen and a very comfortable living room.  In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are shops, supermarkets,cafes, restaurants, bars, clubs, and a cinema, all within walking distance. The area also has great transportation links. It is just a short walk to Shepherds Bush Underground Station, which gives you access to the Circle Line, and the Overground. There are also several buses in the area, including night bus services, so travelling around London is simple and convenient no matter what time of day it is!  The flat is also very close to Westfield Shopping Centre. Here you will find a very wide variety of shops, cafes, restaurants, and a cinema. Hyde Park and Holland Park are also just a few minutes from the flat.

This ride is approximately 15 minutes. name: Outstanding location- NOTTING HILL Flat WithGARDEN
summary: A superbly located, beautiful ground floor one bedroom victorian apartment. Featuring a walled garden to relax in, high ceilings and large eat in kitchen tucked right behind Portobello Road. The vibrant Notting Hill and Portobello neighbourhoods are on your doorstep moments away!
space: TRUE NOTTING HILL LIVING. Outstanding location. See our reviews. All of Notting Hill is on your doorstep and we will give you a list of our favourite spots and travel tips so you can jump into living like a local right away! Elegant ground floor apartment forming part of a victorian period house. With original classic features such as high ceilings and solid wood floor throughout ,you will stay in comfort and like a true Londoner.  The living room features an outstanding ornamental fire place as its centrepiece for you to lounge beside and cosy up with a book or plan your next London adventure. We have just refurbished. There is a large (3 seater) sofa now which coverts easily into a very comfy large sofa bed. The picture frame window looks out onto the pretty patio and a lovely patch of sky. Daydreamers welcome. The luxury hotel style bathroom has been fitted with Italian ceramic tiles, designer rain shower, waterfall bath taps and a fabulous marble sink. Perfect for a long soak at th
description: A superbly located, beautiful ground floor one bedroom victorian apartment. Featuring a walled garden to relax in, high ceilings and large eat in kitchen tucked right behind Portobello Road. The vibrant Notting Hill and Portobello neighbourhoods are on your doorstep moments away! TRUE NOTTING HILL LIVING. Outstanding location. See our reviews. All of Notting Hill is on your doorstep and we will give you a list of our favourite spots and travel tips so you can jump into living like a local right away! Elegant ground floor apartment forming part of a victorian period house. With original classic features such as high ceilings and solid wood floor throughout ,you will stay in comfort and like a true Londoner.  The living room features an outstanding ornamental fire place as its centrepiece for you to lounge beside and cosy up with a book or plan your next London adventure. We have just refurbished. There is a large (3 seater) sofa now which coverts easily into a very comfy large sofa bed.
neighborhood_overview: 60 SECONDS FROM PORTOBELLO ROAD (one block). This apartment really is the best location for those wanting to explore. It allows you easy access all that Notting Hill has to offer, from trendy Portobello Road market, vibrant Golborne Rd, Westbourne Park boutiques, Holland Park, Kensington Gardens. Every type of restaurant you can imagine. All our favourites are literally steps away. We have lived in the area for years and have a black book of all the must dos and must eats including seeing the sights from the film Notting Hill that we would love to share with you. Ladbroke Grove tube station is 5 minute walk away and gives you fast access to all of London and the sights! Notting Hill Gate station is a 15 minute walk away down portobello road but leave time to browse the market, stroll past the iconic door made famous from the film 'Notting Hill' and people watch in the cafes. We provide some of the locations from the film in our mini guide to the area so you can visit yourself. The new
notes: We now have included unlimited super fast  fibre optic wifi broadband installed. So, whether you are working from the apartment or watching movies the internet provider (bt infinity) says it is the fastest London has to offer!  This is an old victorian period home conversion so although there is sound-proofing it is still not sound-proofed like a modern property, so you will be aware of other people in the upstairs flat if they are around. If you are an especially light sleeper or adverse to the sound of other people then this isn't the place for you. Although the apartment is a one bedroom apartment and designed for two people, the lounge has a large three seater sofa bed which converts easily into a comfy double sofa bed so the apartment can sleep up to four people if needed. There are four chairs at the dining table too.
transit: Portobello Road is 60 seconds walk. Ladbroke Grove station is 5 minutes walk away. Westbourne Park station is 7 minutes walk away. Paddington is a direct 5 min tube journey from Ladbroke Grove/Westbourne Park and offers very fast access to Heathrow via the Heathrow express which runs every 15mins and takes 15mins. (we have done door to airport in 30mins though we suggest you leave longer just in case!) Kings cross station is 20mins on the tube and offers a fast service to France and Europe via the Eurostar. The huge Westfield shopping centre is a 5 minute direct tube journey from Ladbroke Grove and has all the iconic British and international brands as well as high end luxury and designer boutiques. Taxis are available on the street and we provide local taxi numbers to our guests. Reasonable on street parking (approx £2 an hour). Free street parking Saturday afternoons, all day Sundays and after 6:30pm on all other days.
house_rules: We want you to enjoy our home but please no parties, bbqs, smoking or pets. Please respect our neighbours by not making excessive noise. Please leave our home in the same clean, tidy, secure and welcoming condition in which you will find it

space: ABOUT THE STUDIO Fully furnished studio perfect for a short stay traveler (entire studio, no sharing).  Private toilet / shower room, fridge freezer, simple cooker, washing machine. name: ★Bright, Sunset View,Modern,Chelsea/Imp.Wharf Apt★
summary: This bright & modern, top floor apartment boasts incredible balcony views. The 2 Bedroom flat is fully furnished and equipped to a high standard making it the ideal home from home, whether your stay be for business or leisure. Set in the stylish Imperial Wharf, the area has lovely gardens with Thames riverside walk, and is only minutes away from Kings Road with its bars & restaurants. It's unrivalled location and transport links makes it easy travel to all London's  must-see attractions.
space: The apartment accommodates up to 5 people. It has two bedrooms – 1 double and 1 single (and a double sofa bed in the lounge); 2 bathrooms (1 en-suite to master bedroom), lounge and kitchen.  Furnished and equipped to a high standard throughout it has all the facilities you require to make you feel at home during your visit.  As an added attraction being located on the 7th floor, the balcony affords extensive views over South West London and amazing sunset vistas.

As an added attraction being located on the 7th floor, the balcony affords extensive views over South West London and amazing sunset vistas. Ground-floor entry to the apartment blo
neighborhood_overview: Imperial Wharf lies between two of London's most exclusive residential areas, Fulham and Chelsea. Set in 10 acres of parkland, with stunning riverside views, this award winning development has to be one of London's most sought after addresses. It's situated in a peaceful location on the North bank of the Thames, adjacent to the famous Chelsea Harbour development - and yet the stylish boutiques, restaurants and cafes of the Kings Road are only a short walk away. For groceries you can walk to a Tesco supermarket within one minute a Sainsbury hypermarket within ten minutes. The Boulevard has a number of restaurants and a riverside pub. A tree-lined, Mediterranean style boulevard lies at the heart of Imperial Wharf, and is brimming with shops, bars and fine restaurants such as Me Love Sushi, Wimbledon Wine Cellar and Saran Rom. You'll also find regular events taking place such as the Imperial Wharf Annual Jazz Festival. Other facilities include the Karen Hardy Dance Studios, Gambado indoor
notes: We always clean the flat professionally prior to each new guest arriving so it is spotless and welcoming for you.
transit: Getting around could not be simpler. We are two minutes walk from Imperial Wharf Overground station with direct links into Central London (20 minutes) and the South Coast via Clapham Junction. There are also frequent bus services from right outside the apartment linking you into the Tube system and we are on a main taxi route. We also have a Thames Clipper riverboat service at peak hours from the nearby Chelsea Harbour pier, which goes to Central London and Putney in the opposite direction.
access: Ground-floor entry to the apartment block is by secure key-tag. With elevator to 7th floor, access for disabled guests or wheelchair users is simple.  Walk through The Boulevard to The Thames, Chelsea Harbour and Imperial Wharf Gardens.
house_rules: Smoking is permitted only on the balcony. Please treat the home as you would your own. Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. No parties. If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the letterbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £150 fee will apply to cover the cost of replacing the sets and fob.

notes: Local area  WALTHAMSTOW MARKET( Longest market in Europe): Walthamstow High Street, , E17 7JY +Walthamstow shopping centre From your apartment take Bus 158 towards  Blackhorse Road Station (get off High street /Walthamstow market  -  7 minutes journey)   Walthamstow Market has been in operation since (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and it still remains Europe's longest street market, taking up the entire length of the high street. The market stalls sell cheap clothing, hand bags, bric-a-brac, fresh fruit and veg, books and second hand CDs amongst other things, with traders loudly touting their wares to passers-by. The market doesn't open on Sundays or Mondays and the busiest days by far are Fridays and Saturdays when getting from one end of the street to the other can become quite a chore. Luckily you can dive into one of the local caffs, pubs or the pie and eel shop for a breather. On Sunday mornings, a separate farmer's market operates just off the high street, on the Town Square o

name: Bright Clean Double Room-Chingford
space: I look forward to welcoming you to my beautiful London home.   This is the "Room with a View"... as it over looks the garden.  As you can see from the picture it is a clean double room suitable for up to 3 people. It is a pleasant private house in a safe residential area of Chingford, London. The accommodation available is suitable for up to six people and perfect for couples or a family with children. I have two rooms that I can offer you. One is a double room listed as, “Bright Clean Double Room”.  The other is a large double room listed as, “Clean Bright Large Double”.   Your stay will include access to our stunning 120m (400ft) long landscaped garden, as well as use of the large modern fitted kitchen and eating area. It includes a sunny outside eating area perfect for breakfast or any meal any time. A huge BBQ area awaits you available for those more creative meals and then there's the organic garden area where you can pick fresh fruits, vegetables and herbs to compliment any meal.

name: Self Isolate - Frontline - NHS - Safe, Secure 1BR
summary: Work From Home,  Safe and Comfortable Self-Isolation  Ready to move-in - just bring your luggage. Normally used for corporate and holiday rentals, this is a secure, comfortable, fully-furnished / equipped 1 bedroom and 1 bathroom apartment in London's Marylebone. Supermarket & food shops at your doorstep Just 5 minutes away from Edgware Road Station & Marble Arch station If you wish to self-isolate or are required to do so, this may be an excellent option for you.
space: This one apartment is spacious and relaxing, the ideal place to come back to after a day of exploring. Great transport links mean you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle!  In the master bedroom, get a wonderful night’s rest on the super comfortable king-size bed, fitted with fresh, luxury linens. Large windows let in plenty of natural light, while lined curtains let you indulge in a lie-in in the mornings. There is also plenty of storage space, so you won’t have to live out of your suitcase; get unpacking and start feeling at home right away. Iron and ironing board are provided to ensure any smart clothing is always ready to go’  The living area is light and airy with a modern design and lovely finishing touches. There is a large sofa, which unfolds into a double bed, and flat-screen TV. Sit back and make yourself at home! Wood flooring and high ceilings complete the room. A lovely breakfast station accommodates up to 2 people and it's the best s

neighborhood_overview: The best part about being a guest in this apartment is the great central location. Whether you staying for pleasure as a tourist or here for business, you are in a great Central London spot!  You'll be staying in between of the beautiful Marylebone and the vibrant Paddington, charming neighbourhoods full of lovely cafes, great restaurants, lovely shops and fun pubs!  My apartment is walking distance from some major London attractions like Hyde Park, Regent's Park, Oxford Street, Baker Street and Madame Tussauds. There are countless fantastic restaurants around.  Dining is an inventive mix of sushi and Japanese tapas-style dishes served in simple surroundings. The idea is genially tasty, give it a try.  If you fancy some pub-food, head towards the Grazing Goat, a spacious gastropub with contemporary country house-style interior, for traditional British cuisine. If you want to experience Oriental atmospheres, we recommend Maroush, a large, 2-floor family friendly Lebanese restaurant, wit
notes: STAIRS The apartment is on the FIRST floor of a 2-story building.  You have to walk up a short flight of stairs to the apartment - there is no lift.  Please bear this in mind before you book! IMPORTANT NOTE: For Guest convenience, we operate a self check in / telephone check in at our apartments.  Prior to your arrival your we will be in touch with you to explain the process. You will either receive a secure access code by email or my Greeter will share her details to conduct a telephone check in. Rest assured we will walk you through the process and I am always available in case of any concerns. We appreciate however, that some guest prefer a personal  "Meet & Greet" check in, which is no problem at all. Kindly note the fees for this service and ensure that the correct money is carried to pay the fee in cash, direct to your Greeter. Fees are as follows:   	 2.00pm - 7.00pm 	GBP (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) pm (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) am 	GBP (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) a
transit: Public transport is very convenient.  There are many buses from Edgware Road taking you all over London.  Edgware Road tube station is just 5 minutes distant connecting to Victoria, Circle and Bakerloo lines. Just at a 12-minute walk distance you also have Paddington Train station, one of the main train hubs in London.
access: Guests can access the entire apartment. It is paramount that we are respectful towards our neighbours. High chairs and travel cots can be provided on request.
house_rules: Thank you for respecting my house rules for your comfort and safety: - ID must be shown upon entry - Strictly no parties - if you are found to be having a party or other event, you will be asked to leave immediately with no refund and you will lose your security deposit in full. - no smoking - sorry, no pets - The apartment will be prepared for the total number of guests stated at the time of booking.   Additional guests may be permitted subject to an additional fee, however the total number of guests must NOT exceed the stated occupancy of the apartment.   - The apartment is in a residential building / street so I ask all guests to respect our neighbours.   - Loud music after 10.00pm is strictly prohibited.

name: Cute 1 bdr flat quiet road central
space: Welcome to my beautiful one bedroom flat. It's located on a quiet dead end street right off Westbourne Grove in Notting Hill/Bayswater, which makes it highly central yet peacefully quiet. It's just a 7 minute walk from either Hyde Park or the wonderfully eclectic Portobello market. My place has a bedroom, a living room, a full bathroom, a kitchen and a beautiful private roof terrace! The flat comes equipped with everything you'll need for an enjoyable stay in London, including free wifi internet. There are tons of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars just 2 minutes outside the door. In terms of public transportation, there are 3 nearby tube stops: Royal Oak (a 7 minute walk), Bayswater (a 5 minute walk), Queensway (an 8 minute walk). In terms of buses, you've got the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) (all within a 1 minute walk). Also within walking distance (just 12 minutes) is Paddington station, which is very convenient in case you land at Heathrow.

name: Maida Vale, modern house with garden and office!
summary: Beautiful garden and sunny living space.
space: Hi, I'm Farzam, The property is situated in Maida Vale, five minutes walk from Little Venice and Abbey Road studios and one minute from Maida Vale tube station. Cafes and shops are all at your doorstep and inside the house you have a modern kitchen, a shower room/bathroom and a main bathroom, private garden and patio, eat in kitchen and a spacious living room. The place is bright and airy with a lovely sized outdoor space. A bus ride or tube will take you into Central London and you'll be in Oxford St or Baker St in under 15 minutes. If you want to stay local, the nearby canal and Regent's Park is a wonderful place to stroll along and many shops and great restaurants are within a five minute walk. The house is in high order, and has a modern comfortable feel. I look forward to hosting you, if you're looking for a large, well situated place to stay while on a long trip to London! Any questions, please feel free to drop me a message.
description: Hi, I'm Farzam, The property is situated in Maida Vale, five minutes walk from Little Venice and Abbey Road studios and one minute from Maida Vale tube station. Cafes and shops are all at your doorstep and inside the house you have a modern kitchen, a shower room/bathroom and a main bathroom, private garden and patio, eat in kitchen and a spacious living room. The place is bright and airy with a lovely sized outdoor space. A bus ride or tube will take you into Central London and you'll be in Oxford St or Baker St in under 15 minutes. If you want to stay local, the nearby canal and Regent's Park is a wonderful place to stroll along and many shops and great restaurants are within a five minute walk. The house is in high order, and has a modern comfortable feel. I look forward to hosting you, if you're looking for a large, well situated place to stay while on a long trip to London! Any questions, please feel free to drop me a message. Entire house. Beautiful residential part of London, ye

name: 1 double-bed modern bright flat, SE1 (Borough Mkt)
summary: Stunning bright one double bedroom in between Elephant and Castle and Borough – very close to the iconic Borough Market and the Shard, well connected with all London airports. The bedroom features a bespoke raised double bed, in steel and Victorian pine, with in-built drawer unit and wardrobe, side boards and headboard. The bed is accessible through a ladder (see picture). New double sofa bed in the open plan kitchen.  Bathroom with shower and huge mirror.
space: Bright and spacious apartment. Wooden flooring throughout except for the bedroom and large windows leading to garden/patio. Linen and towels will be provided for your stay.  I will be there to meet you when you arrive in order to show you around and hand you over the keys. Situated in the most fantastic and vibrant SE1 area (zone1) with its markets, restaurants and cafés. Walking distance to the South bank, the Tate Gallery, the Globe, Borough Market and London Bridge to name but a few... Plenty of buses only minutes away from the flat and transport links (northern line and bakerloo line) close by.

house_rules: SHOES The flat is a shoe-free area, please don't forget to bring your slippers with you. Thanks! SMOKING  This is a non-smoking apartment therefore no smoking allowed. If you are a smoker you can use the garden, but at the same time be tidy with the litter. Whilst we are happy for you to have one friend visiting you for a coffee during your stay, we would like to be informed if you want to invite more than one person over. In any case, your guests can't stay overnight. ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES ALLOWED WITHIN THE APARTMENT nor disturbing the peace. If we receive a complaint or the police are called with good reason you will  be asked to leave without a refund and we will not be returning your deposit. We will charge cleaning fees for any wine spilled or any stains on walls, furniture, carpets and fixtures.

name: Double Room in  Edwardian House
space: Clean, quiet double bedded bedroom in beautiful Edwardian house in Acton, West London. TV, Internet access provided. Close transport, Acton Main Line is 11 minutes from Paddington and Acton Central is approx 30 minutes from Central London. Their are shops and restauarants very close by, with two great pubs, at the bottom of the road. Very friendly couple, who are here to help. Price is for couple. Price for single occupancy £65.00 per night. For price for weekly stay, please contact. The room is avialable all next year also. Prices are really for short lets. Full use of amenities, including kitchen. As an added attraction, you can get to meet Daisy and Maisy, the two Irish Wolhound sisters who i know will be happy to see you. Don't worry if your not a doggy person, as they live outside, in their own run. You will be given your own key, but a small refundable deposit of £10.00 is required, as they are special keys.

name: Georgian Aparment in Bloomsbury
space: Two floor Georgian Apartment with a double bedroom for rent, new renovation in Bloomsbury, the heart of London. This apt has all amenities you need plus a small outdoor deck / garden. Despite the central location the apt is very quiet, especially at evenings and weekends. This apartment has WIFI internet, a washer and dryer, iron and ironing board, wardrobe and drawers for your clothes, a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, separate dining room, the bathroom has a walk in shower and underfloor heating, movies and through room music system available. Washing machine and dryer on site too. Cooking is welcome, tea and coffee provided. Clean sheets and towels provided. Single or couples welcome. No parking available. No extra people to stay unless pre-arranged when booking.

The British Museum is on the other side of Russell Sq, the West End and Soho all within a 20 minute walk. Shoreditch, East London's new art district is close, with galleries, boutiques and restaurants, and is a 20 minute bus ride. The Tate and the South Bank is a 20 minute bus ride to the river.
notes: The cleaning fee is £41 for each week you stay. I will adjust this when it comes to you booking.
transit: Conveniently situated, a 7 minute walk from Russell Sq tube (Piccadilly Line straight from Heathrow) and less than a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross tube and St. Pancras International Rail Station.
house_rules: No shoes to be worn inside - especially high heels as they will damage the wood floors.  No extra guests.

name: Spacious luxury 2 bedroom apartment
space: Light spacious and modern luxury 2 bedroom maisonette apartment. All mod cons, terrace, bath shower separate wc open plan kitchen, dishwasher etc. The apartment is in walking distance to both Shepherds Bush and East Acton stations. From those you can hop on the Central Line and be in Oxford Circus in 15 minutes for shopping, theatres and shows. The Shepherds Bush Westfield Shopping Centre is a short 5 minutes bus drive away. There you'll find many different shops and restaurants to suit any taste.  For transport to major airports and train stations, the flat is very conveniently located. It is just a 20 minute drive to Heathrow and would cost approximately £18 in a taxi. For other airports;  you can easily take the tube to Victoria for the Gatwick Express, or the Central Line is direct from Shepherd's Bush to Liverpool Street where you can catch the Stansted Express. Parking available with Visitor Parking Permit which costs £3,50 per day.

name: Stylish apartment in trendy Dalston
summary: Brand new and very spacious one bedroom apartment situated in a quiet little street in the heart of Dalston, currently the most exciting and arty neighbourhood in London. Excellent transport links-only 20 mins from the West End (downtown London)!
space: The apartment is very modern and spacious, it has a brand new kitchen with all mod cons, light wooden floors throughout the living areas, washer/dryer, power shower, wi-fi, and a very safe entry phone system.  There's only one double bedroom so it really fits 2 people only; that said, it's a big flat for 2 people, you will be extremely comfortable here. Please note that a few things have been improved since these photos were taken and there's now more room both in the bedroom and in the living room as some shelving units have gone, plus there is a bigger tv on the wall in the living room...everything looks much sleeker and cooler now :)
description: Brand new and very spacious one bedroom apartment situated in a quiet little street in the heart of Dalston, currently the most exciting and arty neighbourhood in London. Excellent transport links-only 20 mins from the West End (downtown London)! The apartment is very modern and spacious, it has a brand new kitchen with all mod cons, light wooden floors throughout the living areas, washer/dryer, power shower, wi-fi, and a very safe entry phone system.  There's only one double bedroom so it really fits 2 people only; that said, it's a big flat for 2 people, you will be extremely comfortable here. Please note that a few things have been improved since these photos were taken and there's now more room both in the bedroom and in the living room as some shelving units have gone, plus there is a bigger tv on the wall in the living room...everything looks much sleeker and cooler now :) Guests will have the whole apartment for themselves, which means they'll have access to full kitchen, washer
neighborhood_overview: Dalston is part of the borough of Hackney, in East London, and it's  the place to be for artists, musicians, designers and the whole of London's creative industries. Even the Guardian has recently described it as "the coolest place in Britain". It's been undergoing a huge regeneration, due to its proximity to the Olympic area (only 4 stops away), and it now boasts lots of trendy cafes, restaurants, music venues, theatres and an art house cinema; if that wasn't enough, Shoreditch and Hoxton are just 10 mins away. The lovely London Fields park is also only a 10 mins walk away. If you're looking for an exciting time in London Dalston is definitely the place for you, but if you're not so keen on partying it will accommodate your needs too as the residential streets like mine are extremely quiet and perfect for some relaxing time.
transit: Public transport in the area is excellent, the tube is only 2 mins away and will take you to the West End in 20 mins. There are also bus stops just one min away, with buses taking you to Liverpool St station in 15 mins, Kings Cross St Pancras station in 20 mins and even to the West End in just 35 mins. There are several minicab offices too on the high street, just around the corner
access: Guests will have the whole apartment for themselves, which means they'll have access to full kitchen, washer/dryer, wi-fi internet, 40" tv (not the small ones in the pictures,i upgraded since they were taken!), huge bathroom with tub and power shower.
house_rules: There aren't really that many rules, I just hope you will be respectful of the place and treat it like your own.  It's a quiet building so please no loud music/noises after 10pm. And more importantly, no smoking under any circumstances, the fire alarms are ridiculously sensitive (and ridiculously loud!). Other than that, just enjoy the apartment :)

name: Apartment in the heart of Bayswater
space: The apartment has two rooms. The master bedroom has a king size bed with an ensuite bathroom while the second room has a queen size bed. Both rooms are fitted with a TV. The master bedroom has a 40 inch LED TV and a 32 inch TV for the second room. The living room has a 3D 60 inch TV and is the only apartment in the block with a balcony. The living room opens up to the kitchen.  The apartment also comes with a car park space and a porter. The neighbourhood restaurants are world renowned, this includes the Four Seasons Roast Duck restaurant located 50 steps away, the lobster noodle restaurant called Mandarin Kitchen as well as the New Fortune Cookie and Royal China restaurant. The neighbourhood is home to an international list of restaurants serving Indian, Malaysian, Greek and Brazilian cuisines to name a few. The  Whiteleys Mall is just minutes walk from the apartment. It is also minutes walk to Queensway and Bayswater tube station as well as Hyde Park.

name: Gorgeous Modern 3 Bed Flat in Willesden Green
summary: Bright and spacious 3 bedroom flat in a lovely residential area in Kensal Green. With modern, minimalist décor and all modern conveniences, and offers an open plan kitchen, dining and living area, as well as a bath. This flat is perfect for a family, or a group of friends looking for a relaxing stay in London. The Overground and Tube station is just a 7 minute walk away with great connections into Central London.
space: The flat has got 3 good sized double bedrooms an open plan living room/kitchen space with a dining area for 6 people. It has a good sized bathroom with a bath. It is a modern minimal space which has recently been decorated. The apartment provides hotel quality linen and towels for each guest. The neighbourhood is quiet and friendly.
description: Bright and spacious 3 bedroom flat in a lovely residential area in Kensal Green. With modern, minimalist décor and all modern conveniences, and offers an open plan kitchen, dining and living area, as well as a bath. This flat is perfect for a family, or a group of friends looking for a relaxing stay in London. The Overground and Tube station is just a 7 minute walk away with great connections into Central London. The flat has got 3 good sized double bedrooms an open plan living room/kitchen space with a dining area for 6 people. It has a good sized bathroom with a bath. It is a modern minimal space which has recently been decorated. The apartment provides hotel quality linen and towels for each guest. The neighbourhood is quiet and friendly. Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay. My support team or I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay. Situated in the middle of Brent, surrounded by Harlesden, Brondesbury Park, Kensal Rise and Kilburn l
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the middle of Brent, surrounded by Harlesden, Brondesbury Park, Kensal Rise and Kilburn lies Kensal Green. Conveniently situated just 5 miles northwest of Charing Cross, Kensal Green has some fantastic local facilities including the newly redeveloped library, sports centre and the beautiful open spaces of Roundwood Park. It is a 30min walk to the popular Portobello Road in Notting Hill with it's vibrant weekend market and variety of restaurants and bar and independent shops. It is a popular tourist attraction due to the Notting Hill movie and the individual character of the  neighbourhood. The flat is one tube stop away from Shepherds bush where you can find Westfields, Londons largest shopping centre with anything from high end designer shops to high street brands. There is also a variety of restaurants with flavours from all over the world and a 5 min walk from Holland Park which is one of the most affluent neighbourhoods in London. This vibrant area of North West London
transit: The flat is a 6 minute walk away from Willesden Green station which has both overground and tube connections including  the Jubilee line and Bakerloo line, and a 12 minute walk away from Kensal Green station. From Willesden Green it's only an 18 minute to GreenPark and Oxford Circus and 28 minutes to Waterloo.  The overground takes you south to the beautiful parks of Richmond and Kew Gardens or east to the trendy borough of Hackney where you can explore the vibrant Broadway market of the creative hipster area Hackney Wick.  There are also plenty of buses nearby which can take you all around London.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
house_rules: - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. - Please treat the home as you would your own.

name: London Bridge, Zipstays, Dbl/Twin beds
summary: Please 'Contact Host' before 'Request to Book' to check availability and avoid  a mistaken confirmation. We manage the calendar to offer last minute availability.  Read my blog on my site: zipstays for further explanation and to discover our Special Climate Change Offer to help offset the carbon emissions of your trip.  At present, the prices discount 14% (or one night) for a week, on the nightly price, and a whopping 50% on a month.
space: This two bedroom, two bathroom apartment is suitable for up to 4 adults in a queensize bed and either: 2 single beds OR a queensize bed.  It is provided with weekly cleaning and broadband.  An air conditioning unit is available if needed (see below). This self-catering apartment is ideal for a short stay for holiday or business. It is just one minute walk from some of the best views of London, between London Bridge and Tower Bridge.  Across the street is the riverside walkway with the best views of London towards Tower Bridge and the City of London - great at night! You can walk on the riverside upriver passing the Borough Food Market, Southwark Cathedral, Vinopolis, Shakespeare Globe Theatre, Tate Modern, Millennium Bridge (which crosses the river to St Pauls Cathedral).  After the Tate Modern, you can then walk on via Blackfriars Bridge past the Oxo Tower to the South Bank Arts Centre and the London Eye - the full walk is very popular and has great views of London all the way.  This

An air conditioning unit is available if needed (see below). This self-catering apartment is ideal for a short stay for holiday or business. It is just one minute walk from some of the best views of London, between London Bridge and Tower Bridge.  Across the street is the riverside walkway with the best views of London towards Tower Bridge and the City of London - great
neighborhood_overview: The general area has lots of people and activity in the day time, and is quieter in the evenings.  It is located 30 seconds walk from the riverside, with great views of Tower Bridge.  The South Bank walkway extends west to Westminster. In the last 15 years, London Bridge and Tooley Street has become a modern environment, while not losing aspects of the original area. The new riverside development (called More London Place) is beside the Mayor of London's building.  There is a Hilton Hotel across the street.  Tesco and M&S food and general shops are across the street.  There are many restaurants and pubs within 1-3 minutes walk.  Check out the George Inn on Borough High Street, the oldest coaching inn in the UK. The area was a stopping place for pilgrims going to Canterbury, and famously associated with Shakespeare and Dickens.  The famous Borough Food Market is about 3 minutes walk, the area has traditionally been associated with food imports being at this location on the river.  Acros
notes: This is a hidden gem, probably listed at the end of the listings.  Good find!  We have been providing apartments since the year 2000, long ago when the world seemed like a bigger place.  Now our site is zipstays, and you'll find me at home there.
transit: Being within 3 minutes walk of the new London Bridge station, it is easy to get to anywhere located near a Jubilee or Northern Line stop as well as British Railway (closest airport is Gatwick on a direct route).  It is also a good place to start walking along the South Bank or across the bridge to the City.  It is only 5 minutes from Trafalgar Square via train, less than 8 minutes from Green Park/West End by tube, 10 minutes from Canary Wharf in the east, 10 minutes from Greenwich in the south/east by train, and only 4 stops north to Holborn for Covent Garden.
access: Guests are met at an easily findable place near the apartment on arrival, this is to avoid people getting lost.  They are asked for an expected time of arrival, to text from the airport or an hour in advance of arrival and when at the meeting point.

name: Double Bedroom in Victorian House
summary: This double bedroom has a double size bed, 2 big wardrobes, a desk with chair, a chest of drawers and a view of the back garden. £180 per week. £740 per month. For two guests: £250 per week and £1080 per month. Longer term bookings could get a discount after a 2-week stay.
space: You will share the rest of the house with the other tenants (if there are any) and us. There is a washing machine, high-speed internet (220Mb) and a 32-inch Freeview TV with sports channels.  We have various rooms available in the house, please see our other listings and get in touch if you have any questions. Since we love our house so much we ask people to keep their rooms tidy and clean up in the kitchen and bathroom after use. You will have your own cupboard in the kitchen and space in the fridge, so please, don't bring food in your room. All our kitchen appliances are available to our guests, from Italian coffee machines to our high-speed pizza oven.

notes: For short term stays there is coffee, various teas, sugar, salt/pepper and toilet paper provided. Beyond 2-week stays are expected to buy their own.
transit: Public transport is great here and we're in zone 2, it takes 15 minutes to get to Westfield shopping centre at Stratford, 25 minutes to the Tower of London and 30 minutes to Big Ben, just to give you an idea. We are also fortunate to have a night bus from Regent Street to a bus stop 2 minutes walk from our house (N15). And don't forget the Underground runs Friday and Saturday all night as well, not all but at least the main ones. Extended transport: Underground: Canning Town ( Underground Jubilee line and DLR): 6 minutes by bus or 20 minutes walk Plaistow: 5 minutes by bus Bus:  Stratford with Westfield shopping center 15 mins. National Express buses to and from Stansted leave from here as well. Excel/Custom House Exhibition center: 5 mins / 20 minutes on foot O2 Arena:  15 mins away. City Airport: 10 mins
access: You will most likely share the whole house with us and the other (generally) international guests.
house_rules: Just keep your room tidy and respect the other guests. There's no particular time you have to be in and you'll have your own set of keys to the house. We keep the living room, staircase, kitchen and bathroom clean. You can use the washing machine and have drying racks to put in the patio if the weather allows it, otherwise we'll tell you where we dry our laundry at the local launderette.

name: The Gold Suite, The Villes B&B
space: The Villes is a boutique bed and breakfast situated in a quiet, residential street in the popular ‘villes’ area of Parsons Green. It has been beautifully decorated throughout, and provides an atmosphere of comfort, calm and tranquillity whilst only a few minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of Fulham.  The area is friendly, vibrant and buzzing with fashionable restaurants, cafes, bistros and pubs. The exclusive boutiques and antique shops of the Kings Road and Fulham Road are a stroll away.  Parking is on a 'Pay & Display' basis from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Taxis are in abundance. Buses and Parsons Green underground station are within a 5 minute walk, providing all necessary links to the West End and Central London.  All bedrooms are equipped with multi-channel televisions, wireless internet access, hairdryers, bath robes and hospitality trays bearing a variety of herbal teas, coffee and biscuits.  All beds are beautifully dressed with Egyptian cotton bed linen, duck down duvets and

name: Architect designed Camden canalside townhouse
summary: A unique and spacious canal side townhouse designed by award winning architect, Sir Nicholas Grimshaw.  Cool, quirky, quiet yet minutes from the buzz of Camden.
space: A beautifully designed, bright, spacious, airy 3 storey central london townhouse overlooking the Regents Canal.  The flat is split over 3 floors with the main bedrooms on the top and ground floor offering privacy for the middle floor with an open plan lounge, double height ceilings and island kitchen leading on to a balcony overlooking the canal.  -2 minutes from Camden Tube underground - Next door to a major supermarket and minutes from all the buzz of camden market, it's bars & restaurants - within 15 minutes to the west end or anywhere central - excellent bus/ tube links - 15 minutes walk to regents park and primrose hill (along the canal) - 10 minutes from St Pancras (Eurostar) and Kings Cross - parking available (no extra cost)  - Recently painted and floors sanded (March 2017) NB the plants and some of the art in the photos are no longer there  General description: -Overlooking Regents canal -3 double bedrooms + 2 bathrooms (3rd bedroom has a mattress)  - bright and airy -balcony

name: Home from Home in the heart of London
space: 1 Double rooms with tv, wifi, and a super-cozy kingsize comfortable bed in a two bedroom apartment. You'd be sharing , (but not necessarily as I am most of the time away)the rest of the facilities like the kitchen, the bathroom with shower and bath and the separate toilet with one other person.  Close to all amenities like shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants and supermarkets and only 5 minutes walk to Barons Court Tube Station, on the Picadilly and District lines, it makes for a perfect stay as it is only 15 minutes tube journey to touristic spots like Piccadilly Circus, The Big Ben and London Bridge.  10 minutes walk from the house you'll also find bus stops with day and night connections to the whole of London so you can reach the apartment any time of day.   Heathrow Airport is 45 minutes away and the journey is very straightforward since the Picadilly Line stops in both locations. To be clear, the booking would be for 1 room only with a maximum of 3 guests with 2   separate beds.  Look

house_rules: There is no smoking allowed and unfortunately I don't take any smokers. I would appreciate if guest would look and feel like he is in his own home that mean reasonably clean, close the outside door after themselves,and not to damage and destroy anything. For ladies they should pick up their hair after they wash it and after shower or bath just splash the bath with the water - 15 seconds. It is not nice to leave the hair in the bath from any part of body. Also not colouring hair ; painting the nails on duvet covers or cleaning make-up with the towels.  If you use the kitchen please wash the dishes after yourself unless you arrive with a personal maid. Just that!

name: Self Contained Bedroom
space: I am offering a self contained loft conversion in a beautiful four bedroomed house with good transport links to central london.   The room itself is very quiet, clean and modern and is located away from everyone else.  In addition, you will be given your own access.   The location is great with Ealing Broadway underground station just a short bus journey away with easy access to central London.  There are lots of buses that will take you around the local area and getting to and from London's biggest Airport hub, Heathrow is particularly convenient due to our lovely West London location.   In a similar vein, anyone looking to drive during their stay will find parking in this area much easier, which makes this a great jumping off point for great day trips to Oxford, Stonehenge and Bath.  There are a number golf courses nearby for those who like to indulge that hobby.  I'm really looking forward to hosting many guests and please don't hesitate to get in touch with any questions you may ha

neighborhood_overview: You are making the right choice by picking wembley! The London neighbourhood is really easy to get to/from central London as it is served well by public transport and even more attractive is the diverse culture that Wembley exudes!  Sweet smells of spices and scents come from the shops and after a gig or concert at nearby Wembley stadium there are lots of delightful local drinkeries and eateries at the worlds famous London Designer Outlet village!
notes: Free bedsheets are provided and free towels can also be provided on request
transit: It is so simple to travel around ...the local London underground/overground tube station is just 7 minutes walk away ( bakerloo line and London overground) and Wembley Park underground station is just 10 mins away too served by the jubilee line which runs all night long!  There are also a large number of buses that serve the area, taking you to and from central London!  The easiest way to get to the apartment is via London Heathrow airport which is served by the piccadilly line and is just 45 minutes away, alternatively, London Gatwick airport is simple and easy to get to from London Bridge station via the jubilee line and will take just 90 minutes!  Once you arrive at this easy to reach apartment if you want to stay local you can take a short stroll up to the high street which has everything from Tesco supermarket to Boots pharmacy !
access: You will have access to the kitchen, bathroom and living room ...all beautifully well kept areas! The living room contains a 42 inch tv and comfortable leather sofas and there is storage space within both the bathroom and kitchen.
house_rules: Available on arrival, but the most important rule of all is to make yourself feel at home! Whilst you are in London mi Casa es su Casa :-)

notes: Parking London is not car-friendly and we recommend that guests travel to, and around, London by public transport. London roads are congested and there are parking restrictions on the roads around the apartment and in most parts of London and especially the centre. The parking bays on Beaconsfield Road are restricted during the hours of 8:00AM to 6:30PM on Mondays-Saturdays. Guests may park in these bays from 6:30PM to 8:00AM on Mondays-Saturdays and all day on Sunday but cars parked in the bays outside these times are subject to fines, clamping, and / or towing and any resulting fines & fees are the sole responsibility of the guests. There are private parking places (like personal driveways and garages) available close by the apartment that advertise on parking websites such as (Website hidden by Airbnb) (Website hidden by Airbnb) (Website hidden by Airbnb) and (Website hidden by Airbnb) which can be pre-booked on-line, and parking places may be available quite close to the apartment
transit: Transport links Seven Sisters has excellent transport links including a Tube (Subway) Station on the Victoria line, a Railway Station, and numerous bus routes some of which are 24 hour night buses. The apartment is just 7½ minutes walk to Seven Sisters Tube Station, and from there the whole of London is within easy reach including: • King’s Cross Station (transport hub) - 3 stops (10 minutes ride) • Holborn (for British Museum) – 5 stops (16 minutes ride) • Camden Town Station (for the World-famous Camden Lock Market and the shops of Camden High Street) – 5 stops (21 minutes ride) • Oxford Circus Station & Covent Garden (World-famous for shopping) – 6 stops (18 minutes ride) • Leicester Square & Piccadilly Circus (great for London’s West End theatres & cinemas) – 7 stops (20 minutes ride) • Green Park Station (for Buckingham Palace and Hyde Park) – 7 stops (18 minutes ride) • Liverpool Street (for London’s financial heart and Petticoat Lane Sunday Market) - 7 stops (25 minutes ride) •
access: Guests will have sole use of the entire apartment
house_rules: To ensure your stay is comfortable and happy for you, your neighbours, and for me, please follow these simple house rules. FIRST RULE – Have FUN and ensure you have many happy memories of your visit to London to take home. Check-in and Check-out - Check-in time is 2pm - 6pm and Check-out is 9am - 11am. Check-in or Check-out outside these hours are by arrangement only. There will be a charge of £25 for check-in at unsocial hours (after 8pm). Cleanliness - Please leave the property as you found it (clean, tidy). The flat will be clean for you, so please take off your shoes on entry (bring slippers for your comfort). Respect for neighbours and Noise - One of the charms of the apartment is that it is in a residential area, with neighbours that include young professionals, families and elderly people. It is imperative that guests respect neighbours' rights to quiet and privacy, so no noise is allowed that can be heard from neighbouring properties, and no parties are allowed. Any disturbance
