neighborhood_overview: Crouch End and environs  Crouch end is a great area. Many of its population come from the creative industries; television, music, film, theatre and publishing who are drawn to the area for its laid back atmosphere and cafe society. The nicest thing about the area is that there are mainly independent shops rather than chains. Shopkeepers know the locals by name and it gives the area a more eclectic vibe. It's popular with young people and with families so it has something for everyone. You will never go hungry in Crouch End! There are so many good cafes and restaurants, all very reasonably priced. Whatever kind of food you like, you will find it within a mile of the flat. But mostly just a five minute walk. I can recommend places based on your tastes so please ask. There are two great cinemas just five minutes walk from the flat. There are also four supermarkets and dozens of small food shops open til late, organic shops, butchers, fishmongers and wonderful bakeries. If, like me , you l
notes: The flat is professionally cleaned before and after your visit. If you require additional cleaning/ironing services then this can be arranged. If your visit is longer than 7 days, then you will need to wash and dry sheets and towels yourself (or take to the local launderette). Please note that latest check in time is 9pm. If you arrive between 9 and 12 pm a further £30 will be charged. From 12-2 a further £50.
transit: Transport  Rail  From Hornsey rail station. Walk left from station up the hill. At the crest you will see the police station on the right, cross over and Harold Road is just to the right. This is an overground train just a few minutes from the flat that goes to the city and also connects with tube to take you to the west end or further Its a five minute bus ride to/from Finsbury Park (W3 bus) to round the corner from the flat. Finsbury Park houses the Victoria and Piccadilly lines which will get you to Central London in 20 minutes. You can also connect to the overground train to the city in 10 minutes and there are loads of busses. The No 91 bus goes to Trafalgar square via Euston and Kings Cross and is just two minutes from the flat.  The No 41 bus takes a local route to Archway where you an take the Northern line tube into Camden, the West End and Waterloo. Mini cabs are plentiful if you don't want to use public transport.
access: Guests renting the whole apartment will have sole access to the garden.
house_rules: So that you can enjoy the apartment (and I can sleep at night) there are a few things you should know. This is my home and you are welcome. Please treat it with respect. If you have any problems, then do let me know and I will do my very best to sort it out quickly. Please be tidy and clear up after yourselves. Neighbours  Please be mindful and considerate of the neighbours. I have good relationships with them and would not wish to upset them. No loud noise after 11pm and absolutely no additional visitors. Security and safety - non negotiables  The front door to the house and the door to the flat have two locks each. It is vital you double lock both doors every time to arrive and leave. It is a safe area but as in any city, you need to follow basic security. You will be provided with one set of keys. Please do not give them to anyone else. The back door has keys and deadlocks and should be locked when you leave the house. STRICTLY No smoking in the building. You may smoke at the back o

You are welcome to make drinks in the kitchen and use the microwave.  You can use the dining room overlooking the garden. I enjoy chatting with guests and finding out about their lifestyle and what they enjoy. The world famous William Morris Gallery is situated 5 minutes' walk away in Lloyd Park.  It hosts a now well established Art Trail in June every biennially.  There are many cafes, restaurants and at least two micro breweries!  There's always a great choi
neighborhood_overview: Walthamstow is a vibrant area with a lot to see and do.  The world famous William Morris Gallery is situated 5 minutes' walk away in Lloyd Park.  It hosts a now well established Art Trail in June every biennially.  There are many cafes, restaurants and at least two micro breweries!  There's always a great choice of films showing at the nearby Empire cinema and there are live music venues.  A swimming pool and leisure centre is a 10 minute walk from the house. A short walk from the house will take you to shops and the historic village area.  Walthamstow has a traditional London market which sells fruit, vegetables, clothes, household goods and general odds and ends. It is colourful and lively and definitely worth a visit.  I also recommend a visit to the Lee Valley Regional Park. This natural space stretches 26 miles along the banks of the River Lee, from Ware in Hertfordshire, through Tottenham and Hackney, to the Thames at East India Dock Basin. It is great for walking, cycling and bi
transit: The house has excellent transport links to central London, several airports and the 2012 Olympic site, with London's newest green space, the Queen Elizabeth Park.  We are 7 minutes' walk from a London Underground Victoria Line stop, Walthamstow Central, which will take you to Kings Cross/St Pancras in 15 minutes or Oxford Circus in 20 minutes. If you want a more scenic ride into central London, you can always take the bus. From St Pancras you can take the Eurostar or will have easy access to Heathrow, Gatwick and Luton airports.  From Walthamstow Central, in addition to the tubes and buses, there is the London Overground train that will take you to Liverpool Street Station in the heart of the City in less than 20 minutes. A 10 minute bus or tube ride will take you to Tottenham Hale to catch the Stansted Express for Stansted airport.
access: Guests have free wifi. You are welcome to make drinks in the kitchen and use the microwave.  You can use the dining room overlooking the garden.
house_rules: Please leave your shoes downstairs.

name: Quiet and cozy garden flat  London
summary: Comfortable ground floor garden flat in Wood Green in a quiet street. Great transport links,  7 minutes walk from Wood Green tube on the Piccadilly Line which is 20 minutes to central London. Surrounded by parks and easy access to Alexandra Palace.
space: This is newly refurbished flat is in a quiet residential street near parks and amenities - shopping 10 min walk. Close to Alexandra Palace, Crouch End and Muswell Hill with their restaurants and bars - a popular part of London with good transport links. One double room - big garden (BBQ!) Street permit parking New fitted kitchen with dining area - gas hob and electric oven Sofa bed in lounge Bathroom with shower and bath Gas central heating Wood Green N22 5SS - 7 mins walk from the tube station, Piccadilly line - 20 mins to Kings Cross and 15 min walk from Alexandra Palace overground which goes into Old St. Good bus transport links.Most popular central London destinations are no more than 30 minutes away. Alexandra Palace is host to a variety of exhibitions, concerts and a large ice skating rink, within easy reach of bus, train & tube stations to all parts of London.

name: Large cosy modern London house
space: We have a friendly cat, Monty, who will be at the house while we are away and will need to be fed everyday. We have adjusted the price to reflect this. This lovely modern house in a quiet no through road, 2mins walk to Ladywell village/ station / shops / buses and great gastro pubs. 3 mins walk to green spaces such as Ladywell fields and hilly fields both of which have received extensive investment. 10 mins to London Bridge / 20 mins to Charing Cross. Historic Greenwich and Dulwich are a short bus ride a way. The house amenities include: - 1 double, 1 twin and 1 single room. - Master bedroom room with King size bed and floor to ceiling sliding wardrobe with ample storage space. - A luxurious bathroom with large shower bath / power shower / heated towel rail / stone flooring. - A 27 foot living/dining area with 37 inch flat screen TV. - Wifi - Internet TV with netflix/prime - A 55 ft mature garden for bbq's. - A modern well equipped eat in kitchen looking over the garden. - Stripped woo

neighborhood_overview: Ladywell village is a 2 minute stroll away where you will find an excellent range of shops and places to eat.  Fancy a sour dough pizza? Then check out the stylish new pizza place. Or maybe you'd prefer something spicy then the Indian food restaurant will serve you up some hot classic dishes. If traditional British is what you are after then the Ladywell Tavern pub serves delicious food and has a great selection of craft beer.  For a hearty breakfast there is a chic coffee shop Oscar's, a French patisserie La Delice and a workman's cafe which serves up a full English breakfast. Of the many shops in the village some highlights are a local butcher's, a delicatessen and a gift shop.
transit: Ladywell station is under 5 minutes stroll away which will whisk you into central London and all the tourist attractions in no time. London Bridge for Borough market is under 10 minutes. Waterloo and the south bank are only 15 minutes away and Charing Cross near Trafalgar Square in the West End is 20 minutes away.

name: STUNNING ACCOMODATION FOR OLYMPICS
space: A spacious 2 bedroom and 2 bathroon flat, located within minutes of the Olympic Stadium and set in the most incredible grounds.    The flat includes 2 bed, 2 bath, a spacious living/dining room, an open plan kitchen and a balcony with full view on the Stadium. The flat is fully furnished and located in a modern and recent building with 24h concierge and private car park. Very close to the Olympic village and the main stadium it is easily accessible by DLR, tube and bus.

name: Self Isolate - Frontline - NHS - Safe, Secure 2BR
summary: NHS Staff - Doctors - Nurses - Front Line Workers Safe and Comfortable Self-Isolation  Ready to move-in - just bring your luggage. Normally used for corporate and holiday rentals, this is a secure, comfortable, fully-furnished / equipped 2 bedroom and 1 bathroom apartment in London's Marylebone. 10 mins walk to St Mary’s Hospital Just 5 minutes away from Edgware Road Station & Marble Arch station If you wish to self-isolate or are required to do so, this may be an excellent option for you.
space: This two-bedroom apartment is spacious and relaxing, the ideal place to come back to after a day of exploring and it sleeps 6 thanks to the sofa bed. Great transport links mean you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle!  In the master bedroom, get a wonderful night’s rest on the super comfortable double bed, fitted with fresh, luxury linens. There is also plenty of storage space, so you won’t have to live out of your suitcase; get unpacking and start feeling at home right away. Iron and ironing board are provided to ensure any smart clothing is always ready to go’  The living area is light and airy with a modern design and lovely finishing touches. There is a large sofa, which unfolds into a double bed, and flat-screen TV. Sit back and make yourself at home! Wood flooring and high ceilings complete the room.  If you want to cook up a meal or two, you’ll find everything you need in the stylish kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use,

neighborhood_overview: The best part about being a guest in this apartment is the great central location. Whether you staying for pleasure as a tourist or here for business, you are in a great Central London spot!  You'll be staying in between of the beautiful Marylebone and the vibrant Paddington, charming neighbourhoods full of lovely cafes, great restaurants, lovely shops and fun pubs!  My apartment is walking distance from some major London attractions like Hyde Park, Regent's Park, Oxford Street, Baker Street and Madame Tussauds. There are countless fantastic restaurants around.  Dining is an inventive mix of sushi and Japanese tapas-style dishes served in simple surroundings. The idea is genially tasty, give it a try.  If you fancy some pub-food, head towards the Grazing Goat, a spacious gastropub with contemporary country house-style interior, for traditional British cuisine. If you want to experience Oriental atmospheres, we recommend Maroush, a large, 2-floor family friendly Lebanese restaurant, wit
notes: We operate a "meet and greet" check in service offering our guest flexibility when making travel arrangements.  Normal check in hours are 2.00pm to 7.00pm.  Outside of these hours, the following charges will apply: Arrivals between 7.00pm and midnight:  GBP 55.00  Arrivals between midnight and 6.00am: GBP 100.00 An early check can be offered subject to availability and a fee of GBP 55.00 Please note that all fees are payable in cash upon arrival.
transit: Public transport is very convenient.  There are many buses from Edgware Road taking you all over London.  Edgware Road tube station is just 5 minutes distant connecting to Victoria, Circle and Bakerloo lines. Just at a 12-minute walk distance you also have Paddington Train station, one of the main train hubs in London.
access: Guests can access the entire apartment. It is paramount that we are respectful towards our neighbours.
house_rules: ID must be shown upon entry. The apartment will be prepared for the total number of guests stated at the time of booking.  Additional guests may be permitted subject to an additional fee however the total number of guests must NOT exceed the stated occupancy of the apartment.  Our apartments are strictly NO Smoking .  Pets are NOT permitted.  The apartment is in a residential building / street so we ask all guests to respect our neighbours.  Loud music and above normal noise between 11.00pm and 8.00am is strictly prohibited.

We advice you let us know as soon as possible, if you planning to extend your stay.  (Website hidden by Airbnb) YOUR ROOM  Please keep your room tidy. house_rules: 2 persons allowed only - no guests at any time No meet and greet. I prefer to use an innovative self serve access product provided by Smarterkey. I will send out self check in instructions prior to arrival for accessing your room suite.. If you need advice on where to eat, drink or things to do I'm happy to oblige either in person or by phone.The house number is on the outside of the building, so it should be pretty easy to find. If any problems feel free to call me or i can call you. Once you have arrived there will be key cards provided that open the house front door and your double en-suite bedroom door. With this key you can come and go as you wish. The internet wi-fi code will be texted to you upon arrival and is obviously free to use as you wish. Bed linen, towels and toiletries are included. Check-in time is as we have agreed via email. When it comes to checking out, you can simply leave the key in the bedroom and go, should i not be around to say goodbye. The professional clean

name: Large House with 5 Double Bedrooms
summary: Large five bedroom Victorian house with three bathrooms. Close to Leyton Central Line tube station (Zone 3) connecting to central London in 30 minutes. Also very close to the Olympic Park.
space: There are five comfortable double bedrooms in this spacious bright Victorian house. Each of the five bedrooms has a UK size double bed. Two of the bedrooms have an en suite shower/bathroom. The third bathroom and WC is shared with the remaining three bedrooms. Two of the bathrooms are en suite ones on the second floor and the third bathroom is a shared one on the first floor. There is a garden annexe separate to the house where I stay in when I am renting the house out. The house is in Zone 3 next to Leyton Central Line Tube station about 30 minutes from the centre of London. There’s a 24 hour night bus running from central London (route N26) to a bus stop which is just a few minutes’ walk away from the house. Also, the tubes tun 24 hours on Friday and Saturday nights. Nearby Stratford is also the home of one of the largest urban shopping centres in Europe - Westfield Stratford City and the Olympic Park. There is fast stable fibre optic WIFI internet connection. neighborhood_overview: 'Leyton Technical' is a pub and restaurant on the old town hall with a great interior and atmosphere.  'Leyton Star' is another local pub with good food that I would recommend. Stratford City shopping centre is nearby and very convenient.
transit: Leyton Central Line tube is a few minutes walk from the house and connects to central London in around 30 minutes.  For tube travel, contactless bank cards can be used (which is cheaper than using cash). If you don't have a contactless bank card I recommend buying an Oyster card for tube travel (as it is also cheaper than cash).  There is permit controlled parking outside the house. I can provide permits which cost £3 per day. Permits are needed from 10am until 4pm weekdays. Parking is free at other times.
access: Guests have full use of the kitchen with dishwasher, dual oven, gas hob, microwave oven, coffee machine, washing machine and tumble dryer.  The is a lounge with large TV, piano and dining table. Back garden for smoking or relaxing (which I also use sometimes).
house_rules: Please make sure that the house is properly locked when leaving and windows closed, if no one is in please also double lock the front door. Also, please don't leave the loft windows  or loft balcony doors open as the rain will come in if it rains. Many thanks! If you need something or are unsure about anything, please ask. I want your stay to be as pleasant as possible.

name: Central London Hideaway in the trees, SE1
summary: Perfectly formed central London flat - walking distance from the Thames, Tate, Borough Market. PLEASE NOTE: I am only looking to rent for a month or so over the summer, from mid July and all of August - exact dates and duration are negotiable. I can offer a discount if you are interested in that period.
space: Studio flat in central London with access to Borough and Elephant & Castle tubes. Walking distance to Southbank and Borough Market. Set on the top floor of a Victorian mansion block, this flat is comprised of a purpose built loft bed, with bed underneath for an extra guest, cute kitchen and dining area. It looks out over a lovely quiet park. It is bright and airy, with art on the walls and full of books and nice things. As it is on the top floor there is even sneaky access to the roof, with views across London! But please note - there is no lift! There is a lovely, full size bathroom with warm shower, wireless internet. It would ideally suit a couple on a budget looking to experience proper London living. I am not looking to make tons of money, so am looking for the right people. I work in the arts, love to travel and would love to house friendly people looking for an affordable home from home. summary: Clean well-equipped apt and terrace in very central desirable arty and foodie Fitzrovia, W1. Free wifi. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs & supermarkets.
space: Give your stay the wow factor in this stunning central London penthouse  located in wonderful Fitzroy Street in the heart of Fitzrovia (W1T 4BL)! If you're looking for something special, this is it. This gorgeous contemporary, light and bright, clean apartment is tastefully decorated and offers everything you'll need you'll need for an enjoyable, stylish, convenient, comfortable stay.  It is well-maintained and is offered in excellent condition. There is woodstrip flooring throughout. There is free unlimited wifi access and free Netflix (film service) through the TV. Patio doors open to a stunning large sunny terrace.  With views of two landmarks - the London Eye and the BT Tower - enjoy your own haven above the streets of London. It's the perfect place to watch the sun go down after a day around town. We go out of our way to offer a good service to guests. neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location! You won’t find better than this! Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz.  Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and everything in between.  If
notes: Non-smoking apartment
transit: You can walk to tourist London or take numerous transport options close by.  Our closest tubes are Warren Street, Goodge Street, Euston Square (all within 5 minute walk) and Tottenham Court Road and St Pancras (within a 10 minute walk) Coming from Heathrow? Easy! Take the tube from Paddington direct to Euston Square  Coming from Gatwick? Easy! Take the tube from Victoria direct to Warren Street Coming from Eurostar? Easy! Take a bus along the Euston Road or take the tube direct to Warren Street Being so central, you can walk to all of tourist London. The British Museum is 10 minutes away. You've got Oxford Street / Soho very close by (a 10 minute walk), Covent Garden will take you about 15 minutes, Regent's Park about 10-15 minutes. Camden is a 5 minute bus ride. You can head in any direction and arrive somewhere interesting. Numerous buses stop close by in Tottenham Court Road, Gower Street and Euston Road You are in easy reach of all the sights. Leicester Square and Trafalgar Square

Check out by 10am * Strictly non-smoking. A deep cleaning charge will be applied if there is any evidence of smoking * No pets * Lead guest must be aged 21+ and must provide official photo ID (passport or driving licence) in advance

name: Spacious and family-friendly Hackney home
summary: Spacious and bright converted ground floor 3 bed Victorian home with garden in Homerton/Lower Clapton area in Hackney, East London. New extension comprising of kitchen and lounge. Only 2 bedrooms will be available for guests. Family-friendly.
space: Our home is in a bright and spacious converted Victorian ground floor flat. There is a very spacious master bedroom and two large double bedrooms (the second double bedroom will not be available to guests as it will be used for storage of personal belongings), and a newly built open plan kitchen/dining/living area large bi-fold doors opening up to a garden. The kitchen is fully equipped and there is  washing machine, dishwasher and microwave. The bathroom includes a shower/bath tub.  The flat sleeps 5 people comfortably. There is a super king size bed in the master bedroom, a bunk bed in the other bedroom and also a sofa that you can sleep on in the living area. We can also arrange extra mattresses if needed. Children are welcome to stay and we can provide a travel cot. We also have high chairs and toys if needed.

neighborhood_overview: Our 3 bed flat is situated in Hackney in East London (Zone 2). It is within walking distance to a number of weekend food/arts and crafts markets (such as Broadway and Chatsworth Road Markets), London Fields Lido heated outdoor swimming pool), a great variety of really good cafes/pubs/restaurants and the local Castle Cinema and Hackney Picturehouse. For nature lovers it is a few minutes walk to Victoria Park, the lovely River Lea and some nature reserve areas.  Chatsworth Road is the closest street of note only 5 minutes walk away from the flat with two supermarkets (Co-op and Spar), restaurants/cafes, butcher, green-grocer, second hand shops, pharmacy, hair-dressers and an excellent Sunday market. The area is very safe and friendly and it has a nice village feel to it. It is also very child-friendly.
transit: The flat is 10 minutes walk to an overground station (Homerton) and by train it is only 5 minutes to Dalston, 15 minutes to Shoreditch/Hoxton and 20 minutes to Oxford Circus/Soho. We have parking right outside our door. You will need visitors parking vouchers Monday-Friday 6.30-18.30 (other than public holidays). Please let me know if you require these as I may need to buy them from the council in advance.
access: Guests will have access to all rooms with the exception of one of the double rooms which will be used as storage for the host's personal belongings.
house_rules: Please do not wear shoes indoors.

name: Private room and bathroom in spacious loft house
summary: Relax in style in this loft house in Islington.  Just ten minutes from the centre of town, this is a neighbourhood of second-hand bookshops, antique furniture stores, cafés and traditional pubs. This listing is for a double bedroom, the top floor mezzanine with an air mattress (and the large sofa in the middle floor for one extra). There is a private bathroom for the guests. The other room in the house has its own bathroom and is occupied by the host.
space: This is a house with vaulted ceilings and a patio garden.  The living area is flooded with natural light from the south-facing Juliet balcony; a staircase leads to a library mezzanine for work or play. The house is located on a quiet street close to Finsbury Park station, offering superb transport links to everywhere in London.  The area has a neighbourhood feel, with superb restaurants, pubs, cafés and local shops at the end of the road, not to mention the attentive local butcher and greengrocer.   In addition to the patio garden, there are two enormous parks and a nature reserve nearby, so you can run for twenty miles and barely know that you're in a city.

SMOKING There is an ash tray in the brown box at the front of the house. Please don’t smoke from any of the windows or inside the house (and the courtyard is also non-smoking). name: London, Ace Family Friendly House, Hackney, Zone 2
summary: 5 bedroom family home in the heart of Stoke Newington, seconds from Church Street. The area is a quirky, vibrant village in Central London, Zone 2. Our house is a family home filled with all of our treasured possessions.
space: Our five bedroom house is available as a whole house. The house was completely renovated in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and rejuvenated in September (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  We prefer to host families and wedding guests and do not take bookings from stag, hen parties or groups other than families. We have a travel cot available.  We are situated in Stoke Newington, just off busy Church st, which is renowned for its countless bars, restaurants, gastro pubs and boutiques, hence a great nightlife. Our house is on a residential street a few seconds away from all the shops and cafes on Church st. The area is popular with families too because of the nearby Clissold Park, which has an incredible playground, paddling pool, animals and beautiful house and café. Every weekend we have farmers markets and the hall at the end of our street has endless Bric a brac, vintage & foodie events. The stunning Abney Park Cemetery is seconds from the house. neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington Church st is known for its cafes, restaurants and bars. Our favourites include The Good Egg, Black Pig & White Pearls and Rasa.
transit: Buses & Trains  The nearest train station is Stoke Newington Overground which runs to Liverpool st via London Fields. (5 min walk, 15 min journey) Liverpool st is a major station which connects you to the Central line, District, Circle & Hammersmith tube lines. The Stansted Express arrives at Liverpool Street Station so you can easily change trains to reach Stoke Newington or continue by taxi. Liverpool Street Station is also connected to Cambridge for day trips to the University town.   Dalston Kingsland Overground station is a 15 min walk.  Heading east, 4 stops from Dalston Kingsland, is Stratford and the Olympic site. Heading west the overland train takes you to Hampstead Heath, Kensal Rise, Shepherds Bush, Kew Gardens & Richmond.  Dalston Junction is a 20 minute walk or 5 mins on the bus. This overground tube connects to the DLR and Canary Wharf, Greenwich, New Cross and the South East of London. It's runs south to Haggerston, Shoreditch & Whitechapel stations. You can be visiting
access: You will have access to all the spaces described. Please note that the study door is open for access but is for storage.
house_rules: Please be very careful with our keys. Lost sets will be charged at £25.  No smoking please and no parties please. This is a terraced street so it is important to be kind to the neighbours.  Please do not bring extra guests that you have not mentioned at booking. If you have additional guests they will be charged at £20 per night. Please contact me if you would like to add guests.  Please take off all hard shoes, particularly kitten high heels which will damage the floorboards. Thank you.  Please make sure that children are careful with any toys that they play with and do not allow them to use pens or crayons in the bedrooms or living room. Feel free to do arts and crafts in the kitchen and put newspaper down to cover the table top.  Any pans that are not to be used will be labelled. Please don't use metal spoons etc inside the pans and don't use any kitchenware that is labelled as private. Thank you very much!

name: Stylish Georgian Townhouse - Zone 1
summary: Comfortable, centrally located and with great transport links, this beautiful family home is a great base from which to explore all that London has to offer. The house is suitable for families, groups of friends and business travellers.
space: A well-loved and comfortable family home, with tons of character and very centrally located (you can hear Big Ben from the garden); this is the perfect base from which to enjoy your holiday in London. The house is well equipped and very comfortable, featuring many family antiques as well as lots of creature comforts. * The sleeping accommodation comprises three bedrooms with a double bed in each room, split over the 2nd & 3rd Floors.   * Also on those floors are two full bathrooms. * The 1st floor features a large drawing room with lots of comfortable seating, cable TV and DVD player and DVDs and Books for you to utilise. *On The ground floor you will find the a large open-plan kitchen, dining and seating area with access to a large garden at the rear of the property.  A WC can also be found on this floor.

name: A Modern Double Room in Greenwich.
space: We have a double bedroom in a modern house in Thamesmead, Greenwich, South East London. We own the house and would like to give someone the chance of somewhere to stay at a reasonable price. You'd have your own private double bedroom (king size bed) with tv, private bathroom, and a shared Kitchen / diner. Use of garden room for relaxing and watching TV or videos. The house also has internet wi fi connection, washing machine and tumble dryer. We have a very pleasant garden to use on "sunny days" +  a BBQ. and on hot days by arrangement a garden hot tub. Nearby there is a bus stop, with buses that go to Woolwich, for High Street shops (10mins) the O2 ( 20 mins ) and Greenwich Park ( 30 mins ). Greenwich also has a lot more to offer a visitor including Museums, famous Craft and Antique markets, bistros , restaurants and many famous old pubs. The house overlooks a lake so it is very quiet and tranquil. We are a 10 minute walk to the supermarket or you could hitch a lift with us when we go!

notes: You can park for free in the street outside the house (Private Road).
transit: Bus stop 200 meters from house, straight to Jubilee Line.
access: Kitchen, sitting room, garden.
house_rules: No Smoking, No pets. No drunks. No bigots. No shouting. Take outdoor shoes off in hallway please! Plenty of laughter. No eating meals in bedroom (we have the breakfast bar in the kitchen or the dining room).

name: Big peaceful room 5mins walk from King's Hospital
summary: A large room in a very quiet flatshare in Loughborough Junction, between Denmark Hill and Brixton, close to Kings Hospital. Ideal for a quiet single person who wants a desk or a small couple. Excellent transport links to central London. You are welcome to come home late at night if you do so quietly, mindful of our neighbours and other guests who may have to get up early in the morning for work! No idea why Airbnb say it is in Stockwell. Nothing against Stockwell but it's not in Stockwell.
space: Sunny, furnished room with double sofabed but with a real matress on it that is quite soft, in an old shared apartment on a quiet street in Camberwell. It is a small 4 bedroom apartment and there are usually between 1 and 4 people sharing the space here (usually 2 woman and 2 men). The kitchen is also a communal space where you can prepare and eat your food and spend time.  2 minutes walk to 24 hour buses and Loughborough Junction train station.  15 mins walk to Brixton underground station which is 12 mins on Victoria Line to Oxford Circus, Centre of London.  We are close to many of London's attractions, including the new Brixton Markets. The London Aquarium, the London Eye and the Imperial War Museum are within easy reach by public transport. It is just a 11 minute tube ride to Oxford Circus from Brixton - you are never far from all that London has to offer!

neighborhood_overview: In The Junction Bar the neighbourhood has one of the best live Jazz venues in London right at the top of the road. It also has good local beer and a nice bar menu. It is open 7 nights a week.
notes: This is my home so unlike a hotel it isn't always possible to host people even when the room is listed as free because I might be away on the day you want to arrive or at the time of day or night that you want to arrive.  So please message me first before requesting to book. It's a very quiet old house where people come to rest and relax in a gentle peaceful atmosphere. Guests are invited to come and go as they please but to do so quietly, treading and speaking softly througout the house which has very thin floors and walls so as not to disturb our neighbours and other guests. If you make a booking for one person then no other guests regardless of their relation to you will be permitted to stay in the room without amending the booking.
transit: You can borrow my bike, Loughborough Junction train station is less than 5 mins away which means most things in central London are no more than 30 mins away. You can be in the South Bank in 15 mins.
house_rules: This is a quiet house with a peaceful and calm atmosphere. If you listen to music or watch movies in your room please do so with your headphones onmas the walls and ceilings are very thin.  If you make a booking for one person then no other guests regardless of their relation to you will be permitted to stay in the room without amending the booking. Please leave each room as you would like to find it!  Please wash up your dishes and clean the kitchen immediately after your meal so that the kitchen is ready for the next person. The bathroom is easy to clean and leave ready for the next person too! No shoes in the house! No smoking in the house but you may smoke quietly outside on the steps and put your butts in the bin. The house is old so we ask you to tread softly and keep your voices down so as not to disturb our neighbours and other guests.

notes: *****UPON REQUEST ONLY additional fee****** We  are now offering a new additional service, where we will be using the pool/games room for those of you who would like to hold a dinner party.  The pool table (seats up to 12) will be fully dressed with all crockery, glasses and silverware etc. and also in addition with helium balloons to your requirements i.e. Birthday, Hen, etc.  Please note this is upon request only and there is a charge of £100.   Ceiling height is restricted, but will be fine.  Table will be set up prior to arrival and can be cleared and restored back to pool table  for game use when required.  If you would like this service, please let me know at the time of booking. Please note there is a 20 GBP late check in fee for guests arriving after 10pm.

name: Bed & Brekfast for the Olympics
space: I have a very nice double bedroom available in our Victorian terrace house with garden. It has a well equiped kitchen and 2 bathrooms. The house itself is just 10 minutes walking from the Olympic Centre and one minute walking away from a large supermarket. The road is however very quiet this close to the town centre of Stratford. The room itself is a double bedroom (16’ x 12’) with large bay window, fully furnished and with a big desk, sofa and television. The house is on 2 floors with kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom and garden on the ground floor, 3 double bed rooms and another bothroom with electric shower on first floor. There is a cellar too.  The kitchen is fully equiped with microwave oven, electic oven, dishwasher, fridge and freezer. in the downstairs bathroom there is the washing mashine. there is wirelss internet connection included. the house is 6/7 min walking form tube station. near shops and sport center, sitll in quite road.

name: Fab 1 Bed Condo in Heart of Central London! WiFi
space: Welcome to our large, spacious and beautiful home. It is a 1 bedroom top floor apartment in the city centre in the bustling Euston area and a stone's throw away from Euston Station.  Our Location is simply fantastic! 1 min walk to Euston Station, 7 minutes walk to King’s Cross / St Pancras Station, as well as easy connections to many of London's top attractions including the London Eye and Madame Tussauds. It is a superb location for shops on Oxford Street, the West End and Camden market. It is also close to the British Museum, the British Library and Regent’s park. There are plenty of local boutiques, restaurants and entertainment nearby. The Theatre district is also close by where you can enjoy London's amazing Arts and Musical scene. The apartment is clean, modern and relaxed with a King Size bed and a spacious and bright living room. There is also a separate fully functioning Kitchen with a four ring hob, oven, fridge freezer and washing machine / tumble dryer.  Bedding and towels

The apartment accommodates 2 people, no additional guests are allowed to stay over. Check in at 3pm, Check out at 11am, though this may be negotiable. Thanks in advance.

name: Spacious Central London Apartment by Hoxton Square
summary: I realise there will be people needing short-medium term accommodation, for reasons other than 'vacation' and I would like to confirm that I can take bookings immediately.   Please contact me to discuss, should you have a requirement.   The last guest was a 3 month tenancy and she left at the end of March.  Zero chance of contamination. Sky TV, with boxsets, and all rooms are very generously proportioned and comfortable. High powered air conditioner in the reception room.
space: Very spacious and comfortable one bedroom apartment in Zone 1, perfect for either holiday or business trip. Although in the heart of buzzing Shoreditch, secondary window glazing in the reception room ensures that the city noise is barely even audible.  And for sleeping? The bedroom is at the back of the building, facing a private courtyard and so very peaceful. The apartment is on the 2nd floor, with easy & open stair access if you don't wish to use the lift.

neighborhood_overview: Everything is so convenient and the area is always buzzing with all that's new in London but it still retains loads of character and is the perfect gateway to the city, just 10 mins walk away.
transit: Access couldn't be better.  Served by numerous close tube stations (Old Street, Hoxton, Shoreditch High St and Liverpool St) and loads of buses, as well as being able to access all of Shoreditch and London City on foot and super fast response time with any taxi apps, because there's always loads in the area. Fantastic location with everything you could need on your doorstep as well as great transport links; Old St tube station is less than 5 mins walk and Liverpool St Stn, with the Stansted Express and a huge supply of other travel connections, is only a 10 min (website hidden) Pancras International with the Eurostar is 15 min cab or tube.  The fully wheelchair accessible East London Overground is also only a 7 minute walk from the apartment.
access: The entire apartment, just you occupying it.  It's a really decently proportioned property where you'll really be able to comfortably relax. I have a lock box at a Key Cafe location, 2 mins walk from the apartment, so you can arrive until 11pm Mon - Sat and until 10pm Sundays.  Note, check-in is from 2pm to allow servicing after previous guest/s vacate.
house_rules: Check-in is 2pm - 10pm. Please do not  book if you are arriving outside of these times and have not discussed this with me - before booking - to see if it can be accommodated. Strictly no smoking inside the apartment, but there is a balcony if you wish to smoke, that you are more than welcome to use. Windows in the Receptions Room - The triple glazing and/or the windows in the reception room are not to be opened.   This room is serviced by a high powered air conditioner.  Opening the windows will let polluted and dirty air into the room and dirty the windows.  If the triple glazing is marked from the windows being opened, there will be a £90 cleaning fee charged. Bookings with infants cannot be accepted, please do not ask.   An older child is usually fine, but make sure to discuss this with me beforehand and ensure I am comfortable with your particular situation and that I believe the apartment will be a good fit for your group.  Thank you!

name: DBL. NEXT TO FINCHLEY CENTRAL TUBE.
summary: Spacious and bright double bedroom in modern house. Lovely garden, open plan kitchen/diner. WI-FI included. Sheets, towels and all toiletries provided House is conveniently located next to Finchley Central tube, and all buses, shops and restaurants.
space: We have 2 bright and clean double bedrooms for our guests, in our modern, newly renovated 3 bed 2 bath house in Finchley...Fantastic location! We are situated on a quiet, and pretty street, but only a very short walk to lively high street shops, bars restaurants, and 24 hr supermarket...3 mins walk to Finchley Central tube station, and all busses, including night bus  which goes right into Central London...From the tube station, it takes just 15-20 mins to Central London.  We have a beautiful, and modern open plan kitchen/living room, with skylight..The double patio doors lead into our private and attractive garden, with furniture and BBQ...This is something we love to enjoy with our guests, who always seem to become good friends!! ....WiFi is included, and our lounge area features "state of the art", 3D/HD TV! Shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, sheets and towels included..There are fabulous parks and walking trails nearby, as well as historic sights such as Barnet Church, and Highgate

neighborhood_overview: Finchley has an 'arty vibe' and the Arts Depot which is only a few minutes walking distance, is a hub of comedy, music, drama and art in the area. Notable people who have lived here include : Charles Dickens lived here when he wrote Martin Chuzzlewit (1843) after a trip to the United States, Comedians such as Spike Milligan (Goons) and Eric Morecambe (Morecambe and Wise Show) also lived here, as did Harry Beck (the designer of our famous London Underground Map).Actors, comedians, artists, musicians, writers and journalists still reside in Finchley. Down in East Finchley The Phoenix Cinema is an 1930's Art Deco building is one of the oldest cinemas in the UK and was voted as the best single screen cinema in London.There are also plenty of activities for the kids at the Finchley Leisure Centre including Bowling, Swimming and Cinema.Arriving back at the station of Finchley Central from a trip into the centre, one has a feeling of calm and serenity. Yet within a few minutes from our house
notes: OTHER SERVICES OFFERED.. Breakfast is £7.50p.p. Dinner is available. Please give 24hr notice...£15-p.p. Airport pick up from GATWICK is £80-...All other airports, £60- Off street parking is £10 p.n. Laundry service is £5.00p.l. Pets £10 p.n.
transit: The house is conveniently located 5 minutes walk to all buses and Finchley Central tube station. We also provide airport pick-up drop-off service.  GATWICK..£80- ALL OTHER AIRPORTS..£60-

name: Comfy Family Home in London
summary: We have a comfortable, child friendly, family home in the wonderful area of Stoke Newington.  Stoke Newington is a very sought after place to live in London.  It's got a village feel to it with lots of families.
space: We have a three bed house which accommodates max six people (2 single beds are for children). The design style is simple and clean with emphasis on natural light and minimal clutter. We've put a lot of care and consideration into making it comfortable and guarantee you'll be very relaxed here. We have wireless broadband throughout the house and an excellent sound system in the lounge where you can plug in your mp3 player and enjoy your choice of music, plus radios in the bedrooms and kitchen. name: Room in Artistic house, nr Olympics
space: A quiet room overlooking the garden. I am an artisan, and there are always projects ongoing. These don't affect the room on offer, but around the house there will be timber, canvasses and other materials. There is a stereo and radio in the room, wi-fi is included, and clean sheets and towel. The bed is a double futon, with a foam mattress underneath.  Nearby are the Olympic site (a bus ride or 30mins walk along 'the Greenway'), Westfield shopping centre, Excel exhibition space, Canary Wharf, City Airport, O2 (the Dome), and local shops. Access to central London is easy with District tube line 10mins walk away. DLR, buses and Taxis are also in good supply. Both Tate Galleries are an easy tube ride away; the Whitechapel is even nearer, as is Vyner St. with it's iconic private galleries. Everyone is welcome; Artists, Architects, and Musicians may find particular interest here. There is a guitar in almost every room. I attend a life drawing group on Mondays and Thursdays - it's a drop in g

name: Double Room by Camden Market
summary: Great room in house right next to Camden Stables Market. There are two rooms available in the house.
space: This listing is for a double room in my house - there is a double bed,  and chest of drawers and a hanging rail. The house is just off the Chalk Farm Road, just by Camden Lock's famous Stables Market.  There is a shared bathroom in the house. I am happy to advise on places to go and things to do. I have a small Jack Russell dog called Buster. He is very cute and friendly. The Area; The house is just steps from the famous Camden Lock Market, where you can visit the unique shops, and grab a vintage bargain, or hang out at Proud, the bar that has seen performances from Amy Winehouse and Coldplay. On the high street you will also find zillions of restaurants and clubs, bars and coffee shops. In Camden there is also a massive Sainsbury's although there is also a small Sainsbury's a short walk away (with a cashpoint) - much quicker for a short local shop.  It is also just a short walk to Primrose Hill, where you get a great view over the city. And Regents Park and London Zoo is just round th

neighborhood_overview: There is so much to do in Camden. If you like a good pub, eating out etc.. then this is the place for you. Its also close to great parks and open spaces, 15 mins from very central London. You get the best of both worlds here!
transit: Absolutely loads of public transport...from buses and cabs at the end of the street...two tube stations five mins away and the overground railway five mins walk away. The area benefits from great transportation links. It is just a short walk to either Chalk Farm, or Camden Road underground stations. Once on the Northern Line it is just a couple of stops to Kings Cross/St. Pancras, where you can catch trains all over the country and to some of London's major airports. There is also a stop on the overground (Camden Road or Kentish Town West) just a short walk from the house.. The area is also served by several night buses, including the (phone number hidden) and c2, which means that if you miss the last train you can still easily get home!
access: Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room and Decking area.
house_rules: Welcome! The house rules are that you are friendly and have fun in the house. Music must be played at an acceptable level so as not to upset my neighbours and if you smoke then you are welcome outside on the decking/patio area. You can use the fridge/freezer to your hearts content. You can invite guests into your room and if I am there then they are welcome in the rest of the house.

name: spacious room in comfy family home
summary: We are looking forward to hosting you in this warm and welcoming, generous room with your own desk and chair and plenty of cupboard space.
space: This warm and welcoming room has plenty of cupboard space and a desk with a comfortable chair for your work or studies. The bed can easily be turned into a double bed in case two people would like to share. We charge £15 per night per extra person. There is definitely enough space for two. We offer breakfast, but are also happy for guests to help themselves. You are also welcome to use our microwave to heat ready-made meals in the evenings.

We offer breakfast, but are also happy for guests to help themselves. You are also welcome to use our microwave to heat ready-made meals in the evenings. You have access to the entire house, apart from our private bedrooms. We respect your privacy, but are always available for a chat over a tea/coffee or a glass of wine ;-) We are a cosmopolitan family in a lovely neighbourhood nestled comfortably between the city and Epping Forest. Chingford Mount is a walking distance from our house with lovely restaurants, pubs, bars, and a great variety of shops. We are a 15 m
neighborhood_overview: We are a cosmopolitan family in a lovely neighbourhood nestled comfortably between the city and Epping Forest. Chingford Mount is a walking distance from our house with lovely restaurants, pubs, bars, and a great variety of shops. We are a 15 minute bus ride (no. 34)  away from Walthamstow Central (bus stop is at the bottom of the road) where the William Morris Gallery, Lloyd Park, and two fantastic landmark pubs - the Bell and the Rose & Crown (a vibrant theater incuded!) - await you. From there you also have fast train and Underground connections to the City and London's Westend. You can go for lovely walks along the nearby water reservoirs or you can hop on the 444 bus (directly in front of our house) which will take you all the way to Queen Elizabeth's Hunting lodge at the entrance to Epping Forest (25 minute ride).
notes: Biscuit, our sociable cat, will love you, if you let him, but we can also make sure that he does not get too cosy in your presence.
transit: The 34 bus stops at the bottom of the road and will take you straight to Walthamstow Central (15 minutes). From there you have the Victoria line which will take yo straight to oxford Circus or the train to Liverpool Street station right in the middle of the City. The 444 bus which stops directly in front of our house takes you to Angle Corner (Overground/train line to City) and onward to Turnpike Lane (Piccadilly line) The 444 bus stops directly in front of our house and takes you to Turnpike Lane Underground Station on the Piccadilly Line. If you take it to travel in the other direction, you will find yourself 25 minutes later at the gates of Epping Forest. If you come by car, you can park on our private driveway. If you come from Stansted, it is best to get of at Tottenham Hale and take the Victoria Line ( 1 stop!) to Blackhorse Road Underground Station and from there the 158 all the way to Hall Lane (20 minutes). Alternatively, you can hop onto a taxi at Tottenham Hale and 8-10 minu
access: You have access to the entire house, apart from our private bedrooms.
house_rules: We take our shoes off when we come home. If you would like to smoke you are very welcome to sit in our garden. Otherwise we are easy going and happy to share our home with you.

name: Hotel-style room in Camden Town
summary: Enjoy total privacy in the heart of Camden Town by staying in this stylish self-contained en suite bedroom, with its own direct private entrance.
space: Hotel-style room in Camden Town Enjoy total privacy in the heart of Camden Town by staying in this stylish self-contained en suite bedroom, with its own direct private entrance. We live next door and will be on hand to welcome you and remain at your disposal throughout your stay! THE ROOM •A large 20m2 bright bedroom with a double bed, oak flooring and modern furniture.  •Own private bathroom, gorgeous hotel-style design, with bathtub and rain shower head and under-floor heating. •Direct access to a spacious 15m2 balcony (balcony is shared with our apartment) •Wi-fi, kettle with tea & coffee, TV, hairdryer, all bedding, sheets & towels provided.  •Freedom to access the room with your own key directly from building hallway (not via our apartment) THE BUILDING •Luxury loft-style restoration of Muppet creator Jim Henson’s Creature Shop factory •24 hour porter, very secure THE LOCATION •Fantastic canal-side building •Very quiet, in a residential corner of Camden Town and bordering Primrose

name: Double room in Clapham/Battersea
summary: A lovely large room available in the heart of Battersea. Located 5 minutes from Clapham Junction and situated on a quiet residential room, this is the perfect place to explore the city.
space: Pretty, cosy semi detached end of terrace Victorian House in Battersea. The house has been recently renovated and features 3 bedrooms and a pretty, small back garden. Beautiful Battersea Park is a short 10 minute walk away. Battersea Square and Northcote Road, where you can find shops and markets, are close buy.  Clapham Junction is 8 minutes walk away as there you'll find many shops, bars, restaurants and supermarkets. Also, from Clapham Junction Station you can get the underground to the centre of London as well as mainline trains to Victoria and Waterloo linking you to most of the underground lines. You can also get the buses 49, 345 to Kings Road and South Kensington, 319 Kings Road and 44 to Victoria.   Wi-Fi Internet is available and there's metered parking (09h30-16h30 Monday to Friday) available outside the house.    'Comfortable, clean and kind'. name: Lovely flat in the heart of Islington
summary: Welcome to our spacious flat in the heart of Angel-where you can rent your  quiet, private double bedroom with bathroom and make full use of the kitchen, lounge, dining area and balcony. Enjoy the area and great transport links to the centre!
space: Welcome to our spacious second floor flat (85 sq metres/915 sq), where you can rent your private double bedroom with bathroom and make full use of the kitchen, lounge, dining area and balcony. Your bedroom has a comfy double bed, plenty of storage space/wardrobe and an bathroom with heated towel-rails. The room has direct access to a large balcony at the back of the building, which catches the sun throughout the day and has its own bench, barbecue and pots of fresh herbs. Your room has fresh linen and towels and is professionally cleaned. Its is a peaceful and quiet room, away from the main road.  If you are travelling with kids or a baby let us know the details and we can make arrangements for a cot or kids bed.

If you are travelling with kids or a baby let us know the details and we can make arrangements for a cot or kids bed. The Flat The flat is on the second
neighborhood_overview: The Area The flat is within walking distance to super-fast transport links to the West End and Oxford Street; eight minutes from both Angel and Highbury & Islington underground stations; and there are also six buses that stop outside our doorstep all heading into Central London. Essex Road station is one minute away and provides an excellent link to the City (10 minutes to Moorgate Station).  We’re in the heart of Angel Islington – an area which is both amazingly convenient and very easy to fall in love with. Under five minutes from our doorstep you’ll find some of of London’s most exciting restaurants (you should definitely try Ottolenghi’s), bars, independent cinemas, coffee shops, music venues, galleries and the wonderful Almeida Theatre.  The picturesque Regents Canal is close by with its riverside bars and pubs – as are other must-sees such as nearby Camden Passage Antiques Market, eclectic Spitalfields market, Columbia Flower Market, Broadway market, Petticoat Lane and the food s
notes: AND FINALLY....PLEASE, If you are contacting us about the room, please let us know what time you are likely to arrive for check-in, this is important as we are both working and may not always be available. Hope to hear from you!
access: The Flat The flat is on the second floor of a smart, new redbrick building. It has two double bedrooms, (one for you and one for us, Tom and Eleni, a professional couple- though we will be away when you are staying). There is a big living/dining room area with gorgeous wooden furniture. We also have a separate fully equipped kitchen – including an espresso machine, microwave, juicer, washing machine and dishwasher. The flat has free WIFI, and in the living room we have a LCD TV, DVD player, Ipod speakers, and  wooden dining table.
house_rules: We love our home and expect you to treat it with respect. We will show you around and answer all your questions  when you arrive. You will have your own keys and be able to come and go as you please. There is no smoking in the flat, but you have access to the balcony where you can smoke. We leave our shoes by the entrance of the flat, in order to protect our wood floors and carpeting, and we would ask you also not to wear shoes inside.

name: Lovely 1 bedroom flat in Dalston
summary: A bright and quiet flat in Dalston, located in a Victorian mansion block just off the high street. A beautiful place in the middle of a vibrant neighbourhood with easy access to local transport.  (min 7 days)
space: The flat has one bedroom, a kitchen/diner and a separate living room. It suits one person, a couple or small family.
description: A bright and quiet flat in Dalston, located in a Victorian mansion block just off the high street. A beautiful place in the middle of a vibrant neighbourhood with easy access to local transport.  (min 7 days) The flat has one bedroom, a kitchen/diner and a separate living room. It suits one person, a couple or small family. We're away but there will be a local contact in case you need any help. Located on a back street just behind Kingsland Road's many bars and clubs, it is a quiet spot in the most lively neighbourhood in town. Turkish vegetables, vintage shops, hipster restaurants and great coffee just around the corner. The flat is about 20 minutes walk to Broadway market/London Fields, half an hour on the tube to central London or 5 minutes on the East London line to Shoreditch. There's a baby cot in the bedroom and a high chair.

space: Nice and quiet king size room in a terraced house in Stratford, East London.  We live in a quiet neighbourhood 5 minute walk to Plaistow Station (District Line) or 5 minute bus to Stratford Station (Central Line) . Zone 3. Thirty-five minutes door to door to the West End of London on the tube via any of these two stations.   We are walking distance to the Olympic Site and the new Westfield Mall (or four bus stops if you're feeling lazy). We are an easy going, relaxed and very genuine male gay couple.  The room has a king size bed (UK King Size), chest of drawers and wardrobe which you are welcome to use. There is also a computer desk with a chair, and we provide Wi-fi connection (included). We will have nice and fresh bed linen and towels waiting for you. We have a good sized through lounge with a dinning table, and a lovely kitchen downstairs (which you are welcome to use for breakfast).  The bathroom is big and spacious. house_rules: We welcome everyone with a relaxed attitude and open mind. We are very flexible with the house rules, but will ask our guests to keep the common areas clean and tidy. We will of course do the same. We don't allow smoking indoors, but we have a nice patio/garden at the back, and you're welcome to smoke there.  If you use the kitchen we expect you to clean after you've used it.

neighborhood_overview: The house is conveniently located close to transport, easy access to central London, popular Camden Town, and various parks. There is also a sports centre and library a minute from home.  The house is round the corner from Hampstead Theatre, next to Swiss Cottage underground and buses.   All amenities are available on Finchley Road just a few minutes walk between Swiss Cottage and Finchley Road underground stations.  Quick and easy travel into central London.  A 5 minute bus ride to Camden Town, well known for market during the day and lively night life.  Camden be reached alternatively by a nice 20 minute walk to Camden via Primrose Hill with panorama view of London.  Primrose Hill leads into Regents Park.  Hampstead Heath is a 15 minute walk via Belsize Park.  The Swiss Cottage Leisure Centre has a pool, gym and climbing wall. There is a children's playground and water feature in the square.  The large local library is next to sports centre.
notes: The room contains a computer table not yet photographed.
transit: Underground, buses, and overground to centre of London and all parts of London.  2 night buses, one from central London, the other from east London passing Camden Town.  A 5 - 10 minute walk to Primrose Hill and Regents Park. A few minutes walk to Belsize Park, and 15 minute walk to Hampstead Heath.
access: Guests are welcome to use kitchen. Please be aware others may also use it, and that it is my home kitchen, quite different from exclusive for rent kitchens as in listings with absentee host.   The living-room is available if free and not booked by another guest. The roof-garden is available most of the time. I work in the attic leading to roof-garden, so guests should request access.
house_rules: Only guests who have booked via AirBnB can stay. If guests unexpectedly wish to have someone else stay they must request it prior to bringing anyone in the house, and expect to pay additional charge commensurate with my charges on this and other listings.  I would like to see passport ID on arrival and will make photocopy of ID with £ 30 deposit for Keys to be returned with keys on departure. No outdoor shoes to be worn in the flat.  No smoking in the flat. Drink in moderation. Smokers can request access to the roof-terrace or smoke outside, but not on the stairways leading to the house. I would also appreciate no cooked food outside of kitchen. This will avoid lasting smells & spillage in the bedrooms. For similar reasons beverage in bedrooms should be restricted to water & tea etc. NO CANDLES or any kind of naked flames in the bedrooms. The home is sufficiently spacious to offer privacy & sociability in equal measure. I often work late at night, so there is no problem for latecomers.

name: Big House for Olympics sleeps 6 to8
space: A beautiful, modern, art-filled and clean 4 story townhouse, on the borders of Hampstead and Swiss Cottage. Central, Central, Central!  The house features:  - 1 double bedroom and 1 twin bedroom (with bunk beds). - 1 bathroom and 2 WCs, a large living room and a large kitchen / dining room.  - Wireless internet, cable TV, washing machine, dishwasher etc etc available. It is located within a 4 minutes walk to Finchley Road Tube station ( on the Jubilee Line - direct line to Olympic Park and also Wembley Stadium. Also on the Metropolitan Line) and 4 minutes walk to Finchley Road and Frognal overground station (North London Line).  We're a 15 minutes tube / 20 mins bus to West End / Oxford Circus and 10 minutes walk to Hampstead Village, 15 min to Hampstead Heath, 20 min to Regents Park, 20 min to Camden Market etc.  Off street parking (gated).  5 minutes walk to supermarkets, movie theatres, and 10 restaurants (Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Indian etc etc).

name: Rent for Olympics
space: A beautiful private double room is available to rent in a friendly welcoming apartment suitable for the Olympic period in London!! Great location for the Olympics (postal area E17), just a short 20 minutes by Bus from Stradford( Olympic site ) and also great  transport links to Central London where you can enjoy all the sites and attractions that london has to offer !   This is a beautiful garden flat located on the 1 st floor . The Living room  can accomodate 1 person or up to 3 Children if needed for an extra rate (communicated with me before ) Guests will have access to Wifi , cable TV,fully equipped Kitchen, washer-dryer and parking. (All bills are included in total price.) I am a  native Spanish Speaker and speak English fluently,I would be more than happy to provide you with  extra information about the  nearby area if required . More pictures available on request,for further information with regards to my property please do not hesitate to contact me. Price negation is possible

name: 3 bed/bathroom house central London
summary: Great little terraced house in centrally located Vauxhall/Kennington area.  Set back in from the busy roads of London this is an extremely quiet location, but is very centrally located.  The Underground station is less than 5 minutes walk away.  The house is also walking distance from the following tourist spots (to name but a few!):  (Website hidden by Airbnb) Big Ben/Houses of Parliament – 12 minutes walk  (Website hidden by Airbnb) London Eye – 20 minutes walk  (Website hidden by Airbnb) River Thames (start of the Southbank) 6 minutes walk  It only takes 30 minutes by underground to reach Stratford (Olympic site). There is also a River Boat that has a stop in Vauxhall (5 minutes walk) that takes you down the Thames and into Greenwich. From the house there is a gorgeous walk that you can do from the house that takes you all along the South Bank passing Lambeth Palace, London Eye, London Aquarium, Royal Festival Hall, Tate Modern, Shakespeares Globe, finally  taking you into Borough

name: Stylish, Light Central London Flat
space: Stylish Victorian Mansion flat located next to leafy Battersea Park in a smart and safe neighbourhood (zone 2- 2 mins walk from 2 stations). Ideally located with many great links to several parts of central London. The flat is located on the third floor and is secure with an audio/buzzer system and is tastefully furnished with large windows and tall ceilings.  -Large fully equipped kitchen with lovely butcher's block and dining table to seat six people.  -Stunning lounge with large cream sofa, chaise and footstool,  42” plasma TV screen, satellite channels & surround sound system. -One stylish cosy double bedroom available for our guest(s) with comfortable down-filled duvets and pillows and hairdryer.  Toiletries, towels and fresh linen provided. (we are located in second double bedroom at other end of apartment) -Marble bathroom with shower and bath.   -Free and unlimited WIFI/internet.  -Cellar storage for bicycles and free car parking at rear of building.    AMENITIES: Lovely local

name: A private, en-suite double bedroom
summary: Thank you for taking a look at our place, we would be more than happy to have you stay with us in your own large private double bedroom. Many refer to it as a hotel room in the heart of London. Private access, and tons of great food and nightlife.
space: I look forward to welcoming you to my beautiful, clean double room in East London.  Our place is located in the heart of Shoreditch which is known for its nightlife and amazing food. If your looking to go shopping for antiques or just in town for the atmosphere theres plenty of things to do and see. With plenty of trendy pop up shops and restaurants it a great place for anyone looking to experience London properly. Your stay will include access to the Internet Wi-Fi, there is a lift available in the building making it accessible to all!   Experience Britain's capital from your base here in east London, with Plenty of busses available taking you to Oxford street,South bank and paddington. Located in the east of London with Old street Tube station 5 minutes walk away,Liverpool street is a short 10 minute walk away and the world renowned Brick lane is a 5 minute walk away from my apartment ! The Tube lines are Northern Line and Central Line! Being Close to Old Street tube and the City of

neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of Shoreditch so if you are into food, shopping, antiques, bars, comedy, clubs, art or nightlife there is something for everyone. We find that everyone that has stayed with us has found amazing things around every corner and we hope you will too.
notes: We are in the heart of the city so please note that for some it can be a bit loud on the weekends, we find that since your not on the ground floor with the blinds closed it cancels the noise out.
transit: The closest tube stations to us are Old Street (Northern Line), Liverpool Street (Central Line, or Stansted Express), and Shoreditch Highstreet Station (Overground)
access: When using this booking you are booking the upstairs area of the flat in a duplex apartment. It is completely secluded and you have as much privacy as you need, it is essentially a hotel room in the heart of London. Your own private floor, entrance, bathroom, bedroom and large wardrobes.
house_rules: We expect our guests to treat the flat like their own and during their time with us we think of it as their space. The only rule we have is that we ask you not to smoke in the flat other than that, please leave the flat the way that you found it.

name: A cosy room in a beautiful and quiet location...
summary: Spare room is in a two bedroom flat in a very safe and quiet location with a shared bathroom.  The living room and kitchen are the host's personal space, use of which is not permitted.  A kettle with Tea and Coffee are provided for in the room.
space: A very lovely double room in a very quiet location of Ealing Common close to Ealing Common tube (Piccadilly/District Lines) and Ealing Broadway (Central/West Thames Trains) 30 minutes from central London. Wireless internet and ample parking available

neighborhood_overview: Ealing Broadway and Ealing Common are both situated in a lovely part of West London.  The area benefits from Ealing Broadway Shopping Centre as well as lovely pubs and restaurants to suit every palette. Easy access into the West End, Paddington and City.
notes: Ealing has lots of restaurants and bars as well as easy access into the West End. The Grange Pub and Dining room is a five minute walk as well as Charlotte's Place which is a fine dining restaurant.
transit: There is a bus every 20 minutes to Ealing Broadway which is one stop or a 10/15 minute brisk walk. Easy access into the West End, Paddington and City with excellent transport links being Central/District/Piccadilly and Overground.. Kindly note that Ealing Broadway & Ealing Common are in Zone 3. Further details are available on the Transport for London website. There is also unrestricted car parking available at the property.

name: Chic Victorian Apartment with Fireplace
summary: Through a Victorian family home. Enjoy the chic, monochromatic decor in this bright and chic apartment.  Impeccable style, from the lovely tiling in the bathroom, arched doorways and stripped wooden floors, to the sunny shared terrace area.
space: A beautifully designed and decorated 1 bedroom flat in a warm friendly Victorian family house. This bright and stylish flat is located on a quiet tree lined street close to Clapham High Street. The high street has lots of great restaurants and grocery stores. There is also a fantastic cinema nearby. Huge green space of Clapham Common is 15 minutes walk away, great for jogging or if you feel like a game of tennis.  Feels more like a boutique hotel, the flat is extremely comfortable and well equipped. We like you to feel at home so there will be fresh flowers when you arrive and a complimentary bottle of wine to get you relax.  The light filled living room has a two seated sofa, antique low chair, coffee table, a Victorian fireplace, a small dining table and a interactive HD TV. Through the double doors is the bedroom, with another fireplace, a antique brass bed, oak wardrobe. There is a well equipped brand new kitchen and new walk in shower room. There is the use of a shared sunny roof

notes: We live in the same building so are often around if you need any assistance.

name: Large Victorian ensuite room
summary: Experience Old London in this large period double in a Victorian flat very close to the Chiswick House Park. Extra large desk. Private sitting area around an original magnificent Victorian fireplace. Super comfy king size bed and an artistic private ensuite Victorian bathroom.  Easy access to the M4 and Heathrow Airport, short walk to high street. Well connected to Central London via underground, train and buses. Use of kitchen and washing machine. Two friendly hosts and quirky cats, what more?
space: Hi, we are letting out a lovely, big, period room with large ensuite in a Victorian flat in Chiswick, only a stone's throw from Chiswick House and Grounds. Lovely and airy room with King size bed, period wardrobe and bedside tables, large desk area with book shelves, private cosy sitting area around a magnificent Victorian fireplace. Great sound system with DVD and CD player that can be connected to your phone or computer. Private and large ensuite with panelled and mosaic walls and Victorian style fittings. Extra long bath tub with shower. Use of kitchen and dining areas, washing machine, fast wifi. Would be perfect for a couple as it is self contained, but single travellers are equally welcome! We are 10-15 mins walk from tube (district line or overground), train station and high street. Two minutes' walk from the beautiful park Chiswick House Grounds and the easiest access to the M4! . There is only one other tenant in the flat (with his own private ensuite). We have our own persona
description: Experience Old London in this large period double in a Victorian flat very close to the Chiswick House Park. Extra large desk. Private sitting area around an original magnificent Victorian fireplace. Super comfy king size bed and an artistic private ensuite Victorian bathroom.  Easy access to the M4 and Heathrow Airport, short walk to high street. Well connected to Central London via underground, train and buses. Use of kitchen and washing machine. Two friendly hosts and quirky cats, what more? Hi, we are letting out a lovely, big, period room with large ensuite in a Victorian flat in Chiswick, only a stone's throw from Chiswick House and Grounds. Lovely and airy room with King size bed, period wardrobe and bedside tables, large desk area with book shelves, private cosy sitting area around a magnificent Victorian fireplace. Great sound system with DVD and CD player that can be connected to your phone or computer. Private and large ensuite with panelled and mosaic walls and Victorian st
neighborhood_overview: It's leafy Chiswick!!! We are in a great central area, with easy access to Central London and the airport, both by car and with public transport (buses, train and tube are all at easy reach) and yet we are only 2 minutes' walk from the beautiful park Chiswick house and grounds!  The high street, only 10 minutes away, is packed with great and exclusive restaurants, as well as less expensive but very tasty little pizzerias and cafés.
transit: Sure! Chiswick mainline train station is only 10 minute's walk with southwest trains going to clapham junction and Waterloo in only 20 minutes every 20 minutes! The closest underground is Chiswick Park on the district line, about 15 minutes walk, but we also have the overground 7 minute's walk (gunnesbury) Direct buses to Westfield (272), Hammersmith (H91, 391,E3), Central London and Camden Town (27) and many more!
access: Bedroom, bathroom, living room and kitchen
house_rules: We have a great and lovely cleaner, who is very scrupolous in her work, but please, don't take advantage of her! You are more then welcome to use the kitchen and the washing machine, ironing board, iron and hair dryer are available in the storage area. You can even cook, if you like. We would expect you to wash up your dishes and pans after you have used them, as well as the cooker, and not to leave ingredients and crokery around. The kitchen is very small, and it is essential to put away all the dishes and pans after they are dry so that there is space to move around. Thank you!

neighborhood_overview: Chiswick High Street is a short walk away, with an abundance of available restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shops. Chiswick offers riverside pubs, lovely parks and good schools, which all contribute to its overall charm: combining city life with village living. Chiswick has easy access to the M4 and all major routes in and out of London. Chiswick is also ideally positioned for short journeys to the West End, the City, and Heathrow Airport is fairly close. Chiswicks transport links include underground stations such as Stamford Brook, Turnham Green, Chiswick Park and Gunnersbury. Locally there is excellent shopping centre at Westfield - Shepherds Bush, the biggest shopping centre in London, which is a 10-15 minute tube or bus ride away. Notting Hill with its Portobello Market is a couple of miles away and Earls Court and Kensington Olympia Exhibition Centres are nearby too.
