neighborhood_overview: Ladywell Village is just that - a little village located within Central London. It has a very unique character, but it only takes 16 minutes to get to London Bridge (for Tate modern;Tower Bridge;Globe Theatre;The Tower of London;St Paul's Cathedral) and 22 minutes to Charing Cross (within walking distance of Trafalgar Square; The National Gallery and Portrait Gallery; Horseguards Parade (for the spectacular Horse mounted Changing of the Guard);10 Downing Street;Big Ben;Houses of Parliament;Westminster Abbey;Buckingham Palace and Tate Britain).  Ladywell station is less than 2 minutes walk, and the village itself has a lovely feel and some really great shops. Probably of most interest to visitors are the cafes and restaurants.There is a French Patisserie/cafe on the corner by the station with great croissants and Oscars, a little independent cafe with a tiny garden, where the German lady owner bakes all her own delicious cakes and great coffee. There is also a traditional English cafe,
transit: Public transport in London is absolutely excellent, and I chose to buy in Ladywell because of the amazing transport links. I work in central London, so a super fast route is essential to me. A word about trains versus tubes. In North London, most of the transportation is underground, in South London, which is less crowded, it is mostly overground. All the lines connect to each other, so just think of it all as one system. My house is so near the station you will be amazed - I can run there is 55 seconds, or walk in under 2 minutes. There are four trains per hour into London (roughly every 15 minutes). Two go direct to Charing Cross, and the fast ones go direct from Ladywell to London Bridge. This is amazing travel for such a huge city. The other two per hour go to Cannon Street in the City of London. You just take whichever train comes first. If it is a Cannon Street train, you change at London Bridge, and either cross to platform 6, where there is a train to Charing cross every 2 to 3
access: Wifi is super fast, and included in the price you pay. There are two bathrooms shared between three rooms, so there is never a problem with access. One has a shower and one has a bath, both have basins and toilets. You help yourself to the breakfast, as I work quite long hours, , but this means you can have it at a time to suit yourself, should you have had a late night. The kitchen has a microwave, and cooker if you want to heat up meals at other times. There is a garden, and I occasionally have smokers, who are permitted to smoke in the garden, but not in the house.
house_rules: I expect my guests to be quiet and respectful, and I find that most people are, but please be aware that there are other people staying in the house, so don't have your TV or music turned up too loud. A recent problem has been couples staying up late and chatting way into the night. Most people are super respectful, so I only mention it in passing. But there are a couple things that I need to mention. All trash in the UK has to be recycled, so please try to use the re-cycling that I provide in the kitchen (I will show you if you ask me) and separate wet waste from dry. Plastics have to be free of food contamination, so please either rinse it, or put it in the dishwasher and I will take care of it. The kitchen is available for breakfast, and there is a microwave in the kitchen, so that you can heat up meals, as it's no fun to eat out all the time. I do provide tea and coffee in the rooms, but please, if you are eating in the house, use the dining table provided, don't eat in your room.

For anyone less familiar with this area, it is on the doorstep of some of London's best galleries, great bars, clubs and weekend markets - A hub of creativity and fun.  On the doorstep of The City of London and easily accessible to the West End.
notes: Please note that the flat isn't suitable for parties or large gatherings and noise must be minimal in the evening and at night. I will need to fine anybody having a party in the flat £200 and also put in an official complaint to Airbnb and possibly to the police. I need to be this strict because my neighbours have only given me permission to do short terms lets on condition that I am very strict about parties. Check out is 11am. Luggage may be left until 12pm for an extra charge of £10 per case. If luggage is still there beyond 1pm we will need to charge for an extra night.
transit: Walking directions from Old Street tube station will be sent to you in your confirmation e-mail and I can also provide other directions upon request. There are bikes to hire directly outside the apartment and buses and train/underground stations a short walk away. There is also almost anything you could need within walking distance. Walking distance according to (Hidden by Airbnb) maps: Hoxton Station: 11 minutes Shoreditch High Street Station: 22 minutes Old Street Station: 14 minutes  Liverpool Street Station: 28 minutes Hoxton Square: 10 minutes  Hoxton Street Market (mainly Saturdays): 2 minutes  Brick Lane: 28 minutes  Colombia Flower Market (Sundays): 19 minutes

name: Beautiful warehouse flat in London
summary: This is an artist's live-in Studio space in an original old East London factory building located in the heart of Dalston, which has become one of the trendiest and liveliest areas in London over the past few years.
space: This is one of the original old factory buildings that got converted into artist studios before the gentrification of the area kicked in and which made this area so popular in the first place. So expect an original piece of the old East London with more of an industrial feel to it, as opposed to the newly built shiny apartment blocks that have started to appear in the area. This is a charming and charismatic old factory building with high ceilings and big south facing windows. I actually do live and work in this space, so it has many personal objects, books, records etc around. You are welcome to read the books, listen to records, get inspired by things you find as long as you treat the place with respect and leave everything where you found it. Behind the main space with lots of daylight is a cozy quiet double bedroom. There is a bathroom with toilet, sink and shower. The kitchen is open plan included in the main space. The place is ideal to do creative work or to just relax and conte

notes: Dalston has become a bit of a party area, so on the weekends there can be people on the streets quite late into the night and you might hear sounds of them enjoying themselves. the bedroom is usually quiet at all times. i personally don't find it disturbing.
transit: There are plenty of buses and two Overground stations connecting the area to other areas of london. to central London (Oxford Circus) takes about 20 minutes by train. Angel and upper street is about 10 minutes on the bus. Liverpool street is about 15min on bus.
access: You are renting the whole place which consists of one bigger main space with kitchen, a smaller bedroom and a separate bathroom.
house_rules: Please don't remove any books or records or other objects from the flat. You are very welcome to use everything inside the flat as long as you don't take it outside.

name: Homely Twin Room Streatham,London
space: This room has 2 single beds. There is a chest of drawers, a pine wardrobe, side table with a light and plenty of room under the bed.  This is a welcoming home with a mix of victorian / edwardian design. You are able to use the shared bathroom with shower and bath, along with the microwave in the kitchen.  Use of microwave, kitchen and dining room. There is a garden that you can use. There are 2 supermarkets within a 5 minute walk. We have pubs and restaurants nearby, the hideaway is close, which is famous for its jazz. Streatham High road has plenty of shops and restaurants to cater for most. There is also a new leaisure complex with a swimming pool, gym and ice rink. We serve continental breakfast in the morning. You may smoke outside. There is free parking nearby. We have 2 cats. The nearest train stations are Norbury, Streatham and Streatham Common, which are a short walk away.

name: 2 Bed Flat 5 mins from Olympic Park
space: The property boasts 2 carpeted double bedrooms and a good size tiled bathroom, an open plan living/kitchen area, a private balcony which faces the Olympic Park, a mere 5 minutes from the apartment and it can sleep from 4 to 6 people. The 14'7" x 8'6" Master bedroom has an added bonus of a 7'1" x 4'0" dressing area. The apartment is furnished throughout which includes a 42" TV, a kettle, microwave and built in washer/dryer and is conveniently on the 1st floor accessible via stairs or lift. Located near Pudding Mill Lane DLR, a supermarket, minutes away from Stratford train and bus Station and Westfield Shopping Centre with a frequent bus service to and from the City. Available during the London 2012 Olympic Games only. A non-refundable 25% deposit is required at time of booking to hold the apartment and a security deposit of £2000 before the arrival date.

space: Our family home is available to rent occasionally, and comes with the care of our cat, so you must be an animal lover.  The flat: It is on the 1st floor and is modern, bright and homely. neighborhood_overview: The flat is on a quiet residential road on the edge of a large popular park and is a 10-15 minute walk from the centre of Balham. It's an easy walk to the centre of Balham or there's a local bus. Balham is in South London and is a vibrant, trendy area with a large choice of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops and supermarkets. It's 4 miles (6.4kms) from Central London and has both the Underground and Overground trains, making it quick and easy to get to the centre.
notes: The rental includes the care of our cat, so you must love cats. He is very easy to care for. No litter trays to change as he goes outside. Just fill up his food and water bowl, some cuddles and put him in the kitchen at night to sleep.
transit: It's about a 12 minute walk to the Tube/rail station or there's a local bus from an adjoining road that takes you directly to the Tube/Rail/Balham centre. Tube - Balham Underground Station is in Zone 3 of the Northern Line. It's 15-20 minutes to Central London. Rail - Balham has a train station with trains to Victoria/Waterloo taking about 15-20 minutes. Airports - Gatwick is about 45 minutes away on the train. Heathrow is about an hour away on the tube. City Airport is about 45 minutes away on the tube. Stansted and Luton are further away on the train/bus from central London. Car - Parking is free on weekends and Bank Holidays. On a Monday-Friday there is a parking restriction from 10am-12 midday and you would need to move your car to a nearby road which isn't restricted.
access: Guests have sole use of the flat and access to all of the flat and the garden.
house_rules: The booking entails the loving care of our cat. This is our family home- please respect our home and our neighbours and keep noise to a minimum, especially after 10pm. No same gender groups of more than 2 persons can make a booking. Only the guests who are detailed in the reservation can stay overnight or enter the flat.  Please remove your outdoor shoes when you enter the flat.

name: Gorgeous double at Camden Market
summary: This fine property in the heart of Camden Town / Chalk Farm combines the traditional Georgian townhouse with sleek and modern design, great for open plan living. This cool house is a calm antidote to the hustle and bustle of London life.
space: I have a lovely room in my house which is situated just by Camden Lock's famous Stables Market.  The House; The room is on the top floor, a big double room with lots of storage space. I have a small Jack Russell dog called Buster who is very cute  and friendly. The Area; The house is just steps from the famous Camden Lock Market, where you can visit the unique shops, and grab a vintage bargain, or hang out at Proud, the bar that has seen performances from Amy Winehouse and Coldplay. On the high street you will also find zillions of restaurants and clubs, bars and coffee shops. In Camden there is also a massive Sainsbury's, so you can stock up on supplies if you decide to cook at meal at home rather than eating out. It is also just a short walk to Primrose Hill, where you get a great view over the city. And Regents Park and London Zoo is just round the corner too.  The area benefits from great transportation links. It is just a short walk to either Chalk Farm, or Camden Road underground

name: 3 Bedroom House by Camden Stables
summary: This fine property in the heart of Camden Town  / Chalk Farm combines the traditional Georgian townhouse with sleek and modern design, great for open plan living. This cool house is a calm antidote to the hustle and bustle of London life.
space: I have a amazing house which is situated just by Camden Lock's famous Stables Market.  The House; There are three bedrooms in the house, two big doubles and one smaler room with a small double. I also have an inflatable single bed and an inflatable double bed, so you can comfortably sleep 9 or 10 in the house. You could also set up a duvet on the sofa downstairs. The Area; The house is just steps from the famous Camden Lock Market, where you can visit the unique shops, and grab a vintage bargain, or hang out at Proud, the bar that has seen performances from Amy Winehouse and Coldplay. On the high street you will also find zillions of restaurants and clubs, bars and coffee shops. In Camden there is also a massive Sainsbury's, so you can stock up on supplies if you decide to cook at meal at home rather than eating out. It is also just a short walk to Primrose Hill, where you get a great view over the city. And Regents Park and London Zoo is just round the corner too.  The area benefits f

neighborhood_overview: It is Camden - turn left at the end of the road, or cross the road and you're  in the centre of the market. Very busy if you want it to be...if you want a quieter life, turn right at the end of the road and make your way to Primrose Hill and Hampstead.
transit: Two underground stations five mins walk Camden Town and Chalk Farm, overground station five mins away is Kentish Town west, bus stops everywhere. You can get to oxford circus in twenty minutes, there's a bike station two mins walk away for instant bike rental or by foot you can walk to the centre of town in 45 mins...or take the canal route east or west. This is Camden.
access: All the rooms in the house! Three bedrooms, bathroom, WC, Lounge, dining room and outside decking area.
house_rules: Welcome! The house rules are that you are friendly and have fun in the house. Music must be played at an acceptable level so as not to upset my neighbours and if you smoke then you are welcome outside on the decking/patio area. You can use the kitchen and the washing machine and dryer.

name: Unwind on a Roof Terrace near Columbia Road Market
summary: Soak up the evening sun on the balcony or linger with skyline sunsets on the roof terrace. Inside this light, modern home with smart technology and heated floors, restful blues and greys are paired with retro accents, lush greenery, and funky prints.
space: The kitchen and living area offer a large sofa, armchair and dining table that seats 6. There's a flatscreen TV with Apple TV and SONOS speakers in all three rooms of the flat.  The kitchen includes a dishwasher, bean-to-cup espresso machine, KitchenAid mixer & blender as well as all the obvious bits and bobs you'd need to cook up a light breakfast or a full 3 course meal. The bathroom is spacious with a good shower and bath, large mirror and empty cupboards so you can store your toiletries and feel right at home. The bedroom has a comfy kingsize bed with feather pillows and duvet and 400 thread count white Egyptian cotton bed linen. There's a balcony leading off both the living room and the bedroom, which is a lovely place to sit of an evening especially when the sun is out. One of the best features has to be the incredible roof terrace, for lazing in the sun, drinking a glass of wine, or taking in the London skyline at night!
description: Soak up the evening sun on the balcony or linger with skyline sunsets on the roof terrace. Inside this light, modern home with smart technology and heated floors, restful blues and greys are paired with retro accents, lush greenery, and funky prints.
neighborhood_overview: Pick out some fresh flowers or local food from famous East London markets such as Columbia Road, Broadway Market, and Paradise Row. Walk to historic pubs, Michelin-starred restaurants, or the trendy bars of Brick Lane, Shoreditch, and Hoxton.
notes: - I'll leave breakfast for you so you can start your stay off with a full belly - There's a comprehensive 'Welcome Pack' full of info about the flat and the local area - I'll be contactable by phone throughout the duration of your stay in case you need anything! - I've had the space offline for some time, but will be opening it up again for 2018 again
transit: You're walking distance from the trendy bars of Brick Lane, Shoreditch and Hoxton, and are only 30 minutes by bus, or 12 minutes by tube from Oxford Circus.  There's also a 'Boris Bike' cycle hire station right in front of the building so you can explore the area by bike.
access: Everything except the hallway cupboard and my wardrobe - there's a separate wardrobe for you! Please note there's no access to a washer/dryer unless by prior agreement, as this is in the cupboard where my belongings are locked.
house_rules: If you smoke, please smoke outside with the doors closed, or on the roof terrace. Please refrain from rearranging the furniture as this can damage the floor and be difficult for the cleaner to move back in to place. Please tidy up before you leave. The cleaner will clean, but it'd be appreciated if you could leave the place tidy. Thank you!

name: Stratford City apartment room
space: Short walking distance to the Olympic Park, Stratford station, Westfield shopping centre, this is for a room with a double bed in a comfortable and convenient apartment. You will also have access to the living area - large TV, wireless internet (I have ethernet cables if required), lovely hifi amp+sound, PS3, kitchen facilities (washer/dryer, halogen stove, oven, kettle, toaster, fridge/freezer), and for your own use, the bathroom. There are also fantastic views of the olympic park from the terraced areas, accessed separately from within the complex. Note that this is my home, so I will be living here too with my other half (I have my own en-suite). I am also a coffee addict so if you enjoy freshly grounded french press or moka pot coffee (or just some tea), this is your place. I'll be happy to recommend cafes (and things to do) around London too as I enjoy the exploration for the good stuff. Transport:  Stratford is a major interchange connecting the Jubilee, Central, Overground, two

name: Double room in Victorian house
summary: A very comfortable double room in our home.
space: We have a beautiful double room in a Victorian house packed with charm and original features. We live in Friern Barnet, a quiet suburb of North London which benefits from excellent transport links into central London via the underground (Arnos Grove) or the overground rail network (New Southgate). There is also a direct rail link to St Pancras International for trains to/from Europe. We are less than 10 minutes walk to the North London Business Park.  Your room has a comfortable double king-sized bed and the use of a shared bathroom. Towels and bed linen are provided. This is perfect for either single travellers or a couple, and if you are travelling with a small child, we can squeeze them on the floor for minimal extra cost (please ask when making your enquiry). If you are 3 or 4 people travelling, we also have a twin room available, please see my other listings on the bottom right hand of this page. The house benefits from free on-street parking, wifi and a lovely garden to relax in.

notes: We have got an adorable puppy but realise that not everyone is a dog lover. He lives in the dining room but can be taken out of the room if you would rather.
transit: Our home is 10-15 minutes walk from Arnos Grove tube station (Piccadilly Line) and we also have an overground station (New Southgate) which has a timetabled service into the city and central London.  You can also take the 43 bus directly to Islington or into London Bridge.  Parking in our street is unrestricted.
access: You are welcome to join us in the evening in the dining room to chat or watch TV.
house_rules: We want you to feel at home in our house so rules are minimal. There's no smoking in the house and if you come home late please be quiet as we may be sleeping.

name: Fabulous Victorian House Islington Central London
summary: Our home is a very spacious, beautifully decorated and well maintained Victorian London terrace. There are three large bedrooms, two gorgeous reception rooms, a light and airy bathroom and a lovely garden with an additional roof terrace. We think you'll have everything you'll need to have a wonderful stay in London – while our house is on a very quiet street, which makes for a really relaxing and tranquil space, you can be in central London in 15 minutes.
space: The space is made up of a double living room with a log burner, large sofa, smart TV and a bar; a fully fitted kitchen with dining table, Rangemaster cooker, dishwasher and washing machine; a large garden with hammock (you can switch this for a swing if you're bringing children to stay); three large bedrooms for you to use, plus a small room with a sofa bed if you need it (for an additional charge of £30/night – this will be on top of what AirBnb charges you for the booking); and a bathroom with shower and large, original bath. There's a small separate loo too.  If you want to relax locally, Finsbury Park has a huge choice of great restaurants offering food from all around the world. There are also  plenty of great local pubs. Crouch End and Stoke Newington are a short distance away with restaurants, cafes and quirky shops. Islington's famous Upper Street – another hub of shops, pubs, independent theatres and restaurants – is a short bus or bicycle ride away.  We will happily recommend
description: Our home is a very spacious, beautifully decorated and well maintained Victorian London terrace. There are three large bedrooms, two gorgeous reception rooms, a light and airy bathroom and a lovely garden with an additional roof terrace. We think you'll have everything you'll need to have a wonderful stay in London – while our house is on a very quiet street, which makes for a really relaxing and tranquil space, you can be in central London in 15 minutes. The space is made up of a double living room with a log burner, large sofa, smart TV and a bar; a fully fitted kitchen with dining table, Rangemaster cooker, dishwasher and washing machine; a large garden with hammock (you can switch this for a swing if you're bringing children to stay); three large bedrooms for you to use, plus a small room with a sofa bed if you need it (for an additional charge of £30/night – this will be on top of what AirBnb charges you for the booking); and a bathroom with shower and large, original bath. There'
neighborhood_overview: I have lived in this neighbourhood for more than 20 years and still love the vibrancy and diversity of the people, businesses, restaurants and shops. Within a  couple of km you can find the best Greek and Turkish food in London. There are Ethiopian, Korean, Caribbean, Thai, Indian, Italian, Chinese and restaurants within a 10 minute walk. It is close to the East End and all its arts and clubs, close to central London and if you want to jump on a train to Cambridge you can. There are parks all around and if you want an adventure, you can walk up an old disused railway line and find yourself in Highgate Village and Hampstead Heath. You can swim outdoors in a local reservoir, play tennis in the park and walk to Green Lanes where you can eat your heart out on the best Greek food in London. I could go on and on...
transit: Situated in  a quiet residential street, our home is just a two minute walk to Finsbury Park station for easy and fast access into central London. Finsbury Park is served by underground (Piccadilly and Victoria lines), a choice of buses and British Rail – taking you straight into the heart of London to the galleries, museums,  Soho and the West End. We are very easily accessible from Heathrow, Stansted and the Eurostar station at Kings Cross. You can take a number of buses to Camden, Oxford Street, Dalston and Shoreditch.
access: You will have the whole house to yourselves.
house_rules: The house rules are simple: please take care of our home and treat it as you would your own. No parties, no loud music, be kind to the cat.  Please lock the house when you are in and out to maintain a secure environment. Enjoy your stay!!

name: Kings Cross Double Music Room & Private Bathroom
summary: Very Central Heart of London Zone 1 by the canal. Modern, safe, clean, tidy & friendly ‘house’ in a private gated mews. Our Music Room is large with a small private shower/toilet wet room. The Music Room has french doors leading to a private garden. The king size  bed has memory foam mattress. Large TV, Virgin hi speed WI Fi. Filtered drinking water, tea, coffee & fridge. We have other rooms in same house. Pls check our profile. Pls note after 10pm, check in is by keybox.
space: THE SPACE Late check ins are sometimes possible with keybox, please ask us. St Pancras Kings Cross very Large Double Room -Boutique Music Studio  with Private Bathroom & Private Garden.  TV, Hi Speed WiFi, Towels, bedding, shower gel, shampoo & hair dryer included. It is a music room and has a guitar for guests to play. To quote one of our guests, " The place is centrally located just at the edge of Westminster area. So if you are here for a holiday this is the place to be. Also Kings Cross st Pancras is the station to connect you to all the airports on a direct route without train changes and is about 5 min walk",  Sumeet Mahajan, 22nd March 2017 This uniquely quirky music room is bright and beautiful and is on in on the ground floor. It has it's own shower room/toilet & garden. Our friendly, safe 'house' is modern, clean & tidy & in a private gated mews. neighborhood_overview: The house is in a private gated mews near Kings Cross.  This is Zone 1.  Kings Cross has many tube lines and also the yellow Circle Line which is only present in Zone 1 Central London.  We have a 24 hour shop, chemist, dry cleaners, barbers, post office, restaurants and bars all within 30 seconds walk! Supermarkets are 5 minutes walk. Really cool Waitrose supermarket with its wine bar and live jazz music while you shop! This happening, cool part of London has charming walks by the canal to Camden Market, Kings Place (a concert hall complex with music, comedy, art and drama performances) and Granary Square (for famous Dishoom Indian Restaurant, Spiritland Retro Music bar), Coal Drop Yard NC1 or Angel for great dining & bars, British Library, Francis Crick institute, Welcome Foundation, Harry Potter Shop, Canal Museum, (Hidden by Airbnb) , You Tube, Samsung, Saddlers Wells, British Museum, Covent Garden/West End, Exmouth Market, Regents Park, London Zoo, Royal Academy of Music, RADA,St M
notes: BAG STORAGE & TRANSPORT LINKS You can check in between (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) hours and Check out by (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) am.  If you need to store your luggage outside of these times, please use bagbnb. Their website is (Website hidden by Airbnb) They provide  secure local storage. There are also luggage storage facilities at Kings Cross station & all other mainline  stations.  Unfortunately, we are unable to offer this extra service as we don't have the staff or space to facilitate this. If you are flying into Gatwick or Luton, the 'Bedford' train line runs from Brighton to Bedford and back stopping at Gatwick, St Pancras (Kings Cross), and Luton.  Unlike the Gatwick Express which goes to Victoria, this train from Gatwick direct to St Pancras is cheaper.  If you have an Oyster card or 'contact less' debit card it is even more cheap.  From Heathrow, you can take the tube Piccadilly line direct to Kings Cross (about 1.25 hour).  You can also take the Heathrow expres
transit: You can get everywhere easily from Kings Cross.  Numerous tubes, trains, buses, City bike stand (15 seconds away)! It a great location, as an example - Tube journey to Oxford Circus & Tottenham Court Road is 4 mins! or 30 minutes walk. Bus journey 21 minutes. British Library 8 minutes walk.  We have 24 hour bus service to a bus stop opposite the house.  Buses direct to Oxford Street, Trafalgar Square (National Gallery), St Pauls Cathedral, London Bridge, Covent garden, Marble Arch, Notting Hill Gate, Hyde Park & numerous other locations.  A tube service runs 24hours at the weekend. Also, most galleries and museums in London are free & close by! You can travel all over the UK & Europe from Kings Cross, St Pancras in one day & still be back in time for bed!  Paris - 2 hours 16 minutes Brussells - 2 hours 1 minute Gatwick Airport - 48 minutes Luton Airport - 28 minutes Heathrow Airport 48 minutes Cambridge - 46 minutes Brighton - 1 hour 15 minutes York - 2 hours 50 minutes Scotland, Edinb
access: GUEST ACCESS The bedroom/music room, en suite, kitchen/diner/ lounge room, garden.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES, TERMS & CONDITIONS & ESSENTIAL GUEST INFORMATION We thank you for taking the time to read our rules. From past experience and being part of the Air BnB Community, we have compiled this list to make everyone’s stay more comfortable: - 1.Strictly, no smoking anywhere in the house (including leaning out of the window), the roof terrace or the gardens! Never bring the cigarette butts back into the house, lit or extinguished. We have a zero tolerance to smoking due to health and safety along with thousands of pounds worth of damage having already been caused to our house masonry by cigarette butts being stubbed out. If you smoke on our property you will be required to cancel your booking and leave without refund 2.No lighted candles or other naked flames in the house, on the terrace or in the gardens. 3.Always double lock the front door 4.Our co hosts need access to check our rooms everyday to empty bins, replenish, toilet paper, soap etc. 5.Always lock your windows & any commo

name: 2-3 bedroom house available for Christmas period
summary: Beautiful large family Victorian house, 7 minutes walk from Leytonstone High Road station and 40 minutes journey to Central London. Sole use of large family bathroom,  2 bedrooms upstairs and 1 bedroom downstairs, kitchen and garden.
space: We have a spacious, clean quadruple room  upstairs. The room sleeps 4-5 people. There is one double bed, 2 single mattresses, and a single sofa bed in the room Upstairs also is a second bedroom with double bed. Downstairs there is a single bedroom which adjoins the sittingroom. Getting around is also really easy. We are located in zone 3 in Leytonstone, East London. From here it is just 20 minutes to Liverpool Street, in

name: Beautiful 2 double bedroom
summary: It is at a great location and it feels like home with all necessary comforts
space: Beautiful two double bedroom flat available in a fantastic, newly refurbished Victorian house in South West London, close to Earls Court, South Kensington and Chelsea. The flat consists of two double bedrooms that are bright, huge and clean. An open plan kitchen, a living room with dining area with a grand piano and a big bathroom with shower and bath.  Flat has recently been renovated.  Changes refer to new heating system, new carpet, flooring in bath and kitchen, new beds and mattresses, internal decorations, paintwork and different colour in rooms. We are planning further on changes of sofas curtains and colour of some of the furniture to add further to an even more stylish look . As we are still improving the place current photos do not reflect last mentioned changes.  We are aiming to have most updated photos very soon. name: Loft for rent in Victorian house
summary: The loft can be prepared with a single bed, a double, 2 single mattresses together or a combination of a double and a single or three singles. There are three chests of drawers in the room, a hanging rack and a big desk. To get into the loft you climb a very secure ladder. We prefer not to have children in there under 10 years of age in that room.
space: You will share the rest of the house with the other tenants (if there are any) and us. There is a washing machine, high-speed internet (220Mb) and a 32-inch Freeview TV with sports channels. The house is on a quiet street, but transport facilities are just around the corner. For shopping, we have several shops 2 minutes walk from our house and a typical English pub as well. We have various rooms available in the house, please see our other listings and get in touch if you have any questions. Since we love our house so much we ask people to keep their rooms tidy and clean up in the kitchen and bathroom after use. You will have your own cupboard in the kitchen and space in the fridge, so, please don't bring food in your room. All our kitchen appliances are available to our guests, from Italian coffee machines to our high-speed pizza oven. ;)

neighborhood_overview: It's a typical East End neighbourhood with a pub, local shops and supermarkets just around the corner.
notes: For short term stays there is coffee, various teas, sugar, salt/pepper and toilet paper provided. Beyond a 2-week stay are expected to buy their own.
transit: Public transport is great here and we're in zone 2, it takes 20 minutes to get to Westfield shopping centre at Stratford, 25 minutes to the Tower of London and 30 minutes to Big Ben, just to give you an idea. We are also fortunate to have a night bus from Regent Street to a bus stop 2 minutes walk from our house (N15). And don't forget the Underground runs Friday and Saturday all night as well, not all but at least the main ones. Extended transport: Underground: Canning Town ( Underground Jubilee line and DLR): 7 minutes by bus or 20 minutes walk Plaistow: 5 minutes by bus Bus:  Stratford with Westfield shopping center 15 mins (National Express buses to and from Stansted leave from here) Excel/Custom House Exhibition center: 5 mins / 20 minutes on foot O2 Arena:  10 mins away. City Airport. 12 mins
access: You will share the whole house with us and the other (generally) international) guests
house_rules: Just keep your room tidy and respect the other guests. There's no particular time you have to be in and you'll have your own set of keys to the house. We keep the living room, staircase, kitchen and bathroom clean. You can use the washing machine and have drying racks to put in the patio if the weather allows it, otherwise we'll tell you where we dry our laundry at the local launderette.

name: LARGE 2 BED FLAT IDEAL FOR FAMILIES
summary: Our 2 bedroom ground floor flat is spacious, comfortable and stylish, it is located in a very quiet area of London and perfect for a up to 4 persons plus one baby.
space: Dear visitors to London, We're a couple in our 30s and we live in a pleasant 2-bedroom 1960s maisonette in Willesden Green, North West London, 20 minutes by tube to the centre. Our flat is available to let for short periods at certain times of year. THE FLAT: ground floor garden flat in a two-floor maisonette. Lovely front and back gardens, both have garden furniture and are very well maintained. Spacious spotless kitchen with new appliances and a kitchen table for 3. Large living room with 42'' flat screen TV with Sky satellite and a dining table for 6. Bathroom with shower and bathtub, separate toilet. Central heating. Free wifi. Washer-dryer. Towels and bed linen provided.  THE BEDROOMS: the master bedroom has a large super king size bed, flat screen TV, desk and french doors that open to the back garden. The slightly smaller second bedroom has two single comfortable mattresses on the floor with built-in wardrobe, as well as a baby changing table and baby bed (up to 3 years). Some s
description: Our 2 bedroom ground floor flat is spacious, comfortable and stylish, it is located in a very quiet area of London and perfect for a up to 4 persons plus one baby. Dear visitors to London, We're a couple in our 30s and we live in a pleasant 2-bedroom 1960s maisonette in Willesden Green, North West London, 20 minutes by tube to the centre. Our flat is available to let for short periods at certain times of year. THE FLAT: ground floor garden flat in a two-floor maisonette. Lovely front and back gardens, both have garden furniture and are very well maintained. Spacious spotless kitchen with new appliances and a kitchen table for 3. Large living room with 42'' flat screen TV with Sky satellite and a dining table for 6. Bathroom with shower and bathtub, separate toilet. Central heating. Free wifi. Washer-dryer. Towels and bed linen provided.  THE BEDROOMS: the master bedroom has a large super king size bed, flat screen TV, desk and french doors that open to the back garden. The slightly sma
neighborhood_overview: THE 'HOOD: Willesden Green is a friendly neighbourhood in north west London, zone 2. The local tube station, about half a mile (6 minutes walk) from the flat, is on the Jubilee Line, with frequent trains to central London (only 10 minutes to Baker Street and 13 minutes to Bond Street station on Oxford Street). The local high street has a Sainsbury's supermarket, a pharmacy and a number of restaurants and cafes. The street itself is a lovely cul-de-sac, which - quite unusually for London - has a strong community feel, with neighbours that actually know each other! Quiet and family-friendly. It's so quiet here you won't believe you're just 4 miles from the centre of town. The verdant Gladstone Park is just 5 minutes' walk away.  Parking is on request if needed
transit: ACCESS FROM AIRPORTS:  Stansted: take the A6 bus (£8, 55 mins) to Finchley Road, then the tube to Willseden Green (5 mins)  Luton: take the train to West Hampstead (25 mins) or the bus to Fincheley Road (55 mins), then the tube to Willdesden Green (5 mins)  London City: take the DLR to Canning Town (7 mins), then the Jubilee Line to Willesden Green (35 mins)  Heathrow: take the Healthrow Express to Paddington (15 mins), then the Bakerloo Line to Baker street (10 mins), then the Jubilee Line to Willesden Green (10 mins); or if you have a lot of luggage, take a mini-cab for about £30 (we can pre-order one for you, upon request)
access: Please note that some closets will be out of bounds, not available but apart from that guests can access all areas of the flat

name: London, Hoxton. Nice, 2 bedroom, 7th floor flat.
summary: Privately owned ex-council flat in a large block. Lift and stair access. Very central with good transport links. Short walking distance to famous Shoreditch/Hoxton nightlife. Short walking distance to the beautiful Regent's Canal waterway which runs east to west across London. Good local park. A good range of local shops and takeaways.
space: Welcome to our  family home in Hoxton. We are on the 7th floor and so have great light plus good views both east and west over London. We have fast wifi, cable tv (BT vision), central heating, double glazing and newly fitted smoke detector/alarm.  We have two bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other with a single 'captain's' bed (up a small ladder) and a single sofa bed. The kitchen is very well equipped with many pots, pans, knives and accessories. It also includes: fridge, freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, double electric oven with a gas hob, a kettle and a toaster.  The airy, light, comfortable lounge has a large sofa (which is comfortable to sleep on), window seating, a flat screen tv with surround sound, CD and DVD player, a Wii, Playstation2 and Xbox 360.  The new condensing boiler will fill the bath or power the shower using a thermostatic mixer. The bathroom also houses the toilet, a sink and a heated clothes drying area.  This is our family home and we only make it av

Short walking distance to the beautiful Regent's Canal waterway which runs east to west across London. Good local park. A good range of local shops and takeaways. It also includes: fridge, freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, double electric oven with a gas hob, a kettle and a toaster.  The airy, light, comfortable lounge has a large sofa (which is comfortable to
neighborhood_overview: The flat is located on the Wenlock Barn Estate, a Hackney council owned social housing estate. We do however own the flat in our building. We have good relations with our neighbours and love living in this area. The neighbourhood is fairly 'typical' for London; it is generally chilled out and friendly but there is a chance you may experience some noise from young children playing football outside during the day and, occasionally, older children chatting in the park at night. We have a good range of shops and takeaways on the estate (GREAT pizza and good fish and chips, Chinese, sushi, Indian and kebab).   Islington is a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus ride away and has a huge range of shops, bars and restaurants. There are several sports centers and swimming pools close by. The infamous 'Shoreditch Nightlife' is a short walk away as is the beautiful Regent's canal where you can walk (east or west) for hours, admiring the lovely boats, summer planting, many parks and wonderful wildlife.
transit: We are in a very central location with easy access to The City, the West End, Theatre Land and all the main train stations.  UNDERGROUND.  10-12 minutes (Old Street Station, Northern Line).  BUSES - various- we are close to many bus stops giving good access to West End, tourist attractions, River Thames, St Paul's Cathedral, The Southbank, Covent Garden and all mains railway stations.   NATIONAL RAIL - King's Cross / St Pancras (20 mins), Old Street (10 mins), Victoria (35 mins).  CAR PARKING - you can park in any designated 'residents parking space' within the estate. This means there are 3 car parks within easy walking distance; these do get busy at certain times of the day and a bit of patience may be necessary. You will need a Scratch and Display' voucher for each day you park. We can buy these for you before you arrive - they are not expensive. Please ask for more information. You may also park free in any suitable street parking space during the weekend.
access: All
house_rules: Please ensure that both the back and the front door are locked when you are out of the flat. Please do not make loud or unnecessary noise or, in any other way, upset or annoy our considerate neighbours. Please ensure that the cooker and gas hob are properly turned off after use. Please contact us immediately if anything goes wrong, needs maintenance or if you have any questions regarding the flat.  We have left a complete set of detailed instructions for all appliances, heating and audio-visual entertainment.

name: 2 Bed Flat in East London By The Canal W/Balcony
summary: Beautiful 2 bed apartment with a fantastic balcony and stunning views of the canal. The home is only moments from buzzing Shoreditch and a 10 minute walk to Bethnal Green underground station. The area is full of life at the weekends being close to the famous Columbia Road flower market (Sundays) and Broadway market (Saturdays). The flat is perfect for a couple, friends or even business travellers.
space: Amenities:  - Professionally cleaned - Hotel-quality bed linen and towels - 24/7 check-in as there is a lockbox with the keys This spacious and modern two double bedroom apartment is ideally located for anyone wanting to experience the attractions of central London and the charm and culture of the artistic east end. The Property You have two double bedrooms with big wardrobes for all your clothes and luggage. There is a separate kitchen with everything you should need including a coffee maker, washing machine and dishwasher. The living room is bright and spacious and includes a 48” HD SMART TV with surround sound. The balcony has tables and chairs. It overlooks Regents Canal and Mile End park. You can see the Olympic stadium and the sky scrapers of Canary Wharf.

You'll be just moments from two tube stations, lots of buses and a bike station so transport is great. The flat is really quiet but as soon as you step outside you’ll find lots of pubs, restaurants, galleries, markets and the pretty Victoria Park village
notes: Unlimited high speed WiFi,  DVD player, fresh bed linen, clean towels, cutlery, kitchen utensils, iron and ironing board and hairdryer.
transit: Bethnal Green and Mile End tube stations (10 minute walk) Bus numbers: 8, D6 Bike hire station My place is also a 5 minute walk away from Queen Mary's Mile End Campus!
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
house_rules: - Smoking is only permitted on the balcony. - Please keep noise down to a minimum after 11pm in respect for your neighbours. - If you have any questions or queries during your stay you can contact me directly. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply. - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. - Please treat the home as you would your own. - No parties.

name: Room w/ WIFI in Arty Victorian
summary: Authentic London experience in charming Victorian house.  See how real Londoners live in one of the original Victorian planned communities designed by Roland Plumbe.
space: **Please be sure you have read description, house rules, check in/out times BEFORE booking. Once you've booked, your itinerary will have detailed directions to the house. .** If you'd like an authentic London experience we can offer you a comfortable place to stay in Noel Park, a historic conservation area made up of Victorian terraced houses that were designed by Roland Plumb, for the "upright working man and his family." So you'll get a quiet, peaceful place to stay that is surrounded by vibrant, urban Wood Green.  The room can be configured with one single bed or two single beds-perfect for friends travelling together. The room is a small double. To use real estate parlance, it's a cozy fit for two people. (in case size is a concern -- it's regular-sized room, not a box room). It has a place to hang your clothes and under-bed luggage storage. The cost for an additional person is £12 per night.  The  shared bathroom and the two toilet rooms are newly renovated and modern.    You're w

neighborhood_overview: Noel Park, a historic conservation area made up of Victorian terraced houses that were designed by Roland Plumb, for the "upright working man and his family." So you'll get a quiet, peaceful place to stay that is surrounded by vibrant, urban Wood Green with a busy high street for lots of shopping.
notes: We only rent to one set of guests at a time, so you will be the only ones in the house, except for the hosts--two adults.  We have three cats. They are clean and shy so you may not see them and you certainly won't smell them. They are not allowed in the room we rent out.
transit: Public transport is plentiful and convenient. We're close to Wood Green Station on the Piccadilly line (underground). There's also an overland train nearby at Alexandra Palace, and buses that stop less than a block from our house. In addition to being walking distance from the high road with plentiful shopping and even more buses.
access: Kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms -- all of the house except our personal bedrooms.
house_rules: We just have a few rules: You are welcome to use the kitchen for light cooking, such as reheating ready meals in the oven. Unfortunately, too many guests have destroyed the pots and pans and caused kitchen fires so we no longer allow people to cook using pots and pans on the stove, but you are welcome to reheat things. No smokers please. This doesn't mean you "only smoke when you're drunk" or "once in a blue moon". No smokers, ever. No one under 18 without an accompanying adult. Please lock the door if you are the last person to leave the house for your days' adventures and if you come in at night after everyone else has gone to bed. We are, after all, in London. Thanks!

name: The Star of the East - 1st floor suite
summary: Lovely big room on first floor of converted pub in Shoreditch. There's a huge king sized bed and a single bed, free standing cast iron bath and antique corner sink. Bay window catches the morning sun, sash window at the rear opens onto roof garden.
space: The Star of the East is a converted pub in Shoreditch, East London. The first floor is open plan with beds at one end and a freestanding cast iron bath at the back. Also on the first floor is a roof terrace with views of the park and the city beyond. Interesting decor ranges from 70's modern to Victorian decadence
description: Lovely big room on first floor of converted pub in Shoreditch. There's a huge king sized bed and a single bed, free standing cast iron bath and antique corner sink. Bay window catches the morning sun, sash window at the rear opens onto roof garden. The Star of the East is a converted pub in Shoreditch, East London. The first floor is open plan with beds at one end and a freestanding cast iron bath at the back. Also on the first floor is a roof terrace with views of the park and the city beyond. Interesting decor ranges from 70's modern to Victorian decadence You will have access to the bedroom and toilet which take up the whole first floor of the house, as well as the roof garden. We often work from home and we're always happy to help out when we can. We are close to Broadway Market with it's lovely shops, bars and restaurants and Saturday farmer's market. In the other direction is Columbia Road with it's famous Sunday flower market. At the back of the house is Haggerston Park which is
neighborhood_overview: We are close to Broadway Market with it's lovely shops, bars and restaurants and Saturday farmer's market. In the other direction is Columbia Road with it's famous Sunday flower market. At the back of the house is Haggerston Park which is a bit of a local secret, and the Hackney City Farm which has an excellent cafe.
transit: The nearest station is Hoxton (London Overground). Bethnal Green (Central Line) is 10 minutes walk, and the 26, 48 and 55 buses stop nearby.
access: You will have access to the bedroom and toilet which take up the whole first floor of the house, as well as the roof garden.
house_rules: The cats are not allowed in the room, the dog is not allowed upstairs. No loud music after midnight.

name: Charming 2-bed Shoreditch Apartment
space: Welcome to my clean and modern 2-bedroom apartment in the heart of trendy East London. It's perfect for anyone looking for a comfortable home with real character in an unbeatable location.  The apartment is in the heart of the London's most vibrant area yet benefits from the quiet location of a lovely Victorian street. A great selection of bars and restaurants are just around the corner and the general buzz of the Shoreditch nightlife is only minutes away. It's on the doorstep of Hoxton Square and Redchurch Street; home to some of the most avant garde art galleries and near Brick Lane and the Columbia Street flower market. The 2-bedroom modern flat is creatively decorated with separate bathroom and kitchen and a small outside patio. It includes everything you need in order to have a great time in London.  The flat can comfortable sleep 4 people, with the possibility of an extra person on the sofa if needed. The apartment has been furnished to a high standard throughout and includes wir

The flat can comfortable sleep 4 people, with the possibility of an extra person on the sofa if needed. The apartment has been furnished to a high standard throughout and includes wir
neighborhood_overview: My favourite restaurants, bars & street markets in the area – ENJOY! Cockney Street Markets:  Brick Lane Flea Market is on Sunday from about 8am-3pm. It's about a 10 minute walk from my apartment. Make sure you walk through the lovely Arnold Circus estate on the way over and along Redchurch Street with its’ wonderful boutique shops. (URL HIDDEN) Good website for local sights around Brick Lane: (URL HIDDEN) Columbia Road Flower Market, about a 5 minute walk from my apartment is also on Sunday like Brick Lane market and starts at about 7am. They're both a wonderful slice of East London like filled with cockneys shouting out their wares. Best to go early because it's gets very crowded.  It’s on Columbia Road.  Broadway Market: Delicious food stands and clothing beside the canal every Saturday. Get there on foot. It’s a lovely 30 minute walk down Regent’s Canal, just north of my flat.  Good for people watching. (URL HIDDEN) Spitalfields Market is on every day but the best day is Saturday f
transit: - Old Street underground station, on the Northern Line, is a 7 minute walk from my apartment. - Hoxton overground station is a 9 minute walk from my apartment. - There are many buses going to the centre of city and south of the Thames
access: You can access all areas. I'm afraid the yard at the back of the house on the ground floor is not accessed by me and can only be used by the ground floor flats.
house_rules: No smoking or pets please

name: Big Double room/own bathroom/Zone 2
space: Big double room with own key and private bathroom in nice Victorian house in a quiet cul de sac.  Free wifi, TV, kettle, desk.   Self service continental breakfast.  Wifi is available free of charge if you bring your laptop. Shops and Cafes.  There are Indian, Thai, French, Italian, Greek, Chinese restaurants within 2 minutes walk on Upper and Lower Richmond Roads and along the river Thames. name: 50% off!! Beautiful Flat - London Bridge. SE1
summary: This listing is for a 2 bed/1 bath super sleek apartment in one of London's hottest areas. It is tucked away behind Bermondsey St, so you have a quiet retreat but with some fabulous restaurants, bars, galleries, and the river, on your doorstep.
space: This beautifully decorated flat is on the top floor in a secure lift service block. It has a huge bright sitting room with views of the London Eye, and a walkway panorama from the Eye to the Tower of London.  The bedroom has light excluding blinds and double glazing to keep the sights and sounds of London out. The main bedroom has a double bed with top-mattress for extra comfort. The office has a sofa-bed to sleep two more guests - please note, this second bed is 3/4 size, so its a cozy fit for two adults, and an uncomfortable night for two large adults not used to sleeping in close confines! The sofa in the living room converts to a larger double sofa bed if needed.   Our kitchen has everything you need - dishwasher, microwave, washing machine - and is stocked with all the essential hardware and basic ingredients, so, should you want to stay in, you will have everything you need to make a meal. The flat has wireless internet, a sound system and ipod dock, and a small TV, to make your
description: This listing is for a 2 bed/1 bath super sleek apartment in one of London's hottest areas. It is tucked away behind Bermondsey St, so you have a quiet retreat but with some fabulous restaurants, bars, galleries, and the river, on your doorstep. This beautifully decorated flat is on the top floor in a secure lift service block. It has a huge bright sitting room with views of the London Eye, and a walkway panorama from the Eye to the Tower of London.  The bedroom has light excluding blinds and double glazing to keep the sights and sounds of London out. The main bedroom has a double bed with top-mattress for extra comfort. The office has a sofa-bed to sleep two more guests - please note, this second bed is 3/4 size, so its a cozy fit for two adults, and an uncomfortable night for two large adults not used to sleeping in close confines! The sofa in the living room converts to a larger double sofa bed if needed.   Our kitchen has everything you need - dishwasher, microwave, washing machine
neighborhood_overview: The apartments are set around a quiet courtyard, on a street in Bermondsey St Village - an area that The Times calls "London's most fashionable new area" which is also dripping with history. The street is full of gourmet restaurants and bars, boutique shops and great coffee shops. We are just 10 minutes from Hayes Galleria and the river, and from there you can stroll along the river walk to Tate Modern, the South Bank, West End and City. If you are visiting at the weekend, we are a short walk to Borough Market - London's best foodie market. This area really is vibrant - London's newest gallery, White Cube 2, recently opened up next door - so please do come and tell us what new treats you find!
notes: In addition to the main bedroom, the office has a sofa-bed to sleep more guests - but please note, this second bed is 3/4 size, so its a cozy fit for two adults, and an uncomfortable night for two large adults not used to sleeping very closely! The sofa in the living room is a comfy double bed too. If you chose to use this as an additional sleeping space, please protect it with linen, and return it to sofa configuration before leaving. We also have a travel cot available under the bed in the main bedroom if you are travelling with a small child.
transit: The apartment is located just 10 mins walk from London Bridge Station and Tower Bridge, so has great access to rail, tube and bus services - making for easy access the rest of London. Its also a short walk to the river, from where you can make your way on foot up to all the sights.
access: The flat is all yours to enjoy, and we will not disturb you during your stay. This is our second home, however, containing our personal belongings, so we ask that you treat everything you find there with the utmost respect.
house_rules: There is no smoking inside the house.  The floors are solid hardwood, so please do not wear stiletto heels inside the house.  Please be respectful of our neighbours. Keep noise to a minimum after 11.30pm.

name: Fabulous room + bathroom in gorgeous Mayfair
summary: A very spacious and exceptionally comfortable bedroom with an adjoining stunning brand new bathroom in the best location in London.  Suits independent travellers who want to stay in Mayfair without paying Mayfair prices. IMPORTANT: READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION INCLUDING THE HOUSE MANUAL AND RULES FULLY BEFORE BOOKING. If you would like to book please ensure you have uploaded a government issued ID beforehand.
space: Very large double bedroom with private bathroom and wifi within my own home. The room is within a spacious 4th floor flat with easy-going host in the middle of Mayfair. The building has a lift/elevator, 24 hour porterage and the flat has views towards Hyde Park and over the rooftops of Mayfair.  Bed linens and bath towels are top-quality and there is plenty of hanging and drawer space in the wardrobe. The kitchen is available for breakfast and tea/coffee and similar light use at other times of the day but not for cooking meals unless agreed in advance. There is also a housekeeper three times a week. All are welcome but preference is given to women either travelling alone or together.
description: A very spacious and exceptionally comfortable bedroom with an adjoining stunning brand new bathroom in the best location in London.  Suits independent travellers who want to stay in Mayfair without paying Mayfair prices. IMPORTANT: READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION INCLUDING THE HOUSE MANUAL AND RULES FULLY BEFORE BOOKING. If you would like to book please ensure you have uploaded a government issued ID beforehand. Very large double bedroom with private bathroom and wifi within my own home. The room is within a spacious 4th floor flat with easy-going host in the middle of Mayfair. The building has a lift/elevator, 24 hour porterage and the flat has views towards Hyde Park and over the rooftops of Mayfair.  Bed linens and bath towels are top-quality and there is plenty of hanging and drawer space in the wardrobe. The kitchen is available for breakfast and tea/coffee and similar light use at other times of the day but not for cooking meals unless agreed in advance. There is also a housekeeper t
neighborhood_overview: You cannot find a better location to stay in London! Mayfair is one of the oldest and most exclusive parts of London. Every amenity you could possibly want is within walking distance and every major site in London is either nearby or within very easy access. The restaurants and cafes of historic Shepherd Market are around the corner and the world-renowned shopping and restaurants of Bond Street and Mount Street are a 5 minute walk away as are Oxford Street and Knightsbridge. Hyde Park and Green Park are right across the street, Buckingham Palace a 4 minute walk, Big Ben, Parliament and the London Eye another minute or so. The bars and restaurants of Soho and all the great stage shows in Theatreland are also less than 10 minutes away.
notes: Please do not send a reservation request without a profile picture. Please read the entire description and THEN ask me any questions. Happy to answer anything but most information you could possibly want is included here. I only accept bookings from guests who upload a government issued ID. Please do not send a reservation request without one. Once you have booked please read my directions. Do NOT rely on (Hidden by Airbnb) maps instead of my directions. I am VERY easy to find. (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps may send you elsewhere if you enter just the building name.
transit: Right on the doorstep are Green Park and Hyde Park Corner tube stations and more buses than you can count on Park Lane and Piccadilly to take you in every direction. The Heathrow Express at Paddington is less than 10 minutes away or the Piccadilly line from Heathrow comes almost to the front door. The Gatwick Express from Victoria station is approximately 5 minutes away. This is the ultimate location for anyone visiting London. There is no parking available in the building and I do NOT recommend you drive into Central London. Any on-street parking is very limited and very expensive.
access: Guests have their own private bathroom.  They are welcome to use the kitchen for the complimentary tea/coffee provided and for other light use. There is fridge space available for guests to put anything they want in the fridge. Any cooking in the kitchen must be agreed with the host beforehand.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking anywhere in the apartment. There is a balcony for smoking on the landing. Do not bring in any visitors.  Please do not leave lights on if you are not home. Please don't throw out food waste in the bedroom. Please put it in the bin in the kitchen. Normal rules of mutual respect apply as we are sharing a space and this is my home. Check out is STRICTLY by 11am but guests are welcome to leave their bags securely with the porter if they have a late flight/train. Please inform me if you may be delayed arriving.

name: Double Room for professionals incl WIFI
summary: Our room is in a friendly and quiet area, St Mary Cray, Orpington. We really like St Mary Cray as it gives a rural feeling in the busy city. It also has great and easy connection to central London main train stations. The double room has a double bed, chest of draws, desk with chair and some built in cupboard. It's ideal for 1 or 2 people. Over the years we have hosted people from all around the world. We leave you to your business but also happy to have some conversions if that is welcomed.
space: Flat is clean and has shared kitchen (with all appliances,washing machine, fridge, freezer, microwave, kettle, dishes and cuttleries are available to use) and 4 piece bathroom. Room is with double bed, chester draw and a nice desk. Please note bedsheet, towel and European plugs are provided.  Easy transport: From St Mary Cray Station (3 mins by Bus R6 from in front of the house): 25 mins London Victoria Station, 40 Mins St Pancras International, also get to Bromley South, Elephant & Castle, Blackfriars, City Thameslink, Farringdon, Ashford International, Luton Airport and Bedford. From Orpington (15 mins by Bus R6 from in front of the house): Waterloo East (21 mins), London Bridge (16 mins), Charing Cross and Cannon Street. Free car park in the front. Smokers no problem however no smoking inside the flat. Please note I have a cat in residence, so if you have cat hair allergy I am afraid my place is not for you. notes: We also provide Airport transfers if it is required by our guests. Trips: We also offer guided trips to inside and outside of London. Prices suits individual requests and what our customers would like to see.  For outside of London we take you by car and show you around the area you wish to see. We are able to take up to 3 people in our car.  For London trips and sightseeing tours we use public transport and support you with your personal tourist guide. If you are interested and would like to get a quote all you need to do is
transit: Right in front of the flat there is 2 bus stops for bus R6, this takes you to St Mary Cray station in about 3 minutes or to Orpington station in about 15-20 minutes.  From St Mary Cray Station you can get to Victoria Station (Central London) in about 25 minutes. from Orpington station you can get to London Bridge Station in 15 minutes and Waterloo Station in about 20 minutes.  Other buses on Sevenoaks Way which is about 5 minutes walk from the flat are: 51, B14, R1 - all take you to Orpington Station.  St Mary Cray Station is about 10 minutes walk.
access: You will be sharing the kitchen, bathroom, living room and garden with the owners and the cat.
house_rules: -Please always ensure you give contact details, so if we need to inform you about something we can reach you easily. -The address should not be used for any personal reasons e.g.: opening bank account or as a permanent address at all times. -Convenient areas (kitchen, living room, bathroom and toilet) must be left in a clean condition after use.  -We make sure that the property is in clean condition. name: Double room in lovely period house - friendly host
summary: Double room in charming Edwardian house built in 1905.  It's a big house with a host who is mostly away so you will have the place to yourself.  It's homely, spacious, and a classic London period experience.
space: Double room available in charming Edwardian house with friendly host Many original features make this a lovely place to stay.   There is a lovely bathroom with a fantastic power shower.   You are welcome to use the kitchen as if it were your own and the dining room joins on to it.  This lovely quiet house is a pleasant place to rest away from the busy town.   The house is near to Alexandra Palace which hosts many events, festivals and shows.  There is internet access.  Free parking is available immediately outside should you need it. The nearest tube station is Wood Green which is 10 mins walk away.  The nearest overground station is Bowes Park and is 7 mins walk away. There is only one occupant of the house which has four bedrooms.  Two are available to rent at any one time so if you are looking to book for a small group this could be the perfect place for you. I am friendly and welcoming but allow guests to be private  It's quiet and safe with friendly neighbours and good transport l

name: London Olympic High standard room
space: Easy access  to London Olympic Venues  We are situated in a very nice area of south London (Bromley/Grove Park), close to Greenwich Park with amazing panorame of City, Thames and University, where you will be very welcome and comfortable in our home. The house consists of 3 bedrooms, fully fitted kitchen, bathroom (shower with radio panel, marble basin, wc), a very nice lounge that looks out to patio and house’ garden. Close access to London Bikes for rental, 10 min walk to Parliament, Big Ben, London Eye and 15 min walk to Trafalgar Square. There is a large Tesco supermarket, small Sainsburys supermarket, about two corner shops about 1 minute away.
space: We have a Shower, Bath, Kitchen, Dining table and Internet WIFI access in our comfortable flat. We are a friendly easy going gay couple, so open to having anyone at our home. name: 2 bed flat, 15 mins to Stratford
summary: A spacious flat that comfortably fits 2 guests. Centrally located, a few minutes walking from the Snaresbrook tube station and a short ride from Liverpool Street, Shoreditch and Brick Lane.
space: I am a professional travelling extensively, especially during the Christmas, Easter and summer periods. 50 square metres (net floor area) flat, comprising a living room, a double bedroom, a study room, a kitchenette and bathroom. The living room includes a large dining table - seating 8+ guests. The study room includes desk. The fee includes bedding, towels, all bills, WI-FI and tea/coffee as needed. Washing machine available.  If the flat is not returned in the same conditions in which it was before your stay, a cleaning fee will be deducted from your deposit. More info in the "house manual". 1 week minimum for bookings in August and December.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is in one of the nicest areas of East London, in close vicinity to the Wanstead high street and to all the amenities (shops, pubs, restaurants, supermarkets etc.). Plenty of parks in the vicinity. Also very close to both Leytonstone  (about 15 minutes walking) and South Woodford (10 minutes) night spots. A short tube ride to Shoreditch, Liverpool Street and Brick Lane if you want to get a taste of East London night life.
notes: I speak English, Italian and Spanish - feel free to write me in any of those languages.
transit: The flat is in the Wanstead area, 500 metres from Snaresbrook tube station, 3 tube stops away from Stratford and the Olympic Village. If you are travelling by car, the North Circular Road is about 1 mile away. Street parking is available; reserved parking may be available upon request.
access: You will be using my whole flat, while I am away.
house_rules: Please treat my house with respect and courtesy and do not do anything that you would not typically do in your own home. Please wash up your dishes, leave the flat tidy and empty any food left in the fridge after your visit. Provided that that's the case, there are no cleaning fees. If that's not the case, 50 GBP will be deducted from the deposit for cleaning. A kWh reading will be made upon your arrival and departure. The maximum limit of consumption per week is 300kWh; each unit used above this limit will be charged at 0.18 GBP (average consumption per week for the flat is 52kWh).  Fibre broadband (72mb) is available and included for free.  Pay as you go SIM cards are available in any newsagent/supermarket in the neighbourhood, and you can use the wifi connection in the house.  Please do not use the landline phone.  If you use the landline phone, 10 GBP + costs + 25% will be deducted from your safety deposit.  Please be considerate to the neighbours.

name: Lovely garden flat - a London oasis
summary: LONDON HOME AVAILABLE FOR OCCASIONAL LET A beautiful two bedroom garden flat within a lovely Victorian house. Situated on the edge of the Clissold Park conservation area in hip friendly Stoke Newington in north-east London.
space: Entrance to the flat is via communal hallway shared with neighbours above. Entry takes you to an inner hallway opening onto a large living room with high ceilings and lots of original features, including shutters and a working fireplace. There is a comfortable sofa and chaise longue as well as vintage dining table and chairs for up to six people. The master bedroom is located next to the living room and provides a wonderfully restful space at the rear of the property. It has a comfortable cast iron bed with a goose down duvet and wooden shutters to keep the warmth in and light out. One of the wardrobes with hanging and shelf space will be made available. The second bedroom is privately located in its own area of the flat adjacent to the shared bathroom. The room has lots of height and a large east facing sash window with black out blind. There is a large new double futon bed with a duvet and the bed is very simple to switch back into sofa mode to create extra space during the day. Ther
description: LONDON HOME AVAILABLE FOR OCCASIONAL LET A beautiful two bedroom garden flat within a lovely Victorian house. Situated on the edge of the Clissold Park conservation area in hip friendly Stoke Newington in north-east London. Entrance to the flat is via communal hallway shared with neighbours above. Entry takes you to an inner hallway opening onto a large living room with high ceilings and lots of original features, including shutters and a working fireplace. There is a comfortable sofa and chaise longue as well as vintage dining table and chairs for up to six people. The master bedroom is located next to the living room and provides a wonderfully restful space at the rear of the property. The second bedroom is privately located in its own area of the flat adjacent to the shared bathroom. The room has
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is a friendly and safe area known as one of London's coolest up and coming neighbourhoods. The flat is situated just a couple of minutes from the buzz of Church Street, with its hubbub of quirky independent shops, restaurants and other amenities. It is also just round the corner from the calm of the park, with its ponds and tennis courts, or for quiet walks round the local reservoirs. Stokey is a short distance from the ever popular Upper Street Islington as well as the new heart of East London - Dalston. This has a wide range of galleries, restaurants, bars, clubs, and live music venues. Dalston is also on the East London Line connecting south to Haggerston, Hoxton, Shoreditch and Whitechapel.
notes: If you suffer from allergies it is worth being aware that two cats live at the flat, although they will not be in residence during your stay.
transit: Although there is no tube in Stoke Newington itself, the neighbourhood is well connected by public transport to all parts of London and it’s well worth using the Journey Planner on the London Transport website: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  •	Bus: Nearby bus services include the legendary 73 from Church Street which takes you to straight to Oxford Street and Victoria (from stop on Church Street) the 341 to Holborn and Waterloo and the 141 to the City and London Bridge (both stop on the other side of the park). •	Underground: A 15 minute walk to Manor House tube station connects you to the Picadilly line, and 20 minutes from there to Central London. Alternatively a 5 minute 106 bus ride (from stop 100 yards away on Lordship Park) gets you to Finsbury Park station for the faster Victoria line which gets you into town in 10 minutes. •	Overground: A 20 minute walk or short bus ride from Church Street brings you to Canonbury station which takes you to Kew Gardens to the west as well as only 1
access: Guests have access to the entire flat, patio outside the kitchen and secluded second section of the main garden to the rear. There is a garden studio situated at the far end which guests do not have access to but which will remain unoccupied during your stay. - There is high speed internet with a good WiFi connection throughout the house and garden - There is a landline to receive incoming calls and make short outgoing calls if necessary - There is a large screen TV with cable and DVD player - There is an excellent sounds system with speakers in the living room and kitchen and a CD collection together with a connection for audio devices - There is a well equipped kitchen with all necessary cooking utensils and a dishwasher - There is a washer/dryer as well as drying rail in the bathroom
house_rules: Please note that this is my fully furnished home, so contains many books, ornaments and personal possessions which you are asked to respect. I have a cleaner who will come before and after your visit please keep the place tidy and let me know of any damages and if you owe money for international calls. I prefer that there is no smoking inside but it is fine to smoke outside on the patio.

name: Pristine 5 Star Dble Room, 1 Guest, Central W1
summary: This beautiful Fitzrovia flat offers a private bedroom for 1 non smoking guest,  with shared use of the kitchen and bathroom. The property provides a luxurious, peaceful & safe haven for a single guest in an unbeatable central location in the heart of London's West End.  The private room is beautifully decorated with luxury linens, a wonderful handmade bed and plenty of storage. We have a 2 night minimum stay. Thank you.
space: Please read through the listing carefully to find out if this is the right private bedroom for you. We are confident that most of your questions will be addresssed in the information provided.  The Apartment The apartment is located on the second floor (US third floor) of a Regency Mansion block within a historical conservation area of London's West End; Fitzrovia, W1. The bedroom houses a fabulous, hand made, Kingsize bed (US Queen) with luxury 400 thread count Egyptian cotton bedding and the best quality mattress for a wonderful nights sleep. Guest dressing gown, slippers and plenty of fluffy towels are provided along with a selection of luxury toiletries. The property has been refurbished to a truly five star standard with a  designer kitchen, luxury pure wool carpets throughout and exquisite but functional designer furniture.  The apartment has a microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer, single oven, gas hob, juicer and a large fridge freezer. Free high speed Wi Fi, Netflix and a small
