Guest dressing gown, sli
neighborhood_overview: This luxury apartment couldn't be better located for London's West End shopping, theatres, restaurants and art galleries. W1 is London's most central West End post-code with everything you could wish for just a few moments walk away. With Oxford Street, Regent Street, Soho, Mayfair, Tottenham Court Road, Leicester Square and London’s theatre district just round the corner, your private room in this exceptional property is perfectly situated for you to get the most out of your London stay. Have all the creature comforts and safety of home sharing this quiet, five star apartment whilst enjoying everything London life has to offer on your door step. With the iconic BT Tower as your local landmark you will never get lost finding your way home from anywhere in central London. At the end of the road to the right is Oxford Street, (London's main shopping street) and to the left is the beautiful Regents Park. A better, more central and accessible London location is hard to imagine. The apartme
notes: Location: London’s West End & Westminster The apartment is located in Fitzrovia, in the heart of London’s West End. Once home to writers such as Virginia Woolf and George Bernard Shaw and more recently Lady Gaga, Madonna and Guy Ritchie. Numerous media companies and the headquarters of the BBC are based in the area, hence its vibrant, celebrity filled buzz.  Oxford Street (five minutes walk away) is the centre of shopping in London. There are hundreds of stores running from Marble Arch to Tottenham Court Road with the most expensive found on New Bond Street, South Molton Street, Saville Row and Conduit Street.  A hive of entertainment, London’s West End offers theatre, music, comedy bars and restaurants. Take a wander down Wardour Street, Dean Street, Shaftesbury Avenue and the Haymarket to experience the centre of nightlife in London.  Shoppers will also enjoy the Covent Garden markets and boutiques in Soho and Carnaby Street. For some true British style head to Liberty of London (abo
transit: Transport The apartment is so well located that you can walk to most of London's main attractions. If you find yourself getting weary simply hail a London Black cab, hop onto a double decker bus or take the London Underground to explore further afield. All the London Underground lines (known as The Tube) are easily accessible, with both Oxford Circus, Great Portland Street, Regents Park and Goodge Street Tube Stations located a few minutes walk from the flat. If you fancy overground travel, buses to the whole of the rest of London are available on Oxford Street, just at the end of the road. The mainline London railway stations of Euston, Kings Cross and Paddington are all about three stops on the Tube away or a few minutes in a cab. If you are traveling from Heathrow Airport you can take the Paddington Express into central London (15 minutes) and, from Paddington Station, be at the flat in less than thirty minutes.
access: This private room rental includes shared use of the bathroom and kitchen. It is a non smoking, no pet property.
house_rules: Rental Agreement  Please read this Rental Agreement carefully before booking to ensure that this is the right private bedroom for your stay.  This listing is for 1 non smoking guest in a private bedroom sharing the kitchen and bathroom with one quiet and considerate other. We do not accept two guests in the room or any over night guests joining you during your stay.  We request quiet time after 10pm and any friends or visitors to your room to have left the property by that time at the latest.  Everything in the property has been bought with quality and luxury in mind and with great care and attention to detail. The flat has been impeccably refurbished and decorated to the highest standards and you will always find it pristinely clean with all linen and bedding freshly washed and prepared for your stay. The only thing we ask is that you respect it and leave it as you found it.  Check In/Check Out  Check In is available from 3pm on your arrival day and Check Out is at 11am on your depart

name: Riverside 1 bed flat - Chelsea / Fulham
summary: We would love to host you in our cultured 1-bed flat between Fulham and Chelsea. The flat has open plan kitchen and dining room, and all mod-cons. A tiny walk from the famous Chelsea Harbour, Kings Road and Fulham Road. Great transport access to central London and local amenities to enjoy the area.  Ideal for single/couples.
space: Enjoy the comforts of this modern 1 bedroom flat adjacent to fashionable Chelsea Harbour. Set next to riverside parks on the river Thames, Imperial Wharf offers you a variety of restaurants, convenient shops and numerous transport links connecting you to central London and all the major airports.  The flat is newly built with modern fittings and interiors, open plan kitchen, washing machine, double glazing, flat screen TV and WIFI. A popular local bar/pub gives you a river-view dining experience and a place from which to watch the sun set. A local gym (with celebrities from Made in Chelsea) offers drop-in classes to keep you fit while you stay, or you can run along the river to Battersea Park.  You can access all parts of London easily by riverboat, overground trains (Imperial Wharf station is adjacent) or the tube. We are 10 min walk away from King's Road and only a short bus ride to the famous museums in South Kensington - V&A, Natural History Museum, Science Museum and more.  The lo

neighborhood_overview: We're in a residential area but situated next to the Design Centre, posh Chelsea Harbour, convenient Fulham Broadway and with lots of nice parks and walks around.
notes: Parking is not included. There is free parking on Sundays on nearby roads. Otherwise, you can use the 24 hr carpark underneath, accessed via Imperial Wharf (behind Tesco). This is £2.60 per hour, 7am-7pm, and £0.80 from 7pm-7am.
transit: You can get to us by Overground train/tube (the orange line). We are one stop from Clapham Junction, which also links to Gatwick. You can also take the C3 bus southbound from Earls Court, which links to Heathrow Airport. We are also 15 min from Fulham Broadway, or you can take the 391 bus southbound to us. If you need to get to the city to work, you can even take the river bus from Chelsea Harbour and there's a coffee shop en route!

name: Camden Town Duplex
summary: Directly opposite Camden Town tube station, in the heart of lively Camden Town!  This apartment is the perfect base to visit London and enjoy all the hustle and bustle of city life. The apartment is located just across from Camden Town tube station and enjoys views from the windows of what life in the heart of Camden is all about. If your looking for to enjoy submersion in the city culture and Camden itself, then this is the place for you.
space: This apartment is in the heart of Camden and is perfect for those who wish to experience what life 'in the thick of it' is like. The apartment is immediately surrounded by many restaurants, cafes, pubs and markets. You can get a great sense of city buzz here...Suitable for those who seek to experience our vibrant and energetic city first hand...welcome to Camden :) Camden is an ocean of culture overflowing with a rich musical and theatrical history. Today this part of London has one of the highest concentration of theatres, music venues, bars, restaurants, cafes, night clubs, shops and markets throughout the whole of the Capital. Camden Town Tube Station (Northern Line) is across the road, meaning transport to and from the apartment and other parts of London is extremely easy. You are in the centre of one of London's most vibrant boroughs. Angel, Kings Cross (Eurostar), Charing Cross, Tottenham Court Road and Leicester Square are only a few stops away using the underground. Camden Lock

name: Sunny single room in South London
space: Sunny single room in a Victorian house ( built in 1898), with garden in South London, zone 3, close to Brixton , Clapham and Balham. The bed is very comfortable and has a new mattress, I  provide clean towels . There are several Time Out travel guides to London in the room which you are welcome to use ,  hairdryer and iron available, there is also a tray with a small kettle, cup and saucer .Streatham Hill train station is 5 minutes walk, trains go to Victoria  and takes  17 minutes, alternatively Balham underground station on the Northern line is a 10-15 minute walk. Clapham Junction is 10 minutes away and from here you take the train to almost anywhere including Brighton and  Hastings on the south coast. Brixton is a 10 minute bus ride away and has lot's to offer, the Ritzy Cinema has a cafe, bar and live music,  Brixton village that has lots of cafe's and independent shops. We are a bus ride away from Chelsea ( about 20/25 minutes, so conveniently placed for the Chelsea Flower Show i

name: Sunny Victorian Flat in London
summary: Beautiful 2 bedroom flat in Tooting Broadway, perfect base for anyone wishing to explore London, Wimbledon and the South Coast - I would love to welcome you into my home :-)
space: A delightful two bedroom lovingly restored Victorian flat located in the ever popular and vibrant Tooting area of London. Our wonderful garden flat contains lovingly restored original Victorian fixtures, and is the perfect pad for up to five people wishing to discover all the delights London has to offer. The flat is very conveniently located close to all amenities, shops and public transport; as well as being a quiet and relaxing place to come back to at the end of a busy day. ACCOMMODATION: The flat has two bedrooms (a double and a single)  and a sofa bed in the Living Room, suitable for up to two people.  Our flat compromises of:  - Fully equipped modern kitchen / diner - Two bedrooms (one double and one single mattress) - Lovely Living Room with shutters on the windows - Private sunny garden - Brand new modern bathroom - Outside lockable storage space Added benefits:  - Free Wi-Fi  - TV with (website hidden) and Netflix - Cleaner (needs to be arranged in advance) LOCATION Tooting i
description: Beautiful 2 bedroom flat in Tooting Broadway, perfect base for anyone wishing to explore London, Wimbledon and the South Coast - I would love to welcome you into my home :-) A delightful two bedroom lovingly restored Victorian flat located in the ever popular and vibrant Tooting area of London. ACCOMMODATION: The flat has two bedrooms (a double and a single)  and a sofa bed in the Living Room, suitable for up to two people.  Our flat compromises of:  - Fully equipped modern kitchen / diner - Two bedrooms (one double and one single mattress) - Lovely Living Room with shutters on the windows - Private sunny garden - Brand new modern
neighborhood_overview: Recently selected by Lonely Planet as one of the top 10 coolest neighbourhoods on the planet; Tooting is one of the most vibrant and diverse up-and-coming areas in London. Absolutely amazing restaurants and bars popping up each week - there's a real feeling of excitement in the air. The perfect place for couples and families alike, Tooting is extremely diverse and yet has a very strong sense of community, which is reflected in its many pop-up festivals each year celebrating food, music and culture. I have lived very happily here for the past 8 years - it's very easy to get in and out of town and also sufficiently close to the beautiful open spaces of Wimbledon Common and Richmond Park. Also very easy to reach the south coast; Brighton, Hastings etc all within a nice day out's reach :-)
notes: Please note I usually live at the property with my small dog. Although 90% of the flooring is original wooden floorboards, there is carpet in the living room that may still hold the odd dog hair, even after a thorough hoovering. I have welcomed guests who have pet allergies and it's been totally OK, but I want to mention it incase someone has a severe allergy.
transit: Absolutely - Easy to locate from all public transport, located on a quiet street off the main hustle and bustle of Tooting Broadway. Nearest tube is Tooting Broadway on the Northern Line (7 min walk, takes 30 mins to Oxford Circus) - mainline train station is Tooting (2 min walk, takes 30 mins to St Pancras International) - bus stop at end of road has many buses including number 77 to Waterloo and 44 to Victoria. Heathrow and Gatwick airports are the closest and again easy to reach via public transport; ask me for details.
access: The entire flat with fixtures and fittings, plus garden
house_rules: Please respect the neighbours in the flat upstairs by keeping noise down after 11pm - they are friendly but London life means we all get used to coexisting close together!

name: 2 Bed Home w/ Garden and great transport links
summary: Welcome to my home! Located in trendy London Fields (North East London) with it's famous open green spaces, fantastic Lido (outdoor swimming pool), quirky bars, restaurants and markets (such as Broadway market and Columbia Flower Market), you have all that London has to offer on your doorstep! We have great transport links to the rest of London also with the train station just a 4 minute walk away. The house itself has a lovey little garden area and homely interiors.
space: Welcome to my home and welcome to this amazing city! This is a lovely two storey, two bedroomed (one double, one single) house in wonderful Hackney, a four minute walk from London Fields rail station, and ten minutes from Hackney Central overground. But don't take my word for it... let me walk you through it a little more! The house has a really colourful and cosy living room which has a real family feel to it. There is a comfy sofa and an additional armchair for guests to use where you can put your feet up in the evenings, kick back and relax! Fancy an evening off? Then sit back, relax and turn on the flat screen TV. There are plenty of channels for you to enjoy. As a travel writer, I've also got a fair few travel guides, but also books written by writers who travel... oh, and books on cooking, gardening, beekeeping... The living area is also home to the dining area, which is the perfect spot to enjoy some local delicacies. Top tip, try out one of the nearby street food markets - you

neighborhood_overview: The area is great for bars, restaurants, cafés, a micro brewery and shops. Victoria Park – voted the best park in London - is seven minutes' walk away and the City (Liverpool Street) is 20 minutes' by bus or 30 minutes' walking from the house. For the West End take a 15 minute stroll to Bethnal Green tube station, then 10 minute underground journey to town. If you're here on Saturday / Sunday there are several great local markets where you'll pick up excellent food: curries, handmade burgers, vegetarian and much more.
transit: It's a five-minute bus (15 minute walk) to Bethnal Green (Central Line) underground and a further 10 minutes to the West End.  The house is also close to lush London Fields, two minutes' walk, and bustling Broadway Market, five minutes' walk.  A great local tip is to download the Citymapper app. This free app will plan your journey for you efficiently and quickly. It gives you a variety of different transport options such as bike, rail, tube and Uber taxi. It will also take you step by step through your journey as you travel and notify you when you are nearing your destination.
access: The apartment is your own and is cleaned, with fresh linens, for each new visitor. Extra cleaning, for longer stays, is optional (ie if you'd like me to arranged for beds to be changed) - otherwise you can help yourself to sheets/towels in the linen cupboard.
house_rules: Please make sure all windows and doors are locked

name: Waterloo Heights
summary: For a comfortable cosy stay for a couple, singleton or business person in the heart of the city you need not look any further.
space: This is a warm and cosy room ideal for a singleton or a couple who are breezing through London and will only be spending a few days on a budget.  The room has got Internet access through Wifi , Towels and sheets are also provided.  The flat is perfectly located and  very close to a lot of tourist attractions.  After a long day out doing your tourist travels and sightseeing, coming back in the evenings should not have to be too time consuming.  A 5-10mins walk from the flat will locate you in an area with restaurants, bars, imax cinema and a few  theatres.  The closest stations are Lambeth North and Waterloo station which are 5mins and 10mins respectively from the flat on foot. name: Delightful Airy Garden Studio with own entrance.
space: We have a lovely bright and airy self-contained ground floor flat attached to our house. It has its own front door, fully equipped kitchen with washing machine, bathroom and separate bedroom leading on to our large garden, and there is free Wi-Fi. Stamford Brook is well placed, 8 mins walk to the District Line and the theatres, museums and Art Galleries of the West End which can be reached in 20 mins. You are 10 mins walk from the lovely shops and restaurants of Turnham Green Terrace and Chiswick, Westfield Shopping Mall and Soho House TV Centre are close by and we are very near the River Thames with its characterful riverside pubs. The French Impressionist painter Camille Pissarro lived at the end of our street and did many paintings of the area! We live next door to the flat and are happy to give advice during your stay in London. This is a friendly, quiet neighbourhood with leafy streets and easy access to airports.

neighborhood_overview: Local amenities in New Malden include a variety of shops, bars & restaurants, a library, local park with tennis court and a leisure centre with gym & swimming pool.  The train route from New Malden provides direct access to Waterloo including the South Bank Centre and London Eye. From Waterloo there are easy links to all other tourist attractions. The pleasant open spaces of Richmond Park are also nearby with a golf course and very good cycle routes for all abilities. There is a direct rail link to Hampton Court where you can visit the beautiful historic site of Royal Hampton Court Palace, explore the maze & gardens or take a boat trip along the River Thames. Other routes from New Malden can transport you to various places of interest in and around the London and Surrey area including the beautiful Kew Gardens. Suggestions for day visits further afield include Windsor to visit Windsor Castle or Legoland, and Brighton on the south coast where you can "see the sea"!  These are both about
transit: There is an abundance of travel options nearby including overground train with direct links to central London, Wimbledon, Kingston upon Thames, Richmond upon Thames, Hampton Court and further afield. There are easy rail links to Gatwick Airport and the south coast. There is a bus route directly to Heathrow Airport. Also bus routes to many other local areas. If travelling by car we are 5mins from the A3 and 15mins from the M25 orbital.

name: Vintage Oasis&Double Room&Peace...
summary: In general -we are easy going family,don't like to moan,respect our guests. When we open our doors at the same time we open our hearts ..... We also have another single bedroom for guests. You can find them in my profile(scroll down, left side-"Listings").
space: Wanted to let you know  - it's not a hotel or hostel - it's our home and we share it with other nice,positive and respectful people who are not afraid to meet others from all over the world :). So if you expect hotel's service - I am afraid our home might won't suit your needs;) You are welcome to stay in a freshly renovated bedroom ! Warm welcome,private space.And more space - if you wish :) .You can have a nap in our garden and enjoy a tea  or coffee in our conservatory .    If we won't have the availability in a calendar in one room for period you want to stay - feel free to ask about the option to split a stay between our other two rooms  ( if you don't mind to swap the rooms ) ---ATTENTION: if you query to stay in our house, please, introduce yourself in a request message,describe purpose of your trip.Also fill the profile.Picture is  required- we want to know who is going to be our guest----- --- If you are reviewed and already have some positive reviews ,feel free to book instan

neighborhood_overview: The most what I like about our neighbourhood is that we live 5 min apart Greenwich Meridian line:),so I easily can find our living place (approximately )in a world map:) .We live in Walthamstow and Meridian goes just 5 min on foot from us:)  --Walthamstow village is ancient nucleus of present days Walthamstow .Increasingly fashionable area focused around independent shops,pubs and restaurants on Orford road. Mainly  characterised by cosy streets of quaint cottage style houses.... --Wood street indoor market is a real gem and really ticks all the market  boxes.If you miss the Camden market of old,then this is place for vinyl junkies...  --Walthamstow market is the longest daily outdoor market in Europe. It occupies all but the last 100 metres of Walthamstow High Street (Tuesday to Saturday )and Farmers Sunday Market.... --Epping forest nearby - we are happy to have greenery around :). --Walthamstow marshes (Lee Valley Regional Park)-a natural treasure and one of London's few remaining r
notes: We have a small 20 yo dog. His name is  Odis. I wanted to let you know in case you are allergic. Our dog doesn't like to be cuddled :)( he knows - he is not Teddy bear). Strikcly-no food for Odis!   Leaving for jobs early , that's why we do not provide the breakfast .
transit: Want to highlight - we live in a safe residential  area ,couple seconds away  from the  bus stop .Walthamstow central Tube station is 10 min away by bus, or 25 min on foot . You can reach  London centre in 25min on underground . In 15 min you will reach Kings Cross -from there you have easy access to Luton and Gatwick airport , Eurostar train to Paris and Brussels , Piccadilly line to Heathrow airport . Wood street train station is 10 min on foot (direct link to Liverpool Street takes you 15 min to  reach the heart of the city ). Also there you can get the Stansted Express for a Stansted airport .  To reach Stansted also is very convenient from Tottenham hale by train , or to take a bus from Stratford . It's quiet convenient and good price to get to Stansted by taxi from our home . It takes just half an hour and no troubles :) Walthamstow village is nearby - it's real gem. It offers a variety of small places to eat out among witch a highly recommendable Tapas bar with a Spanish chef. R
access: Bathroom , extra toilet, kitchen , conservatory, garden - all are share of use . Also we share  utensils , cutlery , pots , pans - for basic food preparation ; fridge to keep your food fresh . You can use hob,kettle , toaster, microwave. You can use washing machine and dryer  ;- we dry  our laundry outside , when weather is suitable . Drying in the bedroom is not permitted, sorry.  Laundrette is located 5 min from our house. We have three rooms for guests  and bathroom is share of use for all .  Be silent from 10pm and morning time if you know that's someone is asleep . Respect others and they will respect you . Kitchen is just for quick use and not intended for preparation of 3-course meal.  Sorry it's small and created not for kitchen chefs;). Not for use after 10pm. Strictly -guests of our Airbnb guests are not allowed without permition. So ,if you fancy separate bathroom and kitchen just for personal use - might our home won't suits your needs :)
house_rules: - Be nice,respect our house in the same way , how you respect yours:) -Respect  others : guests and hosts . You can come back when you want, but we kindly ask you not to make any  noise after 10.30 pm weekdays , 11.00pm weekends . It means no use of kitchen or dry hair after shower. Also do  not slam the doors and no shoes in a bedrooms, because night time every sound feels much louder.  -No smoking  in the main part of the house , you are very welcome to smoke  in the garden. -No parties , no strangers in.  -Guests should wash their dishes and leave ordered kitchen after themselves and leave countertop dry wiped .  - Leave bathroom tidy after use , please :) -The usual stuff! We take shoes off at the door. -Make sure the doors are locked when you are  leaving house . -A feedback is important – to write a review after a stay is fair and required. THANK YOU & ENJOY!

name: Your Central London Home Base
summary: Located right in the centre of London, this self-contained and well-equipped studio flat offers leisure and business travellers a comfortable and secure space close to major tourist sights, shopping and dining, and the new Victoria commercial area. Please note - through till the end of 2020, we have blocked the flat for minimum 48 hours between reservations to give us time to clean and disinfect thoroughly as fully as possible between guest parties.  Self-check-in is also available.
space: A GREAT CENTRAL LONDON LOCATION FULLY EQUIPPED FOR SIGHTSEEING OR BUSINESS VISITORS.  10 minutes walk from Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, St. James Park, Horse Guards Parade, this self-contained and fully equipped studio flat is ideally located to be a really central pied-a-terre for visitors to London. ____________________________________________________________ ARE YOU ALSO TRAVELLING TO SCOTLAND?  Do check out our cottage in the Highlands through the "Other Listings" reviews in our Hosts Profile _____________________________________________________________ The London flat is a studio on the fourth floor of a secure block with entryphones and two lifts looking out over a quiet pedestrian passage. It consists of: •A small entrance hall with a coat cupboard and big shelf over it to store your suitcases. •A separate kitchenette with electric hob and a microwave/oven/grill, refrigerator, washing machine, Nespresso machine, toaster, electric kettle and all china and equipment neces

neighborhood_overview: Buckingham Palace, St James'Park, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament are literally 5-10 minutes walk away.  Trafalgar Square (National Gallery) and Piccadilly Circus (shopping on Piccadilly and Regent Street) are 15 minutes’ walk.  Theatres for plays and musicals are about 20 minutes’ walk, in the Haymarket and Leicester Square area - just beyond Piccadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square. There is the full range of high street shops on Victoria Street, for clothing, food, toiletries, cellphones.  A 15 minute walk across St. James’ Park brings you to the wide range of more fashionable shops on Jermyn Street, Piccadilly and Lower Bond Street - from Fortnum and Mason’s superb food store to Hatchards bookshop.  Stop off at the Royal Academy for an exhibition on your way, or pop into either the Ritz or the Fountain Bar at Fortnum’s for a classic English tea (better to reserve in advance). There is a wide range of convenient eateries – mainly in the Victoria Street direction: Jamie’
notes: Please note - through till the end of 2020, we have blocked the flat for minimum 48 hours between reservations to give us time to clean and disinfect thoroughly as fully as possible between guest parties.  Self-check-in is also available.
transit: The flat is within 4 minutes easy walk of ST. JAMES PARK Underground (Tube) Station on the District (Green) and Circle (Yellow) lines.   The number 11 bus runs very close by along Victoria Street.  This is a really convenient main bus route that can take you West to Sloane Square and the Kings Road, and East to Trafalgar Square, The Strand and Fleet Street – It is almost worth taking just for the sight-seeing along the route from the top deck of a double-decker. There is a London Taxi Cab rank nearby at the intersection of Caxton Street and Buckingham Gate, which generally has one or two taxis.  Otherwise you can normally catch taxis very easily on Victoria Street. In addition to the Uber and Gett aps, there are several private mini-cab services and we can give you details for best-priced airport transfers.
access: Guests have full access to everything in the apartment.
house_rules: No smokers and no pets please. The kitchen and bathroom are stocked with every-day consumables and we like to invite our guests to feel free to make use of these on the basis of "use and reasonably replace". The telephone only takes incoming calls, and can also be used to dial emergency services.  However the Internet is high-speed and can comfortably be used for video-calling. The price includes one full set of linen and towels, renewed every two weeks for longer staying guests.  I do ask for an additional contribution for laundry if guests use extra linen and towels, which are stocked in the apartment.

name: Double bedroom in SW London
summary: Lovely double bedroom in shared 2 bed garden flat in Tooting. Quiet and homely with private garden. 5 min walk to tube and great public transport links to C. London / Gatwick / Luton airport. Close to local shops, bars and restaurants and supermarket
space: Small double bedroom available in lovely, homely and very comfortable 2 double bedroom garden flat in Tooting Broadway (SW London) available for rent from 8 December (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) You will be sharing the property with me, the owner. The flat is in a quiet, safe street and is a 5min walk from the tube station. Street car parking permit is available at an additional cost. name: Lovely Garden Flat for 2 + baby
summary: A beautiful, homely, spacious and quiet 2 bedroom ground floor flat 2 mins from the centre of Tooting Broadway. A good sized main double bedroom with a double bed. The second bedroom is for a baby and has a cot, changing unit and chest of drawers.
space: A lovely, homely and very comfortable 2 bedroom garden flat in Tooting Broadway (SW London) available for rent from January (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  You will have exclusive use of the property. name: Double bedroom mezzanine apartment
summary: A modern fully furnished mezzanine (Website hidden by Airbnb) bedroom accomodating two persons in double bed.
space: A newly refurbished fully furnished self catered mezzanine apartment with it's own entrance located in the quiet leafy Grove Park suburb of Chiswick in West London, about 20 minutes from Central London and handy for all major West London transport links. The living room has a L-shaped settee, coffee table, small dining room table and four chairs. Entertainment is provided by a plasma screen television complete with cable TV service. Also provided is free wireless internet connectivity.  The kitchenette is furnished with a breakfast table and three stools and is fully fitted with hob, oven, dishwasher and fridge. Adjacent to this is a utility room complete with washer / dryer, sink and microwave. The bedroom is on a second level and contains a double bed, wardrobe, assorted shelving and storage space. A separate bathroom is provided with walk-in shower, wash basin and WC. The minimum stay is 3 nights. See (website hidden) for pictures and more information.

Chiswick house(a famous local park),Kew Gardens(famous Botanical Gdns)all walking distance. Chiswick , lively shopping area with many restaurants/shops/pubs 15 min.walk away
notes: For stays of one month or longer I expect the guest to either keep the apartment clean themselves or I can bring them in touch with a local cleaning person who charges £12.50 per hour. Depending on the tidiness/cleanness of the apartment it will take her about 3 hours to do so.
transit: Bus another stop at end of rd/another one min.away.Train station with regular trains into town or change for train to Gatwick airport(1 hr away).15--20 min.walk to 3 underground  stations Heathrow Airport 20 min by taxi or 30-45 by underground as one needs to change
access: Free parking in road except Monday - Friday 10:00 - 12:00 weekdays which costs £1.50 per day available via host. Apartment is fully furnished
house_rules: It is possible to have one extra person who doesn't mind sleeping on L shaped  settee in the living space Bedding for which will be provided. It is a no smoking apartment and there are no pets allowed.

name: Large double room w/large balcony (non-smoking)
summary: A large double bedroom on the 6th floor with a large balcony and great views of Canary Wharf. Only a few tube stops from Central London and a cycle ride or a tube stop from the Olympic Stadium and Westfield in Stratford. (Please note that you may not smoke in the apartment or on the balcony. If you would like to book somewhere that you can smoke, please do not book my room. Thank you.)
space: The apartment is on the 6th floor, situated just a 10 minute walk from Mile End and Bethnal Green underground stations, both of which give access to Central London in 15 minutes. Mile End station is only one tube stop from Stratord. There are also some great local areas, such as Shoreditch, Islington and London Fields, as well as being close to the huge Victoria Park. Across the bridge over the canal you will find one of the best local pubs in London - the Palm Tree. The bedroom is fully furnished, with a large bed, desk and a bed side table. There is also a single mattress available for a guest to sleep on the mattress on the floor. The open-plan kitchen and living room contain all you would expect of a flat built only a few years ago, as well as having a 50inch plasma TV and an exercise bike. Sky TV is available, with all sports channels. The large, south-facing balcony has spectacular views of Canary Wharf and basks in sunshine throughout the day. Wifi internent included. If you lik

notes: The apartment is by a railway. access: You will have access to all of the apartment, except the other bedroom.
house_rules: Nothing out of the ordinary - be friendly and polite, keep the place tidy, wash up any dishes you use, don't be loud after 10pm etc. Please do not book if you are a smoker, even if you would only smoke when not in the apartment or on the balcony.

name: Large sunny room, private bathroom, Dalston
summary: Our characterful Victorian home is located in a quiet residential street on the edge of Dalston, one of London's most interesting areas. It's a great neighbourhood to be based in for a visit to London with numerous transport links into the centre of London.  The room is light and spacious with it's own ensuite. We have a great knowlege of London and can offer lots of advice on where to go and what to do, to help you get the most from your stay.
space: The house is in a quiet, residential street just off the main shopping  areas of Dalston and Stoke Newington. It is well served by transport systems (for details see below). We offer a  large modern, light and airy oak floored loft bedroom (10 sq. meters) with your own private en-suite shower and toilet facilities (4.5 sq. meters ).  The room is furnished with a single/double bed, comfortable armchair, large built-in wardrobe and chest of drawers, Freeview TV, DVD and Wi-Fi internet (included). There is also a hair dryer and European power adapters. You are provided with fine cotton bed linen, fresh towels, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen and our lovely garden. A light breakfast which you can serve yourself (coffee, tea, juice, bread, a selection of butter/jams/marmalade/ cereals and yoghurt) is included.  We have lots of London and local guide books as well as a wealth of knowledge on London and the local area. If you are a sports fan we are

neighborhood_overview: The local area is currently one of the most interesting, greenist parts of London to explore, with the city and Queen Elizabeth Park nearby.  Dalston is a friendly, trendy and very vibrant local area which has everything you may need. There is a great variety of independent businesses - supermarkets, trendy, unusual reasonably restaurants, pubs, cafes, galleries, markets, boutiques, a museum (Geffrye), a theatre (Arcola) and a fantastic independent cinema (Rio) all within walking distance. The area is famed for its Turkish restaurants and nightlife with many bars, clubs and live music venues. There is a large heated open air swimming pool nearby in London Fields. Just down the road is the local Ridley Road fruit and veg market.  Just a leisurely stroll or bus/train ride away you will find a great variety of local shops and many independent eateries in Stoke Newington Church Street, Broadway Market, Shoreditch, Brick Lane, Islington and Camden. Nearby there are lovely green spaces, park
notes: Please note there is limited pay and display street parking. A local authority car park is nearby (approx £7.20 per day).
transit: If guests let us know in advance we can order daily parking permits (extra charge).  There are excellent public (Zone 2) transport connections - Central London only 15 min by Tube or 30 min by bus. Trains run into the early hours of the morning and there are buses throughout night from central London. You will need to buy an Oyster travel card to use public transport (no cash fares) they can be ordered on line from Transport for London or bought at local newsagents. name: Fab Fulham Flat, near Chelsea
summary: Contemporary styled one bedroom apartment in a converted London terrace house close to transport at Fulham Broadway, near Chelsea.  Comfortably sleeps four persons.
space: Fab Fulham Flat sleeps a maximum of 4 persons, with one double bed in the main bedroom and one double bed in the study. A travel baby cot is also available for infants aged up to 2 years. Newly refurbished throughout, the apartment consists of a double bedroom; a contemporary styled living room with television, dvd player and iPod/iPhone speaker dock; an open-plan kitchen with gas hob, electric oven, microwave and dishwasher; a level-access shower room and toilet; and a study with comfortable fold out sofa bed. All bath towels are provided, as well as sheets and bedding for the two double beds and baby cot. Laundry facilities and wi-fi are also available. This 'Fab Fulham Flat' is the perfect base if you want to explore the sights and attractions of London or just want to experience the life of a Londoner.

neighborhood_overview: Located on a quiet residential street near Fulham Broadway, the flat is close to a cosmopolitan mix of shops, cafés, restaurants and pubs. North End Road Market, a typical London street market, selling a range of fresh and cooked food is located at the end of the street.
transit: Easily accessible to the Underground at Fulham Broadway (7 minutes walk - District Line), West Brompton (7 minutes walk - District Line, Overground Line and National Rail to Gatwick) and Earl’s Court (a further 3 minutes walk from West Brompton - Piccadilly Line to Heathrow or St Pancras Eurostar Terminal). The London Underground District line provides direct access to many London top tourist attractions including the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben at Westminster; the Tower of London and Tower Bridge at Tower Hill; the London Eye across the Thames from Embankment; and Buckingham Palace at St James's Park station.  Alternatively, the Piccadilly line provides direct access to Harrods at Knightsbridge, as well as Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square and Covent Garden for West End shopping, theatres, restaurants, bars and clubs. access: Guests have sole access to the whole of the apartment and it's facilities.  Unfortunately there is no access to the garden at the rear of the property unless in the event of an emergency.
house_rules: Please remove outside shoes when inside the flat. No extra overnight guests without prior approval. Strictly no smoking and no parties. No animals or pets. Be considerate of the neighbours at all times. Upon check-out, please: - Remove all food from the fridge. - Remove all rubbish and recycling. - Ensure the kitchen and its contents are left clean and tidy.

Apart from our little cat. You will have to walk for 10 minutes to Hackney Central, take the overrail to Highbury and Islington and change to the Victoria Line and jump off at Oxford Circus. If the trains come straight away and if you walk fairly quickly you will get there in 25 minutes. You can take a bus all the way to Oxford street (38, 242 and 55). 38 is quicker normally but it would still take you around an hour. If there is no traffic its quicker but in London there is always traffic. Busses are much nicer than the tube and trains but they are very slow.

name: King sized double room, part of house sleeping 8
summary: Edwardian house in a quiet cul-de-sac in Islington, North London (N1). Ideally situated between  the famous Angel and Upper St., and trendy Dalston and Shoreditch, all within a 10-20 minute walk. Transport options are extensive in most directions. The house is very much a family house but is child free 50% of the time. There are 2 double bedrooms, 1 twin with ensuite shower, 1 single and a sofa bed in the living room. The bathroom and kitchen are new and well equipped.
space: A sunny 4 bedroom house with original period features (floorboards, window shutters, coving) with high ceilings and large sash windows. Large rear garden, private, but separate from the building, it's 10 meters back from the house. It is very central for anything you might want to do in London, but the house itself is in a quiet residential area with Victorian and Georgian streets and is close to two parks (Rosemary gardens  and Shoreditch park). It is 100m from the Regents Canal along which you can walk to the Angel and Kings Cross in one direction and Dalston the other. There are some excellent gastro pubs within a few minutes walk (Rosemary Branch, De Beauvoir Arms, Scolts Head, The Lord Clyde, The Marquis), and Upper Street, famous for its fashionable shops, pubs, restaurants and theatres, is just 10 minutes walk away. If you are working in the city, then you can be there in 15 minutes.  THE LOCATION Its very safe and very central. Its easy to get anywhere from here with lots of tr

neighborhood_overview: Islington is a trendy "villagey" part of London, a place where Old London meets New London.  You will find fish and chip shops that have been around for generations, next to sophisticated designer cocktail bars; antique markets next to designer boutiques.  The main street, known as Upper Street, is lined with lovely coffee shops, designer shops and antique shops (and of course estate agents!) and  English pubs to sample a pint of traditional ale or classic cocktail. We are also in walking distance to Hoxton and Shoreditch, which is well known for its amazing nightlife. The area is fashionable and has lots of restaurants, cool bars and on trend shops. There are two local supermarkets open until at least 11pm. Other attractions nearby include: Camden Antiques Passage Eclectic Spitalfields market Columbia Road Flower Market Broadway market - great street food Petticoat Lane - famous for clothing Brick Lane - vintage anything and the best curries in London Camden market - Goth, punk and ro
notes: Please refer to the summary and other pictures in the main house listing.
transit: There are numerous bus routes from near (5 minutes or less) the house, both to the West End (central London) and the City (financial quarter). There are two nearby underground stations, Angel (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington(Victoria Line and London Overground). These are 10 minutes away by foot or by foot/bus. The London Overground service also runs from stations nearby and goes East (to shopping mecca Stratford), West (all the way to beautiful Richmond upon Thames) and South (to the less beautiful Croydon).

name: White Room in Classic London Town House - Zone 2
summary: The White Room is a huge room on the ground floor of this Victorian period townhouse with large bay window looking onto the neighbourhood gardens. It is light and spacious, complete with writing desk, plenty of storage and books.  There is a comfortable double and a single  bed for the third guest.  Please browse the other rooms: Serene-, Blue -, and Victorian Room, which are ideal for a big family or group to stay together under one roof, that can accommodate 11 guests comfortably.
space: The Piano Room is spacious and calm, on the ground floor with lovely wooden floors and views over the neighbourhood gardens from a huge bay window, it is quiet perfect for relaxing after a day exploring the sights. Located at the front of the house on the ground floor and near the kitchen dinner of this town house. The large family kitchen/dinner backs onto the garden and the Red Room is next to this one if your group wishes to spread out into 2 rooms. And yes there is a piano in the room!

neighborhood_overview: Brixton Village has a great artisan market with fresh quirky restaurants and vintage clothing and craft shops, an independent cinema, coffee shops and a big department store in it's centre.  Its residential streets are beautiful leafy rows of terraced houses with convenience stores on every corner. Enjoy the best of both worlds being in a vibrant local neighbourhood yet close to the centre of London within 15- 20 mins away by tube or train and with lots of buses past all major sights too. Brockwell Park is a stone's throw away, where you can admire the views of the City, West End, the London Eye (South Bank) and the Docklands.   There are cafés, restaurants, supermarket, pharmacies and shops 200m away.
notes: Brixton is a vibrant cosmopolitan 'Londoners' area. We have a supermarket at the end of the road and great transport all over town (Victoria in 8mins). We prefer guests don't eat in the rooms and prefer you to prepare simple ready meals / sandwiches and not cook full meals in the kitchen. A fridge is available for your use. You are welcome to make coffee or and tea at any time. Ample parking places around the park at the front of the house. Families enjoy our neighbourhood playground and park right outside.
transit: We have a bus stop 200m away with a frequent stream of buses* (all passing the tube) and onto all parts of the city. The nearest station Brixton gets you to Victoria in 8mins and Oxford Circus in 12mins.  *Buses  200m you can pick up any of 8 buses to all parts of London going to ALL major sights on a single bus ride (London Eye, Big ben, Westminster Abbey, Downing St, Nelson's Column, Trafalgar Square, National Gallery, Covent Garden, Oxford-,Regent-, Carnaby Street, Marble Arch, Hyde Park as well as major train stations: Waterloo-, Liverpool Street-, London Bridge-, Blackfriars-, Euston-, King's Cross and St Pancrass International Station.
access: Please make yourself at home, I love London and will happily recommend a day trip and give travel advice. You are welcome to wash clothes and prepare drinks and snacks in the kitchen.   Breakfast is available on request on arrival.  £6 per person per morning. The French door is opened to the garden.

name: 1 Bedroom Flat (Sleeps 4) Angel, N1
summary: We only charge for 2 guests.  2 Stay free. No deposit, TV, WiFi, free OnDemand films, laptop and luggage storage.
space: The flat is a 1 bedroom flat on the first floor of a converted house (built before 1900).   The flat has the original floorboards throughout. The flat is located just off Upper Street in Islington.  You can walk to Angel Underground Station within 8 minutes and the shopping centre and Business Design Centre in 6 minutes.  You have a bathroom that includes a bath and an electric shower, a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, washing machines, hob, oven, kettle, toaster and coffee maker.  We include some basic groceries such as tea, coffee & sugar.    We also have a coffee pod machine and a drip coffee maker.   The living room is equipped with a TV, on demand films and TV shows and cable TV.   The sofabed is also in this room.  It converts from a sofa to a king size bed. Please note:  We do not charge a fee for using the sofabed. Our prices are based on two people and two free of charge. neighborhood_overview: Islington is a great area to live and the perfect base for a trip to London.  There are almost 100 restaurants on the high street along with cafes, coffee shops and a shopping centre.   The people who live here are a real mix - you won't be bored if you enjoy people watching.  There is plenty to do in the evenings, the West End is a short bus ride away and there are lots of green spaces.
transit: Getting around is incredibly easy - there are bus, tube (Underground) and train links to take you anywhere you desire.   There is a bus stop directly opposite the flat. Angel tube is 8 minutes walk away (or faster by bus). Kings Cross and St Pancras International are also a short bus ride away.
access: We do not charge a deposit and there is also no charge for using the sofa bed.      - HD widescreen TV     - Fixed line telephone with FREE UK calls     - Tourist books, leaflets and travel guides     - on-demand TV and films.  A fully equipped kitchen with cutlery, crockery, pots and pans, a dishwasher, microwave, fridge, oven, hob and washing machine. The bathroom includes a full size bath & electric shower - on demand hot water, bath rob & hair dryer     - Iron & Board     - Charging docks for iPhone  +Towels and toiletries     - memory foam mattress.      - All duvet's, pillows & sheets Luggage storage  Parking can be arranged for those with a car.  There is a charge for this and we require 24hrs notice.
house_rules: All external doors must be kept locked shut when not occupied.   The flat is advertised for 2 people although an extra two guests are welcome (to use double sofa bed in living area) at no extra cost.

name: Lovely Double Near the Underground
space: Nice double room in a very large, beautifully refurbished house, only a stones throw away from the Olympic Park and Leyton Football Club. We have 3 other doubles and one single room available on the house, so please check our other listings  The property compromises of five bedrooms, two toilets  and two showers which can be shared by all the guests, a kitchen, a 40ft garden and off street parking.  It is located near a shopping area with a few restaurants and shops, as well as a big 24h supermarket. There's also many shops, hairdressers, off licenses and restaurants in the High Street nearby and westfield stratford shopping centre.  The nearest Underground Station would be Leyton, which is 7 minutes walk from the house. From there you can hop on the Central Line to Stratford (if you'd like to visit the Olympic Park or the Westfield Shopping Centre) and to Central London (Liverpool Street, St Pauls, Oxford Street, Notting Hill...). There are also many buses to central London and other

name: Serene Room in Classic London Town House - Zone 2
summary: The Serene Room is located at the top of the house on second floor of this Victorian period townhouse. It is the largest, light and peaceful room with view over our oasis garden.  It is next to our luxury guest bathroom with twin basins.  The king size bed is comfortable and a single bed can be added for a third guest. Please browse the other rooms: Victorian-, Blue -, and Piano Room, which are ideal for a big family or group, that can accommodate 11 guests comfortably under one roof.
space: The serene room is at the top of this Victorian period town house on second floor. It is a large, quiet and peaceful with views over the garden.  It is next to our luxury guest bathroom with twin basins.  Ideal for a couple, friends sharing or a family of 3.

Please make yourself at home, I love London and will happily recommend a day trip and give travel advice. You are welcome to wash clothes and prepare drinks and snacks in the kitchen. Breakfast is available on request on arrival.  £6 per person per mo
neighborhood_overview: Brixton Village has a great artisan market with fresh quirky restaurants and vintage clothing and craft shops, an independent cinema, coffee shops and a big department store in it's centre.  Its residential streets are beautiful leafy rows of terraced houses with convenience stores on every corner. Enjoy the best of both worlds being in a vibrant local neighbourhood yet close to the centre of London within 15- 20 mins away by tube or train and with lots of buses past all major sights too. Brockwell Park is a stone's throw away, where you can admire the views of the City, West End, the London Eye (South Bank) and the Docklands.   There are cafés, restaurants, supermarket, pharmacies and shops 200m away.
notes: Brixton is a vibrant cosmopolitan 'Londoners' area. We have a supermarket at the end of the road and great transport all over town (Victoria in 8mins). We prefer guests don't eat in the rooms and prefer you to prepare simple ready meals / sandwiches and not cook full meals in the kitchen. A fridge is available for your use. You are welcome to make coffee or and tea at any time. Ample parking places around the park at the front of the house, free but noon - 2 am Monday to Friday. Families enjoy our neighbourhood playground and park right outside.
transit: We have a bus stop 200m away with a frequent stream of buses* (all passing the tube) and onto all parts of the city. The nearest station Brixton gets you to Victoria in 8mins and Oxford Circus in 12mins.  *Buses  200m you can pick up any of 8 buses to all parts of London going to ALL major sights on a single bus ride (London Eye, Big ben, Westminster Abbey, Downing St, Nelson's Column, Trafalgar Square, National Gallery, Covent Garden, Oxford-,Regent-, Carnaby Street, Marble Arch, Hyde Park as well as major train stations: Waterloo-, Liverpool Street-, London Bridge-, Blackfriars-, Euston-, King's Cross and St Pancrass International Station.
access: Please make yourself at home, I love London and will happily recommend a day trip and give travel advice. You are welcome to wash clothes and prepare drinks and snacks in the kitchen. Breakfast is available on request on arrival.  £6 per person per morning. There are facilities to make tea or coffee in the room.

Slippers provided 3) No smoking 4) Kitchen is used to prepare tea/coffee, snacks and simple meals only - no cooking 5) No eating in the bedrooms

name: Victorian Room in Classic London Townhouse -Zone 2
summary: A charming double room is on the ground floor of this Victorian period property. A traditional fireplace and writing desk make this classic room with real 'Sherlock Holmes' style. Plenty of storage and a hairdryer along with fresh linens. Please browse the other rooms: Serene-, Blue -, and Piano Room, which are ideal for a big family or group to stay together under one roof.  All the 4 rooms accommodate 11 guests comfortably.
space: The Victorian Room is the most tradition and in keeping with the period of this property for a true 'London' experience, complete with writing desk and original fireplace - a real 'Sherlock Holmes' feel to it. Cosy and intimate with a small jack bed making it ideal for single travellers, it is also fine for a couple but for those wishing to spread out more in bed we recommend the blue/white/serene rooms.  Located on the ground floor next to the white room with lovely wooden floors it is quiet and secluded and perfect for relaxing after a day exploring the sights. Near large family kitchen/dinner that backs onto the garden.

name: Cosy room, Hackney, flat overlooks Regents Canal
summary: As a guest you'd have the larger sized double room in the flat, which is in an area surrounded by cafes, markets, art galleries and parks, (not to mention the canal) in the best area of London. (I know I'm biased..but..:)) The flat is small (this is London) - the kitchen isn't big enough to have two people cook at the same time for example (but then again.. I'm not a big cook!)
space: Well...the flat is 2nd floor overlooking the canal. It's a 5 minute walk to Victoria Park along the canal, or if you go the other way it's a 5 minute walk to all the cool cafes and restaurants of Broadway Market. It's a very up and coming (URL HIDDEN) I'm really lucky to live here!  Broadway Market has a market every Saturday, selling food and vintage clothes. Around the corner from there is a new york style block market which is open every weekend also.  Broadway Market has some really nice pubs too.  It's an 8 minute walk to London Fields which has an outdoor swimming pool (even in winter!). It's a 12 minute walk to Bethnal Green tube station (located on the Central Line) and just outside the block; there's a bus stop taking you to central London, London Bridge, the City,  or up towards Finsbury Park and Hackney Central Overland Station.  The area is known to be lively, with lots of cafes and great restaurants to check out (as well as pubs, clubs, bars if you're into that: ))  As for

(I know I'm biased..but..:)) The flat is small (this is London) - the kitchen isn't big enough to have two people cook at the same time for example (but then again.. I'm not a big cook!) It's an 8 minute walk to London Fields which has an outdoor swimming pool (even in winter!). It's a 12 minute w
neighborhood_overview: Hackney is very up and coming..buzzing with musicians, artist types...and there's so much going on I hardly need to go into central London for anything! (Apart from work!) I'm very lucky to live here..and to be honest it's a very desirable area to live in. I'm extra lucky because the flat overlooks the canal..and is on the canal tow path which goes to the Olympic Park and to Canary Wharf and the Thames. Victoria Park and the village is just 5 minutes along the canal tow path also.  I know I'm biased..but I've lived in London over 20 years and I don't want to ever leave here!
notes: ermmm...soo many cafes around here. If you like coffee...(or cafes full stop)..you're in for a treat :) Lots of vintage shops and markets around here too.
transit: There's a bus stop right outside the block of flats. These buses run every 5 -10 minutes to: London Bridge, Central London (Oxford Circus), the City of London, Liverpool Street, Whitechapel. Across the road buses go to Finsbury Park, Hackney Central etc etc. The nearest tube station is Bethnal Green Tube. It takes 8-10 minutes to walk to it.  The nearest overland train station is Hackney Central, which takes you to Stratford or towards Camden Road and this is a 20 minute walk or 10 minute bus ride away.
access: Please feel free to feel at home. I'm living here also, but I'm out at work during the day and I tend to do my own thing when I'm home.  There's a cupboard for guests to use to put any food they may wish to buy from the supermarket which is convienantly across the road, and there's an allocated space in the fridge also. The guest room also has a mini fridge.  Of course guests can use the kitchen, bathroom.  There is a washing machine however,  if a guest is staying longer than the need for one wash,  I do appreciate if they buy washing powder as a matter of courtesy, thank you.  Whilst I'm here on 'do's and don'ts'  I'd also be grateful if it's possible not to cook after 10pm week days
house_rules: Obviously we're all adults so there's no set 'rules'. Just to respect the property like it's your own. The one thing though..please no smoking anywhere inside the block. There's a nice bench outside by the canal for smokers.  Cheers.

name: Cosy 2 Bed Flat in Hackney Overlooking the Canal
summary: My flat is on the top floor of the block, so it has nice views of the canal and warehouses opposite (one of the two bedrooms, kitchen and living room). The flat is about 5 mins walk from  Broadway Market/London Fields, and if you go the other way it's about 5 mins to Victoria Park and the area we call 'the village' - (more) restaurants, pubs, shops etc.  It is about 12 mins walk to Bethnal Green tube, or 20 mins to Hackney Central overground. The flat is perfect for a couple visiting London!
space: Further to the above comment..  The flat is cosy, with great views over the canal. There are two separate bedrooms (one bigger than the other) and I'm all about having comfortable beds, and a decent working shower! The pressure of the water is good, and the shower head is big too.  Most guests really like to chill in the living room at the high table overlooking the canal, to watch the boats go by.  Having a coffee with that is a must mind you.  The flat is south facing, so you'll get the sun throughout the whole day.  If you don't fancy brewing your own coffee, there are loads of local coffee places and restaurants. A favourite of mine is right by the canal, with a nice outdoor area.

Most guests really like to chill in the living room at the high table overlooking the canal, to watch the boats go by.  Having a coffee with that is a must mind you.  The flat is south facing, so you'll get the sun throu
neighborhood_overview: I really can't underestimate how much I love this area. There is literally everything you need right by your doorstep. NO need to go into central London....ever! Want to go to the cinema? There is Hackney picturehouse (nearest, about 15 min walk away), or so many more in the area... quirky and different to the generic versions found in central London. Restaurants - too many to count. Vietamese food is a speciality around here.  Broadway Market, Victoria Park Village, Mare St, Hackney Road, Colombia Road.... loads of good restaurants around. oh! and if you can.. catch a play or opera or show at the beautiful 113 year old Hackney Empire.
notes: I can't find where I can add this, but I do have a smoke detector in the flat. The flat is situated on the 2nd floor and it is only accessible via the stairs.
transit: The flat is (literally) about 4 mins walk to the nearest bus stop. Buses from there will practically take you to anywhere you need to go. I'm talking.. Central London, London Bridge, Liverpool Street, Stratford, Hackney Central, Bethnal Green tube.. you name it, this bus stop will take you there (well the bus will, not the actual stop).  If you prefer to walk to the tube - that's Bethnal Green and it's about 12 mins to walk. If you walk slowly, it'll take you 15 minutes.  Hackney Central is the nearest overground, which takes 20-25 mins to walk, or a 5 minute bus journey (I wouldn't count Cambridge Heath Road station even though that's only 5 minutes away.. but it's not as useful as Hackney Central).
access: Guests get the whole flat. Keys include access to the gate in the communal garden area which takes you to the canal tow path. You can store your bike downstairs under the stairs (if you have a bike that is). Free carparking in the carpark.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm - No parties - Please wash all dishes before you check out - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply.  - Please leave the spare key in the specified location, otherwise you will be charged.

name: One Bedroom Flat Shepherds Bush
space: Newly refurbished one bedroom split level Penthouse Flat in a portered Art Deco Building in Shepherds Bush, West London. It is on the 8th floor of a 1920s Art Deco mansion block with 24 hour porterage. The flat is bright, airy and stylish with great views! The flat consists of a large double bedroom, open plan lounge and dining area with parquet floors, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom with a shower. There are two tvs and flat is fully wifi enabled. The flat is best suited to two guests but two more can be accommodated on the double Ligne Roset sofa bed upstairs if needed. Location It is 100 yards south of Shepherds Bush Green on the Shepherds Bush Road. It is within 5 minutes walk from Shepherds Bush tube and Westfield shopping centre. It is 20 minutes walk to Notting Hill and 10 minutes walk to Holland Park and Hammersmith. It's a pretty unique building and one of only four split level flats within the building and has great natural light and views, as well as being very convenien

name: 30% DISCOUNT! - GORGEOUS! Apt.
summary: A gorgeous one bedroom first floor flat in the heart of Camden Town. The perfect combination of the comfort of a home on the doorstep of the quiet and atmospheric Regent's canal and 6 min walk from the vibrant Camden Town High Street.
space: A superb ONE BEDROOM GROUND FLOOR FLAT in the heart of Camden town. The perfect combination of the comfort of a home on the doorstep of the quiet and atmospheric Regent's canal and 6 min walk from the vibrant Camden Town High Street. This entire 1-bedroom (with high quality mattress), 1 bathroom apartment with large living room, dining area, and kitchen is newly renovated with unique furnishings and decor. notes: Please note for early and late arrivals, the following charges apply: For early arrivals between 10.30am and 2.45pm, there is an early check in fee of £25. For arrivals between 7pm and 9:55pm there is a late check in fee of £30. Our housekeeping team maintain our flats in an immaculate condition and welcomes you after 7pm; they forgo their dinner, their family time so this small fee is to compensate them for working outside their normal hours. From 10:00pm to just before midnight the late check-in fee is of £50 to pay for their taxi back home - after such long hours we do not want our staff to risk missing their last trains. From midnight the late check in fee goes up to £100. This is to pay their taxi to the flat and back home. Our staff will be waiting for our guest till 2/3am in the morning! The rubbish / trash bags are to be placed in the street – on the sidewalk by the road. name: Gorgeous apartment nr Olympics!
space: Light, bright and comfortable 2-bedroom apartment with garden in trendy Stoke Newington for rental during the 2012 Olympics.  Stoke Newington is within 30 minutes door-to-door of the Olympic sites in Stratford and Hackney. It is four stops from Dalston Kingsland Station (10 mins walk) on the new Overground line. It’s an ideal location for visiting the Olympics and a fantastic base from which to explore London and to live like a Londoner! My two-bedroom flat is available to rent for the whole of the Olympic period. It was redecorated throughout in 2011, and has a new kitchen and a south-facing garden, which is currently being refurbished. (New pics to follow). It’s situated on a quiet residential street, of mostly Victorian houses, and within a few minutes walk of the lively cafes, bars and independent shops of Church Street. There are several good, traditional pubs serving food nearby, too. Stoke Newington is one of the loveliest of London’s ‘villages’ and popular with both families an

house_rules: CHECK IN AND OUT  Check-in is anytime after 3 pm. If possible we do our best to check you in as soon as you arrive but 3 pm is a deadline. Check-out is anytime before 11am. The check-in is in our office not in the apartment (different address). Late check-in fee  After 9pm - 20GBP  After midnight – 30GBP Check in after 10PM takes place at the Union Street near Borough Tube.  VISITORS  Please ask in advance each time you wish to have a friend or family member visit. We request that there are strictly no visitors from midnight through to 9am.  .  SMOKING  This is a non-smoking apartment therefore no smoking (not even by the window) is allowed  ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES ALLOWED WITHIN THE APARTMENT nor disturbing the peace.  If we receive a complaint or the police are called with good reason you will have to be asked to leave without a refund and we will not be returning your deposit. We want you to have fun, but please go and do it outside. London is a big place. Enjoy it.

name: Large Dble Room TV+wifi nr NPL & College
summary: Just look at the reviews! A fun and relaxing place to stay. Great for NPL and St Mary's College, Bushy Park 2 min walk.
space: Very large bedroom available in a 4 bedroom house in Teddington, Middlesex. The bedroom has 2 very large fitted double wardrobes, a fitted chest of 5 drawers, vanity unit / desk with 8 drawers. There's a TV with freeview and wifi internet. Shower/Bathroom for guests that are staying.  The pricing is for one occupant and second occupant pricing is negotiable. This room is designed for 2 adults only and it is not possible to accommodate young children as a third guest. If you are only booking for a single occupancy please look at my other guest bedroom (www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) as if possible I try to keep the double free for double occupancy. I have a full size snooker table if you fancy a game and dartboard in the log cabin in the garden. Nice south facing garden. It's a quiet location near to good transport links. It's about an 8 minute walk to Teddington British Rail station - 30 minutes to Waterloo. There are a couple of bus routes close by - No. 285 and X26 dir

It's about an 8 minute walk to T
neighborhood_overview: Parks and River Thames all nearby. Hampton Court is a 25 min walk. Good local shopping centres in Kingston and Richmond.
notes: If using the kitchen for cooking in the evening please leave it as you found it and wash up and put dishes away etc when you have finished. We have only one rule here...Please do NOT bang bedroom and bathroom doors as there are other people in the house. Thank you
transit: Transport services in the area are fantastic. 4 buses within 2 min walk operating a very frequent service. If you are arriving from Heathrow Terminal 3 then hop on the 285 at Heathrow Central and it will take about 35 minutes depending on time of day and get off at NPL/Gloucetser Road Bus Stop, or take the X26 (much quicker) but it only stops in Teddington High St and you will need to walk back (about 5 mins) or hop on a (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or 285 back to me. If arriving at Terminal 4 or Terminal 5 then you can get free interconnecting buses to Terminal 3 or Hatton Cross where you can change buses. I would also suggest (if you do not already have one) that you purchase an OYSTER TRAVEL CARD online or at the airport, they are £5 each but the fares on the bus transport will be half price and the buses do NOT accept cash.
access: Fridge, Freezer Space, Washing Machine (£1.00 nominal charge). Bathroom is shared if guests in both rooms. There is another available bathroom downstairs if ever there is "bathroom congestion", but it has never happened to date after over 500 guests. There is sometimes a parking space available on the drive and there is plenty of free parking in the road.
house_rules: Smoking allowed outside in garden. Pets are negotiable at a small extra charge. There are not many rules as such in this friendly happy house, but it is nice if guests treat the house with respect and make themselves at home. If other guests are staying please try to close the bedroom and bathroom doors quietly and not play loud music as they may be sleeping or resting. This would be very much appreciated. Please: No instrument playing after 10pm! Good communication, especially regarding eating arrangements, is nice too, as many guests eat with us providing we are eating that night (note: we do not always eat every night), and I charge a contribution of £3.00 per meal, of course guests can prepare their own meals if they so wish if they do not want to eat with us.

name: Stunning Victorian Flat with woodland garden
summary: A beautiful, clean and spacious flat with lots of character and a tranquil woodland garden.  A recently fully refurbished bathroom and kitchen. Walking distance to numerous high quality restaurants, cafes and bars. There's an art deco cinema nearby and a fringe theatre. The hidden and lesser known gem about this area is the wild nature with open parkland and a nature reserve only 5 mins away, perfect for walks or just relaxing. See the photos to see how beautiful the flat is, inside and out :-)
space: Single bed available in gorgeous shared ground floor Victorian flat. (The large double room is not currently available).  The flat has an idyllic woodland garden with lots of birds. A peaceful sanctuary away from the City where you can enjoy barbecues or just sit and relax with a drink. The flat is walking distance to the historic and very popular Stoke Newington 'village' full of cafes, restaurants, vintage clothes shops and a park. Transport Links: Only 2 mins walk from Clapton station where trains leave every 10 mins to the heart of London (Liverpool Street.) There is also a good bus network from Clapton Pond - a 5 minute walk away, where frequent buses depart for Angel/Old Street/West End.) Finsbury Park/Manor Park tube is only a 15 mins bus ride away.  Neighbourhood. For nature lovers the flat is very close to Springfield Park, (winner of a Green Flag Award for its outstanding natural heritage and beauty.) name: Single bedroom
space: I have a beautiful single bed in a double room in a family home. There is a desk in the room a TV and internet connection provided, and a very comfortable single bed. The house is very quiet and in a great location.  In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are restaurants, bars, cafes and shops, all within walking distance of the house. The huge Westfield Shopping Centre at Shepard's Bush is very close to the house and boasts 311 shops, restaurants and a cinema!  Getting around is quick and simple. The closest underground stations are Shepard's Bush Market and Goldhawk Road which gives you access to the Hammersmith and City Line and the Circle Line. From Shepard's Bush Market it is just 18 minutes to Paddington, where you can catch trains throughout the UK and to Heathrow Airport. The area is also served by several buses (including a number of night buses) which makes getting around easy, even if you do miss the last train!

name: Garden flat, Putney
space: Hiya. Welcome to lovely, leafy Putney in South West London.  We are only two minutes walk from Putney High Street and rail station and 7 minutes walk from East Putney underground station. We’ve got a lovely, warm and very welcoming home, and guests are treated as friends as opposed to customers.  Mary booked for a week and then stayed for 6 months, and Jeni has stayed here twice. So it can’t be too bad! The bedroom has a really comfortable king sized bed, with a single built in wardrobe, a small window, a couple of shelves, a bedside table and a radiator. All stays include clean fresh bedding, unlimited hot water. full Sky TV and wifi throughout. Our flat has a garden, kitchen, bathroom and a comfortable lounge (all shared with us)  Also included in your stay is full and unlimited access to Rufus! He is the softest, most loving dog you will ever meet. However, if you’re not a fan of dogs it’s probably best if you look elsewhere. There are not too many rules here, it's pretty laid back,

name: Small Double in Leafy Teddington
summary: A cosy smaller double room suitable for a single traveller on the top floor of our Victorian town house. We are about a 30 minute bus ride to Heathrow and 10 mins to Twickenham, Richmond and Kingston. Central London is about 40 minutes away by train.
space: Our cosy, small double room is located at the top of our house so it is peaceful, quiet and private. The shower room is for the sole use of our guests, it is shared with guests who may be staying in our larger room.  Guests are more than welcome to use the kitchen to prepare light meals when we are not feeding the children.  Our house is situated very close to the high street in Teddington which has many bars, restaurants and shops. We are also very fortunate to be located within a short walk of the River Thames and the Royal Bushy Park, We are a short bus journey to Kew Gardens, Hampton Court and Central London is only 30/40 minutes away by train.

name: cosy room with friendly family.
summary: Cozy warm and welcoming house, ideal for visitors to London, either for leisure or business. Stay short or long and enjoy what London can offer from a well positioned home within easy reach of the bright lights by train or bus (or combination). You’ll be welcomed by Donna and the Fun Boy Three (otherwise known as Snowny, Pebbles and Barney (the resident felines). If you love cats and are looking for a good base to explore London and the South East of England from, then this is the Home for you.
space: A small but clean and cosy single (URL HIDDEN) to family bathroom with constant hot water, clean towels and linen provided.Breakfast availible upon request and guests welcome to share kitchen facilities.We have 3 cats so animal lover essential. Plenty of car parking space next to house and a small tidy garden. Our house is situated within 10 minutes walk of mainline train services straight into London, Stratford and the Olympic Stadium are both a short bus ride away. Nearby we benefit from a large supermarket, public sports centre and a wide variety of restaurants. In addition the Royal borough of Greenwich has some wonderful attractions including the recently refurbished Cutty Sark clipper ship, Greenwich Park, and is a boarding place to enjoy a trip along the river Thames taking in historical sites as you go. We look forward to welcoming you into our home.

In close proximity are local shops including cafes, convenience stores, Indian, Chinese and traditional fish and chips restaurants as well as a vibrant pub.
transit: Transport is easy by bus or train and we can advise on best routes and connections to get you most any place. Car parking is available in an off street space or on the road which is quiet and traffic slow.

name: Bed & Breakfast - Double Room!
space: Bed & Breakfast - Double Room! Located 5 minutes walk away from Roding Valley Station (Central line) - and just 20 minutes from some of the main attractions and coolest places in LONDON! Also near The Olympic Park in Stratford! We have a double room with shared bathroom on your own floor. Also a single room, on the same floor is available should you require it. (See our other listing) Continental breakfast is included in the rate and 1 litre of mineral water free in your room. Tea and coffee making facilities are available in the kitchen; TV, DVD and internet in the lounge. We supply a set of towel, iron and a decent hair dryer.  This is a No Smoking house, but if you would like to smoke, or just sit outside and read, please do use the back garden. NEARBY UNDERGROUND STATION: Roding Valley - Central Line Buckhurst Hill - Central Line

name: Room to let in leafy Wimbledon
space: Light, airy double room available for rent in Wimbledon, plenty of wardrobe and storage space. Bed linen provided. Shared bathroom, leafy street. The room would be ideal for someone coming for the Wimbledon Tennis Championships and can even offer a lift there each day if you don't fancy walking. Wimbledon station is 8-10 minute walk away, with overland trains to Waterloo, (leaving every few minutes and taking 15 minutes to the centre of London) and underground trains (District Line). There are also local buses leaving from around the corner to Wimbledon Village, Southfields, Clapham and Tooting (including St George's Hospital). You would be sharing the house with myself, my small daughter and one other lodger. You would share the bathroom with just the other lodger as I have another bathroom upstairs.

Kitchen and bathroom are shared with me.
