name: MORDEN London Zone 4, Bright Single Room
summary: A bright room in a 1940's apartment block in Morden, a town with a great ethnic mix. 10 - 15 minutes bus journey from Wimbledon, great local parks,  Morden (metro) station nearby, good local shops and library. Ideal for students or budget travellers.
space: A room of about 3.5 x 2.5 metres with single bed and clothes storage. Quiet room in a 1940's apartment block overlooking the Tube (metro) depot, On third floor facing east; - you can watch the sun come up in the morning! Good Wi-Fi. Full use of all facilities; it's not luxurious but it is bright and comfortable. Own small cupboard space in kitchen, bath as well as shower, I am friendly and easy going and have some knowledge of London so could help if required. Also have a garden allotment 1km away which guests can use to sit in good weather.

I am often quietly in working on the PC or watching TV. Happy to chat or share the odd meal but also respect guests' p
neighborhood_overview: This area is just such a great mix of people and parks. The apartment is sited next to a mosque and near a National Trust park and, open public parks and a swimming pool. The town increasingly benefits from the number of migrants who have moved here and opened great food and vegetable shops. It is 40 minutes from the West End of London by tube and has great bus and tram links to Wimbledon and central London.
notes: There is no washing machine at my apartment and no 'power' shower as such, although there is of course a normal shower and bath. This is not a luxury apartment and it is gradually being upgraded, but if you want to stay in a quiet, friendly place with full use of a kitchen and a clean private room, then you will be welcomed and helped in any way I can. Visitors to the Mosque are particularly welcome; please note there is a strict no smoking rule in the apartment and lobby and alcohol and meat are both consumed here in moderate quantities!
transit: Morden Station, Northern Line tube (metro) is about 7 - 8 mins walk away. Morden Station, National Rail connection into Central London is 5 mins walk away. Numerous buses. Travel in London is by use of the 'Oyster' (Pre-pay) Card. Morden is in zone 4 so it is worth checking travel costs if you are going to commute to the centre often.  (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) 'tfl' for good informationYou can get to the coast (Brighton) in about 1 hour 20 minutes door to door.

name: Lovely family house. Up to 7 guests
summary: Lovely family house with four good-sized bedrooms and two bathrooms on a popular and peaceful residential street in London's highly-desirable Stoke Newington, just a short walk from fashionable Dalston.
space: Lovely family house with 4 good-sized bedrooms and 2 bathrooms on a popular and peaceful residential street in London's fashionable Stoke Newington. Set over four floors the house has a double reception room and new spacious modern fitted kitchen with concertina doors leading to a pretty garden. Upstairs there are four double bedrooms, one with an ensuite bathroom. We have recently had our loft done so that bedroom is modern and spacious and has a high-quality brand new kingsize mattress. The second bedroom has a double bed, the third bedroom is set up for kids with a large sturdy bunk bed and the fourth bedroom has a single bed. We also have a cot if you're coming with a baby - this can be set up in any room you like. Wood floors and neutral walls give it a calming, modern look. The house is fitted throughout with modern appliances including large freestanding fridge-freezer, wide-screen TV, DVD player, XBox, washing machine, tumble dryer and broadband internet. It is ideal for a fami
description: Lovely family house with four good-sized bedrooms and two bathrooms on a popular and peaceful residential street in London's highly-desirable Stoke Newington, just a short walk from fashionable Dalston. Lovely family house with 4 good-sized bedrooms and 2 bathrooms on a popular and peaceful residential street in London's fashionable Stoke Newington. Set over four floors the house has a double reception room and new spacious modern fitted kitchen with concertina doors leading to a pretty garden. Upstairs there are four double bedrooms, one with an ensuite bathroom. We have recently had our loft done so that bedroom is modern and spacious and has a high-quality brand new kingsize mattress. The second bedroom has a double bed, the third bedroom is set up for kids with a large sturdy bunk bed and the fourth bedroom has a single bed. We also have a cot if you're coming with a baby - this can be set up in any room you like. Wood floors and neutral walls give it a calming, modern look. The ho
neighborhood_overview: Kynaston Road is located just moments from the superb amenities of Stoke Newington Church Street famed for its villagey atmosphere. Local attractions include a buzzy restaurant scene, a large local park 5-minutes walk away (Clissold), as well as a well-equipped local leisure centre with squash courts, 25-metre pool, gym and other facilities.  Just across the road is the newly restored Prince pub selling craft beers and fabulous food as well as a lovely cafe called Esters, famous locally for delicious flat whites, tasty homemade cakes and brunches. There is also a very handy grocery shop selling bread, milk, newspapers, beer etc. which is open from early till late every day.  Stoke Newington is one of the few remaining "villages" of London. Our local high street is populated with independent shops, bars and restaurants and has a unique, feel that you simply don't get in busy tourist areas. It's a place where many young families choose to live because it's safe, clean and very easy to ac
notes: I am very happy to help with any details that I can. I can provide you with parking vouchers if you have a car, or assistance if you are attending a wedding at Stoke Newington Town Hall.  We have 3 young sons so the house is well kitted out for families with children. We have a cot as well as a high chair available and an extensive kid's DVD collection.
transit: Stoke Newington is well-connected by bus to major rail stations such as Kings Cross (30 minutes away) and Euston (40 minutes away). Dalston Junction, a 10 minute walk away, also has excellent rail links all over London (on the East London line and Dalston Kingsland on the over ground).  It's easy to get to Waterloo and the South Bank on the 243 bus from just a couple of streets away, or the City on the 67. Shoreditch, Islington and Finsbury Park are also all short bus rides away. There are a number of Tube stations a short bus ride away. These include Highbury and Islington (Victoria line) and Seven Sisters (Piccadilly line). Other nearby public transport includes Stoke Newington railway station which takes you into Liverpool Street in 15 minutes.  If you are driving, the A10, which provides access to both the M25 motorway and the A406 (North Circular), is also within close proximity.  Heathrow, Luton and Stansted airports are all roughly an hour away. I am very happy to help with any

name: **CENTRAL** Comfy Artist's Home in Camden.
summary: If you want to experience London at it's best then come to Camden. This area of London is central, safe, and packed full of cafes, bars, famous nightclubs, music venues and the world famous Camden Market along with beautiful parks and Primrose Hill.
space: I live in the heart of Camden Town, in a late Georgian terrace of houses within a Conservation area, right in the centre of London. My flat is richly decorated which reflects the work that I do as a Textile Artist. My walls are covered with my choice of vintage finds, antiques and objets d'art. **Here is what Leanne from the US had to say when she stayed recently : ‘We absolutely loved everything about our stay. Your beautiful home was simply magical, we loved being surrounded with treasures from around the world. We couldn’t have asked for a more perfect experience to make our first trip to London memorable’. My Flat on 1st and 2nd Floor 16 sq mtrs: SITTING ROOM/BEDROOM: You will be staying in my sitting room on a comfy sofa bed. You will get complete privacy during your stay in my sitting room.  I might be around during your stay but In all probability you will have my Flat to yourself. This large sunny room has two big windows with wooden shutters and a big fire place. There will be

neighborhood_overview: ROUND THE CORNER:  I live on a main road just down from a small high street with basic shops and cafes in it. If you want West End stores then my local bus takes you right to Oxford St in 20 minutes. There are buses near me for all the major sights of London as well as the tube, Camden Town. By my home there are 3 supermarkets, organic butchers, an Earth Store, 2 book shops, one of the first cycle shops in London, a pharmacy, ATM and Post Office, 3 train stations, and a great vegetable stall,  ** There are 3 good local restaurants and more. IN WALKING DISTANCE:  Camden is a vibrant area with many different cultures and creeds. This is reflected in the street life. We have a farmers market, boutiques, cafes, coffee houses, the Jazz Cafe, a Cinema, the Jewish Museum,  welcoming pubs and small restaurants, thriving night clubs and a ground - breaking music scene, as well as charming neighbourhoods and easy access to London's Museums. I have lived in this area for over 27 years and still l
notes: Things to Note: I have had families stay with me in my sitting room. This is a bit of a squeeze for families but so worth it financially. I have an extra mattress for a child that can be put up during the day. Families love staying with me as I live in a safe neighbourhood and they can do what they want. The youngest guest I have had was 4 months and the eldest was 78yrs. My flat  is on the 1st floor for the guest room and the second floor for the bathroom.
transit: TRANSPORT:  The best way to get around London is to buy an OYSTER CARD when you arrive as this gives you cheap trips on all the tubes, buses and trains. I tend to go by buses everywhere as you can see so much and it is a delight to do so. There are bus stops all about 1 to 2 minutes walk from my home, and, there are buses about every 4/5 minutes.   I live nearby 5 major TRAIN STATIONS including Euston, Eurostar, St Pancras, Kings Cross, Paddington and Marylebone Stations. Camden Town Tube and Camden Overground are are close by.  *25mins walk to St Pancras International  Station and Kings Cross  Station but you can take a 6 mins bus or a 5 mins taxi.  *6 mins walk to Camden Town tube.  *2 mins walk to Camden Overground that takes you straight to Stratford and the Westfield Centre for shopping, in 20 mins or to Kew Gardens the opposite way. Coming in from EUROSTAR is easy as I live in the same road. Arriving from Heathrow, get the Express to Paddington, then the tube. If you arrive at Ga
access: You have access to my kitchen as well as the bathroom. You will be sleeping in my sitting room but you can make it back to a sitting room again during the day by putting the sofabed away.
house_rules: House Rules: No parties and no one staying who have not booked in - Thank you.  I would prefer no smokers please.  I do not have pets.  I can provide hypo allergic bedding if given warning. Please do not wear shoes in your room - I have a cream carpet.  All information about your stay will be provided when you arrive, including a map of the area and info about my home. My aim is for you to be able to relax and chill after a day’s sight seeing. Just enjoy yourself when you come and stay in my home. We offer flexible check-in & check-out times, however where we have guests coming or leaving the same day we may apply check-in times after 14:00 and check-out times before 11:00. Late check-in needs to be pre-arranged and confirmed with us at least 3 days before arrival and they are subject to the following charges for arrival between these times: From 19:00 to 22:00 - £40 From 22:00 to 00:00 - £65 From 00:00 to 7:00 - £100 *These prices may differ during public holidays (e.g. Christmas Day

name: Comfortable/Friendly/Double room for 1/Limehouse
summary: Smartpricing is switched on so book now to get the biggest discount!  SuperHost Status since 2017. A warm welcome awaits you at my waterside apartment which is Great Value and brilliantly positioned for central London and Canary Wharf. Your room is a bright, fresh and clean double room (king size bed) with private wc and shower. All set in a quiet location.
space: You'll have sole use of a double room with lots of natural light in my 2 bed/bath spacious warm bright waterside flat.  Plenty of room for you to relax or work. Your own private WC / shower room.  My apartment is about half the price of many local places because I want to offer a welcome to guests, not just run a money-making project.  In a quiet location. Brilliantly positioned in Limehouse. You will experience a quiet flat in a pretty location with a friendly city professional as your host. I try to be as flexible as possible to accommodate your requests both as regards arrival arrangements and during your stay.  I can offer lots of advice on places to eat and drink (happy to share lots of knowledge on local options as well as those all around London). Sightseeing advice is also available - I have lived in London almost all my life.   Included:  *comfortable spacious private bedroom *Clean freshly laundered high-quality bedlinen *private shower & w/c *shower gel,  shampoo, handwash *

name: A Very Relaxing North London Haven
space: The North London Haven can be found in a Homely Environment within a Terraced House that is Very close (under 3 minutes walk) to the Main Underground Station and Bus Stations.  The surrounding area has a big Shopping Mall, 2 cinemas and a lovely market (within the mall) including many other shops on the main street and restaurants and fast food set ups. The bedroom is a comfortable room with a double bed and storage space with cupboards etc. There is a window overlooking the garden that lets alot of light in. Everyone sleeps like a baby in it. It takes 25 minutes to get from the local station to Leicester Square (no changes needed!!) on the Picadilly Line (Blue Line!!) neighborhood_overview: Fantastic transport links ..very easy to get to most parts of London . Great restaurants and bars within walking distance and a brilliant location if you want to experience the Notting Hill Carnival. Portobello Road  is a 5 minute walk away making it the perfect location to visit the market and all the bars, restaurant clubs etc. If shopping is your thing Westfield White City is a 10 minute drive away, 15 minutes on the bus. The grand union canal is 3 minute walk from the house and you can follow this to the Paddington Basin and little Venice - great to walk or cycle. Wembley stadium is 30 minutes by bus/car.
notes: The price quoted is for the double bedded guest room only and is for a maximum of  2 guests sharing. If  an additional bed/bedroom is required the loft can be used as a bedroom at an additional cost (usually the same rate as the guests are paying for the guest bedroom). If 2 additional guests are using the loft the additional room price would be a minimum price of £50 per night. If you want this facility please contact the host prior to your stay. There is a key safe outside the property so guests can gain access even if the owners are not in the residence for check in. Check in arrangements will be communicated the day before your arrival
transit: We have great transport links. There is a bus stop 1 minute away on Harrow road . The number 18 bus goes to Euston Station, Paddington and there are stops linking to jubilee line, bakerloo line, district and circle lines along the route. South London can be easily accessed form the overland  trains from Kensal Rise, Kensal Green ( both walking distance - 7 mins) and Willesden Junction ( 7 min bus ride (No 18) ) as can east London with trains going as far as Stratford from Kensal Green station. There are many bus routes that go all over London from the large Sainsbury Supermarket -  3 minute walk from the house. No 18 Bus (Harrow Road Bustop Z) - Euston Station (Eastbound)- Via Paddington, Little Venice, Baker Street, Regents Park, Harley Street (can walk down to Oxford street), Tottenham Court Road ,  No 23 Bus (Walk to Sainsburys) -No 28 Bus ( Harrow Road) - To Wandsworth via Notting Hill Gate, Kensington High Street (Kensington Palace), Olympia Exhibition Centre, Fulham Broadway (Che
access: Guest Bedroom, Loft room (living space only), Garden, Kitchen ( for breakfast up-to 10:30 am and for making drinks) Shared Bathroom. The loft can be used as a bedroom,  only if agreed with the host and an additional room fee is paid (please let the host know if you want this option). Otherwise the loft is used as an additional living space for guests who have booked the guest bedroom. Guests can use Key safe to access the property when owners are unavailable
house_rules: Check out is 11am - If you need a later check out this will incur an additional cost of £10 per hour if the owners can accommodate this change. The living room and dining room are not available for guest use. The room is rented on a bed and breakfast basis only. If you choose to have breakfast you must be finished by 10:30am after this breakfast dishes will be removed. Guests must not  entertain  friends/ relatives who are not staying at the property without prior permission from the owners. Guests can play music in the garden and in the loft and a bluse tooth speaker is provided however they must be considerate of neighbours and no music outside after midnight. Please ensure you close and lock windows before leaving the property especially if no-one is home. Do not Bolt the front door when you come into the property -just close the front door.

neighborhood_overview: This aprtment is situated to the south of Bellevue Place, which forms part of the Stepney Green Conservation Area. “Hidden away behind the Genesis Cinema and Wickham’s lopsided department store is Bellevue Place. To get there, you walk up a side street from the Mile End Rd where you discover a bright green door in an old wall hung with ivy. Push this door and enter another world just as writer and artist, Geoffrey Fletcher, did when he walked through the same doorway in 1964.” In The London Nobody Knows he wrote,“A green gate opening in the wall leads to a totally unexpectedly corner of London, one that may well disappear if Charrington’s, who own the property, ever decide to expand. Bellevue Place is well named. It is a cul-de-sac with a paved pathway leading to the far end, under a creeper-covered wall. The cottages are early nineteenth century, and have true cottage gardens fenced with wooden rails, pointed at the top. Here are unbelievably rural gardens, full of lilac, lupins and d
transit: The apartment is situated between Whitechapel and Stepney Green District Line underground stations and these stations are about 5 minutes away from the apartment.  The journey time to Central of London is 12 minutes.  There are 24/7 No.25 bus service to and from Oxford Street, central London. 2 minutes away from Tesco Express (grocery shop) for daily food.
access: I have been running this holiday apartment for 6 years. I have learnt and understand totally what my guests need from me as a host.  I am a friendly and approachable host. I try my upmost best to ensure everyone of my guest receive the higher quality of comfort and satisfaction during their stay.  I have listed my holiday apartment in Airbnb as well as at other holiday apartment websites. I continue to receive 5 starts reviews from my previous guests.

Full access to the kitchen however if you plan on entirely self catering evening meals then this listing is probably not suitable other than prearranged exceptions. The flat has all amenities including washing machine, dishwasher, wifi and HD Sky TV. Local calls free but any other phone calls need to be requested and paid for. Owner in his 60's and a quiet flat. I am often available to help with any information and assistance. If I am in during the evenings I usually cook dinner and watch TV. A well behaved Staffordshire Bull Terrier has moved in. She is very gentle and friendly. Roxy would not b
neighborhood_overview: The Apartment is 1 minutes walk from Guy's Campus' Tuesday Farmer's Market and within 2 minutes walk of London Bridge Rail and Tube stations, numerous bus routes, the 16th century George Inn pub and Borough Market. Dozens of restaurants and the river Thames within a 6 minute walk. Mercado Metropolitano a 7 minute walk. City of London business district a 10 minute walk. Iconic London sightseeing is in walking distance; Tower Bridge, Tower of London, Borough Market, the Tate Modern, Shakespeare's Globe, St Paul's Cathedral, Spitalfield Market, the White Cube Gallery in  trendy Bermondsey Street and the Shard with the highest viewing gallery in Europe for unparalleled views over our city. 20 minutes walk along the Thames River brings you to the South Bank Cultural Centre.
notes: ABOUT THE IMMEDIATE LOCAL AREA  London Bridge/Bankside is a historic area near to The City of London.  With Borough Market, Flat Iron Square, Maltby Street Market and Mercado Metropolitano within a few minutes walk the area is a haven for foodies. The nearby ancient Southwark Cathedral, Tower Bridge, Tower of London, City Hall, More London (where various cultural events take place) and riverside places of interest further west such as Shakespeare's Globe and Tate Modern mean that this area is a magnet for tourists. Eating or drinking by the river in one of the local restaurants or bars is a particular attraction.  The neighbourhood includes mainly City workers or Medical Students at Guys Campus of the University of London.
transit: Trains direct to Charing Cross departing every 2 minutes for easy access to the West End within 15 minutes. Direct and frequent Underground lines to Camden, Hampstead, Clapham, Kings Cross/St Pancreas, The 02, City Airport, Olympic Stadium, Canary Wharf, Baker Street, Bond Street, Green Park, Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament (Big Ben) and Buckingham Palace.  Gatwick 30 minutes by rail. Heathrow 65 minutes by tube (Underground)
access: Direct access (but with 11pm noise restriction) to a large roof terrace that runs along the entire length of the building which was constructed in 2002. Full access to the kitchen however if you plan on entirely self catering evening meals then this listing is probably not suitable other than prearranged exceptions. The flat has all amenities including washing machine, dishwasher, wifi and HD Sky TV. Local calls free but any other phone calls need to be requested and paid for.

Please relax and enjoy your stay with me.

name: Large twin bed-sitting room by Battersea Park
summary: This room is  perfect for: a) 1 person wanting comfort, space and a desk for quiet working b) 2 friends wanting to share a spacious room c) a parent and child   Dogs are very welcome too -  at no charge! Battersea Park, a range of pubs and restaurants, a leisure centre and all kinds of public transport (including Boris Bikes) are available nearby.
space: Modern garden flat in Battersea, 20 mins' walk to King's Rd. This is the perfect place to stay while visiting London. Just 50 metres from the property you will find Battersea Park, which is considered by many to be one of the most interesting of all the parks in London. Here you will find a wide range of sporting facilities, a lake and attractive gardens. Also close by are a variety of pubs and restaurants, plus a local sports centre. Full continental breakfast can be provided if arranged in advance, but there is a charge of 5 GBP per person per day. There are also Italian and  French cafes within 5 minutes' walk that offers excellent breakfasts. If you have any questions please send me a message and I will happily get back to you as soon as I can. Thanks.

neighborhood_overview: The choice of pubs and restaurants offering all different types of cuisine; a haven from the hustle and bustle of tourist London; and of course Battersea Park itself and all the activities it offers.
transit: I always ask a guest which airport or station they are arriving at in London, so that I can offer detailed directions to my Battersea home, whether by public or private transport. For guests with cars, I can arrange parking if given advance notice. There is a small charge (12 GBP a day), but it is much cheaper and more convenient than meter parking.  Near the property you will find good bus links to the Victoria and Piccadilly tube lines and to Clapham Junction. Victoria and Sloane Square tubes are also about 30 minutes' walk, at least half of that being through Battersea Park. Also, just a few minutes walk away, through the Park, you will find the Thames river and Albert Bridge, which connects Battersea to Chelsea. We have Boris' Bikes immediately across the road for people to hire for cycling round London or just a quick ride round Battersea Park. I can also call on a very reliable taxi service for guests needing transport at any hour of the day or night.
access: Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen and patio garden.
house_rules: Guests are asked to be out of the property between 10am and 4pm unless otherwise arranged.

space: Room with double bed in 2 bed flat in Docklands, 2/3 minutes walk to the nearest train station. Ideal for visitors to the nearby ExCel centre or travellers looking for a low cost base from which to explore London. Only £10 extra for a guest. Free unlimited fast fibre WiFi! I have hosted over 300 happy guests :) All guests get a personal welcome and flat tour on arrival. transit: TRANSPORT Fantastic transport links! The flat is just 2/3 minutes walk to Cyprus station (320 metres away if you want an exact measurement) which is on the DLR line - Zone 3 - and is ideal for travelling to Central London, the ExCel centre, Canary Wharf and the City. The ExCel Centre is just 5 minutes away by train, O2 arena - 12 minutes, West Ham - 13 minutes and Stratford - 18 minutes - according to the Transport For London website. Other train times from Cyprus station are: Canary Wharf - 17 mins Bank - 25 mins  Liverpool Street - 28 mins  Leicester Square - 33 mins West End/Green Park/Central London - 30/35 mins Shoreditch - 35 mins  Last train arrives at Cyprus around 12:40pm during the week (last Sunday trains arrive around an hour earlier), with the 474 night bus running every 30 minutes after that. Let me know as soon as possible if you will arrive earlier or later than your expected arrival time.  Strictly no check-in after midnight. Respect my place as if you were staying with a friend. Unlike many other hosts I do not charge a cleaning fee so it is appreciated if you keep everything as clean as you find it. Remove rubbish/recycling from the room when you leave and wash up if you use anything in the kitchen. Keep the noise down after 10pm to respect the neighbours. If I am out when you check-out please lock the door and post the keys in my letter box - number 12 - located on the wall by the stairs. Strictly 2 people maximum staying in the room due to local laws. The accommodation is not child-proofed, thus NOT suitable for children or infants. name: Double room in light airy flat
summary: Available is a spacious and comfortable bedroom in my flat that you will be sharing with me, located in the north of Shoreditch - close to the vibrant areas of central Shoreditch, Dalston and Brick Lane.  Easy access to everywhere - by foot, bus, train or London bike!
space: Lovely light larger-than-double bedroom with very comfy double bed, in a 2 bedroom flat. Situated just north of the lively part of  Shoreditch, and 10 minutes walk south of Dalston .  You will be sharing with the flat with me. My boyfriend Ken lives close by and often meets my guests if I am at work.  Inside the flat all the usual - internet/wi-fi, dishwasher, usb powerpoints, and  good hot water pressure in the bathroom.  You are welcome to use the kitchen, there's a shelf in the fridge for you, the cooker/oven, toaster, popcorn maker etc.  Tea and coffee are provided.  I don't provide breakfast but there are lots of amazing cafes close by. There will be fresh bed sheets on the bed for you and towels in the bedroom, as well as plenty of space to hang your clothes.  There is even a hair dryer. There's a small balcony outside that smokers can use.  The flat is on the second floor of the building with no lift. There's good security, the only access into the building is with a programmed

neighborhood_overview: This is a great location, walking distance to Broadway Market, Columbia Road Market and London Fields and the Geffrye Museum. There's many buses to catch to lots of destinations on Kingsland Road just around the corner, less than 2 minutes away. The flat is 5 minutes walk away from Haggerston or Hoxton stations on the Overground line, and 10-15 minutes walk from Liverpool Street or Old Street stations.  I live close to a busy main road and the area around the flat is well lit at night. Even though the flat is very near Kingsland Road, the area is generally quiet and quite safe. London bikes are available to hire close by at several locations, the closest being just 2 minutes away. Regents Canal is close by, some lovely walks to be had along the canal path to Islington, Broadway Market or Victoria Park. Lots of great quality affordable Vietnamese restaurants just down the road, the 'Pho Mile' as one of my guests called it. Perfect if you are coming to London for a visit! Especially if y
notes: I only accept bookings from people who have completed the verification process including passport or drivers licence details.    Please note: no guests under 18 years of age.
transit: Very close to bus stops on Kingsland Road, and Haggerston and Hoxton stations on the Overground line, 15 minutes from Old Street and 20 minutes from Liverpool Street.
access: There is shared access to the following rooms: bathroom, kitchen, lounge room, and balcony.
house_rules: For people using Instant Booking, please note: - you are booking a private room in a flat shared with me and occasionally my boyfriend - there is a double bed in the room.  If you are booking for two people, you must be comfortable sharing the bed with them - you cannot make a booking for someone else - all guests must be over 18 years of age - generally I am back from work after 7pm on weekdays and this is reflected in the check in time.  The check in time over the weekend is more flexible. No smoking inside.  I have a small balcony where you can smoke (I smoke out there myself).  No candles or incense inside.  Nobody under the age of 18.  I prefer that you do not invite other people into the flat but do speak to me about this if you have friends in London.  You will be asked to leave if you have made a booking for 1 person and bring someone else in to stay the night. name: RoofTerrace dble rm,StratfordCentre
space: Tea and Coffee free provided - just help yourself! Complimentary shower gel and soap is also provided during your stay :-)  The roof terrace bedroom is part of the 4th floor penthouse, flat in central Stratford,  East London.  The flat is situated in the up and coming area of Stratford, east London, most notable for being the main Olympic / Paralympic site for 2012.  The flat is 10-15 minutes walk from the main site or less than 5 minutes via bus.  Public transport links are excellent within the local area -there is a bus stop directly outside of the flat, whereby you can be taken directly to the local tube station / rail / bus station.   The flat itself consists of 2 double bedrooms, a large living room and dining room, modern fully fitted kitchen and bathroom, with power shower.  The flat has gas central heating throughout and has the luxury of 2 double roof terraces on either side of the flat - one on the eastern side, parallel with the living room and the other, off the western sid

name: Peaceful Riverside Island Sanctuary
summary: I love living by the river so close to London as well as excellent services of Kingston in such a quiet place.
space: A unique island dwelling accessed via a charming hand wound chain ferry in the Thames in South West London. A quiet sanctuary from the rush of London to rest and relax in. The island is in the Thames in a very quiet leafy part of London with lots of green space. The living room overlooks the Thames and opens out onto a deck that has direct river access. A bight and airy space ideal for yoga mediation or just sitting and reading. The house is a 15 walk from mainline train services into Waterloo and within the daily travelcard zone (zone6). Hampton court is not far as is Kingston with its excellent shopping, dinning and entertainment options. What is offered is a good sized single room within a veggie household so please no meat/fish. No meals supplied but there is a very well equipped kitchen that you are very welcome to use. Plenty of free parking on the mainland. neighborhood_overview: The island is a community of just under 30 houses with a broad mix of ages. The ferry to access the island is shared by all so provides a lovely opportunity to catch up with neighbours.
transit: there is plenty of free parking on the mainland just by the Island and we are 1 mile away from a station with regular mainline services into London Waterloo.

name: Stunning 4 bedroom house near Wimbledon Common
summary: Stunning, contemporary, bright and spacious four bedroom town house with great views close to Wimbledon Common previously booked by high ranking Wimbledon tennis players and their associates.
space: This fabulous, contemporary, bright four bedroom town house with three shower rooms and  several  balconies is located close to Wimbledon Common .  Arranged over four floors this stunning home comprises a good size reception room,  superb kitchen/breakfast room, four bedrooms, three bathrooms, study, cloakrooms, utility room, garden and off street parking. Entering the property on the ground floor there is a spacious hallway, a study and wonderful reception room with a south facing balcony.  Going down stairs there is the stunning kitchen/dining room with wall to wall bi-fold doors onto the terrace garden.  Also on this level there is a lovely double bedroom along with patio doors to small terrace with ensuite shower room. Going up to the first floor there is a large  bedroom with patio doors to another balcony which has far reaching views to the south. name: Sunny single free WiFi  Nr Richmond
summary: Single room in a 3 storey house on a quiet residential road. Easy walking to Richmond on river towpath. Richmond has a wealth of restaurants, pubs, three cinemas and many attractions: Richmond Park , Ham House, river cruises and rowing boats/boards/bicycles for hire. Hampton Court Palace can be reached by bus or boat.  Richmond has the underground/overground/ regular trains  taking 10 minutes into Central London. Richmond also boasts boat yards still repairing and building wooden boats.
space: NON SMOKERS ONLY PLEASE. Small, quiet and bright single room available in a private home. The window faces the front in a quiet residential road. The bedroom has a chest of drawers and hanging facility. The bed has a very comfortable Hypnos mattress.  It's on the first floor, close to the bathroom. The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle for guests. All bed linen and towels are included. There is free street parking. The garden is walled and a sun trap and can be used weather permitting. The house is only five minutes walk to the bus stop which can take you to Richmond Railway station for trains and the underground direct to the centre of London. You can also walk along the River Thames towpath to Richmond which is a very beautiful walk.  It takes ten minutes on the fast train into Central London or twenty minutes to half an hour on the underground depending on where you need to go. neighborhood_overview: There is a good Italian restaurant round the corner for dinner. Also an excellent Asian fusion noodle bar within 10 minutes walk.. Easy access to River Thames towpath. Also close to the National Archives at Kew for those interested in Genealogy. Very close to Twickenhamn Rugby Stadium-perfect for Rugby and other events.  It is only a ten minute walk away.  Great area for runners and walkers alike.  Close to Hampton Court and many other tourist sites.  The river has water facilities like rowing, canoeing and paddle boarding, and there is a lovely boat ride to Hampton Court and towards central London.
notes: Although the bathroom is shared, I don't get up early so you would have it to yourself.

access: Bathroom.  Garden (depending on weather). There is a dining area and the kitchen can be made available for hot drinks and simple meals.  You can use the washing machine but there is a charge of £5 per load. Clothes can be dried on the washing line in the garden.
house_rules: Definitely no smoking.  Shoes should be removed when you enter the house.  The room is only suitable for one person. No food in the bedroom. Arrival preferably after 1800 hours but can be flexible. Check out by 10.30 am please.

name: Maida Vale,Double bed with private garden   Zone 2
summary: Located in a great location very close to public transport: between Kilburn Park and Maida Vale. Central London is just 15 mns away. 5 minutes walk from beautiful Paddington ground ( Park ) and 10 minutes from Little Venice. St John's wood ( Think Abbey Road ! ) is 20 minutes walk away. You will have a double bedroom with direct access to my private garden. You can use the kitchen. Central heating.  10% discount for weekly stay ! 25% discount for monthly stay !
space: This is a bright double bedroom in a lovely flat on the edge of Maida Vale and Kilburn in North West London ( zone 2 ). The bedroom opens directly onto a large, private garden, which you are welcome to sunbathe in or relax in the hammock( in the summer !). The flat has a small bathroom/toilet   ( which we share) and kitchen overlooking the garden. Bed linen, towels are provided and  coffee or teas are  included ( just help yourself! )  There is WIFI,  and a washing machine.  I am friendly and easy going, But... yes a little "but"...1: Strictly no smoking and 2: No visiting friends of guest unless previously agreed !( safety/security! ). I look forward to welcoming you in my home!   The flat is in a residential area and a great location for exploring London. There are bus stops 2 minutes walk from the flat. space: CLEAN, COMFORTABLE DOUBLE BEDROOM with PRIVATE BATHROOM and GREAT TRANSPORT CONNECTIONS   Sleep under the stars and wake to the morning sun in this lovely room with a large architectural skylight and windows opening onto the back garden. Your bedroom and bathroom are separate and next to each other, downstairs at the back of the house, so exceptionally quiet and peaceful for such a central location.  The bedroom measures 6 x 2.5m and is light, plain and clean with plenty of storage space.  In the room there is a double bed [with a light memory foam mattress topper], and also a double sofabed.  The room is perfect for one or two people.   For a short stay only a third/fourth/fifth person can share the room, using the sofabed.  Families welcome.  [Depending on your expectations you may find the room small with the sofabed open]. Fresh organic cotton linens and towels provided.  24/7 wifi included. neighborhood_overview: Mornington Crescent is a residential district tucked between Camden, Islington and Westminster.  Although central with very easy travel connections all over town, it maintains a cool local neighbourhood vibe.  The architecture is a mix of modern, 1930s Art Deco, Victorian and Regency terraces, private and social housing.  It is an area of contrasts, an eclectic mix of people and culture.  A short walk brings you to Regents Park, the Camden Markets, Kings Cross St Pancras and new public spaces on the canal at Granary Square, or UCL, UCLH, Bloomsbury and the West End. Camden offers famous (and infamous) live music venues and clubs, markets, shops, alternative theatre, comedy, arts venues, cinema, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, cafes and pubs, canal boat trips; there is a choice of local gyms, yoga studios, sports facilities.  For shopping, in addition to the world famous markets, all the major retail chains are represented on the High Street and there are numerous interesting independe

summary: Spacious double room in beautiful house in quiet, green conservation area/village.  Sharing kitchen, bathroom, living room, conservatory and large patio and  garden with Italo/Anglo family. Close to parks, shops, buses, easy access to central London.
space: A lovely double room on the first floor of a modern, eco friendly town house in the Greenwich Millennium Village. Overlooking a south facing, internal garden, the room is very light. Built with a very high sloping roof ceiling and a high shelf the room is spacious with lots of storage space. Fully furnished with double bed with new orthopaedic mattress, chest of drawers, wardrobe, desk, chair and mirror.  Price includes wi-fi, use of telephone (for national and european numbers, excluding mobiles). Use of two bathrooms, a large, open plan kitchen, dining and living on the ground floor and private patio. The home owner lives in the house with her two children (aged 14 and 18) and the family dog who lives on the ground floor. If we are away we ask guests to help look after the dog. We are a bilingual family, Italo/English and live a more mediterranean lifestyle than an English one. We are friendly, love meeting new people from all over the world but respect people's privacy. neighborhood_overview: We are 3 minutes from the river Thames and you can walk or cycle into Greenwich town centre along the river or down stream to the famous Thames Barrier. We have an ecology park with lots of lovely birds including Canada geese. So the place is quiet apart from bird song in the spring and summer.  We have shops and restaurants and an IMAX cinema a few minutes walk away. The village is very safe with CCTV camera's so one can come and go all night.
transit: We are on 6 bus routes so its very easy to get anywhere and 10 minutes walk from North Greenwich tube station from where its 10 minutes to London Bridge. and its easy to get into the countryside  down the A2, an hour from Dover.

space: A very comfortable apartment room with double bed, seating area, en suite shower room and private kitchen. Situated on the ground floor of a double fronted Victorian House. Free WiFi is available along with with Freeview TV. We are a family with 2 children and a very friendly West Highland Terrier dog called Jasper, that loves people. You are highly likely to meet him in the garden. The apartment is self contained and situated at the rear of the house with its own entrance, making it very peaceful and quiet. You will have access to the large garden with your own seating / dining area to use when the weather is nice. There is also free on street parking available should you require it. We are usually available to help with any questions or problems you might have during your stay and would love to have a cup of tea with you when you arrive, and tell you all about the local area and how best to get around London. neighborhood_overview: Fantastic area with great cafes, bars and restaurants. Wonderful green spaces including the Rookery gardens and Streatham Common open public park area only 8 minutes away.  Streatham ice skating and leisure centre is a recently opened facility also only a 10 minute walk. There are many large supermarkets within walking distance, including Sainsbury's and Tesco Extra selling everything you will ever need.
notes: - Ground floor access, no stairs. - Your own front door, so come and go as you please. - Laundry available on request (if we are available) at a cost of £5 per load. We are more than happy to loan an iron and ironing board if needed. If we are not around there is a launderette 10 minutes walk from the house that can also provide service washes, so you don't need to hand around and miss any valuable sightseeing time.
transit: Easy access to central London and other parts of the city. Streatham Common Station and Streatham Station are very close and there are buses that can also take you into London. Regular buses to Brixton underground.

summary: Single room with a balcony in CENTRAL London (Zone 1). Excellent location, close to all public transport routes, shops, restaurants, etc. Safe, peaceful neighbourhood. Please read the full description.
space: DESCRIPTION: This is a single room in a flatshare in Westminster, CENTRAL London (Zone 1). The flat is located in a very strategic area (Paddington, Lancaster Gate, Bayswater, Hyde Park, Queensway, Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park), on a safe street surrounded by hotels and near to all public transport routes (even Heathrow Express). Unlimited wireless internet (fibre optic broadband).  Balcony. Suitable for a tenant (flat-mate) who needs to live/sleep in a safe/peaceful area in central London. Note: it’s not a big flat, and there’s no living room, but the location and neighbourhood are why we love staying here. BULLET POINTS: - Superb central London location. - Situated on a safe street and among hotels, with convenience stores, restaurants, cafes nearby, also Sainsbury's in Paddington and Tesco in Queensway (there's an Odeon Cinema in Whiteley's, Queensway). - Flat is on the First Floor, with a very high ceiling (breathing space). - There's a lift/elevator to carry heavy luggage/items f

name: Cute Double Room,Shoreditch, London
space: The perfect place to experience cool East London. Cute and airy, set in a Georgian Terrace, the room has a double bed designed and built on a platform. The room is bright and has wardrobe and cupboard space.  From here you can walk to all the great sites in Hackney, the coolest part of London - Brick Lane restaurants, flower market on Columbia Road, the clubs in Shoreditch and the new Olympics Park! If you want to get to know the most vibrant part of this great city, this is the place for a perfect stay. Suits people who are into the sites and scenes of the city. I've lived here for 8 years, know all the places to go and can give you all the tips you need for the best London experience. Near to buses and tubes. On street parking also. Perfect for single person or couple looking for a short stay in London's most vibrant Zone 1 area with great transport links to the rest of the city.  If you have any questions please send me a message and I will happily get back to you as as I can.

house_rules: House rules. Leave the flat clean and tidy as you find it. If you want to pay additional for a cleaner so you don't have to do it, I can arrange that. I will cost £40. Otherwise, I expect you to leave it clean, dishes washed, beds stripped. And respect the neighbours. The flat is in a terrace so there are neighbours above and below and to the side. No noise after 11pm and no parties in the flat. Deposit required for breakages and damages.

name: Edwardian house sleeps 8
summary: Edwardian house in a quiet cul-de-sac in Islington (N1). Ideally situated between  the famous Angel and Upper St., and trendy Dalston and Shoreditch, all within a 10-20 min walk. Transport options are extensive in most directions. The house is very much a family house but is child free 50%. There are 2 double bedrooms, 1 twin with ensuite shower, 1 single and a sofa bed in the living room. The bathroom and kitchen are new. Generally I will be staying in the house unless requested no to be!
space: OUR HOME A sunny 4 bedroom house with original period features (floorboards, window shutters, coving) with high ceilings and large sash windows. Large rear garden, private, but separate from the building, it's 10 meters back from the house. It is very central for anything you might want to do in London, but the house itself is in a quiet residential area with Victorian and Georgian streets and is close to two parks (Rosemary gardens  and Shoreditch park). It is 100m from the Regents Canal along which you can walk to the Angel and Kings Cross in one direction and Dalston the other. There are some excellent gastro pubs within a few minutes walk (Rosemary Branch, De Beauvoir Arms, Scolts Head, The Lord Clyde, The Marquis), and Upper Street, famous for its fashionable shops, pubs, restaurants and theatres, is just 10 minutes walk away. If you are working in the city, then you can be there in 15 minutes.  THE LOCATION Its very safe and very central. Its easy to get anywhere from here with l

It is 100m from the Regents Canal along which
neighborhood_overview: Islington is a trendy "villagey" part of London, a place where Old London meets New London.  You will find fish and chip shops that have been around for generations, next to sophisticated designer cocktail bars; antique markets next to designer boutiques.  The main street, known as Upper Street, is lined with lovely coffee shops, designer shops and antique shops (and of course estate agents!) and  English pubs to sample a pint of traditional ale or classic cocktail. We are also in walking distance to Hoxton and Shoreditch, which is well known for its amazing nightlife. The area is fashionable and has lots of restaurants, cool bars and on trend shops. There are two local supermarkets open until at least 11pm. Other attractions nearby include: Camden Antiques Passage Eclectic Spitalfields market Columbia Road Flower Market Broadway market - great street food Petticoat Lane - famous for clothing Brick Lane - vintage anything and the best curries in London Camden market - Goth, punk and ro
transit: There are numerous bus routes from near (5 minutes or less) the house, both to the West End (central London) and the City (financial quarter). There are two nearby underground stations, Angel (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington(Victoria Line and London Overground). These are 10 minutes away by foot or by foot/bus. The London Overground service also runs from stations nearby and goes East (to shopping mecca Stratford), West (all the way to beautiful Richmond upon Thames) and South (to the less beautiful Croydon).
access: I would expect guests to stay in the shared areas: kitchen, bathroom, living room and their bedrooms. Generally I will remain in the single room when the house is let.
house_rules: No vaping in the property Please do not store food in your bedrooms. Smoking is of course allowed outside in the front yard.

name: Airy 3 bed flat, central location!
summary: Perfect base for exploring London, light bright and airy flat.  Ideally suited to a young family but the space is flexible.  Stoke Newington is a fantastic area to explore with parks, cafes, bars and independent shops galore. You won't want to leave!
space: Modern, clean and cosy maisonette in a quiet estate, set off a residential street so there is very little noise to disturb you. This flat is ideal for a young family.  There are three rooms, one with double bed, one with a cot and one with a toddler bed.  We have a single airbed, fold out single Z bed and a double airbed which you are welcome to use. Clean bedlinen and towels are provided. You're welcome to help yourself to tea and coffee.  Use of the washing machine is available. There is free wifi available.   There is a terrace available for outdoor breakfast in the summer! Parking is not available but public transport is good. Please note, there is a short flight of stairs to access the building.

There is a terrace available for outdoor breakfast in the summer! Parking is not available but public transport is good. Please note, there is a short flight of stairs to access the building. Guests will have the whole flat to them
neighborhood_overview: We're based in the heart of Stoke Newington which is a trendy, vibrant area. Great public transport, and very easy to reach most parts of London.  There are a huge number of places to eat and drink in Stoke Newington, with clubs to keep you entertained to the early hours. It's a short walk or busride to Dalston and on to Shoreditch. We have the magical Abney Park cemetery close by, where the founder of the Salvation Army is buried and where Amy Winehouse recorded her Back to Black video.  Clissold Park is nearby with its kid's park, deer, skate park and toddlers paddling pool.  Stoke Newington Church Street is full of lovely independent shops and restaurants. Islington, Camden and Stratford (Olympic site) are all easily accessible from here.
notes: You'll be living with our two cats, so cat friendly people only please!
transit: We're two minutes walk from well connected busstops and ten minutes from overground stations which links up to the underground.
access: Guests will have the whole flat to themselves, all of our things will be in it, you're welcome to use toys, books, kitchen implements etc
house_rules: We respect our neighbours and expect our guests to be quiet in the evenings, particularly on the roof terrace.  No smoking in the house and no pets please.

name: Homestay with cosmopolitan family & small dog 2TW)
summary: Our place is close to Forest Hill Station, travel zone 3, which takes you to London Bridge  in approx. 13 minutes . You will love this place because of the homely, clean, pleasant rooms and comfortable beds. Both rooms have a TV, Wi-Fi, fridge, kettle and small towels. There is no kitchen use included. We are a non smoking house and do not wear 'street shoes' in the house. We are a great stay for small groups, families (with kids) and furry friends (pets).
space: Your two rooms are on the ground floor of our house, next to each other. You will have your own toilet downstairs. The bathroom is on the first floor and shared with us. One room has an extra bed, so could accommodate total of 5 guest, extra bed will be charged on arrival.

summary: Chilled out, cosy and friendly London pad for one FEMALE guest. Converted Victorian terrace gives a real London feel and with all mod cons. Great cafes, restaurants, shops and excellent transport links from Finsbury Park station, all just five minutes away. **Please read 'Other Things to Note' below to ensure it is a good fit for you.
space: Pleasant, good size, light and airy double room perfect to retire to after a day at work, study or being out and about sightseeing. Oxford Circus is a tube ride away! The apartment is on split-levels with the two bedrooms on the top floor; and the kitchen, bathroom and living room on the second floor. I love art so there are prints, posters and paintings around the place. There is access to a desk space (please ask).

neighborhood_overview: We have great, urban-village-like local amenities. There are excellent cafes, restaurants, pubs and a theatre in the nearby vicinity. A supermarket, independent greengrocers and two health food shops for food shopping and also hair salons, barbers and the long standing New Beacon Bookshop all located along Stroud Green Road. Camden Town, Regents Park, Alexandra Palace, Primrose Hill, Hampstead Heath and Angel Islington with the Sunday Farmer's Market are all 20 minutes away by bus, half that by taxi. Please click on the Guidebook link to get started.
notes: ~ Please note: this is an authentic airbnb experience. The house you will potentially be staying in is my home, which I have owned and where I have lived since 2004. Guests are expected to behave as if they are staying at a friend's. There are two other flats in the building which are my neighbours' homes. I expect my guests to respect this is a residential area. It is not a hotel or public space. If you are expecting hotel facilities, services or procedures, my place is probably not for you. ~ Your airbnb profile PHOTO and BIO (see my profile for reference) is appreciated. I cannot guarantee to confirm your booking otherwise. ~ Has your airbnb booking been confirmed? Please check before you board your flight!
transit: The flat is located less than 10 minutes from Finsbury Park tube and train station - 15 mins to Oxford Circus, 10 mins from Kings Cross St Pancras on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines; bus terminal for Crouch End, Archway and Primrose Hill; also the London Overground from Highbury. Excellent transport links for getting around London (personally, I love it)!
access: Cosy and spacious living room unless in use by the host, hygienic bathroom, the kitchen for LIGHT cooking (inc. microwave), also use of the washer and dryer. Then of course your main area, the bedroom pictured, with the (memory foam mattress, i.e. very comfy) double bed. A good night's sleep is important after sightseeing in Piccadilly Circus or Trafalgar Square.

name: Small well placed room in Docklands
summary: The cosy bed is a small double In a box room overlooking the garden  but there is plenty of space  for the single traveler based in a  residential area. You'll have use of the shared bathroom & kitchen with space to put  food in the fridge.
space: Hi, I'm able to offer you a single room in a 1980's built, end of terrace house located in a strictly  residential area with a few local shops nearby. You would stay  preferably for 2  nights or longer depending on your plans but I am flexible and understand that some guests just need to stay for only 1 night, so that is quite acceptable.   If you book on the same day that you would like to stay, please give me at least 6 hours notice and if you book in the morning, I might be out and you will have to wait until I get in, which is usually about 4pm so I will need time to prepare the room as well. We are tucked away just behind the main road and I am quite happy to come out to meet you, as our turning can be missed if you are using an APP.. There is one shared  bathroom with  shower/bathtub  and another separate washroom downstairs at the front of the house.  The room is upstairs, small  and simply furnished and has  TV & WIFI and ample space under the bed for luggage/suitcases.  There

neighborhood_overview: This area is family orientated with primary and secondary schools just minutes away and  a small park  with open spaces and trees.  The local council have improved the landscaping around the area and we are included in the Greenway walking/cycling map for getting about in and around London. If you are here for a few days and are sporty,  we have a large field with a 'Green Gym with running track which is free to use just outside our front door.  There are 2 supermarkets ASDA and Lidl  just 10 minutes walk away and a 24 hour Tesco's which is a bit further away but you can walk to it during the day but I would recommend the bus if you were to go late evening it is in  a shopping complex where there are also High Street fashion stores and a Costa coffee shop. Locally near to Cyprus station we have 2 small general stores, somewhere to buy Fish & Chips or Kebabs and a  pharmacy.  We are opposite - across the water from the London City Airport and you can see the planes landing and taking of
notes: We live in a parking controlled area so although you can bring your car you will have to pay for the permits which I can provide.
transit: I love having the DLR network on the doorstep, it makes it so easy to get out and about this great city. The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and Westfield in Stratford, 02 in North Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Greenwich are easily accessed from here via the DLR and the Jubilee Line which will also take you into the West End in 25 minutes . We live in what was the main  Olympic borough so you will find that the public transport has been greatly improved and it is easy to use.  There are plenty of  places of interest nearby and National Rail stations are not far away making it simple to go further afield.  It takes between 30 and 40 minutes to reach  central London  in Zone 1 from Beckton which is in zone 3. The local buses are pretty good as well and we have a night bus that stops just down the road and comes in from central London.  From Stratford you can travel on the High Speed  trains outside of London to the Kent countryside including Canterbury and the seaside town of  Margate or Nati
access: Bathroom & Kitchen 24 hours. The garden during the day and early evening. You will be given a key to the front door while you are here, which you must return when you leave.
house_rules: No smoking inside my home but you can smoke outside , just remember not to leave cigarette butts lying around or on the ground Vegetarians preferred Please clear up after you've used the bathroom or kitchen, and do not leave towels lying on the bathroom floor or dirty plates, cups, cutlery etc. around for me to clear up after you. I provide bed linen and towels but it is up to you to put them in the washer if you stay longer than 1 week. Finally, please bring your rubbish down to put in the dustbin. .

The room is located in a beautiful newly decorated,sunny, terrace house, very close to central London. There is a lovely Front and Back garden which you are welcome to use. During your stay you are welcome to use the Internet (Wi-Fi),TV (cable),Use of my fully equipped kitchen, Washer and Dryer. Free parking will be provided for the duration of your stay, for those travelling with a car. The bathroom has a Hot Tub perfect for a relaxing bath after a long day of exploring this amazing city. Transport wise, we are well connected with buses and Trains stops nearby (all within walking distance). The Trains are Zone 2 connecting you to central London. 40 minutes from Heat

name: Super small double in stunning home
summary: Please message me before making a reservation.  This is my home where I live and some exchange of information is useful.  Please note that check-in is between 12am and 10pm  unless by prior arrangement.
space: Please message me before making a reservation so we can discuss your stay. This is a really attractive small house in a friendly and "villagey" area. The bedroom has a very comfortable small double bed but it is a 4 footer and not for those who are used to very big doubles.   There is good transport, five minutes from Wandsworth Town station with great connections to both the West End and the City, plus lots of buses. It is also ten minutes from the river bus where you can go both up and down the river, by far the best and most picturesque way to travel in London.  There is free parking between 4.30 pm and 9.30 am after that it is only £7.00 for the whole day.  If you are interested in staying here.  There is also a smaller bedroom than the room advertised (smaller price!) but still with plenty of room, which is very pretty and quiet. Formerly an office it is being re-born as a bedroom again!  It is great to stay for the weekend or longer, so do get in touch if that suits you. It also

neighborhood_overview: Literally five minutes from the station where it is 13 minutes into central London.  Also a lot of buses in different directions.  We are really lucky, this is a lovely "villagey" area but also very close to the centre of town.
transit: A good safe area with excellent transport to and from the centre of town only twelve minutes from our local station.
access: In the summer (or even the spring) you are very welcome to sit in the garden and have a cup of tea or a drink and recover from the whirl of sightseeing and shopping!
house_rules: Smoking is permitted but only in the garden. This is my home and not a hotel, so please treat it with the care and consideration you would your own. You are very welcome to use the wifi, etc but this is not for office use 24/7.  Please be considerate in your use of the bathroom, very lengthy showers mean no hot water for the next person! Some use of the  kitchen is allowed but not massive amounts of cooking.  You are welcome to sit and have a drink in the garden, English weather permitting!  Please be aware that this is a  small house without lots of storage space for very large suitcases and boxes.

name: Beautiful Flat
space: Airy and light flat in the heart of London - close to great bars, restaurants and a 20 minute walk to the British Museum and Tate Modern. It is a 5 minute walk from Russel square, King's Cross, Farringdon and Angel tube stations as well as having excellent buses close by. You really couldn't do better than this flat for location. The flat is ideally positioned for Exmouth Market, Sadlers Wells Theatre and Rosebery Avenue. The City, West End and Islington are all within walking distance. The flat comes with all amenities including 32" flat screen tv and a hard drive with hundreds of movies to watch. Wifi and a laptop comes with the flat -  as well as a great library. There are 3 bedrooms one very large double and one medium sized double. And one small single bedroom with a large single loft bed. This is used as a children's room but the bed can sleep an adult easily. There is a living area with 2 sofas and there is a dining table for 4-6 people. A small but fully functional kitchen and

transit: Spoilt for public transport as we are so close to 5 stations and have  excellent bus services. We walk much of the time as it is so centrally located.

Its is opposite the family bathroom which has a wash basin, toilet, bath with power shower and heated towel rail. As mentioned the block of flats is  very secure (video entry system), very quiet and has indoor bike storage. The flat is in a GREAT LOCATION in the heart of vibrant Hackney!  • The building itself is part of the Hackney Empire complex, which is an iconic London theatre which was recently restored to it’s original glor

name: Ensuite double bedroom (Ideal)
summary: This is a two bedroom flat. There is an ensuite bedroom, which is available for guest. The other room has access to a bathroom on the corridor.  There is a shared sitting and dining area and a shared kitchen.
space: This light and airy property is located on the second floor of a three storey apartment. It comes with private parking space and easy access to all major train stations and bus routes. There is access to three train station within 0-5 minutes. Manor Park, Woodgrange Park and East Ham. This is a zone 3 area but Manor Park is zone 4. There is a fully equipped kitchen, where you can cook. There is a sitting/dining room where you can relax and wifi throughout. The neighbours are quiet and reserved. Should you wish to experience London as a Londoner, this is the place to be. It is away from the hussel of the City of London but within easy access of it.    A secure entry system ensures your security.  The nearest shopping centre is Westfield which is a 10 minute train journey. Other Local shops include TESCO and ASDA. It is therefore ideal for long stay whether you are a student or professional working in London.

name: 10 Minute Walk to the Olympics Park
space: This cosy flat is located just 10 minutes from the Olympic park in Stratford and is right next to a huge shopping centre. The flat has a nice double room, good for 2 people with the option of using a sofabed for a third person. There is storage space to put your things. The flat has an open plan living room/kitchen. The kitchen is fully equipped with cooker, microwave etc. The bathroom has a tub and shower. We have a garden which you can use and smoke out there is you wish. We are in an area with many transport links to different parts of London and beyond. The closest station is Maryland, there are also several busses you can take or simply walk to the olympic park. Nearby you will find shops and restaurants to cater for most tastes.  The new westfields shopping centre and Olympic buildings will leave you with lots to do in the local area.   There is free parking if you decided to drive.

name: Sunny loft, Brixton: WiFi & B'fast
space: What's included? - UK Mobile phone and SIM Card for cheaper calls during your stay (Can be topped up using the card provided at many shops) - Two Oyster Cards for cheap London travel (You can easily top them up in newsagents or tube stations) - Breakfast - Clean towels for each guest - WiFi (On up to 60Mbps broadband)  - Hairdryer  - We can do a second bed or a cot for children if necessary. Brixton is the coolest place in London right now and this flat is walking distance from the main attractions and the station, which will have you in Central London in less than 20 mins. We can lend you Oyster cards so that it simpler and cheaper to get around London. The space is a spacious loft bedroom in a recently renovated Victorian terrace in a leafy part of Brixton. There's three skylights with blackout blinds, from which you can (just) see the iconic chimneys Battersea Power Station. We can add an extra single bed if you have a child with you and we're happy to have cots up there if you have

We can add an extra single bed if you have a child with you and we're happy to have cots up there if you have
neighborhood_overview: Nearby there is the lovely Brockwell Park and Brixton now boasts a huge selection of awesome cafe's and restaurants to suit every taste. Let us know what food you like and we'll point you in the right direction. For music lovers there's great gigs at the Brixton Academy, The Electric, Jamm, Hootenannys and DogStar. The Ritzy is a Brixton institution showing a great selection of films both mainstream and arthouse (We got engaged there!).
transit: Brixton Tube (Underground) Station, which is on the Victoria Line, is either a 3 minute bus journey or 10 minute walk from the flat. From there it is 10 minutes to Oxford Circus and central London. You can get from Heathrow in under 1 hour on the Tube by taking the Piccadilly Line and changing at Green Park. From Gatwick you can take the  Gatwick Express or a normal train (Slightly cheaper, a couple more stops) to Victoria Station and then it is about 6 minutes to Brixton on the Tube.
access: The room has a bathroom next door with a showerbath and underfloor heating that is shared with Jack, a wonderful friend who lives with us. We will supply you with bath towels. There is an open plan kitchen and lounge with four gas hobs, two electric ovens and a grill. There is also a dishwasher, a large fridge freezer and a washer/dryer. For breakfast we can arrange pastries and pain au chocolat as well as our selection of cereals, yoghurts and fruits. You can make toast in our lovely bright red toaster and there are a selection of spreads. There is a red kettle, with a large selection of teas. And we also have a stove-top espresso maker and a cafetiere for coffee lovers. In the lounge there is a 55 inch 3D TV with internet and Blu-Ray player. We have wi-fi throughout the house, as well as ethernet connection at the desk in the loft bedroom. There's a selection of board games including Farming and Settlers of Catan. We have a communal computer in the lounge as well as a Wii with Rock B
house_rules: It's a no smoking house. We have a dog called Boudica, Bou for short, who is generally very well behaved.  Please make sure if you use the Oyster cards or SIM card that you don't leave them with a negative balance. We generally take shoes off and leave them in the storage boxes by the front door. Please leave the keys on the kitchen table when you leave and make sure you sign the guest book! Other than that it's just like a home from home!

name: Cosy private double room in vibrant area
summary: I provide accommodation in a cosy and quiet flat just moments from vibrant Green Lanes with its restaurants, Finsbury Park and excellent transport links into town.
space: The accommodation consists of a private double bedroom within a flat shared with me (I live here). It provides a double sofa-bed and is fully furnished offering a welcoming and friendly stay with privacy and comfort.  Guests will have access to the kitchen and the bathroom is shared with me. The flat is in a great location just moments from vibrant Green Lanes, Harringay, and within walking distance to Finsbury Park, Crouch End and not far from Muswell Hill with Alexandra Palace which has the most fantastic view over London. THE ROOM A lovely, clean and spacious double room with a comfortable sofa bed. The room has Freeview TV, Hifi, chest of drawers, a desk with office chair and a built-in wardrobe.  The flat is situated on the very popular Harringay Ladder off Green Lanes in North London. A multicultural area Harringay Green Lanes is a very dynamic and exciting neighbourhood with an impressive selection of shops and restaurant including some of the best Turkish restaurants in the cap

The flat is situated on the very popular Harringay Ladder off Green Lanes in North London. A multicultural area Harringay Gre
neighborhood_overview: I absolutely adore this area with the hussle and bussle on Green Lanes and its lovely turkish restaurants which serve delicious, fresh and cheap food and all the shops, Finsbury Park just a few minutes down the road for a lovely stroll on a sunny day, then Wood Green with its shopping and 2 Cinemas just a few busstops away, and not to forget 'Alexandra Palace' which is one of my favourite places in the whole of London with its view across the whole of the city.
notes: Arrival and departure times have to be negotiated for each booking to suit the guest and also me. I am mostly quite flexible as I work from home quite a bit but not all the time.  When I'm out then check-in generally after 7pm as that's generally when I get back. If I am working from home then earlier check-in is available, so please enquire nearer the time.
transit: It couldn't be easier or better :) there is Piccadilly line which goes all the way through the West End to Heathrow Airport. There are 3 buses: 29 via Camden Town and Leicester Square to Trafalgar Square, 141 to London Bridge and 341 to Waterloo and  there are 2 Overground lines as well (one will take you towards Richmond & Kew Gardens).
access: Guests are welcome to use the kitchen and I allow smoking in the kitchen, even so I have given up now :) but absolutely no smoking or eating in the bedroom!
house_rules: This is my home, so I kindly ask that guests are considerate during their stay respecting my privacy in common areas and treat it as such.  This is a private home and feels & looks like one; it is not a hotel ;)  However, it is an easy going place and you can go in and out any time 24 hours a day... I would expect you to be reasonably quiet at night to avoid disturbing others...  You are allowed to smoke but if you do, please do so only in the kitchen (with the window open please) not the guestroom. No eating in the guestroom please.

name: Sunny self-contained 3-bed/2-bath near market
summary: With huge windows and high ceilings, this is a bright, beautiful and well-appointed apartment at the edge of Portobello’s famous antique and vintage market. It's just 100m from Ladbroke Grove tube station and 15 mins from Holland Park and Kensington Gardens. Architects have recently tranformed the space, so the older reviews are out of date but please read them all - just be aware that the flat is nicer than ever! Long-term stays are fine; if your dates come up unavailable, please just ask.
space: The flat is set over three levels at the top of a large Victorian building. There's no lift, but on the upside, there's a very impressive oak and glass staircase within the flat itself. The place is spacious - around 100 square metres, or 1000+ square feet -  with three double bed rooms (the one in the loft is a small double, but the space is especially cozy) and two tiled bathrooms with underfloor heating. The large reception room has a pine dining table with benches and sixties Pieff chairs, a huge sofa, a window seat, and a comfy chaise longue by the main window.  There's also a sofa bed: it usually lives at one end of the over-size upstairs bathroom, but it can quite easily be moved down into the 15 x 25 foot living room if required. The sash windows of that main room looks out onto lime and plane trees, and it gets light all day from three sides. A new kitchen runs along one wall, with fridge/freezer, microwave, hob, oven, dishwasher and washer-dryer. There's a 42-inch smart TV wi

It's just 100m from Ladbroke Grove tube station and 15 mins from Holland Park and Kensington Gardens. Long-term stays are fine; if your dates come up unavailable, please just ask. The flat is set over three levels at the top of a large Victorian building. The large reception room has a pine dining table with benches and sixties Pieff chairs, a hug
neighborhood_overview: As you probably know already if you're looking at this ad, the flat is in one of London's most vibrant districts. Portobello's legendary weekend market is on your doorstep, and there are more restaurants, bars, delis and coffee shops in the vicinity than you can shake a stick at. Within a quarter of a mile, you can find Danish, Moroccan, French, Lebanese, Iranian, Iraqi, Ethiopian, Swedish, Chinese, Thai, Japanese, Mexican, Jamaican, Indian, Turkish, Palestinian, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese and Malaysian restaurants – as well as plenty of fish 'n' chips or pub grub. Sainsbury & Tesco each have supermarket branches within 50 metres, and there's a 24-hour convenience store next to the tube. The green spaces at Holland Park and Kensington Gardens are a (very pleasant) 15 minute walk away.
notes: The flat occupies the entire top half of a large Victorian house, so there are quite a few steps (three flights, totalling 27 steps to the front door, and then internal stairs between three levels). If you have mobility difficulties, it's not the place for you, but otherwise, the space is well worth the climb!
transit: From the apartment, you can reach almost anywhere in central London within half an hour. The nearest tube station, Ladbroke Grove, is literally around the corner - less than two minutes away - and its Hammersmith and City Line offers an easy link to all of London's transport hubs. It's a direct 3-stop journey to Paddington (and the Heathrow Express), for example; it's eight stops to the Eurostar and Luton Airport connection at Kings Cross/St Pancras International; and it's nine stops from Farringdon, which connects to Gatwick Airport. Alternatively, you're a short (15-minute) walk away from Central Line stations at Holland Park and Notting Hill Gate, which open up another range of transport options. There are five or six buses that stop nearby (including 24-hour nightbuses), and between them they go pretty much anywhere: Oxford Street, the British Museum, the National Gallery, Knightsbridge, the museums of South Kensington, Victoria, Liverpool Street/Brick Lane, and so on. There's also
access: You'll have the run of the entire place.
