name: Cosy and central St Luke's/Barbican single room
summary: Are you working, studying, or exploring London on your own? Looking for somewhere grown-up, comfy, relaxed and central to stay? Great transport links, arts all around you, a street market and a low-key, friendly neighbourhood vibe help make St Luke's feel like home from home. Nothing luxurious, just a great fuss-free base to use and a Londoner (me!) to help you make the most of it all. Any questions, just get in touch.
space: If you're visiting London alone for adventures, work, study or to hook up with friends, this cosy little single room is all you need. It's in a really central flat, in a friendly, scruffy Edwardian red brick apartment block in the Barbican area of the City of London. Right in the middle of the blossoming area of St Luke's/Whitecross St, between Clerkenwell and Shoreditch and within easy reach of the West End and the river, it's ideal for exploring London. And if you're feeling lazy, there's a cinema, theatre, concert hall, street eats, cool coffee houses, great pubs and a dozen restaurants within a five minute walk. My flat is simply, comfortably and a bit quirkily furnished, with old wood floors throughout and rather too many pipes here and there. There are five smallish rooms - double bedroom, single bedroom, kitchen,  sitting room, bathroom with shower - and a long hallway. Windows are double-glazed and there's gas central heating, WiFi, TV, DVD etc.  Your room has an upright piano

Great transport links, arts all around you, a street market and a low-key, friendly neighbourhood vibe help make St Luke's feel like home from home. Nothing luxurious, just a great fuss-free base to use and a Londoner (me!) to help you make the most of it all. Any questions, just get in touch. If you're visiting London alone for adventures, work, study or to hook up with friends, this cosy little single room is all you need. It's in a really central flat, in a friendly, scruffy Edwardian red brick apartment block in the Barbican area of the City of London. Right in the middle of the blossoming area of St Luke's/Whitecross St, between Clerkenwell and Shoreditch and within easy reach of the West End and the river, it's ideal for exploring London. And if you're feeling lazy, there's a cinema, theatre, concert hall, street eats, cool coffee houses, great pubs and
neighborhood_overview: I've lived here for many years - it's a close local community and I can't imagine a better location. Situated between Old St, Clerkenwell, Hoxton and Shoreditch you've got all you need right around you in the most vibrant part of London. And it's a great base to explore from, too. Starting outside, there's a good supermarket and a daily street food market just 50yds away. The Barbican Arts Centre is just two minutes' walk (cinema, theatre, concert hall, art gallery, library, cafes, restaurants),  and lots of other cafés, shops etc. are all around. Brick lane, Spitalfields and Columbia Rd markets are all within walking distance.  For summer relaxing there's a little community park with a tiny but great mobile cafe, and there are the waterside fountains at the Barbican centre. Bunhill Fields, the pretty, shaded burial place of Defoe, Blake and Wesley, is two minutes away.  Strolling through the city reveals Roman remains, hidden churches and countless city secrets (you can join walking t
notes: As noted above, please do remember that this is a walk-up apartment, i.e: there isn't a lift (elevator).  So you need to be fit enough to enjoy the workout... The communal stairs are fairly clean but not modern and are very much due for redecoration. If you have a problem or special request (e.g: an odd check-in time, something that needs booking), just let me know - I'm happy to help out and I'm pretty flexible on most things. Please note though that I don't accept overnight guests. I don't have pets unless you count the squirrels the visit the window boxes.
transit: Public transport is easy and quick from here, and there are many choices.  Barbican, Moorgate and Old St tubes are all within 5 minutes' walk, bringing you into direct contact with four key tube lines.  For day trips out of London, Kings Cross, Liverpool St and Farringdon rail stations are all within two or three tube stops. These also have direct links to three London airports for hassle-free arrival and departure.  Nearby buses (some running all night) provide an alternative to take you direct to the West End, etc., and there are bike hire stations as well.
access: Sitting room, kitchen and bathroom are all free for you to use, and in busy periods when I'm working a lot you may well have the whole place to yourself. Please note that I don't accept overnight guests.
house_rules: - No smokers, please, and no extra guests.  - Help yourself to stored food etc. - no need to replace unless you've used a lot of something. - Similarly, accidents happen, so don't worry - but if you break something please let me know, so I can replace it for my next guest. - In general, arriving early evening and leaving by late morning works well. But if there's a problem with this let me know - I'll do all I can to help. - At the end of your stay, it helps if you: - strip your bed and leave sheets, towels etc. piled up on the bed.  - Take your own rubbish down to the chute or the recycling bin. - Don't forget to leave your keys! (they're expensive to replace).  The main thing is that this is a home - yours as well as mine while you stay - so treat it kindly, smile at my neighbours, and enjoy yourself...

name: Victorian Hospital Converted Flat
summary: 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom (sleeps 6) one of a kind family home in heart of trendy east end. Comes with roof terrace, large open plan living and dining space, unique features and a lot of love put into it!
space: A two/three story family home/flat on the top floor of a converted Victorian hospital. High ceilings, period windows, bespoke wood floors (that my partner's wood flooring family business laid), exposed brick wall (me with a sledgehammer) and even a 19th century sliding barn door lugged from a Blackpool farm!       The Flat: We are a very large 2 bedroom flat.  *The main bedroom is on the upper floor/loft with an exposed original truss, king size bed, and remote control sky lights. The second bathroom is just next door making it feel like an en suite.  *The second bedroom is on the main floor off the open plan living space. There are two entrances to the room - a traditional door off the laundry room and coat closet and a sliding barn door off the living room. space: THE SERVICE THE FLAT I x double bedroom (There is also an extra single put up  bed in lounge if required) My home is spacious, new and has a really cool architectural feel It's full of beautiful Art  by artists and ceramicists living and working in the  the iconic Shoreditch and London City area. name: Richmond/South West London home
space: Two rooms in charming Edwardian house in Richmond (St Margarets), South West London. Richmond provides good access to many of the Olympic Events - Rowing at Eton (30 minutes away), tennis at Wimbledon (30 minutes), Track and Field/Olympic Park (approx 55 minutes away). We have Tivo (Virgin) and there will be a laptop with internet access. Richmond is on the river Thames and has a range of restaurants, shops (generally quite upmarket). There are great places for participant sports nearby, running in Richmond Park, along the Thames, golf nearby and a good public swimming pool. Richmond is home to Jerry Hall and Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt and family were staying in the area last summer! The owner will keep himself to himself but can help out with the odd car ride to places, prepare the odd evening meal. name: double room in Walthamstow north east London
summary: Double Room in Walthamstow  Only 45 minutes from Stansted airport by Stansted express train ( Tottenham Hale stop ).
space: Come and live like a local, shop on the one-mile long street market of Walthamstow and enjoy the East London Asiafropean melting pot. Experience multi-ethnic food, cultures in the Olympic Borough of Waltham Forest.  You will be just minutes from Walthamstow central, Black Horse Road or Tottenham Hale station . The  Olympic Park is easily reachable from here,  you can get there either by car or by the several public transport options which go from here taking just 20/25 minutes. You can also get to central London from Blackhorse Road station (Victoria line) in just 20 minutes.   I am offering a room with a double bed  which can accomodate two people. It is located in the quiet residential area of Higham hill in Walthamstow. The neighborhood  is very quiet, safe and leafy; Epping forest and Walthamstow wetlands are within very easy reach.

name: Spacious holiday apartment in Belsize Park
summary: Beautiful and spacious one bedroom apartment just around the corner from the delightful  Belsize Park village. Ideally located for access to public transport, shops, parks and the Royal Free hospital.  Fits up to five people comfortably.
space: Lovely and comfortable flat located in Belsize Park Village and very close to Hampstead.   As you come in, you will see a large open plan space.  To your right is the bedroom, with a double, queen size bed, prepared fro you with excellent quality linen.   The bed is very comfortable and you can be assured a very good night sleep.   Off the bedroom is a generous walk in wardrobe so you can unpack your clothes and have comfortable access to all your belongings for the duration of your stay, there you will also find a washer dryer so you can easily do all your laundry in the apartment. To your left is the dining area and lounge.  The dining table is large and comfortable, perfect for a romantic dinner for just two or for some friends to come along and share food together.  The lounge area has a cosy leather sofa with cushions and the TV is connected to Virgin media so you can have lots and lots of TV and films to choose from. notes: Belsize Park Studio Apartments are four beautiful and spacious studio apartments located just around the corner from the delightful  Belsize Park village on Belsize Park. name: DYNAMITE views!
summary: Large one bedroom flat on the top floor (3rd) of a quiet building with lots of light, space and security. Centrally located near fashionable Brick Lane/Shoreditch, and 25 minutes from Oxford Circus, the flat offers everything a visitor seeks.
space: A large, furnished, spacious one bedroom flat is available. With wood floors, loads of light and amazing views of the City and Aldgate East, this apartment is a 5 minute walk from fashionable Brick Lane. The building is very secure, the bedroom for rent overlooks a large park, and the price includes wifi.  The fireplace offers a lovely chance for warm cuddles on a chilly evening, and the recently refurbished kitchen is well equipped and large enough to accommodate any sort of food preparation. The home is clean and quiet, so it's perfect for someone who wants a bit of alone time, or for a couple with dream of a romantic stay in buzzy East London.  The flat is two tube stops, or a 25 minute walk, from the 2012 London Olympic Stadium, which was the most amazing athletic event of British history. Buses 8 and 388 will whisk you right into town, and they both stop within minutes of my front door. The D3, to Canary Wharf, is even closer! The best thing about the whole place, other than the f

name: lovely double room in creative house, Dalston
summary: Lovely creative household in Dalston, close to Newington Green, Shoreditch, Angel and Highbury. IMPORTANT: PLEASE MESSAGE ME A BIT ABOUT YOURSELF AND YOUR TRIP BEFORE MAKING A BOOKING REQUEST - THANK YOU SO MUCH!  :-)) I LOVE TO HEAR WHAT YOU ARE UP TO - AND I CAN TELL YOU MORE ABOUT MY PLACE AND IT'S AVAILABILITY!  thanks for taking the time to look!
space: Long and short term Lovely double room with double bed in between Highbury and Dalston.   Five  minutes from Dalston tube with direct link to Stratford.  The area is quite arty and a little edgy but great fun, with lots of transport and a host of things to see and do.  My house is close to a small cluster of shops, and a five minute walk from all the wonderful, quirkiness of Dalston which is brimming full of vintage shops and hip cafes. There a bustling fruit and veg market at Ridley Road. Dalston is close to Shoreditch with it's great shops and flower market. Angel, Islington is a short bus hop away for it's designer style. A no 38 bus which runs all night, goes into the west end and stops one minute from my door. Available is a double bedroom in a house with garden.   I share with another guest, so there will be a total of 3 people living at the house.   I am happy to tell you where all the best places to go are. Wi fi, clean sheets and towel.

A no 38 bus w
neighborhood_overview: I love the cultural diversity of my neighbourhood.  All the characterful independent shops.  We have a  lovely independent cinema The Rio, which has the largest screen in London and has a beautiful interior. .  There's a brilliant car boot on Saturday and Sunday (flea market), fantastic fruit and veg market and slightly further into Hackney an artisan market with lovely homemade goodies and vintage clothes.   There are lots and lots of vintage clothing shops in Dalston, great places to eat and fun places to drink. Sorry, I do not supply breakfast.
transit: Yes, there is a great bus stop practically on the doorstop (no traipsing around for miles catching buses) which goes into the West End and Hackney.  There are good connections all over the place, including two tubes nearby and an overground to zip across London.
access: Access to kitchen, living room with t.v., bathroom and washing machine.
house_rules: Smoking permitted in the garden.   There is a desk in your room for work/study.  Please avoid using the downstairs dining table for study.    Thank you!  Other than that, have fun!

name: Great apartment for Wimbledon!
space: Newly Renovated! Your very own clean and comfortable apartment in an art deco mansion block in West Wimbledon. Located within easy reach of both Raynes Park and Wimbledon Chase overground train stations, there are direct lines to Central London (20 mins), Waterloo (15 mins) and Kings Cross (for St. Pancras International Eurostar links).  There is a bus stop outside, where a regular service will take you to Wimbledon town centre for shopping and local amenities, or even to the glorious Wimbledon Common for an open air stroll. For tennis fans, we are perfectly located for quick and easy access to the All England Lawn Tennis Club, home to the famous Wimbledon Grand Slam tournament every summer! The apartment comprises 1 double bedroom with a double size bed, with all bed linen and towels provided. Kitchen with all utensils & washing machine. Bathroom with electric shower over bath and bidet and large window for natural light. A large living room with 32 inch flat screen tv/dvd/freeview an

name: Self contained studio, West London
summary: Small self contained space at the back of our garden, independent entrance from the back.
space: We have a beautiful small guest house in our garden with it's own entrance from the rear of the house.  Your relaxing, tranquil and green private space has a comfortable double bed. Equipped with all basics: fridge, kettle, tea and coffee. There is no cooking facilities but  you will have continental breakfast provided. You also have your own toilet/shower room complete with towels toiletries and hairdryer. Wi Fi 24/7 Free parking at the front of the house. We are situated in a quiet neighbourhood, around 10 min walk to the local shops.  Gym and indoor swimming  pool: 7 min walk. Note:THIS IS NOT CENTRAL LONDON- but suburbia with excellent link to central London via tube-Central line. Closest Tube station  Northolt is 5 min walk Well travelled family will make you feel at home. We look forward to welcoming you!

name: Lovely room in Clapton, Hackney E5
summary: It would be a pleasure to have you come and stay at what I think is my lovely flat in Clapton, Hackney. Please do get in touch and ask questions if you like what you see or read. Look forward to welcoming you here in London!
space: Hello everybody, I'm Joe, and I've got a small, but cosy and sunny double room to rent in my flat in Clapton, Hackney E5. For the moment I'm just renting out my spare room. I live in the flat alone, so looking to have people to come and stay, either for a day, a few, or a few weeks  - up to a month or so.  The room is available for a single person, or for two. Linen and towels will be provided. Feel free to make use of the Wifi throughout the house, the kitchen, the bathroom, the washing machine, and the sofa and TV in the lounge. Please make yourself at home and don't be shy! I'd like your stay to be as pleasant as possible, and for you to feel able to communicate with me about your needs, particularly if you're moving to London or visiting for the first time. I think my city is great, so I hope you will feel the same too. I'm pretty easy going, but there is zero tolerance for any prejudice or nastiness.  The flat is part of a larger Victorian house, on one of the tree lined Clapton s
description: It would be a pleasure to have you come and stay at what I think is my lovely flat in Clapton, Hackney. Please do get in touch and ask questions if you like what you see or read. Look forward to welcoming you here in London! Hello everybody, I'm Joe, and I've got a small, but cosy and sunny double room to rent in my flat in Clapton, Hackney E5. For the moment I'm just renting out my spare room. I live in the flat alone, so looking to have people to come and stay, either for a day, a few, or a few weeks  - up to a month or so.  The room is available for a single person, or for two. Linen and towels will be provided. Feel free to make use of the Wifi throughout the house, the kitchen, the bathroom, the washing machine, and the sofa and TV in the lounge. Please make yourself at home and don't be shy! I'd like your stay to be as pleasant as possible, and for you to feel able to communicate with me about your needs, particularly if you're moving to London or visiting for the first time. I t
neighborhood_overview: Many things. Clapton is great. I don't want to use the phrase "up and coming" because everyone says that about many areas of London, but there are some great pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants in the local area, and you can travel some short distances to find more, such as in Dalston, Hackney central or Stoke Newington - and slightly further, Shoreditch.  Chatsworth Road, only 10 mins walk away, has a great Sunday market, many stalls, food, antiques and various stuff, and some great places to eat and drink. I'm also very close to the Lea Valley and Walthamstow Marshes, which has some great walks down the river, cycling, or jogging if you need somewhere to run to or around. I even believe you can go horse riding.  Very happy to answer questions about this, and to recommend place to eat or drink.
transit: Clapton overground station is a short walk, and trains will take you to Liverpool Street (which is on the central line) in 12 minutes, and to Walthamstow in the other direction (Victoria line). Hackney Central is a 15 min walk (5mins by bus), trains go to Islington (connects to Victoria line - easy for Oxford Street), Camden, Shepherds Bush in one direction, and Stratford if you want to go shopping at Westfield in the other.  If you want to get the Piccadilly Line, which takes you into central London very easily, there is a bus to Manor House or Finsbury Park (Piccadilly & Victoria line) which takes about 15 mins.  There are great bus links. If you want to go to Dalston, Stoke Newington, Shoreditch, Oxford Street, Soho, Leicester Square, Victoria, Euston, London Bridge, the City, St Pauls, Clerkenwell, Stratford,Walthamstow, Leyton, there are buses that will take you there directly. Times of course vary, as does traffic. To many of these places, the buses are 24hrs, so if you're having
access: WIFI, washing machine, cooking and storage facilities, dishwasher, TV, lounge area, bathroom. Nothing off limits (within the boundaries of common sense, obviously :)) I'd really love you to feel at home here, and feel able to communicate with me about your needs during your stay.
house_rules: I guess this is the common sense part. As long as people know how to live alongside another person with respect and fun, I'm usually happy. If you're having a boyfriend, girlfriend, friend or parent come and stay if you're hear for a longer period, I usually say for 3-4 nights - after that there's an extra charge per night - prices on the listing.  No smoking in the house, purely because it can be more fun to stand outside and see what's going on. Ask away if you've any more questions.

name: LONDON FIELDS 1 BED FLAT WITH VIEW
summary: My homely minimalist flat away from all the hustle and bustle, faces west across green leafy London and the city. In the heart of arty London Fields (E8, Zone 2) with cafés, parks, yoga studios, art cinema, canal walks. Comfortably fits two.
space: Welcoming cosy peaceful one double bedroom high-rise flat available for longer periods when owner is away on extended work trips. The flat is on the 14th floor of an iconic 1960s block at the north end of London Fields in highly desirable E8 (East London).  Ideally suits single professional guest or couple.  Open plan living room and kitchen with views across London west facing. The whole flat is painted white and has a modernist refreshing style. The Sky Palace, as I affectionately call my home, comes into its own in the winter months. Warm and secure with beautiful views across London and walking distance to the heated open air swimming pool, arty cafes, markets, numerous yoga studios etc. etc. Local transport includes overground links at London Fields, Hackney Central and Dalston Junction all in walking distance and regular bus routes into town from Graham Road, Mare Street and Kingsland Road. name: Beautiful Penthouse in Clapham
summary: Modern and cosy one bedroom top floor flat with terrace, 5 minutes walk from Clapham Common
space: Our top floor 1 bedroom apartment is the perfect place to stay in London! The apartment has one bedroom with a double bed and full length mirrors. The apartment has a fully fitted kitchen which is equipped with all mod cons, including oven, toaster, kettle and washing machine. The living room has comfortable sofas, a flat screen TV and patio doors that open onto our gorgeous roof terrace which enjoys beautiful views over London. The apartment is fully equipped with everything you need to live just like you would at home. In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are supermarkets, shops, cafes, restaurants, bars and clubs all within a short walk of the front door! The apartment also has really great transportation links. We are just 2 minutes from Clapham Common underground station, which gives you access to the Northern Line. description: Modern and cosy one bedroom top floor flat with terrace, 5 minutes walk from Clapham Common Our top floor 1 bedroom apartment is the perfect place to stay in London! The apartment has one bedroom with a double bed and full length mirrors. The apartment has a fully fitted kitchen which is equipped with all mod cons, including oven, toaster, kettle and washing machine. The living room has comfortable sofas, a flat screen TV and patio doors that open onto our gorgeous roof terrace which enjoys beautiful views over London. The apartment is fully equipped with everything you need to live just like you would at home. In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are supermarkets, shops, cafes, restaurants, bars and clubs all within a short walk of the front door! The apartment also has really great transportation links. We are just 2 minutes from Clapham Common underground station, which gives you access to the Northern Line. We are also just 12 minutes on the u
access: As the apartment is my home, and I live in it full time, most of my personal belongings (clothes etc) are there and I will try and make space for guest clothes and toiletries etc. The entire living space is for the guests to use but please do not move things around and I think replace what you use and put back things where you found them are just basic manners.
house_rules: The apartment is situated in a quiet residential block, and all residents value the tranquillity, which is rather exclusive in a big city and we'd like to keep it that way, so try to keep music or TV at volume levels, that only you can hear and not everybody else. I have a strict No Party policy and this is closely monitored by all residents in the building too.  There are specific bins for recycling available exclusively for the block, so kindly put recyclable items (glass, plastic, paper etc) into the green bins, and everything else in the other ones. And finally,  if you could leave the place,  the way you found it,  I would really appreciate it since I do live in the flat and coming back from work trips,  I do want to feel like I am returning home,  which I am sure you can all understand.. Thanks a million and have a great stay.

neighborhood_overview: A much-loved park, a popular Sunday market and a quick commute into central London combine to make south London's Herne Hill a popular neighbourhood.   On a sunny Sunday the area is full of couples and families walking their dogs, piling into the pubs for a roast and stocking up on food at the market for the week ahead. As well as the park, Herne Hill boasts an outdoor Olympic sized swimming pool and cycling velodrome.
transit: Herne Hill train station with trains to London Victoria as well as London Blackfriars and Kings Cross St Pancras. Brixton tube station is a 10 minute bus ride away.

name: Spacious two-bedroom flat in London Finsbury Park
summary: This bright, spacious flat occupies two floors of a classical London Victorian terraced house, located in a quiet street, near the excellent shopping opportunities and restaurants of Stroud Green. Only 8 min to Finsbury Park Station.
space: Spacious two-bedroom London flat The flat occupies two floors of a classical London Victorian terraced house, located in a quiet tree-lined street and near the excellent shopping opportunities and restaurants of Stroud Green and Crouch End. It is located only a short walk from the recreations of Finsbury Park and only 8 mins walk from Finsbury Park Underground and Rail Station (for the Victoria and Picadilly lines) - Oxford Street is only 15 min away with the Underground. The flat includes a spacious kitchen with access to a small garden, on its first floor, a dining room, a bright living room (with a sofa bed) and a small toilet. The second floor includes a large bedroom with an en-suite shower, a second bedroom (with a bunk bed) and a large bathroom.

name: HUGE Shoreditch Warehouse 3 DBL BDR
summary: Unless you have reviews from previous stays in Airbnb properties you will not be able to stay here. This 2-floor warehouse is by far the most unique and probably the largest Shoreditch property available on Airbnb. This apartment is on Curtain Road, the epicentre of Shoreditch where all the bars, street art and restaurants are.
space: This Shoreditch warehouse conversion was featured in the New York Times Style Magazine as an Airbnb place to stay. Bedroom split: X3 Double Bedrooms all with a king size bed (sleep 6). X2 Friheten Ikea Double Sofa Beds (Sleep 4). X2 Luxury Double Height Air Beds (Sleep 4). If you don't need the air mattresses they will stay tucked away. I prefer professional and corporate bookings and family get togethers, I don't accept stag groups. This place is perfect for companies looking to house a group of colleagues for their time in Shoreditch as everything will be at their doorstep. Please check my calendar for when my apartment is available. This apartment is purely for sleeping, no events or party requests. OCCUPANCY:  This apartment is a 3 double bedroom 2 floor warehouse perfect for up to 14 people wanting the Shoreditch experience.

neighborhood_overview: You're looking in Shoreditch because it's where everything is happening. The main street where it's all happening is Curtain Road, my warehouse is on Curtain Road. There is every type of cuisine you can imagine from Sushi to Shanghai street food right on your doorstep. The apartment is also in the heart of Shoreditch surrounded by some of the coolest bars and clubs in London. Private Members Club with roof top swimming pool: Shoreditch House is 5 mins walk. Cow Shed where you can get a swedish massage is only 5 mins walk and to keep fit or for a Spa visit Virgin Active Classic Broadgate only 5 mins walk.
transit: Within 2 minutes walk from this extremely secured apartment you will find over 30 restaurants and bars. Although this apartment is in the heart of Shoreditch the location is off the main road and completely peaceful with minimal noise. Just minutes away is the trendy Hoxton Square, Great transport links and the Square Mile/City. Direct link to Soho/West End (door to door in 25 mins).
access: Amazing New York style 2-floor warehouse conversion on Curtain Road in the heart of Shoreditch, London's most vibrant area. This property is spread over two floors, one floor is one huge living area/lounge area, the second floor consists of three bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom and utility room. This apartment has the WOW factor as you walk in, not only for the obvious reasons but the 110 year old floor and red bricks sets this place apart from the others. At night the lighting creates a great feel to this warm apartment. Yes it does have bongos. Additional with this apartment, TV, Broadband Wifi unlimited, clean linen and towels. One huge lounge on one floor to hang out. I've had people stay here for a month at a time to just one night to write a review for the New York Times, whatever your stay requires I'm sure you will enjoy it.
house_rules: No smoking inside the apartment. Please respect my neighbours and keep noise to a minimum after 10pm.

space: Hi Our flat located right in Central London at between Holborn station and Kings Cross station.  As the flat is on the 3Rd floor and fully equipped with lift. I am renting one of the double size bed room, bath room. All area is sharing with us except bedroom.  We only rent the one bed room which can accommodate two people.  The flat is very clean and newly furnished. Little things are provided in the flat, such as London Oyster cards for public transport (electronic cards for you to use and top up),  an international plug adaptor, clean towels, iron etc. Please be aware that you will be sharing the flat with the owner. It is within walking distance of many of London's sights, from the British Library to the British Museum and the West End 10-20 minutes walk away. name: Penthouse, Wraparound Terrace, Parking, Near Tube
summary: If you are looking for a peaceful spot in the city,  a spacious home with great light, views to the east for the dawn and the west for the sunset, an address with doorstep transport links, then my apartment is perfect for you.
space: Situated in a quiet pocket of Stratford, it has one double bedroom and one single room. The master bedroom and open plan living area have sliding doors to a balcony that runs around three sides of the apartment. The flat is seventy square metres of space and will comfortably accommodate three people. For shopping, cinema and modern restaurants offering the world's cuisine try the Westfield centre, or for a traditional local English Pub-The King Edward VII on Stratford High Street is very welcoming. What makes my place special: the peace and quiet in the heart of the city, easy links to the rest of London and beyond. There is secure parking, internet access, Freeview TV, washing machine, a hairdryer, a sound system which includes a turntable with USB input, a microwave, views of the Olympic Park and Canary Wharf.
description: If you are looking for a peaceful spot in the city,  a spacious home with great light, views to the east for the dawn and the west for the sunset, an address with doorstep transport links, then my apartment is perfect for you. neighborhood_overview: Stratford has a cosmopolitan neighbourhood. It's an area of regeneration, the most striking features being the Olympic Park and the Westfield Shopping complex. If you like something a bit underground check out the old warehouses around Hackney Wick-twenty minutes walk away from the apartment-where London's future artists and some already famous ones work and exhibit. A great pizza, DJs, as well as a lovely Sunday afternoon vibe can be found by the canal at The Crate in Hackney Wick.
notes: There is a concierge on weekdays who is available until 4 p.m every working day.
transit: The apartment is very convenient for buses, DLR, Underground and trains. Links to anywhere in London are a five-minute walk away from Stratford High Street station. You can get to the centre of London in twenty minutes on the Central Line. Stratford High Street station is on a direct line to City Airport and perfect for the ExCel Centre. Stratford is probably the most connected hub in London and you can easily reach all of London's hot spots from it, or even take a day trip to the seaside or Paris from Stratford International station. There is secure parking in an underground car park with CCTV cameras. I am happy to give advice on getting to my apartment from any of London's four airports. Tip: On arrival get an oyster card or use your credit card to tap in and out on public transport, so much cheaper than paper tickets or pay using your credit card
access: Guests have access to all parts of the flat, the terrace and secure carpark should parking be required.
house_rules: I expect guests to be respectful of neighbours - no loud music at late hours and adhere to the house rules.

name: Cosy room - 20 min train to London
summary: Small room in family home
space: This is a small room which is suitable for younger people visiting the area. Quiet, friendly, safe, well maintained. Please note carefully before booking that we are not comfortable with guests staying in our family home for extended periods when we are not around during the working week. It is ideal for people using it as a base whilst they go out to work (day time), or whilst sightseeing each day for example. Of course once we get to know you we may well be more relaxed about this.

Berrylands Train Station with trains to Hampton
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, friendly, safe, well maintained.
notes: Towels and bedding provided. Please strip the bed when you leave. The house is alarmed and very easy to operate.  As we all work, it is unlikely that we will be around for you to arrive before 5pm unless on a weekend so please do check first.
transit: Surbiton Town centre 12 min walk. Bus stop 5 mins walk away for buses to Kingston upon Thames. Surbiton Train Station 12 mins walk away, with regular trains to London (fast -18 mins to Waterloo). Berrylands Train Station with trains to Hampton Court (12mins) or London (slow - 30 mins).
access: All the house, garden & facilities, except other bedrooms.
house_rules: The bed is a double but the room is small so only really suitable for one person. When arriving, if it is a week day, we would not usually be home until after 5pm. Checkout by 11am. Please speak to us! We like our guests to be comfortable and relaxed in our home so finding out a bit about each other is important. Please wash your hands after using the bathroom! If we have all gone to bed because we have work the next day, please don't take a shower.

It is a 4-6 minutes walk to Caledonian Road underground station, just one stop to Kings Cross/St. Pancras, where you can catch trains all over the country and to some of London's major airports. Equally, Caledonian Road is on the Piccadilly Line, which is really convenient if you are flying into/out of Heathrow, as
neighborhood_overview: its a great quiet area, there are many supermarkets and independent stores locally, including Turkish, Greek, wholefood, butcher, fish monger.
transit: buses into central London can be caught a 1 minute walk from the listing, the underground (tube) is around 4-6 minutes. it is on the Picadilly line, the same as Heathrow airport, and is just one stop away from Kings Cross International station. a 10 minute tube ride gets you into the very centre of the city.
access: the guest has the whole place to themselves
house_rules: Basic respect to the property and its contents.  Due to some disrespectful guests I now have a no smoking rule.  This is my home. I don't charge for cleaning and I do not take a deposit, as many airbnb listings do. Please leave it clean and tidy.  2 persons maximum. I have a good relationship with my neighbours and I do not want them upset by noise made by guests. please respect the house and neighbourhood.

name: Bright Rooftop Nest In Notting Hill
summary: A pretty, modern flat for 1-3 guests nestled among the rooftops on Chepstow Road,  a perfect London location. There is easy acces to all of central London and a five minute walk from the world famous bustling 'Portobello Road'.
space: This is a stunning, modern flat for 1-3 guests - ideally a couple or a couple and one more. It is nestled among the rooftops on Chepstow Road, a perfect London location. There is easy access to all of central London plus it’s a five-minute walk from the world famous bustling 'Portobello Road' (scene of Notting Hill movie) with its market, restaurants and shops.  The flat is for your exclusive use. You will not be sharing. If you are interested in this flat please read on as I have answered all the questions prospective guests have asked me in the last two years in the following description! Thanks!  The living room and the bedroom/study areas are radiant with light. The living room has a comfortable white leather designer sofa and seat, an antique table, a TV and DVD payer and a built in cabin bed (70x184) - this is the second bed. A roof hatch lets in the light from above and the large windows from the side. The bedroom has a standard double bed (135 x195) with under bed storage, a ch

neighborhood_overview: I love everything about the neighborhood. Great places to eat & shop and lots of things to do - even a great spa, ice-skating, cinemas within easy walking distance.
notes: Even though the neighborhood is busy and fun - the flat is a light, bright, peaceful oasis which is great for working or relaxing. If there is no other guests checking in or out on your arrival or departure day then the times can be flexible. If there are guests leaving or departing on your arrival or departure day then the check in will be at or after 1600 and the check out will be at or before 10am. These are standard times. With the agreement of my housekeeer or other guests it is sometimes possible to leave your luggage for a few hours duing the 'overlap' time when beds are being changed. Please discuss details with me.
transit: Public transport links are excellent.
access: Guests have access to the entire flat.  I try to fit in with the arrival and departure arrangements of my guests unless there is overlap with other guests in which case the standard check in times apply. This is 1600 for check in and 10am for check out. There is a left luggage service at Paddington Station which is 5 minutes in a taxi.
house_rules: If you have children, the flat is best suited to children over the age of 6/7 as the cabin bed is high and there is no protection at the top of the internal stairs. The owners of the flats below mine are permanent residents. We know each other well and we respect each others' need for privacy and quiet. We ensure that noise  (Music, TV and conversation) is kept to a minimum after 23:00. My housekeeper cleans the flat most Wednesday afternoons between 13:00 and 16:00. Her responsibility is to do a maintenance clean and not to wash up or clean up after guests. I expect guests to leave the flat in the same condition that they found it when they arrived with the exception of the set(s) of sheets and towels and the kitchen T towels that you use immediately before your departure. Before you depart, please strip your sheets from the bed(s) and fold the sheets and put the towels into the large grey pop up bag you will find in the bedroom cupboard. Long stay over 3 months can be arranged, suits someone on long holiday or short course/work assignment in London. House is max 10 mins walk to Overground station & another 2 mins walk to gym, swimming pools, supermarket etc.

Washing Machine, dishwasher, gas hobs, electric oven, microwave oven. All crockery, cutlery etc supplied. A nice clean comfortable self-catering accommodation. 10 minutes walks to Forest Hill Station for London Bridge, Victoria. London Overground Zone 3. Bus routes - (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and N171 and many more from Forest Hill Station eg 176, 68 etc. Clean towels and bed linens provided. Complementary tea/coffee, condiments, laundry powder provided. You get your own key to bedroom. neighborhood_overview: An overlooked affordable area in South East London, quiet residential area. shops etc within 10 mins walk. Parks and Horniman Museum within 15 mins walk the garden at Horniman Museum is gorgeous Dulwich College and Dulwich Horse Riding School are short bus ride away, you can buy free range eggs, potatoes at the riding school Forest Hill Swimming pools 15 mins walk away
notes: The house is suburbia London so there might be spider/flies and they might get into house/room via open windows/doors. Please don't slam doors when you come home very late at night :) other guests are sleeping :)
transit: Buses near house - 185, 122 and 171 night bus N171 other buses from Forest Hill Station eg 176 (24 hours service), 197 London Overground or rail to central London takes about 40 minutes in total from house. TFL website for travel info. Easybus is cheap for coach transport to and from airports. From Gatwick airport you can use Southern Rail to get to Forest Hill Station 1 change at East Croydon usually on same platform, about 45 Mins. From Stansted Airport you can get to Whitechapel  by coach and change for London Overground to Forest Hill Station or Stratford and change for Jubilee line then change for Overground at Canada Water for Forest Hill. All other airports you would need to get to central London eg Victoria or London Bridge and change for rail or Overground to get to Forest Hill Station A 7 days Bus Pass cost £21.20, monthly pass £81.50 A 7 days Travel Card for Zone 1-3 costs £41.20, monthly travel card £158.30 this allows you to use all modes of public transports in zone 1 to
access: you'll share the Kitchen/dining, TV room, bathrooms, toilets with other guests You'll get a cupboard for groceries storage and share a large fridge with 1 other guest. Freezer space is shared but some fridges have its own small freezer compartment. Plastic food containers are provide for pack lunch for work etc but please reuse them, put them in dishwasher to wash. Water (cold/hot) supply throughout the house comes directly from the mains so its drinkable from any tap.
house_rules: Quiet hours mid night till 6.30 am If you want to cancel booking after checked in you may not get refund.

name: Three Bedroom Sunny, Airy Penthouse in Hampstead!
summary: Shabby chic Hampstead apartment! Parking available right in front of the house for an extra £20/day. Set in the famously safe and quiet historic neighbourhood between trendy Hampstead High St and the natural tranquility of Hampstead Heath. Village feel while only being 15-20 mins to central London.  Plus great transport links to stadiums in London for those visiting for sport or music.
space: This top-floor, fully furnished, equipped and connected for short-term let is perfect located in London Zone 2 between Hampstead Heath and Hampstead High Street, both 6 minutes. Public transport: (a) tube Hampstead, 6 minutes away; (b) Overland to Stratford /Richmond, 9 minutes away.  Overall 60 m2 with plenty of light. Master bedroom is spacious 18 m2  with two windows, chest of drawers, built in closet, sofa, desk with printer and double doors opening on to the sizeable living room which is open and airy 13 m2 with 38" TV on wall. Second bedroom is a small but very bright 7 m2 functional bedroom with 140cm Double Bed.  Third small bedroom features a platform raised bed over locked storage. The apartment would be ideally suitable for 4-6 people, we have two sofas making total guests potentially 7. We also have a spare single mattress kept behind the daybed which could go on the living room floor if you really wanted to stretch to more!  New handmade hardwood windows and flooring throu

neighborhood_overview: The best of quaint England and lively city life comes together in Hampstead village, with its boutiques, restaurants and pubs. Take a walk on the Heath, enjoy fast or fine dining, see a movie, or hop on the tube for a 15 min ride to the West End. Hampstead High St has all the feeling of a village further out of London while still being in zone 2 making it very accessible to Central London Oxford St etc for shopping and taxis are consequently relatively cheap to get home. Camden has a good drinking scene while restaurants from Belsize Park and South End Green all the way up to Hampstead High St provide a wealth of dining options. Hampstead is a highly sought after area known for its intellectual, artistic, musical and literary associations. The area has retained most of its village atmosphere and charm and offers its occupants excellent cultural attractions such as Freud Museum, Keats House, Kenwood House featured in the film Notting Hill and also home to many major open-air concerts. H
notes: Parking is available but is an added fee. Contact us for more details.

name: Children's room in central London
space: Children's bedroom which sleeps 3 in beautiful Georgian house with large garden. The room is very large with bunk beds and a single sofa bed.  There are 3 other double bedrooms for rent in this house.  The house is 8 minutes walk away from Oval tube station and has excellent transport connections. You can be in Westminster and Victoria in 15 minutes by bus, central London (Oxford St) is 15 minutes by tube, London Bridge and the City 15 minutes by tube. You will be at the Olympic Park within half an hour. The house has all mod cons, is tastefully decorated throughout and the owner will be there to accommodate you and give any information/advice throughout your stay.  This house is nearly 200 years old and oozes character!

name: 1-Bedroom Penthouse,Central London,Clerkenwell,EC1
summary: Clerkenwell is an excellent area to be based in London. There are many interesting sites to visit a short walk from the property, such as St Paul’s Cathedral and the Barbican Theatre. The district also has many well known restaurants to choose.
space: One bedroom apartments in a new development in Turnmill Street, moments from Farringdon Station. The apartments are interior designed throughout and comprises an attractive hallway, reception room and modern designed kitchens, with views to the City, a double bedroom and shower room. The apartment is quietly situated to the rear of the building.  Located in the centre of Clerkenwell, an area steeped in history which is now home to many leading creative and design businesses. The train and tube hub at Farringdon Station is only a minute’s walk away, providing quick and easy access to all parts of London, just one tube stop to St Pancras International (Eurostar) and a direct train link to Gatwick airport. A variety of restaurants and pubs are also close-by including well known establishments St John, Hix Oyster and Chop House, Moro, Bleeding Heart Yard and original gastro pub The Eagle. On Cowcross Street you will find Italian trattorias, coffee shops and a Marks & Spencer supermarket fo

name: Central Camden, lovely double room
summary: It's a bespoke well designed London Terrace house which is 200 years old but modernised by myself as I am a designer.
space: Classic Georgian town house, contemporary inside, smart home with rear garden in quiet location but on the doorstep to busy Camden Market. Situated on 4 floors, the second bedroom is the one rented out. Fitted kitchen, which guests renting a room can use for making tea coffee, toast, and keep a few things in the fridge. Guests renting the room don't use the kitchen for  cooking meals. Just breakfast, in summer you can use the garden. Bathroom with shower, please follow instructions for the shower.  Please read the house rules thank you. 2 min to Mornington Crescent tube and 5 min to Camden tube stations, buses 2 minutes away.  4 stops away from Eurostar,  close to British Museum, Theatres,  in the neighbourhood: Regents Park and canal, with boat trips, London Zoo,  Jazz Café, Primrose Hill, home to celebrities, British Museum, Theatres, Madam Tussauds.  If renting the room my house will be shared with 2 others, me and my son and one fluffy dog. All lights on dimmers, dinning room next

neighborhood_overview: Camden is central to west end and city. Camden market and the music scene are walking distance 5 minutes and are recognised as the best in uk. The transport system is 24 hour and close by. The main parks, zoo, canal, museums and heath are also close by so if you want the bus stle of the city or the green space or the village of Primrose Hill it's all on the doorstep.
notes: Shoes left in dinning room can be left by fireplace. Heavy bags can be left downstairs to - in order to avoid scuffing the walls on the staircases.  Most windows open - sash windows turn knob first please. All open easily, if stiff please leave. Front dinning room window is on security catches so best not to open as only opens 5cm for air. Velux windows on top floor - turn top bar downwards. Dishwasher by sink. I leave some space in the fridge and let me know if room is required in freezer. There is a garden with outside, table and chairs and swing chair for the summer - please wipe feet when back in the house. Towels and linen supplied, one set, unless lengthy stay. Cleaning fee is the normal for bedding towels and hoovering, guests need to clean kitchen as they use it please. Guests staying about week should clean up after themselves. Things I don't provide: Milk, Fresh coffee, most guests like their own, more than average amount of loo roll,  large groups do need to get their own, l
transit: 2min to all destination  buses, tube and overground, 2 tube stops to Eurostar.
access: To the kitchen and dinning room and of course the shared bathroom. The garden also - too muddy in winter though

name: Lovely room in N1 flat
summary: Great transport links - buses, tube and overground.   The flat is on the 4th floor - Sorry no lift.
space: Lovely room in a flat in the heart of Islington.  Full of character and smack bang in the centre of Angel -  a vibrant and lively place full of interesting bars, cafes and shops.   There is a world renowned theatre and cinema practically on my doorstep.  Angel and Highbury & Islington tubes are both ten mins walk away and there are a huge variety of buses to take you all over London. The flat is located on the fourth floor (sorry no lift).  It is a large double room with a lovely comfy bed. There is a small balcony of the dinning room with a great view. You will be staying with me and a flatmate (who is out a lot). There is wifi but no tv.

You can have breakfast before 11am I am very friendly and there if you need anything but don't really have time to socialise as have a full s
neighborhood_overview: 10 min walk from the busy King's Cross/ St Pancras station, brings you to the Angel. There is  Angel tube station, lots of buses connecting to the rest of London. It gives you a taste of local life here.  Movie theatre ,shopping centre's. Plenty  of bars, restaurants and coffee shops It is always busy. Also there is the interesting Camden Passage, Chapel Street market and  lovely walks on the canal . Lots to enjoy!
notes: Please no showers after 10.pm unless it's a late arrival and no cooking after 9pm. Please keep showers to a minimum time.
transit: Angel Tube  (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington station (Victory Line and Over Ground trains) Lots of buses  going all over London.
access: You can access your room, kitchen and bathroom. However limited access to the dining room as I work from home. You can have breakfast before 11am
house_rules: **Strictly not suitable for anybody who wishes to work or stay home during the day as I work from home.**

name: Loft Style Flat in Victorian Dairy
summary: A spacious and beautiful loft style apartment in Notting Hill's vibrant Portobello area. This space is ideal for a couple who would like extra space, or a couple with one or two children. It also suits a couple traveling with a friend. Bright & modern with wifi and very peaceful
space: NO SMOKING IN THE FLAT PLEASE! If you are a smoker this may not be the flat for you :) This is a top floor modern flat in a recently converted Victorian Dairy 2mins from Portobello Road. Ideal for a couple, or a couple with a friend or a child or two. There is a main bedroom in the eves with a double (comfy) futon bed,  as well as spare double futon next to it (with restricted head height - ideal for a child) this is the main bedroom pictured. There is also a spacious seperate bedroom with a standard sized single bed and a window which looks out on grass, trees & a playground.  The street is very quite as it is not a through road. It's actually really peaceful for central London. Wooden floors & modern appliances/fittings throughout. The flat is light in all weathers. The flat has an open plan living/kitchen/dinning room which boasts large skylight which carries from the living area over the main bedroom. There is one bathroom with a shower and bath combined. Small internal staircase t

neighborhood_overview: Portobello is a vibrant spot of London, we are surrounded by restaurants, bars, great small boutiques and of course the famous market! Lost of gems to be discovered, with great transport links - buses and tubes. But fortunately our street is really peaceful, so a great place to relax at the end of the day
notes: **If your stay is over 7 days, please note that you are required to pay for the cleaning lady once a week, this is a cash payment (£20) made directly to her usually on a Monday**
transit: We have a number of buses: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  as well as Ladbroke Grove underground station (Hammersmith & City and the Circle line)
access: Wifi included, also an amazing smart TV! Washing machine, oven, dishwasher. **We can sometimes provide an earlier/later check-in/out time (depending if there is a booking clash) or at least a baggage drop/leaving, option, just ask!** **Check-ins after 9pm and before 7am are subject to a £35 additional charge** All linen and towels are provided.
house_rules: No smoking & no shoes inside the house as it is extremely noisy for the flat below - also nicer for you as London pavements are not that clean! The Front Door: Please make sure the front gate is always closed behind you. It just needs to be gently pulled and does not require slamming. Please also close both front doors behind you. We recommend that you double lock the internal front door into Flat C when you are out. Please respect other people who share the building. We try not to slam the doors & gate, but especially not after 8pm so as not to disturb the flats next to the entrance! Please also refrain from slamming internal doors as this disturbs our neighbours as well as the whole building! Window locks: The windows have screw in burglar bolts, which allow the windows to open only a few inches. If it’s hot and you want to open the windows fully, just unscrew them. However please make sure that the bolts are in when you leave the house. Please don’t leave skylight windows wide open

name: Lovely Double 10mins frm LDN Bridge, Zone 2
summary: WELCOME to London! We have a lovely house in Zone 2 near Greenwich Park, 3 floors, 2 bathrooms, garden... and 4 minutes to the station.  It is the best location I have found to live in London, and I have lived here for a while :)
space: ROOMS AVAILABLE:  - Double bedroom, as listed here, fully furnished, all ready to live in :) ROOM COST:  Price depends on number of people and length of stay, but the Airbnb system will generally give the accurate price.  It includes bed linens, Wifi, towels, bills, council tax, bathroom, and sharing the kitchen, and the washing machine.  Does NOT include breakfast (or other food), but I can recommend some Cafes down the road :) DOG:  We have a Labradoodle (dog) who loves everyone, and is even SUITABLE FOR PEOPLE WITH ALLERGIES (she doesn't shed). You can enjoy sitting in the Sun in the garden with her, and bring your own pet along if you like. Our current guests have dog allergies and she is fine with Lara and does not need to take any tablets/no symptoms. --------------------------------------------  We've had many many travellers stay with us and they all loved it - hope you'll be the next. I'm confident that you will enjoy it :)

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION:  - Zone 2, quiet cul-de-sac  - privet Parking available for free  - great city access LOCAL SHOPS / FOOD:  - Tesco, Sainsbury's 5 minutes away  - great fresh market 5 (!) minutes away on the high street  - Maggie's Cafe, ALL YOU CAN EAT BREAKFAST for £6 :D  - plenty of restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood
transit: TRANSPORT Links:  Trains are the nicest way to travel in London - you get to see Big Ben, Parliament, etc. all on your way into the city. Southeastern Trains come every 5 minutes, and it is  - 12 minutes to London Bridge  - 12 minutes to Waterloo / Southbank or to Cannon Street / Bank  - 15-18 minutes to Charing Cross / Trafalgar Square / National Gallery or Cannon Street / City / Bank  - 20 minutes to Victoria - Piccadilly Circus & Oxford Street are 30min from our door! DLR (Light Rail) come every 10 minutes:  - 15 minutes DLR to Canary Wharf, 30 min to Bank / Stratford WALKING distance (or bus/DLR) to Greenwich Park. TRANSPORT COST:  We are in Zone 2 - and transport for just Zone 1 and for Zone 1-2 is exactly the same. The train costs just the same or less as the underground (Tube).  I recommend buying an 'Oyster Card' when you get to the airport for travelling in London  - children under 11 can travel for FREE on the DLR and Tube  - Day Travelcard Zone 1-2 (Oyster card will automati
access: We share the kitchen, bathroom, and second toilet.  You are welcome to hang out in the living room and garden when we are at work / not at home, but if we are at home in the evening we may need some privacy.
house_rules: Sorry, but ONLY NON-SMOKERS allowed in the house.  Please try to be as quiet as possible from 10pm to 8am to avoid disturbing neighbours.  Please leave the house and room as clean and tidy as you found it.

name: Kitchener House, Historic grounds
space: Presenting a Luxury Flat in private secure grounds amidst grade II historic architecture at the Woolwich Academy. The Flat contains extensive amenities and is within 5 minutes of the venues at Woolwich (Woolwich) is a district in south London, England, located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich) and 15 minutes from those at Greenwich town centre. Greenwich is notable for its maritime history and for giving its name to the Greenwich Meridian (0° longitude) and Greenwich Mean Time. The town became the site of a royal palace, the Palace of Placentia from the 15th century, and was the birthplace of many in the House of Tudor, including Henry VIII and Elizabeth I. Excellent transport Links with the Tube, Overground, DLR (The Docklands Light Railway is an automated light metro or light rail system opened in 1987 to serve the redeveloped Docklands area of London.[1][2] It covers several areas of London, reaching north to Stratford, south to Lewisham, west to Tower Gateway and Bank in the City

name: Room in Stoke Newington by Church Street and park
summary: Private double bedroom in a flat in fashionable Stoke Newington. Me and my partner Mark live in the flat too. You're welcome to share our living room and kitchen, and we're happy to show you around.  The location is amazing. We're just a couple of minutes walk from Church Street, which is packed with restaurants, bars, and shops. Just around the corner is the beautiful Clissold Park. Manor House underground and Stoke Newington train station are 15 mins walk away.
space: Room available in homely, modern flat. Washing machine, wi-fi, clean kitchen and bathroom. Sharing with owners, professional couple in early 30s. Very desirable location, really close to Church Street, which is a lovely street full of interesting shops, restaurants and nice pubs and close to a good park. Good bus services into central London and walking distance overline and tube services. Hosts very happy to show local area and give guidance about getting around London and where to go.

neighborhood_overview: This is one of London's best locations. Nearby Church Street is bustling with shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants. There is a a lovely park and reservoir really close by too.   Down the road is Dalston, which is a great area for night life. A bus ride a away is Shoreditch or Brick Lane.  We're very happy to tell give you tips on where to go and how to get there.
notes: This is a residential flat so no late parties are allowed. It's a quiet road but as it's in a lively area it's not completely silent.
transit: Very close to buses that go to central London, Angel, Finsbury Park or into Hackney.  There are a few tubes and stations within a 15-20 minute walk. Nearest tube stop is Manor House on the Piccadilly line.

name: Fab Sunny Room in South London
space: Sunnny room in lovely Victorian house, built in 1898 in South London, zone 3,walking distance to Balham underground station, which is on the northern line or even closer is Streatham hill train station, 17 minutes to Victoria , also nearby are Brixton and Clapham, both just a short bus ride away. name: Lovely 1 Bed flat in North London, Zone 2
summary: I live in Stoke Newington which is a lovely area in North London. It has a great village feeling with farmers markets, local boutiques and canals. There are lots of shops, restaurants and pubs nearby. There is a good transport links to central London (20 min by tube). Nearest tube is Manor House on Piccadilly line, zone 2.
space: Please note that I live in the property so the availability can be limited. If you can let me know the dates required as much in advance as possible the more likely it is I can be away but please do not get offended if I say no. The flat is clean and quiet   (not a party house) and it is in a secure gated mews, near charming Stoke Newington Church St where there are lots of shops, restaurants and bars. I'm also very close to a lovely Clissold Park as well as  Springfield Park/Marina.  Excellent bus connections, nearest tube station is Manor House, zone 2, which is 10 - 15 minutes walk away. It takes 20min to the West End/Kings Cross/Victoria.   The flat itself is fairly modern. Its got a good size kitchen with a washing machine and a microwave. A large living room with a big tv & cable channels and an internet connection. The bedroom has got a king size bed. Your stay will include bed linen and towels. I'm advertising this place for 2 people but one person could sleep on a large sofa o

name: Chic Central Flat near South Bank
summary: Right next to London's South Bank, this flat is clean, simple and stylish.
space: A bright and minimal flat in a historic Grade II listed building, only 4 minutes walk from both Waterloo and Southwark stations. The flat is in the middle of an area full of theaters, trendy bars, small restaurants and boutique cafes. It is within easy walking distance of the Southbank with its river walks, the Tate gallery, the Globe theatre, and more restaurants and cafes. Fifteen minutes walk gets you to the famous food market at london Bridge, Borough Market. A short walk across Waterloo Bridge (around 15-20 minutes) takes you into the heart of Covent Garden. The flat has internet, washing machine, bath and shower, and has recently been renovated. There is a TV hooked up to a projector - it's a little fiddly to use but I'll send details as to which remote does what. If you'd like to watch DVDs, you'll need a laptop which you can connect to the projector. It is in a quiet, residential block, and we would ask you to be considerate of our neighbours. name: Quiet room in Clapton
summary: My place has lots of character, a great garden and a peaceful vibe. You wouldn't believe you were in London!
space: My home is an old Victorian house with lots of original features and plenty of character. It’s warm and cosy with splashes of colour and an ever growing house plant collection!  The bedroom is in the basement at the back of the house. It’s super quiet. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen and free to help themselves to tea and coffee.  Clapton has some great cafes and local restaurants and has pretty good transport links to the rest of London.  I have a cat called Sox who probably won’t say hello as she’s a little shy!

name: Charming Southbank Studio SE1
summary: Studio located in a quiet tree-lined street just two minutes walk from the tube and bus. It offers all you need for a short stay in London. Situated in Zone 1 you are ideally located to be able to walk to most of the major tourist sites.
space: ***PLEASE ALSO SEE OTHER LISTING *** -Entrance  The studio is in a Victorian Terrace. A communal hall leads to the studio's private entrance on the first floor.  -Main Room  The room has dark oak floorboards covered in the centre by a colourful Kelim rug to add warmth. The Orbit Double Bed is made up with Hotel linen, plenty of pillows & cushions and comfy feather duvet. For your convenience there are two wall- mounted reading lights and shelf behind for your belongings. There is plenty of open hanging space available as well as a number of drawers and opening shelving. The classic Conran velvet two-seater sofa is at the end of the bed along with a Kartel La Bohème stool that can also be used as a side table. Relax on the couch or the bed and watch the flatscreen HD TV (Freeview channels). The studio also has 50MB wireless broadband – an essential for most travellers these days.  The decor has been collected by us during our many visits to South Africa.  In the kitchen area the Metro t

Situated in Zone 1 you are ideally located to be able to walk to most of the major tourist sites. ***PLEASE ALSO SEE OTHER LISTING *** -Entrance  The studio is in a Victorian Terrace. The classic Conran velvet two-seater sofa is at the end of the bed along with a Kartel La Bohème stool that can also be used as a side table. Relax on the couch or the bed and watch the
neighborhood_overview: If you study a map of London you'll appreciate how central Waterloo is, however it's also so peaceful. The local area is very safe and walking around is a must to truly appreciate it. Within a couple of minutes you'll be in Lower Marsh, site of one of London's oldest continuous street markets and always busy during weekday lunchtimes. At the end of the market stands the Old Vic theatre, one of London's best known theatres now under the artistic direction of Kevin Spacey. Further down the road are the Young Vic rep theatre and a selection of fantastic restaurants and bars.  We are well served by local shops. There are a couple of cash machines (ATMs) within a few minute's walk as well as Post Office, bank, supermarkets, organic grocer, coffee bars and bakeries.  TOURIST SIGHTS  --------------------- Ideally located for all the major sights:  -Imperial War Museum – 4 minutes walking  -Old Vic Theatre – 5 minutes  -Young Vic Theatre - 6 minutes  -BFI London IMAX – 8 minutes  -Southbank ri
notes: TRAVELLING FOR BUSINESS ----------------------------------- The studio can be an attractive alternative to a bland hotel room. Direct tube links to the West End, City and Canary Wharf make the commute very easy. Or both the City and West End can be reached on foot in 20-30 minutes. It's a very picturesque walk.  HEALTH & FITNESS  ----------------------- For the more active guests there is a Soho Gym at Waterloo (5 minutes walk) where you can work out or join a class. Daily and weekly passes are available.  For the runners I can provide you with a number of 3, 5 and 10 kilometre routes through the parks and past central London landmarks. QUESTIONS  --------------- If you require any further information, then please do not hesitate to contact me.
transit: The studio is located in the central transport zone (Zone 1) and there are so many options easily available to you:  - London Underground (Tube)  Lambeth North (Bakerloo Line) - 3 minute walk  Waterloo (Bakerloo, Waterloo & City, Northern & Jubilee Lines) - 6 minute walk  - Network Railway  Waterloo (trains to South West London and the south westerly regions of the UK) - 8 minute walk  - Buses  The studio is also very well placed for buses to almost anywhere. Major bus stops at each end of the street with a total of 15 different routes!  - Barclays Bikes (also known as Boris Bikes)  There are a number of docking stations within a few minute's walk. Closest are the ones 3 minutes away outside Morley College and Lambeth North Tube Station.  - Airports  Travel to and from the airports is relatively simple and I can provide details to you depending on which airport you are arriving from.  -Eurostar  From St Pancras (London terminus) you have the option of bus (no. 59), tube or taxi.
access: The guests have exclusive access to the Studio apartment on the first floor.
house_rules: There is no smoking permited anywhere in the studio. Please, there are no pets are permitted. The studio has only one double bed and is suitable for a maximum of two people only. Whilst there is a sofa it is a small two seater and definately not suitable for sleeping on.

name: Kitchener House!
space: Presenting a Luxury Flat in private secure grounds amidst grade II historic architecture at the Woolwich Academy. The Flat contains extensive amenities and is within 5 minutes of the venues at Woolwich (Woolwich) is a district in south London, England, located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich) and 15 minutes from those at Greenwich town centre. Greenwich is notable for its maritime history and for giving its name to the Greenwich Meridian (0° longitude) and Greenwich Mean Time. The town became the site of a royal palace, the Palace of Placentia from the 15th century, and was the birthplace of many in the House of Tudor, including Henry VIII and Elizabeth I. Excellent transport Links with the Tube, Overground, DLR (The Docklands Light Railway is an automated light metro or light rail system opened in 1987 to serve the redeveloped Docklands area of London.[1][2] It covers several areas of London, reaching north to Stratford, south to Lewisham, west to Tower Gateway and Bank in the City

name: Cool Shoreditch courtyard flat
space: I have a beautiful flat for you to stay in for your visit to London; a new build in an old build!! I am away working a great deal, although love this flat, look after it and do not like it empty.  This Islington flat comprises of a double bedroom, which sleeps two for a couple and a very comfortable Laura Ashley sofa bed in the sitting room which can also sleep two. There is a 2nd single bedroom with two single beds. A travel cot can be provided on request and yes towels, fresh cotton sheets  and duvets are provided! The flat also has parking nearby, internet, Sky HD TV,  a DVD and high quality sound IPod player. This is a quiet flat with a lovely Juliet balcony, which overlooks a pretty courtyard filled with greenery. It lights gently up at night which is magical! There are two lifts to the second floor to the flat. The flat and building has a modern look and is located behind the Bezier building. Please note that the flat is available for any weekends visits, Friday to Monday, also a

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is wonderful with shops, galleries, restaurants  and coffee bars galore.  Just a great place to be ! Simple by bus and underground to get anywhere very easily.
notes: The Sainsburys grocery store below our building is open til midnight each day. All other information is on the itinery on confirmation
transit: There are many car parks nearby and car parking on metres opposite the flat - the one way street is accessible by car from Tabernacle Street.  Easy to get to Liverpool Street Station from Stansted Airport then get a short taxi ride or walk! - Gatwick Airport travel is the  Bedford train to Kings Cross  and then the northern line underground  to Old Street, leaving from  exit 2 from the steps exit towards Leonard Street,  (the ramp exit 2  goes away from Leonard Street) with  the buses stopping opposite Leonard Street.-  -Eurostar is easy as Kings Cross underground is 2 stops by Northern line metro tube to Old Street -Heathrow Airport is express train to Paddington and then get the underground to Moorgate and walk to the flat. It all depends on if you have too many suitcases get a taxi after Paddington as 4 people can be easier and cheaper this way.
access: Guest can help self to food in the fridge,cereals in cupboard  with  teas and coffee, anything else do please replace if low in supplies. There is toilet paper and toiletries, shampoo, shower gel and soap, bath cleaners, cotton buds  etc even medicine, plasters etc  if needed in an emergency.
house_rules: Please take your shoes off in the bedrooms, think of our cream carpet!! Do please  turn off all lights before leaving the flat before you go out as it is good for the environment. Do kindly check the address with me on booking confirmation as sometimes the flat number in the building on the address on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) is inaccurate and so the flat is frustrating therefore to find! For own security please remember to close windows especially the balcony doors when leaving the flat and also lock the front door behind you when entering the flat for your security.  After your stay ends  and before leaving the building, kindly place the keys in the NO 4 post box in the hall of the flats.  In the flat please do make sure the white blinds on the windows  and french doors are used first and then the  green silk curtains afterwards. In the morning push the curtains right back as only white colours are strictly allowed to be seen in the courtyard!!! Kindly water the one plant in pot n

name: Lovely flat in the Brixton/Camberwell area, zone 2
summary: Modern, luminous flat located between Brixton and Camberwell in London, zone 2. The flat has 2 double bedrooms (1 with ensuite bathroom), living room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, single sofa bed and all mod cons.  ** Kindly note the price in the title is for the first 2 people, there's a supplement of £ 5 per person per night for 3rd, 4th and 5th person staying
space: Modern, bright, clean two bedroom flat - with two bathrooms - situated between lively Brixton and Camberwell in zone 2 of South London and very near King's College Hospital. The flat is at second floor and has a large, bright living room; two double bedrooms, one with ensuite facilities (toilet and bath tub) and the other bedroom is located in the mezzanine which overlooks the living room. The second bathroom has shower and toilet. We now have a single sofa bed in the living room, suitable for an adult or child. We're happy to give discounts to children (up to 12 years old normally), please get in touch and we will discuss it. It has all mod cons - microwave, dishwasher, electric oven, washing machine, hairdryer - plus internet and wireless connection, as well as television, DVD player, HI-FI and projector. Please note that as we don't really watch TV we haven't got an arial for it (we've got plenty of DVDs though!) Transport-wise the area is really well served with buses going to Brix

neighborhood_overview: Brixton is a lively area famous for its Afro Caribbean market and has more recently seen a growing number of trendy restaurants and cafes - it boasts the best pizza in London (Franco Manca) according to Time Out. It also hosts the Brixton Academy famous for its concerts and there's a lovely cinema too, the Ritzy. If you fancy staying in the area some evenings, we recommend the Cambria Pub or the Sun Pub, and if you want to have a stroll to Camberwell (10 minutes walk) both the Tiger and the Bear are worth a visit - plus there's a fantastic Chinese restaurant (very unassuming from outside) called Silk Road - spicy and nothing like your usual sort of Chinese food.  The flat is conveniently located to reach Vauhxall, London gay mecca, easily and quickly. Via tube, Vauxhall is just two stops away from Brixton; or by bus from Camberwell it's approximately 15 minutes away - see "directions" for details.  If you also fancy to explore a part of London a bit off the beaten track, just around th
transit: Transport-wise the area is really well served with buses going to Brixton underground station in 10 minutes and there is a train station at walking distance which takes you into the City of London and the fashionable Clerkenwell.  Also, the Overground Line (part of the city underground) has just been extended and it now stops in Denmark Hill Station which is 10 minutes walk (towards Camberwell): it now links Clapham Junction all the way to Hampstead via trendy Shoreditch and Dalston.
access: whole flat

Kindly let us know about your expected time of arrival and departure as soon as available, even with a quick text message (or just write the flight/ train arrival time and at which airport/ station and we'll figure it out) No additional guests than what originally booked, unless agreed differently with us Please respect the neighbours Overnight guests by prior arrangement only Thanks!
