name: Boutique Room w/ Private Bath and Breakfast
summary: Our modern, elegant apartment with city views from the roof terrace is part of a stylish new development on a pedestrianised square in the vibrant and thriving artistic community of Dalston on the borders of Hackney and Islington - there are colourful East London markets, amazing cafes and restaurants, quick connections to all the tourist sights of London, jazz bars and fringe theaters at your doorstep. We have two beautiful, hypoallergenic Siberian cats.
space: Our spacious apartment is on the eighth and ninth floor of this architecturally renowned complex, overlooking a pedestrianised square. The open-plan lounge and kitchen with the attached double-height glazed wintergarden give this apartment a holiday feel. Your bedroom and bathroom are on the lower floor, together with the shared lounge and kitchen, so there is a large degree of privacy for your stay especially at night as we sleep upstairs and have our bathrooms upstairs. Your immaculately clean bathroom has a double shower, large mirrors, and a dresser. The bedroom is filled with unique high-end furniture.... You will be living a boutique airbnb experience, with new pocket sprung mattresses with luxury fillings, Egyptian cotton towels, designer furniture, and gorgeous linens. Breakfasts are informal and delicious!
description: Our modern, elegant apartment with city views from the roof terrace is part of a stylish new development on a pedestrianised square in the vibrant and thriving artistic community of Dalston on the borders of Hackney and Islington - there are colourful East London markets, amazing cafes and restaurants, quick connections to all the tourist sights of London, jazz bars and fringe theaters at your doorstep. We have two beautiful, hypoallergenic Siberian cats. Our spacious apartment is on the eighth and ninth floor of this architecturally renowned complex, overlooking a pedestrianised square. The open-plan lounge and kitchen with the attached double-height glazed wintergarden give this apartment a holiday feel. Your bedroom and bathroom are on the lower floor, together with the shared lounge and kitchen, so there is a large degree of privacy for your stay especially at night as we sleep upstairs and have our bathrooms upstairs. Your immaculately clean bathroom has a double shower, large mir
neighborhood_overview: Dalston's high street is one of the most vibrant, colourful and authentic in London, with absolutely everything from pound shops to pharmacies to upmarket restaurants and cafes, as well as Ridley Road market (one of London's oldest markets) for colourful fruit. Dalston Square is a pedestrianised area moments away from Dalston Junction Station, Cafe Route, the fringe Arcola Theatre, Vortex Jazz Bar, Cafe Oto, Dalston Roof Gardens, Farr's School of Dance, Sainsbury's, the community Eastern Curve garden, Ridley Road Market, and a short walk to Broadway Market. The Square itself has a great cafe (Cafe Route), an upmarket Spanish restaurant (La Ventana), a spa (Smooth You), Dalston library, an excellent vegetarian called Mildred's, and a neighbourhood supermarket (Coop). Our apartment overlooks the square, and is quiet for its central London location, as well as being bright because we are on the higher levels. It truly is a serene, elegant space - very well-connected and practical as well
notes: We have two Siberian cats.
transit: The new Dalston Junction station affords excellent connections to Shoreditch, Hoxton, Canary Wharf, Southwark (for Tate Modern), Waterloo (for South Bank), Oxford Circus, Green Park, Westminster. Buses include the 38 (Angel, Covent Garden, Piccadilly), 56, 30 (King's Cross, Regent's Park, Oxford Circus), 149 (London Bridge), 242, and 76, 243 (straight into the City/Bank/Waterloo). If you take the Dalston Kingsland Overground in the western direction, you can get to Camden (for Camden Market) in around 15 minutes, Hampstead in around 20. Parking is also possible - there is free parking overnight and you can park in the Bentley Road car park for around £7.20 a day. Guests have pay as you go parking (max. 4 hours) in Beechwood Road and Roseberry Place.
house_rules: We don't have any house rules, please just feel at home.

We offer a light and airy double bedroom, within a secure river side development. Our apartment has beautiful views of River Lea and Hackney Marches, is situated between two parks, 30 minutes walk from Olympic main site and 15 minutes walk to the tube station. There are many bars and restaurants in the area. 1. We have a great location, walking distance to Olympic Park and tube station, great transport links with Olympic venues and central London. name: Sunny Central Double Bedroom
space: My location is PERFECT for exploring all of real London while being able to return home to a lovely flat just off Portobello Road. I am 3 minutes walk to the ever-vibrant Portobello market and 20 minutes walk to Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. This is an area of London adored by so many.  My flat is a very relaxing place to be, the view from my living room looks on to apple trees and lovely vibrant flowers from the garden below. My friends who have stayed here have always talked of how well they have slept and how fresh they feel after a great night's sleep. The room measures 108sq ft and has a double bed, chest of drawers and a wardrobe. Clean linen and towels are provided. Be sure to let me know if I can help in anyway. I know the area well and will be able to suggest a variety of things to keep you entertained. I'm positive your stay will be a great experience.

name: The Old Coach House (Olympics)
space: Fabulous, recently refurbished original Victorian Coach House on the edge of Greenwich Park and Blackheath.  It is ideally located for the Equestrian and modern pentathlon events - being only a couple of mins walk to Greenwich Park where they are being hosted. It is also ideally located for North Greenwich Arena (hosting Artistic Gymnastics, Basketball, Trampoline and Wheelchair Basketball), and of course, once you are at that venue, there will be the Emerates Air Line gondola link to the Excel venue (also hosting Olympic events). Also, as a DLR station (Elverson) is right at the bottom of my road and that is the line into Stratford, the house is also very well located for Stratford and the main Olympic Stadium which will host the Athletics and Paralympic Athletics events, as well as the Opening and Closing Ceremonies. Also, as a DLR station (Elverson) is right at the bottom of my road and that is the line into Stratford, the house is also very well located for Stratford and the main Olympic Stadium which will host the Athletics and Paralympic Athletics events, as well as the Opening and Closing Ceremonies. space: A small but modern 1 bedroom flat situated on the raised ground floor of a listed Georgian building and located in the beautiful conservation area of Vassall in Oval, a short 3min walk from the Oval tube station and a 12min walk from the "clubland" of Vauxhall and River Thames. Furthemore, it's a 12min tube and/or bus journey to Piccadilly, Oxford Circus, the West End etc with connections both day and night (24/7).  The flat has recently been renovated to a high standard and comprises of a brand new bathroom (walk-in power shower), a new kitchen, a small bedroom (double bed), wooden floors throughout and window shutters. There is also a sofa-bed in the lounge that turns into a comfortable double bed too. This flat would be ideal for those looking for a centrally located place to stay in London without breaking the bank and with no time restrictions (available anytime for the whole year). Red Lion pub is opposite the Horizon Cafe on Leytonstone High Road.  Quite nice food (bit over-priced in my opinion), but great area out the back with cinema screenings. Open till 11pm -Asian 24 hour supermarket - right opposite the tube station as you come out -Tesco 24 hour supermarket - Gainsborough Road, behind McDonalds which is on Leytonstone High Road. name: Great Apartment by the Thames!
space: Hello! About 15 mins walk to Canary Wharf and another 15 mins walk to Greenwich, a spacious, light and modern apartment on the Thames with river and O2 views from each room.  The flat is in a private development - London Yard. There is a separate fully functioning kitchen, a bedroom, bathroom and a very large living room. We are on the 1st floor in a small block in a private residential development with a beach on the Thames and a small lake. The entrance hall leads to the fully equipped kitchen and the comfortable living room has a L-shape sofa bed and a dining table for 6-8 people. There is a Plasma TV and home cinema with a DVD/Blu Ray player/Ipod dock. The bedroom is comfortable with a double bed and overlooking the Thames. There is also a beach by the river which is accessible via a few steps, great for sitting down and enjoying the water and the crashing waves. There is free parking in the development. Excellent transport links.  City Airport: 10 min by car or easy tube journey.

neighborhood_overview: Broadway Market is renowned throughout London for it's famous Saturday Market, selling everything from organic produce to vintage collectables. It has recently been described by Italian Vogue as "the coolest place in London"! The tranquil Regent's Canal is located at one end of the street; a hidden gem that few tourist’s know, where Londoner's love to stroll.. At the other end is the popular and child-friendly London Fields, with London's only outdoor heated Lido (swimming pool). Your stay on vibrant Broadway Market will allow you to experience a host of award-winning restaurants and cafes right on your doorstep. These include; 'Buen Ayre' – London's Highest Acclaimed Argentinian Steakhouse, 'Bella Vita' – forever-bustling Pizzeria; 'Cat & Mutton' Pub & Bar – Michelin Starred Food; 'La Bouche' – Parisian-style coffee house and Deli
notes: • Do you have free WiFi? Yes we have super fast reliable WiFi ! We will give you the WiFi code when you check-in. • Do you provide linen and towels? Yes all fresh, pressed bed linen and double size towels are provided.  • How many bathrooms are there? There is 1 bathroom. • Are infants able to stay at the property? Yes! In this property, infants are welcome. • Is smoking allowed? Strictly NO smoking in the apartment and/or common parts. If you want to smoke, you must completely leave the building. You will automatically forfeit your deposit if you are found smoking on the premises.  • Is there parking? Unfortunately, there is no private parking for this apartment. • Please note we will check the passport of the person who booked upon arrival. **Please note, the futon in the double bedroom has been removed** Thanks for looking - we hope to welcome you soon! :)
transit: Bethnal Green Station is only 15 minutes walk away and connects you to London via the Central Line. There are also a number of bus routes nearby that can take you to wherever you need to go!
access: The whole property is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.
house_rules: The terrace attached to the apartment is not under my ownership therefore is strictly out of bounds.

name: 3 BED/2 BATHROOM  MANSION FLAT OPP. BATTERSEA PARK
summary: Built in 1894, Albany Mansions is a beautifully kept series of double gabled flats overlooking Battersea Park. There is a porter on site & private gardens to the rear. The flat is 1,000 sq ft & newly refurbished making it warm, quiet & comfortable. In addition, there is free parking from Friday afternoon until Monday morning which is incredibly rare in central London. Otherwise pay and display hours are 9-5 weekdays. Further free parking 24/7 is at the end of the road but it’s not guaranteed
space: A few years ago, the entire flat was stripped back to the bare brick, opened up and redesigned / refurbished! All sash windows, doors and radiators have been replaced so property is warm and very quiet.  The 2 children’s bedrooms (one with very good floor space) are set up for little ones with changing mats etc. They have comfortable toddler beds with toy storage and book shelves (one still being a cot bed) and an adjacent bathroom with a loo, bath and power shower. This Victorian mansion flat comes with a porter and an established garden to the rear. In central London and overlooking Battersea Park / River Thames, it is ideal for combining a convenient and social location with spacious / quiet surroundings....... The master bedroom (king size bed) comes fully furnished with a Tempur cloud mattress and Egyptian cotton linen. There is your own flat-screen TV and built-in DVD and the bedrooms are blissfully quiet due to being situated at the garden end of the property. The area is very s

neighborhood_overview: The area is very safe with great local pubs / restaurants on the door-step. The Prince Albert pub, The Butcher & Grill, Source (the new celeb hang-out) and Gordon Ramsay's recently refurbished restaurant to name but a few......not to mention Chelsea's fashionable Kings Road!
notes: With beautiful Battersea Park opposite it is an ideal place to stay with little ones as there is an adventure playground a few minutes walk away not to mention a crazy golf course and 'Go Ape' in the trees above . There is use of a double buggy if requested and garden toys outside.  Equally, it is also a great place to stay as a couple with romantic river walks and the famous Pear Tree Cafe situated on the east side of the park for lovely long lunches by the lake. There is a shaded table with chairs and a bench outside the master bedroom if somewhere more private to dine is preferred..........
transit: South Kensington / Sloane Sq tube stations are a short walk or bus ride. The UK's busiest hub, Clapham Junction, is close by as well as the mainline stations of Victoria (170 bus) and Battersea Park / Queenstown Road. Alternatively, Cadogan Pier is a 2 minute walk away and a hover-boat will take you down the River Thames, in either direction - a very relaxing way to travel!
house_rules: Staying guests: please bring official ID with you on arrival. To be respectful of the property and contents. Check in / out times are  broadly flexible but must tie in with working hours during the week. Strictly no extra guests or 'house parties' allowed.

name: Lovely apartment sleeps 2 to 4
summary: Sleeps 4. A perfect place to stay with your family when visiting London with easy access to central London.  Modern clean affordable and spacious self catering apartment.  Very close to London City airport and London Stansted is not too far away.
space: A self contained apartment on the first floor of fairly large modernised Victorian house, clean, comfortable and airy with numerous facilities making it perfect for single (women especially welcome) travellers, couples or a family - whether on business or a holiday. Spacious bedrooms, a large family bathroom for guests' exclusive use, free WiFi, a lounge with a snooker table, large plasma TV with all Sky channels and recording facility and a huge terrace/patio, overlooking a beautiful garden. I welcome professionals who are in London for a short period and are looking for a comfortable home. It's very convenient for professionals working in the City in the banking sector, IT consultants and Doctors, especially working at Whipps Cross teaching hospital which is very close to the apartment. Maximum stay would be for 90 days. The apartment can be shared with friends and or colleagues. Its also ideal for Monday to Friday stay. There are 2 spacious double rooms and one single: 1 with a doub

neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is leafy and safe. We are very central so access to public transport is easy. We are only 30 minutes from Central London. We are also very close to Westfield centre which has the largest shopping mall in Europe so shopaholics can have fun. Wanstead has many cafes, wine bars, restaurants and pubs. There is a very beautiful park just a few yards from our house which is lovely for a jog or a stroll. The local golf course is not too far away.
notes: We are friendly and love meeting people from different parts of the world.
transit: Parking is free and most days plenty of it. There are many links to the public transport network. The London City airport is close and travelling from London Stansted is also very easy, either by coach or by train.
access: My guests have keys to the front door and have access to ground floor which has a large TV lounge and snooker table. There is also access to the patio. I live in the basement flat with my husband and that space is accessible  by invitation. The apartment has fully fitted modern kitchen. Please note the laundry facilities attract a small fee.
house_rules: We don't allow single sex groups (hen nights, stag parties). We are gay friendly. Rooms are suitable for singles and couples with or without children. Use of downstairs lounge and terrace garden, though exclusive, restricted to before 11:00 pm only, unless expressly agreed beforehand. No drugs, inebriated or rowdy behavior will be tolerated. All damages have to be paid for, especially any damage to equipment such as TV, Sky box, WiFi, snooker table, furniture, etc. The hosts reside on the basement floor. Smoking only permitted outside.

name: Double bedroom in cute house
summary: Tasteful quiet bedroom in a beautiful house with a secret garden, right in the centre of Shoreditch. Hoxton square, Regents canal, London Fields, Broadway Market, Columbia Road...Nothing is more than a 10 minute walk away.
space: Attractive large double room available in a stylish 3-bed house. The property has 1.5 bathrooms, a large living/dining room, a fully fitted kitchen with dishwasher and all amenities, and an attractive back garden. High speed fibre-optic wifi is available throughout.  The house is conveniently located for all of the social/shopping scene of Shoreditch, London's coolest neighbourhood. On the doorstep of the City, the house convenient for both tourists and business people.
description: Tasteful quiet bedroom in a beautiful house with a secret garden, right in the centre of Shoreditch. Hoxton square, Regents canal, London Fields, Broadway Market, Columbia Road...Nothing is more than a 10 minute walk away. Attractive large double room available in a stylish 3-bed house. The property has 1.5 bathrooms, a large living/dining room, a fully fitted kitchen with dishwasher and all amenities, and an attractive back garden. High speed fibre-optic wifi is available throughout.  The house is conveniently located for all of the social/shopping scene of Shoreditch, London's coolest neighbourhood. On the doorstep of the City, the house convenient for both tourists and business people. The bedroom is on the first floor, in close proximity to the bathroom. Guests are welcome to make themselves at home, the garden is always available, as is all of the common living space. I'm happy to welcome guests and provide any help I can. I know the area and all of its attractions/amenities prett
neighborhood_overview: The area has to be seen to be believed - you don't know contemporary London until you've experienced the East London scene.  Perfectly located in the triangle between Shoreditch, Hoxton and Broadway Market, everything you need to experience in the area is in easy walking distance. The property is also a block away from the pretty canal, which facilitates easy walks/bike rides to Islington, Victoria Park, and beyond.  There are 40+ bars/pubs in walking distance, as well some world-class restaurants, alongside the cheap and cheerful array of Vietnamese restaurants of Kingsland Road, and the famous Indian/Bangladeshi places on Brick Lane.   The East-End market scene on a Sunday has to be experienced, Columbia Road Flower Market is on the doorstep, and Spitalfields and Brick Lane Markets are not much further.  The stunning Museum of English Interiors and its incredible gardens are a few minutes walk away, as are Hackney City Farm and Haggerston Park.  I can't enthuse about the area enough
transit: Less than 5 minutes walk from Hoxton Station, with easy access and well connected to bus/overground train network and the rest of the city. The canel is a minute away, and Liverpool Street and Old Street are either a 15-minute walk or a short bus ride away.
access: The bedroom is on the first floor, in close proximity to the bathroom. Guests are welcome to make themselves at home, the garden is always available, as is all of the common living space.
house_rules: I'm pretty laid back, people are welcome to come and go as they please, make themselves at home, cook, eat in the dining area or in the garden. I would only ask that guests keep the common areas clean and tidy. Smoking is permitted in the garden.

name: Beautiful Notting Hill Flat Close to Portobello Rd
summary: Clean, classic, quiet and cozy flat located a short walk away from the famous Portobello Road, and perfect location for the Notting Hill Carnival. Short walk to two central tube lines.  Portobello Road - 12-min walk - 1 tube stop Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park - 30-min walk  Westfield White City Shopping Centre - 20-min walk - 2 tube stops Holland Park - 30-min walk
space: Classic styled one bedroom apartment on leafy Notting Hill street. This first floor apartment was built in 1890 and still contains original features including marble fireplace and chandelier, double-height ceilings and ornate glass door handles.  The property also boasts a large balcony with outdoor seating, underfloor heating in the kitchen. Sound system in every room. Sky/Flat Screen TV/Blu-Ray/Apple TV. There is also a large library of DVD's as well as modern and classic literature and an upright piano.   The centre of Notting Hill is a 10 min walk as are connections to the Central and Hammersmith & City underground lines. (perfect for access to Stratford and the Olympic site). The reception room features an upright piano and 3 seater sofa as well as a classic Louis XIV occassional chair.  The Bedroom has a double bed and integrated reading lamps as well as a flat screen TV and floor to ceiling wardrobe space. The apartment sound system also plays in this room. French doors open out

name: Quiet and well decorated one bedroomed garden flat
summary: The space is relaxing, quiet and  extremely comfortable. The area is synonymous with the TV series 'The only way is Essex', boasting some stunning countryside and great shopping nearby.
space: The flat has central heating, wireless, curved screenTelevision, washing machine and is  tastefully furnished throughout. The bathroom has a shower and bath and the garden has a large decking area with tables and chairs in which to relax. The flat is a very relaxing and comfortable space. It is located exactly 5 miles from the Olympic complex and there are excellent transport links via the central underground line, just 10 minutes walk away. Stratford station is 5 stops from there. The local village area has a supermarket, good pubs, restaurants and a green with an attractive duck pond. It is only a short drive to stunning Epping forest and Buckhurst Hill.  There is on street parking outside the property and the area is very quiet and safe. Covent garden and other central London attractions are only 25 minutes by underground from woodford station.

space: Double bedroom+ 24 hr internet &Sky - Double bedroom with private bathroom. Access to 24hr Internet and Sky available. Cooking facilities also available. name: Central, Beautiful, Author's Apartment in Soho
summary: This is a bohemian author's apartment in central Soho. It's London's theatre-land, art gallery mecca, red light district, gay village and NOISY hub of cafe, bar and restaurant culture. For the liberal, bon viveur, what's not to love? If this isn't you, it really isn't for you.   NB. Please do read the full profile for further details before booking.
space: A first floor, light and airy apartment in the hub of the exciting and famous Soho. It's spacious for the centre of town and decorated in an Art Deco, shabby chic.  By profession, I'm an author and actor. I absolutely love it here and, to my mind, the apartment is an absolute gem in the metropolis. As a Soho resident I've been interviewed several times about the area and have written and voiced an audio guide to the area as well.  NB. I'm a social creature who loves the buzz of a city but there's no disputing that by night here - especially at the weekend and in the summer - it can be properly lively. The secondary glazing here is good, but some nights you are still very much aware of the hubbub below till the very early hours. There's a bar directly under the apartment! For me that's a highlight, for the more conservative that's definitely a lowlight. If you're a light sleeper or like pin drop silence, this pocket of London really, really isn't for you and you'd be better suited to a

neighborhood_overview: I love the cafes for people watching, the art galleries for meditative moments, the theatre for tickling the soul and the bars for a night cap or two...
transit: From here you are minutes from Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square, Covent Garden, Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Street (the furthest away and 12 minutes at a leisurely pace). Also there are the 'Boris bikes' for hire and buses all lead to W1!
access: You have access to everything in the apartment. Sorry but there's no washing machine or dryer. You can handwash and put things on the clothes rails (stored behind the bedroom door). There's a launderette (not self-service) on Marshall Street about 10 minutes away and a dry cleaners a few minutes away from the apartment 9 Green's Court (cross the road, head left and it's the second street on your right) .
house_rules: Hi there the apartment is self contained and private. The only house rule (apart from not setting it on fire, throwing the TV out of the window rock star style etc) is to be respectful of neighbours and being quiet in the communal hallway.

name: Bright Double in friendly Islington/Stokey/Dalston
summary: The guest room includes a double bed, lots of storage space and a work desk. The flat is in a Victorian terrace in Islington, near Stoke Newington and Dalston, in a Conservation Area. There are several reasonably priced and friendly cafes, restaurants and food shops nearby.  Clissold Park (56 acres) is five minutes away by 141 bus. Newington Green - a small park with cafe - is at the end of the road.  The flat is well served by bus and tube links to the rest of London and main train stations.
space: DOUBLE ROOM  - Standard double bed with feather bedding and cotton bed linen. - Towels - Work desk, adjustable chair, ethernet & WiFi. - Shelving, chest of drawers, wardrobe with hangers  - Black-out blind to window - Suitcase stand - London maps & guides - Novels, books - Hair dryer - Umbrella  - Water bottle - Travel adaptor plugs EXTRA BEDDING - Available on request  BATHROOM (shared with host) - Bath with shower attachment - Toiletries - Bath board - Bath safety mat - Basic first aid kit LIVING ROOM - TV, DVD player, sound system, Yamaha piano KITCHEN/DINER - Fridge freezer (top shelf for guest)  - Electric oven - Gas hob - Toaster - Blender - Electric kettle - Cafetieres - etc.  UTILITY ROOM - Washing machine, washing tablets, tumble dryer, clothes airer - Ironing board, iron GARDEN - West-facing patio, lawn and mature trees - Glass-topped table and wooden benches PARKING - Free off-street parking for a small to medium-sized car or small van.  THE NEIGHBOURHOOD: EATING AND DRINKIN

neighborhood_overview: I enjoy the local green spaces, friendly neighbourhood cafes and restaurants, and easy access to Islington, Dalston, Stoke Newington and Central London.  My guidebook and photos provide local recommendations and places of interest, or feel free to ask me.  I enjoy local venues such as the Arcola and the Almeida theatres, Hackney Empire, Dalston Rio and the Screen on the Green cinemas.
notes: BREAKFAST Help yourself to - coffee (cafetiere/French press), tea.  - bagels & bread (toaster available) - butter, jams, marmalade etc.  - granola, fruit & yogurt.  If you prefer to go out, Acoustic Brasserie, Belle Epoque or 'Lizzies on the Green' are five minutes walk away on Newington Green.  VICTORIAN PROPERTY The house dates from 1896, so may appear more worn than a new-build.
transit: JOURNEY PLANNING - PUBLIC TRANSPORT  I recommend the CityMapper app for planning London Transport journeys.  BUSES - 21 & 141 buses to the City, river and beyond run down my street.  - Numerous other bus routes run close by.  TRAINS - Dalston Junction Station (London Overground) 10 mins walk. - Canonbury Station (London Overground) 12 mins walk. - Highbury & Islington Station (Piccadilly and Victoria lines, London Overground) 12 mins walk. - St Pancras International (Eurostar) 20 mins by bus/cab. MINICABS - UBER cabs are available within minutes. - Local cab firms include Essex Express or Premier Cars (pay cash).  GETTING HERE FROM LONDON AIRPORTS STANSTED: Train to Tottenham Hale, London Overground to Dalston, then bus or walk. Or 'Terravision' bus into Liverpool Street, then cab.  GATWICK: Train to London Bridge Station, then 141 bus. Or Gatwick Express to Victoria Station, Victoria line to Highbury & Islington Station, then bus / walk. name: Sunny double room/balcony/shower/wc
space: Lovely sunny double bedroom, has its own shower/wc, and a balcony overlooking the private woods behind the house.  It is close to Honor Oak Station with fast connections to Central London and Whitechapel.  My guests share the kitchen and living rooms with myself and my small dog Charlie and I have wi fi and free view tv.  There is a washing machine to use and you are very welcome to cook if you wish. It is very peaceful here and there is a great view over London too but it is also very easy to get into Central London.  There are some good local restaurants as well. I like all of my guests to feel really relaxed here and you are welcome to tea and coffee at any time. I enjoy helping guests finding their way around London and having lived here a long time can suggest places to go as well.

However if guests just want to get on by themselves that’s fine too. I want guests to feel free to make drinks, food whenever they wish. Th
neighborhood_overview: Honor Oak Park has several restaurants and cafes and a Sainsbury’s local supermarket . It’s a family friendly residential area . Forest Hill one stop further south on the train has the fascinating and free Horniman Museum and gardens . Dulwich is easily accessible by bus and has the beautiful Dulwich Gallery and park if you want to explore the local area. Easy connection by train to central London .
notes: You are staying in my home and as a guest I want you to be relaxed and happy. I do have a little dog who loves with me and my grandchildren visit too. It’s a family home . We have a private wood at the rear of the garden accessible by residents only. There is a piano if you want to play !! Just enjoy your stay
transit: Fast connection to central London by the overground line of the underground . There are buses too if you want a leisurely ride into central London. It’s a  10 minute walk to the station (depending how fast you walk of course)
house_rules: I like guests to feel relaxed in my house and ask if they have anything they need.

name: London, Ealing, W13 Artists Home
summary: Our unique comfortable vibrant 1909 Edwardian home is well placed to provide everything you need for your trip:- Excellent transport links into Central London & Heathrow Airport,  bars & restaurants, quiet green spaces, shopping, art, sport; it's all here in a safe environment, with a quiet, restful, extremely safe space of your own when you need to sleep!
space: Jeanie Marsh welcomes you to stay in B&B accommodation provided in one lush double bedroom in her family home. You will have your own private bathroom, and all towels, bedlinen and toiletries are supplied. Ealing is a very green area with plenty of parks, open spaces and even a couple of golf courses and for this reason is known as 'The Queen of the Suburbs'! We have many cafes, bars and restaurants nearby, and are Ideally placed for getting around London. Served by 3 tube lines (Central, Piccadilly and District Lines) and 2 overground lines Central London is 20 minutes away by tube, Heathrow Airport around 30 minutes away (tube or driving). I am available to collect you from Boston Manor tube station when you arrive and depart. We are just a few miles away from either junctions 2 or 3 of the M4 motorway, so if you are driving, we also have a place to park in driveway. Wifi, cable tv, delicious breakfast, tea/coffee and homemade biscuits in our comfortable, quiet guest room, a beautifu

neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is a very friendly one, which as well as being a typical busy London borough, it also has many green parks, canal walks & open spaces a short walk from our house.  The Grosvenor Pub is a really highly regarded local hostelry, which extends a warm welcome to its visitors & provides great food, wines, & beers.  A great place to unwind & we find that our guests love it!
transit: I am available to collect visitors from the local railway stations in my car if required:  Ealing Broadway (main line & tube), Boston Manor, Northfields (Piccadilly line tube), West Ealing (main line from Paddington)
access: We are happy to share our main living spaces with our guests, or leave them to the privacy of their own room.

Only the booked guest/s are permitted to stay/socialise in the property.

name: Attic Room in historic Greenwich
summary: The room does not have a door but its own discreet staircase. It is light, airy and open plan. The leaning ceiling provides  a snug hideaway feel and  benefits from a fine panoramic view of London.
space: Double room available in historic royal Greenwich; a UNESCO designated World Heritage Site for its significant contribution to  the cultural and natural heritage of the world. The house is in a peaceful residential street that has panoramic views across London.  Please Note that clean bedding and towels are provided and whilst I do not prepare breakfast you are welcome to make use of kitchen facilities, and sundries like cereal, fruit, milk, tea, coffee I may have in, for breakfast and light refreshments. The walk to the house is up hill. The attic room is on the second storey it has privacy but no door. The stairs have a tight turn at the top which makes trunks and very large suitcases difficult to maneuver - ask if assistance is required. A key for access to the house is available on request.

name: Spacious Room 2.1mi. near Stratford
space: We have a spacious and comfortable double room in clean and decent house. The room is situated at the front of the house with a view of the road and is very bright and airy too. It is suitable for couples or two girls sharing the room.  We have great transport links into London and the surrounding area. Our nearest Tube Station is Upton Park, whis about a few minutes walk away. Here you will find both the District and Hammersmith & City lines that can take you into central London in 25-30 minutes.  London's East End, with it's great markets (Brick Lane, Spitalfields and Colombia Road) are a 20 minute tube ride away. Best of all, we are very close to the Olympic Park, and this can be reached by public transport, only 3 stops away on the train! We are close to all local amenities on Green Street, which is only a minute's walk away form our home (Tesco, Barclays, Ice land, Boots , Shoe Zone, enormous restaurants, Poundland, various grocery shops, barbers and beauty parlours etc.) Nearest

name: Double Room/twin, green butterflies
summary: A large twin room, that can be turned into a Double. Suitable for 2 people, this lovely big room has a grand fireplace, antique furniture and a soft cosy bed! A small television sits in the corner,Tea/coffee making facilities are also available.
space: A twin room in a cosy 3 bedroomed Victorian House in North London, a short walk away from the lovely Hampstead Heath and Highgate Cemetery. There are numerous pubs/ restaurants around the area and as for public transport,the tubes and buses are 2 mins walk away, so  the English capital city from this spot couldn’t be easier.    It is a charming house that lends a home from home atmosphere. There are 3 large bedrooms, which are broken down into 2 doubles and 1 twin, as well as a pull out double bed in the living room. There is a shower room and a bathroom ,and  the use of the lounge and the garden. Most of the rooms are equipped with a tv, sink, heating and hair dryer and the doubles also have interesting wallpapers and designed fabrics. The house has wonderful kitchen, perfect for a hearty breakfast!! It is perfect for a  couple or a group who want to explore London town! I also can arrange to let the whole house ,so please contact me if you would prefer this option. This house is very

neighborhood_overview: Archway Is brilliant for public transport. It is a busy hub that has lots of character, and is in walking distance to parks, pubs/cafe's and in 20 mins I can be in the centre of town. Highgate is 10 mins walk with lots of restaurants and pubs and backs off onto hampstead heath, a wonderful park with swimming ponds.
notes: from the tube station , you cross towards a pub called Sweeny's, then cross again to a small triangle of grass, and cross again at the traffic lights towards a telephone box filled with flowers. follow the road to the left, around the corner and the b&b is on the right
transit: The b&b is  2 mins walk from Archway tube station which is on the northern line, and can take you straight to leister square or charring cross and the min attractions of London Town. Parking is not included I'm afraid. From Stansted I usually get the national express bus to golders green and get the 210 bus from there to Archway. From Heathrow you can get the picadilly line to leister square,and change to the northern line (towards high barnet) to Archway.
access: The guests will have access to the shower/toilet and are welcome to make coffee/tea in the kitchen, also breakfast is served in the kitchen in the morning.

name: Very Central! Bayswater Apartment
summary: Great apartment in Central London location with easy access to all parts of town.  The apartment is in a quiet square but in a busy area with lots of shops and restaurants a short walk away and is very close to public transport links.
space: A double bedroom (and annexe) with own shower room/lavatory (not en suite) in quiet shared basement flat in a garden square with professional owner in Central London. Owner is generally away from Thursday night until Sunday so during these times you will usually have exclusive use of the apartment. This makes checking in on a Friday or Saturday problematic. In an annexe to the double bedroom, divided by a curtain, is a full size bunk bed suitable for children or an adult seeking some privacy.  I am afraid that I only accept children over 10 years old and a maximum of 3 guests at any one time. Minimum stay of 3 nights or I will need to charge a £10 premium per night per person. Part of the Notting Hill general area, a safe area with lots of shopping, restaurants and cool cafes.The location is extremely well connected for public transport as 2 tube stations (Bayswater and Queensway) are  within a 5 minute walk from the property  and will easily connect you to the rest of  London. transit: Lots of busses and 2 tube stations to quickly get you around town.  A 15 minute walk (and a faster bus ride or taxi) from Paddington train station too, with fast links to London Heathrow Airport and trains to the West of London.

summary: Contemporary London living yards away from Hyde Park and Kensington Palace
space: Spacious one bedroom apartment right in the heart of London only yards away from worldwide known Hyde Park and Kensington Palace, ( residence in life of the late Princess of Wales) in the cosmopolitan neighbourhood of Queensway. The apartment is suitable for two guests. The open spaces of Hyde Park as well as Queensway and Bayswater Underground Stations, serving the Central and Circle lines respectively, are literally 100 metres away granting fast access to any central London attraction via a maximum fifteen minutes tube ride. neighborhood_overview: Quensway is a vibrant neighbourhood set across the street from Hyde Park, the abundance of facilities on your door step, to included shops, groceries and restaurants of over 30 nationalities will ensure an enjoyable holiday.
notes: In addition it offers two lifts, concierge, CCTV security system, night patrol for added security, superfast 8MGB WIRELESS internet access, impressive 50' LCD TV set providing 55 Channels, DVD player, fire alarm, and entryphone.
transit: All London attractions are at your fingertips thanks to the proximity to two Underground stations: Queensway and Bayswater, both 100 metres away from the property. If your flight lands at Heathrow, the estimated journey time from the airport to the apartment is a mere 35 minutes. From Gatwick airport, the estimated journey time is just under one hour. From Stansted or Luton airport the estimated journey time is just over an hour. The fast-track Heathrow Express takes you to Heathrow Airport in 15 minutes and also departs from Paddington Station every 15 minutes, therefore making a weekend trip to Paris, Rome, Madrid, Berlin...easily accessible during your stay in the UK.
access: The open spaces of Hyde Park as well as Queensway and Bayswater Underground Stations, serving the Central and Circle lines respectively, are literally 100 metres away granting fast access to any central London attraction via a maximum fifteen minutes tube ride. Renowned sights such as the "Victoria and Albert Museum" or the "Natural History Museum", as well as the "Royal Albert Hall"  can be reached after a short and pleasant stroll/walk through the relaxing settings of Hyde Park. All major destinations within the UK can be reached from Paddington Station, only five minutes away should you fancy visiting Oxford, Cambridge or Strafford Upon Avon, (home town of Shakespeare), to name but a few.
house_rules: Please note that we favour a very strict non smoking / no pets policy. Well behaved children over 10 years of age are welcome. Rest of house rules are flexible as long as RESPECT is shown.

name: Dalston: private flat in large house
summary: One of two private flats in large house: large sunny room with king-size bed, single day-bed, dining table, TV/DVD, wifi. Ensuite shower room with washer and dryer.  Fully equipped kitchen.  Step out onto the balcony for fresh air and view over the gardens. Great location in Dalston, close to public transport to central London and airports.  Good local restaurants, cafes, bars, clubs and the Rio cinema.  One minute from the famous Ridley Road market, close to Broadway and Columbia Road markets.
space: Ideal for a business or holiday stay.  Two train stations, Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction, are less than 5 minutes walk away, and multiple buses service the area.  Our house is in Colvestone Crescent, 2 minutes to the famous Ridley Road market. Guests have an entire floor with a large Bedroom, sitting area, dining table, en-suite bathroom with washing machine and dryer, iron and ironing board, and self-contained fully equipped kitchen.  Bedding and clean towels provided and refreshed each 7 days for longer stays.   Facilities include clock/radio/alarm, TV (free to air, not pay tv), DVD, and broadband internet.  The kitchen has an electric stove, fridge, dishwasher, 4 piece place settings of cups, plates, glasses, knives, forks, spoons, etc, and sufficient cooking implements to make substantial meals. An initial complimentary supply of tea, coffee, and sugar, and for the cost of the supermarket till receipt, we will fill your fridge and larder with anything you might specify in

name: Lovely 2 Bed Apartment in East London
space: This is a modern, spacious 2 double bedroom apartment situated in the heart of East London! The property comprises of a large, bright open plan living/ dining/ kitchen area, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 2 generously sized balconies with fantastic views. The kitchen is fully-equipped and offers new, high-spec fittings, including state of the art cooking equipment, a dishwasher and a practical, easy to clean design. The living/ dining area is homely and comfortable, with a luxurious L shaped sofa, flat screen TV, and a sizeable dining table perfect for enjoying a home cooked meal. The living area opens onto a large, well proportioned balcony with a great view of the city, perfect for enjoying a morning coffee or relaxing in the evening sun. The master bedroom is bright and airy, opening onto an East facing balcony and boasting an en-suite bathroom. The second bedroom has a large, sleek private bathroom across the hall. Both bedrooms offer ample storage and wardrobe space. The apartment is

name: Dream Apartment in central London
summary: Beautiful room in a lovely 2 bed apartment in Primrose Hill, a romantic area famous for its movie and rock star residents. Your lovely south facing bedroom has a comfortable bed, large and bright window overlooking a lush garden below. Very peaceful.
space: Beautiful room in a lovely 2 bed apartment in Primrose Hill, a romantic area famous for its movie and rock star residents. Your lovely south facing bedroom has a comfortable bed, large and bright window, and overlooks a lush garden below. Very peaceful and relaxing! You have a wardrobe, and bedding is also included. You have access to a shared modern bathroom, with a bathtub, and a shower over the bath. The lounge has a comfy sofa, fireplace, and flat screen TV. Free wi-fi! A fully equipped modern kitchen is at your disposal too, complete with microwave, oven, kettle, toaster etc., for making drinks and snacks during your stay. An iron, ironing board and hairdryer are available too. The apartment is located a 5 minute walk from Swiss Cottage tube station, and a 7 minute walk from Chalk Farm tube. name: Room(2) with a view in Nottinghill
summary: A haven in the middle of it all...London comes in to your space here with views from every room.
space: Trellick Tower is an iconic dual aspect listed building with spectacular views of Nottinghill, close to the centre of London with excellent transport links.  Your room is large, bright, light, peaceful and safe. It has a double bed (not single as in the photo)Outside your bedroom window is the Grand union canal and breakfast in the kitchen is overlooking Golborne Rd (which has some of the best coffee shops in London). The bathroom is clean with a bath and a shower and there is a separate toilet.  This flat is "Location,location,location" On the doorstep is the famous Portobello Rd with a good selection of bars and the market with it's bustling fruit stalls and vintage clothes at the weekend..Bus No.23 goes from outside Trellick to Londons main attractions in the centre. .Westborne Park tube (on the Hammersmith and City line) is 5 mins walk along the canal and Paddington is 3 stops away  The area has a village atmosphere and the Royal Parks are close by.

name: London "Victorian cottage" flat - near Tube & STN
summary: Entire apartment to yourself, a traditional Victorian period "cottage" property in Walthamstow with 1 kingsize bedroom that sleeps up to two.  Very close to the Victoria line tube. Clean linens and towels provided!  NO SMOKING allowed.
space: Set in a quiet and safe area of Walthamstow, I have a one bedroom flat available. This area has been my home for the past 15 years, so I have plenty of local knowledge to share! The flat is situated on the ground floor of a Victorian "cottage" maisonette, built in 1896, and is clean, homely and comes with original Victorian features, quirks and imperfections! TRANSPORT: 5 mins walk to Blackhorse Road Tube station (Victoria line, blue: 20 mins journey into central London) AND 10 mins walk to St James Street Station (London Overground orange line: 15 mins journey to Liverpool Street/Shoreditch neighbourhood). Your bedroom has a kingsize bed, desk, wardrobe and with drawers. Bed linens and towels are provided for your stay. The lounge room is bright and faces out onto my garden (which you're welcome to use), with a comfy sofa, a dining table and TV. The bathroom has a bath tub and shower over the bath. The kitchen has all mod-cons (microwave, oven, hob, toaster, kettle, washing machine, o

neighborhood_overview: I live close to the East London Marshes area which provide lots and lots of outdoor space and water -- very rare to find in London which is such an urban city!
notes: Absolutely no smoking!  This has been a problem with previous Airbnb guests.  And sorry but not pets.
transit: 5 mins walk to Blackhorse Road Tube station (Victoria line, blue: 20 mins journey into central London) AND 10 mins walk to St James Street Station (London Overground orange line: 15 mins journey to Liverpool Street/Shoreditch neighbourhood). The Stansted Express train runs from Stansted Airport to Tottenham Hale, and then it is only one stop on the blue Victoria line to my neighbourhood stop, Blackhorse Road.
access: Wifi, all kitchen facilities, washing machine. Sweet little garden with seating. Feel free to peruse my books and records too!
house_rules: Please be mindful of noise and of my neighbours directly above. Keep voices/music/TV to a reasonable level and please be particularly mindful after 10pm - my upstairs neighbours are very sensitive to noise.  ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING, E-CIGARATES, VAPING ETC. ETC. Please be careful of the wooden floors – I just got brand new rosewood wooden flooring. Please remove all outdoor shoes and be careful when moving suitcases etc. around the flat to avoid scratches ☺ My place is clean and has a good positive vibe.  I ask that guests respect that when staying here!  I have a full House Manual for booked guests which has all the info you need for an enjoyable stay.  Whenever possible, I will meet guests when they arrive and answer any questions they may have.

name: Architect's pub conversion, London
summary: This pub dates back to 1869 and has gone through a dramatic conversion into a contemporary, minimalist apartment.
space: The Apartment: Set up: The apartment consists of 1no bedroom with a super-king size bed, 1no study with a sofa bed and the architecure studio which sits below ground.  Me and my small team are working during the day from 9AM to 6:30PM, Mon-Fri tucked away in the underground studio. We are not there during the evenings or weekends. This 'compromise' has been considered when pricing the apartment and to date this set up has worked very well with my guests. Most of my guests are either out for work or exploring London but you are obviously more than welcome to be there all the time. Previous guests have composed music from there, worked on their thesis and even used it for professional photo shoots.  In addition to the bedrooms there is also a large living/dining room, a kitchen, a hall, a bathroom and a garden. The apartment is at 100m2 quite large and has 3.2m high ceilings.   The bathroom comes with a Whirlpool and a rain maker. There is also a private discrete court yard (planted, fur

neighborhood_overview: Location:   Quiet, close to Limehouse Cut, Canary Wharf, Mile End & Victoria Park. A variety of grocery stores, a fitness centre with pool, a climbing wall, a go-carting track, a cinema, a Health Centre, a drug store, dry cleaners and other things can be found within walking distance.  Below a short list of restaurants nearby that I can recommend: Within walking distance: Burgers, crocodile, etc The Greedy Cow Modern British/French The Morgan Arms Modern British The Narrow (by Gordon Ramsay)  Posh Indian Dock Master's House Within walking distance or a short bus ride: The S-curve north of Victoria Park: Fine British The Empress of India Italian Susazzagoni Posh Fish and chips Fishouse Pub Food Royal Inn On The Park Good Pub Pizza The Lauriston And there is the whole of Canary Wharf: (website hidden) Short bus or tube ride and well worth it: Hackney Organic British The Old Ship Near Canary Wharf Exquisite Modern British The Gun Indian curries on Brick Lane (website hidden) (I like 'The
transit: Infrastructure: Close to Mile End Station (Zone 2, Central Line, District Line, Hammersmith & City Line) - only 2 stops from Liverpool Street Station and near the London Olympics; close to Devons Road DLR station; within walking distance of Canary Wharf. Note: There is also a bicycle docking station of London's bicycle hire scheme at the back of the apartment plus a car parking space of a car sharing scheme in front of it.  Arrival from the airport: Heathrow: Take the Tube: Piccadilly Line (the blue one), eastwards. Change at Holborn onto the Central Line (the red one), eastwards. Get off at Mile End. Turn left when exiting the station and left again at the traffic light. Take the 323 bus. Get off at the third stop (St. Paul's Way School). Alternatively you can walk from the station as well. It is about 10mins if one knows the shortest way. Stanstead: Just take a bus to Stratford (IE National Express). There take the Tube: Central Line (the red one), one stop westwards to Mile End. Tur
access: You can access all areas including the studio should you need to print something or simply have a chat about architecture, London and all the world.
house_rules: No smoking, no shoes and no pets in the apartment please. Smokers are welcome to use the apartment's cosy courtyard. Please use the extraction when using the shower in order to avoid the build up of humidity. Please ensure that all locks (front entrance door, apartment door, courtyard door and windows) are locked when you are not in. The keys can be left behind on the dining table at departure. The access code for the high-speed WIFI is on the drawers next to the mirror in the bedroom. When using the whirlpool, please fill it 5cm (2 inches) above the highest jet with cold water, let it then run for 5mins, drain the bath before refilling it with hot water. This way the jets and pipes get cleaned of any dirt in case the whirlpool has not been used in a while. Do not use bubble baths in conjunction with the whirlpool as this will flood the bathroom.   For my long term guests: The rubbish collection is as follows: Generic waste (black bags): Monday and Friday early morning Recycling (pink

name: Bright London Flat Close to Centre
space: I am offering my flat while I am on holidays.  The flat is 38 square metres in size and boasts a well-proportioned bedroom, living room, kitchen and a bathroom. It is located one floor above the ground level (up by a flight of stairs with around 12 steps -there is no elevator in the building).  The flat has wooden floors, and because of that, although I have put rugs on the floor to minimise the noise going through to the flat downstairs, I ask for the shoes to be removed whilst in the flat in order not to disturb my neighbours downstairs. I would overall ask all guests to be considerate of the neighbours and refrain from making too much noise at night. Guests are welcome to use all facilities in the flat, including the washing machine and the dishwasher, as well as the fiber-optic broadband internet connection. There is no TV in the flat. It gets very good light through the day. The double bed in the bedroom can sleep two, and two more people may sleep using the sofa-bed in the living

house_rules: As could be expected, I would request that the guests be mindful of the neighbours in the apartment and not make too much noise late at night. Notice that if you will be more than 3 people sharing the flat and use the sofa bed, that the sofa-bed has a mat that measures 120cm by 200cm and is not as thick as the mattress I have on the bed. Two people have slept quite a few times using that sofabed, although note that it is around 20cm-30cm shorter than how wide a normal double/queen sized bed would be. I would like you to confirm this before proceeding with the booking. I am quite flexible with check-in and check-out times, but we may have to coordinate with other guests that might be checking out/in the dates you are checking in/out.

name: Large London central double room
space: I have a room in Pimlico (Central London) available during the Olympics and Paralympics to one or two people. It’s available from 13 June 2012, but can be extended after the Paralympics 9 September.  Three other rooms in the flat are occupied by very nice and friendly long term tenants. It’s a large double room (20m2) with huge window and a balcony in a very nice, clean and friendly flat share in Lupus Street, Pimlico. Close to several Olympic sites, 30min by tube to the Olympic village. 5 minutes walk to Pimlico Tube Station (Victoria line), 10 minutes walk to Victoria Station, close to Chelsea, Westminster and Buckingham Palace. Busses outside the building take you to West End, South London and Chelsea/Kensington in just 10-15 minutes. name: Ensuite room in artist lofty studio
summary: Ensuite room in quirky arty, eclectic loft apartment. Looks of main living area is constantly changing, because of changes of artwork etc.
space: Laboratory artist lofty studio A beautiful ensuite double bedroom is available in a big artist live/work space. The studio is in an old warehouse, with exposed brick walls and floorboards. The flat is on the 3rd floor and there is a lift in the building. The ensuite bathroom has a shower. GUEST ROOM The room is 15sqm. It is a quiet room as it is at the back of the building, away from the main street. The room is beautiful with a double bed, a wardrobe with some hanging and an ensuite shower room. I would prefer single guests, but couples are welcome so please ask. LIVE/WORK STUDIO I use the studio to work (I'm an artist - photography and painting) during the day. Sometimes I stay overnight and sometimes I don't. I have another room where I sometimes sleep. The room is therefore best for guests who are going to be out and about during the day. Also the studio space is constantly changing as I love moving things around to give it a different feel. The whole studio is around 120sqm.  AMEN
description: Ensuite room in quirky arty, eclectic loft apartment. Looks of main living area is constantly changing, because of changes of artwork etc. Laboratory artist lofty studio A beautiful ensuite double bedroom is available in a big artist live/work space. The studio is in an old warehouse, with exposed brick walls and floorboards. The flat is on the 3rd floor and there is a lift in the building. The ensuite bathroom has a shower. GUEST ROOM The room is 15sqm. It is a quiet room as it is at the back of the building, away from the main street. The room is beautiful with a double bed, a wardrobe with some hanging and an ensuite shower room. I would prefer single guests, but couples are welcome so please ask. LIVE/WORK STUDIO I use the studio to work (I'm an artist - photography and painting) during the day. Sometimes I stay overnight and sometimes I don't. I have another room where I sometimes sleep. The room is therefore best for guests who are going to be out and about during the day. Also t
neighborhood_overview: Lively, trendy neighbourhood with lots of shops and restaurants and constant changes.
notes: The flat is a non-smokers flat, there is  strictly no-smoking in the guest room, but in the Living area near the window, one can smoke, if the urges are strong. I have no TV, however if wanted the Desktop computer in the kitchen area can be used as TV (and computer)
transit: Underground stations: Old street : 10min (exit 2) Liverpool st: 15-20min Busses directly to Oxford st, Covent Garden or Waterloo (No. 76/243 and 55)
access: Access to living area and kitchen.
house_rules: Guests should be aware, that I am also living/working in the studio. No smoking in the bedroom - in the living area allowed to smoke near window. Otherwise it's a non-smoking flat.

name: A superb self-contained studio flat
space: A superb self-contained studio with own built-in toilet & bath, kitchen sink with electric hob, freeze-freezer, microwave, toaster, washing machine, single bed with pillow and quilt. Very clean and tidy place and within easy access by underground, bus and north circular road. Wood Green underground and shopping city are only 5 minutes away. Wireless Internet facility is 24 hours on. Printing, scanning etc. are available upon request. Foods: Breakfast is included within the price. Breakfast includes milk, cereal, toast with margerine, marmalade, jam, egg omlette or poach, fried sausages & mushroom etc. Cooked lunch and dinner can be served upon request from the following choices of foods: rice, chicken, lamb, fish (Salmon & other), prawns etc. plus fried items like chips, fish, fish fingers, nuggets, scampy etc.

name: London loft room 2/3/4p.friendly family!
summary: Come and share a little of our London life: exchange with us; ask us about our best places in London for adults and children alike.  Échangez avec nous: nous nous ferons un plaisir de vous renseigner sur nos endroits préfèrés :) Contact us for a family discount! Contactez-nous pour un prix famille!
space: Great cosy brand new loft room for 2, 3, 4 people with own toilet and bathroom in lovely residential area 30 minutes away from Saint Paul Cathedral and 40 mns from Oxford Street (centre of London), GANTS HILL tube / metro station on the Central Line, direct line, no change.  The guest room has a double bed for 2 and we can add 2 additional beds for children or teenagers and a travel cot or a camp bed for one small child.  Breakfast? Depending: Cereals, eggs from our own hens with bread or British crumpets and jam. In the summer, you could have a tomato and cucumber salad – all from our garden too!- depending on weather.  We provide you with towels and bed sheets as well as shower gel/shampoo to avoid travelling with extra weight. We offer a great relaxed atmosphere in a lovely family home that is near to supermarkets and affordable restaurants.  For an extra and reasonable sum, we can collect you from any airport (Stansted airport is 20 mis from us)if you would rather not use public tr

We provide you with towels and bed sheets as well as shower gel/shampoo
neighborhood_overview: We love Valentines Park with its 2 lakes, 1 of them a boating lake, and the play area for kids. The Mansion is lovely and full of history: The house was built in around 1696 for Elizabeth Tillotson and her family, after the death of her husband, the Archbishop of Canterbury.
transit: The Central line, the main underground line going through London, is a 10 minute walk in a straight line from our house. You just need to walk along the park and you are there! Also possible to walk to the mainline train station ILFORD (20 minutes) and soon we will have Crossrail (10 minutes away).
house_rules: We welcome people of all cultures who want to share a bit of their life with us. We are open-minded and above all respect everyone in our household.  check in :  according to your arrival time, we are pretty flexible. We can wait for you any evenings. check out: before 11 am if possible on the day of departure. If no guests coming after you, then we are pretty flexible on this too as long as we are off work. Smoking OK if in the garden only. We hope we can welcome mainly couples with (or without) a child or single parents who want the security of a family home and want to visit London and make the most of the city during the day.  Our aim is to help out other fellow travellers to find accommodation at a decent price in a friendly household. Exactly what we always look for when we go on holidays! Also, as we are a family with a 12 year old, we will hope to accommodate guests who will respect her sleep :). Nous souhaitons accueillir des voyageurs de toutes cultures qui veulent partager u

name: Spacious Double/Triple near Common
summary: Large room with double and single bed in the historic village of Wimbledon. Suitable for short stays and guests with planned activities during the day.
space: A bright, modern and clean room in a private house in Wimbledon village with easy access to all the great restaurants and shops in the surrounding area.    You will enjoy use of a bathroom and breakfast will be served in dining room.  There is also fast Wifi broadband internet.
description: Large room with double and single bed in the historic village of Wimbledon. Suitable for short stays and guests with planned activities during the day. You will enjoy use of a bathroom and breakfast will be served in dining room.  There is also fast Wifi broadband internet.  There is a washing machine and drier available for a small charge per load. I'd love to answer any questions about the area. Wimbledon (email hidden) area so very close to the centre of London. The village has many high-end shops, restaurants, gastro pubs, supermarket and The Common for rambling walks. The 200 bus stops nearly outside the door. Street parking is available. From Wimbledon or Raynes Park station London is only 15-20 minutes away. Airport connections are good and I can give you more details upon request.

name: Cosy Room,London,well connected Z.2
summary: Cosy room on the second floor of a Victorian, split-level flat. The room now has a wardrobe and quite a lot of storage space for its size.   There is an additional small single room available for extra guests. Thameslink train or a bus to Brixton tube stn. Please check that the hopefully reasonable house rules suit you! Many thanks!
space: The room is situated on the second floor of a split level Victorian flat in a quiet road in Herne Hill.  It has a black out blind in the roof window, a wardrobe, which is not visible on the photo ( it was added after the photos were taken). The room is on the smaller side, a single, but has quite a lot of storage space and light. The bathroom is just diagonally opposite, and my son's room is next door to yours. There is a  utility room with an ironing board next to the bathroom. A hair-dryer is provided, as well as hotel slippers, towels, bed-linen, emergency toothbrushes or shampoo, if needed.   I have a second and smaller room available for rent, soon, if you would like to have a friend of family member visit.  Use of the kitchen, upstairs bathroom, living room- the latter please use on invitation/ arrangement only or when I am out!  It's always fun to share a few stories in the kitchen! Just feel at home and use all pots and pans etc. Spices are ok to use and sunflower oil, but spec

neighborhood_overview: Brockwell and Dulwich Parks are within walking distance. Brockwell Park has two cafe's, an outdoor pool and gym.  On the weekends there are various outdoor food markets. Nearby, Brixton is full of contrast and very lively. Great for bargains and unusual exotic food items. You might like the independent cinemas in Brixton or various live music venues and deli shops in the streets off the high street. Frequent busses go to central London or Brixton Underground Station on the Victoria Line. The trains (7 Mins walk away- go to places like Luton, Kings Cross, Wimbledon, the City and London Bridge. Some stops connect to the Underground. Very handy!) More below.
notes: I have a folder in the room with instructions for heating, the cooker etc. I will show you around or will enlist help to do so. Please check the cancellation policy and please note that I will not take bookings outside the Airbnb terms, which offer both parties a lot of safety benefits. Please point out if you are planning to leave items behind, such as food or toiletries, at the end of your stay.
transit: Many busses lead to and from (Victoria Line) Brixton tube station to my flat: the (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) -to  'Tulse Hill Tavern' stop or even nearer,  the 322 or 196 to 'Deronda Rd.' When you arrive at Brixton Underground station, turn left out of the station and walk to this stop outside Kentucky Fried Chicken. There are also two overground stations, near my place, as well. One is 'Tulse Hill' - (7 minutes walk away) . You can catch the Thameslink Train to Sutton from Kings Cross St. Pancras Int. or a train from London Bridge, directly.  From Victoria it is a 10 minute train journey to Herne Hill Station. (10mins & then take bus (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) or 468 up the hill on Norwood Rd. ). Connections are easily worked out online (tfl welbsite) or on 'city mapper'. The nearest stops are 'Deronda Road', 'Tulse Hill Tavern' or 'High Trees' . If you have lot of luggage, then Brixton Underground is your best bet for step-free travel via Green Park, coming from Heathrow.  An Oyster
access: The bathroom, upstairs (shared with my son). Kitchen. The living room is our private family space, but when we are out, feel free to chill out in there, for a change. Please use the kitchen for food prep and a chat but be aware that it is not an all day work space as it is uses by us and other guests.
house_rules: Please always double lock the blue outside front door from the inside / and or outside when leaving or having entered. (Bottom lock)-blue long key. We usually take our shoes off by the door and we keep them there tucked against the wall-or I'll trip over them!;-) Thanks for leaving things roughly as you find them. Please feel free to do a reasonable amount of washes per week.  Please be so good as to turn off lights and the central heating when you are not in, but usually,  the  heating is on a timer. We can overrun it or adjust it to suit. The outside hallway lights switch on and off by the kitchen door in the flat and also downstairs by the neighbours' door.  You could mark your food items in the fridge with a pen, if you want to make sure that no-one gets confused about who's food is whose. (It rarely happens.) Please use all my jams! They are piling up! I'd be happy to do swaps if there is too much or too little of somethjng.  (Only as negotiated in advance, of course!). Thanks!

name: Twin Room in lovely Victorian House in N11
summary: We have lived in our Victorian house for many years and love this neighbourhood.
space: We have a beautiful twin room in a Victorian house packed with charm and original features. We live in Friern Barnet, a quiet suburb of North London which benefits from excellent transport links into central London via the underground (Arnos Grove on the Piccadilly Line) or the overground rail network (New Southgate). There is also a direct rail link to St Pancras International for trains to/from Europe. We are less than 10 minutes walk to the North London Business Park.  Your room has two comfortable twin beds and the use of a large bathroom which is shared between the two guest rooms. Towels and bed linen are provided. This is perfect for either single travellers or a couple and if you are travelling with a small child, we can squeeze them on the floor for minimal extra cost (please ask when making your enquiry). The house benefits from free on-street parking, wifi and a lovely garden to relax in. We provide a continental breakfast which comprises juice, tea/coffee and toast or cerea

neighborhood_overview: Friern Barnet is a quiet neighbourhood near to Muswell Hill and Finchley with the added attraction of excellent transport links with the Piccadilly Line and overground rail into the city nearby.
notes: Please contact me if you have any queries or would like to know about availability in case my calendar is not up to date.

name: Light, 2 bedroom flat w/ courtyard, London Fields
space: This light and comfortable flat is part of a smart 1900's mansion block in the heart of Hackney. It has two bedrooms, original wood floors throughout, period fireplaces, and a lovely sunny central courtyard complete with picnic table. The flat is on a quiet backstreet, with the high street just around the corner, and the Overground station just two minutes walk away taking you to Highbury & Islington, Hampstead Heath, or Stratford, in minutes.  There is more to explore in London Fields, Broadway Market, and Dalston which are all a stone's throw away.  The living room comes with a dining table for 4-6 guests, a 32" flat screen tv, audio system, and large corner sofa which converts into a kingsize sofa-bed. The flat has wi-fi and freeview. The kitchen has a built in fridge/freezer, gas hobs, oven, and all the mod-cons (toaster, kettle, microwave, blender, etc). A back door in the kitchen takes you out into the central courtyard, where you can enjoy the sunshine and have lunch on the picn

neighborhood_overview: Hackney is a fantastic place to live these days. There is a new cafe opening every week, now that it's Spring there are flowers blooming everywhere, pop up garden centres, people hanging out in London fields every day. It is just lovely!
notes: I have a cat, who will stay with my neighbours whilst you stay in the flat. But she spends time in the central courtyard and will probably try to come and say hi to you/come into the flat since it's her usual home. If you have a cat allergy or don't like pets, this might not be the place for you!
transit: (phone number hidden) etc all buses taking you to central London. The overground is across the road. It is very well connected here.
house_rules: Please just treat the space like it was your own, and enjoy your stay! When you arrive, I will give you a set of keys for the front and back door  and show you the flat. Sometimes I am not around and I get my neighbours to  show people around - they are good friends of mine and are very friendly  too! But either way I will arrange this with you in advance and make sure  you know the deal. Usually I seem to be out when people are leaving, and in  this case I ask that you leave the keys in the post box just outside the  front door.  Please leave the flat in the same condition you found it. You will need to strip the sheets of the beds, and make sure you have washed everything up and put things away, and also taken out the trash to the bins at the end of the courtyard that would be great. Easy! The final thing to mention is that I have a cat called Meisje who is indoor/outdoor. During your stay she will be looked after by my neighbours, but she is very friendly so you'll probably see her,

name: Stylish, airy, Highbury loft studio
space: A light, airy and spacious loft conversion in Highbury & Islington - perfectly situated for direct tube and rail connections to all parts of London; close to the world-famous Emirates Stadium, home of Arsenal FC.  A comfortable, peaceful haven within this great city, with shared use of pretty patio overlooking leafy London gardens; stunning rooftop view across London. Used during term-time by art students studying at either Christie's or Sotheby's.   Stylish French 'bateau' double bed and imposing wardrobe accent this  eclectically furnished space, which also features contemporary art and antique furniture. There is a neat, well-equipped galley kitchen and a fully fitted bathroom with both bath and shower. Free wi-fi, easy walk to the fashionable bars and restaurants of Islington, as well as superb connections to central London via bus and tube.  Owned by art historian Sarah Jane and historic buildings consultant Gervase, and reflecting their sense of style. At least one of them will b

name: Elegant double room, Hackney, E9
space: We have a lovely bright and very large double room (16 sq metres) to rent in our elegant house between Victoria Park and trendy Broadway Market in Hackney, East London.  Built in 1855 the house retains many original features, but provides modern comfort. The room has a king-size bed, TV, CD/radio and wifi. The shared bathroom has a luxurious roll-top bath and power shower. Overall, the accommodation offers warmth and cosiness, with modern convenience. All linens and towels are provided. Unfortunately, we cannot provide breakfast, but tea and coffee is readily available.
description: We have a lovely bright and very large double room (16 sq metres) to rent in our elegant house between Victoria Park and trendy Broadway Market in Hackney, East London.  Built in 1855 the house retains many original features, but provides modern comfort. The room has a king-size bed, TV, CD/radio and wifi. The shared bathroom has a luxurious roll-top bath and power shower. Overall, the accommodation offers warmth and cosiness, with modern convenience. All linens and towels are provided. Unfortunately, we cannot provide breakfast, but tea and coffee is readily available. The room is on the top floor of our 4-storey house, so not suitable for those who have difficulty climbing stairs. The beautiful Victorian-style bathroom (with power shower) is on the floor below. We are always available to advise you on the best shows to see, places to visit and easiest ways to get around busy London. You won't regret booking with us - we're friendly, helpful and give our guests the privacy they requir
neighborhood_overview: There are many restaurants and a theatre within a 10-min stroll of the house.  London Fields Lido (open air swimming pool ) is open year-round – even when it snows – and is a 10 min walk away. Our local Hackney Picture House is superb, with great films and events, plus good food. There is a public bike hire station at the end of our road. You will delight in one of the edgiest and most interesting parts of London. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars at Broadway Market and nearby Victoria Park village. There are  some great art galleries in the area, and this part of Hackney is home to many well-known artists.  There is always something (and someone) interesting to look at as you visit the markets nearby (including Columbia Road Flower Market, Brick Lane and Spitalfields - all within walking distance).   Saturday morning is a treat as our nearest market, Broadway Market, is the buzziest place to be this side of London.  Within a 5 minute walk you have shops, food stalls, str
notes: Warning: we have a dog - but he's a big soft border collie, who isn't allowed on the top floor (where your room is) We are unable to provide breakfast, but tea and coffee are readily available.
transit: We are very centrally located, just 10 mins walk to Bethnal GreenTube which is on the Central Line and takes you straight to the West End (Oxford Circus 7 stops, 12 mins) or Westfield, Stratford (2 stops, 10 minutes). Bus stop is 2 mins away: 55: to Oxford Circus (25 mins max) 388: through the City to Blackfriars  D6: to Canary Wharf (via Bethnal Green Tube.. 2 mins away) 26: through the City (Spitalfields/Liverpool St/St Paul's) to Waterloo  48: via Liverpool St/Spitalfields/City to London Bridge Station 106: Whitechapel (via Bethnal Green Tube.. 2 mins away) 254: Aldgate (via Bethnal Green Tube.. 2 mins away)
access: The room is on the top floor of our 4-storey house, so not suitable for those who have difficulty climbing stairs. The beautiful Victorian-style bathroom (with power shower) is on the floor below.
house_rules: Kitchen is unavailable to guests, but we do provide tea/coffee on demand No parties or visitors  No loud music/TV .... erm, nothing else really, but if you have any questions just ask.  We're very flexible as long as we know what's about to happen!
