name: Gorgeous huge 5 b/room house garden
space: A large, roomy, comfortable, relaxed family home. There are three double bedrooms, 1.5 bathrooms, enormous live - in kitchen (which we live in), living room with big TV & related gadgets, conservatory and sunny garden with BBQ and tables/ chairs. Equipped with all the latest conveniences, which we invite you to use. Excellent location, close to Willesden Green tube, which is on the Jubilee line, zone 2. Also great buses with many routes, including to Notting Hill Gate, Kensington, Marble Arch, Golders Green, Brent Cross and many other places. Walking distance to West Hampstead, Queens Park and Kensal Rise, all fun areas for bars and restaurants. The house is fully equipped with everything you might need for a luxurious stay. There's also a lovely landscaped park nearby, with two playgrounds for kids, a cafe, an art gallery etc. There's a room - by - room description in the notes page (below). We would be happy to guide and advise you about all our favorite places in London: restaurants

house_rules: Have a great time!  You are welcome to use the BBQ and teak garden furniture, perfect for summer evenings. Also everything in the kitchen: 3 ovens, microwave, pots & pans, china, etc, as well as herbs & spices as you need.  Technology: We will set you up with wifi internet access (available across all 3 floors of the house and in the garden). You can use the very large plasma TV (to watch the games you don't have tickets for), DVD player and Wii. Let us know if you need any extras, such as baby equipment (cot, highchair, toys), child equipment (bikes, scooters, toys) or the kitchen stocked up with fresh food! Here's a room-by-room description. Ground Floor - private front garden with mature shrubs. Front hallway entrance, with 10 hook coat rack. Living room with over-sized plasma TV, DVD player and Wii, plus two comfortable weather-beaten brown leather sofas to lounge in. Enormous kitchen/diner. Kitchen is fully-equipped with triple over & grill, microwave, dishwasher, full-size fridge

name: Perfectly located Portobello Mews House
summary: You couldn't be closer to the action. This charming & cute mews house places you firmly in the heart of Notting Hill, but is neatly tucked away so still remains relatively quiet. With a grand living room, with dining table for 6 and plenty of lounging space, it's the perfect place to plan your next London adventure from and unwind in the evening. Close to two tube stations, and all the amenities or Portobello Market.
space: A unique opportunity to experience London life in a chic and arty mews house, just off the Portobello Road. Ground Floor As you walk in the front door, to the left you have a self contained bedroom with ensuite. The room has a UK king size bed, with comfortable furnishing and interesting pieces on the walls. We have a stylish Camerich chair in the corner ideal for reading and gazing out to the mews, as well as a walk in wardrobe with fitted mirror, which keeps your clothes nicely out of sight too...Off the bedroom is a shower room, with further toilet room. Up the stairs Into the main living area, it opens out nicely into an L shaped room, with dining area for 6 tucked in one corner, and open plan living across the rest. Two sofas for maximum lounging space with book cabinet and TV for entertainment. The kitchen is fully functional and has everything you need for making family meals and more.  Up to the 2nd floor You have 2 double bedrooms, the first is straight ahead from the stairs a

And within minutes to Ladbroke Grove and Notting Hill Gate tube stations, it provides the perfect launchpad to explore other areas of London!
notes: 3 story house, so top floor is up 2 flights of stairs... Please note that if you are checking in after 8:30pm and before 8am a slight charge will apply...  And for any last minute changes of schedule to checkin times we need at least 24 hour notice, otherwise a small charge will be incurred.. Many thanks.

name: Elegant, Boutique 4 bed 3 bath w/ Terraces
summary: Our gorgeous, stylish apartment offers you a boutique AirBnB experience on a pedestrianised square 1 minute from Dalston Junction tube/subway station: 3 stops from the Eurostar and 22 minutes from Oxford Circus. We have hosted guests from all around the world who have loved the spacious layout over two floors, conservatories with impressive glass frontage, a communal roof terrace, designer furniture and quality mattresses, immaculate cleaning, professional as well as caring communication.
space: The apartment is very close to central London and right beside a tube /subway station Dalston Junction (just across the pedestrianised square). This Zone 2 central station affords quick transport links to all the important tourist and business areas. This flat is just 3 stops from King's Cross International and 22 minutes from Oxford Circus. You can also take the 38 bus to places such as Covent Garden and Piccadilly, 76 to Bank and Waterloo; this is the reason Dalston and Islington have become so popular with people working in the city. We are situated in a stylish new development on pedestrianised Dalston Square at the borders of Dalston/Islington, surrounded by old markets, period properties, fancy new restaurants, wonderful independent cafes with quality coffee, and great pubs which have been around for decades. Our generously sized 150 sqare metre or 1600 sqare feet maisonette/duplex apartment is on the eighth and ninth floors with two lifts/elevators and a 24 hr. concierge. The tw
description: Our gorgeous, stylish apartment offers you a boutique AirBnB experience on a pedestrianised square 1 minute from Dalston Junction tube/subway station: 3 stops from the Eurostar and 22 minutes from Oxford Circus. We have hosted guests from all around the world who have loved the spacious layout over two floors, conservatories with impressive glass frontage, a communal roof terrace, designer furniture and quality mattresses, immaculate cleaning, professional as well as caring communication. The apartment is very close to central London and right beside a tube /subway station Dalston Junction (just across the pedestrianised square). This Zone 2 central station affords quick transport links to all the important tourist and business areas. This flat is just 3 stops from King's Cross International and 22 minutes from Oxford Circus. You can also take the 38 bus to places such as Covent Garden and Piccadilly, 76 to Bank and Waterloo; this is the reason Dalston and Islington have become so popu
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the thriving community of Dalston on the borders of Hackney and Islington - there are colourful East London markets, amazing cafes, quick connections to all the tourist sights of London, jazz bars and fringe theaters at your doorstep. If you want to experience the diversity and vibrancy of the real London, a place where London professionals and families and young creatives live - Dalston is your best bet. It is honestly one of the most interesting boroughs in London, especially in summer with London Fields and Broadway Market Close by. Recent gentrification has taken the edges off and given us some top quality restaurants and cafes. Dalston Square is a peaceful setting above a pedestrianised square moments away from the trendy Arcola Theatre and Bar, Vortex Jazz Bar, Cafe Route, Pond, Cafe Oto, Birthdays, Passing Clouds, Dalston Superstore, Dalston Roof Gardens, Rotorino, Hunters, The Talbot, The Scolt's Head, Farr's School of Dance (a pub), Pond (Hawaiian food and ra
transit: The transport links are amazing. Dalston Junction Overground station is almost on your doorstop. Dalston Junction Overground north will take you to Highbury and Islington in two stops, from which you can change to the Victoria Line which takes you in a swift diagonal through the city - King's Cross in one stop, Oxford Circus in four stops. Dalston Junction Overground south will take you through Hoxton and Shoreditch (3 stops) down to the river, where you can connect to the Jubilee Line at Canada Water to get smoothly to Waterloo and Westminster, or head east on the Jubilee Line to connect you to Canary Wharf and Greenwich. Buses include the frequent 38 (Angel, Covent Garden, Soho, Piccadilly), 56, 30 (King's Cross, Regent's Park), other buses are the 149 (London Bridge), 242 (St Paul's, Waterloo), and the 243, 76 (Bank, St. Paul's, Waterloo). The 277 eastwards heads over to utterly gorgeous Victoria Park. Head west on the Dalston Kingsland Overground (a separate station five minutes fr
access: There are 4 large bedrooms, 3 bathrooms (2 with double shower, 1 with a bathtub), 2 enclosed balconies/conservatories with seating, 1 communal roof terrace, 1 open-plan lounge and kitchen,  2 lifts. The flat will sleep 8 friends/family members very comfortably on real beds, or 4 work colleagues each with their own bedroom. All beds have quality 2000 pocket sprung mattresses with natural fillings like wool and cashmere, topped with mattress protectors, solid wood slats underneath and stable solid wood frames, and bedding from designers such as Sheridan and Orla Kiely. On the ninth floor down the hall is a communal roof terrace with great views. You do not need a key to access it - just walk out of the 9th floor and walk down the hallway. Please read all our FIVE STAR reviews from the fascinating world travellers who have stayed with us thus far. We love hosting and love travelling ourselves - we know how important it is to feel at home, enjoy your stay and have a memorable experience. W
house_rules: We don't like to set out rules for you while on your holiday but would be grateful if you could consider the following when staying with us: - Please don't put anything wet on wood or over door frames - no towels or cups that are wet underneath. - Please lock up even when you are in the flat for insurance purposes; the block is very safe and we are on the 8th and 9th floors but please do lock up even if you personally feel it isn't necessary. - No parties or guests who are not included in the booking in the flat- of course if it is your mum who lives down the road and just wants a cup of tea, that is fine. - No smoking AT ALL in the flat/wintergarden - please go to the communal roof terrace on the 9th floor if you would like to smoke. - Feel at home and remember that you are the guest and entitled to having wonderful, relaxing stay. - If you have any problems, please contact me via airbnb messaging or on the emergency numbers given as I am always ready to help and sort things out. Than

name: Funky, cozy loft in a family home
summary: You'll be staying in the lovely and colourful room at the top of the house, away from the city buzz and with interesting views of the neighbourhood. We want you to feel at home with us and will endeavour to help you make the most of your visit to London.
space: We have a bright, cozy loft in a friendly family home in London's vibrant East End. The room has a comfortable double bed with soft pillows, a wardrobe and storage space. Bed linen and towels are provided and you will be sharing a big, airy bathroom. It's a new conversion at the top of the house to which you can retreat for peace and quiet. As the ceiling is below average, taller people might have to lower their heads a bit! We are happy to welcome single people and couples. You can share the living area with us and our two young girls if you want to. Feel free to use the hair dryer, microwave and wifi, and sometimes we can wash your clothes for a little extra. The price includes breakfast every day and you can help yourself to tea and coffee, fruit and biscuits at any time. The house is in Bethnal Green, less than 5 minutes away from the tube and about 15 minutes from the city centre (Oxford Circus) and the Olympic Park. We live in a lovely street with plenty of nice restaurants, pubs

neighborhood_overview: Bethnal Green is a great neighbourhood in the East End of London. In recent years, it has become really fashionable with a variety of food and clothes markets, as well as lovely parks and also restaurants and nightclubs. It's definitely a family friendly area but also ideal if you want to go out in the evening, with trendy Dalston and Shoreditch nearby. Bethnal Green is on the Central Line of the underground and really well connected with the city centre: it takes just about 15 minutes to Oxford Circus. If you want to discover London in a different way, come here, you'll love it!
notes: Very near the house there are several good coffee shops, which serve vegetarian and vegan food (The Larder, The Gallery Cafe), as well as a popular greasy spoon (The Full Monty),  where you can try the typical English breakfast. There are also lovely pubs such as The Camel and restaurants serving Turkish, Chinese, Corean or Italian dishes. Within walking distance from us is Victoria Park and several traditional and hipster markets, including Columbia Road flower market, Brick Lane (food, clothes and vintage) and Broadway Market (clothes, food and farmers’ produce).
transit: How to get home from London's airports: From Stansted, take the Stansted Express train to Liverpool Street station and then the tube's Central Line, just one stop to Bethnal Green. For a cheaper option, get the National Express coach to either Bethnal Green (direct, it takes longer) or to Stratford, and then change to the Central Line, two stops to Bethnal Green. You can buy all the tickets at the airport and the trip takes about one hour. From Heathrow, take the Picadilly Line until Holborn and then take the Central Line to Bethnal Green (it takes about 1,15 hours). From Gatwick, take a regular train or the (more expensive) Gatwick Express to Victoria Station, then the tube's Victoria Line to Oxford Circus and change to the Central Line until Bethnal Green. From Luton, take the train to King's Cross/St. Pancras International and then the tube to Bethnal Green. From Southend, take the train to Stratford and then the tube to Bethnal Green. The more convenient airport for us is Stansted.
access: Apart from your room and the bathroom, you'll have access to the living room and the dining area, the newly refurbished kitchen -where you can use the microwave or prepare cold food- and also to the patio.

name: Lovely Victorian House - sleeps 4
summary: Our Victorian house is in a quiet street where we have lived for many years. The guest rooms and bathroom are on the first floor and the dining room on the ground floor.
space: We have two beautiful guest rooms in our Victorian house which is packed with charm and original features. We live in Friern Barnet, a quiet suburb of North London which benefits from excellent transport links into central London via the underground (Arnos Grove on the Piccadilly Line) or the overground rail network (New Southgate). There is also a direct rail link to St Pancras International for trains to/from Europe. We are less than 10 minutes walk to the North London Business Park.  The rooms both have comfortable beds and the use of a shared bathroom between the two rooms. One room has a king-sized double bed, the other has twin beds. Towels and bed linen are provided. This is perfect for a family of 4, or a small group of friends. If you are travelling with a small child, we can squeeze them on the floor for minimal extra cost (please ask when making your enquiry). If you are only 1 or 2 people travelling, you can book either a twin room or a double room, please see my other list

The rooms both have comfortable beds and the use of a shared bathroom between the two rooms. One room has a king-sized double bed, the other has twin beds. Towels and bed linen are provided. This is perfect for a family of 4, or a small group of friends. If you are travelling with a small child, we can squeeze them on the floor for mini
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet, family, neighbourhood and we know most of our neighbours which makes a nice community.
notes: Please contact me for availability in case my calendar is not up to date.
transit: There is free on street parking although it can get crowded. We are 10-15 minutes walk from Arnos Grove on the Piccadilly Line and 3-4 minutes walk to New Southgate overground railway station which is a fast service into the city. There are also lots of bus routes.
access: Guests will be sharing the dining room and kitchen with us and also our puppy! However if you are not a dog lover he can be moved out of the dining room when you are there.
house_rules: We want you to feel at home in our house so rules are minimal. There's no smoking in the house and if you come home late please be quiet as we may be sleeping.

We are happy to have you prepare your own food in the kitchen and these is always space in the freezer and fridge etc.

name: Bedroom in flat opposite Victoria park, E3.
summary: From the flat you can see the park, lake and are opposite the Cafe in the park which offers breakfasts,lunches, great coffee.  Lots of light from huge Georgian windows. Neighbourhood is friendly, full of life. There are art galleries, a lido, markets (Brick Lane is a short bus ride away) and loads of transport links.
space: A single bedroom in a family flat opposite Victoria Park. Set on the top floor of a Victorian house in a leafy area, with large windows and plenty of natural light, the flat has great treetop views over Victoria Park opposite. Your room has a comfortable bed, wardrobe space, and all all towels and bedlinen are provided for your comfort. You will have access to a shared family bathroom with bath tub. Also at your disposal is the family lounge with TV and wifi, and also our kitchen where you can make tea and coffee, or prepare yourself some breakfast (or maybe take advantage of one of the many great nearby cafes for a traditional Full English breakfast!) name: Great apartment in Hackney.
space: A spacious, ground floor flat in a modern development in Hackney with all mod cons. Suitable for two people. Located between Clissold Park and Finsbury Park, and close to a reservoir, this is a great area to relax in the heart of London. We are close to Angel Islington & Stoke Newington Church street, which both offer loads to do and have a great choice of cool places to eat. Great local pub nearby and a corner shop. It is located in centrally, perfect to see all the sites in London or to visit the Olympic Park.

name: Characterful 2 Bed with Large Terrace - Zone 1
summary: The property comprises two stunning Victorian double bedrooms, reception room, spacious kitchen, amazing bathroom, and a very large roof terrace to the rear. Further features include wooden flooring, large windows and feature fireplaces. The apartment forms part of the attractive and sought-after 'Pullens Buildings' which is considered to be of architectural and historic interest. Elephant and Castle and Kennington both just a 7 minute walk away.
space: Amenities:  - 24/7 guest support - Professionally cleaned - Hotel-quality bed linen and towels - 24/7 check-in as there is a lockbox with the keys Fully equipped kitchen: - Oven - Stove - Refrigerator - Microwave - Toaster - Kettle - Plates & cutlery - Small table and dining chairs for 2 Master bedroom: - Double bed - Wardrobe - Chest of drawers - Chandelier  Second bedroom: - Double bed - Large wardrobe - Sofa - Desk - Fireplace Shared Bathroom: - Antique Victorian bath tub Separate WC Outdoor space: - 18 ft roof terrace with outstanding views

neighborhood_overview: Crampton Street is located off very central Penton Place and has the added benefit of a well maintained public garden on the south side. Kennington Underground station (Northern line) , Elephant and Castle Underground station (Bakerloo and Northern line) are very close by, plus bus services from Kennington Road and Walworth Road (London Bridge in 7 minutes) . 7 stops from the Olympics hot spot ( about 25 minutes) .  The Walworth Road offers a number of local amenities, shops and cafe's, as does nearby Kennington with some charming pubs. Elephant & Castle, formerly occupied by swathes of students, a new wave of young Londoners who might previously have chosen East or North London are now descending here, bringing a creative energy and new independent businesses with them such as those found in The Artworks hub (think yoga studios, Mauritian cafes, and vintage clothes shops). It’s rapidly becoming one of South London’s hottest places to live! Points of interest in Kennington: The Imperia
transit: Elephant and Castle train station has Thameslink services to Blackfriars, Farringdon and St Pancras. Walking distance to London Bridge, Waterloo, Westminster, Tower Bridge and Southbank.   Elephant & Castle has a large concentration of London bus routes — there are 29 services, including to King’s Cross, Liverpool Street, Shoreditch, Tottenham Court Road, Holborn and Oxford Circus. Cycle: For many locals, cycling is their main mode of transport. It only takes 15 minutes to cycle to Charing Cross and, even if you don’t have your own bike, Kennington has several Boris bike docking stations. Cycle Superhighway 7 from Morden to the City runs through Kennington. Getting away: London City Airport is only 45 minutes away via the DLR and Northern Line. Trains to Gatwick take less than an hour.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property.
house_rules: If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply. Please treat the home as you would your own. Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. No parties.

name: Charming Garden flat artistically decorated
summary: A beautiful spacious double bedroom garden flat boasting a newly designed kitchen and a second dining and living room under a glass extension facing a secluded mature garden. Centrally located in zone 2 near two underground stations the host provides you with information and and maps for sight-seeing.There are plenty of local restaurants , shops and pubs ,two parks with cafes, a climbing centre ,reservoirs sailing Kayaking and the Woodberry down nature reserve.
space: I am renting a double bedroom in my large, beautiful garden flat in a wonderful Georgian building with a large glass extension housing a second dining and sitting area.  The open plan living room has a sofa bed for extra guests and a second dining and living room under a glass extension facing a secluded mature garden. The perfect place to have a relaxing time whilst visiting London. The bedroom is cosy and newly decorated with ample wardrobe space.The bathroom has a bath ,new shower, sink and toilet which is kept clean at all times. I provide a hair dryer ,bedding and towels. Shampoo and shower gel will also be provided The flat is within a short walking distance to the travel hub of FINSBURY PARK (Zone 2) Victoria and Piccadilly Line Tube Trains and British Rail. It is also just a short tube train ride from all HEATHROW Terminals - Piccadilly Line to Finsbury Park (1.5hr) Door to door!  It also  takes just one hour to get to Gatwick  Airport  and Stanstead Airport from this location.

neighborhood_overview: Located in Zone 2 (North London, between Finsbury Park and Manor House underground stations) and between two lovely parks Finsbury Park and Clissold Park next to Stoke Newington Church Street with lovely cafes and many vintage shops.  Either self-cater or eat out at one of the many exotic restaurants just around the corner and down the road with many choices – Mauritian, vegetarian Indian, Indian, Thai, Caribbean, or Turkish, Italian, Greek and more! The local pub the Brownswood has real ales and good old English pub food. A short bus journey or taxi ride will bring you to Upper Street, Islington; Kingsland Road, Dalston and the many hotspots of Hoxton, Shoreditch, Hackney and The City, or the serenity of Hampstead Heath. Clissold Leisure Centre with its excellent public facilities which include swimming pools, gymnasium and squash courts, is a short walk across the park.
notes: Guests can also use my washing machine and ironing equipment. There are parking permits which are £5 per day ,just let me know if needed before you arrive
transit: There is street parking which requires payment on weekdays and at weekends during events at the nearby Emirates Stadium - home of Arsenal Football Club. The closest tube is 7 minutes walk with direct access to London's West End, King's Cross St Pancras and Heathrow Airport. Connections are easy for other London airports such as Gatwick, Stansted and Luton. Local buses provide alternative transport to parts of London such as The City, London Bridge, Islington, Hackney, Whitechapel and Waterloo. The ground floor garden flat is located 7 minutes walk from Manor House tube, Piccadilly Line, which takes twenty minutes to Piccadilly Circus/Soho/Covent Garden. Additionally, local buses within a 30 second walk provide quick routes to Old Street, Hackney, Dalston, Shoreditch, Islington, the City, London Bridge and Waterloo.
access: Guests have full access to all areas
house_rules: Please make sure you lock up properly when leaving the flat. Replace any objects that you have damaged. Take care not to spill any liquids on the sofas in the living rooms. Please keep communal areas kitchen and bathroom clean after use. Please turn the heating off when going out.

name: Room Zone 2 Lewisham with ensuite
summary: Quiet room in leafy area, and only 20 minutes to Central London.
space: A beautiful, clean, 1930s home in a contemporary, Asian style with a spacious double bedroom. Own shower room & toilet on the ground floor. The kitchen has a table and breakfast bar with fabulous views over East London. There is wifi throughout the house.  I live here with my cat Betty and work from home. The double room has a double bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, side table, lamp, TV with Freesat and DVD player.  There's a fan available if the weather's hot. There's a foldaway bed for a third person.  The house is 50m from a beautiful park with incredible views of London and has free tennis courts, table tennis, and fitness equipment and is great for a morning run or walk. Five minutes’ walk away is Ladywell Village with a cafe, an award-winning deli and local pub. There are three markets within walking distance selling everything from clothes to artisan foods. The house is situated in an extremely quiet, tree-lined street and has just been voted one of the top ten quietest streets

neighborhood_overview: Hackney -  Hackney is one of London’s most diverse, creative and historic boroughs. It has more green space than any other inner-London borough including Haggerston Park, London Fields, Hackney Marshes, and more. Diversity has created a thriving cultural quarter all around Hackney with theatre, cinema, festivals and a cutting edge music scene and nightlife. The famous Hackney Empire puts on a wide variety of entertainment including plays, children’s pantomine and opera. The Rio Cinema is one of the few independent and community run cinemas in the country; and of course there is Sutton House – a Tudor hunting lodge restored by the National Trust is located in Homerton. If you cannot find your favourite food in Hackney then you’re not trying. There are food stores and restaurants from almost every part of the world. From Vietnam to the Caribbean, West Africa to Turkey, or Italy to China, Hackney has them all. Close to central Hackney, Broadway Market has become a growing hub of community
notes: The flat is located in a quiet residential block overlooking the River Lea canal, Middlesex Filter Beds Local Nature Reserve and surrounded by park land either side so no noisy roads keeping you awake at night.
transit: Clapton is conveniently located in zone 2 and offers easy access to the rest of London. I highly recommend bus travel to/from my place, as it is easy, cheap and convenient: direct bus connections to London Bridge, Euston, Kings Cross,  Oxford Street. Numbers 38, 48, 55 and 56 drop you off directly outside the flat. Otherwise,  Clapton overground station is  a 10 minute walk away with easy access to the city, just 8 minutes by train to Liverpool Street and the delights of Shoreditch.

name: Spacious 3Bed Apartment | Shoreditch, East London
summary: A larger than average three bedroom apartment  in a modern development with access to an amazing communal roof terrace with panoramic views across London. The property is bang in the middle of the thriving neighbourhoods of Shoreditch and Bethnal Green so you are spoilt for choice whether you are looking for bustling cafes, boutique shops or great restaurants. Both Bethnal Green and Hoxton stations are with in a 10 minute walk so exploring the city couldn't be easier.
space: **Please note there is no internet at the property**  This functional space is a great base for exploring East London. Based on the 4th floor of a modern development with a secure entry door system and lift access. The main living area is open plan with a kitchen, lounge and dining area. The kitchen is fitted with all essential amenities so you can whip up a home cooked meal. The comfy sofa is the perfect place to sit back and relax and catch up on your favourite programmes on the Freeview TV after a long day exploring the city.  There are two spacious double bedrooms and one single bedroom, all with plenty of room to unpack you belongings and make yourself at home during your stay. The cleaners will place fresh, hotel-quality linen on the beds before your arrival. With two bathrooms and an extra toilet you won't need to fight to get ready for an evening out in the city. The bathrooms will be supplied with basic toiletries.

neighborhood_overview: Shoreditch is now one of London's most popular neighbourhoods where old brick warehouses transformed into interactive art galleries, and countless buildings have served as Banksy’s canvases. Shoreditch’s appeal as a creative playground stems (at least, in part) from an urban, gritty underbelly, but clean-cut treasures aren’t in short supply—Shoreditch’s design sensibilities also influence its trendy pubs and cafes. A triangle of influences have made Shoreditch into one of London’s most distinctive and unusual areas. To the East, Bangla-town and Brick Lane – London’s celebrated curry mile – are a riot of smells and colours from the Indian sub-continent. In the West, the looming towers of Liverpool Street and the City represent the world’s most concentrated area of money-making talent, where a number of sophisticated business hotels have sprung up. And right in the middle of it all is Spitalfields market, a citadel of the working classes and home of the cockney music hall tradition. The
notes: *Please note due to an Airbnb glitch internet is showing up as an amenity when there is no internet in the property. I have spoken to Airbnb about this and they are trying to remove this. There is the possibility that there will be an occasional visit from estate agents but we will contact you before the estate agent attends to make sure this is convenient.
transit: The flat is perfectly located to explore London with great transport connections, Bethnal Green (Central line) and Hoxton (Overground) Stations are   just a 10 minute walk, allowing you to get to some of London's best loved areas in no time: - It's a short stroll to Broadway Market (Sat) and Columbia Rd Flower Market (Sun), as well as all the boutique shops and cafes in nearby Shoreditch. - 15 minutes to Liverpool Street - 25 minutes to Oxford Street - 25 minutes to Waterloo and Southbank, with attractions such as the London eye and London Dungeons  - 28 minutes to London Victoria which is the best train station for access to Buckingham Palace - 30 minutes to Westminster, where you can see Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of parliament
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.

If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply

name: Double Room 15 mins from Olympics!
space: I'm planning to go abroad during the olympics so I'm putting my flat up on air bnb to try and balance out to the cost of going away.  It's a 15 minute journey to sStratford which is where the olympic site is, but it's alson only a 20 min tube into central london on the victoria line. It's also very close to Shoreditch/Dalston and the east end, which is where most of the trendy bars are. It's very close to Angel as well. Really for me this is the perfect place to live in London in terms of location, and the transport links are great.    The room is a spacious double room, with a bathroom opposite. All the usual amnities, washing machine, kitchen, with everything you'd expect. Free wireless included obviously.  I have two (Hidden by Airbnb) Romi (25) and Aylin (29). They are both really awesome and friendly and will help you get around london if you need. name: Cosy light room in Zone 2 (Oval)
space: Thanks for looking at my page.  If you are interested in staying here, would you very kindly not book the room before I have confirmed the dates are free.  Do note that I can only accept reservations from people who have a completed profile and photo and at least two types of verification. If you need any more information, please get in touch and I would be happy to write back!   Thanks very much. THE LOCATION:  The flat is in a quiet residential street off Clapham Road and between Oval and Stockwell tube stations.  It’s approximately 5-10 minutes walk to Oval Cricket Ground and approx.15-20 minutes walk to Vauxhall and the river. As well as the two tube stations (Oval is on the Northern Line; Stockwell is on the Victorian and Northern line), there are a couple of bus-stops within a few minutes walk where you can catch a number of buses able to take you into the centre of town and elsewhere incredibly quickly. Vauxhall overground station is also nearby. There are two local supermarkets

name: Room to let in Newham, London
space: We have a lovely spare double bedroom to let in our family home.  Your room has a very comfortable double bed, a wardrobe and lots of storage space. During your stay you will also have access to the common area in the house, including our fully fitted kitchen, our living room and our 100 foot back garden, which is a great space to enjoy warm summer nights! The house has wifi internet throughout. There is parking available on the street. This is a link-detached house in nice clean and quiet neighbourhood. In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay. The house is just a short walk from Gallions Reach Shopping Centre, and here you will find shops, and supermarket and a number of restaurants. The area also has excellent public transport via buses, the tube, and the DLR. The DLR is very convenient for travelling in The City (approximately 30 minutes to Bank Underground Station) and for Canary Wharf (just 20 minutes).  We are in a great location if you are visiting t

name: Central Good Value Apartment.
summary: Central London apartment.  Get a real taste of London life staying in Central Islington in a central residential area. Super easy to move around with many buses and two tube stations close by. Comfortable apartment suitable for those wanting to explore London staying in a good value place with home comforts. Also a good option for families with child, I can provide a cot and high chair.
space: Victorian house  conversion on a quiet tree lined street in a great residential neighbourhood with a busy high street and close to the two most important tube lines. It's clean bright and sunny with high ceilings. APARTMENT AMENITIES Super comfy bed with memory foam mattress plus everything you'll need for the best stay in a great part of London !  In the kitchen you have everything you'll need- tea, coffee, oven, fridge freezer, microwave, toaster, kettle and all the utensils! Clean towels and bed linen will be provided along with free fibre optic broadband for the fastest wifi connection and flatscreen tv with extra channels.  It's centrally located just 10mins from the 2 most important tube lines - Northern and Piccadilly. All the great areas such as Camden Town, Angel, Highgate and the beautiful Hampstead Heath all within easy reach. name: London, Atmospheric Bloomsbury Flat
summary: If you weren't able to book because of minimum renting times please feel free to send me a request. I can sometimes arrange exceptions.
space: This is a bright and airy second floor flat in a Georgian house. The open-plan lounge lounge and the bedroom can be separated by large sliding doors. The lounge and kitchen to the front overlook Regent Square, while the bedroom to the rear is south facing over St.Georges Gardens so the flat is surrounded by mature trees. A mix of original features, modern design and some art give the flat its sophisticated but cosy atmosphere.  LOCATION  :  Central London, in short walking distance from Russel Square station (Picadilly line, direct connection from Heathrow 50-60 min.) and only a short walk from Kings Cross/St.Pancras intl.(direct connection from Gatwick and Luton 50-80 min, most underground lines, national rail and Eurostar. It’s in 20-min.walking distance to Soho, Covent Garden and Oxford Street. By tube its 2 stops to Covent Garden and 3 stops to Leicester Square. Cycle hire station 3 min. walk.

house_rules: This is my private home, I welcome my guests to participate in a very personal atmosphere and feel like at home.  I will ask you to treat it with care.  It's an absolute non-smoking zone.  I personally love dogs and cats very much but the flat is not suitable for pets. The prices are same for one or two people. Upon request you can bring a third guest. I usually travel out of the UK when I'm renting out and will adjust my traveling times to yours. Your arrival and departure times therefore are fairly flexible. I might leave some hours before and get back some hours after your scheduled arrival times. In that case you can easily get into the flat by code. (detailed explanation after booking )

name: Great flat, very close to tube
space: Contemporary apartment in purpose-made block of flats with porter and lift. Unrivalled location allowing to easily reach all parts of London Literally 2 mn walk from Finchley Road tube station (direct lines to St Pancras/City/West End/Canary Wharf and beyond).  The flat has full amenities: wifi Internet access, cable TV, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, master bedroom with large doubel bed and en suite bathroom, guest bathroom, very comfortable lounge area, and much more. A large Waitrose supermarket with extended opening hours is located on the ground floor of the same building.  Safe yet lively neighbourhood with very good public transport (including direct bus connections to Stansted and Luton airports), retail (5 mn walk to O2 shopping centre, with Virgin Active health club providing monthly membership) as well as a large selection of high street shops along Finchley Road, and a good choice of restaurants and pubs within walking distance. house_rules: A high-end flat for discerning travellers who are going to use it as their own and leave it in the same state as they have found it. Weekly cleaning during your stay can be arranged upon request.  While the apartment is not recommended for occupation by more than two people, up to one additional short-term guest could sleep on a sofa in the study or lounge area if necessary. To be used as private residence only. No smoking or pets allowed.  Keys will usually be made available to guests through the porter, and prior confirmation of expected arrival time is required. Check-in and check-out outside the porter's normal working hours (i.e. very early morning, late evening, public holidays) should be discussed on a case-by-case basis.

name: Stylish Apartment In Central London
space: I just refurbished my flat to a fantastic spec.  It has 1 master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom, equipped with walk in shower, cast iron bath, and private loo.   The spare bedroom has been converted to a nursery, so this room will be off limits for guests. There is a W/C for guests.  And, the open plan kitchen/dining room has a couch as well.   My flat is located in Marylebone - you can't get more central than that!  Steps away from Regents Park and Hyde Park, not to mention all the shopping on Oxford Street and Bond Street.   But, most importantly, access to public transportation is top notch.  All tube lines are within walking distance - getting around couldn't be easier or more convenient from here.   Likewise, Marylebone boasts one of best high streets in London with boutiques, restaurants, and gourmet food stores.  Free wifi included along with cable.

neighborhood_overview: Marylebone boasts one of the best high streets in the UK, aptly called Marylebone High Street.  If you are a foodie, there are restaurants to suit your every craving:  Fairuz (Lebanese), Fischer's (Austrian), Grazing Goat (Gastro Pub), Il Baretto (Italian), Orrery (French), Trishna (modern Indian), and the list goes on and on and on.  We also have a Farmers' Market on Sundays, a Waitrose Grocery Store, a Daylesford Farm Store, and specialty shops like The Ginger Pig (butcher) and La Fromagerie (cheese shop) if you are so inclined.  If you like to shop, all the top boutiques can be found on the High Street, and Selfridges is just steps away (not to mention the endless shopping available on Oxford Street, Regent Street, and Bond Street).  If you like the outdoors, Marylebone is bordered by Regents Park on the north and Hyde Park on the southwest.  We have a peppering of garden squares throughout including Paddington Gardens and Cavendish Square.  Soho, Mayfair and Fitzrovia are a hop, sk
transit: The following tube stations are all equidistant from my flat:  Oxford Circus, Great Portland Place, Regents Park, Bond Street and Baker Street.  Nearly every tube line in London is on your doorstep.  Whether you're in London for work, to see the sights, or to visit friends, Marylebone is literally the most convenient neighborhood in town.  You can walk nearly everywhere.  Public transport is a breeze.  And, if you prefer to be driven, cabs are aplenty; Uber is always around.  Use my promotional code (MANYAK) to get £10 off your first ride.
access: My flat is actually a 2 bedroom / 3 bathroom flat, but I have converted the guest room (and it's ensuite shower room) into baby quarters, so I'm afraid guests won't have access to the nursery.  For the purposes of AirBNB, only the master bedroom, master bathroom, a W/C, the utility room, and of course, the kitchen/reception area will be available.

name: BEAUTIFUL HOUSE IN SPITALFIELDS
space: Eighteenth century, five floor, panelled town house built by French Huguenot silk weavers in 1722. Open fires in every room, creaking wooden flooboards, flag stoned kitchen, and a high walled back garden filled with a riot of aromatic plants. You will be staying in a gorgeous, atmospheric attic bedroom with a four poster double bed, and private bathroom for the exclusive use of our bed and breakfast guests.  This stunning home, which has featured in numerous advertising campaigns and design magazines is in the chic, centrally located district of Spitalfields, moments away from Liverpool Street tube station and Bishopsgate. The restaurants and clubs of Shoreditch are within easy walking distance, and the Spitalfields International Music Festival is held in Christ Church opposite. Lie in the bath and gaze through the skylights at Hawksmoor's architectural masterpiece! Wander the stone paved streets in the footsteps of Shakespeare, Wren, and Jack the Ripper.  Bed and breakfast guests have

name: Luxury En Suite Room from £40 pn
space: Available for you to rent is a room in a luxurious house with a separate  bathroom for the room. There is one double bed and single (folding) bed in the room so it can accommodate 3 adults. The accommodation is located very close to public transport and an underground station which can take you to central London in 15-17 mins. Preston Road Underground station on the Metropolitan Line is a just a short walk away, or Wembley Central overground station, is around 1km away. House itself is located in an affluent residential locality and includes a fully equipped kitchen with laundry facilities. There  is parking available outside. A wireless internet connection is included in the price. In the local area you will find plenty of amenities including supermarkets, banks, takeaways and pubs. There is also a park close by if you want a bit of greenery. Please just send me a message if you have any questions.

name: Five bedroom modern and chic apartment
summary: Price negotiable. Ideal for two couples with or with out children. Please note two of the single bedrooms are children's rooms with high sleeper beds. Please see pictures.
space: Our apartment is part of the striking Queensbridge Quarter, a new development in Dalston/London Fields. It is spacious, bright and stylish with a fantastic spacious private garden. It is on a residential street.  It is beautifully fitted and equipped with all mod cons and spotless. Quiet and secure. 10 minute walk to Broadway Market with all it's trendy pubs restaurants and shops. 5 minute walk to Dalston Junction connecting to tube. Very nearby popular gastro pubs. 25 minute walk into the city. We also have a dedicated secure bike shed attached to the apartment with room to store up to 5/6 bikes. GUEST ROOMS: The apartment consists of 5 bedrooms, three of which are children's. The master bedroom has an ensuite. APARTMENT: The apartment is exceptionally light and spotlessly clean. All appliances are top end brands. The neighbours are quiet and friendly. The newly extended living and dining areas benefit from two double french windows both leading on to the beautiful garden. name: 2/3 BEDROOM  HAMPSTEAD VILLAGE NW3 FLAT
summary: Hampstead is a highly sought after area known for its intellectual, artistic, musical and literary associations. The area has retained most of its village atmosphere and charm and offers its occupants excellent cultural attractions such as Freud Museum, Keats House, Kenwood House featured in the film Notting Hill and also home to many major open-air concerts. Hampstead Heath is a main attraction for people looking to visit Hampstead, the 790 acre parkland boasts 3 open air swimming areas.

name: Stylish room in trendy Bethnal Green heart of East
summary: New to London and want to explore the vibrant east-end or just need a convenient clean place to stay for work? This is my spare room in an East London 2 bed flat I call home which is cosy, comfy and stylish. Excellent Transport links (3 mins walk to Bethnal Green tube) gets you to city and Central London fast!  Discover & fall in love with Trendy East London hotspots such as local markets, green spaces, art galleries, bars, coffee shops and restaurants and our very own V&A childhood museum!
space: My spare room is available to stay now that my long term flat mate has left after 3 humble fun years.  It’s a good size simply Furnished double room and a good place for a rest after a long day of exploring London or hard day in the office. Share the 2 bed flat with myself and my partner we both work 8am - 6pm during the week and on weekends we like to explore our local neighbourhood or relax at home and occasionally socialise.  Neutral Decor throughout flat Open Plan Living area/Kitchen Shared Bathroom is clean and tidy There is TV and WiFi available though admittedly rather slow!

neighborhood_overview: Arty, Cool, laid back, Bethnal Green is the real East London gem.  Excellent Good markets close by from brick lane to broadway market and the famous Columbia road flower market.  An array of traditional pubs spoil you, open Green spaces, easy connections, diversity, bars/clubs, cocktail bars, galleries and museums, coffee shops, art galleries, comedy clubs and so many restaurants and cafes to choose from. .   Eat Eat japanese, Italian, English, indian, turkish, and have craft beer literally 5-10 mins from the flat! Vegan and halal all close by!  Stay in Heart of East London, close to the vibrant Shoreditch, famous Brick lane, Liverpool Street, Trendy Hackney, very near Victoria Park , a nice stroll to Broadway market on Saturdays and Columbia Road flower market on Sundays.. whitechapel Gallery is close by too!  Old Ford road has hidden cafes, restaurants and takes you to Victoria Park. Cambridge Heath Road leads you to Hackney with its local cinema and array of Vietnamese and Turkish r
notes: My 20 Year old chesterfield sofa  - Family heritage for you vintage lovers! Please help yourself to tea/coffee and jams and cereal for breakfast. Bethnal Green Tube (Central line)  is 3 mins walk taking you to Central London in 15 mins. The overground is also 3 mins away taking you to all parts of London.  Whitechapel tube station (district line) is 8 mins walk away taking you to Victoria and West London conveniently. There is a bus stop 30 seconds from the flat (254, 106) taking you to many places in London and the number 8 bus on Bethnal Green road takes you to central London.   Local Cab firm is very reasonable and black cabs are often available in the area and of course Uber!  Many people cycle and there are the bikes for hire 1 mins from the flat.  I live in the apartment with my partner  but we are both working professionals so will probably only see you in the evenings perhaps. On the weekends I am very sociable and know the lovely East London very well so happy to give you some
transit: Bethnal Green Tube station is 3-4 mins walk.  Its the Central line which takes you to Central London in 15 Minutes. Whitechapel Station is also 8 mins walk away with a variety of tube lines (District and circle line and Overground) An array of buses (phone number hidden))
access: Double room with comfy double bed  -all bedlinen and fresh towels provided. Simply furnished with book shelf, desk, chair, chest of drawers, double wardrobe and lamp. Laminate flooring and spotlights with gas central heating. Open plan kitchen/living room with washing machine, microwave, coffee machine. Bathroom comprises of a bathtub and shower head, basin and toilet.  Toiletries can be provided on request.
house_rules: Please take outdoor footwear once you enter flat and leave inside the hallway.  Please reduce noise after 10.30pm on weekdays and after midnight on weekends.  Please turn off all electrics when not in use (lights, power). No smoking in the flat but you can outside the Juliette Balcony Please do not use anything that doesn't belong to you without asking first

name: Beautiful Family Home North London
summary: Please note, our house is only usually available during the school summer holidays as it is occupied the rest of the year.   Many thanks and Happy House Hunting!
space: A lovely luxury 4 bedroom family home in North London, the perfect base to have when visiting London with easy access and a multitude of alternative routes and journeys for getting into Central London.  The house benefits from four good sized bedrooms, one of which  has a balcony.  A great open plan fully equipped kitchen and dinner plus spacious, airy sitting room.  It also includes wireless internet and cable TV.  Situated between two close tube lines (Northern and Piccadilly) and overground stations, getting to the main Olympic Park will take roughly 40 minutes to get to from Oakleigh Station.   Many local shops and amenities are close by,  plus it will only 25 minutes by tube into the centre of London. Off road parking and a larger than average London garden in this quiet leafy enclave of North London. name: Peaceful room in Shepherds Bush
summary: A comfortable room in a ground floor flat with spacious gardens, convenient for transport links to all parts of London. Very near to shops, pubs and restaurants, Westfield shopping mall, music venues, cinemas and the famous Bush theatre.
space: A conveniently located room in a 2 bedroom flat. The flat is on the ground floor of a redbrick Edwardian mansion block in a quiet tree lined street. It has a private patio and lovely garden with lawn and trees. The room has a single bed, chest of drawers, wardrobe, desk and chair, TV and unlimited WIFI. The flat has central heating.  The bathroom is fitted with a large bathtub with a shower over it, wash basin and WC. There is space for guests to keep their toiletries in the bathroom. Towels are provided. There is use of a kettle, toaster and microwave in a pleasant kitchen overlooking the garden. The kitchen has a table and chairs.  The immediate area is quiet but minutes from local shops, supermarkets, pubs and cafes.

The immediate area is quiet but minutes from local shops, supermarkets, pubs and cafes. Guests have access to the bathro
neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush is a lively neighbourhood in the West of London. It has green, open spaces as well as many independent pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants. It is home to the Bush Theatre one of London's most famous fringe theatres, which is based in a Victorian building that was once the library. By Shepherds Bush Green is the Shepherds Bush Empire, a music venue where many famous artists perform.There are more intimate music venues such as the Bush Hall, which has a restaurant next door.  Most of the residential area was built in the late 19th and early 20th century, in recent years  land behind the Central Line station was developed to create the the biggest shopping centre in Europe-Westfield, with its designer shops and wide range of restaurants, it is the perfect place if you love shopping. In contrast there is a bustling market underneath the arches of the Hammersmith and City Line, where you can buy just about anything. It is only a fifteen to twenty minute walk to the River Thames
notes: Please note - this is not a designer showroom flat. It is clean and tidy but it is an old building. We like to think it has character, we have interesting objects and artefacts. One day the flat will have a make over but its time hasn't come yet, don't book if you want modern designer living!
transit: One of the best things about staying here is how easy it is to travel to all parts of the city and also to the major stations and airports. There is a choice of underground and overground stations and many frequent buses. Within walking distance is the centre of Shepherds Bush with theatres, clubs, cinemas, music venues, pubs, cafes, market, and shops of all descriptions, including the enormous Westfield shopping mall.  It is easy to get to all parts of London using local public transport. A short walk to Uxbridge Rd where there are buses to Shepherds Bush Market Station, Westfield Shopping Centre and Shepherds Bush Central Line and Overground. A short walk to Goldhawk Rd for the 94 bus to Picadilly Circus, and the 237 to Shepherds Bush. On the opposite side of Goldhawk Rd - with the traffic heading west, the 94 and 237 go to Turnham Green and Chiswick for shops and cafes-remember stay on the right hand side of the road for Central London. It is written on the bus stop sign. The buses
access: Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen and garden which are shared with one other person.
house_rules: Maximum length of stay is 1 month. If you have a friend to stay the night let me know so I'm aware of who is in the house. Please leave everything clean and tidy when you use the kitchen.

name: Great Quirky Twin room in Wimbledon
space: Welcome to my lovely Wimbledon home, which is on the ground floor, so no stairs to battle with!  and perfect for the Tennis and visiting London during the year. When you stay with me this is your home for the length of your stay, so please treat it with respect.   This is a cosy bedroom which has a unique fitted wardrobe, designed by myself (hence the "Quirky" bit!) and can accommodate  two guests comfortably. The room can be configured either as a twin or a double room, as when the beds are pushed together they form a SuperKing bed. Guests are treated to very comfy pocket-sprung beds, as well as fresh towels and linen. There's Wi-Fi internet and the room has a TV with Freeview channels.  Help-yourself breakfast, if wished, is included in the price. You are also welcome to use the kitchen - as long as you tidy up after! The house has one shared bathroom with a loo, bath, bidet and shower, and there's also a separate loo with a wash basin. I also have a lovely big garden and a summerhou

name: Comfy B&B with Wifi & TV Wimbledon
space: Great single bedroom in Wimbledon, perfect for the Tennis and visiting London during the year. Includes breakfast on request.  This room  (which has it's own tv and wi-fi internet connection) overlooks my lovely big garden at the back of the house, where there is also a summerhouse (also a fun option to stay in) I live in a peaceful area but within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants and transport. We are fortunate in having train, tram, underground and good bus services that will take you easily wherever you wish to go. Wimbledon has its own theatre - which is now a designated West End theatre, so means that we have all the top productions. There is also the famous Polka theatre which produces performances especially for younger children (over  ninety thousand children a year come to Polka!) name: Fun Summer Garden Room - Wimbledon
space: Welcome to my lovely Wimbledon home, perfect for the Tennis and visiting London. When you stay with me this is your home for the length of your stay. I have a lovely summer house in my large garden, which is perfect for the Summer. Traditionally they were built as a sheltered refuge from the heat of the day,  or in the case of husbands/wives looking for a bit of switch-off time, a perfect place to curl up with a book and a glass of wine, sketch or listen to music . The summer house (which has electricity) has a small double bed with a bedside table and lamp, and a small wardrobe, with an oak table (mini fridge/tea & coffee facilities) and two wicker armchairs, and can accomodate up to 2 guests, as long as you don't have a lot of luggage! It is a fun option for staying in London. I have also had a guest staying this January when it was snowing who was very happy and booked  again for a return visit. summary: • Contemporary designed basement apartment in a leafy quiet residential area. Bright, airy and tastefully decorated. Comfortable, clean and impeccably presented. Restaurants and shops easily accessible on foot.  Excellent transport links to central London.
space: • Contemporary designed basement apartment in an Edwardian house in Muswell Hill, North London. Fully fitted modern open-plan kitchen/lounge with ample built-in storage and bedroom overlooking outdoor deck. Bright, airy and tastefully decorated with neutral walls and hard wood floors throughout. Comfortable, clean and impeccably presented. Located in a leafy quiet residential street, with excellent transport links to central London that is less than 30 mins hour away, all touristic areas, and the London financial district. Very easy access to Kings Cross /St Pancreas and all London airports. We are surrounded by beautiful parks . Queens Woods and Highgate Woods are on the doorstep for walks & jogging, Alexandra Palace, is a short stroll from the house. neighborhood_overview: Muswell Hill Broadway and Fortis Green Road, the main shopping streets, still maintain their historic character with most of the original facades preserved above street level. Some parts have spectacular views over London, and the area is home to a large number of actors, journalists and other media people. There is also a weekly farmers' market at the foot of Muswell Hill in Alexandra Park. The cinema is art deco, built in the 1930s. This area has an abundance of things to keep you entertained and satisfied and all in comfort, safety and style. A great base to explore London. Close to Alexandra Park and Highgate Woods, with a village atmosphere and mainly Edwardian buildings. Muswell Hill has developed from the staid suburb it was in the 1950s to become fashionable with a host of trendy bars, restaurants, coffee shops and delicatessens. Muswell Hill is located in the London borough of Haringey. Haringey is famous for its literary connections such as Sir John Betjeman, who lived in Wes
notes: Languages: I speak Spanish, and Portuguese. Also understand some Italian. Free parking in our street.
transit: There is good transport into central London. Frequent buses stop at the top of our road, going to West End or the City. Nearest underground is Highgate (Zone 3), 10 minutes walk or a two minute bus ride.

We try to keep things very friendly. Here  just a few rules for a perfect experience: - We have beautiful wooden floors, we ask you to please take your shoes off and leave them on the shoe rack by the entrance. It keeps the flat cleaner for everyone. No wearing of Stilettos or any sharp heals in-doors . No spilling of liquids or leaving wet or dripping clothes on the wooden floor. No scraping of luggage across the floor.  - Please be careful and conscientious when using the iron. Make sure it is turn off after use, and no water/steam is spilling onto the floor. - We will ask you please not to smoke. name: My London Holiday Home - Royal Arsenal Riverside
summary: A luxury 2 bedroom apartment in the historic and picturesque Royal Arsenal Riverside, located South East of the River Thames, close to the O2, Excel centre, London City Airport and Greenwich . The apartment has been described as a hotel from home as it's welcoming, bright, deceivingly spacious and furnished to a high standard with convenience and comfort in mind. The neighbourhood is a heritage site steeped in history, with a blend of modern and restored buildings, within a vibrant community.
space: Located in the heart of Royal Arsenal Riverside development across the river from Canary Wharf and the City, the apartment is close proximity to the O2 arena, Greenwich market and direct access to Kent (known as England's garden) as well as the hot tourist spots of Central London.  It's perfect for a  welcoming return after a day's sightseeing in London, visiting friends and family or as an access point to Kent - England's garden city. Woolwich Arsenal is a colourful and traditional neighbourhood that boasts one of the oldest markets in South London.  So, whether it's a peaceful ramble around the park admiring the architecture or a visit to the local museum or eateries, the area provides an ideal place to relax and unwind. The apartment is in a Grade I and II listed development with historic buildings that have bold new modern architecture. The area boasts: • Green open spaces  • Young's pub and dining  • Marks & Spencers, Sainsbury's, Tesco Express and a local farmers market all withi
description: A luxury 2 bedroom apartment in the historic and picturesque Royal Arsenal Riverside, located South East of the River Thames, close to the O2, Excel centre, London City Airport and Greenwich . The apartment has been described as a hotel from home as it's welcoming, bright, deceivingly spacious and furnished to a high standard with convenience and comfort in mind. The neighbourhood is a heritage site steeped in history, with a blend of modern and restored buildings, within a vibrant community. Located in the heart of Royal Arsenal Riverside development across the river from Canary Wharf and the City, the apartment is close proximity to the O2 arena, Greenwich market and direct access to Kent (known as England's garden) as well as the hot tourist spots of Central London.  It's perfect for a  welcoming return after a day's sightseeing in London, visiting friends and family or as an access point to Kent - England's garden city. Woolwich Arsenal is a colourful and traditional neighbourhood

Tesco Express on 10 Major Draper St, London SE18 6TF 2. Tesco Extra on Grand Depot Road, Woolwich SE18 6HQ Pubs and bars: 1. The Taproom on 15 Major Draper Street, London 2. transit: Use TFL or citymapper as a journey planner.  The nearest station is Woolwich Arsenal which has a DLR station and a Train station.  There are also plenty of buses all within 7 minutes walk. Alternatively hop on the Thames River Bus (Thames Clipper) which is just a 3 minute walk to the Royal Arsenal Pier.  To get there, when you come out of the apartment turn left and take the lift or stairs out.  You will find yourself at the entrance closest to an estate agents.  Cross the road and carry on walking straight until you approach the river.  The thames clipper pier will be on your left.

summary: A unique garden maisonette in Hackney, Dalston with private entrance, split over two floors and flooding with light. Large windows, high ceilings and wooden floors throughout. Scandinavian feel. Open-plan kitchen, private car park. The maisonette has its own private entrance so it feels like being in a house. Main bedroom is very quiet and faces the garden. Suitable for people visiting family and friends who live in the area. Welcome!

name: Spacious Ensuite Room: Great Area
space: This inviting en-suite double room in a two bedroom ground floor flat. It is set within a stunning Adelaide Wharf development with concierge, cleaner, communal gardens and excellent location.The flat enjoys its own balcony overlooking the Regent's Canal, well-proportioned living space and contemporary décor. The property comprises of a bright and airy reception room with open-plan kitchen and access to balcony, sizeable master bedroom with en suite bathroom, second double bedroom, second sleek bathroom and good storage. The flat has a 50inch HD TV in the living room and two smaller TVs in each bedroom. There is also Sky Plus HD (Sports & Movies) and broadband.  Haggerston Station (London Overground line) is only 5mins walk and there are also a number of reliable bus routes into the City, Docklands and West End. The flat offers a convenient location with 5-10mins walking distance from the wealth of bars, cafes, boutique shops and exhibitions of Broadway Market, Brick Lane, Columbia flow

name: Luxury single room
space: Need place to stay whilst away from home ?....... then look no further  I'm offering a luxury single room in modern newly refurbished 3 bed Bungalow close to Wembley stadium. The bungalow has wooden flooring through out plus heated flooring. During your stay you are welcome to make use of  the Kitchen which is open plan complete with all mod-cons,Dining area with sky lights leading out to the decking area ,Internet(Wi-Fi) and utility room Washer/Dryer. The bungalow is Ideally situated only a short distance away from Wembley Stadium and 30 minutes from Heathrow  , yet still only 30 minutes by tube from the heart of London. We are based in the heart of a multicultural location, with a wonderful selection of restaurants ,bars and shopping centres all just a short distance away from the Bungalow. Free on street parking is available for duration of your stay. Please fell free to contact me for any questions regarding my Bungalow. This is a non smoking household. No pets allowed .

name: Olympic rental with view of stadium
space: Bright, spacious, modern apartment. Only 10 mins walk from Olympic stadium. Two bedrooms, open plan kitchen and living room. Children welcome. Outside patio area for dining out and barbecues. Wi-fi, Sky TV. Yards from excellent park which will be hosting a range of festivals and screenings of Olympic events. Shops and public transport links to central London are all nearby. An excellent location for the Olympic park and all that East London has to offer. Trendy Shoreditch, Hoxton and Brick Lane are all within easy reach. Lovely Victoria Park village nearby for pubs, restaurants, boutique shops and deli's. Europes largest shopping centre is also a 20 minute walk or short bus ride away. London Cycle Hire docking point is round the corner if you want to explore by bike or take a ride down the canal to Islington or Camden.

name: Quirky & cool. Bright & cheery.
summary: My colourful house is reflective of my own style and the title for my listing sums it up perfectly! The room available to rent is lovely and quiet and furnished in a contemporary style with original fireplace, painted white floorboards and a view out to my rear garden.
space: This friendly house is situated on a lovely tree-lined street in an upmarket area of southwest London. Owned by a graphic designer, it's a unique and interesting place to stay with distinctive interior features and a wonderful 'contemporary style' rear garden - perfect for chilling out after exploring London's bustling streets and attractions, or visiting any of the many local amenities that East Sheen and Mortlake have to offer.  The accommodation includes a bright double bedroom that overlooks the quiet rear garden, with a well designed modern bathroom just down the hallway, (shared with host). ADDITIONAL INFO Although breakfast isn't officially provided, if you need your cup of coffee as soon as you wake up, there's a great Nespresso coffee machine in the room. You're welcome to tea or coffee downstairs in the kitchen too, or you can bring your own breakfast and make use of the kitchen and garden  - I can highly recommend the bakery just down the road offering delicious croissants a

neighborhood_overview: Just down the road you'll find great local independent shops and eateries, Richmond Park (the largest of London's wonderful Royal Parks) and the lovely pubs and walks along the river. Also close by is the renowned Kew Gardens and the pretty riverside neighbourhoods of Richmond or Barnes with their interesting shops, restaurants and pubs.
notes: The room comes with its own private Nespresso coffee machine so coffee lovers will be happy!
transit: TRANSPORT: The house is located in South West London just south of the river Thames and west of Hammersmith. It's within easy reach of London with quick access by train (25 minutes) to the much loved South Bank area (next to Waterloo Station), via nearby Barnes or Mortlake Stations. Hammersmith tube station is a quick 15 minute bus ride away too (depending on traffic), providing all sorts of public transport options, making it easy to get to or from Heathrow airport or onward to different parts of London. Hammersmith Bridge has recently closed for refurbishment and during that time you do need to walk across the bridge as buses aren't able to travel across it. It's about a 10 minute walk. As Londoners, we are all hooked on the easy method of getting around town using a pre-paid 'oyster' card or you can use your 'contactless' credit/debit card too. Guests can easily purchase travel cards at a nearby shop, next to the bus stop, if needed.
access: Guests are invited to make use of all the communal living areas and the free wifi. Parking is available in the street, should you need it, and there are no parking restrictions. Guests staying for more than a few days are welcome to use the washer and dryer, if needed, just ask.
house_rules: Come and go freely but be considerate of making early morning or late night noise. Make proper use of the house alarm system when you enter/leave. Leave your room and the house in the condition you find it on arrival. Above all, enjoy yourself in the house!

name: August in east London
summary: Probably the best view in east London, overlooking the Olympic Park, now available for a week in August. Discount offered for a week booking.
space: The flat is available for a week in August, with a minimum stay of 5 day preferred. Here's a bit about the flat: It's got the most fantastic views over London. You can see all the landmarks, from Canary Wharf, over the Gherkin, to the London Eye.  Best is the view over the new Olympic Park - spectacular.  It's a newly-built flat just 5 minutes walking distance to Olympic Stadium, 10 mins to the Aquatic Centre. Located in Hackney Wick on the 9th floor, sitting room has floor to ceiling windows, and a south facing balcony. The flat is filled with light. Modern kitchen and bathroom with all the things you'd expect. Hackney Wick, is filled with artists' studios, and old warehouses, with a few busy places for coffee, drinks and food, including The Hackney Pearl, Foremans, and Crate. description: Probably the best view in east London, overlooking the Olympic Park, now available for a week in August. Discount offered for a week booking. The flat is available for a week in August, with a minimum stay of 5 day preferred. Here's a bit about the flat: It's got the most fantastic views over London. You can see all the landmarks, from Canary Wharf, over the Gherkin, to the London Eye.  Best is the view over the new Olympic Park - spectacular.  It's a newly-built flat just 5 minutes walking distance to Olympic Stadium, 10 mins to the Aquatic Centre. Located in Hackney Wick on the 9th floor, sitting room has floor to ceiling windows, and a south facing balcony. The flat is filled with light. Modern kitchen and bathroom with all the things you'd expect. Hackney Wick, is filled with artists' studios, and old warehouses, with a few busy places for coffee, drinks and food, including The Hackney Pearl, Foremans, and Crate. transit: Hackney Wick station is one stop from Stratford, and the area also connects to Shoreditch and Liverpool Street via the 388 and 26 bus, or to Dalston and Highbury via the 30 bus.  Free parking is available on Victoria Park Road close by, but the immediate area is residents parking only. Hackney Wick is easy to get to from all London airports, especially, City, and Stanstead Airport.

space: Hi,  Thank you for considering my place, which offers a private room with full access to all the other amenities and is a quiet flat that includes the bathroom, kitchen, and living room. West Hampstead is quaint, with a village feel and a community atmosphere. Even celebrities make their home here, including Emma Thompson and Little Britain's Matt Lucas. There are many charming and independent bars and restaurants with in walking distance. Another major attraction is the EMI Studios on the Abbey Road which is only a short bus ride away. Options for public transit include the underground (Jubilee Line, Zone 2); overground train; and Thameslink direct to Gatwick and Brighton. Bus lines include C11 to Hampstead; 328 to Chelsea; and 139 which brings you to the heart of the shopping district - Oxford Circus and Picadilly Circus, via Regent Street. name: Lovely home-excellent location-Z2
summary: WE have just stated hosting after a gap of several years when our young adult offspring were all home.  This room has just become available again as we how share our house with only one of our adult children and three rescue cats.  Our house provides a beautiful, calm and relaxing base from where you can explore this exciting and vibrant city. Check out our full description and reviews.
space: 9 MINUTES TO LONDON BRIDGE,  5 MINUTES TO GREENWICH (ZONE 2) A lovely and quiet single bedroom overlooking the pretty garden on second floor of our elegant Victorian family house.  The house is in a pleasant residential street which is centrally located and very close to excellent transport links in zone 2.  Your bathroom, next to the bedroom, is shared with my adult son . In your room there is a desk, drawers and hanging space in the wardrobe. Breakfast is included in the price. Full English breakfast can be provided on request. A microwave is available in the kitchen to heat up ready meals should you wish to stay in.  A very pretty landscaped garden and sunny conservatory are also ideal for relaxing in warmer weather. Wi-Fi, linen and towels, laundry and tea/coffee making facilities are provided. There is an iron, ironing board and clothes drying area on the top floor. neighborhood_overview: Lewisham is a lively multicultural area. We have happily lived here for more than 34 years now.  It is very easy to get around most areas of London from Lewisham as it has excellent transport links. We arevery close to historic Greenwich and beautiful Blackheath and there is a good shopping centre. There are also several lovely parks, river walks and green spaces within a 5 minute walk from our house as well as a variety of restaurants, pubs and cafes within easy walking distance.
notes: My daughter sometimes comes home or occasionally there may be guests staying in the other bedroom so you may be sharing the bathroom with 2 people if this is the case. Please note there are cats living in the house.

Both single rooms are bright with original fire places, a single bed (one of the two single beds has been replaced with a bigger size single, having taken into account a feed back from a very tall guest) wardrobe, a desk and chair, book shelves and will be provided with bedding and towels. name: Gorgeous flat, great location
summary: Gorgeous architect designed loft-style apartment actually on Broadway Market, one of the most fashionable streets in east London. Seconds away from great coffee shops, bars, restaurants, yoga studios, big green parks, iconic London markets. And since its winter I'm offering a major discount - up to 20% off the normal listing price. You will be warm and cosy in my lovely flat and not have to brave the cold for long to hang out in the best places that London has to offer.
space: Sunny and stylish - architect designed apartment on Broadway Market, recently voted one of Europe's hippest streets, with London's most exciting bars, restaurants, markets, shops and culture within 5 minute walk. With lime-washed wooden floor boards, vintage 20th century furniture and art the apartment is as stylish as it's address. The top floor is one big sunny loft-style kitchen/living space with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows, which open onto a small Juliette balcony on the south side.  The large double bedroom window opens onto a balcony over-looking the wonderful Saturday market.  The bathroom features proper shower and bath. The flat comes complete with all mod cons: WiFi, washing machine/tumble dryer, dishwasher, high speed broadband and flat screen smart TV (which also allows you to browse the web as well as watch Netflix or Love Film films and TV series for free). For sun lovers there is also a huge roof terrace with panoramic views across to the City skyline. The
