neighborhood_overview: Hackney is the creative hub of one of the most creative cities in the world, and Broadway Market is at its centre. It has the  restaurants, bars, live music venues, independent boutiques, coffee shops & markets in the capital. There are also tons of green spaces, yoga studios & London's only Olympic-sized outdoor heated pool for those looking for healthier pursuits. It is basically London's equivalent of Brooklyn, but arguably better.
notes: My flat has a private roof terrace that guests have exclusive use of. It has some of the best views in London and is the perfect spot to have breakfast or a sundowner.
transit: Lots of transport connections - East London line and central line underground will whizz you across town in no time.
access: Guests have exclusive access to my roof terrace, a great place for breakfast or a sundowner glass of wine to enjoy the stunning views across London.
house_rules: This is not a party flat. So I have one very strict rule and that is only named guests are allowed to visit. This means no unplanned overnight guests (sorry singles) or meeting fun people on Broadway market and bringing them home for a few more beers. This is my home and should be treated with respect. I should also add that the second bed is a single fold-up and not suitable for a tall adult.

name: Great St. Paul's and Big Ben views
summary: The apartment is on the fifteenth floor looking south west over the city of London. Some of London's greatest features are visible. It is a light and bright and airy, well appointed and very secure. I work nearby so am available to assist you. 2018 NEWS: a brand new fully fitted kitchen is being installed for this summer's guests. Enjoy!
space: Two/three bedroom apartment with stunning views over central London. Walking distance to Angel and Old Street 'tube' (underground) stations. Concierge (8am to midnight weekdays, 10am to midnight weekends), main entrance access control and entryphone. All mod cons. Fully fitted and equipped kitchen, bathroom and separate WC. Plenty of storage. Bedding and towels provided. The apartment was completely refurbished in 2010. There is quality wood flooring throughout. The bathroom and separate toilet are tiled and fitted to hotel standard. A large flat screen digital TV and internet are included. There is a separate utility room with a washing machine and drier. Elsewhere there is plenty of storage for your suitcases so you can keep them out of the way. The living room can be used as a third bedroom if desired, so the apartment can accommodate up to 6 people at no extra cost. neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood has many choices for shops and restaurants.  There is a Co-op mini-market on the opposite side of City Road - literally across the road - and a number of other shops, cafes and restaurants.  An excellent new Turkish restaurant has recently opened in this location.  There is also a stand of 'Boris' bikes (rentable bicycles) within a minute of the front door!  In the other direction - to the south - there are also shops, restaurants and amenities. Try Fish Central at 149-155 Central Street, King Square, London, EC1V 8AP.  It's excellent!  The Old Street roundabout, just 5-10 minutes walk to the south-east, is now known as Tech City or Silicon Roundabout.  It's a vibrant hub for hitech and IT startups with cool cafes, bars and restaurants. If you continue walking south down Central Street you reach the heart of Clerkenwell which has great funky character with many cafes, restaurants and shops.
notes: The apartment is bright and airy with many openable windows. Please do not leave windows wide open while you are out.  They can be secured in a slightly open position to provide ventilation without risk of rain getting in. Please refer to 'Basics' for more detail.
transit: Transport connections are excellent.  You are 5-10 minutes walk form either Angel or Old Street stations giving you access to the Northern Line (Bank Branch) and National Rail at Old Street.  From the Angel you can enter Upper Street and trendy Islington.  From Old Street you can go further East to Hoxton and Brick Lane, or you can go south to Liverpool Street and Spitalfield.  You can also walk directly south to reach Clerkenwell another trendy hang-out.  The choices are endless! If you are keen on cycling, walking or running, you can get onto the Grand Union Canal towpath by crossing City Road.  Once on the towpath, you can go east or west for many miles.  East leads to the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.  West leads to Kings Cross, Camden Lock and onward to Maida Vale and Paddington Basin. If you need a taxi, it is best to book a minicab to come to the building and collect you.  Use the internet to find a local minicab company.  This is a cheaper option than hailing a black cab on the

There is an open landing area between the lift and front door where it is possible to smoke. Rubbish can be disposed of via a chute on the landing. Do not through cigarette butts down the chute! *For an additional £35 per week professional weekly cleaning can be provided

name: Double room view of river thames
space: one double room, at the top of a four storey block, (no lift) with views of the river thames. Share of kitchen, tea, coffee available, shared bathroom. Wireless broadband access, and off road parking. The thamesview driving range and golf course is a 15 minute walk. Local bus to shopping centre, or 20 minute walk along the river on the thameside walk,the N1 night bus gets you back from central london to the local bus stop. The local 472 bus is a 24 hour service, it will take you to north greenwich for the cutty sark (ship) museum, and the 02 concert arena (40 minutes) From nearby woolwich arsenal rail 30 minutes to london bridge for central london, or 30 minutes to stratford for the westfield shopping centre, both on the scenic docklands light railway. There is a good selection of high street shops in woolwich centre, where you will also find the royal artillery museum. London city airport is 10 minutes from woolwich arsenal on the DLR.

We are just 35 minutes from central London, yet, our area and our actual road is very typical of a quiet English suburban street.  The district was described by poet laureate Sir John Betjeman as a retreat for people leaving the centre of town as:  "Hurries down the concrete station With a frown of concentration, Out into the outskirt’s edges Where a few surviving hedges Keep alive our lost Elysium – rural Middlesex again."

Location: Shepherds Bush, a cosmopolitan part of West London (next to Notting Hill). Public Transport: i) Tube Stations: 3 tube stations within 5 minutes walk (Shepherds Bush central line, Shepherds Bush Market & Goldhawk Road). You can reach central London (Oxford Circus) in 12 minutes via the central line. ii) Overland Train Station (Shepherds Bush), 5 mins walk away. iii) Large number of 24 hour buses that connect Shepherds Bush to central and east London Local Facilities: i) Westfield Shopping Centre: One of the UK's largest shopping malls (260 shops from supermarkets to Prada & Gucci stores) ii) Large number of small supermarkets, cafes, restaurants and internet cafes within a 2 minute walk iii) Parks (eg, Shepherds Bush Green) within 5 minute walk iv) Historic buildings eg, BBC Headquarters, Shepherds Bush Empire concert hall, Shepherds Bush theatre A

name: Single Room in a Stylish Flat
space: Stylish single room in a gorgeous modern 2 bedroom flat in Kilburn (room with desk).  The flat is modern and beautifully styled as I am an interior designer and try to look out for every detail.  There are hardwood floors throughout, and large windows let in great light into all the rooms.  The bathroom is stunning with beautiful tile and a wonderful deep bath as well as modern shower. The kitchen is also modern and stocked with cooking utensils as well as a hob, oven, microwave, and washing machine.  The private room has its own television with desk, cable and WiFi. You'll feel safe and secure on the first floor of this historical Victorian home with intercom buzzer.  Kilburn is a great location with a wonderful mix of cultures and eclectic shops on the high street.  The flat is a 6 minute walk to the Kilburn tube on the Jubilee line (zone 2).  Oxford Street is only 15 minutes away on the tube.  In addition, many buses run along the high street which is within 3 minutes walk.  Wembley

neighborhood_overview: Lovely quiet neighbourhood with Victorian houses, but just a few minutes walk to Kilburn High Road with lots of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.  There is a good size grocery store as well as bodega for fresh fruits and vegetables just by the tube station.  You will have everything you need within a 10 minute walk.
notes: I am very neat and tidy and ask you to clean up after yourself. Some of my clothes are in the room and I may need to access the room no more than once a day to get them.
transit: 6 minute walk to Kilburn tube station (Jubilee line, zone 2).  10 minute walk to Brondesbury overground station.  Plenty of buses as well from the high street which is 3 minute walk.
house_rules: Dear Guest,  You are welcome to use the kitchen.  However, if you do so, please make sure you wash and put back all plates, utensils and pans used.   Fresh towels are available upon request.

name: Double room in Hackney Wick
space: Private double room to rent in Hackney Unit in converted warehouse in a vibrant neighbourhood renowned for its art scene. The unit is on the ground floor facing a large yard where cars can be parked. The yard is closed with a gate and has chairs and tables to chill out. The building includes four other units and two flats above. It is a 38m2 unit with a kitchen space and a bathroom with shower (24/7 hot water) and toilet. With three large windows, one double bed and an extra single mattress, a cloth hanger, a desk, a coffee table and a sofa, utilities include WIFI, a fridge and freezer, two hobs, an oven and a microwave. All bills are included. About the neighbourhood: Hackney Wick is a effervescent location inhabited by artists and creative people, stuffed with art studios, galleries, theaters, cafes. The area is surrounded by the large Victoria Park and canals which you can walk and cycle along for miles across London.

name: TOWER BRIDGE, SHAD THAMES,BALCONY
space: Fantastic one bedroom flat in the heart of the historic Shad Thames, a stones throw away from the famous Tower Bridge. A very quiet and comfortable open plan space with lots of light due to the large windows and 2 balconies. Sleeping four people with a double bed and a double electric blow up mattress. A bathroom with toilet shower and bath facilities.  Clean Towels, soap, shampoo, sheets, hair dryer, coffee, tea, washing machine are also included. Feel free to ask for anything else. agnetha Fantastic one bedroom flat in the heart of the historic Shad Thames, a stones throw away from the famous Tower Bridge, with plenty of bars and restaurants on its doorstep. A 10 minute walk or 3 minute bus ride away from London Bridge station making travelling very easy, as well as the option of renting Barclays Bikes just outside. name: Bright and clean flat in Hackney, great transport
summary: Located in a very vibrant area and very close to central London (about 20/30 mins on public transport), this flat is very bright and silent. Very nice views and lots of privacy. Comfortable bed and amenities. Close to Springfield Park. Only 5 mins walk to Clapton Station, which is 3 stops into Liverpool Street and lots of buses to central London as well as  tube stations (Finsbury Park and Manor House). All essentials included as well as coffee, teas and breakfast items (croissants/butter/jam)
space: Very bright and well kept one bedroom flat with a double bedroom, a large living room, a very functional kitchen and bathroom. The flat is situated on the 4th floor (there's a lift!). The area is very convenient with lots of restaurants, shops and great transport (train and buses). There is also a huge natural reserve about 10 min walk from the flat with and plenty of places to go to. Lots of street food markets around and organic shops. The flat is in east London, Clapton/Stoke Newington area.

name: Double bedroom for short stays
summary: This cosy room is very quiet, has an en-suite feel and opens out on to the patio garden. It is particularly suited to the single person wanting peace and privacy for anything from 1 night to 3 weeks.   Battersea Park, cafes and restaurants, good transport links and a leisure centre with a gym and swimming pool are all close by.
space: Modern garden flat in Battersea, 20 minutes' walk to King's Rd. This is the perfect place to stay while visiting London - or needing to go to the new American embassy! This double bedroom is right at the back of the flat, opening out onto a well-established walled patio garden. It is cosy and quiet - ideal for anyone wanting peace and privacy.  It is particularly suited to the single person who needs a room from anything from 1 night to 3 weeks. Two people sharing are welcome too but the room and bed are quite cosy so I usually recommend a maximum of 3 nights for two people wishing to stay.  Just 50 metres from the property you will find Battersea Park, which is considered by many to be one of the most interesting of all the parks in London. Here you will find a wide range of sporting facilities, a lake, a zoo, cafes, sculptures and specialist gardens. There's also an Exhibition Centre which hosts several art fairs throughout the year. Also close by are a variety of pubs and restaurant

neighborhood_overview: The area has a choice of pubs and restaurants offering all different types of cuisine ranging from Thai to Italian to Mexican! It's a haven to return to after  the hustle and bustle of tourist London. Then, of course, there's always Battersea Park itself and all the activities that offers. The area's spacious, with wide roads and pavements, quiet and safe.
notes: Sadly I no longer have dogs of my own. Guests are welcome to bring theirs, at no charge, but this would need to be discussed in advance because I sometimes look after well-behaved dogs owned by neighbours!
transit: I always ask a guest which airport or station they are arriving at in London, so that I can offer detailed directions to my Battersea home, whether by public  transport or taxi. For guests with cars, I can arrange parking if given advance notice and the car registration number. There is a small charge (12 GBP a day), but it is much cheaper and more convenient than meter parking.  Near the property you will find good bus links to the Victoria and Piccadilly tube lines and to Clapham Junction. Victoria, South Kensington and Sloane Square tubes are also only about 25 minutes' walk, much of which is through Battersea Park. Also, just a few minutes walk away, through the Park, you will find the Thames river and Albert Bridge, which connects Battersea to Chelsea. We have Boris' Bikes immediately across the road for people to hire for cycling round London or just a quick ride round Battersea Park. I can also call on a very reliable taxi service for guests needing transport at any hour of the
access: Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen and patio garden.
house_rules: Guests are asked to be out of the property between 10am and 4pm unless otherwise arranged.

name: Apartment in Shoreditch - Zone 1
space: Fantastic 1 bedroom flat right in the centre of the Shoreditch triangle, on the 3rd floor of a period property overlooking the ever popular Arnold Circus.  Newly refurbished and furnished to a very high standard.  Two minutes walk to the East London line and 10 minutes walk to Liverpool Street station, in the middle of everything Shoreditch is famous for: trendy bars, amazing restaurants and the weekend markets and art galleries of Redchurch Street just next door. The flat is approximately 70m2 and has one bedroom with a double bed, a very large living room (both with views out onto Arnold Circus) and a spacious bathroom and eat in kitchen.  There is space for further guests to sleep in the living room and mattresses/airbeds/bedding can be provided upon request. Please contact me prior to making a booking - minimum stay is 5 nights and longer term rates are negotiable.

name: Spacious family flat with terrace
summary: Our confortable flat is over 2 floors and a private terrace, with lots of space and light. It confortably fits four and is well located in booming borough of Hackney, with easy access to tube and buses to Central London. We will trust you in feeding our lovely cat.
space: The flat is layed over 2 floors with an outdoor walled garden. A large open plan kitchen and lounge, leading to the terrasse are on the top floor, while downstairs has 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. It's confortable for 4 people, but can accomodate 5, especially with children. The flat is perfect for self catering and relax after a long day out in town.

notes: We expect to get the place back as clean and tidy as you'll find it. Cleaning fees can be added to have it done by a professional cleaner.
transit: The area is also well deserved to reach Central London, from Hackney Central tube station and lots of buses. We are on the outskirts of Dalston, Shoreditch for night life (even our local pub is booming!), Angel and Islington for shops and Stratford where the Olympics took place.

name: East London flat on the Canal
space: Hi there Thanks for checking out my listing!  Welcome to our modern flat in sought after location directly on the canal, with balcony overlooking the water and city views in the distance, two minutes away from public transport (also secure bicycle storage facilities inside the apartment building). Large & bright double bedroom with windows overlooking the canal, and with your own private ensuite bathroom/shower. The flat is shared with very friendly permanent residents/young professionals (male and female) who will be delighted to share their knowledge of London and the local area with you! The flat features an open plan kitchen-living room with all modern facilities, flat-screen television and wifi access for your comfort and convenience, and a large dining table and big comfy sofa for lounging. space: This apartment is three underground stop from Kings Cross/St Pancras and the Eurostar (piccadilly line) which is also the Underground line direct to Heathrow Airport. The flat has plenty of natural light as well as a massive outside private  garden with working Gas BBQ and Patio. The apartment has stylish modern decor throughout, minimalist furniture, double height ceilings and wood white floors. name: Cool Dalston Warehouse
summary: A converted warehouse in the heart of trendy Dalston: cafes, restaurants, bars and culture all with easy transport links. A small but charming flat, ideal for one or two people on a short trip to London.
space: A converted warehouse in the heart of trendy Dalston: cafes, Turkish restaurants, funky bars, The Vortex jazz club, the Rio cinema, the Arcola theatre, Ridley Road street market six days a week, a large supermarket and excellent transport links - all in a very short walk! Dalston Kingsland in 3 minutes away by foot, and links to the Victoria Line tube at Highbury & Islington in 10 minutes, and Stratford in under 15 minutes. Central London is under 30 minutes away. Dalston Junction is also very close, at 5 minutes walking, and allows for further trains south. There are also many buses and night buses too. Dalston is Zone 2. High ceilings, wooden floors, the original metal columns and an outdoor terrace make for a one-bedroom converted warehouse flat with character, all within a gated development (1 parking space too). A full kitchen (washer-dryer, fridge-freezer, toaster, citrus juicer, coffee machine, kettle, etc.), a good kingsize bed, instant hot water and speakers/projector for your

A small but charming flat, ideal for one or two people on a short trip to London.  A converted warehouse in the heart of trendy Dalston: cafes, Turkish restaurants, funky bars, The Vortex jazz club, the Rio cinema, the Arcola theatre, Ridley Road street market six days a week, a large supermarket and excellent transport links - all in a very short walk! High ceilings, wooden floors, the original metal columns and an outdoor terrace make for a one-bedroom converted warehouse flat with character, all within a gated d
neighborhood_overview: Dalston is special for many reasons!  First of all it is a key part of East London, so there are trendy bars and cafes and a variety of restaurants, many of which reflect the local Turkish and Caribbean communities. Mangal and Mangal II serve incredible charcoal grilled lamb. Red Art Café is chilled and wonderful for an English breakfast or Turkish menemen eggs. There is an amazing independent cinema - the Rio Cinema - steps away, as well as the Arcola Theatre, and a few jazz clubs.  Shopping is very easy with a large Sainsbury's supermarket as well as the Ridley Road Market which offers fresh fruit and veg, six days a week, with meat butchers on the sides. Both are under three minutes away.
notes: Please have a photo on your profile, as it helps to know who will be living in my home! General details of your plans in London are helpful too. Your stay should be under a week long, unless during a school holiday. Much longer rentals are possible during school holidays (March/April, July & August, December), and half-term breaks (mid-February, late May and late October). Otherwise, I prefer rentals to be under a week.
transit: Transport is very easy. Dalston is Zone 2, and has two Overground stations: Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction. Both connect to the Victoria Line at Highbury & Islington station.  There are many North-South buses (e.g. 149) and East-West buses (e.g. 38), with night buses running regularly too.  If flying into Stansted then I recommend a bus or train to Liverpool Street Station which is quite close. If you are on the Eurostar, there is a direct bus from St. Pancras (30), though tube and Overground is a little faster.  The nearest street bike rental docking station is by Haggerston, which is a 15 min walk away.
access: The whole apartment.
house_rules: NO PARTIES. No dinner parties. No quiet get-togethers! (Of course you can have a friend over, but larger groups will only run the apartment down). Otherwise just common sense and mutual respect. I will show you around the flat before I hand over the keys where possible. If you have any questions or requirements, just ask. It helps if you have a clear photo and tell me a little about you and your plans in London before I welcome you into my home! I don't smoke, but you are welcome to smoke in the terrace. And don't try to open the bathroom mirror!

name: Spacious Clerkenwell Georgian home
space: This superbly located family home was redesigned 10 years ago by award winning architects and featured in the 'Sunday Times' Magazine. Although stylish, the emphasis is still very homely and child friendly (we live here most of the year). From an unusually light and spacious living room, sliding glass doors open out onto a courtyard with outdoor dining with deluxe barbeque. The rear of the coach house opens out onto a private cobbled mews. There is one double bedroom with an ensuite luxury bathroom and two further bedrooms (one single with bunk and the other with one double bed). The Grade II listed townhouse is set in a conservation area of Georgian London and whilst very quiet, the busy and vibrant neighbourhoods of Islington and Clerkenwell are just five minutes away, offering theatres, cinemas, a fantastic range of shops, bars and restaurants. With Kings Cross tube also only a few minutes walk away this is the ideal hub for almost anywhere in London. We have wifi and cable and plen

We are not to far from Epping Forest which is a conservation area, and fantastic.  We also have plenty of open green spaces, and parks for gentle walks for young and old alike.
transit: We are zone 2/3 East London 15/20 mins walk either way to Stratford or Leyton Tube.  2 buses either way run very regularly throughout the day and night.
house_rules: These are common sense, but just to ensure you understand what we expect from our guests  We have a lovely clean house, so expect everyone to clean up after themselves.  No food or drink to be consumed in room all cooked meals to be eaten in kitchen or dining room.  Full use of kitchen equipment – Ensure kitchen utensils are washed, dried, and put away after use. We recycle as much as possible, in order to minimize land fill waste This is a non-smoking house but can smoke outside No Guests after 9 pm Please ensure the security system is activated, all windows closed, and doors locked before leaving the house.  You are responsible for your own door keys – if lost there will be a charge of £50 for a replacement.

name: Charming & Cozy Twin Room, for 2 in Hackney E5
summary: Ideal if you are looking for separate beds.  One room with two single beds (80 cm x200). See my listings for just queen size bed set up and more details on staying with us in Homerton, Hackney.
space: A London terraced house in a cool neighbourhood with stuff happening all the time.  Easy walking distance to Victoria Park music festivals and Hackney Wick 'scene'.   You would be sharing the space with us. The house is non smoking and we have a cat, (so if you are highly allergic, this might be important).  Fully equipped kitchen and a lovely garden. You'll be making your own breakfast (that way you can sleep until you want to), but it's all here for you.   Please see my other listing for more info and a long list of comments from our guests. Or find out more #plus_belle_place 10 minutes walk from the London Overground (orange line on the tube map) which operates every 7-10 minutes.  Very close to an extensive network of canals and parks - great for a wander or a run.

neighborhood_overview: We live in an emerging and buzzy part of London - the eastern edge of Hackney: Clapton - though, as we are local, we actually refer to our very particular corner as Homerton.    We have some pubs that are really very good - food, beer and cocktails - at the end of our road.
notes: We have plenty of reviews for the same house and rooms on our other listings.   We should mention here - our house (and perhaps our disposition, if we are honest) is really not suited to kids.  That is randomly defined, by us, as under 12. Parking requires a resident's permit. This charged at cost to you. Please ask us about parking and we'll let you know the associated costs.   For those staying for longer term, we expect that you will be pretty independent and look after your own food, etc. Also, we will need to work out bathroom schedules, general house-keeping guidelines and such.
transit: We are 10-15 minutes walk (well, 6 if you walk particularly fast) to Homerton Overground station.  And our favourite bus, the 242, is pretty close to the house - it will take you to great places in style.  And home again.  At ANY hour (maybe with less style after 2 am)
access: Kitchen for making meals, garden for fresh air (or smoke), bathroom and your room - and wifi of course. Other amenities by invitation.  Generally, however, we would prefer that you are not just hanging around the house all day, as we work from home.
house_rules: We love our home and we love sharing it.  A few things to make it a fabulous stay:  We don't smoke - occasional smokers are welcome, if you do smoke, use the ashtray in the back garden and don't smoke out front of the house.  Even if we aren't watching. Normally we don't expect visitors of guests to be at the house after eleven pm, if you want to have visitors later, please arrange this with me beforehand.  Being out and arriving home at your leisure is fine though - we don't have curfews.  And we aren't bothered about what time you decide to get up.  Help yourself to breakfast when it suits you. As there are open stairs (no railings), please do keep your wits about you.   (I should mention, it's not a child-friendly house). And please bear in mind it's a shared bathroom. Otherwise we are very flexible and I hope that people treat my home like they would their own home.

name: Nice Room Near Park and The Thames
space: It is close to everything you would want to visit and see in London. The bedroom has a comfy double bed. There is an equipped kitchen in the flat along with a living room and shared bathroom. Clean sheets will be provided for all guests. There are great transport facilities, including South Bermondsey (National Rail) Surrey Quays Over Ground station (5 minute walk) and Canada Water underground station (8 minute). Buses stops in front of the house. There is a big shopping centre, a cinema, a Tesco and Southwark park which are just 5 minute walk from the house, Lidl and McDonald's are 1 minute away. There are restaurants nearby if you want to eat out. There is also a washing machine if you need to wash clothes.   The flat has Wifi throughout and a TV. It is on the 2nd floor but there is a lift. Bermondsey antiques market is nearby .Boat rides down the Thames are at Westminster pier. We have a fully stocked supermarket 3 mins away for groceries. Kennington subway/tube station is a short walk and there are trains and buses to all over London from just outside. The house is really central! Great restaurants and old English pubs are nearby. All very good value and not tourist prices ! The best sushi is just below ! We love the area and think it is one London's undiscovered gems.... a great place to escape the buzz of London.

The Elephant and Castle is a main centre for buses and they travel all over central London - buses are a lovely way of seeing London .

name: Big light room & ensuite - Wanstead
space: One private double guest bedroom available in a Victorian terraced house located in Wanstead village - a seven minute walk from Wanstead and Snaresbrook tube stations (both just three stops on the Central line to Stratford). Central London is 15 minutes by tube (Liverpool Street) and 30 minutes to Oxford Street.  The area: The house is in a lovely quiet road in a safe, leafy area. Wanstead is one of the best areas in East London – with a lovely village-y feel. Great local pub (just 3 minutes away) and just 5 minutes from the high street with lots of good cafes, restaurants and shops. Plenty of parks in the vicinity.  The room: The bedroom is large and light, with all mod cons – usual Victorian high ceiling and original wooden floors. The room has its own ensuite shower room (powerful shower and sink/vanity unit only). There’s also a spacious shared bathroom with toilet and bath. There isn't a tumble dryer so guests must use the dryers at the nearby launderette if laundry can't be dried outdoors. Please be mindful of security. If your window is left open and I have to leave the house I will need to enter your room to close it.  Additional guests allowed only with prior agreement. (NB: my insurance is only valid for up to two guests.) Normal internet usage fine - additional broadband costs will be charged. Don't let the cat out - she's curious to explore but definitely not street-wise! Have a good time! Please remember to return your key at the end of your stay (otherwise I will deduct £50 from your deposit to help cover the cost of replacing the lock and keys).

name: Modern ensuite king size, Stratford
space: A spacious double bedroom with en-suite bathroom for rent in a luxury apartment located on the 9th floor of the brand new Aurora development in Stratford. Just 2 minutes walk from the southern Olympic park entrance, and 5 minutes walk to the Olympic stadium itself. Everyday amenities are located within the ground floor levels of the Aurora and surrounding buildings, while the Westfield shopping complex and Stratford tube, train & international rail station is a short 10 minute walk away. The spacious living area boasts panoramic view of the the O2 Arena in Greenwich to the south, Canary wharf and the city skyline to the West, and the Olympic Stadium and look out tower to the North-West. Should you rent, the apartment includes your own fridge freezer, super fast broadband and Sky television, which can be watched either in the main living area, or via the 32” television in the bedroom. Friendly owners willing to provide freedom and a comfortable environment for the duration of your stay.

name: Camden Town Pensione Central London
space: Beautiful studio apartment in the centre of Camden Town. The studio flat is on the top floor of our house, you share the same front door and stairs but the accommodation is self contained. It is a large sunny room with windows that overlook pretty gardens. There is a new double bed, and a kitchen dining area with halogen hobs, a microwave oven and fridge. There is a TV, radio and wifi. Also you have your own bathroom with shower/bath. Camden Town is a great place to be as it has everything you need within easy reach. Within ten minutes you can be in Regent's Park,  London Zoo, or wandering round Camden Lock and Market. There is a huge choice of places to eat and drink, as well as live music and night clubs. The West End with its shops, art galleries, theatres and cinemas is ten minutes away by bus. We are a 12 minute walk from St Pancras International. We will be on hand to advise you on anything you need to know about Camden and London generally.

transit: Camden is at the centre of many transport systems. Buses, tubes, overground trains can whizz you all over London. You can park in a car park over the road from our house.

summary: Lovely one bedroom apartment 10 minutes walk from Tower Bridge
space: Lovely one bed flat in new apartment blocks with friendly neighbours right next to the river Thames. The flat is next to the tube so you can get to most of the West End in less than 20mins. A short walk from the artsy shops and cafes of Bermondsey street where you can also relax in the park or have a game of Ping Pong. The weekend markets pop up under the nearby railway arches and Bermondsey Square. Walk to the Thames in 5 minutes where you'll find Butlers Wharf shops and restaurants and Tower Bridge a bit further down - keep going and you'll reach London Bridge, Shard and SouthBank activity that runs all the way down to Waterloo and the London Eye. I do live here most of the year but have made it available as I'm away on holiday so you'll have everything you need in terms of bedding, towelling and cooking. Distance to:  Bermondsey Tube - 2mins walk  London Bridge/Borough Market - 5mins tube or 15mins walk  Waterloo - 8 mins tube or 15mins bus  Bond Street (Oxford St) - 15mins tube  O2

name: Prime Kensington luxury 2 bed flat
summary: A stunning two bedroom, two bathroom apartment (985 sq.ft) in an exclusive street in the heart of Kensington. Holland street spacious 2 bed flat 2 minutes by foot away from Kensington Palace with its own large outside roof terrace.
space: Top location, fantastic, large and extremely high quality 2 bedroom apartment (converted from three bedroom flat) in a historic Grade II listed building on Holland Street in the heart and, arguably, the best part of Kensington, just 2 mins walk from Kensington Park Gardens. Apartment has its own private entrance  and is arranged over three floors. It offers contemporary living and entertaining space (92 sq m/985 sq ft) plus a great roof terrace with a mature roof garden of 30sq.m. It consists of a 30 sq.m (320sq.ft) double bedroom with wooden and marble flooring on the 2nd floor, beautiful bright open plan reception room with marble floors and contemporary furnishings and  acontemporary kitchen room 30sq.m with marble flooring, fully fitted Italian designed kitchen with granite work surfaces on the first floor, plus study / guest bedroom with newly installed bathroom and jacuzzi on the ground floor. Each bedroom has en suite bathroom. Apartment has separate entrance and no neighbours.

summary: A COMFY SPOTLESS SMALL single room in my home where I live in Fulham. Accessible from all major airports and close to museums and shops. The room has a single bed - ideal for the solo traveller. If you don’t see the days you want, message me! I may be able to open up the days you want.  WELCOME to my listing and thank you for looking!
space: My small single guest room is in my home where I live. Apart from the guest room and my room there are no other bedrooms, so you will only share my home with me.  Although the room is small, it has space for all your luggage and also has a computer table and chair, so that you can work privately.  LOTS of hanging and drawer space for all your clothes, and plenty of room under the high French antique metal bed. Lots of tea and coffee are provided, but NOT breakfast.   There are so many great cafes close by. I work during the day, so you will have the flat to yourself. I provide: - free unlimited wifi internet access - towels - anti-allergy pillow covers and bed linen - lots of hanging space with clothes hangers - global adaptor plugs - hairdryer - washing machine - guidebooks - additional fans for cooling or heating - a wide variety of complimentary teas and coffees. neighborhood_overview: Fulham has a lovely village atmosphere with excellent transport links. Location-wise my home is in an upmarket area of Zone 2. The area is quiet and extremely safe part of London.  The river Thames is within a short walking distance, and provides a magical respite from the busy city. Fulham is a great location for traditional English pubs, local shopping and restaurants.
notes: LEFT LUGGAGE - BAGGAGE STORAGE Check-in 6pm and check-out is 9am.  PLEASE message me, I may be able to see you in or out, outside those hours.  I like to be there to welcome you when you arrive. If you need to store luggage, note that all mainline stations have left luggage / baggage storage facilities.  Do an Internet search for Left Luggage London.   I recommend the following: From HEATHROW take the Heathrow Express - leave bags at Paddington train station.   From GATWICK, take the Gatwick Express - leave bags at Victoria train station.   From STANSTED, take the Stansted Express - leave bags at Liverpool Street train station.  Or get closer to my place and leave them at Paddington.  Take the circle line to Paddington from Liverpool Street. There are other left luggage offices at EUSTON, KINGS CROSS and ST. PANCRAS mainline train stations.  Search for them on the internet.  Message me for further options. Details on how to get to my flat from these baggage storage facilities will be p
transit: Fulham Broadway is the closest tube to my home. Hammersmith is also nearby and is the tube station for Heathrow.  All tube stations can be reached by a five minute bus journey, or a 15 minute walk.    From outside the flat there are a wide variety of bus routes to all the top sightseeing and shopping spots - the major museums, Kings Road, Westminster, the South Bank, Queens Tennis Club, Wimbledon, Chelsea Football Club and Fulham Football Club. Top travel tip 1: Get the 'CITYMAPPER' app.  Excellent app showing all London bus, tube, overground, cycle and walking directions between points - plus all costs and timings.  Highly recommended. Top travel tip 2:  Get a London Oyster card if you don't have a debit or credit card with contactless technology (all London tubes, trains and buses use contactless technology); top it up with a week's pass or £10 or whatever suits you. This will get you to the flat via London train, tube or bus.   Cycles for hire:  Right outside the flat is London's Cy
access: My guest room is part of my home where I live. I go to work every day in Central London.  Guests are welcome to use the kitchen and the living room when I am not in.
house_rules: CHECK-IN & OUT Check-in is at 6pm and check-out is 11am.   But I can be flexible - just ask!  I work 9am to 5pm weekdays in Hammersmith. I can be very flexible on the morning check-out and at the weekends I can be flexible for both check-in and check-out.  I operate a 'one and one out' guest policy so that my guests can enjoy their exclusive time in my home. I like to ensure that guests are not interrupted by a new guest arriving or wanting access to the flat to leave their luggage, use the facilities, or take the door keys, before the outgoing guest is ready.   I do provide lots of tea and coffee but not breakfast as I have so many good cafes near me. There are also late night supermarkets close by and you can stock up on your favourite breakfast foods and keep them in my kitchen for the morning. House rules:  Wipe down the glass shower partition after use. Double lock the door when you go out, and, Turn the lights out when you go to bed   :-) There will be keys for you on arrival so

On Salusbury Road, there are many bars and restaurants, shops, Farmers market on Sunday, Fitness First and the park itself is just around the corner. The park has tennis courts, kids playground and a lovely cafe. In addition, the apartment makes an ideal base from which to visit London's attractions (London Zoo, Regent's Park, Madame Tussaud's, British Museum, Trafalgar Square, London Eye, Shard, Tower Of London etc), shops (West End, Harrods, Westfield, Stratford, etc), and culture (theatres, galleries, South Bank and cinemas). Famous Portobello Road market is 20 minutes walk and West End is about half an hour on foot or 15 minutes by underground. This is a great little neighbourhood with a villagey feeling. There are lots of fantastic places to eat and drink and watch life go by. There is the local Queen's Park for a little nature break and we think you'll find the locals really f
notes: We have 2 more very similar apartments in the same building so it is possible to book larger groups up to 21 people in the 3 apartments. If you require any further information regarding booking 2 or 3 apartments at the same time, please contact us well in advance.
transit: EXCELLENT TRANSPORT LINKS: 2 minute walk TO QUEEN'S PARK station (bakerloo line) 10 minute to Euston by train 10 minute walk to Brondesbury Park station (National Rail)  15 minute walk to Kilburn station (Jubilee line)     2 minute from bus and night bus 98 on Salusbury Road
access: There is unlimited wireless internet in whole apartment. All essentials are supplied including bed linen and towels, crockery and cutlery. Free parking is available outside the house in our own front garden. Daily cleaning can be arranged if required.

name: Modern 1-bed with stunning views across London
summary: Modern one bedroom apartment in Greenwich (Southeast London), with unique views of entire London skyline across the River Thames. Very close to public transport, and the historic town centre, park and market in Greenwich. Enjoy the many restaurants and pubs of Greenwich, as well as the upbeat area of Deptford.
space: Modern 1-bed, 1-bath apartment in West Greenwich near Deptford, with amazing views of entire London skyline from north facing terrace. Close to Cutty Sark DLR, Greenwich Station, and Deptford Station with easy access to Canary Wharf, London Bridge, Bank and the City.
description: Modern one bedroom apartment in Greenwich (Southeast London), with unique views of entire London skyline across the River Thames. Very close to public transport, and the historic town centre, park and market in Greenwich. Enjoy the many restaurants and pubs of Greenwich, as well as the upbeat area of Deptford. Modern 1-bed, 1-bath apartment in West Greenwich near Deptford, with amazing views of entire London skyline from north facing terrace. Close to Cutty Sark DLR, Greenwich Station, and Deptford Station with easy access to Canary Wharf, London Bridge, Bank and the City. The apartment is fully furnished with all beddings and kitchen utensils provided. Digital TV and wifi provided for free. Secure parking may be available upon request during reservation. In addition to private terrace, guests have access to the communal rooftop garden. We can be contacted at anytime via phone or email. Within the Royal Borough of Greenwich, it is less than 10 minutes walk to the historic Greenwich tow
neighborhood_overview: Within the Royal Borough of Greenwich, it is less than 10 minutes walk to the historic Greenwich town centre and market. Enjoy the many cafes, bars, and restaurants. Lovely walks through Greenwich Park or along the River Thames. Nearby Deptford is an upbeat and lively area with new restaurants and bars around the ‘hip’ Deptford Market Yard.  Nearby attractions include:  - Greenwich Park & the Royal Observatory  - The Maritime Museum & Queen's House  - Royal Naval College & University of Greenwich - Lively, bustling Greenwich Market with arts, crafts, and great food  - Cutty Sark boat - Deptford High Street and Market Yard - The O2 Greenwich (North Greenwich) - Bars and restaurants all within easy walking distance  - Canary Wharf is also close by and the business districts of Central London are easily accessible.
transit: Less than 10 minutes walk to Cutty Sark DLR, Greenwich or Deptford train stations, and Greenwich Pier for boat services. Bus stop right outside that go right into the city in 20-30 minutes. From Greenwich Station, it is:  - 10 minutes to Canary Wharf (Jubilee Line) by DLR - 10 minutes by train to London Bridge (with connections to Charing Cross) - 15 minutes by train to the city (Cannon Street)  - 25 minutes by train to St. Pancras International (Thameslink) - 25 minutes to Stratford by DLR The area is within the inner London transport Zone 2.
access: The apartment is fully furnished with all beddings and kitchen utensils provided. Digital TV and wifi provided for free. Secure parking may be available upon request during reservation. In addition to private terrace, guests have access to the communal rooftop garden.
house_rules: Smoking not allowed on terrace.

name: Trendy and very central 1 bedroom
space: The apartment is located very centrally in the Holborn / Chancery Lane area, in between the West End and the City. All major Central London attractions are within walking distance, and so are public transports (5 minutes walk to Chancery Lane station on the Central Line, 8 minutes walk to Holborn station from where you can take the Piccadilly Line directly to Heathrow). In addition, the apartment is only a few minutes walk from the borders of the Thames and the Northbank promenade. Finally, location is also ideal for professionals, with numerous law firms, investment banks or accounting firms within walking distance.  The apartment is on the 5th floor (without elevator, about 90 steps) and is therefore very bright with sunlight from morning to evening (partially also through velux windows on the ceiling). It is 52m2 in size (about 550 square feet), sleeps 4 people, and consists of one large, very quiet bedroom (with large built-in wardrobes), one brand new bathroom with bathtub and rai

house_rules: Please...: - No excessive noise between 11pm and 7am please!  - Preferably take off your shoes when inside the apartment. - Don't overload the washing machine - half full should be the maximum. - Do not attempt to access the roof - Please use the recycling bin for paper, cardboard, cans as well as plastic bottles and container (full description can be found on bin) - If you want to get rid of garbage, please leave it on the pavement outside the building ideally between 5 and 7pm on weekdays only - Close all windows when leaving the apartment. - Make sure the building's main door is properly shut when leaving the building. - Make sure the apartment's door is locked when leaving the apartment. Many thanks and enjoy your stay!

space: The apartment is located just off New King’s Road in the affluent area of Fulham/Parsons Green and housed in a purposed built block. name: Lovely double room with ensuite bath near Brixton
summary: Bright, spacious double bedroom with ensuite bathroom in flat between Brixton and Camberwell, near King's College Hospital Note regarding breakfast: our guests are welcome to use any food in our kitchen (all included of course), although we don't get it ready for them
space: Spacious double bedroom with ensuite facilities, in modern two bedroom flat (which has another bathroom), situated between lively Brixton and Camberwell in zone 2 of South London and very near King's College Hospital. Transport-wise the area is really well served with buses going to Brixton underground station in 10 minutes and there is a train station at walking distance which takes you into the City of London and the fashionable Clerkenwell. Also, the Overground Line (part of the city underground) has just been extended and it now stops in Denmark Hill Station which is 10 minutes walk (towards Camberwell): it now links Clapham Junction all the way to Hampstead via trendy Shoreditch and Dalston. Brixton is a lively area famous for its Afro Caribbean market and has more recently seen a growing number of trendy restaurants and cafes - it boasts the best pizza in London (Franco Manca) according to Time Out! It also hosts the Brixton Academy famous for its concerts and there is a lovely c

name: Relaxing stay in leafy Hackney, E5
summary: Spacious, light and comfortable room with comfortable double bed and its own shower room/WC situated in charming period house on a quiet residential street close to public transport, great shops, markets, restaurants, pubs, cafes and green spaces.
space: The large room which overlooks Millfields Park has exposed timber floors, original stucco ceiling, fireplace, doors and windows and its own bathroom/wc (not en suite, but next to the room and for sole use by our guests), and facilities for making tea. There is a comfy double bed, and for younger children we can also provide a cot or a futon. The bed will be made up for your arrival and towels will be provided. The room also has a desk with views over the park and enough space for your belongings including a rack with hangers for clothing. The room is situated on ground floor just as you enter the house providing an extra sense of independence.

neighborhood_overview: Clapton is a much sought after neighbourhood - it has a lovely traditional high street with old fashioned green grocer, delicatessen, cool cafes, restaurants and pubs, as well as being next to the open spaces of the Lea Valley which connect to the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. It is really close to other interesting areas in East London: Dalston, Shoreditch, Clerkenwell and Spitalfields Market, Broadway Market, London Fields with its heated Lido, Columbia Road Flower Market, Stoke Newington's Church Street, and Hackney Village close to Victoria Park.
notes: The person making the booking will need to be present during the entire stay. We do not accept booking requests via intermediaries (e.g. someone booking on behalf of their friend or family).
transit: We are in Travel Zone 2, with frequent Overground train services to Liverpool Street from nearby Clapton station (10-12 minutes journey time), and many direct bus routes into central London and the West End for all museums, theatres and visitor attractions.
access: There is free wi-fi for guests to use. You are welcome to use our large kitchen for breakfast and on agreement also for preparation of other meals. Space in the fridge is of course provided, and we will try to accommodate any particular requirements.
house_rules: We would ask you to be respectful of our home, as you would be of your own. Please confirm your check-in requirements before booking. Please let us know if you travel with children before booking. The person making the booking will need to be present during the entire stay. We do not accept booking requests via intermediaries (e.g. someone booking on behalf of their friend or family).  We do not accept pets. Please ensure doors and windows are properly locked when leaving. Please no shoes on the timber floors.  Strictly no smoking inside the house. We are happy, on agreement, to let guests use the kitchen. Be respectful of our neighbours if you are coming home late. No overnight visitors unless booked are allowed. We cannot take responsibility of the loss of guests' valuable items. Please keep them safe at all times. If in doubt about anything please ask.

name: Comfortable room to stay in London.
space: Why pay huge hotel bills for your accommodation whilst in London when you can stay in a clean and comfortable room at a fraction of the price! I have a double room in a spacious Victorian house where you can rest after a day's sight-seeing or shopping. New bedlinen is on the bed and a light breakfast can be provided if requested for a small fee.  You'll have a bedroom key and the house keys for your convenience for which a £45 deposit is payable on check-in. This is returned on check-out when the keys are returned and no breakages or damage.  The house is non-smoking but if you're a smoker you may do so in the quiet mature garden. Wi-fi Internet is available for a very small charge of £5 or free for stays of 30 or more days. The house is on a quiet tree-lined road with free parking.  Shops, restaurants, parks, a post office and a leisure centre are five minutes walk away. The train station is approx seven minutes walk with regular trains serving central London, East Croydon and Gatwick

neighborhood_overview: Thornton Heath is a lively multi-cultural South London borough with a wide variety of shops selling different foodstuffs from around the world. There's a 24 hour supermarket and many smaller independent shops open until late in the evening. The community is mainly working class living in a mix of private and social housing.
notes: No shoes please upstairs.
transit: Thornton Heath is in zone 4 with easy and frequent access into central London by overground train and by bus. Gatwick airport is easily reached by train via East Croydon. There is a 24 hour bus, the 250 serving Thornton Heath to Brixton tube station.
access: Guests have access to the rear garden for smoking. Guests are welcomed to use the kitchen facilities.
house_rules: No smoking on the premises . No shoes on carpeted areas e.g. Upstairs, bedrooms etc. Guests to clean up after their use of the kitchen and bathroom. Cleaning products are provided. A refundable deposit of £60 is payable at check-in to cover breakages and replacement of lost keys. This is repaid at check-out if no breakages and on return of keys.

name: Great St Paul's and City location
summary: This listing is our own home and not a managed property.Fantastic location for sightseeing and business. Close to four different tube lines and city thameslink train station. All the comforts of a hotel at half the cost.
space: Fantastic location for sightseeing and business. Close to four different tube lines and city thameslink train station. All the comforts of a hotel at half the cost. Central London Location - The home is just 500 yards from the famous St Paul's Cathederal. It is also close to the Museum of London, the Millenium Bridge as well as 4 tube stations, all within an easy 8 minute walk. . . You will also have access to speedy Internet as well as an underground parking concierge. The flat is on the 8th floor of the building with distant views of post office tower. You are only 10 mins from Thameslink station which goes direct  to Gatwick and Luton airports. You will also be Opposite the Barbican cultural centre. name: Spacious Room Limehouse/Mile End
space: Mile End (1 stop to Stratford - the Olympic Park, Westfield) and Limehouse (two stops from Bank/Tower hill) are both within a 10 mins walk. This 3bedroom flat is on the 9th floor with a great view on Canary Wharf and the City. The block has a private garden facing the Regent's Canal. The room offers a single bed, comfortable sofabed, table with lamp, large wardrobe and chest of drawers. Wifi and bedlinen are provided.

name: Short let - 16 July - 26 Aug 250pw
space: Lovely spacious double room available in house share available for 6 week short let from Monday 16th July - Sunday 26th August, throughout the Olympic period. I will be away from London working for 6 weeks and would like to rent my room during this period. The house is based near Stamford Hill, and just a mile from lovely Stoke Newington. It is a five minute walk to Stamford Hill train station, which has direct links to Liverpool Street in 15 minutes. We are a 10 - 15 minute walk from Seven Sisters station on the Victoria Line, and from there you can be in central London within 15 minutes. There are also numerous buses running regularly within a 5 minute walk. The room has a double bed, desk, chair, armchair, chest of drawers and double wardrobe space. You will be sharing with three lovely housemates, one female and two male. We're all friendly and sociable but don't see too much of each other in the house as we're all working at different times. The house has a shared living room, kit

name: Amazing Luxury Penthouse  - W12
summary: Well located Unique Penthouse in W12, 5 mins walk to Shepherd's Bush Central Line tube. Great location for The West End /Exhibitions/Theatre/Culture.  This is a great space for business travel. The White City Soho House is local, we are walking distance to Olympia Exhibition Centre and Westfield Shopping Centre. We are close proximity to some lovely parks and walks in  Holland Park and Kensington Gardens/High Street, Portobello Road for the  market and great local Pubs in our neighbourhood.
space: Very large stylish and comfortable luxury apartment.  The apartment is a well designed 1700 sq ft Contemporary loft, unique in this location. Very safe & secure in a very private setting in W12.  With 2 large double bedrooms, quality luxury Emperor size and King Size beds,  both very comfortable with V Sprung Mattresses.  Designer on-suite bathroom and a separate shower room. The property has a large living area with open plan kitchen and dinning area.  The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you should need for your stay, built in oven, steam oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher, washing machine,  there is no microwave or tumble drier but plenty of pots and pans and cooking utensils, glasses, crockery and cutlery for you to use and cook at home. Executives that are bored with hotels and want to feel more comfortable in a home environment then this is an ideal work space also. The living room opens out to a lovely terrace where you can enjoy the sun or have evening drinks or have a s

This is a great space for business travel. The White City Soho House is local, we are walking distance to Olympia Exhibition Centre and Westfield Shopping Centre. We are close proximity to some lovely parks and walks in  Holland Park and Kensington Gardens/High Street, Portobello Road for the  market and great local Pubs in our neighbourhood. Very large stylish and comfortable luxury apartment.  The apartment is a well designed 1700 sq ft Contemporary loft, unique in this location. Very safe & secure in a very private setting in W12.  With 2 large double bedrooms, quality luxury Emperor size and King Size beds,  both very comfortable with V Sprung Mattresses.  Designer on-suite bathroom and a separate shower room. The property has a large living area with open plan kitchen and dinning area.  The kitchen is fully equipped with everything
neighborhood_overview: You should definitely visit the portobello road on market days, stop for coffee, enjoy a great lunch.  The parks are amazing for a Sunday walk, Kensington Gardens and Holland Park are well worth a visit.  If you like outdoors there are walks or cycling along the Thames River Path with lovely pubs to stop for lunch.  The central underground is a few minutes walk if you are going to the city you will be there in 20 minutes.  We are also Ideal for the Olympia Exhibition centre which is walking distance.
notes: The apartment is situated on a train line, but you are 4 flights up.  Having lived in the apartment for many years the sound is a humming noise, sometimes you will see the Oriental Express go by.    The windows are double glazed and they do not run at night.  The location of the apartment is very private and peaceful.
transit: Getting around is easy, by foot, tube or Bike's for rental are scattered everywhere.
access: You have access to all the apartment, it's lovely and private, no noisy neighbours and no parties.
house_rules: Whilst we want you to enjoy your stay, Please respect our neighbours.  No smoking inside, but there is a terrace outside.  No high heels or shoes worn in the apartment. No late night parties.  No extra guest unless approved prior to arrival. Please leave clean and tidy, enjoy your stay but respect our home. Happy to answer any questions.  Jackie

name: En-suite double bedroom - Olympics
space: Hello! We have a gorgeous en-suite double bedroom in a secured block of newly built flats, which we are interested in renting out this summer 2012.  Lovely views of the Olympics Aquatics Centre from the bedroom.  The bedroom leads directly to the balcony where you could enjoy the views or simply chill out.   Our flat is around 10 minutes walk from Stratford tube / rail station (Jubilee, Central, DLR, Overground, National Rail), the new Stratford Wesfield City (for shopping, eatery and entertainment) and the Olympics park. We are also less than 5 minutes walk from the Stratford High Street DLR station. Buses run frequently with a dedicated stop right next to the flat. You are most welcome to share the use of our microwave, kettle, toaster, fridge/freezer and washing machine.

name: Olympic Rental - Designer Flat
space: ABOUT THE FLAT: This bright 3 large double bedroomed flat has recently been completely refurbished to a very high specification and includes all the mod cons you would expect from a boutique hotel. It is on the ground and lower ground floor of aVictorian House just off Hackney’s main street known as Mare Street. In a very funky location the flat's cool interior designed interiors reflect the trendy moment happening in East London.The large living-room with solid oak wood flooring is spacious and sunny with a large L-shaped sofa and 2 designer lounge chairs. The flat has cable TV and fast speed wifi throughout. The kitchen is a proper dine-in kitchen with table and chairs for 6-8 people. There are additional chairs in the flat for larger dinner parties. It is fully equipped with everything you could possibly need for your stay including a built in oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, toaster and kettle. There are plenty of pot and pans, cooking utensils, glasses, crockery

name: London Bridge SE1 £1000
space: In a newly refurbished building. Large property with all mod-cons: large fridge and freezer, lots of kitchen and bedroom storage.  Couldn't be better lit , very spacious, very secure.  7 minutes walk from London Bridge Station , 10 mins from Bermondsey Station, 15 mins from Tower Hill.  Only available for 6 months.  Very friendly flat , only sharing with 1 person with a large screen TV ,High speed broadband, a balcony , sits 4 , private and secure parking spot.  2 local drycleaners, 2 off-licenced/grocery store, Indian, chinese , mediteraanean, spanish and many more restaurants within 1-3 mins walks.  3 mins walk from Thames riverside. 9 mins walk from Borough Market.  And Lots more !

name: Bright 2 Bed Flat by Queens Park
summary: Light and spacious 2 double bedroom flat next to the beautiful leafy Queens Park and 5 minutes from the bakerloo line underground (zone 2) and moments from popular bars, restaurants and cafes on Salusbury Road. Available for short term rent now.
space: Set next to a leafy hideaway in central London Beautiful, bright and airy two double bedroom apartment in period Victorian terraced house, opposite Queen's Park.   It would be perfect for 2 couples sharing or a small family ( we have a baby cot). Conveniently located less than 5 minutes walk from Queen's Park Station (Zone 2) with Bakerloo Line underground trains direct to Paddington and Oxford Circus, and overground trains direct to Euston Station.  From Paddington, the Heathrow Express takes just 20 minutes to Heathrow Airport. The apartment is fully furnished and equipped including TV, washing machine, dishwasher - everything you need for a comfortable stay.  Bed linen and towels will be provided and a cleaner can be arranged for stays of longer than 1 week. This is a very safe and enjoyable neighborhood with a range of cafes, bars, restaurants and great local pubs.  There is a farmers market every Sunday selling organic food. house_rules: THIS IS A NO SMOKING HOUSE. CHECK IN AND OUT  Check-in is anytime after 3 pm. If possible we do our best to check you in as soon as you arrive but 3 pm is a deadline. VISITORS  Please ask in advance each time you wish to have a friend or family member visit. We request that there are strictly no visitors from midnight through to 9am.  .  SMOKING  This is a non-smoking apartment therefore no smoking (not even by the window) is allowed ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES ALLOWED WITHIN THE APARTMENT nor disturbing the peace. If we receive a complaint or the police are called with good reason you will have to be asked to leave without a refund and we will not be returning your deposit. neighborhood_overview: Location: The Kingston Upon Thames, a Historical market town is located in SW London. The house is off the main road, Quiet & Leafy, opposite the lovely Canbury Park and the River Thames. It is also very central to all facilities, mins walk to the superb Bentall Shopping Centre; Kingston Train and Bus station; Leisure facilities; Parks;Tennis Court; Cinema; Gym facilities;Tow path on the River Thames;  There are many excellent restaurants and cafes by Kingston riverside. The QUEENS HEAD & THE BOATERS INN  both gastropubs are 5 minutes away, where you can enjoy a beer & fabulous meals.  SAINSBURY Supermarket is only 5 mins walk away.  PLACES OF INTEREST NEARBY -HAMPTON COURT PALACE- A beautiful historic Tudor Palace of Henry the 8th  -WIMBLEDON -home of Lawn tennis -KEW GARDENS - Royal Botanical Gardens -BUSHY PARK- free 5km  PARKRUN (where it all begins) very Saturday -RICHMOND PARK-A Royal Park -free for all to enjoy  ISABELLA PLANTATION,in the heart of Richmond Park. notes: We are also very well located for events like the Annual Hampton Court Flower show; Rugby & Concerts events at Twickenham Rugby Grounds; Kew Gardens; The Hampton Court Half Marathon In February; Annual The Lawn Tennis Wimbledon in June/July. Free Weekly Parkrun at Bushy Park.
transit: TRANSPORT CONNECTIONS -Travel by train ( regular frequency 15 mins) to Waterloo Central London in 20 mins, with the Oyster Card or 1 day Travel Card (zone 1-6) -Travel by Tube (Metro) on District line to Richmond then the No: 65 Bus (outside Richmond Station)- STOP at WINDSOR ROAD, 3 mins walk to the house. AIRPORT CONNECTIONS- - Taxi from the airports best to prebook on line, - Heathrow Central Bus Station to Kingston Cromwell Road   via  X26. - London Gatwick/Stansted/Luton  to Kingston; by train or coach to Central London then change train via Vauxhall/ Clapham Junction or Waterloo to  Kingston
access: -Tea/Coffee & a kettle in the guest room. -For Health & Safety reasons cooking is NOT permitted in the bedroom. -Bed linen and towels provided are changed weekly. In general, the use of the communal space is not included within the cost of renting the room. The rental is best viewed as renting the room alone.  FREE - WIFI FREE PARKING: 06.30pm - 08.30am,  At other times Resident Permit can be arranged at extra cost £4 per day per car. Use of Kitchen is not permitted but meal plans for breakfast or  dinner can be arranged at a very fair price.
house_rules: No smoking household! Please note, the kitchen is only available by arrangement and the preparation of light snacks only. We can make exceptions when necessary!  That being said, the place is warm, family environment and we want to make all our guests feel welcome. As this is a private family home, we do take  safety and security very seriously. Generally there is someone in the house, please advise the estimated time of arrival once booking is confirmed.  If you are booking for 2  or 3 persons please provide full details of the all occupants ( Gender. Age, Passport details) for the duration of the stay. For insurance purposes, please make direct enquiry with us as we do not accept bookings on behalf of friends. For hygiene reasons, we also like our guests to remove their outdoor shoes after they enter the house.

name: Comfy 2 bed apartment in Central London
summary: This is a newly renovated (April 2020) cosy, bright and sunny apartment.  After each guest apartment is cleaned according" Interim guidance for environmental cleaning in non-healthcare facilities exposed to SARS-CoV-2"  issued by ECDPC Free high speed WiFi, lounge and dining area, kitchen with all cooking facilities. Located  near 3 underground stops 5-15 mins walk away. If you are on a business trip, the apartment located in between 2 bank and business districts: Canary Wharf and City.
space: There are 2 decent size bedrooms and living room, kitchen with all cooking facilities, washing machine, hob, oven, fridge and bathroom with bath and shower. The apartment is centrally heated and has free Wi-Fi. The London tube stations of Shadwell and Whitechapel are only 5-10 minutes (500 - 700m) walk away. Master bedroom has a super king size bed with a very comfortable mattresses and anti-allergy pillows and duvets. Egyptian high quality bed linen will make your stay extremely comfortable. 2nd bedroom has a double bed. Rooms are light, airy with a blackout blinds. The apartment is very close to the Spitafields, Brick lane and Columbia road markets. You can find there unique presents and souvenirs, art, vintage and hand made clothes and jewelry, try excellent food and absorbed the urban atmosphere of East London. name: Fantastic room in Shoreditch/Hoxton
summary: Arty little flat but with your own private room with en suite bathroom.  Free to come and and go as you please . Individuals or Couples are welcome. Towles and bed linen provided.  As I’m an artist there is lots of art and books around.  You are sharing my home and all I ask is that we respect each other’s privacy and I in return will make your stay as comfortable as possible .
space: A large double room to rent which is ideal for a short term holiday rental or a business trip. Its a quirky little flat based in the Shoreditch/Hoxton are. You will have your own room with en suite bathroom but are welcome to share the kitchen and living room with me.   Its a very close to the City and  has excellent transport links into the West End with Hoxton Overground just a few hundred yards down the road. This is a vibrant and happening area with many galleries and markets including Columbia Rd Flower Market and Brick Lane.  The flat is on a quiet street but only a short walking distance from the vibrant night life of Kingsland Rd and Hoxton Square. Its a well located and quirky little home which is clean and comfortable.  Its perfect as a base to explore the rest of London.  Please bear in mind that this is my home and I  will be around some of the time we will always keep a low profile and respect your  privacy.  I would be happy for you to have the whole use of the house whil

name: Cute, cosy, quiet  1-bed flat in conservation area
summary: A beautiful, cosy home in a quiet, leafy street within walking distance of all the great spots of north and east London: Old Street, Angel, Hackney, Dalston, London Fields and more. Live on the top floor of a conservation-area terraced house, from where you can see the City and the sky, while enjoying the peaceful quietness of our neighbourhood. To previous guests: I have recently updated the flat with a new double bed, a small bistro table, a proper desk and new towels.
space: PRETTY LITTLE HOME ON ISLINGTON/HACKNEY BORDER NEAR DE BEAUVOIR TOWN, CLOSE TO REGENT'S CANAL, DALSTON, OLD STREET, ANGEL AND SHOREDITCH. BLISSFULLY QUIET RESIDENTIAL STREET WITH GOOD TRANSPORT LINKS.  Up for rent is my cute little one-bed flat in a period conversion house in Islington. I'm situated close to Hackney and Regent's Canal, and Dalston, Haggerston, Kingsland Road, Old Street and Angel are all easy to walk to.  The flat is on the second floor (stairs, no lift) with plenty of natural light, a new boiler and lovely neighbours. The bedroom features a double bed with a medium mattress and a fitted wardrobe. You have plenty of storage space for shoes, drawers and hanging space. You may well never want to get up though, because you really look into the sky, and at night you can see the City lights in the distance.  The living room features an Ikea desk (good height!). The couch table is a little space miracle: it folds out to twice its size and can also be made higher for dinner.

The flat is on the second floor (stairs, no lift) with plenty of natural light, a new boiler and l
neighborhood_overview: VISITORS GUIDE TO THE NEIGHBOURHOOD: Walkable areas: - Islington: Upper Street is around 10-15 mins walk, and you’ll find all your shopping needs there (Whistles, Aria, Space NK, etc pp), bars, restaurants, pubs, the Screen on the Green, and the famous Almeida Theatre here. - Hoxton: Hip-establishment with tech start-up vibe. Old Street station is around 15 mins walk, and from there you can easily walk to Hoxton Square, Curtain Road, Great Eastern Street and Shoreditch High Street. Too many bars, pubs and restaurants to list. - Dalston: If you’re 25 you probably love it – lots of clubs and the bars around Dalston Junction and Kingsland Road. Café Oto has been voted the coolest bar in Europe, and that’s a 15 mins walk. - Broadway Market/London Fields: Best on a Saturday, when the food market is on, and the market leads on to London Fields. The market offers amazing fresh produce, meat, etc. as well as lots of lunch and cake options to have there. While Broadway Market is a 20 min-stroll
transit: Buses into town: 38: towards Gray’s Inn, Holborn, Covent Garden, Victoria 56: towards Clerkenwell, Barbican 73: towards King’s Cross, Tottenham Court Road, Oxford Circus, Bond Street, Victoria 341: towards Gray’s Inn, Waterloo 476: towards King’s Cross, Euston 76: towards the City, St. Paul’s, Aldwych (Covent Garden south side) 21 and 141: towards the City, London Bridge 271: towards Moorgate In short, you can get pretty much anywhere with a bus nearby! Tube/trains:  Angel, Old Street (both Northern Line) Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line, Overground) Haggerston, Dalston Junction (Overground) Additionally, the Santander Bikes are available in Shoreditch Park, and other bikes (such as Uber) are all around the streets now.
house_rules: - This is a residential neighbourhood and house. Please keep the noise down, and please no parties.  - The flat is entirely decked out in wooden floors. Please take off high heels and anything else that might damage the floorboards.  - No smoking please. - In the interest of safety, please always lock the front door (I'll show you how).

name: Spacious bright quiet studio flat
summary: Calm and peaceful, light and airy independent top floor flat in Victorian Town House in a cosmopolitan neighbourhood - Perfect to come home to after a busy day working or exploring London. Wifi/Ethernet, TV, new tiled Shower-Bath, Kitchenette.  Excellent transport nearby : Kilburn-Brondesbury-West Hampstead with most of London within 20-30 minutes door to door.  Heathrow 50 minutes. Gatwick or City Airports 65 minutes.
space: Lovely and quiet, bright and with a pleasant view, this is a well appointed self-contained studio flat occupying the entire top floor of a characterful London Victorian private townhouse in very conveniently located Kilburn, North West London. Newly installed in Summer 2016, by popular demand - a shower!! Note that reviews that say we don't are out-of-date now.  We can provide a super-king size Hypnos bed or twin single beds, depending on your requirements. The flat includes en-suite private bathroom, small kitchenette with fridge/freezer, stove and microwave, expresso maker, kettle, toaster. Wifi/(website hidden). Modern/vintage furniture.  Wardrobe with full length mirror, hanging and drawer space, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Sheets, bedding and towels are provided. A cleaner (who will also change sheets and towels) will be provided for stays of more than 1 week. We are also happy to buy provisions for you in advance of arrival, upon request. Children and/or babies are welcome

name: Denmark Hill - Sabbaticals/Holidays
summary: Fabulous 1960s modernist three storey family Townhouse,  spacious and light filled,  fully furnished and equipped. Accommodation includes three bedrooms, living room, kitchen / dining room, bathrooms, balcony, back garden, central green, leafy ambience.
space: This fabulous 1960s modernist three storey Townhouse is part of an award-winning development of 32 houses surrounding an attractive green designed by the architect Peter Moiret.  It is spacious and light filled and fully furnished and equipped for families. Accommodation is approximately 1,200 sq ft, includes three bedrooms, living room, kitchen / dining room, bathroom and shower room. The house has a balcony on the first floor overlooking the garden at the rear. Ground floor houses kitchen / diner, shower room, access to a garage storeroom (not available for cars but suitable for cycles and motor cycles) and rear garden. First floor: consists of an stunning open-plan reception / dining area with balcony to rear. Top floor: contains three bedrooms and bathroom/shower. The neighbourhood is calm and quite 'leafy' with the houses overlooking the central garden square. There is minimal traffic noise because all the houses behind the development are also on cul de sacs.  Although it is very
