neighborhood_overview: The area offers wonderful contrasts:  the immediate area is leafy and tranquil yet it has easy access to the centre of London, fabulous shops and restaurants nearby, a Sainsbury's Superstore within walking distance and beautiful parks within easy walking distance. The houses are built around a central garden green providing a wonderful social space in the summer where the children play together and adults share the odd glass of wine in the sun.
notes: Not suitable for groups. Baby gates and travel cot available. Enclosed back garden.
transit: Denmark Hill is situated between Herne Hill, Dulwich and Camberwell and the house is just a 10 minute stroll from Denmark Hill station in Zone Two, with direct trains to London Victoria, London Bridge, Elephant & Castle, Kings Cross St Pancras, St Pancras International and beyond. Denmark Hill Station joined the London Overground network in December 2012 with added connections west to Clapham Junction and east to Peckham Rye, Canada Water, Surrey Quays and Whitechapel. East Dulwich station is a 12 minute walk away.  Numerous buses run from Camberwell Green to Vauxhall, Brixton, East Dulwich, Herne Hill, Peckham, Greenwich, Elephant & Castle, Waterloo, London Bridge, Euston, Trafalgar and Leicester Squares, Covent Garden, Holborn (approx 30 mins) and beyond. In particular the 68 and 176 bus services run every few minutes throughout the day from close by to Central London via Elephant and Castle, Waterloo and South Bank to Strand, Trafalgar Square, Covent Garden, Aldwych,  Holborn, Eusto
house_rules: House NOT suitable for groups. This area is quiet and has families with young children living close by - please take account of this and keep late night noise to an acceptable level. Shoes off inside, please and no smoking within the building - there is a balcony on the first floor where you can smoke outside. If anything gets broken or damaged please do tell us so that we can replace it for the next person (it is hard to replace something we don't know about!) Enjoy our house, if you do tell your friends - if you don't please tell us so we can improve :) No parties, no groups and no pets.

name: Bright Spacious 2-Bed - Victorian School E2
summary: Two-bedroom East London apartment in a converted Victorian School Building with huge windows and very high ceilings. The spacious main living area/kitchen gets beautiful light in the morning. Although the building is just off busy Hackney Road, the street itself is very quiet. The view from the windows through a leafy tall sycamore is of modernist icon Keeling House with Canary Wharf in the distance. The apartment is bright, airy and calm.
space: There is one large double bedroom and one smaller one - both have double beds up on raised platforms reached by ladder. It sleeps 4 people sharing doubles and we can also leave a blow-up double mattress and bedding if you have extra people/kids needing separate beds. There are writing desks in both bedrooms. It is excellently located for London’s tourist attractions. NEARBY ATTRACTIONS:  Broadway Market is a short walk away over the canal. Thriving cafés, pubs, restaurants, organic veg shops, Market Day on Saturdays. Columbia Road Flower Market (Sundays)  Small independent gift shops, bookshops, nice pubs and restaurants – very picturesque old London streets, 5 mins walk away. London Fields Lido for outdoor swims. Shoreditch & Hoxton Brick Lane (for Banglatown curry restaurants) and old Spitalfields (for the cobbled streets of 18th C east London) are also nearby. Thriving cafés, pubs, restaurants, organic veg shops, Market Day on Saturdays. Columbia Road Flower Market (Sund
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the intersection between Hackney, Bethnal Green and Shoreditch.  East London is infamous for its hipsters and street style - but that's due to the air of tolerance and 'anything goes' approach!  We love this area for its diverse community where all ethnicities, social backgrounds and persuasions intermingle.  We've lived in the neighbourhood for 13 years and still love it.  In the past few years the area has gentrified further, which of course is not without its problems.  But from the perspective of a visitor you'll now find there are a huge range of independent shops, barista coffee spots and delicious food within a short walk either direction.  We'll leave a list of restaurant recommendations for you.
transit: TRAVEL LINKS:  7 minutes walk to Bethnal Green tube for Central Line straight into Central London - 15/20 min on tube. Buses 55, 48, 26 right outside on Hackney Road (connect you to main rail stations Liverpool St, Waterloo, London Bridge; and Central London)  Plenty of city bikes depots nearby - £2 per use!  We can also give you a fob for the secure gated CAR PARK if you are driving.
access: Main large kitchen/living space, bathroom, 2 x bedrooms
house_rules: The raised beds are not suitable for small children as there is no railing.  Please get in touch if you are coming with family, especially small children as the flat can be made 'child-friendly' for long stays.

name: Stylish Central London Apartment
space: Entire flat available located just off beautiful Cleaver Square in Kennington. On sunny weekends the square fills up with people playing petanque.. Very charming. On the square there is a traditional English pub which serves food and drinks. There are many restaurants in the immediate location. It is only a 4 minute walk to the tube station and 2 stops from the West End. From this tube station there are good links to all parts of the city. The flat interior is of a modern urban style with exposed brick walls and wooden floors it includes all comforts..  Wifi internet, cable TV, wet room bathroom, balcony, double bedroom, NEW DOUBLE SOFA BED (1m35 wide POCKET SPRUNG EVERY DAY MATTRESS) in the living room, Nespresso coffeee maker (which also now takes Carte Noire capsules).. The balcony with an excess of 30 plants is a real urban oasis.  This apartment is unique and will be a perfect retreat after a busy day in the city.

The balcony with an excess of 30 plants is a real urban oasis.  This apartment is unique and will be a perfect retreat after a busy day in the city. Entire appartment and terrace. I will not be present during your st
neighborhood_overview: Cleaver Street serves as the entrance to Cleaver Square which is the prettiest and most well known of Kennington's Geogian squares. In spring the cherry trees are in full blossom and then in summer people come to play petanque. On summer evenings (and warm spring/Autumn ones) the square provides a great place for a relaxing drink. The Prince of Wales pub is in the square and traditional pub food and drink are available all year around. On Kennington Road there are a number of pubs, restaurants and cafes. The Tommy Field gastropub is literally accross the road from the apartment and they serve great food and drink. The apartment is a short walk through Cleaver Square to Kennington Underground station.
notes: Sorry but we're unable to accomodate any check ins after 9pm. Bed linen for both beds (excluding the Cot Bed) and towels are provided.
transit: The apartment is a short safe walk (less than 5 mins) through Cleaver Square to Kennington Underground station. There are numerous bus stops on Kennington Road, Kennington Park Road and Kennington Lane which serve all areas of the city including night buses. These stops are all right around the corner. Vauxhall (10 mins walk) has a bus station, an overground train station and also a tube station.  Check out TFL (Transport For London) and search Kennington or Vauxhall  for more info.
access: Entire appartment and terrace.
house_rules: Enjoy the flat and also respect the neighbours. No smoking indoors but it's cool to smoke on the balcony, there is an ash tray provided.. There is no cleaning surcharge but I would ask you to please leave the flat clean and tidy. This flat has bare brick walls and would not suit someone with bad allergies. Above all have a great stay!!!

name: Double bedroom near Olympic village
space: I have a spacious double bedroom available near the Stratford Olympic village.  It's 2 train stops or a 20 minute walk.  Train station is 100m away, as well as main bus hub.  Shops, Restaurants, Cinema, and London fields are all in walking distance.  The room is part of a two bedroom flat, so there will be someone living in the floor below you.  An air mattress could also be arranged if you want to fit more people.  We have a patio with a bbq grill and a large projector with surround sound in the living room, free wi-fi, and a kitchen with washing machine, slow cooker, steamer, and blender.  Nearby Tesco open 24 hours a day.

summary: A quiet, friendly neighbourhood, close to transport links with very easy access to central London.  We have had Airbnb guests for 5 years now and would love to hear from people looking to stay short, medium or long term.
space: A modern, comfortable single room with adjacent shower room/wc for your use on the ground floor of my townhouse.  We live upstairs and you are very welcome to use the kitchen and open plan living room. Off street parking, wifi/internet, 5 minutes walk to station with easy access to London (17 minutes). There's an express supermarket (open late), bakery and newsagent 3 minutes' walk away.   Nearby there is Crystal Palace Park, the Horniman Museum and Dulwich Art Gallery.  Travel into central London for all the sights! Tea/coffee making facilities are provided along with a fridge. Bedlinen and towels included. Use of a large shared kitchen. We are friendly and will help to make your stay as easy as possible. We would be particularly interested in people wishing to stay long term.  Please contact me for details.

name: E2 lovely double, 5 mins to tube
summary: Private room in bright and airy and quite house.
space: Sunny double bedroom in newly renovated quirky house in E2. The room is at the back of the house and hence is very quiet and overlooks peaceful back gardens. The house is in a quiet street 5 mins walk from Bethnal Green tube, which gets you into the City in 5 mins or the West End in 15. You can stroll into Shoreditch or Brick Lane in 20 mins, and Columbia Road and Broadway Market are within easy reach. There are a some good local cafes and a couple of great pubs which serve nice food all within few mins walk. The house has 2 bathrooms, and as its only me living here, you effectively have your own bathroom. There's plenty of eating and general hanging out space, and a nice sunny patio which is great in the summer. Parking outside is no problem with permit that I can supply. Washing machine/dishwasher/sat tv/wifi all in place.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is in the great location of Old Bethnal Green. Good for restaurants, pubs, bars and shops of Bethnal Green, 10 minute walk to the shops, markets and nightlife of trendy Shoreditch.  Also a 10 minute to broadway market, a must do on a Saturday and great for food and drinks all week long. Columbia Road Flower Market is also just moments away, open on Sunday. The most beautiful park in London - Victoria Park is just a short walk.
transit: Shoreditch, Spittlefeilds is 10-15 minutes walk. Liverpool Street station is 20 minutes walk, or 10 minutes by bus. There's also a sunny, south-facing garden to relax and enjoy during the warmer months. name: Central panoramic Flat Bankside near Tate modern
space: This listing is for a loft style flat in central London - Zone 1.  Closest tube station is Southwark (Jubilee line) -3 min walk.  The flat is spacious and light with one large semi- open space  and a separate bedroom. The flat is 2 bedroom, however the part of the wall was removed between second bedroom and lounge.  The  Bedroom is facing east with views towards  Shard -tallest building in London. There is a king size bed ( 150cmx 200cm) with a foam mattress. The room is simply furnished and free of clutter.  The other bedroom is facing west and  is conjoined with a living / kitchen area to maximize the space and light. The current layout would suit 2 people sharing the bedroom.   The flat has a balcony with fantastic city views. Wooden floors throughout.  Wireless internet. Please note the flat is on 4th floor and there is no lift. Please ask if you have any additional questions

neighborhood_overview: Fantastic Location. Abundance of cultural venues nearby: Tate Modern, Southbank center,  Cinemas - British film institute, Curzon Mondrian. Theater -Old and Young Vic, Globe,  National theater. independent bookshops, food markets, Borough market. Coffee shops (Monmouth is my favorite). The Table on Southwark Street for fantastic breakfast.  For evening -Union Cafe on Great Suffolk Street, Anchor and Hope on the Cut, Brindisa in London Bridge, etc...  I can give you more tips where to go and what to see if you need.
notes: There is no Lift. Flat is on the 4th floor - which is a top floor from from my entrance, however  the building has additional floors  that are accessible from other entrances.
transit: Closest tube Southwark, 5-10 walk to Waterloo and London Bridge that also have train stations along with Underground service.  Blackfriars Train station with link to Gatwick and Luton is also around the corner.  Barclays bikes are just around the corner and available for £2 a day or weekly membership. 15 min cycling to Covent Garden, Soho or a longer but pleasant ride through parks towards Knightsbridge/South Kensington and Notting Hill.

summary: Spacious and modern top floor Apartment with breathtaking views over the London Skyline on one side and a leafy park on the other. Situated right next to the picturesque Regents Canal and Victoria Park, a short stroll away from trendy Shoreditch.
space: ACCOMMODATION: A spacious modern two bedroom apartment, with two separate bathrooms (one En-Suite), an open plan living-room wooden floors throughout. name: Lovely, modern, flat in Shoreditch
summary: A sunny flat with all mod cons in exciting Shoreditch. Lots of transport links and only a few minutes to lots of restaurants, bars and parks.
space: A really bright one bedroom apartment in Shoreditch / East London. New kitchen and bathroom, wood floors, balcony - all mod cons; washing machine, wireless internet etc and a small balcony. It consists of a separate double bedroom with wardrobe and draws, a combined kitchen and lounge and separate bathroom with shower-bath. The lounge has two sofas and a selection of books and DVDs to borrow. The kitchen has pots, pans, plates, glasses and everything necessary for cooking, in addition to a washing machine. The location is fantastic - only a 5 minute walk to Shoreditch High Street Station or Bethnal Green Station - on the East London Line and Central Line for underground. It's only a 10m walk to Liverpool Street Station making it very accessible to Stansted airport. name: Beautiful Georgian House by Heath
summary: Please check availability before booking. A beautiful double room with living room in a stunning four storey Georgian House, dating 1770, situated next to Hampstead Heath with convenient travel links around London.
space: Please check availability before booking. A beautiful double room with living room in a stunning four storey Georgian House, dating 1770, situated next to Hampstead Heath with easy and quick travel links around London. You essentially have your own floor within the house comprising of a double bedroom with adjacent living room. Floor to ceiling windows, tv. There is a shared bathroom, outside your room and an  additional wet room on the floor below. Outside there is a 135ft garden, perfect for bbq's on hot summer evenings. It is also possible to rent the entire house if required, there are two further bedrooms. A love of animals is essential as I have a cat and a dog although these are not allowed in your room, unless requested! The house boasts many features including original panelling and fireplaces. name: Lovely Private Bedroom - Maida Vale
space: *** Guest Bedroom with Double Bed, Shared Bathroom *** Enjoy London while staying in a large private bedroom, in a sunny top floor flat, located in the pretty tree-lined Maida Vale neighbourhood. Very centrally located, just outside Zone 1 and very convenient for travel around London. A 5 minute / 2 block walk from the Warwick Ave tube stop on the Bakerloo Underground line, or you can walk to Paddington Station in 10 minutes along the scenic canal.  Little Venice is just a block beyond the Warwick Ave Tube station. The BBC Maida Vale Studios and the Paddington Sports Club (private) are within easy walking distance. There are nearby bus stops with lines to Oxford Circus, Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square and Harrods. Cool restaurants and pubs are close by, some on the canal.  If you have a car, there is easy street parking (metered).   The bedroom is large, with a comfy double bed, good reading lamps and an iPod player.  There is a charming (non-working) fireplace, also closet space.

house_rules: Fresh towels and bedding provided for each guest. This is a non-smoking household, and therefore ask that you do not smoke in the flat.  I also ask that you do not have guests (other than those who we know about!). Swiping down the glass shower stall is very appreciated and better for the limestone! If you use the kitchen, please clean it up. Because I go to bed around 11pm and wake around 7am, I would ask you to respect this and keep volume to a minimum during these times.

name: A lovely one bedroom garden flat!!
space: Olympics season rental only!  We offer our beautiful and specious one bedroom garden flat in lovely and trendy Queen's Park.  It's centrally located with excellent transport links (15 minutes ride to central London, Bakerloo tube zone 2, London's overground and buses).  It is a minute walk from shops, cafe's & restaurants, Sainsbury's is right around the corner and the park is literally at the end of the road.  The flat has a fully equipped kitchen, very nice private garden, TV, Wifi, shower (no bath). Utility bills are included in rental price. There is no land line.  Minimum rental period - 6 nights. We will require a 500 GBP deposit.

name: 2bed Penthouse N8 London - Wifi
space: We are offering a bright modern penthouse flat with a big balcony and fantastic views over North London. The flat is in Crouch End, a vibrant area with lots of trendy cafes, bars and restaurants (Japanese, Thai, Malaysian, Turkish, Italian, French, Vietnamese, Chinese, Greek, Carribean, etc) - all within 5 mins walking distance. There are 4 supermarkets within walking distance including Marks and Spencer which is literally next door. Travelling to Central London is easy - Bus goes directly from outside the apartment to Piccadilly Circus via Kings Cross.  Alternatively, a 10 mins short bus ride will take you to Zone 2 Tube Station (Finsbury Park or Archway). Travelling to Olympics - Again a bus ride to North London Line (Railway - Caledonian Road and Barnsbury) which goes straight to Stratford (the Olympic Park) - no need to go via central London. name: Only 1 mile from London Bridge !
summary: Welcome to my place- A funky retro 2 bed flat 1 mile from the iconic Shard at  London Bridge. Great for transport links and close to the main attractions on the South Bank /Thames River. A real home, cosy and welcoming. There are free kisses from Cassie the resident Boston Terrier included she  is super friendly and loves new people! The  room includes WI-FI, and use of a Smartpad and Bluetooth speaker.
space: Hello my name is Tia, and I have a cool double room available one mile from London Bridge in a 2 bed  funky retro-vibe apartment with a view of the Shard.  The modern 2 bed apartment  has been refurbished with tiger bamboo floors. It is situated on the top floor of a private development. This building has 3  levels and we have a fantastic view of Burgess Park including the lake. If you like a morning run this green space is a great bonus! There are two bathrooms, the main bathroom which is for the exclusive use of the guest has a bath-tub  and shower and there is full use of the kitchen and lounge space with a large flat screen . You are welcome to use the laundry facilities. Included in the price is unlimited wi-fi access so you can feel free to surf .There is also a Smartpad and Bluetooth speaker included in the room for your own personal use. The flat is in zone 2 and is really well located and has a lot of tourist destinations in really easy access to Tower Bridge , Westminster, Lo

name: Pristine Flat in cool Bermondsey
space: One bedroom flat in a new block just south of Tower Bridge. The flat is roomy with large kitchen/lounge area, separate bedroom, bathroom and utility cupboard with washing machine. There is a small balcony overlooking a private courtyard. There is a sofa bed in the living room which could accommodate two people at a pinch, so the flat could just about house four people, but I'm not sure how comfortable that would be, so I've listed it as accommodation for three. If you have any questions, just ask. The flat is very centrally located. Bermondsey tube station is a ten minute walk away so you can get into Central London in twenty minutes. You're also just fifteen minutes walk from London Bridge for further transport options. Alternatively, Tate Modern is a lovely half hour walk along the river from the flat. Bermondsey is a fantastic base for a stay in London - you're a five minute walk away from some of London's best and best value restaurants on Bermondsey Street, and the area is full of

name: Large Double room private bath near Kilburn tube
summary: A large bedroom with a large private bathroom that can accommodate up to 3 persons in a family Victorian house only 2 minutes from 2 tube stations (Kilburn and Brondesbury), zone 2. Located in busy and mulitcultural Kilburn, North West London.
space: You will be sharing our family home, a 4 floor Victorian house in the North West of London, Kilburn.  The bedroom  and private bathroom are located in the first floor of the house. The bedroom is large for London standards and bright. It has a Kingsize bed, small sofa, chair and some cupboard space.  The bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom  (en suite) and will be for your sole use. It has a big central bath (great after a long day of sightseeing/ shopping), steam shower, sink and toilet.  If you are booking for 3 guests, I will add a comfortable mattress. I will provide you with  bedlinen and towels that I will change for you every week. I also supply soap, a hair-dryer and numerous guidebooks and maps. Some plug adaptors are available but I would advise that you bring you own as they tend to disappear at times. You will be sharing the house with me, my now grown -up daughter and my son when is back from Uni.  Coffee and tea are available in the kitchen downstairs.
description: A large bedroom with a large private bathroom that can accommodate up to 3 persons in a family Victorian house only 2 minutes from 2 tube stations (Kilburn and Brondesbury), zone 2. Located in busy and mulitcultural Kilburn, North West London. You will be sharing our family home, a 4 floor Victorian house in the North West of London, Kilburn.  The bedroom  and private bathroom are located in the first floor of the house. The bedroom is large for London standards and bright. It has a Kingsize bed, small sofa, chair and some cupboard space.  The bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom  (en suite) and will be for your sole use. It has a big central bath (great after a long day of sightseeing/ shopping), steam shower, sink and toilet.  If you are booking for 3 guests, I will add a comfortable mattress. I will provide you with  bedlinen and towels that I will change for you every week. I also supply soap, a hair-dryer and numerous guidebooks and maps. Some plug adaptors are available but I woul
neighborhood_overview: Kilburn is a North West London neighbourhood. We are in Zone 2. Kilburn has since the Roman times been a place a passage, Kilburn High Road being an old Roman road. It is multicultural and enjoys a very varied and busy high street, where as some say “everything and anything can be found”. Kilburn high road used to be the biggest shopping and entertainment street in Victorian times. We have shops  and eateries catering for all tastes, from the first Primark shop in London, to TKMaxx for example. The Tricycle, a very successful cinema/theatre, is minutes from the house. Kilburn is also home to the  “State”, now a church that was the biggest cinema in the world. It is opened to the public on Wednesdays. Within walking distance is a nice park if you enjoy a run and are travelling with children. If you like pubs, there are 5 within 5 mins walk. If you prefer a less busy atmosphere then West Hampstead and Queens Park are minutes away.
notes: We have 2 small cats, bu they do not have access the the floor where the bedroom and bathroom are.
transit: We are very well located for public transport and major tourist sights are within easy reach. I would advise that you get “pay as you go” Oyster cards  for use on the public transport network -2 tube stations within 2 mins walk, “Kilburn” on the Jubilee Line and “Brondesbury” on the overground. It will take you 18 minutes to get to Westminster(Big Ben), 15 mins to Bond Street, 12 mins to Camden market or 14 mins to Wembley stadium. -2 24/7 bus routes 2 mins walk- Number 16 that goes to Victoria and number 189 that goes to Oxford Circus via Baker Street and Abbey Road. We also have bus number 332 to Paddington station or number 316 to Notting Hill. - train station “West Hampstead Thameslink” at the end of our road with direct trains to St Pancras (9 mins), Luton Airport and Gatwick Airport. If you are arriving at Stansted or Heathrow I will give you directions and travel should take about 1h30mins. I can provide the number for minicabs if you have heavy luggage.
access: You can freely use our  kitchen and lounge in the basement. I can make some space in the fridge if you require it. You can help yourselves to coffee and tea and cook light meals. I do not supply breakfast as there are numerous places offering great breakfasts within a few minutes walk and numerous grocery stores  within 2 mins walk. You can also use the garden, weather allowing.
house_rules: The rules are simple... Make yourself feel like home.  I want you to enjoy your stay, so if anything is missing or bothering you please let me know as soon as possible. I will provide you with a key to the house so you can come and go as you please. Please ensure that the door is securely closed on entry and exit. So that we can all have a good night sleep I ask guests to be quiet, and not to use the bath or shower between 11pm and 6am. Check-in time is flexible but I require guests to give a 2 hours slot arrival time, at least 48 hours before check-in date. There will be a charge of £50 for any arrival outside this slot, unless there is clear communication of delays in a timely manner. Check-out is 11am. Without prior approval of late check-out time, there will an additional charge of £20 per hour after 11am. Additional guests are not allowed unless with prior approval.

name: Sunny en suite loft Shepherds Bush
summary: A light and spacious loft room with very comfortable king sized bed and ensuite half bathroom with washbasin and WC. It has fast wifi. a large chest of drawers and hanging rail, a bigTV, books and DVDs and a desk with swivel chair and light. There is a small separate kitchen area with table and seating for guests exclusive use with tea and coffee making facilities, fridge, microwave and toaster. The area has excellent transport links and is close to supermarkets, bars, cafes and a lovely park.
space: A very large, light and airy loft room, with en-suite half bathroom with washbasin and WC. The king size bed is very comfortable, there is also a desk and chair, a clothes hanging rail and a large chest of drawers.There is a cupboard with a choice of books and DVDs. There are two small chairs and a side table to watch TV . Bedside table has lighting and a radio alarm. The large TV has freeview channels and Amazon video, there is unlimited WIFI. The room is on 2 levels, the lower level down a flight of stairs has a small separate kitchenette with table and chairs for guests exclusive use. It has tea and coffee making facilities, fridge, microwave and toaster. There is gas central heating with a radiator in the bedroom and a plug in oil filled radiator for the kitchenette. There is also a large fan if the weather gets too warm.

neighborhood_overview: The house is in a quiet tree lined street, with Victorian brick houses which were built around 1895. It is within minutes of Ravenscourt Park, which has open space, a lake with wild ducks and geese, a nature reserve, tennis courts and two cafes. The second cafe is under the railway arches inside the W6 Garden Centre. The immediate area is quiet and peaceful with very little through traffic, but only minutes from shops, supermarkets, pubs and cafes and ATMs. It is a safe, mixed neighbourhood. The streets are well lit and it takes only a few minutes to walk to the nearest bus stop. The nearest main street is Askew Rd We are within walking distance of the centre of Shepherds Bush with theatres, clubs, cinemas, music venues, pubs, cafes, the open market, and shops of all descriptions, including the enormous Westfield shopping centre. The river is about a 20 minute walk, where there are many pubs where food is served. Hyde Park and Holland Park are a short bus ride away
notes: Sometimes the host will have work, family commitments or holidays that will take place away from London. If there is any reason why the host can't be around during your stay this will be communicated to you in advance and provision will be made for someone to assist in settling you in. There is no access to the main kitchen, only for occasional use of the washing machine.
transit: Shepherds Bush, Hammersmith and Chiswick are a brisk walk away. It is easy to get to all parts of London using local public transport. Public transport options: 4 mins walk to 94 bus stop for bus to central London approx every 3-5 mins peak times. 94 and 237 also stop outside Goldhawk Rd station (2 mins) and Shepherds bush station (5 mins) Journey times: Shepherds Bush 5 mins Notting Hill 15 mins Hyde Park 20 mins Marble Arch 30 mins Piccadilly Circus 40 mins, approx times as traffic is a variable! 10 mins walk to Shepherds Bush Market or Goldhawk Road Stations, for Hammersmith and City line trains to Portobello Market, Baker Street (Madame Tussauds), Euston and Kings Cross. 15 mins walk to Ravenscourt Park District line station, for trains to Earls Court, South Kensington, Trafalgar Square and South Bank. 20 mins walk to Shepherds Bush Central Line station for Marble Arch, Bond St, Oxford St, St Pauls, Stratford
access: As well as the very spacious loft area, the guest has use of a kettle, toaster, microwave and fridge. It is possible by arrangement to use the washing machine downstairs in the family kitchen and a drying frame which should be kept upstairs. The bathtub and shower are in the main bathroom on the first floor, which is usually shared with one other person.
house_rules: *Please keep the place clean and tidy. *If you bring people to stay please let me know so I am aware of who is in the house. *If there is anything you wish to use in the kitchen apart from kettle, fridge and microwave, ask me and I will advise what to use and where it is. * laundry to preferably be done on Saturday, a laundry basket and drying rack is in the room. *any problems just ask. *please remove shoes if it is wet and muddy outside.

name: Chic double room in boutique flat, Zone 1
summary: Delightful double room in south-central Victorian flat, on a quiet residential street in a charming conservation area, yet just two minutes from Zone 1 Elephant & Castle tube and amenities including buses, rail, bikes, pubs, cafés and restaurants. A fabulously quirky base for exploring London.
space: In the heart of the Elliott's Row Conservation area, the street is a real slice of 'olde London' with its Victorian/Georgian architecture on a quiet residential street. Situated on the first floor of a converted Victorian house, the flat is comfortable and quirkily decorated, and perfectly situated for exploring London. The room has a double bed with a comfortable, quality mattress, bedlinen, towels and wifi, and is bright and airy with a huge sash window which overlooks the back gardens, so is quiet and peaceful, yet very convenient for central London. Check-in/out times are flexible, and I'm always happy to store luggage if necessary. Any questions, please ask!

neighborhood_overview: This is a lovely, slightly off-pitch area, close to everything you want to see, but with a secret, tucked-away feel in a Conservation Area – a real slice of old London. It's also very green – the Imperial War Museum and Gardens are five minutes away – and it's also within the sound of the 'division bell' of Big Ben. Within 20-30 minutes walk are Borough Market, the London Eye, South Bank, Tate Modern, Shakespeare's Globe, the Houses of Parliament and Westminster Abbey, and all transport amenities are on the doorstep. There's a great gastropub (The Albert Arms) a two minute walk away; the fabulous Mercato Metropolitano, a lively, Italian food-market/cinema/gym/community space is five minutes away and open all day until 11pm – the pizzas, wines and coffee are highly recommended, and the atmosphere is unbeatable. The flat is centrally located with superb transport links, so it's fast and easy to get to anywhere you want to explore, but the street itself is quiet and feels like stepping ba
transit: The area has excellent public transport links - buses, tube and railway stations all just moments walk away, plus hire bikes across the street. The flat is a fantastic base for walking into town too.
access: I live here too although I'm often away, or in and out, but always available to answer any questions before or during your stay, and very happy to assist if you need anything – or leave you in peace if you prefer privacy. I'd love you to be comfortable and enjoy your stay.

summary: The best panoramic views in London overlooking the city from each room. Decorated with original art pieces, handmade and hand made furnishings in a neighbourhood buzzing with clubs, restaurants, galleries of international standard, a canal and park!!! It's a private two bedroom flat with a kitchen and living room.

neighborhood_overview: Hoxton and Shoreditch are the best places to go out for meals, coffee, dancing, cocktails, visiting galleries, boutique shopping in London. It's a small hop to the financial district and very trendy Dalston. Hoxton is more residential than Shoreditch and there is a great community feel - especially in local pubs such as the Howl at the Moon on Hoxton Street. From Wiki: Hoxton is a locality of Shoreditch of Central, East and North London, part of the London Borough of Hackney, England. Hoxton lies immediately north of the City of London financial district, forming the western part of Shoreditch. The area has never been formally defined, but approximates to an area bordered by the Regent's Canal on the north side, Wharf Road and City Road to the west, Old Street to the south, and Hackney Road to the east. The geographical distinction between Hoxton and Shoreditch is often confused. The two districts have a historical link as part of the same manor, and in the 19th century both formed par
notes: Please note that the flat isn't suitable for parties or large gatherings and noise must be minimal in the evening and at night. Check out is 11am. Luggage may be left until 1pm for an extra charge of £10 per case. If luggage is still there beyond 1pm we will need to charge for an extra night.
transit: Walking directions from Old Street tube station will be sent to you in your confirmation e-mail and I can also provide other directions upon request. name: Bright, beautiful & spacious house in Hackney
summary: 'Lovely home for a family vacationing in London: perfectly comfortable for our family, every amenity included (as well as a washer and lots of toys), fantastic restaurants and cafes nearby, lots of transport options to central London by underground, bus, and overground, and a gorgeous garden as well! We have very special memories from our trip and recommend Katrin’s house highly. An ideal Airbnb experience!' From our most recent guest review.
space: Our lovely Victorian terraced house overlooks some wonderfully green and mature gardens and trees. Spread over three floors, it has three bedrooms (two for your use), a large living room, kitchen and dinning room on the ground floor and a pleasant garden. The master bedroom on the first floor has a very comfortable double bed as well as a desk and chair and radio. The second bedroom on the second floor is suitable either for one or two people, there is a single bed and a double sofa bed plus flexibility in moving beds around depending on your needs.  We can also provide a child travel cot for any parents travelling with young children plus tons of lego and playmobil! On the ground floor there is a large open-plan kitchen, a dining-room and a living-room. We also have a lovely garden at the back with a table, chairs and a bench. There is a toilet on the ground floor, and a large bathroom (toilet, sink, bath and shower) on the first floor. Our house is a in quiet and leafy street, a shor

neighborhood_overview: Our house is a in quiet, safe and leafy street, a short walk away from London Fields, a lovely, vibrant park with the Lido, London's only heated 50 metre outdoor pool, as well as Broadway Market which is a bustling and friendly street with lots of cafes, bars and restaurants and its well-known Saturday market. There are excellent cafes, restaurants and bars practically at each end of our quiet street. We're a couple of minutes walk from the famous Hackney Empire theatre and the Hackney Picturehouse cinema.
notes: We're a 5min walk from Hackney Central Overground station (the Overground basically operates in the same way as the Underground and is shown by orange lines on the Tube map). You can also get to Dalston Kingsland within 10mins walk (another Overground line taking you into South London). Bethnal Green Tube station is 10-15 minutes away by bus and the Central Line is very fast into central London and the West End. There are also lots of different buses going into all directions of London, we mostly use the 242 and 277 and 55 and 48 and 254 and 38 to get around London!

space: The flat is ideal for musicians as it has a piano and a mandolin (a saxophone or flute may be borrowed on request) - but please note that I'm not tuning these instruments on a regular basis. name: Kensington Flat During Olympics
space: Lovely one-bedroom garden flat situated between Barons Court and West Kensington tube stations (Both only a 3-minute walk away to the District and Piccadilly lines). Delightful one-bedroom lower ground flat benefiting from private split-level garden and close to local transport links. Further comprised of spacious reception room, kitchen, bedroom with French doors and bathroom. Situated close to shops, bars and restaurants with a popular gastropub and small theatre across the street. This flat can comfortably sleep 4 with an air mattress included. Also includes the use of stereo system, 2 flat screen tvs, digital cable and high speed internet access. A bicycle is also included for use if required. The flat is available throughout the Olympics and Paralympics. 20-minutes to central London and 45-minutes to the Olympic Stadium.

name: Cosy Victorian House
summary: Lovely Victorian house on a quaint tree-lined residential street in Streatham Hill, perfect for living like a local but being close enough to London to experience all the city has to offer.
space: The Area Lovely Victorian house on a quaint tree-lined residential street in Streatham Hill, SW2. At the bottom of our street is Tooting Common, which is perfect for reading the paper on sunny days or kicking around a football. The common is also home to a lido (outdoor swimming pool) which is a popular hangout. We are spoilt for public transport options! We are a 12 minute walk to Balham underground on the northern line that takes about 15 minutes into central London. Alternatively Streatham Hill train station is a 6 minute walk and then takes 15 minutes in to Victoria or you can catch a bus at the top of our street that takes you into central London.  Only 10 minutes bus ride from our door is Brixton with it's vibrant market, and famous Brixton Village. You can also visit the Ritzy, an art house cinema that also hosts live music and nearby is the Hootenanny and the Brixton Academy, both great music venues.  The House The master bedroom hosts a large king size bed with 2 double wardro

name: A lovely Victorian Garden Flat in London N16!
summary: Surrounded by beautiful green spaces, leisure facilities, excellent restaurant choices, traditional pubs and gastro bars, boutique and vintage shopping - this beautiful 2 bedroom Victorian garden flat is ideally located for a complete London experience.  Nestled between North and East London, Stoke Newington North is Hackneys doorway to energetic Islington and historic, theatrical and royal central London, as well as providing direct links to the more urban, artistic and creative East London.
space: Situated in the heart of vibrant Stoke Newington: A bright, neutrally decorated, small double bedroom rent rent in this stunning two bedroom garden flat in a classic London Victorian house offers well presented and tastefully decorated accommodation.  Situated within a charming period conversion in one of Stoke Newington's most affluent locations, the property comprises an open-plan kitchen / reception room, two bright, neutrally decorated bedrooms - one large double and one small double, that overlook a peaceful private garden with lawn and a patio area.  A contemporary shower room comprising a double walk-in power shower provides a luxurious shower time experience.  The kitchen is contemporary in presentation, although relatively small, the kitchen is generously equipped and provides all the essential white goods.  The reception room is a calm space that includes a British hand made leather sofa, two original 1930's English club chairs, a beautiful period fireplace, original cornicin

neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is is nicknamed "Stokey" by many residents. It is an area of significant historical importance and is recorded as part of the 'Ossulstone' hundred in the county of Middlesex in the Domesday Book of 1086.  In the Middle Ages and Tudor times, it was a very small village a few miles from the city of London, frequently visited by wayfarers as a pit stop before journeying north. More recently, Stoke Newington has undergone major gentrification, much of this based around Church Street (5 minutes walk), where there are many independent shops, pubs, bars and cafes. Just beyond Church Street, on Saturday mornings, St Paul's churchyard in Stoke Newington High Street hosts an active farmers' market and this was the first farmers' market in the UK to have only organic and biodynamic producers. It is an area that offers open spaces, nature reserves, access to beautiful canal walks, fine local fayre, live music and endless opportunities to eat, drink, shop and be entertained. A truly
notes: THE LARGER DOUBLE ROOM CAN BE RENTED AND THE PROPERTY CAN BE RENTED OUT AS A WHOLE PROPERTY. CAN SLEEP UP TO FOUR AND CAN CATER FOR FAMILIES.
transit: You are pretty spoilt for piblic transport options here as both Highbury & Islington, and Manor House tube stations are a reasonable 15/20 minute walk away. There are numerous local buses to take you on scenic routes directly into central, north and east London for that all important shopping/theatre/Thames experience. Canonbury Overground Station is 6mins walk from the property, and this offers a very short connection time, through the heart of urban East London, to Stratford Station situated in the heart of the olympic village and Stratford Westfield Shopping Centre.
access: Guests can access all areas of the flat.  There is no 'curfew' time - as long as the neighbours are respected in this peaceful residential area. I can accommodate families with enough notice as there are two bedrooms.

name: Docklands house on river
summary: A truly stunning award winning house (4000sq ft). Surrounded on two sides by the River Thames, opposite Greenwhich. 2 mins from DLR station, 25 mins central London. 4 double bedrooms and 1 single have been made available. A great holiday rental.
space: A truly stunning house with probably the best view in London  Its perfect for a family holidaying in London.  Surrounded on two sides by the River Thames, opposite Greenwhich, with a private drive, this house has featured in a number of architectural books/journals.  . It's very large (4000sq ft) with nine bedrooms of which five lovely ones are available (two large and two normal double ,one single) , a very spacious living room. kitchen and dining room, all with views across the river to the Cutty Sark and Wren's palace – which you look at even while dong the washing up!  There's a large terrace and a balcony on which to have romantic meals and  a big garden with a Wendy house.

There's a large terrace and a balcony on which to have romantic meals and  a big garden with a Wendy house. All of the house and gardens except 5 rooms which will be locked.
neighborhood_overview: History is all around you.  Walk under the foot tunnel to Greenwich with its museums and famous observatory, hunt for treasure on the beach, go by the nearby cable car to the famous O2 stadium, visit the Olympic site, explore Canary Wharf's shopping malls,  eat in riverside pubs or travel by nearby Thames Clipper to the Tower of London and  many other of London's best sites.
notes: We look forward  to greeting you at the start and end of your holiday and giving you any advice and help you need. There is a  charming cleaning lady who will come in when you want her.  It is a family home.and we hope you will respect it and enjoy it. Children are very welcome and we have baby seats if required (the house does have some exposed stairs with no stair gates so you will need to watch them).
transit: Only 3 mins to the Docklands Light Railway, then quick link to |Canary Wharf and Jubillee (15 mins to central London), 5 mins to Thames clipper at Greenwich.
access: All of the house and gardens except 5 rooms which will be locked.
house_rules: Please enjoy the house but no parties and please be respectful.

Grafton Way is located within moments of a range of shops, bars and restaurants, with Warren Street, Tottenham Court Road and Goodge Street all close by whilst the theatres, cinemas and entertainment venues of the West End are within good distance. Transport links include Warren Street Underground Station (Victoria and Northern Line) and a selection of regular bus services. Internet access. 24 hour off licence shop next door.

name: Double bedroom in loft conversion
space: We offer one lovely spacious double bedroom with private en-suite shower room and toilet situated on the top floor of the house. We also have a single bedroom (see my other listing) which can be booked in conjunction with the double room. We do not mind smoking but only in the garden. Now a little bit about the area we are in: It is a 5 minute ride on the bus to Walthamstow Central Tube Station which will take you to Liverpool Street in 15min., Oxford Circus in 20min. and Kings Cross in 15min. All very straightforward connections. Stanstead airport is a 40min drive away or alternatively the Stanstead Express takes around 30min.  Collection from the train station can be arranged. Walthamstow itself is a very cosmopolitan area with the longest street market in Europe, the famous William Morris Gallery, lovely Parks and a very picturesque Village.  It is full of international restaurants, pubs and friendly people!

summary: Good for group of friends or family as it got enough space to accommodate up to 7 person if you got kids. You will get all you need for a comfortable stay. Short bus or train journey to all major London attractions. Easy access to Victoria Train,Coach and Tube station - main link for most London airports.
space: Bright spacious two bed apartment situated on a 4th floor of a 10 store building in South-West London. My place can accommodate comfortably up to 6,7 persons particularly if you got kids.  It also provides relatively easy access to most of London's sightseeings.  LOCATION: 10-15m by bus from Victoria, ideal link for most London airports including Stansted and Luton. From Gatwick can use Clapham Junction station. Bus 44/344 run 24hours(Battersea Library stop). Taxi is worth considering especially if you have a bigger group or a bit of luggage. SPACE Main Bedroom - is a bright spacious room with slight feminine twist consists of stylish double bed, black leather sofa, bedside table, chest of drawers, mirror, chair. neighborhood_overview: Area:   Big Tesco and Sainsbury supermarkets near by, few nice pubs with life music,(Secret Garden to the right,Light house,Latchmere and few others to the left), leisure center, 5m walk to Thames through stunning Battersea Park overviewing Chelsea and Albert bridges, plenty of different restaurants(will recommend Italian near Latchmere road/half price on Sat,Sun,Mon/lively atmosphere/good service),free off-road parking except area reserved for residents(look for a small sign),multicultural,but extremely peaceful and friendly neighborhood!    Please don't hesitate to ask host any questions about the place, area and transportation!
notes: If you come by car, please make sure you parked not in residents area. kitchen service lights situated inside the 1st top kitchen cabinet above kettle. Santander bicycles station just outside estate if you up for riding the bike. Sensitive sleepers bring your earplugs - plane traffic can get busy in a early mornings if Queen is not at Buckingham Palace. :)
transit: Transport tips for tourists and visitors: If you decide to use double deck red london buses to explore the city you'll have easy access to: Buckingham palace and St James Park (44) Hyde park corner,Piccadilly str.Chelsea's famous Kings Road, Knightsbridge or Oxford streets shopping arias + Bakerstreet (137)  Kensington's Natural History,Science and Victoria&Albert museums (49 and 345) bus 344 on week-ends will take you to To Big Ben (Lambeth Palace stop+short walk by the riverside), Tate Modern,Shakespeare Globe Theatre and St. Paul Cathedral 10-25m accordingly by. To British museum or London Bridge and London Tower you will have to change bus or take Underground. I would suggest to take a train from Queenstown road station (within 5-7m walk from flat) and in10m you will be at Waterloo where LondonEye and all the fun of riverbank walks as well as some of the most iconic London's panoramic views of Big Ben, House of Parliament , St.Paul Cathedral and London Egg...Here on Embarkment you
access: You are welcome to use tea, coffee, sugar, oil if you are a short term guests. Kitchen got everything you need to cater a group of 6 or 7 people.  Appliances: Wash-machine, Hob, Owen, Fridge, Microwave, Kettle and Toaster as well as cutlery,salt pepper. Washing liquid and powder,Iron and ironing board also available. Stylish bathroom with shower tap and newly fitted suit.  Small communal balcony (please make sure locked when leaving flat).  Wi-Fi internet connection. Digital TV channels.
house_rules: Use intercom on arrival Do not wear your shoos inside particularly in carpeted areas. No smocking or candlelights. WiFi name and password printed on modem in spare room. Rubbish distributor  in-between the floors; bottles and paper into recycling bins outside. You can use host's cutlery,salt and pepper,tea or coffee,  washing liquid and powder as well as iron and ironing board and hairdryer for short stay. Please leave my place clean and tidy - small cleaning fee applies only for washing your beddings and vacuum-cleaning after you depart. The cupboards and fridge contain host's possessions. Please don't be wasteful using energy and help as to keep the price down as well as to save the environment. Have a comfortable stay and exiting time in London!

space: Beautiful Room  We have a beautiful, bright and large double room available in our apartment on the ground floor of a historic, grade 2 listed victorian Block. space: One-Bedroom Serviced Apartment, Clerkenwell, London The apartments are located in a new residence (2011) in central London, next Farrington Station; with excellent transport links and easy access to all the main sites of the Capital. The St Pancras International train station is just one tube stop away, where you will find the Euro Star and direct trains to Gatwick and Luton airport. From this location you can walk to St Paul’s Cathedral and the Barbican Theatre in several minutes. name: Friendly Double Near Underground
space: Room in a very large, beautifully refurbished house, only a stones throw away from the Olympic Park and Leyton Football Club. We have 3 other doubles and one single room available on the house, so please check our other listings  The property compromises of five bedrooms, two toilets and two showers, a kitchen, a 40ft garden and off street parking.  It is located near a shopping area with a few restaurants and shops, as well as a big 24h supermarket. There's also many shops, hairdressers, off licenses and restaurants in the High Street nearby.  The nearest Underground Station would be Leyton, which is 7 minutes walk from the house. From there you can hop on the Central Line to central london (if you'd like to visit the Olympic Park or the westfield shopping centre) and to Central London (Liverpool Street, St Pauls, Oxford Street, Notting Hill...). There are also many buses to central London and other directions, some of which run 24h.  There's free tea and coffee and I'm always a phone

space: Modern, fully furnished, very bright and lovely one double bedroom apartment, certified by the Plum Guide. The flat has fully equipped kitchen and large living room (can be used as a second double bedroom), double bedroom, bathroom (with power shower), and two balconies (one with table and chairs)  It's located in a modern residence 1 min from Highbury & Islington tube (Victoria and Overground line), North London and 10 minutes from Angel (Northern line) and Holloway (Piccadilly line). There are bus lines to London City and the West End. Olympic park is 16 minutes from Highbury&Islington. Excellent transport links for where ever you want to go. The flat is fully furnished and equipped. Shampoo and shower gel provided, as well as salt, sugar, tea, and coffee. All bills included, Wi-fi internet included, brand new fully fitted kitchen, brand new bathroom, wooden laminated floor, doorman, and supermarket next to the residence building. There is no TV, but I'll be happy to provide access t

house_rules: Remember that you are responsible for the behaviour of any guest you have in the apartment, and in accordance with standard airbnb terms you are ultimately liable for the full cost (not just the security deposit) of any loss or damage caused by you or your guests. The maximum occupancy is two people including yourself. I will try to work with you on mutually agreeable check-in and check-out times. If you have exact timescales in mind, please agree them with me before confirming your booking. You will usually be able to drop your bags off before check-in and/or collect them after check-out. You won't hear the neighbours - please don't let them hear you either!  No smoking inside, but you can smoke in the terrace if you like. Other than that, please treat the place with the respect you would your own place.

name: Beautiful 2 Bedroom Herne Hill flat
space: Beautiful two bedroom musician's garden flat with grand piano in a lovely sought after and quiet tree-lined street in Herne Hill with excellent transport links to the centre of London.  The flat has two double bedrooms, one bedroom has french doors that lead out to the large, private south west facing garden. The other bedroom, with grand piano, overlooks the garden. There is a spacious lounge with large bay windows, modern kitchen and bathroom. Laundry facilities. Internet access/WIFI. Herne Hill is only 4 miles from the centre of London. The lovely Brockwell Park in the centre of Herne Hill, and 5 minutes walk from the flat ,is a great place to go walking or jogging and has great views overlooking the capital. There is a Lido, gym and tennis courts in the park, and great cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops in the village. Excellent transport links to the centre of London via overland train or tube via Brixton underground station. Tulse Hill train station - 5 minutes walk from the flat
description: Beautiful two bedroom musician's garden flat with grand piano in a lovely sought after and quiet tree-lined street in Herne Hill with excellent transport links to the centre of London.  The flat has two double bedrooms, one bedroom has french doors that lead out to the large, private south west facing garden. The other bedroom, with grand piano, overlooks the garden. There is a spacious lounge with large bay windows, modern kitchen and bathroom. Laundry facilities. Internet access/WIFI. Herne Hill is only 4 miles from the centre of London. The lovely Brockwell Park in the centre of Herne Hill, and 5 minutes walk from the flat ,is a great place to go walking or jogging and has great views overlooking the capital. There is a Lido, gym and tennis courts in the park, and great cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops in the village. Excellent transport links to the centre of London via overland train or tube via Brixton underground station. Tulse Hill train station - 5 minutes walk from the flat
house_rules: We are non-smokers and keep our house clean and tidy. We are always respectful to our neighbours and have peaceful and friendly relations with them. We do not put drinks on the piano as it can badly damage the casing and the mechanics inside. Otherwise enjoy your stay and have fun!

name: Sunny, spacious Highgate Let
space: Sunny, spacious, stylish 1 bedroom, ground floor, Victorian conversion flat in conservation area near Highgate.  Available July & August for long term rents. A 10 minute walk from Archway station (Northern line), with many bus links. High ceilings, large front facing bay window, with a small amount of stairs going up to the bedroom, and ensuite bathroom. Contemporary flat with a nice mixture of modern, and retro, on a quiet leafy street. Restaurants and pubs within a 10 min. walk. Corner grocery and newsagent shop 3 minutes away. Three rooms of approximate equal size with folding doors, which can either be used to divide the rooms, or left open plan.  Living room is equipped with flat screen TV, and DVD plus blue ray player. I-pod, and i-phone dock. There is a Danish daybed which doubles as a sofa, for 3rd guest. Washing machine, Wi fi, free calls to some numbers, bath and shower, central heating. name: Stunning views over Central London!
summary: Wake up to the sound of Big Ben! This is a very spacious, centrally located maisonette (5 mins from Kennington tube station) and a balcony with views to the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye, the Shard and St. Paul's Cathedral.
space: Our home is a large 2-bedroom flat arranged over 2 floors (9th and 10th), with a large, open-plan kitchen next to a dining room and living room with full height glass sliding doors opening onto the balcony.  The kitchen has an induction hob for safety, a fridge-freezer and clothes-washing machine. The upstairs bathroom has a bath and power shower, with a separate toilet. The flat has fast broadband internet connection and a sound system for music. The whole flat is for rent, with two bedrooms, one the master bedroom, both with double beds available, one of which is a futon. Plus there is a very comfortable, single sofa bed in the living room. The flat is within walking distance of the Thames River,  the Southbank (including the Hayward Gallery, National Theatre, Royal Festival Hall and Shakespeare Theatre), and an equally short journey to the West End (Soho and Covent Garden), and the East End (Shoreditch, Hoxton and Dalston). summary: Hello everyone! I am looking for someone to rent my bedroom out to over the winter. There is no lock on the door. I have placed some useful amenities in the room, such as a mini fridge,  kettle and toaster for guest convenience. Suited to a single person, who is friendly, quiet and non smoker. You will share the flat with myself. I am friendly and sociable, but also respect others space/quiet time.
space: Light and airy, large space with double bed, sofa and small table. Nicely decorated. very comfortable and clean facilities. No smoking in the apartment.  Located in a quiet residential area. White hart lane train station is 5mins away, with links to seven sisters, Tottenham Hale and Liverpool street underground stations. Very central location in Tottenham, with Woodgreen  and Edmonton shopping malls 15 mins away. All local amenities, shops, restaurants and transport links less than 5 mins away.

London Liverpool street station (Central line/Circle line/Metropolitan line) approx 25mins. Local buses run along the main road, just outside of the apartments; towards Woodgreen/Finsbury Park. Also there are numerous shops and a Sainsburys supermarket nearby.
notes: The kitchen is open plan with the lounge. There is no shared living room. I sleep in the lounge. So guests will have to walk through the lounge area to access the kitchen,  but I have put a screen divider up for privacy.

You do not have to do the washing though, just leave linen inside, I will wash them when I collect keys before you go. The washing machine door is to be kept open after each use, to allow it to air out. This prevents mouldy odours. Unfortunately no children or pets please.

name: 3 bed house Walthamstow Lloyd Park
summary: We have recently moved into a lovely 3 bedroom house in Walthamstow, a few minute walk from Lloyd park and the awarded winning (Museum of the the year 2013) William Morris Gallery.
space: Located a short two minute walk from historic Lloyd Park, our flat is situated in the heart of William Morris land.  Llyod Park is recently being re-landscaped and will include the re-opening of the William Morris Museum, a cafe and tea room, open-air theatre, skatepark, tennis courts and more. It's a lovely oasis in London!  We are a 15 min walk from Walthamstow Central (Victoria line) and main rail to Liverpool Street (20mins), buses direct to Stratford City in 30mins (or so traffice depending).  Trains into central London are regular and can get you to King's Cross in 15-20mins and Piccadilly in 25mins. If you are cycle adept, we can offer two bicycles at a negotiated price which would open up a whole new relationship to accessing the Olympic Park.  You could cycle along through Coppermill Lane, through the wonderful Dickensian marshes and down to the Lea Valley and the Park itself. Hackney Wick is accessible in 35mins cycling where you can find fun bars and resturants.  You can mak

name: Comfy 2 Double Bed Garden Flat near the Thames
summary: A cosy, well maintained 2 bed 1 bath garden flat in a safe, quiet area of London. It has everything you need for a comfortable stay in London, with good transport links to the centre and lots of green space nearby for walking, running and relaxing.
space: We have just moved out of London for work so we are letting our lovely apartment to guests.The flat is fully furnished, close by lots of green space and 5 minutes walk from the riverside.  The flat has  - A kitchen with washer/dryer and utensils for cooking - 2 furnished double bedrooms, 1 with a king size bed - Lounge with comfy leather sofas - New bathroom with shower over bath - New hardwood floors througout  - Garden  - Free off street parking  - Double glazing  - Space for a bike out front  The Area has  - 7 minute walk to chiswick rail station (25 minutes to London Waterloo)  - 190 and E3 buses stop outside the flat- 10 minutes to Richmond, 10 mins to turnham green station, 15 minutes to hammersmith  - 5 mins walk to pay as you go gym and swimming pool  - 5 mins walk to the river, great for jogging, walking and local pubs  - 5 mins walk to local shops  - less than 5 minutes walk from grove park and chiswick house  - weekly farmers market 2 minutes walk away

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is in a lovely part of London, with a farmers market in the neighbourhood every Sunday and a public swimming pool and lots of green space close by. There is an excellent childrens play area in Duke's Meadows nearby, and the wonderful Chiswick House you can walk through to get to the bustling high street with its shops and restaurants.
transit: There is a bus stop 2 minutes walk from the flat which will take you to Richmond or Chiswick High Road on the 190 or E3 bus routes, or to Hammersmith in the other direction. Chiswick rail station is about 8 minutes walk away, with direct train connections to the centre of London every 15 minutes. Turnham Green underground station (District line and Piccadilly line at night) is about a 20 minute walk, or a 10 minute bus ride away.
access: The flat is yours for the length of your stay :).
house_rules: We work full time so ask that guests are flexible about check in time and communicate their plan when booking. When you arrive, you will need to show some photographic ID such as a passport or driving license before we exchange the keys.

space: Fantastic super central flat in Clerkenwell/Islington. Super quiet. On both sides is a side road which is one way and has almost no traffic (It is only used for cars turning). You will think you are  in a village, not in the center of London. A small Park is directly in front of the house.   The flat has 2/3 bedrooms, one with a double bed, another with two single beds. If you urgently need it, you can also put one single bed in the study. There is a an open kitchen/living room with a couch and a large table to seat 6. The bathroom is rather small, but stylish, with a very large mirror and slate covers.  The Kitchen has all amenities you will need, 5 burner gas-stove, electric oven, dishwasher (but no microwave). We cook a lot, so there is literally everything you need for cooking meals. Wifi is available. All Bedding and towels provided. Reserved resident street parking available at the front door. About the Neighbourhood Transport in the area is excellent. neighborhood_overview: The high street has many cafes and restaurants. It also has a library, banks, post office and a variety of shops including chemists, supermarkets, butchers, bakers and greengrocers.
transit: The underground tube station is one minute from the house and there is a bus stop also very close by. Parking is available outside the house but visitors will need parking permits for weekdays which must be displayed on the windscreen.

name: Huge Loft; Former ShoeFactory: Cinema Piano Sonos!
summary: Stay in a beautiful old Shoe Factory, between London Fields and Victoria Park, a stone's throw from Broadway Market and Regent's Canal. As the sun streams through huge warehouse windows, sip your coffee sitting on 100-year old floorboards...
space: You'll have the whole place to yourself! Over 1,070 square feet of beautiful warehouse loft in a converted Shoe Factory. Huge original windows facing west, for light all afternoon, and gabled skylights for natural top light all day. Two huge original zinc loading doors , and London-brick walls remind of the building’s original use, and many other architectural and industrial features remain. 100 year old hardwood flooring, architect-designed handbuilt staircase, reclaimed iron purpose-built gallery, antique piano, and antique and reclaimed furniture throughout. Hand-built kitchen with sunny window sills, Smeg fridge and Belfast sink. There is a brand new state of the art induction hob, and a brand new oven too.  Huge four-seater sofa, which is very comfortable for movie nights on the projector screen with surround sound Home Cinema System and Sonos stereo system for playing music! Surrounding Area London Fields park is one minute away, with Tennis courts, basketball courts, cricket pit

name: Entire home in the heart of Stokey
summary: Entire home on Stoke Newington Church Street.  Beautifully presented with two spacious double bedrooms, open plan kitchen and living area and loft extension with south facing private roof terrace.  A peaceful haven in the heart of N16.
space: Hello! Our entire home is available to rent for long weekends and the occasional longer term stay.   Enormous living room and kitchen which make a great entertaining space.   Bathroom with bath tub, separate WC.   Two spacious double bedrooms.  There is a 3rd bedroom/studio/roof garden room which can sleep 2 further guests on single futon mattresses.   Private south facing roof terrace. Stoke Newington Church Street boarders both leafy north london (Canonbury/Highbury) and trendy east london (Dalston/Clapton). There are restaurants, shops, bars and pubs a plenty on our doorstep and a leisure centre and a park moments away. Good transport links into the city.

name: Boutique room & copper bath. Homerton, Hackney.
summary: On offer is a beautiful double bedroom with its own copper bath in a 1920s apartment on Chatsworth Road. This luxurious 2nd floor has original features with dark wood floors and woodwork throughout, silk blinds and curtains, and iron and glass chandeliers. There is a marbled shower room with antique Persian tiles. A fire escape serves as a balcony for morning coffee in the sun, leading down to a communal garden with street access through a locked gate, where you can keep a bicycle.
space: There is great attention to detail within the space; 1920s Art Deco door handles; copper saucepans; kitchenware by the potter Chris Keenan. The bed linen is 100 % cotton and the pillows and duvets are feather down. The apartment is south-facing, with windows also on the east and west sides, so it sees both sunrise and sunset.

neighborhood_overview: Chatsworth Road is a bustling and magical spot on the edge of the marshes. There are boutiques and restaurants; a deli, bakery, antique shops and a Sunday market.  The Lea River and canal are on the doorstep for cycling, to go for a jog, or to relax and unwind. The surrounding area also has much to offer. Victoria Park and the site of the London 2012 Olympics  are both a longer walk, with many more restaurants, shops and facilities.
notes: There is a luxury food store next door (similar to Whole Foods), which has a an art cinema on the floor above.
transit: Homerton Station is 5 mins walk. The overground train runs direct to the Olympic Park or to Camden. It is 8 minutes to Highbury & Islington, where you can join the underground network (Victoria line), which the fastest way to Oxford Circus. The 242 bus also goes from outside the flat direct to Tottenham Court Road, and there are plenty other buses to explore the East End of London including Shoreditch and Hoxton.
access: Kitchen Living room with dining table Shower room Balcony Communal garden

neighborhood_overview: A great location, within walking distance from the Olympic stadium and approximately 10 minute walk from Stratford underground/ train station and the Westfield shopping centre. If you would like to have a dip in the Olympic pool in the Aquatic Centre or visit the Accor Mital and if you not faint hearted, you can take the slide down.  If you an avid cyclist, the Velodrome is approximately a 15 - 20 minute walk from the flat. You can take a stroll to Westfield, Europes largest shopping centre where you can find over 300 shops,restaurants, bowling alley, 17 screen cinema and casino. The area is well connected to local transport links including Stratford Station (Central and Jubilee lines, DLR). This is also a great location for getting into central London, as Oxford Circus, Hyde Park, Piccadilly Circus etc are all under half an hour away by public transport.
notes: If you check out on a Sunday, we can arrange for a later check out time.
transit: The flat is situated approximately a 10 minute walk from the station with easy links into central London (within 15 - 20 minutes) depending where in central London you want to be. There is a 24 hour parking garage close by.
access: You have access to the kitchen (for teas and coffees only - no cooking), lounge and dining area.
house_rules: Kitchen only open for tea and coffee - No cooking. No alcohol to be consumed in the apartment. Be considerate to the neighbours. Keep the place neat and tidy. The flat has wooden floors and a light carpet in the bedroom, therefore no shoes to be worn in the bedroom. Only registered guests are allowed to stay in the apartment. If you check out on a Saturday or Sunday, we can arrange for a later check out time.

name: Three storey house with two  bathrooms and garden
summary: Great location in a quiet and pretty tree-lined street. 4-8 minutes walk to two tube stations with very quick access (8 minutes) to the City Centre and Canary Wharf. It is a traditional Edwardian house,  fully modernised and double glazed.
space: There are two large bedrooms perfect for couples, or families with children. There are therefore two double beds available, but if required, there is also an additional very comfortable fold-out single bed for a 5th guest in the ensuite room. We prefer not to rent the house to very young groups of friends, but we consider all requests.  We naturally want to feel secure that the house will be well treated so please tell us about yourselves and your visit when making an enquiry.  This is our home that we rent when we're away.

We are always contactable and also have family, friends and neighbours on hand to assist when w
neighborhood_overview: [*Near 3 Mills Studios for staff requiring accommodation*] This is a modernised Edwardian house in a quiet conservation area.  The "West End" of the City (Oxford Circus, Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square etc) is under 20 minutes away from Bow Road station (6 minutes walk away). The Westfield Shopping Centre Stratford is 5 minutes away (2 stops on the DLR line).  It is a new and massive shopping mall with restaurant chains and bars, a cinema and a casino. The Olympic Park is within walking distance and you can see the stadium from the end of our road.  Search the internet for “things to do Olympic Park London". Victoria Park is within walking distance.  It is an old and beautiful park ideal for walking and seeing wildlife.  The park is surrounded by many independent restaurants and traditional pubs serving great food. My favourite pubs are The Coburn Arms, Morgan Arms, Lord Tredegar, Peoples Park Tavern, Royal Inn on the Park, The Victoria, The Crown, The Lauriston, Lord Morpeth, and
transit: I will give any advice you need - please just ask! Closest stations: Bow Church (DLR line) - 4 minutes walk Bow Road (green and pink lines) - 6 minutes walk  Buses: Many to choose from - 1 minute walk away from Bow Church bus station including the 24 hours no. 25 bus which goes to Oxford Circus. Airports: - Stansted Airport is just a 45 minute bus ride away. A 24 hour bus goes to London Bow bus stop also called Bow Church bus stop which is just a short walk away. Alternatively, you can get a train to nearby Stratford. - Gatwick Airport is easy - get the train to Victoria or Blackfriars station then the green line to Bow Road station - Heathrow Airport is accessible by the Heathrow Express to Paddington station (then get the pink line to Bow Road station). Or the piccadilly and distric line to Bow Road station (change at Hammersmith).  Or £45 by taxi. - London City Airport is 20 minutes away (taxi or DLR line) Cycling: Many bike sharing stations are nearby for wonderful trips in our loc

name: Lovely Double Room in North London
summary: A lovely comfy bed in a quiet, warm and friendly house, easy going host, with one other guest, access to kitchen and all amenities. A short walk or quick bus ride to the underground where it's 20 mins into the centre of London. Perfect.
space: I have a lovely double bedroom available in my comfy house. Your room has comfy aerobed that electrically folds away in the day. Sheets and towels will be provided to you for your stay. During your stay you will also have access to a lovely bathroom, the garden, free parking, internet, cable TV and the piano! Breakfast (cereals, toast, tea, etc) included. Please note that I have a lovely cat, so please bear this in mind if you have allergies.  In the local area you will find all the amenities you will need for a great stay; there are supermarkets, cafes, banks and takeaways all within a short walk. The area also has great transportation links; there are several buses which pass close to the house. Seven Sisters underground station is also within walking distance. Seven Sisters gives you access to the Piccadilly Line, which takes you directly to two of London's main stations, Kings Cross and Victoria. Buses and trains leave from these stations going to all of London's main airports.  If

name: 'Vie de Boheme' in Central London
summary: Right in the heart of London - this is an amazing location! My cosy apartment is the perfect place for those who wish to explore London on foot. Many tourist attractions are literally around the corner. It is very easy to get to my place from any airport because I am surrounded by various tubes lines, trains and buses. The kitchen is fully functional, you can cook your own meals (this is a gluten free household). You will live on the third floor and the area is very safe, also at night time.
space: This cosy one bedroom flat is based in an excellent location; you'll be in a charming cobblestone street right in the center of London! You will be in walking distance to Oxford Street, British Museum, British Library, Madame Tussauds and the lovely neighbourhood of Fitzrovia. There are many restaurant and cafes in this area and Soho is only 15 minutes down the road. There is plenty of public transport: 2 tube stations with 5 different tube lines and various buses, just 3 minutes away from my doorstep. Supermarkets are open even during nighttime. Additional information: the flat benefits from FREE telephone calls to the UK and most of Europe, a free  wireless Internet connection, a fully functioning kitchen with washing machine and a bathroom with bath tub and a 'sitting' shower. I am very happy to supply you with 'Oyster' cards, maps and books about London as well as information about art & culture in the neighbourhood. As I am an artist myself, I usually know what's going on in town.
