name: London Calling - Cosy two bedroom flat, King's X
summary: When I'm out of town, I'm happy to let you stay in my two bedroom flat in Central London, King's Cross St Pancras (10 minutes walk). Walking distance to the British Museum, countless pubs, restaurants, supermarkets. I will provide towels, linen & cleaning products. You will have a ready entire flat (two double bedrooms, separate living room with a double bed, separate kitchen with cooking utilities/cutleries etc). You will find a clean,tidy & ready flat. Please treat it with respect.
space: CHECK IN WHEN IT'S POSSIBLE NOT WHEN YOU WANT. If you don't like the proposed time, don't book. If you don't like the proposed time but my place is cheaper than others, don't book. My check-in time, is on my time as this is my home, not a hotel and I don't have staff working 24-hours. Check-in is flexible and depends on many things: 1. OTHER GUESTS CHECKING OUT, then cleaning and preparing the flat for you.  2. Whoever checks you in (me or my friend) is working that day. We all work full-time so you must be flexible. As a guide: Weekdays after 6pm; weekends more flexible. Check-in after midnight could be available and costs £50 as I will need to get a cab home at that time. This is ONLY if I check you in. I'd never dream of asking my friends to wait that late. All people in your party, regardless of age, must be included in the booking numbers.  Just to clarify, if it's human, it's 'people'. neighborhood_overview: King's Cross is just a short walk from Euston Station.  The flat is located in a really central area. Approximately 10 minutes walk to King's Cross station where there are National Rail trains, Buses, Underground and Eurostar. Also easy access to Heathrow, Gatwick, Stansted, City and Luton airports! King's Cross is a great place to explore!  Approximately 10 minutes walking is Granary Square on the banks of Regent’s Canal. This square has over 1,000 coloured fountains, look spectacular at night when lit. There is a shopping mall with an arthouse cinema at the back. Also there is my favourite big supermarket called Waitrose (and Sainsbury’s or Tesco's). It is really convenient to get some food there if you would like to save money to cook in at home.  There are also a lot of shops inside St Pancras International station.  You can have a meal at one of the many restaurants (Indian, Chinese, Turkish etc).  There are wide, south-facing steps going down to the canal from Granary Square. It
notes: Mid stay cleaning upon request and with additional charge (£30 each clean of 2,5hrs and you're requested to not be present so the cleaner can complete the work uninterrupted)
transit: King's Cross Underground station has 6 Tube/Metro Lines (Metropolitan, Northern, Victoria, Hammersmith and City Lines Piccadilly, Central Line) with two national mainline rail stations and international high speed rail; connecting trains to Heathrow/Stansted/Gatwick/City and Luton Airports & EUROSTAR  Euston Station just 5 minutes walk away from King’s Cross.  24 hours tube service on Fridays and Saturdays. There are two lines, Piccadilly and Victoria stop at King's Cross after midnight.  Buses are another popular option for tourists as you can sightsee while traveling. Nearby Bus stop is 2 minutes’ walk which is ‘’Penton Rise’’. Also more Buses in Euston Road & Pentonville Road.
access: You will have the entire flat during your stay as I'll be out of London.  Since I live here, my clothes live in the master bedroom wardrobe and the chest of drawers also in the master bedroom. There's little space in the wardrobe and none in the chest of drawers. I will leave hangers behind the door for your use in the master bedroom. There's space in the wardrobe in the second bedroom for hanging clothes and shelves. The fridge will not be completely empty but I will ensure there is some space for your items. If you want to use some of my items, please do. If you use it up, please replace it.
house_rules: - All of the House Rules below MUST be read all the way through to the end. It will not be in your best interest to skim through my rules. Therefore, please do not do so. - Every person in your group must be included in the guest numbers.  Just to clarify; a baby is a person, a toddler is a person, a child is a person.  If it's human and has a pulse, it's a person. - No parties whatsoever.  - No other guests other than who is booked. - DO NOT use property address as a postal address. - Check-in and out is flexible but with prior consultation with me. I'm working so you also have to be flexible. - You'll have your own key to the flat and the codes for the entry gates. - I am renting my home while I am away, this is really my home, not a second home so please treat it with care and respect. Thanks very much. - No smoking anywhere in the flat. - If you lose the flat/room keys you will be charged 100 pounds for a locksmith. - You can contact me any time, if you have any questions and I'll

name: Lovely bright room in Queen's Park
summary: This is a lovely Victorian house from the 1890's decorated in a modern style in Queen's Park Village. The bedroom shares a large bathroom with shower and toilet. There is another seperate toilet. We are only 2 minutes from Queen's park tube station.
space: This lovely victorian house that feels more like a greek holiday house by the sea filled with paintings by Robert,the owner, who is also an illustrator of several food books. We had put the room for rent in 2012 for the Olympics, but have only just decided to put it on Airb&b now, so that's why we have such few reviews!! But you won't be dissapointed!! You will have a large bedroom with a very comfortable italian mattress, use of modern bathroom that is shared with 2 others,and a seperate toilet downstairs. There is a  modern kitchen with the usual facilities and a lovely south facing garden. We are a two minute walk from Queen's Park tube station on the Bakerloo and Overground lines, as well as plenty of buses into the very centre of the city.We have wireless internet, and Robert is a very good host who speaks fluent Spanish, French, some German and Italian..and of course English!!  Robert can offer a healthy breakfast of muesli, yoghurt, herbal and ordinary teas or coffee and toast w

neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood, more like a village, with plenty of local shops and cafes, and very friendly shopkeepers.Our park is a wonderful retreat after a busy day of sightseeing.
transit: We are 2 minutes from Queen's Park Station on the Bakerloo line that takes appx 15 minutes to Oxford Circus and the Overground to Euston. There are plenty of Buses as well into Oxford Circus, Regent St,Piccadilly Circus and Little venice.
access: You will have your own double Bedroom, share the bathroom with 2 others,seperate toilet and share the kitchen.
house_rules: We don't allow smoking in the house. We appreciate if you please leave the room as you found it!! We will provide one set of keys, and a deposit for the keys of £10 is required incase they are lost. We really appreciate if you arrive during normal daytime hours, from 8am to 8pm ideally.Check in is after 11am and check out is 10am....but obviously we will try to be as flexible as possible.

name: Come to the green side of Camden - Primrose Hill
summary: A double room with en suite bathroom in a period family house on a quiet street close to cafes, shops and restaurants. Not suitable for babies or children. We are an easy walk to the buzz of Camden Lock - and the canal runs on through Kings Cross where the  latest happening developments can be found. We are minutes from parks [the best view of London is from the top of Primrose Hill] and all transport links into London's heart -  and when you've had enough come back to a haven of peace.
space: One double room (with en suite bathroom) in Grade 2 listed house in the heart of Primrose Hill village, London N.W.1. Coffee, teas, tv, wi fi provided.  This is one of the quietest streets in the capital, at the end of a cul de sac, and yet just a few steps from numerous cafes, restaurants, pubs and all kinds of interesting shops. Around the corner and after a brief climb, the top of Primrose Hill offers the best of all views across London.  We are a few minutes' walk from all transport links to the centre of the West End [Piccadilly, Oxford Street etc] and Camden's lively market on Regent's canal. Take a boat and see parts of London you would miss otherwise. Recently re-decorated, this family house has been a tranquil stop-off for family, friends and visitors for many years. With Airbnb we are now opening our home to more visitors - and we look forward to welcoming you.
description: A double room with en suite bathroom in a period family house on a quiet street close to cafes, shops and restaurants. Not suitable for babies or children. We are an easy walk to the buzz of Camden Lock - and the canal runs on through Kings Cross where the  latest happening developments can be found. We are minutes from parks [the best view of London is from the top of Primrose Hill] and all transport links into London's heart -  and when you've had enough come back to a haven of peace. One double room (with en suite bathroom) in Grade 2 listed house in the heart of Primrose Hill village, London N.W.1. Coffee, teas, tv, wi fi provided.  This is one of the quietest streets in the capital, at the end of a cul de sac, and yet just a few steps from numerous cafes, restaurants, pubs and all kinds of interesting shops. Around the corner and after a brief climb, the top of Primrose Hill offers the best of all views across London.  We are a few minutes' walk from all transport links to the cen
neighborhood_overview: Over several decades Primrose Hill village has evolved from an unknown backwater to a well known and "classy" neighbourhood. We do have a supermarket within 200 metres but most of the shopfronts are cafes, restaurants, delicatessens, fashion shops. We have none of the usual chains but we do have plenty of estate agents reflecting the quality of the local housing. Primrose Hill itself offers one of TripAdvisor's best views of London. The base of the hill leads into the shops and eating places of Regents Park Road - our village.
notes: Primrose Hill is considered one of the "coolest" of London's villages. So, on weekends - especially when the weather is good - "The Hill" beckons. This means more people than usual passing the bottom of our street but few venture to the top of it where our house is.
transit: The nearest underground station is Chalk Farm  - about 10 mins from the house.  There are also frequent buses into the centre from nearby bus stops.
access: From the front door the room is 2 flights up at the back of the house. Because we are so close to every kind of cafe, pub and restaurant - open early 'til late - we do not offer a guest lounge or catering - although coffee,  tea and snacks are provided in the room plus a small fridge.
house_rules: We hope you will have the most comfortable and relaxing stay with us. The room is in the centre of the house and therefore we respect our guests' need for privacy and quiet as we also do.  We are definitely more suitable for people over 40.  We don't accept additional visitors connected with our guests, and if there should be a need for an extra bed, this is by one to one arrangement.

name: Luxury 2 bed flat in Dalston Square
space: Brand new modern 10th storey, 2 bed flat with balcony that overlooks the Olympic Stadium and Canary Wharf. 2 double bedrooms, 1 with en-suite bathroom and the other with a separate bathroom with bath tub. 24 hour concierge service and fully equipped gym. 1 minute walk from front door to Dalston Junction Station and 4 minutes to Dalston Kingsland Station. Fully equipped and furnished flat with all expected modern amenities including broadband internet and Sky Tv. The kitchen is equipped with an oven, a microwave, fridge and freezer as well as a toaster and a kettle. This is an ideal location to explore London as it is an authentic London area with great transport links: 15 minutes by tube to Oxford Circus station in central London (for shopping or Soho) or 5 minutes to Shoreditch. Dalston is often touted as the 'trendiest' area in London and as such has plenty of nightlife, restaurants and great cafes to keep everyone happy. We absolutely love our neighbourhood and will be able to give

neighborhood_overview: Dalston is our favourite neighbourhood. There are so many amazing restaurants and pubs nearby and such a great mix of people. It is constantly changing which makes it very exciting. It's also great to walk along the canal to Broadway Market, Victoria Park or Angel. It has got real character.
notes: Staying here can feel like staying in a hotel, which is amazing. Hit the gym on the 2nd floor, then go for breakfast or lunch at Route Cafe, right next to the building. And after pamper yourself in the spa across the square, then come back to the flat and enjoy the lovely view over London.
transit: There are two overground stations by the flat and countless bus lines which makes getting around London very convenient and quick. Though we love walking to Stoke Newington, Shoreditch or Angel at the weekends.
access: You will have access to the in-house gym as well as the roof terrace on the 9th floor.
house_rules: Care taken of everything as if it were your own home. Common sense. Leave everything as it is found. No smoking please, unless it is on the balcony. Have fun!

name: Double room in lovely north London flat
summary: The spare room in my two-bed flat has a double bed, wardrobe, desk and chest of drawers. It's at the back of the building overlooking gardens, so it's extremely quiet and very comfortable! We would be sharing kitchen, bathroom and living room. I'm afraid I don't accept third party bookings on behalf of someone else. (Nor does airbnb as it happens.) I do need to have some direct communication with the guest before accepting a booking, and the more you can tell me about yourself the better!
space: Mine is a two-bedroom flat on the first floor of a two-storey house in Willesden Green. The living room has a beautiful 'cathedral' ceiling built up into the roof, which gives the whole place a great feeling of light and space. The living room and kitchen are open plan and the bathroom has a bath and separate shower cubicle. I have all the usual amenities - washing machine, dryer, microwave, satellite TV and broadband.  The spare double bedroom is at the back of the flat and is very quiet and light. It is available to let for a maximum of four weeks.  The nearest tube station is Dollis Hill, 8 minutes' walk, zone 3. Willesden Green, zone 2, is a 12 minute walk or a brief bus ride. It's 35 minutes into the centre of town on the Jubilee Line, and there are buses on the corner that cover most areas of London including Brent Cross shopping centre. There's a big supermarket just down the high road and plenty of smaller shops that stay open 24 hours.  There are two parks within 10 minutes' w

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is unpretentious, and not (yet) trendy. There are no fashion shops nearby but otherwise, you can find pretty well everything within a few minutes' walk, including some interesting ethnic restaurants.
notes: I work in the living room in the daytime (not evenings!). So I ask guests not to use the TV in the daytime.
transit: The tube is nearby, and there are buses covering all parts of London. It is 35 minutes from my door to Piccadilly Circus on the tube. There is restricted parking but visitors' permits are available costing £4.50 per day.
access: Guests have access to the kitchen, living room and bathroom. The kitchen has limited storage space, and as it's part of the living room (where I work), it is not suitable for creating time-consuming, complicated meals. Guests are welcome to use it for simple cooking obviously.
house_rules: Just treat the place as your home, wash up after yourself, all the usual things. And noisewise bear in mind I'm on the first floor and have a neighbour downstairs.

name: Light, Space & Nature + 4 bedrooms
summary: A very large, quiet four-bedroomed apartment with two bathrooms, an oasis of calm in a vibrant neighbourhood where shops, restaurants and parks abound, with excellent rapid transport links to the the heart of London.  Read on !
space: Welcome to our beautiful, light and airy flat in Streatham, South London, with its four lovely bedrooms, the perfect place for a family stay. Children are not only welcome, they are positively encouraged ! The apartment was recently entirely renovated ; the kitchen has been made 'open plan', an extra bathroom been added, and both bathrooms and kitchen have completely renewed ; floors have been re-sanded and polished, and the entire flat repainted and refurnished. A couple of years ago, the place was entirely rewired. It is, in effect, a new apartment !  Judge for yourself from the photos ! Given its spaciousness, it is supremely comfortable and eminently suitable for anything up to four couples, or for a large family. We also have a cot for your baby ! (This being said, this beautiful apartment is NOT a hostel - we have neither the beds nor the bedrooms - and the sleeping arrangements are NOT suitable for eight singles. If this is your case, we would thank you not to embarrass yourselv

notes: We are ALWAYS here to help if you have any questions before, during and after your stay.
transit: Public transport is second-to-none - the very best. Buses and trains are close by and a 15' journey takes you to the heart of London. access: The entire apartment, the gardens and all facilities. Nothing is off-limits. If you require and EARLY CHECK-IN please let us know.
house_rules: Since we have only FOUR bedrooms and FOUR beds, we can accept NO MORE than FOUR singles. We can, however, accept FOUR COUPLES or one large or two small FAMILIES. The sofa is NOT a convertible and may NOT to be slept on. You might like to spare the neighbours' ears by removing shoes at the door. Please do NOT smoke inside the apartment. You my do so on the fire escape. Because of allergy concerns, we can permit NO animals in the apartment, much as we love them.

name: Nice Room in Verdent Lane, Catford
summary: You will be staying in a comfortable, peaceful and relaxing house, which is located in a friendly, yet quiet residential area. Ideal for relaxing after sightseeing in Central London. Catford and Lewisham are vibrant areas with a great ethnic mix.  You will be able to purchase food for all cuisines both from restaurants or the supermarkets.  We are not in the heart of Central London, but you will be able to travel into town in 30 minutes from one of the 4 nearby railway stations.
space: Hello, I’m Edris, I’ve lived in London for most of my life so have excellent knowledge of all London’s tourist attraction and places of interest to visit, as well as London in general.  I live with my partner in a lovely house in South East London and have a nice room that sleeps two to let for your vacation. Your stay with us includes bed and breakfast (toast, cereals, eggs, bagel, jam, marmalade, juice, fruit tea and coffee. Alternatives can be provided with advance notice). There is a TV with freeview and integrated DVD player in the room, which provides numurous digital TV channels, as well as cable TV in the living room, which also provides lots of TV channels. While staying with us you will have use of a fully equipped kitchen which includes cooker, oven , washing machine, microwave, as well as use of kitchen utensils, crockery, cutlery, etc.  There is a hairdryer, towels and flannels for your use throughout your stay. As well as the above you will  have access to the living room

There is a TV with freeview and in
neighborhood_overview: Catford and Lewisham are very diverse, lively, friendly and very vibrant. There's a great ethnic mix and you will be able to purchase food for all cuisines. The house itself is in a quiet residential neighbourhood, so when you return from sightseeing in Central London, Greenwich, etc you come back to a quiet relaxing home.  If you want to go out very locally in the evening there are several pubs in  Central Catford, Lewisham or Downham for you to visit, some serving food. Bromley shopping  centre (Intu) with lots of restaurants, pubs, The Churchill Theatre, and a cinema is 10 minutes away by National Rail from Grove Park Station or you can take the 208 or 320 buses from Catford town centre.  Grove Park Station is 5 minutes by the 284 from my house.
notes: Free WiFi is available. TV with freeview and integrated DVD player. An international adaptor for your electrical items. A hairdryer, iron and ironing board are provided so you don't need to pack these.
transit: Transport is very convenient, with the 284 bus stopping just a minute from the house. This bus takes you to Catford and Catford Bridge National Rail stations in as little as 10 minutes, Grove Park Station in the opposite direction in 5 minutes,  Lewisham Station and Lewisham Docklands Light Railway (DLR) Stations in 15/20 minutes.  You can board trains from all these stations to travel to Central London for sightseeing. You can also take a train from Lewisham Docklands Light Railway (DLR) to Greenwich where you can visit the Cutty Sark, the National Maritime Museum, the Planetarium, Greenwich Meridian and other attractions in the Greenwich area.  If you don't mind walking, Hither Green Station is 15 minutes walk from my house.  You can also take a train from this station direct to Central London.  Once on the train yo will be in Central London i.e. London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross in 12 to 20 minutes, depending on which of these stations you want to get off.  Or you might wa
access: Guests will have access to the bedroom, kitchen, both bathrooms, living room, garden and all kitchen equipment. Crockery, cutlery kitchen utensils are also available, as well as towels and bed linen.
house_rules: This is a no smoking household. You can smoke in the garden if you are a smoker. No parties or events allowed.   No pets allowed. Obviously tidy up after yourself. Other than the above we are an easy going, relaxed couple and want you to enjoy your stay with us.

name: 2 Bed apartment trendy shoreditch
summary: I am willing to take 1-3 night bookings if I have appropriate gaps, please get in touch with me about bookings under 4 nights
space: Two bed apartment in fantastic location. This is a great area to stay with an abundance of things to do and see right on your doorstep.  Lots of wonderful coffee shops, quirky boutiques, great choice of restaurants bars and clubs, fantastic independent cinema with cosy sofas and great galleries all within walking distance. Few minutes walk to Shoreditch station. Good connection into stratford (only 4 stops away) 10 minutes from Liverpool street.  Everything on your doorstep and within walking distance.  Brick lane with its array of curry houses and Spitalfields both close by. Wonderful flower market few minutes away on a sunday well worth a visit Double bedroom and twin room which would sleep four comfortably, extra guests possible. Great views over London.

name: Massive Superb flat in Notting Hill
summary: A rare find, Notting Hill superb flat in 2 floors with an sunny conservatory. A space that is great for several guests.
space: This superb two/three bedroomed flat is split over two floors in a charming period building located on the desirable Chepstow Crescent, boasting generous rooms and chic décor throughout. With all rooms in immaculate condition the flat comprises vast reception room, modern kitchen with integrated appliances, stunning conservatory, master bedroom with mezzanine-level and storage, second bedroom, slick bathroom, en suite bathroom, en suite shower room, there is a patio, its set up with seating and a BBQ, garage and second car space in front, garden. Chepstow Crescent is situated within easy reach of Portobello Road renowned for its vibrant shops and antiques market as well as Westbourne Grove and Notting Hill Gate. description: A rare find, Notting Hill superb flat in 2 floors with an sunny conservatory. A space that is great for several guests. This superb two/three bedroomed flat is split over two floors in a charming period building located on the desirable Chepstow Crescent, boasting generous rooms and chic décor throughout. With all rooms in immaculate condition the flat comprises vast reception room, modern kitchen with integrated appliances, stunning conservatory, master bedroom with mezzanine-level and storage, second bedroom, slick bathroom, en suite bathroom, en suite shower room, there is a patio, its set up with seating and a BBQ, garage and second car space in front, garden. Chepstow Crescent is situated within easy reach of Portobello Road renowned for its vibrant shops and antiques market as well as Westbourne Grove and Notting Hill Gate. name: 2-bed garden house in Shoreditch
space: In the heart of London’s coolest market, restaurant and boutique shopping area but with the peace and comfort of a garden and quiet home.  Brick Lane and Columbia Road markets are a minute away. The area is packed with art galleries, reknown for its clever street art and is a foodie’s heaven with brilliant restaurants for every taste.  Downstairs in this light-filled modern home is one large open space, with folding sliding doors that open onto a leafy green garden.   The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need for easy cooking and a spacious seating area great for entertaining or just relaxing. One wall is floor to ceiling bookcases, and there’s wireless broadband.  There is a downstairs loo and one bathroom upstairs with bath and shower and another toilet and also washing machine and dryer.  Two double bedrooms sleep four very comfortably – one bedroom has two single beds which can be made into a kingsize bed and the other bedroom has a double bed.  For longer stays, clean

name: Luxury 2-Bed/2-Bath Apartment
space: A spacious beautifully presented 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom apartment set within this prestigious dockside development in Canary Wharf, London. The apartment will sleep 4 in absolute comfort. A 5 minute walk to London Underground (Canary Wharf) and less than a 3 minute walk to the Docklands Light Railway (South Quay) with direct links to Stratford for the Olympics. Minutes from the historical beauty and lively nightlife of Greenwich and only one stop away the O2 Arena (largest concert arena in Europe). This ground floor property benefits from: 1.) A large reception area with an LCD TV and DVD Player. 2 large bedrooms with double beds, one with en-suite bathroom. 2.) A fully fitted modern kitchen with all essential integrated appliances. 3.) A safe and secure development with porterage and entry phone. 4.) A weekly linen change and full clean. 5.) Secure underground parking with elevator to apartment. Locally there are any local bars and restaurants.

name: Victorian house during olympic stay
space: Victorian Home and Garden for the Olympics Bookings for a minimum of 7 nights (between end of July-August 2012 and during the Paralympics)  This secure, private and quiet Victorian house, in southeast London, is ideally situated in Lewisham (zone 2) and accommodates up to 4 people.  The property is stylish and spacious, with plenty of Victorian features, wooden floors throughout and a lovely private garden, perfect for al fresco dining in the summer. The house is located in a peaceful neighbourhood you can enjoy a varied choice of independent shops, restaurants and pubs all within walking distance. We have friendly neighbours who can offer help if needed. We'll leave a welcome package with information’s about the running of our house, tips on where to go and what to see as well as restaurants and bars - tried and tested. Tea, coffee, bottled water; milk, bread and a bottle of wine will be complimentary on the first night. Although this is a 3-bedroom house, only two double bedrooms wil

name: Lovely Family Home!  1 Minute from Tube Station!
summary: Welcome and thank you for looking in!   ------- Coronavirus Update: In view of the present pandemic we are risk assessing our guests so please make an enquiry rather than a booking request in the first instance by clicking on the link "Contact host" and be prepared to answer some questions that we will ask. Thanks for your cooperation.
space: The advantages of renting a room in our place : 1)Reasonable rent. Why pay more, possibly much more, for a room in Central London when you can hop on the tube, a minute away, which takes you into the heart of London? 2)Spacious and comfortable accommodation. 3) Safe, friendly family ambience. 4)A beautiful garden where you can sit and chill out! 5)Very convenient for travel.  6)Very convenient for amenities: the park, restaurants, shops just a minute away! 7)Off street parking if space available (please note cars are parked on the property at guests' own risk!). 8)We have a long list of satisfied guests...read the reviews! A bit more:   There is  satellite tv (46inch flat screen), Wifi, washing machine, dryer, kitchen,  garden etc.  The house itself is spacious and comfortable. Guests have use of the communal facilities: lounge, diner and kitchen. house_rules: No shoes upstairs. No excessive noise, especially after 9pm. No food in rooms, please. Guests are provided with cupboard and fridge space and may eat in the dining room. Please keep bathroom and kitchen clean and tidy after use. Please make sure only one front door is open at a time so the dog doesn't run out! No visitors without prior permission. No overnight visitors. Free use of washing machine once a week (including soap powder). To avoid excessive use, additional use is charged at £5 per wash. Check-in procedures. We are flexible with our check-in times. Check-in is after 2 pm to allow for previous guests to check-out and for us to get the room ready. If there are no guests checking out then it's fine to check in earlier. Or if there are, you can leave your bags here ahead of time. But whatever time you arrive you must agree with us on an approximate time of arrival to avoid us having to wait in all day! name: Sunny Double - quick links to Victoria!
summary: Our Victorian home is located in a quiet tree-lined street between the High Road and Tooting Common.  The sunny bedroom is at the top of the house and has just been redecorated, so it's fresh and bright and ready to welcome guests!  Great travel links and free parking, perfect for sightseeing in London or for visiting family and friends in Streatham and Balham. We do have a further rooms on Airbnb if you need more accommodation.
space: Whether you are coming to London to visit relatives, sightsee, go on a course, or need somewhere to stay whilst working, we are the perfect base. The south facing bedroom is on the second floor.  The comfortable double bed is covered in 100% cotton linen and soft fluffy towels add a little luxury. The bathroom, with a bath and shower,  is on the floor below and will be shared if we have other guests staying. The large kitchen is the hub of the the home and you are welcome to help yourself to tea and coffee throughout your stay.  At breakfast help yourself to yoghurts, cereals, toast, and freshly made tea and coffee.  Wifi is available, and if you are driving here there is plentiful and free parking. We share our home Jasper a two year old West Highland White terrier. He's very friendly and we have discovered he can sniff out the smallest scrap of food in the blink of an eye! He knows he shouldn't visit our guest rooms, but is such a curious dog that he often can't help himself.   See a
description: Our Victorian home is located in a quiet tree-lined street between the High Road and Tooting Common.  The sunny bedroom is at the top of the house and has just been redecorated, so it's fresh and bright and ready to welcome guests!  Great travel links and free parking, perfect for sightseeing in London or for visiting family and friends in Streatham and Balham. We do have a further rooms on Airbnb if you need more accommodation. Whether you are coming to London to visit relatives, sightsee, go on a course, or need somewhere to stay whilst working, we are the perfect base. The south facing bedroom is on the second floor.  The comfortable double bed is covered in 100% cotton linen and soft fluffy towels add a little luxury. The bathroom, with a bath and shower,  is on the floor below and will be shared if we have other guests staying. The large kitchen is the hub of the the home and you are welcome to help yourself to tea and coffee throughout your stay.  At breakfast help yourself to yo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is an oasis minutes away from the hustle and bustle of busy London.  Tooting Common is close by and some of our more athletic guests have enjoyed an early morning or evening run around it!   We have some really lovely restaurants close by catering for a huge range of tastes - a newcomer is Hood serving Modern British cuisine - reservations are definitely needed! We also have Lebanese, Indian, Fish & Chips and Cafes galore.  Balham also has a great choice of places to eat, and we are more than happy to recommend some of our favourites. If Jazz is your thing then Streatham has it's very own jazz club - The Hideaway - which is in full swing most evenings.  Great fun and fabulous music.
notes: We joined the Airbnb community five years ago and have met some wonderful and interesting people.  We are happy to have guests staying for a couple of days or longer and feel that we offer a safe and secure place - especially if you are coming to London for the first time and need to get your bearings.  We're also perfectly placed for visiting family and friends in Streatham and Balham - especially grandparents coming to see their grandchildren!
transit: Streatham Hill train station is a short walk away and there are frequent trains into Victoria. From here it's easy to get to  Buckingham Palace, St. James's and Green Parks, and the Houses of Parliament. If you prefer to go shopping the 139 bus takes you into the heart of Knightsbridge, with Harrods and Harvey Nicols close by.  Or you can stay on the bus and head up to Oxford Street. Balham is a 15/20 minute walk or  5 mins from Streatham Hill Station.  Here you can take the Northern Line tube which will take you into the heart of the West End in a matter of minutes.   Cars can be arranged to collect you from the airport - please let us know if you would like this service.
access: Access to kitchen at breakfast and to make tea/coffee.  Cooking facilities are not available. Guests are welcome to watch TV the in sitting room and and wifi is available.
house_rules: There aren't many... - If you are going to be late (arriving or during your stay) please let us know. - If you go out when there is no one else in make sure that you leave the house secure. - Respect our home as if it were yours.

name: Bauhaus Apartment Dalston
summary: Bright one bedroom apartment in a peaceful location in the heart of Dalston.  The flat is on the second floor of a converted Bauhaus hospital, looking over a quiet and beautiful garden square. Comfortable double bedroom, bathroom & large open kitchen and living room. Everything you need for your stay in London.
space: Perfect base for a stay in east London - minutes from Dalston stations (Dalston Junction, Dalston Kingsland, London Fields), Kingsland Road, Broadway Market, London Fields and all the fun of the neighbourhood. The room is a comfortable double: double bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers. The kitchen is well equipped, has a good sized dining table if you want to receive friends, and opens into the living area. The flat is a loft-style conversion with beautiful high ceilings and windows. Please note that this is a real lived in home so the price reflects the fact not everything in there is shiny new.  You get access to a roof terrace with spectacular views of the whole city, and the lovely garden square which is the original Albert Square from Eastenders - the pilot was actually filmed here! There's everything you need in the flat in good working order, so you can make yourself at home. All mod cons: full kitchen, dishwasher, brand new washing machine, high speed broadband. It's actually a tw

name: 2 dble rooms Wimbledon/Southfields
summary: Two large, nice and clean double bedrooms (you can actually walk around the bed!) in a HOUSE, in Wimbledon / Southfields in LONDON (Zone 3 for tube Travelcard/Oyster). TV, and tea / coffee facilities in each room. The kitchen is available on a "heat and eat" (microwave) basis and shelves in the fridge/freezer/cupboards are there for your use. Breakfast cereals are provided (or of course, you can use your own). Tea. coffee and milk are also provided. Breakfasting in the kitchen finishes by 9am. SMOKING is OK in the private and beautiful GARDEN.  I would prefer 2 females but could sleep 4 people BY ARRANGEMENT.  Quiet and safe area for a good nights sleep but within 5 minutes walk of pubs and restaurants and WIMBLEDON TENNIS grounds with its museum and tours is 1.29km/0.8 miles walk away. Southfields tube is 10-15 minutes walk away, Central London 20 - 30 minutes by tube. Buses into town one minute away.  A great place to base yourself while sightseeing, or if you're working in "London T

notes: Please note that I do not accept reservations without prior contact via the messaging system here on Airbnb where you can tell me a little about yourself and the purpose of your trip etc. Check in is after 2pm, check out by 11am. Sunday check in after 5pm, check out by 11am. Please read the "House Rules"! If you intend to bring your child/children, please let me know and note that I cannot host anyone under the age of 10 years old.  Each room accommodates two people, and all guests are charged for.
house_rules: We're pretty relaxed, but we do ask that you communicate with us about your comings and goings so that we can arrange ours. For practical reasons, we do also ask that you are out and about during the day.  We are a fairly quiet household, so if you are planning on very late nights, this might not be the place for you! We are also up early so not a place for long lie-ins.. Please note that the kitchen is literally to "heat and eat" with use of a microwave. No hot food is allowed in the bedrooms. If you are breakfasting in the kitchen, please be cleared by 9am. WiFi is free for reasonable use, email etc. Watching films, streaming, gaming, (Hidden by Airbnb) etc might incur charges for me, which will, I'm afraid, be passed on to you! If you intend to bring your child/children, please let me know and note that I cannot host anyone under the age of 10 years old.  Each room accommodates two people, and all guests are charged for. name: GREAT VALUE ROOM- SAVE £££££
space: If you'd like to experience London as a local, look no further. My family and I live in a leafy residential area of London, away from the noise but also within easy reach to central London.  Our home is a semi detached 1930's built house which is quiet typical of this area of London. We have 3 rooms available to accommodate our guests. One of the rooms is a single or twin while the other two can accommodate up to 3 people. There is a dedicated guest bathroom which includes towels, shampoo and shower gel. We also provide all our guests with fresh linen and a hair dryer.  Although there is NO USE OF KITCHEN except store your food in the fridge or borrowing plates and cutlery , all our the rooms have tea and coffee making facilities. If at any time you feel anything else is missing, let me know and I am sure we could organize this. There is FREE wifi throughout the house. We are very flexible with check-in and check-out times, just let us know your requirements. In terms of location, we a

name: Beautiful Bohemian Flat in N London
space: If you are looking for a place to stay in London, be it for work or pleasure, this could be the answer. Spacious two-room flat suitable for a couple (one bedroom & one living room), fully functioning kitchen/diner and bathroom with combined shower and bathtub. All modern amenities included (internet & TV). This flat comes fully furnished and ready to use! There's a double bed and a double sofa bed for extra people.   We are a creative couple living close to the relaxed Crouch End, a green spot in the midst of the bustle of North London. The flat is a 10 minute walk from Finsbury Park Tube station and only two minutes from Crouch Hill Overground. Being in zone 2 and on the Victoria and Piccadilly tube lines, it is approximately 20 minutes from door to door to key locations such as The West End, Hampstead Heath, Camden Town, Piccadilly Circus and London Bridge. name: Double room 10min from Olympics
space: Light, sunny and quiet double room in the best part of Stratford, London, just 10min walking distance from the Olympics venues and biggest shopping centre Westfield Stratford City, 2min away from Morrison's /food supermarket/ We offer wi fi, TV with free view in the room, double bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, access to fully equipped kitchen, washing machine/ dryer, shared bathroom, living room, garden, parking can be arranged.  Bed linen and bath towel will be provided and changed every week. The House will also be cleaned every four nights during stays of longer length. Stratford station is a short walk and has some excellent transport links. Approximate train journey times are as follows: Liverpool St: 7 mins Kings Cross: 10 mins Canary Wharf: 10 mins The West End: 20 mins Do not hesitate to contact me if any questions!

This bus takes you to Catford and Catford Bridge National Rail stations in as little as 10 minutes, Grove Park Station in the opposite direction in 5 minutes,  Lewisham Station and Lewisham Docklands Light Railway (DLR) Stations in 15/20 minutes.  You can board trains from all these stations to travel to Central London for sightseeing. You can also take a train from Lewisham Docklands Light Railway (DLR) to Greenwich where you can visit the Cutty Sark, the National Maritime Museum, the Planetarium, Greenwich Meridian and other attractions in the Greenwich area.  If you don't mind walking, Hither Green Station is 15 minutes walk from my house.  You can also take a train from this station direct to Central London. name: Beautiful Family Home near Tube
space: Our  home is in leafy East Finchley, in North London, just a few minutes walk from a Northern Line Underground stop, shops, pubs, playgrounds parks and Hampstead Heath. We are on a quiet, friendly cul de sac, and our beautiful home has everything a family could require, including a washing machine, a dryer, a microwave, tv, wi fi, and a lovely garden for the kids or just grown up bbqs, as well as off street parking if you are hiring a car. Our house comfortably sleeps 4-5 people.

name: Stylish, Spacious Hampstead Heath Garden Flat
summary: Our stylish, spacious one-bedroom flat has the additional benefit of a separate office room .  It is just 4 miles from Central London yet feels a million miles away with its unique location backing onto Hampstead Heath's 790 acres of ancient woodland.
space: The apartment has a private patio leading onto a large shared garden with direct access to the Heath.  In just moments you are onto Parliament Hill with it's iconic views over London and then it's a short stroll to the bathing ponds, woods and hills. The large, sunny double bedroom is very comfortable for two people. There is also a smaller office room with a desk.
description: Our stylish, spacious one-bedroom flat has the additional benefit of a separate office room .  It is just 4 miles from Central London yet feels a million miles away with its unique location backing onto Hampstead Heath's 790 acres of ancient woodland. The apartment has a private patio leading onto a large shared garden with direct access to the Heath.  In just moments you are onto Parliament Hill with it's iconic views over London and then it's a short stroll to the bathing ponds, woods and hills. The large, sunny double bedroom is very comfortable for two people. There is also a smaller office room with a desk. Guests have access to the whole flat with widescreen TV, DVD player, Netflix etc. wifi.  Fully-fitted kitchen with washing machine/dryer, dishwasher, a bathroom with a large rolltop, claw-footed bath.  Outside in the garden is a clothes line. We will be away and guests have sole use of the flat. There are many things in Hampstead to attract tourists but it is also a friendly vi
neighborhood_overview: There are many things in Hampstead to attract tourists but it is also a friendly village of residents who love and support their neighbourhood.   Just minutes away is the hustle and bustle of South End Green's enclave  of restaurants, cafes,shops, bars and transport services.  Keat's House, The Freud Museum, historic pubs serving wonderful food and traditional ales are just some of the immediate attractions.  Nearby are cinemas and theatres,  swimming pools and a gym.  It's a short bus ride to Camden's famous covered markets, music venues and nightlife.  Central London is a bus or tube ride away.
notes: No guests please.
transit: The flat is really well-located for transport to all parts of London and beyond. The London Overground station is a few minutes walk away at the end of the street and links to Underground stations.  There are buses going direct to central London and a bus to Paddington connects with the Heathrow Express.  A brisk 10 minute walk away are the nearest underground stations of Belsize Park or Hampstead and then it's 12-14 minutes on the tube into London's West End, or South Bank, with its riverside restaurants, the National Theatre and views.
access: Guests have access to the whole flat with widescreen TV, DVD player, Netflix etc. wifi.  Fully-fitted kitchen with washing machine/dryer, dishwasher, a bathroom with a large rolltop, claw-footed bath.  Outside in the garden is a clothes line.
house_rules: Just be respectful of our beautiful place!  No smoking please and no shoes indoors.  Sorry not suitable for children.

summary: 2 double bedroooms rented  together as one unit . Could either be for 2-4 adults. If it is for 2 adults, the second bedroom could be changed into an  living/office space.  Bathroom,  living room,  kitchen and outside space shared with owners.
space: Situated in a quite street, sleeps 2-4 (maximum). Two double bedrooms, rented together as one unit, on the first floor. To share with the owners, family bathroom, ground floor living room, kitchen diner and outside, a large decked area for eating and socialising, garden with BBQ.  WiFi, cable TV, washing machine and central heating.  If it is a couple wanting to rent the 2 double bedrooms then one of the bedrooms could be turned into a living room/office area. Please request this at the time of booking.

neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance is Lloyds Park with a duck pond, running track, childrens play area, skate park, bowling green and cafe. We are connected by London Overground to the true East London (Shoreditch, Hackney, Dalston, Bethnal Green). You can also take this line all the way to Richmond, stopping at Hampstead Heath etc. or the other way to Stratford for the cinema house or Westfield Shopping Centre Great location with easy access to either central London or you could stay local and see the true London East End. Just around the corner, walking distance to the local shops, organic wine and craft beer shop, Tesco Express. Walthamstow market, Sunday farmers market, shopping centre, 15 minutes walk or one stop on the tube to Walthamstow Central station. Trout and Carp fishing and canal walks, 10 minutes walk. Epping Forest- a 15 minutes drive into one of the oldest forests, boasting boating lake, walks and picnic spots and fishing ponds.  Local take away restaurants less than 5 minutes wa
notes: The house has gas central heating so is toasty and warm all year round. Constant hot water, so no waiting around for the hot water tank to fill after the last person has showered! And NEW this year we have a brand new wooden deck leading onto the garden with place for you to rest, read, relax, do some yoga or just sit out and listen to the birds. Full English breakfast can be requested. We can also have dinner ready for you on your return from a hard days shopping. Ask for a packed lunch to take with you on your days out or a picnic if you want to head out to the boat lake and Epping Forest.
transit: 5 minute walk to Blackhorse Road tube station and within 20 minutes to central London (Victoria line-Blackhorse Road tube station).  Very well connected to Shoreditch, Haggerston, Canary Wharf, Shepherds Bush, Richmond and Hampstead Heath using the London Overground Line from Black Horse Road station. The Emirates Stadium, home to Arsenal is 3 stops away on the Victoria Line. Tottenham Hotspurs can be reached easily using the Seven Sisters tube on the Victoria Line. 15 minutes walk to St James Street Rail Station to take a direct train to Liverpool Street (15 minute journey time) 35 minutes drive from Stansted airport. Stansted Express stops at Tottenham Hale, one stop from Blackhorse Road on the Victoria line. Journey time 33 minutes. Kings Cross for the Euro Star on the Victoria Line, 4 stops from Blackhorse Road tube station. Journey time 10 minutes.
access: You will have full access to the living room, kitchen/diner, family bathroom, outside decked terrace and garden. All these you will be sharing with the owners (my wife and I).

name: Cosy single bedroom in loft
summary: Our room is the perfect place to rest after a long day of sightseeing in London or it will accommodate students and professionals alike due to its quiet and peaceful location.
space: We are offering a cosy single bedroom in our loft with shared bathroom. The room can be part of a booking for 3 guests as it is next to a double bedroom with en-suite bathroom.   We can provide towels at no additional charge.   Now a little bit about the area we are in:  The bus just outside the house will take you to Walthamstow Central Station in about 5min. from where you can catch the train/tube to Liverpool Street in 15min., Oxford Circus in 20min. and Kings Cross in 15min. All very straightforward connections.   Stanstead airport is a 40min drive away or alternatively the Stanstead Express takes around 30min. Collection from the train station can be arranged.  Walthamstow itself is a very cosmopolitan area with the longest street market in Europe, the famous William Morris Gallery, lovely Parks and a very picturesque Village. It is full of international restaurants, pubs and friendly people!

name: Elegant, Quiet Room near Bohemian Camden Market
summary: My Comfy, Homely Artistic Two bed House is a Quiet, Safe Sanctuary -close to world famous Camden Market. Easy access to North/West/ East End- with a high local transport rating. A pretty 1800s Cottage with Garden, in a quiet Conservation area. Guests stay in the Master Bedroom. The alternative relaxing stay in Zone 2. Catch a gig at the Roundhouse, visit Triyoga for a course,  Shop for gifts at Camden Market,  walk to Primrose Hill, dine at a huge array of local restaurants- its on the doorstep!
space: ABOUT THE GUEST MASTER BEDROOM & ITS AMENITIES:  - Comfy and Spacious King Sized Double Bed with fresh linen  - Sunny Large Double Master Bedroom with antique wooden flooring and furnishings.  - Lots of wardrobe/ hangers and shelf space available.  - 2 large sash windows with pretty windowboxes that overlook a very quaint and quiet street of Victorian Terrace Houses.  - Fresh Towels (Bath/Hand Towel)  - Shampoo, Conditioner, Toothpaste and Body Wash  - Tea/ coffee snacks, sweets on a bedside table.  - Fan available for the warmer months, Eiderdown for the colder months - Umbrella - Hot water bottle - Universal travel adaptor  - Double USB Charging Point with Cable - iPod docking station  - Hairdryer  ABOUT THE HOUSE:  - Antique Wooden Flooring throughout - Galley kitchen with washing machine/drier, fridge/ freezer, microwave,    dishwasher and brand new oven.  - My love of arts and crafts and quirky theatrical antiques decorates the    lounge/ dining room and bedroom.  - 2 comfy sofas,

neighborhood_overview: Although the house is a mere less than a minutes walk from the famous Stables Market, its a very quiet street with local residents who have been here for years. The street definitely has a 'village' feel.  Camden is a vibrant, colourful, alternative place to visit- full of Youth Culture and Creative Businesses. I was first drawn to the area for the alternative 'Britpop' and Indie music scene.  Take a stroll down the canal to beautiful Regents Park, Little Venice or re landscaped Kings Cross, people watch from the many bars/ restaurants with outside seating on Chalk Farm Road, or go star spotting and catch the best view of London in nearby Primrose Hill. Take in a gig at the iconic Roundhouse, Dublin Castle, Koko, Proud Gallery and Jazz Cafe, or eat at the Gordon Ramsey Restaurant 'The York and Albany' at the top of Parkway.  Or take a day trip to Paris from the Eurostar- 15 mins down the road by tube. There are loads of interesting street art organised walks around Camden too.  The cho
notes: My long term lodger and friend Nick who works as a Senior Planning Officer for the past 6 years for Hackney District Council for will be staying at the house but working most of the time - he tends to work Monday to Friday (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and is around for some weekends. He is in the second bedroom and the other communal areas including the bathroom are shared with just him. Nick is a mature friendly guy in his 40s,  has been living in London for 20 odd years and knows London well. He used to live in Camden approx 15 years ago. He is great company, is very chilled and a songwriter too. He has been chosen as my lodger as he is very sociable, friendly and puts guests at ease quickly- he also loves the airbnb aspect of living at the house and enjoys meeting people from around the world.   If Nick and I are around- I will of course, introduce him to guests at check in
transit: Amazing transport links and the camden area has been graded with a high rating for transport provision in London.  Overground Station (Kentish town west: 2 mins walk away) takes you out to Dalston/ Hackney Wick or Richmond.  Tubes (Northern Line- both Chalk Farm and Camden Town Stations are 5 mins walk away) takes you to the City or Charing Cross in 25 mins Buses 1 min walk away)- takes you to Tottenham Court Road/ Waterloo/ Paddington in 20 mins.  Basically, its very easy to get to any corner of London from here.  Getting to the Airport:  Heathrow Airport: Northern Line to Kings Cross, then District/ Circle Line to Paddington then Heathrow Express OR Northern Line to Leicester Square then Piccadilly Line straight to Heathrow.  Gatwick Airport: Northern Line to Euston, then Victoria Line to Victoria then Gatwick Express Stanstead: Northern Line to Moorgate then Circle or Hammersmith and City Line to Liverpool Street then Stanstead Express Eurostar (Gateway to Europe): Northern Line or
access: Access to Kitchen for cooking, Dining Room/ Lounge, Garden, Bathroom and Cloakroom Loo. These will be shared with my friendly lodger Nick (see 'other things to note').
house_rules: I have the usual rules- No parties or events.  Quiet time is 11pm- 7am I would prefer if guests didn't bring other people back to the house - unless I am aware of the request.   No more than 2 guests can stay at the property.  If you are thinking of bringing pets- then this could potentially be accommodated. I don't have pets myself.  Smoking is not allowed in the house but absolutely fine in the garden and ashtrays will be provided. V IMPORTANT: On departure, the bottom lock of the front door needs to be locked and the keys put back in the keysafe outside the house if I am not around. Please never use the safety chain on the front door- the bottom lock needs to be locked at night before going to bed and the conservatory door also locked and anytime when out of the house.    Kitchen Facilities are all available but I ask that you buy your own food/ drink - I can provide basic breakfast - muesli or porridge,  fruit, granola bars, milk etc.  I just ask that guests are respectful of my ho

summary: A bright and airy one double bedroom river apartment close to Battersea Park and minutes walk to restaurants and shops.
space: A bright and airy one double bedroom river apartment close to Battersea Park and minutes walk to restaurants and shops. Private gated community with porter and gardens. A charming 12 mins walk to the famous Kings Road along the river. A 1 min walk to Battersea square, a cobbled square with cafe's, restaurants and local shops.

summary: You have the option of renting the entire apartment with private, bright, double bedroom or renting the private, double bedroom and share the living space. Please specify on booking. Thank you.
space: The apartment in situated in Hackney, East London. The apartment is clean, bright and spacious. You will have access to a lovely double bedroom, an open spaced living and kitchen area with WiFi thoroughout. Guests have full use of kitchen, living area and bathroom. The apartment is 2 mins. walk to Homerton overground station, Stratford City is 6 mins and West End is 20 mins away. Various bus routes are within walking distance and run through the night. One of Hackney's oldest and famous markets is on Chatsworth Road, a short walk away where you can experience the vibrant hub of Homerton, boasting independant resturants, cafe's, patisseries, a local Co-op and many shops. Local area - Hackney Empire Theatre, Hackney Picturehouse Cinema are a short distance away. London Fields market, London Fields, Victoria Park & Shoreditch are all in close proximity and within walking distance. neighborhood_overview: The flat is a 10 - 15 minute walk to Chiswick High Road, which has lots of great bars, cafes, supermarkets and unique shops. This makes the area one of the nicest places to be in in London. Chiswick is an enchanting area of west London, set on the edge of one of the Thames' sweeping loops. And while its beautiful riverside scenery is perhaps its biggest draw, Chiswick has many other attractions: great stretches of green land; historic houses; leafy avenues filled with handsome Edwardian and Victorian homes; easy road and rail links in and out of London; and a lively, boulevard-style High Road whose tree-lined pavements offer all the important contemporary shopping options as well as a thriving restaurant, bar and café culture with outdoor tables.  Traditionalists, however, may prefer the atmosphere of the 19th Century pubs scattered along the long thoroughfare, and seasoned beer-drinkers are warmly invited to tour Fuller Smith & Turner's Griffin Brewery, the capital's last surviving fa
transit: as mentioned it is about a 5 minute walk to Acton town station which is a fast underground line to Central London in one way or to Heathrow airport in the other direction.
access: The whole flat is available for guests as well as a lock up garage situated around the back of the flat. This involves a small walk around the block to access the garage.

name: Bright & Spacious North London Home
space: Our home is spacious, light and very relaxing. We are situated right at the foot of Alexandra Palace in a great neighbourhood with loads of coffee shops and green spaces. We are between three large parks Alexandra Palace, Priory Park and Highgate and Queenswood, all within a few minutes walking distance from the house. There is free parking on street, Crouch End is a few minutes walk away, and there are excellent transport links to get into Central London within 30 minutes. If you are interested in using our home as a base for your London stay we would gladly leave an extensive list of the fantastic restaurants, shopping  and points of interest in the neighbourhood.

name: Self-catering room in Belsize Park
summary: You will not regret coming to Belsize Park! We have made many guests into Belsize patriots-:). Looking forward to welcoming you to our place! In a quiet, tree-lined Victorian street, a good-sized room sleeping one, or a parent and a child between 6 and 14 years old. The adjoining bathroom for your private use. A kitchen available for your near-exclusive use. Access to a sunny living room. Friendly hosts always happy to offer advice - or leave you in privacy.
space: A quiet, spacious room with a window overlooking the garden on the first floor flat of a semi-detached Victorian house (sorry, no lift).   Bed can be made as a single or as a double. A modern bathroom with shower, bath, basin and WC. A compact kitchen (kettle, toaster, microwave, fridge, oven, gas stove, washer drier) to prepare your breakfasts and dinners (light cooking only please). Tea, coffee and other staples provided. The sunny living room is yours all mornings and evenings. It may be yours to use daytime as well - please let us know in advance. New in: a 27-inch monitor with built-in audio at your disposal in the living room. Connect your device with a cable and participate in virtual meetings or classes, watch/replay films & pictures, or log into your streaming service. With reliable fibre broadband -DSL and WiFi coverage; a perfect pad for longer stays!

The sunny living room is yours all mornings and evenings. It may be yours to use daytime as well - please let
neighborhood_overview: The North London "village" of Belsize Park is between Hampstead, Camden Town and Primrose Hill - all of which are worth visiting, and are 10 - 20 mins on foot. While Belsize may be less well known than its neighbours, it can offer plenty: restaurants, pubs and cafes around the underground station, along Englands Lane (round the corner from us), as well as in the lovely "Belsize Village" just up the road. The nearest small supermarket is 3 mins walk away.  Fancy a walk or a jog? Hampstead Heath is a 10–15 minute away.  Primrose Hill, where if you're lucky, you'll spot some of our local celebs jogging or chilling out, is 10 minutes walk. It offers some of the best views of Central London. If you'd like something more lively, Camden Market is just 15 mins walk downhill.  The Royal Free Hospital and the Olave Centre are a pleasant 15 mins stroll for those on training events. The Tavistock Institute is even closer.
notes: - We provide discounts for longer stays, starting with 5 nights. The longer you stay, the better the rate.  - The whole flat is cleaned, and the bedding changed, once a week. Please let us know if you would like to book additional cleaning. You can help yourself to fresh towels as needed at any time. - The bed is made with two pillows per guest and a duvet; if you'd like a top sheet as well, please let us know - If arriving by car, please let us know in advance as we can provide free off-street parking. -  Renata speaks German, French, Czech, Polish and Slovak, so do write to us in any of these languages, if it's more convenient.
transit: The quickest way to central London is by tube (subway/metro). Either from Belsize Park (6 mins walk from us) on the Northern Line, taking you directly to Leicester Square and Chinatown, or from Swiss Cottage (12 mins walk) on the Jubilee Line; Baker Street station with its museums is just two tube stops away.  Both tube lines now run late night services at weekends. Should you prefer to see London from the top of a double-decker bus, you can take a No 13 bus from Finchley Road (13 mins walk) or a No 24 from either South End Green or Camden (15 mins walk).   Paddington station for trains to Heathrow Airport, as well as Oxford, Bath, Wales and Cornwall, is easy to get to. Kings Cross / St Pancras International stations are four tube stops away. Apart from the Eurostar Terminal for Paris or Brussels, they can be your departure point to Cambridge or Edinburgh.  Euston Station, just three tube stops away, takes you to Manchester and the Lake District.  Some friendly advice: if arriving by t
access: You will have the whole flat to yourself overnight.  In addition to your own room with a comfortable bed, you have sole use of the bathroom/WC. Kitchen and living room to be shared daytime Monday to Friday, exclusive use from the evening till breakfast time. During the day only, Chris is using the other room in the flat as his study.
house_rules: No smoking anywhere in the house, please.   Please respect the neighbours after 23.00. The main entrance door to the house has two locks, and guests have to take care to lock both of them whenever they come or go. Please take care not to lose the keys; any loss will have to be charged for depending of the circumstances (making of a replacement key or changing the locks). The kitchen and the living room has to be kept tidy and available for our use (i.e. for common use), particularly during daytime hours between approx. 9 am and 5.30 pm.

name: Penthouse ensuite bed Whitechapel
space: Location: between Whitechapel and Stepney Green tube stations, walking distance to Bethnal Green and Shadwell. This is a 4 bedroom flat. Shared areas include a spacious living room/dining room: comfortable sofa, dining room table and a small balcony just big enough to put two chairs out and plant a few flowers and tomatoes. Kitchen has all you would expect and more! incl an oven, microwave, coffee machine + a small dishwasher and washing machine.  The large double room with private ensuite bathroom : Fully furnished with  double bed, desk + office chair, bedside table. The bathroom has a bath, shower and toilet. Preference is for monthly stays. This room is available from early October until December.  During this time, you will be sharing with a German female teaching fellow, a French/British female researcher. Both are in their mid 30s, working at a university.

neighborhood_overview: Attractions in the area: Genesis cinema, the George Tavern pub, access to Regents canal and Victoria Park or towards Docklands, many food shops, take aways, markets (also a few supermarkets such as Sainsburys, Coop and Tesco extra) + several sport centres/swimming pool...  Brick lane/Liverpool Street/ Shoreditch area is a short walk and there are many interesting markets and art galleries to visit, as well as places to eat out or go for a drink.  We are also close to Queen Mary university of London,  and London Metropolitan University as well as the Royal London Hospital. Easy access also to LSE, King’s College, UCL.
transit: There is a choice of underground stations (Whitechapel and Stepney for the District and the Hammersmith & City line) are within 5 minutes walk, Shadwell (DLR) and Bethnal Green (central line) are a 10 minute walk. Overground also runs from Whitechapel as well as several good bus routes (incl. 205 and 25 are 24h) to Oxford & and towards Kings Cross/Paddington. Cycling is easy and there are excellent public transport links to the city. There is the option of parking in the garage under the building where we have an allocated space.
access: Communal areas - bathroom, kitchen, living room.
house_rules: Please take shoes off in the flat. Be careful on the stairs which is sisal - a seagrass material. Do not spill anything on it.  There is a dishwasher - please make sure you fill and empty it when necessary & wash any dishes by hand if they cannot be washed in the dishwasher.  Take the bins downstairs when necessary- I will show you where.  Respect neighbours & keep noise down especially between 9.30pm and 8am  Always lock the front door & close the downstairs door to building. Keep all shared areas tidy including the kitchen and bathroom

name: Super-convenient, 3 mins to Kings X
summary: The best location to access all of London! Kings Cross has 6 tube lines to all parts of London. This is a bright, comfortable, simple and convenient base  to enjoy London composed of 2 bedrooms, 1 bed/living room, kitchen, bathroom, toilet & balcony.
space: Sunny and comfortable 2 bedroom flat, living room/bedroom common space and south-facing balcony. Ideally located in Central London with excellent transport links to tube, bus and trains from King's Cross, 3 minutes away. There is also a bike share scheme 200m from the flat where you can rent a bike for a day for £2 with a credit card.  The flat is quiet, bright and a great place to spend the summer to explore and enjoy all that London has to offer. In the immediate vicinity there are the great shops and cafes of the King's Cross area. Oxford Street, Regent Street and all the facilities of central London are just a short bus ride away.  The British Museum is also walking distance.   There are two double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobe/cupboard space, and a single bedroom. I also provide a comfortable inflatable mattress for additional guests that had electronic inflation so that you can be more comfortable in the space during the day.   The flat also has a South-facing balcony wit

neighborhood_overview: A newly regenerated area with lots going on and a central location make London's Kings Cross and attractive area to artists and cultural establishments. There are lovely squares, like Granary Square and a Real Food market with homemade goods for sale on Wednesdays-Fridays. It's on your doorstep and a perfect place to get a snack or buy some really good bread.  I have updated my listing with things to see and do in the area as well as places that you can buy groceries. There is a printed copy in the flat as well as the online copy on the listing, which you can access once you are connected to wifi.  Kings Place, next to Regents Canal hosts numerous art, comedy, music and cultural events throughout the year.  Granary Square, a newly redecorated area with more than 1,000 coloured fountains is a short walk away.  Gagosian Gallery, a cutting edge art space, has it's main premises in the area.  The British Library, just a few minutes walk away, displays some of the world's most famous writte
notes: There is currently construction going on 100m from the flat. This runs from around 8 in the morning until 6 at night Monday-Saturday. It may be a little noisy during those times. So far people have found the flat to be quiet but if you are a very light sleeper you may be disturbed by the noise. Generally the area is quiet and it is on a street that has very little traffic - this is really unusual in Central London.  Need to print your boarding pass or some other document? Netstream internet cafe is nearby at 254 Pentonville Road.
transit: The flat is just a few minutes walk from Kings Cross station, which makes you 15 minutes or less from the following locations: Oxford Circus, easy access to Oxford Street, Regent Street and Carnaby Street Covent Garden Camden with it's market and nightlife Shoreditch, (Old Street tube) a great neighbourhood for a fun night out Green Park, with easy access to Mayfair, the Royal Academy and Buckingham Palace International access: London Heathrow Direct tube access on the Piccadilly line to Kings Cross station. This journey takes 60 minutes.  Gatwick Airport  Thameslink trains run direct from Gatwick Airport to St Pancras station, a 6 minute walk from the flat. The journey takes 55-65 minutes and costs £11-£32. If you are arriving very late or very early in the morning, you may find it more convenient to take the Gatwick Express train to Victoria station, this train runs from 3.30am to 00.30am at night and costs £17.70 online or £31.05 return (you save 10% booking this way). It is a 30 mi
access: You have access to all of the flat. It is your independent home while you are there. It is on the 4th floor of the building with lift. When leaving, please take the lift to the LG floor to exit. I will also leave you 3 sets of keys so that you can be independent and move freely.
house_rules: No particular rules, please feel at home and treat the place with the respect that you would any home.  I would rather that you didn't smoke inside, there is a balcony at the front and back of the flat, both of which are covered in case of rain.

name: 5 bed house, Islington, Big garden!
summary: Our home was renovated in 2012 by Charles Tashima Architecture. We can sleep 10 people comfortably. The kitchen opens up to a 35 metre garden, with a sunken trampoline hidden in a silver woodland. We have two wood burning stoves for winter nights and a projector to watch movies.
space: This is our family home. It was refurbished in 2012. It is spacious and has lots of entertainment space with a double reception room and pull-down projector screen. Four folding doors open up completely from the large kitchen to the 35 meter garden. The master bedroom has an en suite bathroom. There are four more bedrooms including a loft-converted bedroom and  one further bathroom. The house is 3100 Sq ft in total. There is a trampoline in the garden surrounded by 40 silver birch trees. Behind this is a large kids playhouse hidden in the trees. Mercers Road is a desirable street which is well served by nearby amenities, within easy reach of the shops, bars and restaurants around Upper Street and Tufnell Park. Hampstead Heath is in walking distance. Transport links include Upper Holloway Station (Overground) Tufnell Park Station (Northern Line) and Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line). Local authority: Islington Council

neighborhood_overview: The Local Area SHOPS Holloway Road  - turn right outside the house, walk to the end. Lots of small shops. Fortess Road – turn left outside the house, walk all the way to the end, turn left again, then right on to Tufnell Park Road and walk up the hill to the junction.  Along the way you will pass the Tufnell Park Tavern – a good local place for eating out (breakfast, lunch, dinner). Upper Street in Islington is 1.5km south down the Holloway Road but it’s very nice. Many cafés, shops and restaurants. For big weekly shopping we go to WAITROSE,  1km south down Holloway Road on the left. The car park is just past WAITROSE – turn left off the Holloway Road and follow the signs that take you around to the back of the store.
transit: UNDERGROUND  / METRO  Tufnell Park (Northern Line) is nearest Holloway Road (Piccadilly Line) BUSES Walk to Holloway Road for many bus routes into the centre of London.
access: Projector for films The projection screen pulls down with a hook that we keep under the sofa by the wall. Pull all the way down and hold. To retract, tug quickly and release. It is delicate so an adult should do this. Projector – when using the DVD player, be sure the amplifier is set to ‘AV’. The sound will then play through the speakers.

name: Double room - Acton/Shepherd's Bush
summary: Private room for one or two people with twin single beds, plenty of storage space, a small desk, TV,  hairdryer, bedding and towels provided.
space: Private Double Room in modern two-bedroom apartment. Named 'Issigonis House', the property is located in West London on the borders of Shepherd's Bush and Acton. The room has twin beds, plenty of storage space, a small desk, a TV/DVD and free Wi-Fi connection. The bathroom is shared with me (the only other occupant in the flat. I live on the upper level), but it is conveniently located for you; directly opposite the guest's bedroom.  Bed linen and towels are provided and a continental breakfast is included. The accommodation is not self-catering but the occasional use of the kettle or the microwave oven in the kitchen is permitted.  Conveniently, there is a cashpoint and a Tesco supermarket situated at one end of the building and several other amenities nearby.  'Westfield' (one of Europe's largest shopping mall) with its multitude of shops and restaurants is a short 10 minutes walk away. Excellent transport links to all airports, major tourist attractions and places of interest with b

neighborhood_overview: Located between Shepherd's Bush and Acton, the immediate neighbourhood is pretty quiet (especially at night!) With various bus routes stopping right outside the front door 24/7, the transport links are excellent. There are several tube and train stations nearby including, Shepherds Bush Market, Shepherds Bush, Acton Central and Hammersmith.  On "Askew Road", the local High Street, you'll find many restaurants to suit all taste buds, (some are truly excellent!), cafés, pubs, etc... and our local fish'n'chip shop! The gigantic shopping mall "Westfield" is merely 10/15 mins walk away (or 5/8 mins by bus). For a more tranquil experience, a spot of jogging or a game of tennis, you can head over to Acton Park (5 mins walk away) or to Ravenscourt Park, a little further away towards Hammersmith and the Thames riverside.
notes: Please send me your travel details  in advance and let me know what time you would wish to check in to the apartment. I'll try my best to accommodate you though, I sometimes have very strict work commitments. Also, please keep me informed of any delays or difficulties. Thank you.
transit: Bus 207 from Shepherds Bush (Central line) and bus 266 from Hammersmith (Piccadilly/District lines) stop right outside the front door at "Third Avenue" bus stop. They are in operation 24/7. Also from "Third Avenue", you can catch the (smaller bus) 272 to Turnham Green and Chiswick. To and from Shepherds Bush, you can also catch the bus 607 but, you will need to alight at bus stop "Bromyard Avenue" (150m away from Issigonis House). For the London Overground line, Acton Central station is 5 mins walk away,  across Acton Park. For the Hammersmith&City / Circle lines catch the 207/607 to Shepherd's Bush Market Station.
access: Shared spaces: hallway, bathroom, lounge/kitchen and balcony. No access to private quarters on mezzanine and limited access to lounge/kitchen area after 9pm.
house_rules: No smoking allowed anywhere in the building. No access to private quarters on upper floor. No use of the kitchen except authorized access to a kettle and a microwave oven. Use of private telephone line (landline) strictly forbidden - Outgoing calls monitored daily.
