name: Queens Pk nr Notting Hill: Quiet, big 2 bdrm, NW6
summary: 1 mile from Notting Hill. 2 bedrooms over 2 floors. Your room has a comfy super king (6 ft wide) expensive Cloud mattress bought Jan 17. I live in the loft upstairs. Spacious Victorian flat, contemporary style in trendy Queens Park. Quiet & not on a main road. Oak wood floors, bright w/ many windows.  10 to 20 mins DIRECT tube to Baker St, Paddington, Hyde Park, SoHo, Covent Garden, Camden, Piccadilly & Oxford circus. 30 mins to Westminster, Waterloo & East London incl Shoreditch & Islington.
space: Your bedroom looks out to the quiet garden. It comes with a TV, desk, wardrobe, chest of drawers and 2 side tables so lots of space/storage. You will have access to the kitchen, living room and bathroom.  The kitchen has oak cabinets, SMEG stainless steel appliances and a lovely wood farmhouse kitchen dining table.  The living room has a big bay window leading on to rich aubergine goose down filled sofas. The big flat screen TV comes with Virgin cable and 200Mb broadband. The modern tiled bathroom has a wide bathtub with shower.  Queens Park is sometimes called North Notting Hill as many Notting Hillbillies have moved here to find affordable housing. Hence property prices have tripled in the past 10 years. Leafy Queens Park is a 10 minute walk away offering concerts on Sundays in the summer. Popular local pubs are The Salusbury and Caldo Tapas Bar across the street.  The flat is located off of Kilburn High Road which has a proper big Sainsburys grocery store and Costa Cofee etc. All in

There is a definite community feel when you walk around Queens Park village with little shops, pubs and restaurants and the park is wonderful in the summer with free concerts. Kensal Rise on the other side of the park has fab pubs and is just north of Ladbroke Grove and the famous Portobello Road.

space: This is my home that I rent out as an "Entire Flat" when on holiday. It is 100% private when I am not there however please be aware that my things are in the flat and some things are in your bedroom (i have changed the red covers to neutral fyi!). You will have access to all of the flat, bathroom, kitchen, living room. Please do not confuse this place with my second listing which is a "Private Room". There is Virgin cable TV and 300Mb fibre broadband. Your bedroom looks out to the garden. Your room has a TV, portable desk for studying, chest of drawers, wardrobe and two bed side tables. description: 1 mile from Notting Hill. Spacious bright one bedroom Victorian flat, contemporary style, very quiet, not on a main road. Comfy super king (6 ft wide) expensive mattress bought in Jan 17. Five star reviews are under the 2 bed Private Room listing. Trendy Queens Park NW6  is in zone 2, many Notting Hillbillies moved here when NH became too expensive. Its 4 stops from Paddington. 15 mins direct to Oxford and Piccadilly Circus. 20/25 min direct overground to Islington & Shoreditch/East london. This is my home that I rent out as an "Entire Flat" when on holiday. It is 100% private when I am not there however please be aware that my things are in the flat and some things are in your bedroom (i have changed the red covers to neutral fyi!). You will have access to all of the flat, bathroom, kitchen, living room. Please do not confuse this place with my second listing which is a "Private Room". There is Virgin cable TV and 300Mb fibre broadband. Your bedroom looks out to the garden. Your room
transit: Excellent transport links: Tube:  	Queens Park station on the brown Bakerloo line. The grey Jubilee line is ten mins walk away (Kilburn station.)   Bus: 	The 139 and189 to Baker Street and Oxford Circus. Queens Park is not far from Notting Hill and Ladbroke Grove (328 and 31 direct buses.) 98 and 16 go to Hyde Park, Oxford Circus and Victoria Overground: 2 stations: Queens Park and Brondesbury Park. Trains direct to Euston (12 mins), Kings Cross, Camden, Islington, East London etc and Richmond (25 mins) in the other direction.

name: Entire Home in London Bridge
summary: Spacious townhouse, set over 2 floors, and located in the heart of the renowned London Bridge Quarter. The property boasts a fully equipped kitchen, 2 bathrooms, a private terrace, and 6 bedrooms. All two-bedroom and three-bedroom rooms offer comfortable furnishings and large wardrobes, allowing for a pleasant and relaxing stay.
space: Located in the renowned area of London Bridge, the property can accommodate a maximum of 14 people. It features 6 bedrooms, two bathrooms and a fully furnished kitchen.  The apartment is spaced over two floors. On the first floor, you will find a kitchen, a bathroom with shower and three bedrooms (one of them with a sofa bed that can accommodate up to 1 person). On the top floor, you will find three bedrooms ( two of them with sofa bed) and a bathroom with a bathtub. All the guests are offered:  - Free Wireless Internet  - Fresh bed linen, towels,  hairdryer and mini size toiletries. - Hot water 24/7  -  A tablet is available in each room. It contains house manuals, guides and maps of the local area and of London in general.

name: LUXURY APT. NEAR BUCKINGHAM PALACE
summary: “The area around Westminster Cathedral has long attracted nobility, ambassadors, and even former residents of No. 10 Downing Street.”—The Wall Street Journal  This comfortable top floor flat is centrally located on a quiet street opposite Westminster Cathedral. Enjoy high ceiling spacious rooms, a gourmet kitchen, cleaning service (extra cost) and extremely easy access to the West End and City.
space: This stunning, spacious, 4 bedroom, top floor apartment is in the heart of London. Victoria Tube Station, one of London´s best connected hubs, is a mere 5 minute walk, allowing you to be anywhere in Central London in under 10 minutes. Victoria Station is also 5 minutes away providing convenient access to the City, West End, and Heathrow & Gatwick International Airports. Big Ben, BuckinghamPalace and all the attractions associated with them are also less than a 5 minute walk away. The apartment comfortably fits 6 people but there is a large sofa bed allowing for 8 people to reside in the apartment at any one time. The apartment itself has: Entrance Hall  Two Reception Rooms  Large designer kitchen  Four Bedrooms  Three Bathrooms  Balcony  24 Hour Porterage Security Video Entryphone  Security Cameras  Lift  Independent Gas Central Heating and Hot Water  Wifi

name: Superhost- Cosy Room in Stoke Newington, London.
summary: Small cosy room with a view, beautiful location, yet close to main attractions. Bus stop right outside flat. No tube nearby. Shared use of bathroom, kitchen & sitting room. Full English breakfast. Wifi, Fresh linen, towels provided. Home away from home. Real London. Perfect location for foodies searching for Hidden eateries.
space: Small cosy bedroom in lovely Georgian flat, Stoke Newington, Hackney, in a tranquil area whilst conveniently located to explore London or be close to friends.   In addition to the guest room you can share the bathroom, kitchen, living room with windows down to the floor.  Your room has a great leafy view. The house was built by Thomas Cubitt in 1826. Cubitt is well-known for the houses he built in Belgravia and Tavistock House for Charles Dickens. My flat is on the first floor as they say in England, up two flights of stairs.   It's a lovely light and airy flat with the kitchen getting the sun in the morning and the living room, the evening sun at the end of the day. With the bus stop right outside the flat, you will feel like having your personal taxi that takes you to a myriad of places. You will have a great start of the day with a lovely breakfast. During the week I will prepare breakfast between 8 and 9, on Sundays between 8.30 and 10.30. Outside of those hours you can help yourse

Small cosy bedroom in lovely Georgian flat, Stoke Newington, Hackney, in a tranquil area whilst conveniently located to explore London or be close to friends. It's a lovely light and airy flat with the kitchen getting the sun in the morning and the living room, the evening sun at the end of the da
neighborhood_overview: The area is very friendly and Stoke Newington Church Street is full of small shops and little cafes and restaurants. It has also become a real food destination. Since February 2017 it includes the best pizzeria in the world L'Antica Pizzeria da Michele (see my guidebook) as well as Rasa a famous vegetarian South Indian restaurant.  The greenery makes you feel outside of London whilst benefiting from the good transport links to the centre of town and attractions. The flat is well situated, being in the middle of the fondly regarded bohemian style area of North East London, Stoke Newington. It's a couple of minutes walk North to Stoke Newington Church Street where there are many restaurants, cafes, delis, shops, pubs, a nice park (Clissold Park), and a great local bakery. A health club with swimming pool, gym and sauna is 3 minutes away. To the south west , 10 minutes down the road is Dalston, with its many clubs, bars, galleries, live music venues and eateries. Beyond that 2.5 miles fur
notes: I am proud to be a Superhost and as such I take great care in ensuring that you feel at home at my flat.  In July 2016 I proudly represented the Airbnb London Hosts during the Olympics Torch Relay in Passo Fundo, Brasil. What is described in my listing is what you get. Therefore the majority of my guests score me 5 out of 5 when asked to provide a review.   To make sure that what you are looking for is what I can provide you, in case you want to make a straight booking, please make sure you include some information about yourself and what the purpose of your trip is. I won't be able to accept any bookings without any details.   If you are looking for a tube close by, then this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a quality stay, a home from home and great cooked breakfast, then you are in the right place. Please note that the room is small, but there is plenty of space in the cupboard to put your things. An empty suitcase can be left outside in the hall of my flat. In a
transit: I am based in Zone 2. The easiest is to buy a Pay as you Go Oyster Card immediately when you arrive, which you can top up as needed.  You can buy them at any tube stations but also newsagents.  The 73 and 476 buses stop outside my flat and you will feel like having a personal taxi. The 73 also runs throughout the night so you can come home at any time. But if you want a tube nearby then this is not the place for you. The famous 73 bus route crosses London down through Islington to Kings Cross up to Oxford Circus on Oxford Street. The 476 goes to Euston Station. Both buses stop in front of the house. There are plenty of buses from Newington Green 2 minutes down the road by bus that run 24 hours to all other parts of London and major attractions such as Westminster, the Tate, and St Paul's amongst others. The overground to Stratford (access point to the Olympic Park and Westfield Stratford is 5 minutes away - it will only take you 20 minutes to get there. There is resident parking from 8
access: The bathroom, kitchen and sitting room are shared.  In addition to Smart TV in the Guest Room the sitting Room has  Wifi, and a large TV with HD Screen in the sitting room with a large number of digital channels, which you are free to use. It has a large sofa designed by Wawa (a local design company). There is a fully equipped kitchen with a washing machine, and a table which easily seats 4. You can use the kitchen for your lunch or occasional evening meal. I am not around during the day, but generally during the week. There is  a great collection of books on London which you are free to read.
house_rules: You will be provided with a key and you are welcome to come and go as you please. Check in times are flexible. However you should arrive at my place before midnight. This means arriving around 9.30 pm by plane. On Saturdays check-in is after 2 pm. In case the next guest arrives the same time, I ask the leaving guest to vacate the room by 12 noon, and ask the arriving guest to use the room from 2pm. However in case the plane leaves late or arrives early this can be accommodated and the luggage can be left in the hallway in my flat. No Smoking allowed.  You can eat either in the kitchen or the sitting room. Don't eat in your room.  No overnight guests. In addition to a continental breakfast you can make your own tea and coffee during the day. If you want to buy food for other times, there are several supermarkets and small shops nearby. You will be allocated space in the fridge and kitchen.   Please keep the kitchen clean as this is shared with myself. I do not have a cleaning fee.  Let

name: Airy flat in Clapton, east London
summary: A bird's nest of a flat with plenty of light. Photos have been updated.
space: Light-filled comfortable one bedroom, warm but spacious flat in travel zones 2 and 3 both.  Open kitchen good for cooking and having people to dinner.  The flat is at the top of the building (no lift) and good for dreaming as you look down on trees, with birds flying in front of the window and over the skylight as you lie in bed.  Close to huge, green Springfield Park and the canal which is good for running, people-watching or biking, Clapton rail and plenty of buses, transportation, Stoke Newington, and the nightlife of Hackney, east London.  The area is changing, with a new food and clothing market not far away and new bars and cafes opening all the time.   Wifi internet access included and the flat has a washing machine.  Please note that we are a post-TV household and do not have a microwave oven. name: Great guest room near Stratford station/Westfield
summary: Our modern, bright and comfortable double bedroom is a great accommodation if you're looking for a great location to stay in London.
space: We're a male couple, easy going living in Landlords, offering our bright and cozy double bedroom in Stratford. We're 8 minutes walking distance from Stratford station and Westfield shopping centre, and and 10 minutes from Stratford International station and the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.  The flat is in the second - top - floor of a 60's building in a very quite and residential street. The bedroom has a double bed, wardrobe to accommodate your stuff comfortably, a small desk, one  side bed drawers, a comfortable chair and a big window with blackout curtain.    The flat has two balconies, it's bright with windows on both sides and has a large living room with a big tv, one comfortable sofa and armchair, and spacious table that you can use for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The flat has also a fully equipped separate kitchen with cooking and laundry facilities, and wireless internet. name: Victorian family home. Sleeps 6-8
summary: 4 generous bedrooms, 2 living rooms, 2 bathrooms, a large kitchen which opens out into a relaxing garden for you to enjoy.  The whole house is yours with a wood burning stove, hammocks, bicycles and a table tennis table. Come and relax in Hackney, great for families & groups.
space: Gorgeous Victorian home between lovely Chatsworth Road and the open spaces of Hackney Marshes. Lovely quiet street, big house with a beautiful garden, bikes & hammocks. Great for families or groups wanting to hang out in hipster Hackney. Sleeps 6-8. This is a large classic victorian terraced house in a beautiful location right by the Chatsworth Road. Our well-loved family home has a separate kitchen diner, large garden and two bathrooms. You won't feel cramped.  The bedrooms: We have four bedrooms (two doubles and two singles) and two living rooms, one of which can be converted into a bedroom to sleep a further two people on futon mattresses.  For groups of 6+ we do ask for an additional fee per person (please see Pricing). Fresh towels and linen are provided in all rooms. We have wi-fi, a projector for film nights, a table tennis table, a piano and can arrange for on-street parking if you want to pay extra. We are right by lovely markets in Chatsworth Road and next to the Hackney Mars

neighborhood_overview: Clapton is in the heart of Hackney and has everything you need for a enjoyable stay. 30 seconds from our house is Chatsworth Rd full of cafes and pubs. There are also plenty of supermarkets, a pharmacy, deli, creperie, butchers, hairdressers. There is also a weekly Sunday market with stalls selling gourmet foods, vintage, bric-a-brac, crafts, local meats, cakes, clothing and jewellery. Close by is London Fields with its heated outdoor Olympic-sized lido and Broadway Market (Saturday farmer's market) with lively cafes, pubs and restaurants. Columbia rd market is a must see on Sunday morning with its amazing flower stalls, live music and boutique shops. There are loads of pubs and parks nearby plus the canal-side towpaths that will take you to the Olympic Queen Elizabeth park/Walthamstow Marshes/Victoria park.
transit: 45 minutes from our door to Oxford Street via the tube/train. Buses can take you into Soho, Covent Garden and other tourist destinations in 45-55 mins. name: Listen Out for Big Ben's Chimes at an 1870s Gin House
summary: Dine beside the original fireplace under enamel pendant lights at an open Victorian retreat with whitewashed bricks and elegant sash windows. Freshen up at the vintage stone sink, then take a riverside stroll or sip coffee on the wood-framed sofa.
space: An impressive 1,800Sq ft 3 bedroom 4 bathroom house. Outside there is a lovely patio with a sunny aspect for outdoor dining. On the first floor the stairs lead to a spacious open plan living and dining room. There are large comfortable sofas and chairs for guests to relax while they watch the wall-mounted Flat Screen TV, with cable channels and Bose music console. There is an extensive dining table in the dining area that seats 12 people comfortably. The professionally equipped stainless steel kitchen and stand-alone stove is complimented with in-cupboard dishwasher, washing machine, dryer and fridge freezer. The adjoining balcony overlooks the patio and there is a discrete guest bathroom on the same floor. On the second floor there are two large double bedrooms: the Master bedroom with  Flat Screen TV, with cable channels and large en-suite wet room. The Second bedroom has an en-suite with bathtub and shower. On the third floor there is a large double bedroom with en-suite bathroom, o
description: Dine beside the original fireplace under enamel pendant lights at an open Victorian retreat with whitewashed bricks and elegant sash windows. Freshen up at the vintage stone sink, then take a riverside stroll or sip coffee on the wood-framed sofa.
neighborhood_overview: It's just a five-minute walk to the River Thames, then just a few minutes further to Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, the London Eye, and the Tate Britain. Oxford Circus and Regent Street's shops are just four tube stops away.
notes: CHECK IN from 3pm  CHECK OUT by 11am We agree together your ½ hour check-in slot according to your landing time allowing plenty of time for you to travel to the house.  We can always accommodate changes in check-in time up to the day before your check-in date and we will do our best to accommodate same day changes.  Please bear in mind that last minute changes or if you fail to let us know your arrival time has changed will incur an extra £30 for every hour or fraction of hour past the agreed arrival time. Please call, text or email when you are about to leave the airport. LATE/EARLY CHECK IN/OUT FEES  •If you wish to book a check-in from 8pm to 11pm, it will incur an extra £50 fee.  •If you wish to book a check-in from 11pm onwards, it will incur an extra £100.  •You can book an early check-in or late check-out at a fee (according to availability), please ask for a quote.  •You can also drop your bags at no extra charge from 11am to 2pm if agreed in advance.  Please let me know in you

name: Penthouse Apartment London Bridge
summary: Very bright air conditioned 100 sq mtr apartment with a double bedroom and large terrace in a great location perfect for business or sightseeing.
space: Very bright air conditioned 100 sq mtr apartment with one double bedroom now with original art on the walls. Direct access to a large private roof terrace (with 11pm noise restrictions).   The flat has all amenities including washing machine, dishwasher, wifi and HD Sky Rooftop views to The City, Canary Wharf and facing south east with sun till late in the day. Smokers only on the terrace please.
description: Very bright air conditioned 100 sq mtr apartment with a double bedroom and large terrace in a great location perfect for business or sightseeing. Very bright air conditioned 100 sq mtr apartment with one double bedroom now with original art on the walls. Direct access to a large private roof terrace (with 11pm noise restrictions).   The flat has all amenities including washing machine, dishwasher, wifi and HD Sky Rooftop views to The City, Canary Wharf and facing south east with sun till late in the day. Smokers only on the terrace please. Direct access to a large private roof terrace that runs along the entire length of the apartment. None. Exclusive use of the entire 1 bed flat. Cleaner attends weekly and emergency service on standby. The Apartment is 1 minutes walk from Guy's Campus' Tuesday Farmer's Market and within 2 minutes walk of London Bridge Rail and Tube stations, numerous bus routes, the 16th century George Inn pub and Borough Market. Dozens of restaurants and the river Th
neighborhood_overview: The Apartment is 1 minutes walk from Guy's Campus' Tuesday Farmer's Market and within 2 minutes walk of London Bridge Rail and Tube stations, numerous bus routes, the 16th century George Inn pub and Borough Market. Dozens of restaurants and the river Thames within a 6 minute walk. City of London business district a 10 minute walk. Iconic London sight seeing is in walking distance; Tower Bridge, Tower of London, Borough Market, the Tate Modern, Shakespeare's Globe, St Paul's Cathedral, Spitalfield Market, the White Cube Gallery in Bermondsey Street and the Shard with the highest viewing gallery in Europe for unparalleled views over our city. 20 minutes walk along the Thames River brings you to the South Bank Cultural Centre.
notes: ABOUT THE IMMEDIATE LOCAL AREA  London Bridge/Bankside is a historic area near to The City of London.  The nearby ancient Southwark Cathedral, Tower Bridge, Tower of London, City Hall, More London (where various cultural events take place) and riverside places of interest further west such as Shakespeare's Globe and Tate Modern mean that this area is a magnet for tourists. Eating or drinking by the river in one of the local restaurants or bars is a particular attraction.  The neighbourhood includes mainly City workers or Medical Students at Guys Campus of the University of London.
transit: Trains direct to Charing Cross departing every 2 minutes for easy access to the West End within 15 minutes. Direct and frequent Underground lines to Camden, Hampstead, Clapham, Kings Cross/St Pancreas, The 02, City Airport, Olympic Stadium, Canary Wharf, Baker Street, Bond Street, Green Park, Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament (Big Ben) and Buckingham Palace.  Gatwick Airport 30 minutes by rail. Heathrow Airport 65 minutes by tube (Underground)
access: Direct access to a large private roof terrace that runs along the entire length of the apartment.
house_rules: Smoking strictly (and fully!) on the terrace only.  Please relax and enjoy your stay.

space: Quiet single room in family home overlooking large garden in the idylic surroundings of Hampstead Garden Suburb, North West London. Surrounded by trees, woods and birdsong and within easy walking distance of many wide open spaces including Hampstead Heath its hard to imagine that you are only 5 or 10 minutes away from a bus or tube into central London. Ideal for walkers , local places of interest include Kenwood House with its famous art collection and park, Hampstead Heath including open air ponds for swimming and many famous pubs including The Bull and Bush and The Spaniards Inn. Hampstead village is a short ride away and attractions include Keats House as well as a large selection of pubs, cafes ,boutiques and independent cinema. More local amenities include the many shops and cafes of Temple Fortune and Market Place including Vegetarian and Kosher. name: Boutique style B&B private bathroom
space: A large double bedroom with private bathroom (not ensuite) in a contemporary style family home close to Tooting Bec, SW London.   The house is close to Tooting Bec tube station (Northern line) which is 15 minutes walk or three short stops on the bus.   Travel to Leicester Square/Euston Station is approx 30 minutes.  There is also a bus (319) from the house direct to the Sloane Square/King’s Road (close to Harrods and Harvey Nichols). The large, bright guest room has a standard double bed, wardrobe and drawers, desk, two lounge chairs, TV and Wifi. The private modern bathroom, situated on the next floor, has a walk in shower and underfloor heating.  There is also access to a bath in the family bathroom if you prefer.  Bed linen, towels and hairdryer are provided. The house is very close to Tooting Bec Common (a very large park) with access to Tooting Bec lido and tennis courts.  There are some very good restaurants and bars close by around, Tooting Bec and in nearby Wandsworth Common, B
description: A large double bedroom with private bathroom (not ensuite) in a contemporary style family home close to Tooting Bec, SW London.   The house is close to Tooting Bec tube station (Northern line) which is 15 minutes walk or three short stops on the bus.   Travel to Leicester Square/Euston Station is approx 30 minutes.  There is also a bus (319) from the house direct to the Sloane Square/King’s Road (close to Harrods and Harvey Nichols). The large, bright guest room has a standard double bed, wardrobe and drawers, desk, two lounge chairs, TV and Wifi. The private modern bathroom, situated on the next floor, has a walk in shower and underfloor heating.  There is also access to a bath in the family bathroom if you prefer.  Bed linen, towels and hairdryer are provided. The house is very close to Tooting Bec Common (a very large park) with access to Tooting Bec lido and tennis courts.  There are some very good restaurants and bars close by around, Tooting Bec and in nearby Wandsworth Common, B
transit: The closest underground station is Tooting Bec (Northern line).  12-15 minutes walk from the house or 7 minutes on the bus.  The closes mainline stations are Balham, Streatham Common and Clapham Junction.

name: A bit of the country in London
space: We can offer an attic double bedroom with en suite bathroom  or a single room in a large end of terrace house . The house overlooks the Wandsworth Common, a wooded green expanse with pleasant walks and some varied natural history. There is a small garden in the front and a patio garden in the back. WiFi available. The transport links to central London are good. Wandsworth Common Station is 5-10 minutes walk and only three stops (15 minutes) from Victoria Station (near Buckingham Palace and Westminster) in the heart of London.Buses to Chelsea and Wimbledon are 5 minutes away and the nearest underground station is 15 minutes walk away at Tooting Bec. Most basic requirements are available in the shops on Bellevue Road (5 minutes on foot) along with a good selection of cafes and restaurants including the Michelin starred Chez Bruce. We are an Anglo-Swedish couple who enjoy hosting guests and know their London well. Swedish, French and Japanese spoken.

name: Victorian Garden Flat in Tulse Hill
summary: A two bedroom apartment in Zone 3 with its own private garden, on a quiet leafy street with no traffic noise. The apartment is 350 metres from Tulse Hill mainline station which takes you to London Bridge in 20 minutes. A 10 minute bus ride takes you to Brixton underground station. Gatwick is the nearest airport. There is a medium sized supermarket near the train station 350 metres away from the apartment.
space: The apartment can sleep up to four people - with a King size bed in the main bedroom,  two single beds in the smaller second bedroom. I supply all bedding, bedlinen and towels and there is a hairdryer in the apartment to use. The flat is spacious with high ceilings and consists of the following:- * Living Room: Large TV with access to Amazon Prime and Netflix, DVD player and DVDs,     Hi-fi, Wi-fi, Piano ( sheet music provided !) * Large Bedroom with king size bed, french doors opening onto the private garden. * Kitchen with electric oven, gas hob, washing machine, tumble dryer, microwave,    SORRY NO DISHWASHER!    Back door opens onto the garden. * Under stairs Cupboard:  Mini Freezer * Bathroom with WC, bath and overhead shower. * Second Bedroom with a two single beds. French doors opening onto the garden.     PLEASE BE AWARE - this is a VERY SMALL ROOM so if space is an issue then perhaps this    isn't the room for you. * Private 10 metre garden with garden table and six chairs, pa

The apartment is 350 metres from Tulse Hill mainline station which takes you to London Bridge in 20 minutes. A 10 minute bus ride takes you to Brixton underground station. neighborhood_overview: Tulse Hill is a multi cultural, down to earth, working class neighbourhood and is sandwiched between two districts Brixton and Dulwich. A major road ( the South Circular) runs through it.  There is a busy road junction near the station but the apartment lies on a very quiet leafy street away from this junction with no traffic noise.  The road is configured so there is no through traffic - only people who live on the street would drive up the road. Major changes are imminent in the neighbourhood including an overhaul of the South Circular junction which will make it more pedestrian friendly and a new Picturehouse Cinema is opening this Summer on the high street.  A 10 minute bus journey takes you to vibrant multi cultural Brixton where you can enjoy the bars and pubs and shopping in the bustling rejuvenated boho market. The renovated Victorian Ritzy cinema is worth a visit showing both art house and mainstream movies as well as housing a bar and live music. A 20 minute walk away from th
notes: I try to as flexible as possible with check in/ check out times but please do not EXPECT to rock up before 2pm and have the place be ready.   PLEASE NOTE: due to nuisance and disturbance to my neighbours I no longer accept bookings from people checking in after midnight.  No exceptions.  If you book and don't inform me that you are turning up after this hour I will ask you to cancel your booking. Late check out after 10am can be arranged at an extra fee of £30. Please send a text/SMS when you have landed or reached the UK and if you are going to be late PLEASE let me know !   When you book please tell me how many people will be staying in the apartment. Due to noise issues affecting my neighbours, I no longer accept booking from people with babies or children under the age of 8 years.
transit: The apartment lies in Zone 3 and is 0.3 km from Tulse Hill mainline overland train station. I recommend that you download the app Citymapper ( for London) onto your phones.  This will only work once you have arrived in London but its a great way to check out the various route options for getting around London.  It has live updates so if there is any transport issue you can find an alternative route. From this station trains run to London Bridge ( journey time 17 minutes) and from there you can pick up the Jubilee or Northern underground lines or pick up another train to Charing Cross ( for the West End) or Waterloo East  ( for the Southbank) Buses run regularly from the end of the road to Brixton ( journey time 10 minutes) where you can pick up the Victoria underground line into the city centre. There is permit parking for cars on the street outside the apartment which operates Monday - Friday between 8.30am - 6.30pm.  All other times parking is free. You can buy daily permits from me
access: There is a shared front door to the building, a communal hallway and a private door on the ground floor to the apartment. You will have sole access to the whole apartment and garden during your stay.
house_rules: I would expect my guests to treat my home with care and respect while having a good time and enjoying it. While there is not a "no shoes" policy, please be aware that most of the apartment has wooden floors so its better for my neighbours if you walk around inside without shoes on. Please respect the neighbours and keep the noise to a minimum after 23.00 and before 7.30.  Please be considerate about the hours if you stay up late ( talking or otherwise ! ) and be considerate about when you use the TV, radio or piano. No smoking inside the flat. Please do not store any buggies, bikes or wheelchairs in the communal hallway as this is a fire hazard - please store in the apartment. Please supervise children at all times to prevent damage or accidents. Letting them run up and down the apartment disturbs my neighbours. No food or drink in the bedrooms. Please double lock ( bottom lock) both the apartment door and the outer communal door every time you leave the property. Please do not collect

space: A two-bedroom apartment with a balcony on a green and leafy street in a fancy Islington. Shops, restaurants and Clissold Park all within easy walking distance. Excellent transport links to almost anywhere in London. We are renting our two bedroom apartment in Newington Green, Islington, in north London. The flat consists of: - Living room with a large sofa which opens out into a double bed, also a TV and DVD - A main bedroom with a queen size bed (150x200cm) - A smallish kid bedroom with a raised small double bed (120x200cm) and a ladder - Kitchen - with fridge freezer, electric cooker with a double oven, washing machine and dishwasher, and a dining table which opens out to sit 6 (at a push). neighborhood_overview: Newington Green is 5 min away. If you cross the road and bear right, then walk down Ferntower Road, you'll come to Newington Green, which has most shops and bus stops. Also there is a small playground on the Green.  Acoustic Cafe - does great breakfasts and lunches. Lovely friendly staff, definitely our favourite hangout in Newington Green.  Trattoria Sapori - excellent for pizza and very child friendly  Newingron Green Road - fish & chips shop, bakery, news agent, flower shop, post office and vegetable shop.  Clissold Park - is a good big local park, with a children's playground, ponds with ducks and swans, a small animal enclosure with goats, deers and chickens. Nice to walk in... In the summer, the paddling pool is open some days - kids love it!  To get to Clissold Park - just turn left outside of our block and walk 7-8 min to the end of the road. The New River Walk is lovely. A hidden gem, you can walk most way to Angel.  Turn right outside of our block sand walk 7-8 min to the end
notes: Directions from Heathrow airport: Take Piccadilly line to Green Park.  Change for Victoria Line northbound to Highbury & Islington At Highbury& Islington, take Overground just one stop to Canonbury Total journey: 50 min
transit: Canonbury Overground station is 6 minutes down the road  Highbury & Islington is the nearest tube station (Victoria Line). It's just one stop away by Overground, or 15 min walk  Buses from St Paul's road - bus 30 to Marble Arch straight to Madame Tissoude 30 eastbound - to Dalston and Hackney 277 eastbound to Mile End  Buses from Newington Green: 73 to Angel, Kings Cross and St Pancras, British Library, Oxford Street to Victoria Station 476 to Angel, Kings Cross and St Pancras, British Library and Euston 341 to Angel, High Holborn, Aldgate, Waterloo  236 to Hackney, Ridley Road Market, London Fields and Broadway Market
access: Bedding and towels are provided. Bedding is all cotton, but we don't always iron...there's always something better to do!
house_rules: A maximum number of adults per booking is 4 plus 1 child. This is because one of of the beds is a raised child bed - please read full listing description.  We would like you to have a very comfortable stay in our home and so far we have had only good, and often great, experiences with our guests. We live in a very lovely sociable block and have a good relationship with our neighbours, which is very important to us. So we respectfully ask that you:  Please don't disturb our neighbours (e.g. don't knock on their door or buzz them to let you in unless absolutely necessary); Don't have parties, invite other people over; Please keep noise down; Sadly, we don't allow pets to stay in our home.

The studio apartment accommodates 2 people comfortably, with all accessories and at the heart of trendy South Kensington/Gloucester Road area. All the local amenities of both Earl's Court and Chelsea can be reached with a 5 mins walk. The underground stations of Earls Court and Gloucester Road are only 5 mins away. The flat is also great for friends on a sociable weekend in London given its great location with trendy bars and restaurants. name: Elegant & Colourful Victorian Home In West London
summary: Our home sits on a quiet tree lined road a short stroll from the vibrant centre of Shepherd's Bush.  It is extremely well connected to airports, the heart of London and has been refurbished to a high standard.
space: The flat's newly furnished to a high standard and the entire building's been recently renovated.   Make use of the free high speed internet connection, fully kitted out kitchen, free weekend parking and selection of TV, movies and books. The area's known for several famous live music venues, popular bars and restaurants along with the newly renovated BBC development and the now expanded Westfield Shopping Mall.   Shepherd's Bush is one of the best connected parts of the city.  There are regular buses to Notting Hill, Soho, Oxford Street and Kensington.  Hyde Park's within jogging distance and the Circle, Hammersmith and City and Central Tube lines are only 5-10 minutes walk (URL HIDDEN) also is the overland train with links to Gatwick Airport, the Midlands and South Coast. There's a direct bus to Oxford departing every 15 minutes. Ideal for day trips. I love living here.  I'm sure you will too.  Plus if you need any help I'll be on standby to point you in the right direction!!

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is extremely diverse and vibrant. There are hundreds of dining options either locally with great Middle Eastern food at the end of the street, lovely pubs like The Andover Arms, The Angelsea Arms, The Queen Victoria nearby for a pint and a roast and then the endless options at Westfield Shopping Centre which is 5 mins walk away.
transit: The flat is extremely well connected to the rest of London.  The Central line is 10 mins walk from the flat with both the White City and Shepherds Bush stations nearby. This will easily get you to Nottinghill, Marble Arch, Hyde Park, Bond Street, Oxford Circus, Tottenham Court Road, Soho, The Westend.  The Hammersmith & City line station Shepherd'd Bush Market is 5 mins walk away. This will get you to Paddington (Heathrow Express), Euston, Kings Cross, Brick Lane.  Buses are regular and reliable from Shepherds Bush Green.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.

The Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace and on Horse Guards Parade are free displays of colourful Royal pageantry. In August and September Buckingham Palace itself is open to visitors. Take a look at the Houses of Parliament and the famous clocktower that houses Big Ben. Other must-see London sights include the London Bridge and nearby Tower of London with its colourful 'Beefeaters', British Museum, Princess of Diana's memorial and Madame Tussauds. Of course, you have to ride on the London Eye - the new landmark for London! London has some of the finest parks in the world. name: A Design Flat 200+reviews Super Location & Central
summary: This contemporary super bright and high quality designer luxury apartment sleeps up to 4 guests and is set within a traditional pretty London Victorian terrace house. Located in the fashionable, charming, tree lined and friendly BRACKENBURY VILLAGE in Hammersmith.  Close to tube.  Quiet street. Many pubs and restaurants around. Super convenient for public transport. Easy connection for major airports.
space: A lovely and bright apartment with big windows and high ceilings within a charming Victorian terrace house on a quiet and leafy residential street.   The apartment sleeps up to 4 people and has 2 comfortable UK king size beds (200cmx150cm) and is suitable for one couple, 2 couples or a family of 4. This is a high quality contemporary designed and newly renovated accommodation.  It is bright and has neutral and light decor throughout.   It is fully equipped for longer term and short term rentals and comes with all domestic appliances.     The 2nd foldable designer king sofa bed by Softline is easy to unfold and fold back and works as a normal bed. The apartment is located within a safe and secure building with floodlights and recording cctv outside and in communal hallway areas.
